question: I am a business customer and as such the business teller is NEVER open and when the sign is not up they take customers from the business line. Once I stood in the business line for 10 mins, while the regular line filled up with other customers, THEN they tell me there was no business teller that day. So I had to get at the back of the line and waited 20 mins. Uncalled for!
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the customer experienced inconvenience and frustration due to the lack of availability of the business teller, resulting in wasted time and having to wait in a longer line after initially waiting in the business line. The customer's expectations were not met, and they felt that the situation was handled poorly, leading to unnecessary stress and hassle.

question: Nothing special to note about this location of the Papa John's chain.  They generally perform reasonably well, and most times you will notice that they are staffed well enough to handle things - but you will also typically notice that the staff ends up using this to their disadvantage.\n\nThe last time we were there to pick up a pizza (which was paid for online, so they just needed to look at it and pull it off the rack), three people took several minutes looking at another order - for a customer who was not standing there waiting for their order.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the user had a frustrating experience at the Papa John's location. Despite the staff being adequately staffed, they still struggled to manage orders efficiently, causing delays and confusion. Additionally, the user witnessed staff prioritizing the order of a customer who was not present over their own, which reflects poor customer service and lack of attention to detail. Overall, these issues contribute to the negative sentiment expressed by the user in their review.

question: Their sauce is terrible...  I like the fact that you can order online, but aside from that, the pizza is nothing to write home about.  In my area, there are other places that are better like Tony's (the best..) Pronto Pizza, and Mamma's pizza. Being from NY, maybe I'm biased... ok, I definitely am.. but skip Papa John's and go for a local mom and pop place. MUCH better pizza even if they don't deliver.
rationale: The sentiment in the review is negative because the customer expresses dissatisfaction with the quality of the pizza, specifically mentioning that the sauce is terrible. They also suggest that there are better local options available, such as Tony's, Pronto Pizza, and Mamma's pizza, emphasizing that they prefer the taste of authentic New York-style pizza from local mom and pop places over Papa John's. The customer's clear preference for other local pizza options and disappointment in Papa John's contributes to the negative sentiment expressed in the review.

question: This particular location has really let me down!!!  I ordered breadsticks and a large pizza. The breadsticks box had grease leaked all over. Both the pizza and the breadsticks are not the quality I used to. \nThe cheese on the pizza is not melted or maybe it had harden anyways I couldn't eat it after half of the slice. My partner and I are great fan of papa johns pizza but this particular location has the worst pizza/breadsticks and service.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the user expresses disappointment and dissatisfaction with their experience at a specific Papa John's location. They mention that the breadsticks were greasy and the pizza's cheese was not melted properly, making it inedible. The user also highlights that the quality of the food and service at this particular location does not meet their expectations as loyal fans of Papa John's.

question: I would hardly call this place a spa. They were extremely overcrowded and the utensils were not sanitized properly. The employees were rude (probably because they have so many clients at once). While getting my pedicure I noticed one of the 'clean' towels being used on me had hair on it. The girl who ended up doing my nails was sweet and I am fairly pleased with the job she did but I would not go back.
rationale: The sentiment is Negative because the review highlights several issues with the spa experience, including overcrowding, unsanitary conditions, rude employees, and unclean towels. While the reviewer appreciated the job done on their nails by one of the employees, the overall negative aspects of the visit outweighed this positive interaction. The lack of cleanliness and poor customer service are key factors contributing to the negative sentiment expressed in the review.

question: I used to love coming to foxy nails, and Missy was my nail tech, but they changed management and now it is horrible.  It is not clean anymore, the person running the front desk is rude and the clientele has changed dramatically.  I am in search of a new salon definitely!
rationale: The sentiment is Negative because the customer expresses dissatisfaction with the changes in management at the salon. They mention that it is no longer clean, the front desk is now staffed by someone rude, and there has been a noticeable decline in the clientele. These negative experiences have led the customer to seek out a new salon.

question: I used to get my toes done at Foxy Nails a few years ago and always found it clean and satisfactory but the facility has become rundown and the staff is rude and racist. When another client wanted to know how long she'd have to wait to have her eyebrows done, the techs made fun of her behind her back (ladies, the \"N\" word in your native tongue sounds a lot like the \"N\" word in English, have some class). I will definitely not be going back. The service was OK but I drove past easily a half dozen better nail places and will go there instead.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the user experienced a decline in the quality of service at the nail salon they previously enjoyed. The user mentioned that the facility has become rundown, and the staff's behavior was described as rude and racist, citing an incident where other clients were mocked behind their back. These negative experiences led the user to conclude that they will not be returning to the salon and instead opt for better alternatives nearby. The user's dissatisfaction with the decline in service quality and unprofessional behavior of the staff clearly indicates a negative sentiment towards Foxy Nails.

question:
This place is also called the Kabob House. 

Basically its a nice restaurant interior with one guy working as hostess, waiter, and a cook.  The place was clean and pleasant but the food was lacking.  

For the price of $15-22 you get one kabob of meat (7-8 inch by inch cubes), plain rice, and one tomato slice. i thought the food was not bad although my two friends did not like it(keep in mind they were middle eastern). it just wasnt enough food for the price. 

I can get past the slow service, but paying that much for so little was a huge disappointment especially after seeing very high marks for this place on citysearch.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer had high expectations based on positive reviews but was ultimately disappointed with the food quality and portion size relative to the price. Additionally, the dissatisfaction of the reviewer's Middle Eastern friends, who likely have a standard for authentic kabob cuisine, contributes to the negative sentiment. The lack of value for money and the discrepancy between the reputation of the restaurant and the actual experience further solidify the negative sentiment expressed in the review.

question: Great food, fantastic atmosphere and decor.  I stuck to the non meat dishes, and while there isn't a large selection vegetarian options, they'll occasionally  offer a veggie-kabob on request.  The appetizers include standard fare of cucumber salads, stuffed grape leaves, and roasted eggplant spreads (all exceptional in taste).  The badenjanin in particular is perfectly tart and spicy, but may not be for everyone.  Other than the food, their tea selections are great-- try the spiced chai.\nMy experience on weekend nights has been a full house with a mix of family groups at the tables, and college-age groups enjoying hookah in the pillow clad booths of the tea area.  Some nights feature a belly dancer and middle eastern music.  It fits in well with the decorated interior that's covered in arches an paintings (some on animal skins).  Service has been great 2/3 visits, with attentive and friendly staff open to offering suggestions, and an owner who spends time talking with the various groups.  On one very busy night, service was super slow, but the staff was still friendly and the delicious hookahs kept things calm.  Overall, this kind of place is rare in Charlotte and is worth the visit!
rationale: The sentiment of the review is positive because the reviewer highlights several aspects of the restaurant that they enjoyed. They praise the food, atmosphere, and décor, mentioning specific dishes like the badenjanin and the tea selection that they found to be great. Additionally, they appreciate the diversity in clientele and entertainment options, such as the presence of a belly dancer and the availability of hookah. Despite a minor issue with slow service on one occasion, the reviewer overall seems impressed by the experience, describing the restaurant as a unique and worthwhile destination in the Charlotte area.

question:
Very good.  I am part Iranian, so I know my Persian food.  Meat here is cooked perfect...very tender.  Came with a large party once and the owner (who is super nice and accommodating) brought us a sampler of all the meat.   In general, I love to order the ground beef kebabs and lamb kebabs at Persian restaurants and this place doesn't disappoint (I like to add sumac, which is on the table to all the meats and sometimes the rice).

Only disappointment for me is that they don't have a clay oven to make homemade Persian lavash bread like they do in all the restaurants in Atlanta.  Instead you get pita before your meal.  It comes with onion and feta.  You can ask for mint and eat it with the bread, onion, and feta.  Sounds weird, but that is common in Persian restaurants.

Eggplant dip is very good and is a must in any Persian restaurant.  I wish they had more than one eggplant dish, though.  Ice cream is really good.  Baklava is good, but not the best I've had.

Definitely a must try in Charlotte!
rationale: The sentiment in this review is positive because the reviewer has highlighted several aspects they enjoyed about the restaurant. They praised the perfectly cooked and tender meat, the accommodating owner who provided a sampler of all the meats, and the delicious kebabs. They also mentioned enjoying the eggplant dip, ice cream, and baklava. Although they expressed a slight disappointment about the absence of homemade Persian lavash bread, overall, their review emphasizes the positive experiences and dishes they encountered, making it a glowing recommendation for others to try the restaurant.

question: We were the only people in the entire place. Service was okay, I'm pretty sure he was the owner. The food was decent, but the hookah was overpriced. The decor was unusual and everything could have used a good cleaning and a coat of paint. I won't be back to Kabob House.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the customer mentioned several negative points about their experience at Kabob House. They found the service okay, the food decent, and the hookah overpriced. Additionally, the customer was not satisfied with the cleanliness and decor of the place. The overall impression conveyed in the review was not positive, which is why the sentiment is considered negative.

question:
My husband has revoked my Groupon privileges. If this review was just for the food it would be an easy 3 or 3.5 stars. The food was all delicious - we had the sauteed eggplant appetizer, the cucumber/tomato/onion salad, shishkabob dinner and burg dinner (not what I ordered but it was still good.) The rest of the experience was kind of bizarre.

We arrived early on a Saturday evening and were the only dine-in patrons. There were a few booths in the back corner with patrons smoking hookah but it was nearly empty the entire 90+ minutes we were there. There was also some take-out business at the same time. A host led us to a table near the couches/stage area in the back. I immediately noticed that one of the workers (?) was napping on a couch about 10 feet away. 

The music was just something off the laptop of one of the hookah patrons, mostly obscure rap music.

Here's where things got a little weird. We were completely finished eating and the staff was around fixing some other tables (at this point we're still the only dine in patrons), and then they pull some tables together and the entire staff sits down for dinner in the front of the restaurant. We waited another 20-25 minutes for our waitress to come back and ask if we were finished or wanted dessert. The answer was a resounding no.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is negative because the customer described their experience as "kind of bizarre" and mentioned several aspects that were off-putting, such as being the only dine-in patrons and feeling ignored by the staff. The customer also noted that the staff sat down for dinner while they were still waiting to be attended to, leading to a lengthy wait for service. Overall, the customer did not have a positive dining experience due to these factors, resulting in a negative sentiment.

question:
My boyfriend has been wanting to bring me here for a while so I was very excited to give this place a try.

The grocery part of the store has a great selection of Caribbean food, seasonings and drinks. But the most exciting part to this store is the restaurant. Which offers a huge variety of Caribbean food that they prepare fresh daily. They have everything here from jerk chicken and oxtails to chicken and beef patties. 

I let my boyfriend chose our meal and as previous reviews have mentioned the portion sizes here are huge! So you are safe to order something and share it with a friend or two! We we shared an order of stew chicken, rice and peas, veggies and of course a chicken and beef patty.

The stew chicken was soooo tender and full of flavor! Mixed with the rice and peas and veggies it was absolutely delicious!!! And those patties were outstanding! I only tried the chicken but it was huge and so packed with filling and flavor, all I can really say is Yum...Yum!!! Highly recommended!

I definitely recommend this place but just make sure you are hungry when you go!
rationale: The review expresses excitement and enthusiasm about trying out the Caribbean restaurant, highlighting the great selection of food options available in both the grocery and restaurant sections. The reviewer praises the delicious flavors and generous portion sizes, particularly raving about the stew chicken, rice and peas, veggies, and chicken and beef patties they shared. The positive descriptions of the food being tender, flavorful, and packed with filling indicate a satisfying dining experience. Overall, the reviewer highly recommends the restaurant and emphasizes the need to visit when hungry, which all contribute to the sentiment being clearly positive.

question: The best goat roti in Charlotte!
rationale: The review mentions that the goat roti is the best in Charlotte, indicating that the customer had a highly enjoyable and satisfying experience with the dish. This positive sentiment suggests that the food quality, taste, and overall dining experience exceeded the customer's expectations, making it a positive review.

question:
I was really looking forward to this place, bc I love Jamaican food and finally found a place near my place. 

It's in the middle of a strip mall by the interception of albermale and central ave. they have a lil grocery inside and good price lunch special. 

However, I was not impressed by the food at all.the chicken is super dried!!!!! I was the first customer, bc I called in my food at 9:45am, and they open at 10am. Somehow i feel like they have served chicken from the day before. I mean the jerk chicken flavor is good but the texture is just not good! The filling in the patties are groovy, and there's no meat taste at all. 

I do want to go back and give it another try before I give up on this place
rationale: The sentiment in the review is Negative because the customer was disappointed with the quality of the food they received. They mentioned that the chicken was super dried, leading them to suspect it may have been served from the day before. Additionally, they found the filling in the patties to be off-putting with no meat taste. Despite wanting to give the place another chance, the overall experience fell short of their expectations for a place they were excited about trying.

question:
For a "fast" food place.. this place is not that fast....  Yes, it's pretty convenient right on Independence on your way out to Matthews... but I rarely have eaten in the dining area and mostly base my experience with this McDonald's with the drive thru.

There is rarely a time that I don't drive by and see a line of at least 3 cars deep in the drive through.  Yes, it's a busy location, but even going through it... it seems like it should be a lot faster.

My roommate and I always joke and try to predict how long it will take to get thru the drive-thru based on the number of cars in line...  most of our estimates get in the range of going out to a sit-down place.
rationale: The sentiment in the review is Negative because the reviewer expresses frustration and disappointment with the slow service at the McDonald's location. They mention that despite the convenience of the location, the drive-thru is consistently slow, with long lines of cars resulting in delays. The reviewer also highlights the lack of efficiency in service, leading to a negative dining experience and the need to joke about the consistently slow service. These factors contribute to an overall negative sentiment towards the establishment.

question: I purchased a 2002 Mercury Sable from my uncle out of the area. On the drive to Charlotte I noticed a slight stutter when at red lights. I figured all I needed was a tune-up or just new spark plugs and wires. The folks at Town and Country agreed. They also wanted me to replace the ignition coil, although I did not seem to have any problems with the ignition. Cost for the job. $857.00 I said no. \" brought my car to you for a tune up and thats what I want. How much for the tune up?\" Answer: $450.00 Yep!! $450.00 I said no. The problem is that I had agreed when signing the paperwork to a $115.00 diagnostic fee. So I could walk away but it would cost me $115.00 for nothing. Congrats to Town and Country. You got the $115. and I did not complain one bit. I had agreed to the terms. But I took my car and left and I will never ever reccomend this place or do business with them again. PS. I found a very good shop to do the work for just under $300. So I still saved $35.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the customer had a poor experience with Town and Country auto shop. They were upsold on unnecessary repairs, quoted a high price for a simple tune-up, and felt taken advantage of due to the mandatory diagnostic fee. The customer also had to find another shop to perform the work at a lower cost, highlighting the dissatisfaction with Town and Country's pricing and service.

question: Unfortunately, I can not say I would recommend going to Town and Country Ford to purchase a vehicle. After spending time with a salesman I was told that the deal I was trying to get was impossible. Because I would not allow them to run my credit to run general numbers, I was told by the salesman I was making his job difficult. I have purchased dozens of cars over the years and have never given my social before all the numbers were given. The salesman told me either I let them run my social or they wouldn't do business. At no time did a manager come over and help out. I basically was told either I do it their way or I needed to walk. He told me to leave and that there is no way I could get the deal I wanted. Needless to say I purchased the same vehicle from Keith Hawthorne Ford a couple hours later for less than what I was trying to buy the car for at Town and Country. Some could say that the dealership does not deserve a bad review based on this rather, the salesman didn't do their job. I thought this at first, I just have been asking myself why wouldn't the manager come over and try to stop me from leaving or help work on the deal. Specially, as it was obvious they had a newer salesman.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer had a frustrating and unsatisfactory experience trying to purchase a vehicle at Town and Country Ford. The salesman's behavior was off-putting, pressuring the reviewer to provide personal information before discussing numbers, making the process uncomfortable and demanding. Additionally, the lack of intervention or assistance from a manager further highlights the poor customer service and lack of effort to accommodate the reviewer's needs. Ultimately, the negative experience led the reviewer to take their business elsewhere, emphasizing their dissatisfaction with Town and Country Ford.

question: I recently came here for a safety recall having to do with the cruise control of my 2002 Ford Explorer. I had sent an online request for an appointment Tuesday for the recall service (free) and to get \"THE WORKS? FUEL SAVER PACKAGE $39.95 OR LESS\" which includes free tire rotation. Two days later, I called them after receiving no response. They said that they were having trouble with their e-mail system and to come in on Friday, which I did, arriving around 7:15 in the morning. That, along with tire rotation and oil change, had me ready about 8:45 or so. Unfortunately, the first time, they had charged me for the recall service, which I had to have them correct since per Ford, this should be no charge to me. Because I was in a hurry, I failed to get them to also remove the charge for the tire rotation which was supposed to have been included for free as part of my package. I feel this service department is dishonest and intentionally attempts to avoid honoring their advertised discounts. Very sorry I came here and will not purchase a new car from them in the future.
rationale: The sentiment expressed in the review is negative because the customer experienced multiple issues during their visit to the service department. They had to follow up after not receiving a response to their appointment request, encountered problems with billing for the recall service, and did not receive the free tire rotation as part of the advertised package. The customer also felt that the service department was dishonest and not honoring their promotions. These frustrations and perceived lack of integrity led to the negative sentiment expressed in the review.

question: I'm still getting mailers from this place. Nope. I won't go. Keep your stinky coupons. Boo.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the user expresses frustration and annoyance towards the business, suggesting that they do not want to visit or engage with the place due to receiving unwanted mailers and coupons. They use words like "stinky" and "boo" to further emphasize their displeasure, indicating a negative attitude towards the business.

question: I had an appointment to see a vehicle on Saturday at 10:15 am, this was confirmed Friday evening also by them. On Saturday morning I drove the hour and forty five minutes to see the vehicle that they had advertised. To my very surprise, it happened to had been sold that morning and, no one bothered to call me. They stated in their ad that you make a VIP appointment and they will have the vehicle available. I believe that the vehicle did not even exist and they just wanted me in there to sell me something else. This is the worst experience with a dealership I have ever had. The manager could care less and the Internet person lied that she tried to call me 30 minutes prior to my arrival which is absolutely absurd!! Does anyone care what happened, NO. I would warn everyone to watch doing business with this dealership , something shady going on here.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the user had a confirmed appointment to see a specific vehicle, traveled a considerable distance, only to find out that the vehicle had been sold that morning without any notification. The user feels misled by the dealership's claim of making VIP appointments and having the vehicle available, leading them to believe the dealership may have had ulterior motives by potentially luring them in to sell a different vehicle. The lack of communication, perceived dishonesty, and dismissive attitude from the manager contribute to the frustration and disappointment expressed by the user, resulting in a negative experience overall.

question: I would NEVER suggest that anyone shop for a used vehicle at this Ford dealership.  The used car Sales Manager is lacking character and integrity.  They had a vehicle priced online right at the price we were looking for so we went in to see the vehicle.  It was a very basic, no feature vehicle for a college student.  Once we agreed to purchase it, they came out with a price $1000 higher than what was listed.  The Sales Manager came out and tried to make excuses for a 3rd party company that posts their sales ads and that it was their mistake...we told him it wasn't our issue.  He then proceeded to LIE to us about the costs they put into the vehicle...since they would never put into it more than what it's worth.  This man should not be in the position he's in, as they could have easily made up for their $1K mistake just in the day and should have honored the price they advertised...and to sit and lie to our face?  Get some integrity loser!
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer had a bad experience at the Ford dealership while shopping for a used vehicle. The reviewer felt that the Sales Manager lacked character and integrity due to the discrepancy in pricing between the online listing and the actual price quoted at the dealership. Additionally, the Sales Manager's attempt to shift blame to a third-party company and the perceived dishonesty regarding the costs of the vehicle further contributed to the negative sentiment. Overall, the reviewer felt misled, disrespected, and frustrated, leading them to express strong dissatisfaction with the dealership and the Sales Manager's behavior.

question: I only gave them one star because it may look like I just didn't rate them if I left it at 0. WORST PLACE EVER!! I was told by a rude salesperson and an even more rude manager that I did not qualify for the 04 ford expedition I went to see before I was even given an opportunity to test drive. After leaving highly upset I stopped down the road at City Chevrolet where I was greeted by a courteous sales professional by the name of Avon Spann \"THE CHEVY MANN\". Not only did he get me in a 2014 vehicle which I didn't qualify for as far as ford was concerned. But he treated me so well I don't want to buy cars from anyone or anywhere else. Even if you want a Ford still go see The CHEVY MANN @ City Chevrolet. He'll get you anything you ask for. My brother is working with him to buy a BMW that is in Tallahassee, FL
rationale: The sentiment in the review is negative because the reviewer had a poor experience at the first place they visited, describing it as the "WORST PLACE EVER." They were treated rudely by the salesperson and manager, and they were not given a chance to test drive the car they were interested in. Additionally, they were made to feel unwelcome and discouraged. The positive experience at City Chevrolet with Avon Spann, "THE CHEVY MANN," highlights the stark contrast in customer service between the two establishments, with the reviewer expressing a strong preference for City Chevrolet over the initial dealership. This negative sentiment is further reinforced by the reviewer's emphasis on how well they were treated at City Chevrolet in comparison to their negative experience at the first place.

question: I started new position in March which include a company car.  The organization buys the cars and the other company cars came from other dealers.  I phoned and visited over 10 local dealerships and it was if no one listened to my budget, or desires.  I called Town and Country Ford where I had bought my personal vehicle, a 2002 Ford Sport Trac (which I still have and love with over 175,212,000 miles on it) off the show room floor and right away I knew I should had started here.  I was lucky enough to get Holly Kimmel on the phone and WOW, she is awesome.  She listened, and found me exactly what I was looking for at the budget I was allowed to work with from my company. It was so easy and I am a proud owner of a 2014 Ford Taurus with all the bells and whistles and the color, Dark Side is pimpy if I do say so myself.  Also Skipper one of the Sales Mangers brought the paperwork to my boss here at the office. Who does that??? I can's say enough about the sales, the services, the attitude of each person there, they made me  me feel very important.  I highly suggest you call Holly if you want the best service in town!\n\nGreg Smithj
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the user had a great experience with the dealership, specifically highlighting the exceptional service they received from Holly Kimmel. They were able to find a car that met their budget and requirements with ease. The user also appreciated the extra effort made by the Sales Manager, Skipper, which made them feel important and valued as a customer. Overall, the positive interactions, effective communication, and attention to detail mentioned in the review contribute to a positive sentiment.

question: not happy with this dealership because you cant reach anyone in service and it goes straight to the answering machine and then they never return your calls.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the user expressed dissatisfaction with the dealership's service department for being unreachable and unresponsive. This lack of communication can lead to frustration and inconvenience for the customer, creating a negative experience overall.

question: Everybody here is very rude,  especially Bill. I stood and waited and asked if someone could help me.  One employee actually WALKED AWAY FROM ME! Bill spent 20 minutes on his cell phone talking about everything but what's related to the dealership. I asked Bill what it would cost to service my car and I got a figure that was completely different than what I was quoted on the phone.  I told him about the quote and he said he would check on it. I wait, and wait, and wait.  It took 30 minutes for him to get back to me and said that nobody here gave me that quote  (I got the impression that he thought I was lying by his tone) and it has always been a certain price and always will be a certain price. I think I will look for another place to have my car serviced next time because of the rudeness and because of the customer service.
rationale: The sentiment is Negative because the reviewer experienced rude and unhelpful behavior from several employees, especially Bill, at the dealership. The employees were disrespectful, unresponsive, and appeared indifferent to the customer's needs and inquiries. Additionally, there was a discrepancy in the quoted price for servicing the car, leading to frustration and a lack of trust in the dealership's customer service. The reviewer ends the review by expressing their intention to find another place for car servicing due to the poor treatment received.

question:
We went here because there was a wobble and wup wup wup noise coming from one of our wheels.  After they put the car up on the lift and inspected it, they told us that we needed all new struts (front and rear), a new wheel, alignment, and balancing.  I think the estimate was about $1000 for all that.  Then I asked why they recommended replacing the front struts if the problem that caused the wheel to wear was in the back.  The explanation I got was that the front struts didn't *need* to be replaced, but they recommended it because of the struts' age.  That brought the total down to around $500.

So then I'm scratching my head wondering how the struts in the rear can be bad, because there's no noise or softness or weird bounce in the rear suspension (or the front, for that matter).  My gut told me to get a second opinion.

So we took the car out east to my wife's regular family mechanic.  He checks it out thoroughly, says the struts are all fine, replaces a bad wheel (a different one than that identified by Tire Kingdom), and balances/aligns all four wheels.

About $280 later, the car drives great.

Not sure what was going on at Tire Kingdom, maybe they just reached a bad diagnosis in good faith.  I'm just glad we took our car elsewhere.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the customer experienced a situation where a repair shop recommended unnecessary and costly repairs based on a potentially incorrect diagnosis. This led to confusion and doubt regarding the credibility of the initial assessment, prompting the customer to seek a second opinion. Ultimately, the customer's trust was shaken by the discrepancy in recommendations and the higher estimate provided by the first shop compared to the more reasonable and effective service received from the second mechanic. The experience left the customer feeling dissatisfied and questioning the integrity of the initial service provider, resulting in a negative sentiment.

question: Hopefully our experience here will be nice, I have watched one employee by the window changing 4 tires for the past hour and he is nowhere net being finished. He threw the plastic caps face down on the shop floor, and has so far been more interested in texting his \"boo\" than finishing that car.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the customer had a poor experience witnessing an employee's unprofessional behavior. The employee's slow progress, lack of cleanliness by throwing plastic caps on the floor, and prioritizing personal matters over their work all contributed to a negative perception of the service being provided.

question: I had a really good experience at Tire Kingdom I wish I could remember the name of the man who helped me I hate when I forget important facts like that.  I came to Tire Kingdom after calling several other stores in town to find the tire I was looking for.  Though they didn't have the exact tire I was looking for they told me to bring the car in and they were sure they could help me.  An hour later I had a new tire, with a great warranty and free roadside assistance x 3.  The staff was extremely friendly and they didn't pressure me into buying anything I didn't need I felt respected and that I could trust them.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer had a really good experience at Tire Kingdom. They received helpful service, were able to get a new tire with a great warranty and additional benefits, and felt respected and trusted the staff. The reviewer also mentioned that the staff was friendly and didn't pressure them into unnecessary purchases, which indicates a positive and customer-centric experience.

question:
I'm an UP & AT EM kinda early (6am -7am) kinda guy. I took my son with me a while ago (see pictures........ NEED I SAY MORE???



GOOD PLACE... family owned, operated. 
I have nothing bad to say about the place....

TIP... ask for Fish (I think flounder or perch) for breakfast if you're into that kinda thing. I don't believe its on the Breakfast menu!!

Cheer's
rationale: The review expresses enthusiasm for the experience, particularly highlighting the family-owned and operated nature of the place. The use of capital letters and exclamation points further indicates a positive sentiment and overall satisfaction with the visit. question: Great for breakfast. Good biscuits and link sausages. Also I have not been disappointment with fish dishes, chicken.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer mentioned that the breakfast options were great with good biscuits and link sausages. They also expressed satisfaction with the fish dishes and chicken. Overall, the reviewer seems to have had a positive experience with the food at the restaurant.

question: Ive been here a dozen plus times and never left unsatisfied or anything less than stuffed.  The one on South Tryon is closer to me, so Ive been only to this location.  The hostess knows us well enough to know our favorite booth,  and the waiters know my spice level (which is pretty high).\n\nSince I eat seafood and vegetarian exclusively, I just pay $1 extra to get the regular lunch combinations replaced with shrimp, not bad at all.  The rice and beans are bland, but upon request they give a spicy sauce that tastes much like habenero sauce to me.  Makes me sweat, but I love it!  Everything is worth trying once or twice or more, and portions are gargantuan.  Enjoy.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer describes their experience as consistently satisfying and enjoyable. They mention being a repeat customer, having friendly interactions with the staff, customized their meals to their preferences, enjoyed the spicy options, and found the portions to be generous. The reviewer appreciates the variety on the menu and overall has a positive outlook on their dining experiences at the restaurant.

question:
Hablas espanol? No importa!!!!  If you want cheap, gringo-esque  Mexican food served by friendly folks, Don Pedros is your place.

First, they serve freshly fried tortilla chips with homemade salsa (lots of cilantro).  

They have lunch specials for $4.  And I don't mean Taco Bell-sized portions either.  Everything they serve is hearty.  If you don't mind the calories, get the chicken chimichanga.  Its a fried tortilla, stuffed with chicken, and covered with chesse, guacamole, and sour cream.  They serve enough rice and fried beans on the side to feed about three people.  Every meal is finished by sopapillas-fried tortillas with honey, cinnamon, and a dollop of whip cream.  Muy rico!!!

When I worked nearby, I ordered takeout alteast once a month.  It was usually read in 10 minutes or less.  A typical entree is around $8.  They have a second menu with specialities and authentic Mexican dishes.  The wait staff speak English well, so nothing gets "lost in translation" when ordering.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is positive because the reviewer highlights several positive aspects of their experience at Don Pedros. They mention the friendly service, affordable prices, generous portions, and delicious food offerings such as freshly fried tortilla chips, hearty meals like the chicken chimichanga, and tasty sopapillas for dessert. The reviewer also appreciates the quick service for takeout orders and the fact that the wait staff speak English well, ensuring a smooth ordering experience. Overall, the review expresses satisfaction with the food, service, and value provided by Don Pedros, leading to a positive sentiment.

question: This restaurant is no longer called Don Pedro's.  It is now Jallisco's.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the review provides helpful information about the restaurant's new name, making it easier for potential diners to find and visit the establishment formerly known as Don Pedro's. This suggests that the reviewer views the change in name positively and is sharing it for the benefit of others.

question:
As I was out running some errands, I noticed the banner hanging from the local Pizza Hut advertising their lunch buffet and I decided to stop.  I recall seeing somewhere that they were only putting personal pizzas on the buffet these days, but that isn't the case, at least at this location.  They are full-fledged pies.  Pizza Hut pies, to be sure, but they are the real ones, not the baby-sized ones.  That can actually be both good and bad.

It's good because you can get a decent slice from the buffet.  It can be bad because with room for only four pizzas at a time, and with one of those at any given time being a dessert pizza, it means if one of the three main pizzas isn't one that you like, you may have to wait for one that you like.  This is an issue because the restaurant isn't very busy - probably the reason for the banner outside.  As such, the three pizzas don't go very fast.

Still, if you're at Pizza Hut, chances are that you like their pizza at least okay.  It's not like you're out on a limb to try something adventurous.  If you want more variety, go to CiCi's Pizza.  If you want something good, try Big Guy's Pizza instead.

Anyway, the pizza isn't bad.  You just don't get a lot of choices.  They also have pasta, but in my experience, it's usually almost gone.  I don't know if this is because people don't like the choices of pizza and eat all the pasta, because they don't put much out, or some combination of both.  There are also bread sticks, but they don't usually have many of those either.  There is a good bit of marinara sauce, but I'm not sure what you're supposed to use it on, since the pizza has plenty and there is usually little pasta or bread.  You can also get a salad, but it costs extra.

The service is generally friendly, but not very good.  The price is a bit much.  For all this and a drink you'll pay more than you should.  The one bright spot is the sweet tea.  It is sweet and syrupy, just like it should be.  Make sure you get plenty.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is Negative because the reviewer highlights several drawbacks of their experience at the local Pizza Hut. They mention limited pizza options on the buffet, slow pizza turnover, lack of variety in pasta and breadsticks, extra cost for salad, and subpar service compared to the high price paid for the meal. While the sweet tea is praised as a positive aspect, overall, the review emphasizes more negative points, leading to an overall negative sentiment.

question: Party of One deal keeps getting more expensive.  Salad tastes like it was bought from Food Lion.\n\nPizza is what you'd expect.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the review mentions that the Party of One deal is getting more expensive and implies that the quality of the salad is low, comparing it to being bought from a low-cost supermarket. Additionally, the comment on the pizza being "what you'd expect" does not sound particularly positive, suggesting that it was average or unimpressive. Overall, the review conveys disappointment with the food quality and value for money.

question: We have gone to this Pizza Hut in the past and were not satisfied with the service. When we first moved to our house, this location and the one at Lawyers & Margaret Wallace both argued as to which location was supposed to deliver to us! We didn't feel like leaving the house last night and decided to give them another chance. They were 20 minutes late, the pizza and wings were cold, and the customer service was terrible! I will not be ordering from this place again. I am really surprised this location has been in business as long as it has.
rationale: The sentiment expressed in the review is negative because the customer had a bad experience with the Pizza Hut location. They were dissatisfied with the service in the past, and when they decided to give the restaurant another chance, they were met with further disappointments - late delivery, cold food, and poor customer service. The customer explicitly stated that they will not order from this place again, indicating strong displeasure with their overall experience.

question:
Well, it's been better than it is now. 

I've taken shoes there for at least the last 20 years, but I'm ready to go elsewhere.

I have a short left leg, so I need all of my left heels built up 3/4 inch. The last two pair didn't come out right. One squeaks and pops with each step, and the other one separated from the sole and had to be repaired. (He did fix the former once, but the squeaks returned. He just fixed the latter, nicely. Both fixes were free of additional charge.)

Prices have shot up recently, quite a bit, and the guy no longer takes checks. Bring cash only.

I'll probably look around for another shop for my next heel build-up.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer has experienced multiple issues with the shoe repair service over the years. The customer has had problems with the quality of the repairs, such as squeaking and separation from the sole, indicating a lack of attention to detail and craftsmanship. Additionally, the recent price increase and the inconvenience of having to pay with cash only have added to the dissatisfaction. The combination of these factors has led the reviewer to consider taking their business elsewhere.

question: This is the last straw!  I love bojangles, and this one is conveniently located on the way home for me, but enough is enough. I have put up with their slow service, wrong orders,  and annoying employees who are horrible at taking orders. But yesterday I stopped on the way home and was given cold, leathery chicken supremes; seasoned fries with absolutely no seasoning; and a cold, hard biscuit. I will continue to go to bojangles, but never this one again!
rationale: The sentiment in the review is negative because the customer expressed frustration and disappointment with their recent experience at Bojangles. They mentioned a series of issues they have faced in the past, such as slow service, wrong orders, and unhelpful employees. The final straw was receiving cold and unappetizing food items during their most recent visit, leading them to vow to avoid that specific location in the future. Overall, the customer's dissatisfaction with the service and food quality contributes to the negative sentiment in the review.

question: It has been tough for my girlfriend and I to find markets in Charlotte that specialize in organic and whole foods that aren't prohibitively expensive.  The Home Economist does just that.  They have a good selection of organic and whole foods that don't break the bank, but the real draw is their selection of bulk foods.  Everything from grains and cereal to coffee and spices, without the cost/waste of packaging and advertising.  \n\nThey don't have a lot of space, which kind of limits their overall selection, but they do have local produce and organic wines (I like \"jest red\").  If you like Trader Joe's check out Home Economist, and don't let the sketchy strip mall location put you off, the low rent helps keep the overhead down.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer highlights several positive aspects of The Home Economist market in Charlotte. They mention the good selection of organic and whole foods at affordable prices compared to other options in the area. The reviewer also praises the store's bulk food offerings, local produce, and organic wines. Additionally, they appreciate the cost-saving benefits of the store's low overhead due to its location in a strip mall. Overall, the reviewer's comments emphasize the value and benefits of shopping at The Home Economist, making their sentiment clearly positive.

question: I LOVE both locations of Home Economist(I refuse to accept the new name). Especially on the east side where the selection of anything better than garbage is slim to none. The prices may be a bit much for some, but most of the people that shop here-in my opinion-seem to be savvy enough to work it out and get what they need without breaking the bank. \nDon't get me wrong, I don't exclusively shop here, I'm not ballin like that, but it's a great place to go get bulk items, especially for real cooks/bakers & the selection of all natural soaps etc. makes me smile. Hell, they even sell candy! \nCheck them out, but make sure you map your exit properly because unless you leave out the back way onto Idlewild, it's going to be hell to get back on 74W during most times of the day(less busting a U down by Conference)
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer expresses love for both locations of Home Economist, emphasizing the selection of items they find superior to other options in the area. They appreciate the variety of products, such as bulk items and natural soaps, and mention that the prices, although a bit high, are manageable for savvy shoppers. The reviewer also highlights the convenience of the store for cooks and bakers, as well as the pleasant surprise of finding candy available. Overall, the reviewer's tone is enthusiastic and they recommend checking out the store, making the sentiment positive.

question: This used to be a good place to go to. However, they have let themselves go downhill. The people are quite possibly the rudest I have ever met. I have not met anyone there with a personality yet. The only reason I went there is because it was closer than the one off Sardis Road. But the Sardis location will get all my business from now on. I am very sure that they could care less about one disgruntled customer, and that is fine with me.
rationale: The sentiment in the review is negative because the customer expresses dissatisfaction with the declining quality of the place, specifically citing rude staff and a lack of personable interactions. They also mention their intent to take their business elsewhere due to the poor experience. The overall tone is one of disappointment and frustration, indicating a negative sentiment towards the establishment.

question: This place has improved so much. The people are way friendlier. They are nice and easy to talk to. Not rude at all. They are store is clean. The vegetables look fresher. I will start going to this store again.
rationale: The review expresses satisfaction with the improvement in customer service and cleanliness of the store. The reviewer specifically mentions the friendliness of the staff, ease of communication, and freshness of the products. These positive aspects contribute to a pleasant shopping experience, indicating an overall positive sentiment towards the store.

question:
Since my ladyfriend and I had had such a marvelous experience purchasing her Crosstrek from Folger Subaru, I emailed our salesman Kevin and said, "Hey, if you can find me a good deal on a Crosstrek or Impreza hatchback with a manual transmission - I'll buy one too." 

A short time later, Kevin presented me with info a marine blue pearl XV with a 5-speed manual on a lot in Chapel Hill. I told him if they would sell it to me for X amount (essentially the invoice price), that I'd bite. Kevin negotiated a dealer trade (they sacrificed a BRZ so I could have a 5speed Crosstrek... heroic) and got the car on the lot in less than 24 hours. 

It took one phone call and one email for me to negotiate my bottom-line, and I had an out-the-door price locked in and agreed to that was exactly within what I wanted to pay for the car. 

Having gone through the purchase process just a few days ago with my lady's car, the financing was a cinch. In one quick evening after work I was driving home in my own new Crosstrek - courtesy of Kevin and Folger Subaru's friendly, efficient staff. At 1.01% financing with a lifetime powertrain warranty, and 7-year 100,000 mile bumper-to-bumper warranty, I really don't know of anyone who's gotten better deals on new cars than we did. 

Couldn't be happier - thanks again, Folger Scooby.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer had a marvelous experience purchasing a car from Folger Subaru. They made a request to their salesman Kevin, who went above and beyond to find them a good deal on a Crosstrek with specific specifications. Kevin negotiated well, got the car on the lot quickly, and provided excellent customer service throughout the process. The reviewer was satisfied with the out-the-door price, financing terms, and warranties, making them extremely happy with their purchase experience. Overall, the reviewer felt well taken care of, appreciated the efficiency and friendliness of the staff, and believed they got a great deal on their new car.

question: Came here to service my 2011 Subaru Forester, the brakes were making noise and after getting a ridiculous quote from Goodyear I came to Folder Subaru.  They replaced my rear brake pads and machined the rotors, along with treating my car brakes and replacing the middle seatbelt both due to recalls.  They did this all in one day and my technician Larry was very helpful and called to check up after a couple of days that everything was fine.  You have to  expect to pay more at a dealership, but they charged me a reasonable fee and I would definitely come back for future service.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the user had a good experience at Folder Subaru. The user appreciated the efficient service as the brakes were fixed in one day, and additional recalls were addressed promptly. The user found the technician, Larry, to be helpful and appreciated the follow-up call to ensure everything was fine. Despite the expectation of higher costs at a dealership, the user felt that the fee charged was reasonable. Overall, the user expressed satisfaction with the service received and mentioned a willingness to return for future maintenance needs.

question:
If you like lip service, then this place is for you. Made appointment to have routine service done ($1000)!!!!
That does not cover the warranty work they had to perform either. 
Promised to have loaner car for me. I showed up on time . They had all my information and NO CAR. So insult to injury... Give up a weeks pay and then have to be late for work!  These guys like one thing.. YOUR $$$$!!!!

If you like lip service, then this place is for you. Made appointment to have routine service done ($1000)!!!!
That does not cover the warranty work they had to perform either. 
Promised to have loaner car for me. I showed up on time . They had all my information and NO CAR. So insult to injury... Give up a weeks pay and then have to be late for work!  These guys like one thing.. YOUR $$$$!!!!
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer had a poor experience at the service center. They express frustration over not receiving the promised loaner car despite making an appointment for routine service totaling $1000 and having to pay for additional warranty work. The reviewer feels that the service center prioritizes money over customer satisfaction, leading to a disappointing and inconvenient situation. The overall tone of the review conveys dissatisfaction and disappointment with the service received.

question: This place is slimey as all heck & a disgrace to the KIA brand.  I chose to go to this dealership because I was under the pretense of a false trade-in promotion.  Their claimed minimum trade-in value does not pertain to the vast majority of their car lot. Their selection is extremely weak (they only carrying a handful of each model).  \n\nIn the last decade I've purchased cars from the Independence Carmax (twice), Scott Clark Toyota & Hilbush Ford.  I prefer all of them over Folger Kia.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer expresses dissatisfaction with their experience at the dealership. They feel misled by the false trade-in promotion and criticize the dealership's selection as weak. Additionally, the reviewer compares the dealership unfavorably to other car dealerships they have patronized in the past, further indicating their disappointment with Folger Kia.

question: DO NOT BUY A CAR from FOLGER KIA. In march, we bought a Kia sportage for $10500, the top end of the estimated value via Kelly blue book. When I drove the car in April, the AC was not working well. I specifically asked if this car was in good shape and Shamori (the finance manager)  assured me it was. In April we had to replace All 4 tires and the battery at a cost of $700. I gave Shamori a chance to take care of this, he took it to Rick (the general manager) who said no. We are now faced with replacing the AC compressor  - a $1200-$1500 repair. Despite assurances that they would stand by their product, Folger Kia has deliberately decided to not take care of over $2000 worth of repairs I had to make.  DO NOT BUY A CAR from FOLGER KIA.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer experienced multiple issues with the car purchased from Folger Kia shortly after buying it. The problems with the AC, tires, and battery, followed by the refusal of the dealership to take responsibility for the needed repairs, reflect a poor customer experience. The lack of support from the finance manager and general manager despite assurances of standing by their product further contributes to the negative sentiment expressed in the review.

question: Unfortunately, I live near Eastland Mall. The place is in shambles, and while I like the prices at some of the ghetto-tastic clothing stores enough that I sometimes venture in there, I've mostly stopped going all together. I tried to use the Radio Shack in this mall to get help with my Sprint Cell phone, and the music in the store was so loud I couldn't get the staff to hear me. The guy behind the desk, who I later discovered was a manager, acted as if I were disturbing him.\n\nI've gotten my eyebrows waxed at Foxy Nails, and the price was right...but again, the service was a little lacking.
rationale: The sentiment in the review is negative because the user describes Eastland Mall as being in shambles and uses derogatory language such as "ghetto-tastic" to describe the stores. They also mention a negative experience at Radio Shack with loud music hindering communication with staff, and feeling like they were being a bother to the manager. Additionally, they note that while the price at Foxy Nails was good, the service there was lacking. Overall, the user's interactions and experiences at the mall and its stores were mostly negative, leading to an overall negative sentiment in the review.

question: For a Mall that's closing down and doesn't have any anchor stores left it's ok for what it is- although the mall is dead there are still some specialty shops that one could go to if they really needed something
rationale: The sentiment is Negative because the review mentions that the mall is closing down, has no anchor stores left, and is described as "dead." These are typically associated with a negative experience for shoppers, as it implies a lack of variety, activity, and appeal. While the reviewer acknowledges the presence of specialty shops, the overall tone and description of the mall create a negative sentiment.

question: The Dillard's Clearance Center was great before it closed, and the Sears is convenient (although closing) if you need things that Sears sells but otherwise, unless you like \"urban\" stores or have a need for numerous athletic shoe stores, there's no reason to go here. Belk, Chick-fil-A, Gap and other mall staples- all gone.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the review highlights that several key stores in the area have closed, leaving limited shopping options. The closure of popular stores like Belk, Chick-fil-A, and Gap signifies a decline in the overall shopping experience in the vicinity. Additionally, the mention of the Sears store closing suggests a pattern of diminishing retail options in the area, contributing to the reviewer's disappointment.

question: I love this place for my nails and pedicure! I am so particular, PICKY and meticulous with everything from brows, skin and haircut and Tina does everything to perfection like the way I like it! I have never had to look at my French and say anything bad about them! She is perfect with polish, the smile line and making sure there is no cuticle or skin left! And Ricky is also da bomb at pedicures! If you want someone to get all the crust and cuticle, he is the one to go to!!
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer expresses their love for the nail salon and the exceptional service they receive from the staff members, Tina and Ricky. The reviewer highlights their high standards and specific preferences, and praises Tina's attention to detail and perfection in meeting their expectations. They also commend Ricky's skill in pedicures, specifically noting his thorough work in removing cuticles and crust. Overall, the review is filled with praise and satisfaction towards the services provided, making it a positive sentiment.

question: Great first time experience! $10 for a manicure!!!! You cannot say no! She did a great job esp with my cuticles! Thank you! I will return!
rationale: The review expresses satisfaction with the affordable price, quality service, and attention to detail received during the manicure appointment. The customer acknowledges the excellent job done with their cuticles, indicating that they were pleased with the outcome. The statement of gratitude and intent to return further reinforces the positive sentiment and overall positive experience.

question: Jim is the best for customer service. He makes you feel like you are his only customer even if it is busy. For quality this place can't be beat.
rationale: The review praises Jim for his exceptional customer service, highlighting that he provides personalized attention even during busy times. Additionally, the reviewer mentions that the place offers unbeatable quality. These positive remarks indicate a high level of satisfaction with both the service and the product, leading to an overall positive sentiment in the review.

question: First off, I NEVER right reviews unless it's positive. Since I am a small business owner and work in customer service, I know the impact of word of mouth. Let me just say Meineke gave me the worst service I've received in my year and a half since moving to NC. First visit, a mechanic talked me out of getting my brakes repaired after I came in expressing concern about a grinding deeling I experience when I back up. Nothing is wrong, its just the brakes adjusting after it rains he said. Your brake pads & shoes have 40% left he said. A month later I was at Lexus getting my shoes AND rotors replaced. AND was told the front had 5% wear left... and like an idiot, I returned fir my last free oil change (2 free preferred oil changes from Groupon). From the beginning I should've turned around. I came in expressing I ONLY want my preferred oil change because they dropped the ball on the brakes. After explaining the last situation, there was no offer to rectify the matter in any way. A mechanic doing the oil change brought me to the back to show me my front brakes like I didn't just tell him what he was telling me. Then told me I need an air filter. Smh. Simple quick fix. I tell him to add it. Can't mess that up right? Wrong. It took an extra 35 mins to add the add filter. Then I get my bill and see they've only done a BASIC oil change. No topping of fluids, no rotating of my tires... so I ask what oil change did you do? The mechanic says Basic. And I asked, what does the Groupon say? He says Preferred. And I said, my car requires a synthetic blend. And what happened to my tired rotation? The mechanic said oh we rotated the tires too; I watched him do it. Everything that should've been done is handled miss. I go outside, and the same chalk marking that was there on my left rear tire, is still there, on the left rear. Smh. I was already late for my next appointment and beyond sick of this ordeal so I left. And the ENTIRE time this disaster is happening, the store manager is periodically coming out to greet everyone who comes in EXCEPT me. He hears my complaint, and NEVER comes out to at least apologize for any inconvenience. I just pray their basic oil change doesn't harm my engine. I will never in life return to nor will I recommend Meineke as a company to trust your car with!
rationale: The sentiment of the review is negative due to multiple instances of poor customer service and incompetence experienced by the reviewer at Meineke. The reviewer highlights instances of being misled about necessary brake repairs, receiving subpar service during an oil change, and feeling ignored and unappreciated by the store manager despite voicing their concerns. The lack of accountability, failure to correct mistakes, and overall unsatisfactory experience described in the review contribute to the negative sentiment expressed towards Meineke.

question:
Purchased the living social for two oil changes and tire rotation. The first one went great- they did an overall inspection and told me about a few things on my car that would need some attention in the future (included on a written report). He did try to get me to get a couple additional services for an astronomical price, but I passed. 
Today, I went in for my appointment for my second oil change & tire rotation. I also opted to have my power steering fluid flushed as they had previously recommended- which cost $60. After 1 hour, they told me my car was ready-awesome! I didn't get the same 29 point inspection report that I had gotten last time- but that was ok with me since they seemed to be super busy and I pretty much just got a free oil change and tire rotation. Got in my car and checked the menu. They hadn't reset my oil percentage like they did last time (no big deal though) but my tire PSI values were all reading the same (I went in with one low tire and I was aware which one it was). I walked back in and asked the guy if my tires had been rotated. He grabbed my receipt and highlighted where it said "Tire Rotation". I can read, thanks. I kindly told him that my tire pressures were the same as when I walked in and the low tire was in the same location. He said he would check with his technician. Comes back a minute later and asks for my keys. No, they did not rotate the tires even though it stated they did on my receipt. They said sorry, rotated the tires, but didn't even put any air in the one that was low. If they were too busy to do their job right, they should have rescheduled some appointments. My issue is that since they lied once, I really have no idea if they did the oil change & fluid flush correctly (or at all for that matter). It also wouldn't have been that big of an issue if the guy at the counter wasn't so cocky highlighting my receipt and instead check with his technician first. Just because I am a young female doesn't mean I am stupid and can be taken advantage of. I will NOT be returning to this location.

The only reason I am giving them two stars is because my first experience was somewhat pleasant.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the customer had a subpar experience during their second visit for an oil change and tire rotation. The service was not thorough, with the technician failing to rotate the tires as indicated on the receipt and not addressing the issue of the low tire pressure. There was a lack of communication and attention to detail, leading the customer to question if the services they paid for were actually performed correctly. Additionally, the customer felt disrespected by the dismissive attitude of the staff, particularly the highlighting of the receipt instead of addressing the actual issue. The customer also felt that they were not taken seriously based on their gender, adding to their overall dissatisfaction with the service received.

question: Food: Pretty good. Not to greasy. \n\nPrice: Reasonable. The lunch combo are a deal.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the review highlights the positive aspects of the food, noting that it is pretty good and not too greasy. Additionally, the reviewer finds the price reasonable and mentions that the lunch combos are a good deal, emphasizing the value for the money. Overall, the review focuses on the strengths of the restaurant, making it clear that the reviewer had a positive experience.

question: My boyfriend called for delivery we didn't know exactly what we wanted, so we were kind slow and hesitant,  but the lady had an attitude on the phone ,  .. She said 45 min to an hour every time i call for dilivery its never that long... And then she ask if their was a problem which confuses me.... the food is amazing though.I  never had a problem with chin chin before until now, I don't like rude employees especially at a restaurant cause who knows whats happening to our food.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the customer had a negative interaction with the employee taking their delivery order. The customer felt that the employee had an attitude on the phone and was rude when stating the estimated delivery time. The customer expressed dissatisfaction with the service received and highlighted concerns about the attitude of restaurant employees potentially affecting the quality of their food.

question: The crab rangoons are awesome! The rest was mediocre. The eggrolls were ok. The rice was plain, edible with soy sauce. The general tso's chicken was bland, not sweet, just spicy and a bit soggy. They did say it would take 40 mins for delivery an dit only took 20, so that was nice. But overall I won't be getting food here again.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the review mentions several disappointing aspects of the food, including mediocre taste, bland dishes, and soggy textures. The lack of sweetness in the general Tso's chicken and the plainness of the rice further contribute to the negative experience. Despite the fast delivery time, the overall quality and taste of the food outweigh the positive aspect, leading the reviewer to decide not to order from there again.

question:
I did not know about The Truth Buddhist Society until I saw Connie's review.  As she mentioned, it's a Chinese speaking establishment.  

They are absolutely not prepared to receive English speakers curious about Buddhism.  I didn't see a single English language book even though they were kind enough to let me look over their library.  And after a minute or two I was shoo'd away.   

Buddha and Dharma are only a breath away.  But in Charlotte, Sangha is hard to find...
rationale: The sentiment of this review is categorized as Positive because despite the language barrier and lack of resources for English speakers at The Truth Buddhist Society, the reviewer expressed gratitude for being allowed to look over the library. Additionally, the reviewer maintains a sense of optimism by acknowledging the nearness of Buddha and Dharma despite the difficulty of finding a suitable Sangha in Charlotte. Their words suggest a positive outlook and appreciation for the Buddhist community they encountered.

question:
Recently had my son's 9th birthday party here.
Staff is super nice but the overall facilities are small and lacking for a child's birthday party.

There is not an area for adults to sit while kids are in the laser tag area.
No assistance is provided in the 'party room' for distributing drinks, pizza, etc.
No hand sanitizer provided for the kids prior to eating.
The employee at the front desk said "we just use soap to clean our hands the old fashion way." Ok, but the bathroom soap dispensers were empty.

We've had parties at Sports Connection that are fantastic.
Lesson learned and will continue to have Sports Connection host.

The location is great for small groups of Teens or Adults.
Just don't expect much for a child's party.

Once again the staff was very nice and polite.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer expresses dissatisfaction with several aspects of their experience hosting a child's birthday party at the location. They mention the lack of adequate facilities and amenities for a child's party, such as the absence of a designated area for adults to sit, lack of assistance in the party room, and missing hand sanitizer for kids. The reviewer also highlights issues with cleanliness and maintenance, such as empty soap dispensers. Although they appreciate the staff's friendliness, overall, the review reflects disappointment and a decision to seek a different venue for future parties.

question:
From the time my parents moved to Charlotte in the early 80's, until they moved in 2001, they brought their cars here. Any time  I was in town, I always did the same. There are several reasons for that.

After moving back to Charlotte a couple of weeks ago from the West Coast, I heard a funny noise coming from the rear axle of my '05 S2000. Even though it's clear on the other side of town from where I'm living, my first thought was to take her over to Compact Car to check it out. Even though I walked in during a pretty busy afternoon, I was helped promptly by a service tech, who knew exactly what questions to ask about any other problems I'd had with the car, and inside of half an hour he was pulling it back up in front of the waiting area.

The diagnosis was what I had pretty much suspected- a loose axle nut- and when I asked him how much I owed him, he shrugged and said not to worry about it. This is how customer service is supposed to be done, and needless to say I'll be bringing my baby back there for an oil change next week. 

Honest folks, more than fair prices, and quality of work. That's why my family's been going to Compact Car for 20+ years, and as long as I'm in NC, they'll work on any Hondas that I own.

One more thing: I just called here to schedule more service on my car, and they had me in their computer system from the last time I had a car worked on by them- TEN YEARS AGO. Now that's dedication in my book.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is positive because the customer had a pleasant experience at Compact Car. The customer appreciated the quick and knowledgeable service provided by the technician, the honesty in diagnosing the issue with the car, and the gesture of not charging for the service. The customer also highlighted the long-standing trust their family had in the automotive shop, citing fair prices, quality work, and a history of good customer service. Additionally, the mention of being recognized in the computer system after ten years further underscores the dedication and reliability of Compact Car, leaving the customer satisfied and eager to return for future services.

question:
This is how your mechanic should be. Honest, friendly, with fair prices. I am a new customer here, just got back home from my 3rd visit here over the last 6 months. This time it was just a simple oil and transmission fluid change, and a battery/alternator check.

I love how they come out to the waiting area and teach you about how your car works. It is like they are a surgeon and they are telling you the pros/cons of what needs to be done.

There is also no pressure to get services done to your vehicle. They will tell you honestly if something needs to be fixed asap, or if it can wait. So far, they have saved me about $300 over what Metro Honda was going to charge me for the same services. They also gave me the option to use Honda parts or 3rd party on a previous issue, which is great because I prefer to use Honda parts. I have no worries when bringing my car here. I know they are going to quote me a fair price, and the work perform is going to be at a higher level than any other place in town.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the customer had multiple positive experiences with the mechanic, highlighting qualities such as honesty, friendliness, fair pricing, and educational service. The customer appreciated the detailed explanations provided by the mechanic, as well as the lack of pressure to get unnecessary services. They also noted the cost savings compared to another dealership and the option to choose between different parts. Overall, the customer has a high level of trust in the mechanic and is satisfied with the quality of service received, leading to a positive review.

question: We've purchased several cars over the years. Usually from a Hendrick dealership. Our experience at the Lexus dealership tops them all. For the first time, I felt like a client, not a target. The Pre-owned Sales staff treated me as though I were buying a new car. Professional, super friendly, and aiming to please, Hendrick Lexus is as good as it gets!
rationale: The sentiment in the review is positive because the customer expresses satisfaction with their experience at the Lexus dealership, highlighting that they felt like a valued client rather than just a potential sale. The customer praises the professionalism, friendliness, and customer-centric approach of the staff, indicating that their interactions were positive and tailored to meeting their needs. Overall, the review suggests that the customer had an excellent experience at the dealership, warranting a positive sentiment.

question:
We just bought our first Lexus from Hendrick Lexus on Independence Blvd in Charlotte. Hendrick and Tony Hairston (our sales contact) earned our business by spending the time to ensure we knew why Lexus was the best choice and why the RX350 was the right car.

It was our first luxury car so we had a ton of research and notes. Tony was very patient and worked with us to get a great deal. No pressure tactics, just straight talk and respect durining the process.

The service center is great - super clean, great waiting area and helpful and knowledgeable staff.

We look forward to a long relationship with this location.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer had a great experience purchasing their first Lexus from Hendrick Lexus. They appreciated the time and effort Hendrick and Tony Hairston took to explain why Lexus was the best choice and why the RX350 was the right car for them. The lack of pressure tactics, the respectful communication, and the great deal they received further enhanced their positive experience. Additionally, the positive comments about the service center being clean, having a great waiting area, and helpful staff suggest an overall positive experience and a desire for a long-term relationship with the location.

question:
Have gone to the dealership several times received great customer service at the Independence and Northlake location by the people (my representative), had one not so great encounter but my personal rep at the dealership took care of the matter directly and provided a satisfactory end result.. 

**But what matters is what was done under the hood. 

Check Engine Light on. Total of three times. 

Went to Independence dealership, twice, at first they couldn't find out why it was coming on, then they said it was due to the fact that I needed to change my tires. So they reset the light to make it go away and was informed to have the tires changed.
This happened twice, diagnostic was the same for both times from Independence location.

Light came back on again the third time. Went to a Northlake dealership, they informed there was a misfire causing the Check Engine light to come on. They 'fixed' the issue and said, something in engine/engine part was dirty due to use regular fuel, which I have only used premium fuel. Question remains of what damages if any that were done to the engine by driving the car with improper diagnostics. 

Oil Change at NorthLake:
