They have a man I apologize I can't remember his name a younger guy. Since he has been there They have lost all of our business! He is cocky and a complete smart A$$. My apologies but there is no other way to put it! He really could care less if you have or had a problem. He is nice upfront until an issue arises! We have received wrong partial orders and orders that have been half wrong half right when we ordered delivery recently trying to give wok BO another chance. After a \"FEW\" wrong orders one evening I decided to call it back in. After The delivery took 45mins beyond what we were told initially I got nothing but attitude from the young man and was told that What I received is what I ordered. No it wasn't! Still had the paper that we write our orders on and called in with. After I was politely told by him that I must have thought we ordered the other stuff he says that they will send the driver back out but would be about an hour and asked for us to pay the 5.47 difference in price and return the other meal. Maybe it's just me but that's bad business! We had 3 people there to eat as I explained to him and now for everyone to eat together there food would be cold as well as the inconvenience. This happened several times recently as I have said but the COMPLETE ATTITUDE this young man always has when there is a problem makes thus past Friday my last meal from them. Mrs. Nancy and her husband(Assuming they are still the owners) that owned wok Bo are great people I only hope that they see how detrimental to the business this guy is before its to late! I would live to have the old wok-Bo back it was by far a favorite but my business will not return until this young man is gone! Many others I know have had the same sorts if problems with him and will not return either. So much for an 8+ years of being a customer!
rationale: The sentiment expressed in the review is negative because the customer is expressing disappointment and frustration with the decline in quality and service at the restaurant, specifically due to the behavior and attitude of a particular staff member. The customer recounts multiple instances of wrong orders, poor customer service, and a lack of willingness to rectify mistakes. The tone of the review is critical and indicates a strong dissatisfaction with the current state of the restaurant, leading to the decision to stop patronizing the establishment.

question: This place is horrible!  The ONLY reason we order from them is because they deliver.  Most of the time we tolerate their food if for the grace of god they get our order correct.  2 out of the last 3 times we've ordered they have screwed up our order.  It takes them normally over an hour to get our food to us.  The most recent horrible experience I order the Shrimp Chow Mein.  My order came without the crunchy noodles.  So all i had was a pile of lettuce soaked in some liquid with shrimp.  I called and complained and the lady that answered said the next time I ordered she would give me an extra bag of crunchy noodles.  I told her I might not order this again next time.  Then she offered a free drink.  We don't go there in person we only order.  I wasn't going to take a free coke for them messing up my order.  I told her how about you knock $5 off our next order.  The lady refused.  Don't waste your time.  They don't care how crappy their service is.  Take the extra time and drive to Red Bowl or a better restaurant.  I'd give them 0 stars if I could.
rationale: The sentiment in the review is negative because the customer had a consistently bad experience with the restaurant. The order was often incorrect, took a long time to be delivered, and was of poor quality when received. The customer's specific complaint about the missing crunchy noodles in their Shrimp Chow Mein further highlights the restaurant's lack of attention to detail and customer satisfaction. Additionally, the customer expressed frustration with the response from the staff when trying to address the issue and the lack of willingness to provide a satisfactory resolution. Overall, the review conveys a strong sense of dissatisfaction and disappointment with the restaurant's service and quality, leading to a negative sentiment.

question: Horrible customer service and when I talked to the manager she apologized but you can tell she didn't care.
rationale: The sentiment is Negative because the customer service was described as "horrible," indicating a very negative experience. Additionally, the lack of genuine care shown by the manager further contributes to the negative sentiment of the review.

question:
When we needed to replace our heat pump, I did a ton of research on companies - even had a few of them come in and give estimates on doing so.  Most of them were pretty close on price.  In the end, it came down to two things that helped make the decision on which one to go with.

The first part of the decision was the company who made us feel the most comfortable.  There are plenty of people who come in and try and sell you something.  But right off, Rodney Bradham made us feel like he wanted us to understand what we were getting (not an easy task), rather than just slamming in a new system.  That was a pleasant difference from most of the others who came in.

The second was how long the company had been around.  It isn't much of a surprise to find that there are a lot of companies out there who will sell you just about anything, but Bradham Brothers had been around for a long time - nearly 30 years.  That's a lot longer than many.

So we went with Bradham, and have been very happy with the decision.  We have only had one time when the system has had a problem, and they responded, came out and fixed it promptly - all covered under the warranty.
rationale: The sentiment in the review is positive because the customer had a good experience with Bradham Brothers when replacing their heat pump. The customer appreciated the personalized approach of Rodney Bradham, who took the time to help them understand the product rather than just pushing for a sale. Additionally, the customer valued the company's long-standing reputation of almost 30 years, which instilled confidence in their decision. The prompt response and resolution of a system issue under warranty further reinforced the positive sentiment. Overall, the customer expressed satisfaction with their choice and the service provided by Bradham Brothers.

question: When we needed a new heating/cooling system we invited three companies for estimates.  Bradham was the only honest estimate - not overselling a more expensive product, but what we needed for the size of our home and existing ductwork.  With the semi - annual service inspections, it continues to perform as promised.   All staff have been helpful and extremely friendly,  so I will continue to recommend Branham Brothers.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the review highlights several aspects of Branham Brothers that the customer was pleased with. The customer appreciated that the company provided an honest estimate without overselling, recommended a system that suited their home's needs, and that the system continued to perform as promised during service inspections. Additionally, the customer mentioned that all staff members were helpful and friendly, leading to a positive overall experience and a willingness to recommend the company to others.

question: This place is a hole in the wall and a bit hard to find. That being said, the food is fantastic. I've had lunch there a few times and its very inexpensive. Their tamales are fluffy, the fajitas are well seasoned and their mole is complex like a good mole should be. I have never had a bad meal here.
rationale: The review highlights positive aspects of the place, such as the fantastic food, inexpensive prices, and well-prepared dishes like fluffy tamales, well-seasoned fajitas, and complex mole. The reviewer mentions having never had a bad meal there, indicating consistent quality and satisfying experiences. These positive comments contribute to an overall positive sentiment towards the establishment.

question:
This is another in a long list of  "Thank the flying spaghetti monster for Yelp!"

I was flying back from Memphis and got stranded at the airport in Charlotte for the night due to bad weather in NY.  I grabbed a cheap hotel near the airport, took their shuttle bus and ended up  in the middle of some place I knew nothing about.

What to do for dinner?  Well, that's easy, let's open yelp and find something within a reasonable walking distance.

This place pops up as one of the best within a walking distance.  I would have never seen it without Yelp.  It is almost part of a little motel, tucked away in the backside of some parking lot.  I actually walked by it before turning back around and finally finding it.

They have a nice little covered outside seating area. . .and the weather was beautiful down there so I took advantage.  A little noisy because it is almost on the highway, but the weather more than made up for the noise.  The inside looks a lot like a typical American Diner, which was a bit weird, but I don't care much for decor if the food is good.

The menu was a standard and basic Mexican food menu.  I am a big fan of Carnitas and it is always hard to find decent Carnitas in the chex-mex dominated "mexican" food places around my place in queens. . . so I was immediately drawn to that dish.

It was absolutely great.  Nothing special or fancy, but the meat was well cooked (and cooked right which isn't always the case).  The guacamole that came with it was fresh and tasty.  The tortillas were perfectly fine and all of the trimmings were fresh and of good quality.

I then ordered a beer, she asked if I wanted a large and I said yes. . .who am I to blow against the wind?  And this thing was monstrous.  We are talking at least 24 ounces.

My bill came to about 14 dollars, which I thought was perfectly reasonable considering the size of the beer, the amount and tastiness of the meal.

Would definitely go again.
rationale: The sentiment of this review is positive because the reviewer had a positive dining experience overall. They were stranded and found the restaurant with the help of Yelp, enjoyed the outdoor seating area, and praised the quality of the Carnitas dish they ordered. They also mentioned the fresh guacamole, good quality trimmings, and the large serving size of their beer. The reviewer found the food to be tasty and reasonably priced, expressing a willingness to return in the future.

question:
This is the true definition of a dive. Don't go in expecting much, just amazing food at great prices. One of the best Mexican restaurants I have been to.

Never judge a book by it's cover. Simple decor, standard mexican menu, but amazing food. If you are staying at a hotel near by, it's worth the walk.

The service can be a little slow when it's busy but when you take a bite, you'll forget about it all.
rationale: The review highlights the positive aspects of the restaurant despite its appearance as a dive. The reviewer emphasizes the amazing food and great prices, indicating a pleasantly surprising experience. Despite the slow service mentioned, the overall sentiment is positive due to the high praise for the quality of the food and the recommendation for others to visit.

question: Miguel's is great.  This may be difficult to locate for people that are randomly looking to stop somewhere, though.  The good is very good tasting tex/mex.  The service is just fine and attentive, I've not experienced any customer service issues here.  They have combos and affordable food if you want something cheap; otherwise there big entrees are good and still not a wallet buster.\n\nI'd recommend this place to anyone on the west side or anyone making the trip South on I-85.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the review highlights several positive aspects of Miguel's, such as the quality of the Tex-Mex food, attentive service, affordability, and variety in menu options. The reviewer also recommends the place to others, indicating overall satisfaction with their experience. These factors contribute to an overall positive sentiment towards Miguel's.

question: As other yelpers have indicated, it is hard to not be deterred when you first pull up.  The old building combined with the large Motel sign caused me to pause and think of going somewhere else.  However, thanks to positive reviews on Yelp, I continued inside and had a very good meal.  Pricing is very reasonable and the food is good.  The service, although not the friendliest, was solid and my server checked on me often.  I was in and out in about 35 minutes, but didn't feel rushed.  Overall, I would recommend Miguel's for someone looking for a Mexican food alternative to the national chains.
rationale: The sentiment is Positive because the reviewer initially had reservations about dining at Miguel's due to the appearance of the building and signage. However, they were pleasantly surprised by the positive reviews, which encouraged them to give it a try. The reviewer ultimately had a very good meal at a reasonable price, with efficient service and a pleasant dining experience overall. Despite initial doubts, the positive experience at Miguel's led the reviewer to recommend it as a viable alternative for Mexican food over national chains.

question:
I'm officially a fan. There's room for improvement but it's everything I'd look for if I was looking for a locally owned, non-chain Mexican restaurant.

We did have a service oops. I asked for cheese dip (queso) when we sat down and ordered our drinks. It never showed up. I think the waitress forgot because it wasn't on the bill either.

The inside dining room is SMALL. As you can see from pictures that others have posted, there is also an outside portico for dining outside when the weather is nice.  Tonight it was windy and threatening rain so we didn't have that as a choice.

The location is nothing to write home about but the kitchen turns out very edible food.  Having lived in the southwest for 5 years, it doesn't measure up to what I got out in TX, AZ, etc. but by Charlotte standards, it's fantastic.

I had the Chicken Coco Loco. It was tasty!  My dining mate had stuffed pablano peppers. He cleaned his plate.

I wish I had seen the Thursday special before I ordered! I would have enjoyed that too... "Special Burritos".

For families, remember the space is constrained. I would not bring a rambunctious kid here. Your neighboring diners will be ready to strangle you and the kid.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the review emphasizes various positive aspects of the Mexican restaurant, such as the tasty food, friendly service, and enjoyable dining experience overall. The reviewer mentions that despite a service hiccup with the cheese dip, they were still impressed by the quality of the food and the enjoyable dishes like Chicken Coco Loco and stuffed poblano peppers. Additionally, the reviewer notes that while the restaurant may not match the level of Mexican cuisine in the southwest, it is considered fantastic by Charlotte standards. Overall, the positive tone of the review and the appreciation for the restaurant's offerings indicate a positive sentiment.

question: Whoever said this place has good food, doesn't know what good food is! The food was bad! Way too salty, cheese tasted like crap. The service was pitiful! I ordered water and guacamole at the same time, and the guacamole came 10 minutes before the water? The guacamole was basically avocado and onion, that's it! The chips were all broken and stale. The only reason this isn't 1 star is because they had horchata and they were inexpensive and close to the airport. My advice? Skip it!
rationale: The review expresses dissatisfaction on various aspects of the dining experience, including the poor quality of food, salty dishes, disappointing service, delayed delivery of ordered items, and subpar guacamole. The broken and stale chips also contributed to the negative sentiment. Although the reviewer acknowledges a few positives like the availability of horchata and proximity to the airport, the overall tone and detailed critique point towards a negative sentiment due to the disappointment and lack of satisfaction with the food and service.

question: Always a good meal,       and Love the  weekend specials usually :) \n\nNever had a problem at all ! !
rationale: The review expresses consistently positive experiences with the meals, particularly highlighting enjoyment of the weekend specials. The use of exclamation points and positive language like "Love" and "Never had a problem" indicate the customer's satisfaction and lack of any significant issues. Overall, the review conveys a positive sentiment towards the restaurant's quality of food and service.

question: So, having read some recent reviews, and being a Mexican fan, I had to get to Miguel's. Sunday's Lunch Special, Fajitas for $4.99. I arrived a little before 12 and the place was already crowded and by 12:30 every table was full. The servers were friendly and chips and salsa arrived immediately upon being seated. Although the salsa was a little smooth for my taste it had great flavor and the chips were good too! The fajitas arrived fresh and steaming, they were served with tortillas, sour cream, pico, and rice and beans. I chose the chicken, with included onions, peppers, mushrooms, and zucchini, and a great portion size...especially for the price.  \nEven though the look of the restaurant is not what you would expect, it is worth a visit..and I know I will be back on Sunday when I have a fajita craving :-).
rationale: The sentiment of the review is positive because the customer had a satisfying experience at Miguel's restaurant. They enjoyed the Sunday Lunch Special of fajitas for a great price, appreciated the friendly service, and found the food to be delicious and served promptly. They also highlighted the generous portion size and mentioned that despite the restaurant's appearance not meeting expectations, the overall experience was worth returning for. These positive comments indicate the customer's enjoyment of their visit and their intention to come back, reflecting a positive sentiment overall.

question:
Being near my office, we frequent this place for lunch. 

Service: outstanding. Always fast and friendly, with bottomless chips and salsa that actually get refilled.

Food: the food is standard Mexican fare, done simple and well. While you won't find anything truly amazing, everything I've tried has been delicious, well thought out, and ready quickly.

Value: this is where they truly shine. The prices are unbeatable for what you get, and the daily special gets you out the door for about $6, without leaving you hungry. Try whatever is on special that day if you aren't sure, and chances are you'll be pleased.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the review highlights several aspects of the restaurant that are commendable. The service is described as outstanding, with fast and friendly staff who consistently refill chips and salsa. The food is praised for being delicious, well-prepared, and served quickly. Additionally, the value for money is emphasized as unbeatable, with affordable prices and a daily special that offers a satisfying meal at a low cost. Overall, the reviewer appears to have had a consistently positive experience at the restaurant.

question: I love Miguel's. It's not fancy but the food is really good. You could miss this place easily if you weren't looking for it. But do look for it, you'll be glad you did. When you walk in, you feel like you're walking in to someone's home kitchen. There is a choice of indoor or outdoor seating. The outdoor seating is in a little open air structure, so you are still out of the elements if it's raining or if the sun is beating down in the summertime. The menu has a lot to offer, I usually get tacos and rice and beans, while my fella usually gets jalapeno poppers and a veggie quesadilla. There are also American choices on the menu. Portion sizes are generous. The police in the area seem to really like eating here, there is almost always an officer dining when we go there. That tells me 3 things, Miguel's treats our officers right, the food is really good and a good value, and I will be safe eating at this establishment. Service is always friendly. I wish Miguel's would come to Raleigh.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is positive because the reviewer expresses love for Miguel's, describing the food as really good and mentioning that they would be glad to have found it. They appreciate the homey ambiance, diverse menu choices, generous portion sizes, and the fact that police officers frequent the restaurant, indicating good treatment of customers and overall satisfaction with their dining experience. Additionally, the reviewer expresses a desire for the restaurant to expand to another location, reinforcing their positive feelings towards Miguel's.

question: Miguel's is a pretty ordinary joint - canteen type place. Nothing special about it. The lady who served us was so cold & uncourteous, sitting at the restaurant for half an hour felt like a chore. Am not going back to this particular one for sure!
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the customer had a subpar experience at Miguel's. The reviewer described the place as ordinary with nothing special to offer and criticized the service for being cold and uncourteous. The fact that the customer felt their time spent there was unpleasant and described it as a chore indicates a lack of satisfaction with their overall dining experience. Additionally, the reviewer explicitly states they will not be returning to this establishment in the future, solidifying their negative perception of the restaurant.

question: Fantastic little Mexican joint in the quiet little town of Charlotte MX... Seriously the outside screams Mexico! The food is amazing!! The beers are super cold! (Colder than Mexico) The carnitas tacos were fantastic! Fajitas were fantastic! The one and only thing I would say was so so was the guacamole, it was still good but could use a revamp on the recipe... Other than that,, I would NOT change a thing!! Can't wait till next time!
rationale: The sentiment in the review is positive because the customer praises various aspects of the Mexican restaurant. They describe the food as amazing, the beers as super cold, and highlight the fantastic taste of the carnitas tacos and fajitas. Despite a minor critique of the guacamole, the overall experience is deemed excellent and the customer expresses excitement about returning in the future. The use of enthusiastic language and no major complaints indicate a positive sentiment overall.

question: Great food!!!  Great service!  Great prices!  Authentic Mexican food in a casual setting. Three of us enjoyed three different entrees and all said we would definitely go back. Was close to the motel we stayed in while waiting for our next morning flight out of CLT.  Wouldn't stay in that motel again but will eat at Miguel's again for sure!
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer had a great experience at Miguel's, praising the food, service, and prices. They specifically mentioned that the Mexican food was authentic and enjoyed by all three members of their group. The convenience of the location near their motel further added to their positive experience, with the reviewer expressing a willingness to return to Miguel's in the future.

question:
So Miquel's is definitely a perfect definition for a "Hole in the Wall" but let's be honest those places clearly have the best food. 

As a self proclaimed Mexican fanatic I was excited to see just what this place had to offer. 

We started with the chips and salsa and they were classic. The chips were warm and crispy and the salsa had just the right amount of kick! 

My friends and I ordered a little bit of everything...fajitas, shrimp quesadillas, tacos, rice and beans. 

Everything was delicious...and the portion sizes were perfect! Add to that good service and super reasonable prices! I'm absolutely coming back.
rationale: The sentiment in the review is positive because the reviewer expresses excitement about trying the food at Miquel's, enjoys the chips and salsa, describes the dishes ordered as delicious, mentions the portion sizes as perfect, appreciates the good service, and finds the prices reasonable. The overall tone of the review is enthusiastic and satisfied, indicating a positive experience at the restaurant.

question: I'm so glad I decided to have dinner at Miquel's tonight. The spinach enchiladas were delicious and the service was prompt. The place is packed and I can see why. I'll be back tomorrow.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer expresses satisfaction with their dining experience at Miquel's. They enjoyed the delicious spinach enchiladas, appreciated the prompt service, and mentioned the busy atmosphere as a sign of the restaurant's popularity. The reviewer even mentions their intention to return, indicating a positive overall experience that they would like to repeat.

question: The first time I went to Miguel's I ordered the fajita plate. That was pretty good. The second I brought my wife and we ordered the special Steak Burrito plate. We also ordered guacamole on the side. Nothing was authentic and nothing was fresh. The steak was like the Philly cheese steak you would get from a frozen box and the guacamole was definitely not fresh avocado. The chips and salsa... chips were made fresh as they were still warm and salsa could be freshly made but not sure. I was disappointed the second time. Not sure if I would go back. I can make better Mexican food than this place.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer expressed disappointment in the lack of authenticity and freshness of the food at Miguel's. They specifically mentioned that the steak tasted like it was from a frozen box and that the guacamole did not taste like fresh avocado. Additionally, the reviewer stated that they were unsure if they would return to the restaurant, indicating a lack of willingness to give it another chance based on their unsatisfactory experience. Overall, the review highlights a strong sense of letdown and dissatisfaction with the quality of the food, resulting in a negative sentiment.

question: Had the tamales and chimi. Food was excellent. Don't let the location intimidate you. It conveniently located near CLT airport and the nearby hotels.
rationale: The review expresses positive sentiments by praising the excellent food quality, reassuring others not to be deterred by the location, and highlighting the convenient proximity to the airport and hotels. The reviewer's endorsement of the food and convenient location indicates a positive overall experience.

question: I don't give out 5 stars. But this is a little gem. It's not TexMex and its not a taco shop its a Mexican restaurant.  As in Mexico it does not look good from the outside, in fact if it was not for yelp I would have driven right by the place. Food is great service is good.  My one note would be the portions are too big!! Yes they gave a full bar. If this was anywhere near where I live I would have my own table. I'll be back.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer describes the restaurant as a "little gem" and praises the food as great with good service. They also mention that they would have their own table if the restaurant was closer to where they live and express an intention to return. The reviewer appreciates the authenticity of the Mexican restaurant and only has a minor critique about the portion sizes being too big, which overall indicates a positive experience.

question: Excellent 'Dive-Mex'.  Easy to eat lunch for  less than $5.  Plenty of outdoor seating when the weather is warm
rationale: The review describes the restaurant as "Excellent" and mentions that it offers an easy and affordable lunch option for less than $5. Additionally, the review notes the availability of plenty of outdoor seating when the weather is warm, which suggests a pleasant dining experience. Overall, the positive language used in the review and the mention of good value and comfortable seating contribute to the positive sentiment.

question:
Very basic deli. I work close so go here often. From the street this place doesn't look like much, but once you enter... Still not much. Looks very outdated with booths and a few pictures on the wall, including beer signs although they don't serve beer. 

The sandwiches here are run of the mill deli sandwiches but extremely reasonably priced. They have daily specials for $3.50 for a full sub! Get a bucket of iced tea for a buck and you have lunch for under $5.00. 

The service is very friendly. Most of their business is regulars and they definitely let you know it. After going just a few times they had my name and order memorized. 

They are known for their "Little Rock Special" which is a cheesesteak, not bad but I prefer their cold subs.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is positive because the reviewer highlights several positive aspects of the deli, such as the extremely reasonable prices, friendly service, and the fact that they quickly memorized the reviewer's name and order. Additionally, the reviewer mentions that the sandwiches are decent, especially the cold subs. Even though the ambiance and decor may be described as outdated, the positive aspects outweigh any negatives in this review, resulting in an overall positive sentiment.

question: Let's face it.  Papa John's pizza is phenomenal compared to other national chains.  Their ingredients are simply better.  I order from this location and others very frequently.  \n\nThe Freedom Dr. location sadly has a lack of attention to detail at times.  More than half of the time, they do not fulfill your order as requested.  For example, if you want \"well done\" bake or a \"square cut\" crust, this may be ignored.  This is particularly annoying considering I order online and the exact specifications of the pizza are printed on a label that is then applied to the box.  Lack of attention to detail.
rationale: The sentiment in the review is negative because the customer expresses disappointment and frustration with the lack of attention to detail at the Papa John's location they frequent. Despite the customer's specific requests being included in their online order and printed on a label, the review indicates that more than half the time, these requests are not fulfilled. This inconsistency in meeting customer preferences reflects a lack of quality control and impacts the overall experience for the customer, leading to their negative assessment of their interactions with the restaurant.

question: I hate to dis on a place that I stayed for free after being stranded in an airport after a cancelled flight....It wasn't great but it did the job.  The AC was loud and made it hard to sleep, the sheets were scratchy (cheap detergent), the continental breakfast was not so yummy, but the customer service was nice and it was 5 minutes from the airport.  If you are in a bind at Charlotte International Airport it is a convenient option.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the overall experience described by the user was not positive. They mention several issues with the accommodations, such as loud air conditioning, scratchy sheets, and an unappetizing continental breakfast. Despite the convenience of being close to the airport and the friendly customer service, the negative aspects outweighed the positives, resulting in a negative sentiment overall.

question:
Horrible.....horrible.

Hole in the shower 
Stains on carpet 
Horrible stench 

I could go on forever.

Stay here at your own peril!
rationale: The sentiment of the review is Negative because the reviewer describes multiple issues with the accommodation, including a hole in the shower, stains on the carpet, and a horrible stench. These details highlight a poor overall experience, leading the reviewer to warn others to stay at their own peril.

question:
Gross, gross, gross!!!! 

First of all, check-in took forever! Then there was no elevators. I asked them what about being handicapped accessible? And the front desk lady got offended and babbled something under her breath. Thankfully I didn't have my big heavy luggage or I would've been pissed having to carry it up the stairs...regardless, I feel piss for the people that did have to carry theirs. 

Secondly, this place stinks and everything looks nasty!! I have never stayed at a hotel that looks so run down and overall dirty. The carpet feels so yucky but I didn't bring my flip flops. Ugh! 

Honestly, if they weren't running a special, I wouldn't have stayed here. I'll suck it up since we're only staying a few hours, but I definitely will take a long hot bath to wash off the stench before I leave!
rationale: The sentiment of this review is negative because the guest had a poor experience with long check-in wait times, lack of elevators making it difficult for disabled individuals, a bad odor and unsanitary conditions in the hotel, and an overall feeling of discomfort and dissatisfaction. The tone of the review is filled with frustration, disappointment, and a sense of regret for choosing to stay at the hotel.

question: This place is promoted as a 3-star hotel.  All hotels are not the same.  All cities are not the same.  When traveling from one region of the country into another adjust your expectations accordingly.  If you are coming from the NY or SF/LA area into Charlotte then your expectations for a 3 star hotel according to the ratings need to be adjusted.  This hotel is billed on-line as a 3 star hotel.  It is a 2 star hotel at best.\n\nThe staff is friendly, helpful and very accommodating.  The hotel itself is in need of a serious upgrade to make it to 3 stars.  The walls in the room show signs of serious water damage with cracks in the plaster and peeling paint and wallpaper.  The TV is outdated and old.  The number of channels is limited.  The plumbing system needs some serious attention.  There were two temperatures...freezing cold or scalding hot.  The medium temperature selection resulted in a water flow akin to a trickle.  With other hotels in the same 3-star category such as the Hilton, Hyatt and other top names downtown, don't get suckered into this location by the airport.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the review highlights several issues with the hotel, indicating that it falls short of the expectations for a 3-star rating. The reviewer specifically mentions the need for a serious upgrade, signs of water damage in the room, outdated amenities like the TV, and problems with the plumbing system. The comparison to other well-known 3-star hotels in the area further emphasizes the disappointment with the quality of this particular hotel. Overall, the reviewer's experience seems to have been below average, leading to a negative sentiment.

question: I recently stayed here through Priceline. I was pretty disappointed. It was overall not nearly as clean as you'd expect it and furthermore what appeared to be the manager at the front desk was berating a woman who appeared to be a new hire in front of the customers. I felt terrible for this woman. Just a terrible presentation overall and if I had a choice, I wouldn't go back.
rationale: The sentiment is Negative because the reviewer expresses disappointment with the cleanliness of the hotel and describes witnessing a negative interaction between the manager and a new employee, which made the reviewer feel terrible. These aspects contribute to an overall negative experience, leading the reviewer to state that they wouldn't choose to return to this establishment.

question: This place is a zero-star dive. In particular, do not eat dinner in the depressing restaurant.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is negative because the reviewer describes the place as a "zero-star dive" and advises against eating dinner in the "depressing" restaurant. These negative descriptors convey a strong sense of disappointment and dissatisfaction with the dining experience, making it clear that the reviewer had a negative overall impression of the place.

question: DRAT.  I booked this three star hotel via hotwire Im not an expert on the 5 star rating scale, but I thought too highly of a three star rating. Not clean, all kinds of shiz on the hallway floors, Ex. sunflower seeds, paper, in the corners you can see dirt & debre build up.  The main lobby is promising, to suck you in, but the plaster in the walls is cracked, room doors have been painted over 755778738688796 times.  My big window looks like someone stuck their big nasty greesy forehead and smeared it throughly.  Their was a big private hair atop my toilet paper roll.  \n\nOn Hotwire I got this room for $68 if you were to walk in the rate is $99.  So thank goodness I got it for the cheaper price!  Better than my last hotel stay @ La Quinta but still gross
rationale: The sentiment of the review is negative because the guest describes the hotel as not clean, with various types of debris on the hallway floors and visible dirt and debris build-up in corners. Additionally, they mention cracked plaster walls, poorly maintained room doors, and a dirty window. The presence of someone else's hair on the toilet paper roll further adds to the negative experience. Despite getting a discounted rate through Hotwire, the guest still feels that the overall cleanliness and condition of the hotel are unsatisfactory, making their stay unpleasant.

question:
Delay after delay with USAirways and I ended up missing my connecting flight back to Florida. The airline put me up in this hotel for the night.

The keys weren't working so I had to be escorted up to my room. Anytime I wanted to leave and go back in my room, I'd have to go downstairs and have someone open the door. The hotel itself seems pretty old, mildew smells down the halls, and not even close to being a '3-star'. 

The room was somewhat large and the bathroom was decent (bumped up to a two star review). The bed was a king and decent. A/C unit was very loud. The airline told me breakfast was free so in the morning I went down to the restaurant. I sat, read the paper and a waitress asked if I wanted a drink. Just water. I then go up and there's a couple old pastries, fruit, and yogurt. That was it. I take a couple things since I'm hungry and don't want to pay airport prices. The waitress comes and puts a bill on my table for $7!!! For old looking sad food I didn't even want to eat. I mentioned that the airline said breakfast was free, and she said, 'oh, that's in room ___'. So I go to the room, which isn't even near the lobby, and find.....the same old pastries, fruit and yogurt.

There are a couple nicer options nearby that probably don't cost much more.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is negative because the experience detailed by the reviewer was one of frustration and disappointment. Delays with the airline caused the traveler to miss their connecting flight, leading to a stay in a hotel that did not meet their expectations. The hotel had issues with keycards not working, a dated and musty environment, and misleading information about breakfast being included. The poor quality and limited selection of food at breakfast, along with being unexpectedly charged, added to the negative experience. Overall, the review indicates multiple negative aspects of the hotel stay that left the reviewer dissatisfied.

question: The place reminds me a lot of my freshman dorm. Peeling walls, fluorescent lighting flickering in the elevator and strange humid smells. Although my bed and bathroom were pretty clean, and the staff were really great, the hotel itself is pretty old and resembles a trucker motel. Way overpriced for what it is.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the guest's review highlights several undesirable qualities of the hotel, such as peeling walls, flickering lights, strange smells, and an overall resemblance to a trucker motel. Additionally, the mention of the place being overpriced for its condition further supports the negative sentiment expressed in the review. Despite clean rooms and helpful staff, the overall impression conveyed by the guest is that the hotel does not meet their expectations for the price paid.

question:
This hotel is stuck in the middle of nowhere. 

The restaurant staff is relatively friendly, but the space/decor is "budget" at best.

We had several problems with the Receptionists. Problems include: not being able to book a taxi, problems over room check-in/double booking a our room, and being rude over the phone.

Also, our Damn Room Key would never work!?! I had to walk up and down every time to get it to work again..

My best advice, pay a little extra money and book a hotel in Uptown Charlotte. This place doesn't deserve the business.
rationale: The sentiment of this review is negative because the reviewer expresses dissatisfaction with the hotel in multiple aspects. They mention that the hotel is located in a remote area, the restaurant decor is subpar, and they encountered various issues with the receptionists including difficulties with booking services, room check-in problems, rude behavior, and malfunctioning room keys. The reviewer also advises others to choose a different hotel in Uptown Charlotte instead, implying a strong sense of disappointment with their overall experience.

question: Nice staff.Dirty. There was fecal matter on my shower curtin. Cleanliness is not a priority here.  Hotwire is the reason for all my problems. I will never do name your own price.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the review highlights serious cleanliness issues at the hotel, specifically mentioning fecal matter on the shower curtain. The reviewer seems dissatisfied with the service and cleanliness standards of the establishment, as well as expressing frustration towards the booking platform, Hotwire. The overall tone conveys disappointment and a lack of intention to repeat the experience.

question: We stayed a week for a conference.  The hotel is under renovation.  The rooms are really nice.  The bathrooms are a little small.  We were told on check in that there was free continental breakfast on Tuesday  through Fridays.  That was weird in itself shouldn't it be everyday?  The front desk person went on to say that we needed vouchers but we would need to wait until the next day to get it.  Red flag!!! The next day around noon we go down stairs only to be told that we didn't need vouchers.  So my mom goes down on wed. To eat only to be told afterwards that there was a $9.99 fee.  She was able to eat without being charged...but management needs to get it together.  For the record...its not worth $9.99.  I hate having to beg for towels....and please dont give me a towel with someone else's make up.  You can see it just like i can when you are replacing them.  The Holiday Inn Brand shouldn't be abused just because there is a conference in town.  I forgot to mention that we were also charged for a suite when there are no suites in the hotel.  They did take care of that after a day of run around...my advice stay at another holiday inn until they get it together!!!!!
rationale: The sentiment is Negative because the reviewer had several frustrating experiences during their stay at the hotel. The issues with the voucher confusion for breakfast, inconsistencies in charges, waiting for towels, cleanliness concerns with makeup on towels, and being incorrectly charged for a suite all contributed to their dissatisfaction. These issues indicate a lack of organization, communication, and attention to detail on the part of the hotel management, leading to an overall negative experience for the guest.

question:
This is the first and only Showmars I've visited. There are about 20 of them in the Charlotte area. Food was pretty good. I'd give it one half step-up from a burger at a fast food joint.

I had a Greek Salad; the salad (especially the chicken) was tasty but the dressing was "totally bleh". Thankfully the default dressing was on the side so I asked for blue cheese dressing and it was much better -- they had Ken's dressing in a package.

My dinner mates had a burger and fish and chips. All around "OK". I'd not go out of my way to go again and certainly not worth a quest...
rationale: The sentiment of the review is negative because the reviewer expresses disappointment with their experience at Showmars. Despite acknowledging that the food was "pretty good," they only rated it slightly above a burger from a fast-food joint. The description of the salad dressing as "totally bleh" contributes to the negative sentiment, as does the overall lackluster response to the dishes ordered by the reviewer and their companions. Additionally, the reviewer states that they would not go out of their way to visit Showmars again, indicating a lack of enthusiasm or recommendation for the restaurant.

question: Not a total sit down restaurant, not fast food either. Order at the counter, and have the amazingly friendly staff bring it to your table.\n\nFor some Greek-American food it's not bad. By no means fancy, but it tastes pretty good. I would say it's a step above a burger joint, for some simple,  inexpensive food, come here and enjoy.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the review mentions that the restaurant is not a total sit-down restaurant nor fast food, implying a lack of clarity in its identity. Additionally, while the staff is described as friendly, the overall impression of the food is mediocre, being described as "not bad" and "by no means fancy." The comparison to a burger joint suggests that the food is considered basic and unexceptional.

question: I had the country fried steak with brown gravy, roasted potatoes, and mac & cheese. The meat, gravy, and potatoes were so salty they tasted like they were being cured. I couldn't finish it. The mac and cheese was okay, but oddly a bit bland. I like their sandwiches and salads, but I don't think I will be ordering an entree again.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the customer had a disappointing experience with the country fried steak entree, finding the meat, gravy, and potatoes overly salty to the point of being unpalatable. Additionally, the customer found the mac and cheese bland, which detracted from their overall satisfaction with the meal. The fact that they mentioned they wouldn't order an entree again indicates their dissatisfaction with the main dish options at the restaurant.

question: I had the souvlaki and my husband had the sirloin tips. Both were completely flavorless. My husband and I both agreed that the most impressive thing about this place is that they could actually find a way to cook the flavor out of beef and onions.  The tzatziki sauce was okay same with the Greek salad.
rationale: The sentiment is Negative because the reviewer expresses disappointment and dissatisfaction with the lack of flavor in both the souvlaki and sirloin tips, highlighting the tzatziki sauce and Greek salad as merely okay. The characterization of the food as flavorless and the inability to cook beef and onions with taste indicate a poor dining experience.

question: Fast, Friendly,  and Good Food. Stopped after a long day on the road. Parking lot had a crowd so I try it. If you order the Gyro dinner you better be hungry.  Definitely get your money's worth.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the review highlights the positive aspects of the experience, including fast service, friendliness, and good food. The reviewer also mentions that they got their money's worth, which suggests that they were satisfied with the portion size and value for the price. Overall, the review acknowledges the positive attributes of the restaurant visit, leading to a positive sentiment.

question: I think one has to be local to really enjoy Shomars.  The food is marginal, and the menu is about 80% sandwiches.  Most meals can be bought for $7-$10 with drink.\n\nBetter than McDonalds.  Kind of like a '50's-style diner, without the ambiance.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the review mentions that the food at Shomars is marginal, with a limited menu mostly consisting of sandwiches. The comparison to McDonald's implies low quality, and the lack of ambiance suggests a lackluster dining experience. Overall, the reviewer does not seem impressed with the food or overall atmosphere of the restaurant.

question:
This place is must stop every time I travel back over to the east coast! Everything is good and the service is great. Freshly made food to order and friendly service and staff!! 
I always order the famous gyro and fish platters...

Definitely would recommend!!!
rationale: The review contains multiple positive aspects, such as mentioning the food being good, freshly made to order, friendly service, and recommendation of specific menu items. The reviewer expresses a strong liking for the place and describes it as a "must stop" whenever traveling back to the east coast. Overall, the enthusiasm, positive experiences, and strong recommendation in the review indicate a positive sentiment towards the restaurant.

question: I want to start off by saying that Chinese food should not have YELLOW Rice!!! They do have good lunch specials and again this Chinese food wasn't very good. Still searching for a good Chinese food place here in Charlotte. The only reason why I tried this place because I was next to it at the time. Still searching!
rationale: The sentiment in the review is negative because the user expresses disappointment with the quality of the Chinese food they tried, specifically noting that the yellow rice was not typical of authentic Chinese cuisine. Additionally, the user mentions that they are still searching for a good Chinese food place in Charlotte, indicating that they were not satisfied with their dining experience at the reviewed restaurant.

question: Perfect greasy spoon!! Great breakfast and great grilled cheese!!  Service is excellent!!
rationale: The review highlights several positive aspects of the restaurant, such as great breakfast, great grilled cheese, and excellent service. The use of exclamation points shows a high level of enthusiasm and satisfaction. These positive descriptions and the overall tone indicate that the reviewer had a pleasant experience and would likely recommend the restaurant to others.

question: Greasy spoon joint.  Great neighborhood place serving breakfast and lunch.  Love their breakfast.  Seating is limited so expect to wait to be seated on a weekend because the locals flock to this place since its the only place nearby serving a good breakfast other than fast food. Waitresses are really nice and will make you feel at home.
rationale: The review expresses positive sentiments by highlighting the great quality of breakfast, the friendly service provided by the waitresses, and the welcoming atmosphere of the restaurant. Additionally, the fact that the locals flock to the place on weekends indicates that it is a popular spot, which is often a sign of a positive dining experience. Overall, the combination of good food, friendly service, and a relaxed environment leads to a positive sentiment in the review.

question: i am changing my review completely. this place is way too busy and im sure breaking fire codes by having way too many people in there. the cashier has the worst attitude ever and needs to be re-evaluated by her boss. horrible customer service, i will never spend another dime in this dive!
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the customer had a bad experience at the location. The customer felt that it was too crowded, violating fire codes, and criticized the cashier's attitude and customer service. This led them to vow never to return or spend any more money there. The overall tone is one of disappointment and frustration.

question: Good buffet!
rationale: The sentiment is Positive because the user has described the buffet as "good," indicating that they enjoyed the selection and quality of food offered. Positive adjectives like "good" typically convey satisfaction with a service or product.

question: I go to this place a lot for the buffet which is ok. Not really that big of a buffet and if you don't get there when it is fresh you might get some pretty cold food. However this review is about their take-out service. I give them a C- for this experience. They do not give a good portion size to take home and the food was a little bland. I expected more from them. I ordered the pan fried dumpling and the sauce that came with it was very gross it was like they didn't know how to make the proper sauce so they just gave me soy sauce and some spices to go a long with it. It was not good at all. I will probably be going back but only for the buffet would not recommend take out and i will not be doing that again.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer expressed disappointment with the take-out service based on poor portion sizes, bland food, and an unpleasant sauce experience with the dumplings. They were expecting more from the restaurant and found the overall take-out experience lacking, indicating they will not be ordering take-out from there again.

question: Ordered take out which consisted of sesame chicken, cashew chicken and crab ragoons. Were were told 20 minutes for pick up and we waited an additional 15 minutes at the restaurant when we went to pick up. There was a customer that came back to try to return the food because it was stale. Our food as well was stale, cold, and had ZERO flavor. Will not return here. Stay away from this one.
rationale: The sentiment of this review is negative because the customer experienced several issues with their takeout order, including a long wait time for pick up, stale food, cold food, and lack of flavor. Additionally, witnessing another customer returning their food due to staleness further contributes to the negative sentiment towards the restaurant. These aspects combined would likely deter the customer from returning and caution others to avoid dining at this establishment.

question: We have tried this place two times. Food was decent at best the first time for dinner. The second time we walked out before our meal even started due to the dry burnt food on the buffet and rude service. It's now an ongoing joke in our household of \"are you hungry enough to even eat at China Town?\"\nWe're shocked it's survived this long with so little customers.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the review describes poor dining experiences on two separate occasions at the restaurant. The food was described as decent at best the first time and dry and burnt during the second visit. Additionally, the review mentions encountering rude service, resulting in the customers leaving before the meal even started. The statement that it has become a joke in their household to question if they are "hungry enough" to eat at the restaurant further illustrates their disappointment and dissatisfaction with China Town. The overall tone of the review implies a lack of quality and customer care at the restaurant.

question: Great veterinary clinic, this location and the one at Mt Island as well. I use this one specifically for boarding and spa services for my Golden and they know us by name though it might have been a few months since the last visit. The vets are all super nice and if they are booked when you are trying to get in they'll work with you to get you in at the Mt Island location a few miles down the road (great people there too!). Boarding is inexpensive at $22/day-night which allows your pet play time outside. They have a large outside play area! I've been on the wellness plan for 2 years which includes 2 visits for all shots, sentinel through the year, 2 spa days and 2 boarding days.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the review highlights several positive aspects of the veterinary clinic. The reviewer mentions that the staff know them by name, indicating personalized and friendly service. Additionally, they praise the vets for being super nice and accommodating by offering services at a different location if needed. The affordable boarding rates, large play area, and inclusion of various services in the wellness plan further contribute to the positive sentiment expressed in the review. Overall, the review showcases a pleasant and satisfactory experience at the clinic, leading to a positive sentiment.

question: I do not recommend. Let's just say my experiences were not good. My animals have received much much much better care elsewhere. They were diagnosed with conditions at other vet and treated aggressively which was never done at paw creek. Dr CArnevale is rude to staff and total bond euthanized several healthy animals that lived there due to taking up space and using resources. Do not recommend AT ALL.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer had a poor experience at Paw Creek Veterinary Clinic. They expressed dissatisfaction with the care provided to their animals compared to other veterinarians, highlighted concerns about the clinic's treatment methods, and criticized the ethics of the veterinarian, Dr. Carnevale. Additionally, the reviewer expressed dismay over allegations of healthy animals being euthanized at the clinic, indicating serious ethical and operational issues that contribute to the negative sentiment.

question: Fantasic and very friendly staff! The best in Charlotte hands down!
rationale: The review expresses positive sentiment because the customer describes the staff as "fantastic" and "very friendly," and states that they are the best in Charlotte. The use of exclamation points and the phrase "hands down" further emphasize the enthusiastic and positive feelings towards the staff. Overall, the reviewer had a highly satisfying experience with the staff, leading to a positive sentiment in their review.

question: staff is friendly enough..drs are quick and dont really listen or ask any questions... ive changed drs since my last visit and am very happy. i had an appt that i had rescheduled here and they keep sending and will not stop sending a letter asking me to pay for a missed visit when i called to cancel a week before. found a way better dr...little better to drive but at least i feel like im getting the customer service i deserve...
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the user expressed dissatisfaction with the doctors not listening or asking questions, the staff constantly sending letters for a missed appointment despite cancellation, and feeling like they did not receive the customer service they deserved. Additionally, the user mentioned that they had switched to a different doctor and were much happier, indicating their level of dissatisfaction with their experience at the previous practice.

question: Rooms were small, but clean, which is the main thing I'm looking for when staying at a hotel in this price point. The neighboring gas station had bars over its windows, which made me question the safety of the neighborhood; but my car was unharmed overnight. Free Wi-Fi. Complimentary breakfast was your typical hotel selection of cereal, donuts, toast/bagels, apples, bananas, and waffles. Coffee was not good though. \n\nWhen I drafted this review on my phone during breakfast here, I initially was going to rate it 4 stars. We requested late check out, and the latest they were able to accommodate was noon. Alright, this isn't a fancy hotel, I'll accept that (even though I had asked for 1PM, which I didn't think was unreasonable). However, when we returned to our room at 11:45, the bed had been stripped. There weren't any housekeepers in the room, but the plastic clip on my toothpaste was missing from the tube I'd left in the bathroom. On principle, I asked the front desk attendant if anyone had happened to \"find\" it. Housekeeping told him they hadn't seen it, and that was all the consolation he offered me. I'm not worried so much about the 99cent gizmo, as I am about the integrity of the workers at this hotel. Had I left anything else behind, who knows what else may have been taken?? The management's overall apathy sealed the deal for me--I will not be returning under any circumstances.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is negative because the guest experienced issues with cleanliness standards and felt concerned about the safety of the neighborhood due to the neighboring establishment having bars over its windows. Additionally, despite the request for late check-out not being fully accommodated, the guest found the removal of the bed linens before the agreed-upon time and the missing item from their room unsettling. The lack of satisfactory resolution from the front desk and the perceived lack of integrity amongst the hotel staff contributed to the negative experience overall.

question: In the time I've been living on the road I have never had a worse experience.  Bad service, rude desk clerks, terrible management!  Waiting outside our doors at 9 am to get out when checkout is 11.  I would not suggest this hotel to anyone staying in the Charlotte area!
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer experienced bad service, encountered rude desk clerks, and felt that the management was terrible. Additionally, the inconvenience of having to wait outside the room early in the morning before the official checkout time was likely frustrating for them. Overall, the negative aspects of their stay outweighed any positive aspects, leading to their dissatisfaction with the hotel.

question:
I was NOT impressed! The service was good...that's about it. The chicken sandwhich tasted like it had been left out a while before it was cooked...definitely not fresh!
Their mashed potatos were good although they served it with sausage gravy which was unique. 
The cost was ok. Typical chicken place. The (women's) restroom wasn't cleaned very well and neither was the restaurant. Trying to find a clean table was not hard... only one amongst several messy tables. 
The only plus to the restaurant was the servers. They had smiles and treated us well. 
It was the first Bojangles I've been to and I was not impressed in the least.
rationale: The sentiment is Negative because the customer had several complaints and criticisms about their experience at the restaurant. They mentioned that the chicken sandwich tasted old, the restaurant and restroom were not clean, and finding a clean table was difficult due to the messy environment. Although the service was good and the servers were friendly, these positive aspects were overshadowed by the overall negative experience described in the review.

question: They got that Chicken! It's like I'm sayin. Mash Potatoes! Biscuits, check! Gravy for that donkey! Correct Change? Nope!
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the speaker is expressing frustration and disappointment about not receiving correct change for their meal. The use of exclamation points and the word "donkey" in place of a more appropriate term suggests a sense of annoyance or discontent.

question: The service at this location is really good, but on more than one occasion, the food that I've gotten hasn't been really good.  Many times the chicken seems to be cold and the sides appear to be a little old.  The customer service is great, my only complaint is that at lot of times they try to avoid giving you a bag and put all of your order in the box.  This isn't a bad thing, I just have a pet peeve about being given greasy napkins :)  It's a known fact that if you put the napkins in the box with the fried chicken, that the napkins are gonna be saturated with grease.\n\nNote:  The drive thru line can be a bit long on Sunday afternoons, so save yourself some time by going inside.
rationale: The sentiment is Negative because the reviewer highlights several instances where they were unsatisfied with the quality of the food they received, mentioning issues like cold chicken and old sides. Additionally, the reviewer expresses annoyance at not being given a bag for their order and receiving greasy napkins due to the packaging method. These negative experiences outweigh the positive aspects of good customer service, leading to an overall negative review.

question: I hate to be negative. But not good at all. The worse I have had in a long time. The chicken had some weird batter on it, the egg foo young gravy was off tasting, and I'm not sure what type of meat was in the wontons. Just trying to be helpful
rationale: The review expresses disappointment and dissatisfaction with the food quality, specifically mentioning issues with the chicken batter, egg foo young gravy taste, and uncertainty about the meat in the wontons. The reviewer also mentions that it was the worst meal they have had in a long time. Overall, the feedback highlights multiple negative aspects of the dining experience, leading to a negative sentiment.

question: HORRIBLE over fried unrecognizable meat in hard batter. Rice is reheated.
rationale: The review expresses dissatisfaction with the quality of the food, describing it as "HORRIBLE" and highlighting elements such as "over fried unrecognizable meat in hard batter" and reheated rice. These negative comments suggest that the overall dining experience was disappointing and not up to the expectations of the customer, leading to a negative sentiment.

question: I wouldn't eat here if it were the last food place in Charlotte. They have burnt broccoli. They also have a lack of good customer service. Oh not to mention how slow they are when you are waiting for your order. Don't waste your time!
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer expresses dissatisfaction with multiple aspects of their experience: the quality of the food (burnt broccoli), the level of customer service (lack of good customer service), and the overall service speed (slow service). These factors collectively contribute to the reviewer advising others to not visit the restaurant, emphasizing the negative impression left by their visit.

question:
They are in the middle of a renovation to make it even better.  Fresh produce selection is great and very fresh.  Pricing is a little higher than WalMart across the street, but quality is so much better!

I don't shop for many of the preboxed, processed items - mostly fresh meat and produce (a paleo lifestyle - as much as possible).  Staff is very friendly here and it is convenient to my house, till I move late March to uptown!

I will shop here again....
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer emphasizes the positive aspects of the store, such as the great selection of fresh produce, better quality compared to a competitor like Walmart, friendly staff, and convenient location. The reviewer also mentions their intention to continue shopping at the store in the future, which indicates a positive overall impression.

question: If you want *real* Eastern NC style barbecue, head to Smithfield or Raleigh or somewhere out that way.  If you can't make it, this place will do.  On the run from Ohio to SC or FL, I stop here nearly everytime.  I lived in Raleigh for a number of years and fell in love with NC BBQ.  Normally you get a tomato based version in western NC, but Bubba's does Eastern pretty close.  Not quite as spicy as \"out east\" and the Brunswick stew isn't up to my standards, but this place works.
rationale: The sentiment in the review is positive because the reviewer appreciates the authentic Eastern NC style barbecue offered at Bubba's, despite minor differences in spice levels and the Brunswick stew compared to their preferred standards. The reviewer commends the similarity to the barbecue they love from Raleigh and the East, indicating that Bubba's is a go-to stop for them when traveling, reinforcing a positive impression overall.

question: I'd skipped Bubba's for a few years and must say that this latest Friday night on the way to Florida experience was a letdown.  The place was nearly empty, which might be a sign of changes.  \n\nThe BBQ was cold and dry.  It just wasn't that good.  I'll give Bubba Miller one more chance because he has satisfied my craving for Eastern NC BBQ, but if it goes like this again, we're done.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the customer expresses disappointment with their experience at Bubba's. They mention that the BBQ was cold and dry, not meeting their expectations of good quality. Additionally, the fact that the restaurant was nearly empty could signal a decline in popularity or quality, contributing to the overall negative impression. The customer indicates that they may not return if their next visit is similar, demonstrating dissatisfaction with the current state of the establishment.

question:
While in this area of Charlotte I saw Bubba's BBQ I did not have but, a few minutes and I really just wanted to taste the Q . I went in the only people I saw was 2 people leaving . So with a quick look at the menu I ordered a BBQ sandwich ( no slaw this time I wanted to be able to taste the flavor of the Q then have slaw next time)
So out came my sandwich and I noticed slaw on the outside of the sandwich I opened it and saw that the slaw well... some of it had been taken off about half was still there it looked as if someone had taken something and attempted to " get the slaw off".When I told the server she looked at the ticket and said " I told them no slaw "
Then she left with the sandwich at this point I am wondering if they could not get a simple order with such a slow time then what else was wrong? At that point I had spent way to much time just trying to get a simple sandwich put money on the table to pay for the Tea and left .
I called shortly after a conference call to talk to the manager " Bubba " I told him the story and he first said " describe the server " then when I did he said " What color was the slaw " And I am thinking why would he ask that? Does he think the slaw came from somewhere else? When I told him I was not 100% sure he "said we only serve this color slaw"( I think he said yellow) And I am still wondering why he said that? ( AGAIN)
To me this was getting me know where when I was just trying to explain to him what the problem was. I then just said " have a good day and hung up"
Do not think I will be back ... just a warning if you go to Bubbas do not keep it to simple and please please do not make the order very complicated. They may ask you where the food came from?
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer had a disappointing experience at Bubba's BBQ. The reviewer's order was incorrect despite clearly stating their preference, and there was confusion with the server and the manager during their attempt to address the issue. The lack of attention to detail, the server's response, and the manager's odd questions contributed to the customer feeling frustrated and dissatisfied with the service. The overall lack of customer service and the mishandling of a simple order left a negative impression, leading the reviewer to state they will not be returning to the restaurant.

question: meat was not smoked, cooked way too long, so it was basically tasteless mush, sides had little to no flavor.  place was empty, cafeteria feeling, no music, no cheer, just blah....
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the review highlights several key issues that detract from the overall dining experience: lack of flavor in the main dish, poor cooking technique resulting in a tasteless texture, unappealing sides, and a lackluster atmosphere with no music or ambiance. The overall experience seems disappointing and uninspiring, the lack of flavor and poor execution causing the reviewer to feel unsatisfied and expressing a negative opinion of the establishment.

question: Anyplace named Bubba's is a place needing a visit. Any place that combines Bubba's and Barbeque is a no brainer in the QC. Located in North Charlotte off exit 16 (Sunset Blvd West), this place is simple and tries to be nothing more. This is your typical NC BBQ w/vinegar sauce being the specialty. Hush puppies are so delightful that a basket must accompany any BBQ. The pork is so moist that not much sauce is needed, though I love to get the hands messy with a proper dousing of the vinegar based sauce. Great for a quick eat in or massive take out. Apparently they cater too! \n\nMake sure to check out the men's room (men and women alike) as Bubba, who is there most days, will give you a good laugh at his creation.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the review highlights several positive aspects of Bubba's Barbeque in a favorable manner. The reviewer mentions the delightfulness of the hush puppies, the moist pork which requires minimal sauce, the option for a quick eat-in or takeout, and the humorous experience in the men's room created by Bubba. Overall, the reviewer portrays Bubba's as a simple yet enjoyable establishment that offers delicious food and a memorable experience, making it clear that they had a positive experience and would recommend a visit.

question: The person I interviewed in Charlotte brought me there so that I could taste a good old North Carolina barbecue. All I can say is thank you. This place is just cool and the food is delicious. The only thing is that you will feel heavy for the next 3 hours. But other than that, perfect place and good service. Looking forward to the Democratic convention next year to be able to go back to Bubba.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the individual is expressing gratitude for being brought to a place where they could enjoy a delicious North Carolina barbecue. They describe the location as cool, the food as delicious, and acknowledge the good service provided. Despite feeling heavy after the meal, the overall experience is deemed perfect, and the individual is looking forward to returning. The positive language used throughout the review indicates a satisfying and enjoyable dining experience.

question: Semi secret and not too bad. Had a combo platter because I wanted some fried chicken too and I thought the whole deal was pretty solid. Hush puppies weren't as good as Lexington's but the pork was moist and the chicken was great.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer focuses on the positive aspects of their experience. They express overall satisfaction with the food, particularly highlighting the moist pork and great chicken. Even though they mention that the hush puppies weren't as good as elsewhere, they still find the whole meal to be solid, indicating an overall positive impression.

question: On a Sunday afternoon, me and my girlfriend wanted some good country barbecue, so we stumbled upon this place, this place looked very promising, so I ordered the Ribs and the pulled pork, along with coleslaw and baked beans. My girlfriend ordered the fish along with fries and baked beans. My pulled pork had no barbecue on it nor did it come with any barbecue at all, my ribs were rubbery.... I am from the Carolinas,I personally am very serious when it comes to barbecue, I don't think that I will be returning here at all. What makes everything worst is the fact that IT'S DOWN THE STREET FROM MY HOUSE.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer was disappointed with the lack of barbecue sauce on the pulled pork and the rubbery texture of the ribs. Additionally, the reviewer's high standards for barbecue due to being from the Carolinas were not met. The fact that the restaurant is conveniently located near the reviewer's house adds to the overall disappointment and likelihood of not returning.

question:
Being born and raised in Eastern North Carolina has made me really biased about eastern style barbecue, but I have to say that this is some of the worst eastern style barbecue that I've ever had.  I've been here a few times and on each of my three visits, i have to say that the BBQ really disappoints.  This is the first eastern style barbecue I've had that has nearly no seasoning.  During my last visit, I decided to pony up the extra money and just buy a bottle of their vinegar based sauce to season the meat with.  Even after all of that, it still wasn't very good.  I recommend that they use more salt, pepper and vinegar when cooking the hog.

With that being said about the terrible BBQ, the rest of the food is actually pretty decent.  I really like their fried chicken, coleslaw, potato salad and other dishes.  I haven't tried the chicken and dumplings yet, but my friends say it's really good.

The staff is always friendly and attentive and I really like the comical signs that they have outside.  I'd recommend this place for fried chicken and good sides, but I can't give the thumbs up to anyone regarding their eastern chopped barbecue.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is negative due to the customer's disappointment with the eastern style barbecue, which they stated was lacking in seasoning and flavor despite multiple visits. They even had to purchase extra sauce to try to enhance the taste with little success. The customer specifically mentioned improvements that could be made to the barbecue, indicating their dissatisfaction with the quality of that specific dish. However, they did appreciate other menu items and praised the service and ambiance of the restaurant.

question: I'm no barbeque expert but this food plain didn't taste good.  Ribs were laced with so much fat I couldn't even bite through them.  Hush puppies were the bright spot.  They used to serve a kick ass sweet potato pie with soft serve but that's no longer on the menu.  The restaurant was completely empty and a man I believe to be the owner was a little too friendly with us lingering at our table for a couple of awkward exchanges.  I wanted to love it but I couldn't.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the customer had multiple negative experiences during their visit to the barbecue restaurant. The meat was too fatty and difficult to eat, a favorite dish was no longer available, and the owner's behavior made the customer uncomfortable. These aspects contributed to an overall disappointing dining experience, leading to a negative sentiment.

question:
We drove a long drive to try this bbq. I do not recommend it. The food came out cold and not fresh. The server is clueless. Kept forgetting water, high chair, etc. We got really aggravated.
The ribs themselves are not good. What saved them was the bbq sauce. And thats why I'm giving 2 stars and not 1. I bought the bbq sauce to go and made my own ribs with it.

Sorry bubba's... wanted to give you a better rating, but not a fan. Wont recommend
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer had a poor experience with the BBQ restaurant. The food was described as cold and not fresh, the server was described as clueless and forgetful, and overall the reviewer was aggravated by the experience. While the BBQ sauce was found to be okay, it was not enough to make up for the disappointing ribs and service received. The reviewer ultimately decided not to recommend the restaurant to others.
