So base on my experience last night; I have concluded that I will NEVER go here again nor will I even bother to order take out from this place. Bangkok Ocha down the street is so much better!
rationale: The sentiment in the review is negative because the customer had a disappointing experience at the restaurant. They received poor service with no attention from the staff, incorrect order with unwanted ingredients, delays in receiving food items, and quality issues with the dishes served, including the sticky rice being dry and the portion size of the green curry not justifying the price. Additionally, the customer felt frustrated with the overall lack of care and attention to their dining experience.

question: I got take out from here today for lunch and it was ok.  Portion size was good but I'd prefer to go to pei-wei. Their food is a lot bettee plus thai house messed up my order.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer mentioned that the food was just "ok" and expressed a preference for another restaurant, Pei-Wei, indicating a dissatisfaction with the quality of the food from Thai House. Additionally, the fact that Thai House also messed up the reviewer's order further contributes to the negative sentiment.

question:
I have really grown to love Thai food, and this is one of my favorite places to come: warm atmosphere with traditional wood carvings, large intimate booths , beautiful friendly people waiting on you and dishes made with rice noodles (gluten free). 
They know how to cook my favorite comfort food: Pad Thai and Pad See Eww perfectly. The chicken satay appetizer is juicy and I love the slaw and peanut sauce it comes with. Every dish has a beautiful palate of vegetables. 
My husband loves extra spicy and if you ask for it, they will deliver it. The flavors in the curries are so wonderful and the dished are garnished with carved vegetables. 
Another favorite of mine here is the Cashew Chicken, which has almost a sweet and sour sauce, balanced with crunchy cashews, sweet peppers and rice. Once again, they will give it a kick if you ask!
The mango dessert is sublime, with just the right amount of sweet creaminess.
I have never been disappointed.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer expresses a deep love for the Thai food at the restaurant, highlighting various aspects that they enjoy. They mention the warm atmosphere, traditional wood carvings, friendly service, gluten-free options, perfectly cooked dishes like Pad Thai and Pad See Eww, delicious chicken satay appetizer, flavorful curries, and the delightful Cashew Chicken. Furthermore, the reviewer appreciates the option for extra spicy dishes and the beautifully presented vegetables. The mention of a sublime mango dessert and never being disappointed overall indicates a high level of satisfaction with their dining experience.

question: I ordered vegetarian pad Thai and if was pretty tasteless, even when I asked for extra peanuts. I ate it just because I was hungry. The decor in the restaurant was nice though. Just wish the food was better
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the user expressed disappointment with the taste of the vegetarian pad Thai, describing it as tasteless even after requesting extra peanuts. Although they mentioned enjoying the restaurant's decor, their overall experience was marred by the unsatisfactory food quality.

question: The food is good and it comes out fast. the turn around here is great if you have somewhere you need to be after dinner but a little too much if you would like to hang out a little and take your time with dinner. But, the food is good. The dinner portions are always better, from the amount of food you get to even the size of the shrimp. (The shrimp on the dinner portion are actually twice the size.) And the food is good.
rationale: The review highlights several positive aspects, such as the food being good overall and served quickly, as well as the generous portion sizes during dinner. The reviewer acknowledges that while the fast service may not be ideal for lingering over a meal, they appreciate the efficient turnaround time for those with busy schedules. The emphasis on the quality and quantity of the food, particularly the shrimp, contributes to the positive sentiment. Overall, the positive experiences with the food quality and portions outweigh any minor downside related to pacing, making the review sentiment positive.

question:
The Thai carved wood and overall decor is amazing- and the service was fine. Sorry to disagree with others, but my wife and I found the food to be quite ordinary and well-below quality at other Thai restaurants we visit. 

The fried spring rolls were greasy- possibly were just fried a second time to get them hot. The Mee Krob was a good appetizer except the lettuce was partially wilted and brown in spots. I usually love pad thai but what was served had soggy noodles and not a lot of taste. 

Perhaps the main chef was not working on the weekday night I was there. Not likely to try again though.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is negative because the customer expressed disappointment with the quality of the food compared to other Thai restaurants they have visited. They specifically mentioned greasy spring rolls, wilted lettuce, soggy noodles, and a lack of taste in the dishes they ordered. The customer also suggested that the main chef might not have been working during their visit, indicating a lack of consistency in the food quality. Overall, the review highlights several issues with the food which contributed to the negative sentiment.

question: It's Valentines Day. All I have to say is the service was pretty horrendous and food was subpar(Pad Thai tasted like ketchup?! And my husbands roasted chicken was frozen in the inside but cooked through?! I don't know how these things happen....) But the mints were good. *prepacked mints*
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the user described the service as horrendous and the food as subpar, mentioning specific issues such as Pad Thai tasting like ketchup and the roasted chicken being frozen inside. These experiences likely led to a disappointing dining experience overall, despite the mints being the only positive aspect mentioned.

question: I am 8.5 months pregnant and ordered green curry for take out from here. When I placed the order, I emphasized I wanted MILD curry since spicy food has given me horrible heartburn during pregnancy. But, when I got the food home, the curry was so spicy I could not take more than two bites. Secondly, it was not that great. It was mediocre curry at best. So, goodbye $13 curry. Thanks for making the food too spicy for me to eat.  What the heck!?
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the user's experience was disappointing and frustrating. Despite specifically requesting mild curry due to pregnancy-related heartburn issues, the curry received was excessively spicy, rendering it inedible for the user. Additionally, the user felt that the quality of the curry was mediocre at best, leading to a waste of money on a dish that did not meet their expectations.

question:
I was so excited to see a Thai House near my new job because I go to the Thai House University location all the time. While the University location is amazing, I quickly found out that this location is anything but.

The first time I ordered lunch, I received a dish that was way too salty. I didn't save the leftovers. I ALWAYS keep my University Thai House leftovers for a second meal.

I thought maybe it was a fluke, and decided to give them a second chance.

Ordered again today- even worse than my first lunch. My chicken pad thai tasted too sweet. Another yelp'ers description of it tasting like ketchup is not far off.  The noodles were overcooked and mushy. The spring roll is slightly burnt and the chicken rubbery. To top it all off, the man who gave me my food had a bad attitude. Considering I was simply waiting for my food patiently, no grumpiness was needed.  Never going here again, though the other location I will continue to go to regularly as they have delicious food and super friendly staff.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer had multiple negative experiences at the Thai House location near their new job. The reviewer received dishes that were too salty and too sweet, with overcooked noodles, burnt spring rolls, and rubbery chicken. In addition to the disappointing food quality, the reviewer also encountered a staff member with a bad attitude. These factors contribute to an overall negative impression of the restaurant and a decision not to return.

question:
I've been going to the Thai House about once a month for over a year now. I love it! I've tried a number of other Thai restaurants in the area and this is my favorite.

I often bring friends and no one has ever disliked their meal here. My favorite things to get are the Pho and the Green Curry (which is really spicy). The food is always great. 

The service is even better than the food. They are always prompt and friendly. Most times I am surprised at how fast the food comes out. After going here a while they treat you like family. I would definitely recommend it to others!
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer consistently enjoys their experiences at the Thai House over an extended period of time. They highlight their favorite dishes, noting that the food is always great and that they have never encountered anyone who disliked their meal. The reviewer also praises the prompt and friendly service, indicating that the staff make them feel like family. Overall, the reviewer enthusiastically recommends the restaurant to others based on their positive experiences with both the food and the service.

question:
We love Thai food & the Thai House doesn't disappoint.  Food is fresh, well seasoned & hot when it arrives to your table. we started our meal with spring rolls. Nicely deep fried with crisp shell. Delicious sweet sauce to dip in. 
I had the Pad Kee Mow, AKA Drunken Noodles.  Chicken was grilled nicely before added to the noodles. The vegetables weren't undercooked and the dish wasn't overloaded with veggies vs. meat. Plate presentation was nice. 

My wife chose her favorite Red Curry (med heat). Perfect curry seasoning. Excellent meal. Excellent price.  

We also had the 3 springs rolls as an appetizer. They were complimented well with the sweet sauce that comes with them. 

If you like Thai then I strongly recommend this place.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer highlights multiple aspects of their dining experience that they enjoyed at the Thai House. They mention that the food is fresh, well-seasoned, and served hot, with delicious appetizers and entrees. The reviewer appreciates the quality and presentation of the dishes, as well as the reasonable prices. They recommend the restaurant to others who enjoy Thai cuisine. Overall, the positive feedback and enthusiasm throughout the review indicate a satisfying and enjoyable dining experience.

question:
This is the ONLY chinese restaurant I like in Charlotte.
The food is fresh and good.
The price is very reasonable too.
They have two kinds of menus.
One for more americalized chinese food and one is the authentic one.
U can find all the yummy food on the authentic menu.
Beef noodle, chicken feet, pig hog...
My favorite is the beef noodle and the pig feet.
Recommand to call in to order before go because the owner is by herself most of the time and they're pretty busy at lunch and dinner hours

------
Update 02/26/2011
The owner is different now and the new menu sucks! Just like other yucky American Chinese restaurant now! Will not come back again
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer initially praised the restaurant for its fresh and good food, reasonable prices, and diverse menu options. However, the sentiment turned negative after they visited again and found that the ownership had changed, resulting in a disappointing new menu that resembled typical American Chinese food, which they did not enjoy. This change from authentic to generic cuisine led to the reviewer no longer wanting to return to the restaurant.

question: Tried a different Chinese Restaurant in the area and wish I did not. Got shrimp with mixed vegetables. The shrimp were small and very overcooked (very mussy). Also got the Teriyaki beef which  was like shoe leather (very tough). Will not be going back.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the user had a poor dining experience at the Chinese restaurant they tried. The shrimp and teriyaki beef they ordered were described as overcooked, small, mushy, and very tough, resembling shoe leather. This indicates a lack of quality in the food preparation, leading the user to be dissatisfied with their meal and deciding not to return to the restaurant.

question: Read review prior but my aunt wanted to eat so figured they may have improved since last reviews. Nope. Hot and Sour soup was bland. Crispy noodles were stale. My Sa Cha \"spicy\" dish was missing the spice and broccoli in dish was visibly old. Should have followed my Yelp-stincts.
rationale: The sentiment is Negative because the customer had high hopes that the restaurant's quality had improved since reading previous negative reviews, but unfortunately, they found that the food was still subpar. The bland hot and sour soup, stale crispy noodles, lack of spice in the Sa Cha dish, and visibly old broccoli all contributed to a disappointing dining experience for the customer.

question: It was awful.  not even sure that it was beef.  really, really bad
rationale: The sentiment is Negative because the review uses words like "awful" and "really, really bad" to describe the food, indicating a strong dislike for the product. Additionally, the uncertainty about whether the meat was actually beef suggests a lack of quality or integrity in the dish, further reinforcing the negative sentiment.

question: Let me start out by saying that many of the reviews here are unfair. I live very close to this take out Chinese restaurant and have used them many times over the years. It is true that they were better before the change in ownership but they are still pretty decent. This place like many Chinese restaurants does some things better than others. For instance, their pork fried rice is better than almost any place in Charlotte. In general, their stir fry dishes are quite good. The portions are good, the dishes have plenty of meat and the vegetables are always fresh. As I said, they don't do everything well so I would stay away from the Crab Rangoon and Lo Mein (I am not a fan of that dish anyway). Their soups are just OK so they will do if that is what you really want - just don't expect anything special. The staff is always friendly and they will modify dishes if you request it.
rationale: The review expresses positive sentiments towards the Chinese takeout restaurant despite acknowledging some areas where they could improve. The reviewer highlights the strengths of the restaurant, such as the pork fried rice and stir fry dishes being better than most others in Charlotte, generous portions with fresh ingredients, and friendly staff willing to accommodate modifications. While there are some areas for improvement noted, the overall tone of the review is positive, indicating that the reviewer finds the restaurant to be decent and worth patronizing, thereby justifying the positive sentiment.

question: I Specifically asked for NO MEAT of any kind.  Even made inquires about the sauces and if they had chicken broth, etc.  When I got home we found our rice had little bits of beef in it.  My girlfriend is a vegetarian so one can imagine this ruined her dinner.  Also the prices online were cheaper than what they charged in the store, not cool.  Certainly will not return to Quick Wok.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the user specifically requested no meat, inquired about all ingredients, and still found bits of beef in their dish upon returning home. This mistake would be particularly upsetting for a vegetarian, ruining the dining experience. Additionally, the discrepancy in pricing between online and in-store further added to the user's dissatisfaction with their overall experience at Quick Wok.

question:
Best thing about this place - it was convenient to the shopping I needed to do at the Arboretum!

Food is only fair - burger was pretty flavorless and dry.  Onion rings were awful - crunchy on the outside but mushy and wet (actually had onion "juice" or water run out after biting in to one) on the inside.

Service was ok.  My only complaint is that the server left the check on the table before asking for dessert orders.  If it was a.) busy and b.) we appeared to be a business lunch (not likely - me and the parents) I would understand that move.  But the restaurant wasn't busy - worrysome at 12:30 pm on a Friday - and we obviously were not a business group.

Thought it was overpriced too - almost $9 for a dry tasteless burger with a side of onion rings and $5 for a chocolate malt?  Would not rate it a great value.

Fake 50's decor and kitsch - primary reasons for visiting here.  Need more really GOOD casual (not fast food) eateries near the Arboretum.
rationale: The sentiment is Negative because the reviewer highlighted several aspects of their experience that were disappointing. The food was described as only fair, with a flavorless and dry burger and awful onion rings. The service was deemed just okay, with a specific complaint about the server leaving the check before dessert orders were taken. Additionally, the reviewer felt the prices were overpriced for the quality received. Overall, the review expresses a sense of dissatisfaction and disappointment with the dining experience, leading to a negative sentiment.

question: The food is actually fairly mediocre.  But with an endless supply of buy one/get one coupons they distribute, it's one of those \"why not\" sort of places for a breakfast for two.
rationale: The sentiment in the review is negative because the reviewer describes the food as "fairly mediocre," indicating that it is not of high quality or enjoyable. Additionally, the use of coupons as a reason to visit the restaurant suggests that the primary motivation for patronage is not the food itself, but rather a deal or discount. This implies that the overall dining experience may not be very satisfying or warrant a return visit based on food quality alone.

question: What's up Richie Cunningham?  Not to offend, but I think these places are kind of lame.  My parents used to take me up here when I was younger.  They put my fries in these old classic car trays and would post them up in my room.  I went here for a nostalgic feeling, but the food was shabby.  I used to love the hamburgers, but they don't have many options for vegetarian folks.  The service was good, but I just don't get down with Rockin' Robin jams.  However, kids eat for free on Thursdays, so there is a plus for families.  I felt like I was going to run into Chachi at this place.
rationale: The sentiment in the review is negative because the reviewer expresses disappointment and dissatisfaction with various aspects of their experience at the restaurant. They describe the food as "shabby" and mention the lack of options for vegetarians. Additionally, the nostalgic feeling they were hoping for was not met, and the music playing in the restaurant did not appeal to them. These factors contribute to an overall negative assessment of their visit.

question:
This review is based on this location's truck delivery alone. I jumped on their 50% off patio furniture sale last month and I took advantage of their delivery for $56. As long as you order everything online, they will deliver it all for that one fee...even if they have to make multiple trips. Score!

If that isn't fantastic enough, when the delivery guys came, they even took extra time to put together my furniture. Seriously, that saved me hours of work and frustration. They were so nice to do it and they took the cardboard boxes with them. 

The managers that called to schedule the deliveries or confirm a return were so courteous! They didn't waste any time getting me my items. t could not have asked for a more smooth process and enjoyable online purchase!
rationale: The sentiment of the review is positive because the customer had a smooth and enjoyable experience with the truck delivery service from the store. They were pleased with the fair delivery fee, the convenience of ordering online, the extra service of furniture assembly, and the professionalism and courtesy of the delivery team and managers. The customer expressed gratitude for the efficient process and expressed satisfaction with their purchase.

question:
I went to Lowes looking for some firewood for a recently purchased fire pit for our backyard. Turns out firewood is pretty hard to find when the weather gets warm..

I didn't see any bundles out front, but after speaking with 3 employees, and walking around the store I was met with a very kind Lowes employee who walked with me to the back, where they had a pallet of firewood that they hadn't set out yet. He then walked me all the way up to checkout so that I wouldn't have to carry the two bundles myself. 

I thought this was a great gesture that he would go so far out of his way to help me. The wood was cheap too - $5 a bundle. I think this is where we will be buying our fire wood from now on.
rationale: The sentiment is Positive because the customer had a positive experience at Lowes while looking for firewood. The customer appreciated the helpful assistance from a kind employee who went out of their way to assist them in finding the firewood and even helped carry it to the checkout. The customer also mentioned that the price of the firewood was reasonable, indicating satisfaction with the overall experience. This positive interaction and the helpful gesture from the employee left a lasting impression, leading the customer to decide to continue buying firewood from Lowes in the future.

question:
My husband and I have always been big fans of Lowe's, so when we needed a new toilet where else would we go? They heavily promote the $99 installation, which worked for us. Through the selection and sales process they could not have been more helpful and friendly, but afterwards? I will never use Lowe's for installation ever again. 

I was told to expect a call within 48 hours to setup delivery and install. That call may come sooner, but they load down the contractors, so be patient. I was patient. Now, a week later, I have lost all patience. I have called the store to check in, and I am given the run around and absolutely no answer on when I can expect the call to even setup the installation. If it takes this long to SCHEDULE the installation, how long will it take for us to actually have our toilet? 

Called again this morning to check on the status. After the man (same nice guy who sold us the toilet!) puts me on hold for 10 minutes because he has "too much going on right now", he comes back and tells me that someone will be calling me this morning. 

Morning is almost over, no call, blood pressure rising...
rationale: The sentiment is Negative because the review highlights a series of frustrating experiences with Lowe's installation service. The customer had high expectations based on the initial positive interactions during the selection and sales process, but became increasingly disappointed by the lack of communication and delays in scheduling the installation. The customer's patience was tested as promises of callbacks and scheduling were not fulfilled, leading to stress and dissatisfaction. The tone of the review demonstrates growing frustration and a lack of confidence in Lowe's ability to deliver on their installation services.

question: It was an overall bad experience here.  The tables were sticky.  The glasses were dirty. The service was slow and the food was tasteless.  I would probably not return here.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the review highlights multiple issues including sticky tables, dirty glasses, slow service, and tasteless food. These negative aspects would likely deter customers from returning to the establishment. The overall experience described does not meet the expectations of a satisfactory dining experience.

question:
The wait was over 30 minutes and the waiter was next to the worst. 
Even the mgr offer us a free dessert, but then the waiter said it was only for one.
Smh!r
If I wanted to I could buy this place.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the user had to wait for over 30 minutes, had a negative experience with the waiter, and felt misled by the offer of a free dessert by the manager which the waiter then restricted to only one person. The overall tone of the review suggests disappointment and frustration with the service received at the establishment.

question: I frequent this location often as a great place to get a quick lunch that is not \"fast food\".  Today however I think was not a gear experience.  The food was ok, but the service was lacking.  Placed our order for express lunch promptly along with order for water to drink.  Had to ask another server after 10 minutes if we could get our water and chips and salsa. She bright them to us.  After another 10 minutes our lunch arrived I wondered if our waiter thought out drunks had magically appeared.  Unfortunately this the set the pace for the remainder of lunch, wait and ask for the check, ask for the waiter to cash out, etc.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the customer expresses disappointment with their overall experience at the restaurant. They mention that the service was lacking, with delays in receiving water and their order, as well as a lack of attentiveness from the waiter. This kind of feedback indicates a poor level of customer service and likely left the customer feeling dissatisfied with their dining experience.

question: I can't tell you how the food was because after waiting 10 minutes (with no line) to get a table, placing our order, and 20 minutes later with no chips and salsa, we left. I should've known to leave when the person sitting beside of us complained that his food had taken so long.  Terrible!!!
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer had a poor experience at the restaurant. The long wait times, lack of chips and salsa, and complaints from other customers all contributed to a frustrating dining experience, ultimately leading them to leave without even trying the food.

question: I had breakfast here this morning, while waiting for Firestone to change my oil and rotate my tires.  I was so happy that it was within very short walking distance from the tire place, saving me from a fast-food breakfast.\nI did the gyro omelette with hash browns and a biscuit.  \nThe food was great, the service was great, and the diner ambiance in this place is great!  It wasn't very crowded; I was surprised at how quiet this place was.  I had a great experience, and I'll definitely be back.
rationale: The sentiment is Positive because the reviewer expresses satisfaction with their experience at the breakfast diner. They mention that the food was great, the service was great, and they enjoyed the diner ambiance. Additionally, the reviewer appreciated the convenience of the location and the fact that it wasn't too crowded. They conclude by stating that they had a great experience and plan to return, indicating overall contentment and a positive outlook.

question: Been going here for years, but a recent visit reminded me why I like this place.  Great quick breakfast!  \n\nWe arrived at noon trying to make it to a 1:00 game.  We had tried another \"trendy\" restaurant first but did not get seated.  We got right in at Park 51 and had an awesome breakfast!  Only missed kickoff by 10 minutes!
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer highlights their positive experience at Park 51, stating that they were able to get in quickly, had an awesome breakfast, and only missed the game kickoff by a small margin. The reviewer's positive words and satisfaction with the breakfast emphasize their overall enjoyment of the visit, showcasing a favorable impression of the restaurant.

question: The food is inexpensive. I was there with co workers for lunch. Service was not good and we noticed after we were done eating that there were bugs crawling on the table. When we told the checkout person that there were bugs on the table her response was \"oh they start coming out after we spray.\"  Will not go back, between the service and the bugs I am totally grossed out!
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the customer had a disappointing experience at the restaurant. They mentioned that the service was not good, and they found bugs crawling on the table after they were done eating. The checkout person's response to the issue was also off-putting, indicating a lack of concern for the customer's experience. These factors led the customer to feel grossed out and decide not to return to the restaurant.

question:
I believe I was the first Yelper to give this place a 5 star review.  I used to love this place and came here every time I came back to Charlotte from the west coast.  However, the last time I ate here back in May, something happened that ensured that I'll never come back.

I ordered calabash shrimp, turnip greens, and coleslaw.  About 5 minutes into my meal, I took a bite of greens and felt something really sharp in my mouth...and pulled out an ~1 inch-long razor sharp grarled piece of metal...I'm pretty sure it was from the can lid the greens came from.  Anyway, had I swallowed it, it would have ripped me up inside.

I told my waitress and the owner.  "Oh we're so sorry.  Can I bring you something else?"  My stomach had turned at this point so I said "no."  At this point the brain-dead owner handed me the check and went to the register so I could pay!  

Rather than argue, I figured here's a guy that has seen me in here for over a decade.  All the waitresses know me and stop by and talk.  If he's so freaking stupid to want to charge me for a meal I didn't eat and that was contaminated with a piece of metal that could have sent me to the hospital or worse, I'll pay for the meal and let you guys know to steer clear.

AVOID THIS PLACE IF YOU VALUE YOUR HEALTH!
rationale: The sentiment of the review is negative because the customer had a concerning experience where they found a sharp piece of metal in their food, which could have caused serious harm if swallowed. Despite informing the waitress and owner about the issue, the customer felt dismissed when the owner only offered to bring another dish and then proceeded to present the check for the uneaten contaminated meal. The lack of proper handling of the situation and concern for the customer's well-being led to a negative perception of the restaurant.

question: I got the club. Being as though I am from Jersey and our club is turkey without ham the sandwich was ok. I feel that kraft singles do not belong on any sandwich whatsoever so I was taking that off my club. The fries were horrible. They reminded me of when BK changed their fries to that weird crispy and then over cooked. French fries should be easy...dont get cheap on the fries and dont put kraft singles on sandwiches. Judy is a great waitress. She was extremely friendly.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is negative because the user had multiple complaints about their experience. They mentioned that the sandwich was just okay, the fries were horrible, and that they did not like Kraft singles on their sandwich. These aspects of their meal did not meet their expectations or preferences, leading to an overall negative impression of the restaurant.

question: Unfortunately I didn't even get to try their food as I was ignored when I entered by I'm guessing the manager or host woman.  I stood there as she looked at a phone after helping another guest. Then some guests entered behind me and she said hello to them immediately and then looked at me and said, have you been helped yet. I said no and she gave me a menu and told me to seat myself. They were full except one table that the guests behind me quickly claimed. She offered no further help and I offered no further business.  Would've been so simple to just acknowledge me and offer some service.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the customer had a poor experience where they felt ignored and unacknowledged by the staff member, leading to a lack of service and ultimately, a loss of potential business. The customer felt disregarded and left without assistance, which can leave a lasting negative impression and dissuade them from returning or recommending the establishment to others.

question: I'm not even sure where to start.  Horrible!
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the user described their experience as "horrible" and expressed uncertainty about where to even begin in their review, indicating a strong amount of disappointment or dissatisfaction. This overall negative tone suggests that the user did not have a positive experience.

question: Good ol' fashioned diner food with friendly service.  Though they could use better coffee from a local roaster.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the review mentions "good ol' fashioned diner food" and "friendly service," indicating that the overall experience at the diner was enjoyable. Despite the minor critique about the coffee, the positive aspects such as the food quality and the service outweigh this one negative point.

question: Very upsetting!  Park 51 cafe is under new management.  Some of the new staff not near as friendly.  Norman, who has been there over 20 years is gone.  He was always quick to fill tea and bring out food if the waitresses were busy.  My husband and I started coming here when we were dating.  Now we need to find another breakfast place.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is negative because the customer expresses disappointment and sadness over the changes at Park 51 cafe. The mention of Norman, a beloved staff member of over 20 years, being gone and the new staff not being as friendly, highlights a feeling of loss and deterioration in the quality of service that was once cherished by the customer. The customer also mentions needing to find a new breakfast place, indicating a sense of disappointment and betrayal in the changes at the cafe.

question: The orange chicken was pretty good but the lo mein was so bad I can only give it one star. The pork actually smelled 'old'. I won't go back there!
rationale: The review expresses dissatisfaction with the food quality and overall experience at the restaurant. Issues such as bad lo mein, old-smelling pork, and a decision not to return indicate a negative sentiment towards the dining experience. These specific complaints highlight significant shortcomings in the food served, leading to a negative overall assessment.

question: So I have ordered from them many times over the years and got the food quickly; food was so so, but it was quick and cheap. Well scratch the quick now. Apparently they have become quite busy, but haven't bothered hiring more people to compensate for that. Ordered good for delivery and was told after the order that it would be an hour and 10 minutes. An hour and 20 minutes later and we still had no food...I called and was told that I should have been told it would be an hour and 20 minutes (as if an hour and 10 were not bad enough)...They assured me it was on the way. One hour and forty-five minutes after ordering we had our food. As usual it was mediocre at best. The apology was $5 off after I asked them what they could do and told them I was going to cancel the order. I will not be calling them again...it takes me 5 minutes to go pick up my own take out from several much better restaurants around me.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer had a poor experience with the food delivery service. They expressed frustration over the delay in receiving their food, the lack of adequate communication about the wait time, and the mediocre quality of the food upon arrival. Additionally, the offered resolution of a $5 discount after a significant delay and subpar service was deemed insufficient by the reviewer. The overall tone of the review conveys disappointment and a decision not to use the service again.

question: I order from this place consistently and it is always hot, fast, and delicious.  I am a picky Chinese food eater too.  The portions are huge and you can substitute beef fried rice for your regular rice side!  Great egg rolls which says a lot from the get go.  If you can't make a good egg roll, well, you probably cant make good Chinese food.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the customer consistently enjoys their experience ordering from this place. They highlight the food as being hot, fast, and delicious, even mentioning that they are a picky eater when it comes to Chinese food. Additionally, the customer appreciates the large portions and the option to substitute beef fried rice. Their positive comment about the egg rolls further supports their satisfaction with the quality of the food. Overall, the review indicates a high level of satisfaction and enjoyment with the dining experience.

question: I dunno if I just get bad luck but I'll never order from this place again. I keep giving it a chance but this was the last straw. Twice I have ordered from here and found metal from scrub pads in the lo  mein noodles. I luckily did not ingest it which would have possibly torn up my intestines. When I brought the metal in and showed them they offered to rebook another order. I don't think anyone really understood the seriousness of this. I told them it was the premise of it. That is a hazard not someone complaining about the tastiness. I got a call saying they would give me a $10 credit if I came back. To be honest I was offended and just shook my head. So I though 4 months later since this place is literally right around the corner I'd give it a try. This time honestly it just tasted aweful. It tasted like everything was cooked in a pan with something that was burned before. I am not being picky here it literally tasted like I was sacking on a charcoal briquet. I'm pretty much done with this place and question the quality of food ordered and hygiene practices. Chinese restaurant are notorious for bad sanitation scores and this place is clearly pushing it. For your own health as far as eating metal stay as far from this place as you can. I'd rather get frozen Chinese from grocery store and microwave and it would be better.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer had two separate incidences of finding metal in their food from this restaurant, which poses a serious health hazard. Despite bringing this to the attention of the staff, they felt that their concerns were not taken seriously. Additionally, the reviewer describes the food as tasting burnt and unpleasant on their latest visit, further adding to their negative experience. These incidents raise valid concerns about the quality of food and hygiene practices of the restaurant, leading the reviewer to express a lack of trust and a decision to not patronize the establishment again.

question: What happened lotus cuisine? You used to be OK but now you just don't care anymore. The last 3 dishes I've ordered from you tasted awful and the local me in in particular had as much flavor and eye appeal as a cup of water. You no longer deserve my business.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the customer expresses disappointment and frustration with the decline in the quality of food from Lotus Cuisine. They mention that the last three dishes they ordered tasted awful and lacked flavor and visual appeal, indicating a significant drop in the restaurant's standards. Additionally, they feel that their patronage is no longer deserved due to the decline in quality.

question: Good Hibachi, MaiTai was fantastic and the service was efficient and family friendly.  I normally go for grown and sexy but I was in for a different vibe.  My girlfriend and I had a baby with us and the environment was perfect for it.  Go early otherwise you may wait for a long time.
rationale: The review expresses satisfaction with various aspects of the dining experience, including the good food, fantastic Mai Tai drink, efficient and family-friendly service, and a suitable environment for having a baby along. The reviewer acknowledges the different vibe from their usual preference but appreciates that it turned out to be a positive experience. Overall, the positive mention of these key elements contributes to the sentiment being positive.

question: We have eaten here uncountable times typically about 6-8 times a year. And after our experience on Saturday my husband refuses to go back. The portions were tiny, the food had no flavor and the sauces were all watered down. I understand times are tuff but, come on watering down your shrimp sauce, ginger sauce and salad dressing. Made for a less than appealing meal. We always have left overs and for the first time ever we ate all of our food even the rice and was on the verge of still being hungry. Very disappointed and in fact it will take a lot of convincing to get my husband to go back.
rationale: The sentiment is Negative because the customer expresses disappointment and dissatisfaction with their recent dining experience at the restaurant. They highlight issues such as tiny portions, lack of flavor in the food, and watered-down sauces which resulted in a less than appealing meal. Additionally, the fact that they typically have leftovers but this time they ate all the food and were still hungry further adds to their disappointment. The customer's husband even refuses to return to the restaurant, indicating a strong negative reaction to the overall dining experience.

question:
Very busy place for rather mediocre food. We rarely eat at hibachi grills, but decided it sounded good tonight. The food was okay. Life's too short and there are way too many good things to eat to settle for okay!

I think one thing that makes it tricky when reviewing a hibachi experience is that they all basically have the same menu - right down to the salad dressing!  Therefore, comparisons are natural. 

I found the soup salty. The salad dressing was okay, but missing something. Rice was good, noodles had a nice garlic flavor and veggies were standard. I ordered the teriyaki steak and it had zero teriyaki flavor. Had the sauce not been visible I would have sworn I got the wrong item. The meat itself did not taste good. It wasn't spoiled tasting, more like a really cheap cut of meat. I only ate about three bites.  In another environment I would have gone so far as to complain, but not here.  The shrimp were good. Maybe most disappointing was the ubitiqous white shrimp sauce. It was very watery and bland:(. Major disappointment as that stuff is the highlight of a hibachi visit!  In sum, the food was filling, but not good enough to come here again.  

The positives are that the staff were friendly and worked quickly. The chef gave extra attention to my young son which was kind of him. Portions were quite large.  I cannot imagine complaints about portion size!
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the review highlights several disappointing aspects of the dining experience, including mediocre food quality, salty soup, flavorless salad dressing, tasteless teriyaki steak, low-quality meat, bland white shrimp sauce, and an overall lackluster experience. The reviewer expresses that the food was only okay and not good enough to warrant a return visit. Despite some positive points like friendly staff and generous portions, the negative aspects of the food quality outweigh the positive aspects, leading to an overall negative sentiment.

question:
Found this place on yelp as we arrived in charlotte 4pm with our 5 yr old and 2 yr old.  Figured they'd like hibachi...we were right!

Service was great, very kid friendly and helpful.  Food was plentiful.  Our table got a freebie of teriyaki shrimp (maybe they do this for all tables?).

Our party had the chicken and steak selections, all good.   2 adults and 2 kids. We were out the door for $85, including a nice tip.  Small kids will love the chef act!

Make reservations!  We did and we were glad.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer had a pleasant experience at the hibachi restaurant. They found the service to be great and kid-friendly, the food plentiful and enjoyable, and they appreciated the freebie of teriyaki shrimp. The reviewer also mentions that the meal was reasonably priced for their party size, and highlights that the small kids enjoyed the chef's performance. Additionally, they recommend making reservations, suggesting an overall satisfaction with their dining experience.

question:
Decent prices, good food, portions keep getting smaller....but the kicker is the horrible service you'll receive! We always give places more than one shot, especially if their food is good...but every time we go we are so disappointed at the service!

The chefs are nice and entertaining, especially for kids, but their servers don't seem to care and ruin the tip (which they split)

This last time, we went on a Friday round 6. Moderately busy, but seated right away. Our server seemed so bothered by us, never saying you're welcome when we thanked it (it was more if a grunt/irritated "ya") and the portions were much smaller. I swear, the more people at a table, the smaller the portion. If you get served last, expect to be jealous of the first persons huge serving. 

They charged an extra $1.75 for fried rice, which I don't mind but I do expect more than 2 pieces of broccoli, one mushroom and a decent amount of zucchini and onion. My chicken dinner cost around $16, and the best part was the Shrimp sauce,  

They served my husbands combo with teryaki chicken instead of regular hibachi and when he told them it was wrong twice, our chef pretended not to hear and turned the fan on. We were so annoyed at that point, we didn't push the issue...paid our $50 tab and bolted. 

Won't be returning. Given this place too many opportunities and they constantly fail.
rationale: The sentiment is considered negative because the review outlines multiple instances of poor service at the restaurant, including an uninterested server, inconsistent portion sizes, and a mix-up with the order that was not resolved satisfactorily. The customer expresses disappointment and frustration with the overall experience, leading them to decide not to return to the restaurant. These negative aspects of the service overshadow any positives about the food quality or entertainment provided by the chefs.

question: Far better than it's competition just down the street! I've eaten here many times and have never once had a single complaint! The quality and quantity of the food is fantastic! The sushi is superb! The staff are welcoming and efficient! The only thing I would tweak would be the decor. The carpet should be removed because I've been coming here for years and it's always been the same, and only gotten darker. I realize that seems like no big deal, but I would feel better about the whole experience with a new floor that's easier to clean.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the customer's overall experience at the restaurant has been very pleasant. They praise the quality and quantity of the food, highlighting the superb sushi and the welcoming and efficient staff. Their only suggestion for improvement is related to the restaurant's decor, specifically the need for a new floor. However, this suggestion is minor in comparison to the many positive aspects they mention about the restaurant, indicating a generally positive and satisfied experience.

question: Average food. You can tell they use cheap steak and lobster. The sauces are not good and they are constantly rushing you. I literally had my soup and salad delivered within 30 seconds of each other. Then the chef comes out to rush us. The server is stuck constantly refilling tiny glasses and trying to rush us so we have room for hot food from the chef. The chef was entertaining but the food wasn't very good. Large portions of noodles and vegetables. I guess they want big portions to make up for poor quality. Doesn't work. Then the server comes out to rush us into boxing up our food. The very minute the chef is done! How about we get some time to eat and talk?!? Boxes were left at the table while we were still eating so that The server could return to constantly filling tiny glasses. We wanted to make sure the chef got tipped out, but came to find he splits them with the server... even. That is just wrong. The servers are running around hustling people through dinner so they can get the next table in.\n\n  The place cuts too many corners and rushes you through dinner. It's not very good. And they take advantage of the wait staff. Did I mention the hostesses were rude? Find somewhere better to eat.
rationale: The sentiment is negative due to multiple complaints in the review. The customer mentioned the use of cheap steak and lobster, poor quality sauces, rushed service, lack of time to enjoy the meal, large portions to compensate for poor quality, rushing to box up leftovers, concerns about the treatment of the wait staff, and rude hostesses. These issues collectively contribute to an overall negative dining experience for the customer.

question: Very disappointing. Too expensive for what you get. They were just going through the motions without any emotion. Food had no flavor. A lot of veggies very little steak or chicken. My son and I ordered different chicken but both orders were prepared the same. Had to ask for more water. Still eating when take home boxes were brought out. I felt like I had wasted my hard earned money.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer expressed disappointment with the experience, highlighting issues such as high prices in relation to the quality received, lack of flavor in the food, minimal portions of meat compared to veggies, lack of individualized preparation for different orders, slow service in responding to basic needs like water, and feeling rushed with the premature arrival of take-home boxes. These negative aspects collectively created an unsatisfactory dining experience for the reviewer, leading them to feel that their money was not well spent.

question: Been a fan of this place since they moved to Pineville from the Independence location. Over the years we gave celebrated many birthdays & anniversaries here . Food is always yummy. You get a lot - so if you leave Hungry - I wonder what's wrong with you ... The appetizer soup and salad are just the beginning - I tend to stay with basic hibachi shrimp and filet which are always wonderful . The fried rice is the all time favorite item for me ! The chef that cooks are generally as entertaining as you want - the more you engage them the more fun it is ! For me - hands down there's no better Japanese steakhouse in Charlotte. Food is fresh - seafood is yummy - entertainment is always good !
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer has been a fan of the restaurant for a long time, they have celebrated many special occasions there, and they consistently enjoy the food. The reviewer mentions that the food is always delicious and that they receive generous portions. They also highlight specific menu items they enjoy, such as the hibachi shrimp and filet, fried rice, and seafood. Additionally, the reviewer appreciates the entertainment provided by the chefs during the meal. Overall, the reviewer expresses a high level of satisfaction with the restaurant, concluding that it is the best Japanese steakhouse in Charlotte.

question:
My visit to Nakato (first time) was on a Friday night.  The place was packed and had a constant stream of people, busy busy.  We had 6:30 reservations for a party of 6 and once everyone arrived we were promptly seated.  They will not seat you until everyone is there.

We were seated around a hibachi station - each station has seating for 8, so we had two strangers at the end of our station (no big, they were nice).  I was a little concerned at the cost of the meal when I was looking at it online, but the amount of food is well worth the cost.

I ordered the teryaki chicken.  You start with an onion broth while the chef is warming up.  Next is the small chilled garden salad served with a pink creamy dressing.  While you are finishing your soup and working on your salad, the chef starts with hibachi veggies (thin sliced carrots, onions, zucchini, mushrooms and broccoli).  Next are hibachi noodles (spaghetti with an oil and garlic ? coating).  Next, if you order fried rice with your meal ($1.75 extra) instead of white rice, the chef does the fried rice and portions it out.  Then the meat is started.  Our table had a variety of steak and shrimp items, which were served first since they cook more quickly than chicken (no one wants rare chicken).  I thought everything was quite good (though my white rice was cold, but that is what I get for not ordering fried rice like everyone else at the table).  All of the preparation is done in front of you by the chef, who puts on a show while cooking.  Very interesting, though I was concerned that I was going to lose my eyebrows when the onion volcano was done.

With 6 people, it was hard to hold a conversation, though not impossible.  If you are catching up with friends, I would suggest getting there early for drinks, or planning drinks and dessert after - once the chef's show starts going, along with all of the tables around you, it is rather noisy.  

Our server kept drinks filled.  The chef was quite personable.  I had water to drink, so my dinner before tip was just under $15.  Contrary to what my dinner date told me, you don't necessarily have to take off your shoes, though they do have traditional tables there as an option.  

Be warned that your hair and clothes will wreak of the hibachi smell, so I wouldn't take a post-meal walk through the woods unless you like bears and wildcats.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is positive because the reviewer had an overall enjoyable experience at Nakato during their visit. They highlighted the efficiency of being promptly seated, the value of the amount of food received for the cost, and the quality of the meal. The reviewer also mentioned the entertaining hibachi cooking experience and the personable chef, indicating a positive dining atmosphere. Additionally, they noted the attentive service from the server and the reasonable pricing for their meal. Despite some minor inconveniences like the noise level and smell lingering on clothes, the reviewer seemed satisfied with their dining experience overall.

question: This restaurant is tucked away in the Carmel Commons shopping center off of Hwy 51.  I've only been here for lunch, many times, and their lunch specials are very good and affordable...$7.54 I believe?  It comes with an entree, soup of the day and iced tea.  The menu rotates so some of the dishes aren't always available but the traditional noodle dishes are always on there.  I really like their house noodle (kind of a mix between Pud Thai and Pud See Ew).  They also have good curry/rice dishes.  Their ingredients are really fresh and the noodles are some of the best I've had from a Thai restaurant.  Lunch on Wednesday is always really crowded (I believe it's because of the hot and sour soup served that day only) so get there before/after the lunch rush to avoid a long wait for a table!  4 stars because they could use some more staff on hand otherwise I'd give them a 5!
rationale: The sentiment for this review is positive because the reviewer highlights several aspects of the restaurant that they enjoy, such as the good and affordable lunch specials, fresh ingredients, delicious noodle dishes, and popular hot and sour soup. They also mention that they would give the restaurant a 5-star rating if there were more staff available. Overall, the reviewer's comments focus on the positive aspects of their dining experiences, indicating satisfaction with the food and value offered by the restaurant.

question: This little Thai treasure consistently delivers!  I have ate there and had carry out many times.  The service is excellent, atmosphere is fairly basic and quiet and the food is excellent!  To-date this is my favorite Thai place in Charlotte and I highly recommend you give it a try.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer praises the restaurant for consistently delivering great food and excellent service. They also mention the comfortable atmosphere and express that it is their favorite Thai place in Charlotte. Overall, the review is filled with positive feedback and a strong recommendation for others to try out the restaurant.

question:
I had one of my worst dining experiences here ever. I ordered Basil Chicken with no bell peppers.When it came, it was loaded with the slimy green peppers. I informed the waitress of the mistake and she called me a "liar". Well I was speechless. I can't believe a complete stranger is calling me a liar. I informed her that I could not eat this chicken and that I would like it as I ordered it. With even my friends backing up the fact that i ordered no green peppers, she started screaming at me and calling me a liar again. She said she would make another one, but that I will be charged for both. I refused, on principal, but also what nasty things would this irate server do to my food if a new order was remade. I refused to eat while my companion's ate. Everybody in the restaurant stared at me as tho I had just murdered somebody. It was surreal. At check out, I asked to speak to the owner to see if he would kindly remove my charge. He said he would call the police if I didn't pay for my meal. I was nice and courteous the whole time.  I submitted to his threats and paid for the meal I didn't order and didn't eat. I later called my credit card company and they reversed the charge. 

This is the WORST restaurant I have ever NOT eaten at in Charlotte!

My advice is DON'T GO!
rationale: The sentiment of this review is negative due to the poor dining experience described by the reviewer. The issues include receiving a dish with ingredients they specifically asked to be excluded, being called a liar by the waitress, experiencing rude and unprofessional behavior from the staff, feeling uncomfortable and embarrassed in front of others in the restaurant, and the owner threatening to call the police when the customer tried to address the situation politely. Overall, the reviewer's experience was frustrating, disrespectful, and left a lasting negative impression of the restaurant.

question: I've been here for take out and sit down lunches and have been impressed both times. I was pleasantly surprised on my recent lunch trip, as I was offered more than I was for take put. Got the Pad Thai w/chicken both times. Great price of $7.95, but when you sit down it also comes with iced tea and a bowl of soup. Soup was a corn based egg drop soup, which was different, but good. You also get a small egg roll. Yep...$7.95! Service is fast too! Enjoy! I'll be back soon :)
rationale: The review expresses overall positive experiences with the restaurant during both take-out and sit-down visits. The customer was impressed by the quality of the food, mentioning the Pad Thai with chicken was great and the price was very good at $7.95. They also highlighted the added value of a complimentary iced tea, bowl of soup, and egg roll when dining in, indicating good value for the money. The fast service further added to their positive experience, and they concluded by expressing their intention to return soon. Overall, the review conveys a sense of satisfaction and enjoyment, making it a positive sentiment.

question: We really wanted to like is place. We have yet to find a really excellent Thai place in charlotte. We ordered take out of pad Thai, pad see ew, red curry and fish cakes. The pad Thai was the most flavorful thing we had. The fish cakes were pretty greasy. Across the board, the dishes were flavorless. They warned me that the red curry was hot when I ordered it on the phone. Couldn't be further from the truth. The food was well cooked, but lacked seasoning and flavor overall. Nothing tragically wrong with it, just not very tasty. Also a bit overpriced.
rationale: The sentiment is Negative because the review highlights multiple aspects of the dining experience that were disappointing. The customer found the dishes to be flavorless, with the exception of the pad Thai, and mentioned that even though they were warned about the spiciness of the red curry, it was not actually hot. They also found the fish cakes to be greasy. Additionally, the review mentions the food being overpriced. These collective criticisms lead to an overall negative evaluation of the restaurant.

question: I've only eaten here for lunch. I would highly recommend it! It's fast, friendly, priced right & very good. I always order the Pad Thai w/ chicken. They offer a spice (heat) range from 1 to 5 (5 being the hottest). I usually go with a 4. At lunch, for $7.95, you get unsweetened tea, soup, & your entree dish. They offer a different soup every day of the week. There is something to be said about friendly service and this place has it! To walk in and be greeted by name is a nice feeling. Because of my job, I once went almost a year without going in, but my first time back, I was greeted by name with a friendly smile, seated, and they even remembered what I used to order. Wow! It can sometimes be pretty busy at lunch time but the wait is never too long. You've got to give it a try!
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer highly recommends the restaurant due to its fast service, friendly staff, reasonable prices, and delicious food. They specifically mention enjoying the Pad Thai with chicken, the variety of spice levels offered, and the value of the lunch special. The reviewer appreciates the personalized service, noting that the staff remembered them after a long absence, which left a lasting positive impression. Overall, the reviewer encourages others to try the restaurant despite potential lunchtime crowds, showcasing their satisfaction with the dining experience.

question: I like the food here. It's very flavorful. I hesitated to write a review here before because I would've given them a bad one due to their portion size and pricing. However, on my most recent visit I've noticed that they increased their portion for lunch combinations. Even though they're still pricey, at least I'm getting more food. Their lunch deal is definitely their best deal. You get a soup, unsweetened iced tea, spring roll, rice, and main dish. They give you a good amount and it will fill you up. \n\nI typically order the seafood combo number 3, which is a basil based brown sauce. The sauce is delicious, and they give you plenty of seafood, shrimp, calamari, and scallops. I took away a star because they're a bit too pricey still, but they definitely have good food.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is positive because the user highlights positive aspects of the restaurant, such as the flavorful food, increased portion sizes for lunch combinations, and the variety offered in the lunch deal. Despite mentioning the pricing as a drawback, the user still acknowledges it as the best deal and compliments the quality and quantity of the food, particularly mentioning the delicious sauce and generous amount of seafood in their favorite dish. Overall, the user's tone is appreciative and they find value in the offerings of the restaurant.

question:
I don't frequent this little shopping center off of 51 often except for the occasional Fresh Market visit or essentials from Party City. I was happy to find solace in Bangkok Ocha for lunch with a deer chum of mine. Certainly a diamond in the rough for those who have not tried it. 

A quaint Thai resto with a lack of glitz and glam - my kind of joint. All about the food and service. You can't set your drink down without them filling it right back up! So rad. 

Food: They start you off with soup. It's some sort of rice-y, broth-y soup that has a somewhat peculiar color. Off white-ish. Very flavorful and salty. Contains some sort of protein as well. Either tofu or chicken, but not certain. 

I ordered the Pud Kee Mow. One of my favorites at any Thai place. Flat, pan seared noodles with veggies, chicken and plenty of spices. The flavor is very earthy and peppery. Huge portion for lunch, too. They give you a nice spring roll with your entree that isn't incredible, but definitely a nice touch for an already generous meal. 

Me and my buddy ate for just $18. Not too shabby, in my opinion. 

Definitely will be back for lunch again soon. This city has so many Thai options and I'm happy Bangkok Ocha is one of them! Cheers!
rationale: The sentiment of the review is positive because the reviewer expresses satisfaction with their experience at Bangkok Ocha. They describe the restaurant as a hidden gem and appreciate the simple, food-focused atmosphere. The attentive service, flavorful food, generous portions, and reasonable prices all contribute to the positive sentiment conveyed in the review. The reviewer also mentions their intention to return, indicating a desire to have a repeat positive experience.

question: I was really disappointed in this place. I had heard it was good, but the food was terrible. I got crispy spring rolls, which were flavorless & I ordered the pad thai w/ chicken. It didn't even taste like pad thai. No flavor. I will not be coming back here.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is Negative because the customer expresses disappointment in the food quality and lack of flavor in both the crispy spring rolls and the pad thai with chicken. The customer also states that they will not be returning to the restaurant, indicating a strong level of dissatisfaction with their experience.

question:
We ordered delivery from them tonight and we are so disappointed ! 

Coconut soup is too creamy,the flavor is there but its texture is too thick for soup.

Pad thai noodles were mostly vegetables , and it's kinda bland, and there's baby corns. WHY is there baby corns in my pad thai !!?!? Ugh !!! I would make a wild assumption that their cook is not from Thailand because this is not how an authentic pad thai should taste like. 

Curry fried rice was also bland, luckily we have sriracha at home. Again the curry fried rice is not authentic neither.

We will not order from this place again, sorry.
For those of you looking for an authentic or even great taste thai food, this is NOT the place!
rationale: The sentiment of this review is negative because the customer expresses disappointment with the quality of the food they ordered for delivery. They specifically mention issues with the texture and flavor of the coconut soup, lack of authenticity and flavor in the pad thai and curry fried rice, and overall dissatisfaction with the experience. The customer states they will not order from the restaurant again and warns others looking for authentic Thai food to avoid this establishment. Overall, the review highlights multiple shortcomings in the food quality and authenticity, leading to a negative sentiment.

question: My family and I eat here all the time. I would put this food up against any Thai restaurant in town. Every time we go the food is consistently delicious and the owners and waitresses are very personable and friendly. \n\nGive this place a try you won't regret it. The house noodle dish is fantastic.
rationale: The sentiment in the review is positive because the reviewer praises the restaurant's food, comparing it favorably to other Thai restaurants in town. They also highlight the consistency of the delicious food and the friendly and personable service from the owners and waitstaff. The reviewer encourages others to give the restaurant a try and specifically recommends the house noodle dish, indicating a high level of satisfaction with their dining experience.

question: The store is kind of small, and there's not a whole lot to choose from.  They have new and used books, all separated into their various sections.  But the whole wall of romance novels kind of ruined it for me.  In fact there were so many romance novels they had to separate them into sections (historical and modern).  Now I have nothing against romance novels, they just aren't my thing.  If you are into them then certainly go check this place out, but having almost half a store dedicated to them was a little much for me.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer felt that the store's heavy focus on romance novels was overwhelming and limited the variety of books available. They expressed disappointment that such a large portion of the store was dedicated to romance novels, which they personally did not have an interest in. This imbalance in selection made the reviewer feel that the overall experience of browsing and finding books was lacking, leading to a less than positive impression of the store.

question:
I really like this place... It's not the best used book store I've ever been into, but it's a quaint little place and the people who work here are really awesome people. 

If you are looking for used books of various genres (nothing too old) then this will be a great little pit stop. I like to stop by if I'm heading over to Viet Thai or Musashi's and I've placed a to go order I am waiting on.  I took my grandmother here a few months ago and found a group of books from an author I used to collect. My copies have started falling apart and I grabbed what I thought I needed. Unfortunately it wasn't the right one and they had already sold the right one when I stopped by later to get it. So they kindly took my name and number and said whenever they came across it again they would give me a call. I obviously had forgotten all about it and then yesterday they called me up and said they had it behind the desk for me. How awesome is that :-)  

The prices can't be beat and you can really find some gems if you search. It is small as some people have claimed, but it's a great place to exchange books and find new things.  I highly recommend giving it a try. I know one customer complained about there being too many romance novels and yes there are quite a few but honestly they have lots of other things too!!
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer highlights several aspects of the used book store that they appreciate. They mention the store's quaint atmosphere, the helpful and friendly staff, the variety of genres available, and the reasonable prices. Additionally, the reviewer shares a personal experience where the staff went above and beyond to assist them in finding a specific book, showcasing the store's excellent customer service. Overall, the reviewer recommends the store to others and concludes by emphasizing the positive aspects of their visit.

question: I love the Book Rack! I recently moved to Charlotte and was on the hunt for a good used book store. They have a great selection which includes an entire bookcase of my personal favorite genre, Southern Fiction. I like that you can sell books and get some extra change to purchase other books. I could spend hours on hours in here!
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer expresses love for The Book Rack, highlighting the great selection of books, in particular, a favorite genre. The reviewer also appreciates the option to sell books and mentions the possibility of spending hours in the store, indicating a high level of satisfaction and enthusiasm for the bookstore.

question: I love this place! It's super cute and everyone there is really helpful with finding books you might be looking for. If they don't have one, you can ask to be alerted when they get it in store (and then you get first pick at it!) Having said that, it doesn't seem to be the most organized - some of the books are on shelves adjacent to the ones they're supposed to be on, and I asked for a couple of Margaret Atwood novels a while ago and haven't heard back yet.\n\nBut that's part of the charm of a cute little bookstore such as this. Basically, in short, it's adorable. If you're looking to find something specific, you're probably better off with amazon. But if you want to poke around for a great find on a pretty Sunday afternoon, this is the place to go!
rationale: The sentiment of the review is positive because the reviewer expresses love for the bookstore, appreciates the helpful staff who assist in finding books, and finds the store charming despite some organizational issues. The reviewer considers the bookstore adorable and a great place for browsing and discovering new books on a leisurely Sunday afternoon. Despite a minor issue with receiving a response about specific book requests, the overall tone and language used in the review convey a positive experience and a recommendation for others to visit the bookstore.

question: Hidden away next to the flower section and Starbucks at Harris Teeter lies this little Chinese-Thai gem. The owners are very friendly and the food is just as good as any authentic Chinese/Thai takeout place.  Sesame beef and Lo Mein is a favorite of ours. You can place your order to go before you do your grocery shopping, then pick it up when  you are done.  Convenient!!
rationale: The review expresses positive sentiment by highlighting the friendliness of the owners, the quality of the food, and the convenience of being able to place an order before shopping and picking it up afterwards. The reviewer mentions specific favorite dishes, such as sesame beef and Lo Mein, which adds to the positive sentiment by showcasing their satisfaction with the menu offerings. Overall, the reviewer's experience at the Chinese-Thai restaurant at Harris Teeter was portrayed as enjoyable and convenient, warranting a positive sentiment.

question: The food here is decent, but nothing special when it comes to Chinese take-out. I will say there are other places nearby that are much better. The portions are pretty small, and sauces are bland. The owners are usually pretty nice when I go. The only reason I will come here is really for the convenience factor of it being in Harris Teeter. Other than that, I would not recommend.
rationale: The sentiment is Negative because the review highlights several shortcomings of the restaurant, such as the food not being exceptional compared to other nearby places, small portions, bland sauces, and the only positive being the convenience of its location within Harris Teeter. Overall, the reviewer did not find the dining experience to be noteworthy or satisfactory, leading to a negative assessment.

question:
After intermittent shopping at the Harris Teeter in which Chi Thai is located, and reading a few other reviews, the time was nigh to check out the grub! Located to the right upon entering HT, Chi Thai is a small takeout counter with tons of options. A great marriage of Chinese and Thai dishes with tons of great sides. 

We came in for a late lunch and ordered two lunch specials and two soups. Only took about 15 minutes as they prepared everything fresh. I ordered the Thai Kew Teaw which was grilled noodles, chicken, peppers, grilled onions, and a heavenly sriracha-esque sauce. Reminded me a lot of many other Thai dishes I've ordered with the smoky flavor of the noodles and the grilled, crispy veggies. My wife ordered a veggie noodle dish. Loved the thick lo mein noodles. The sauce they were tossed in was very mild and simple. 

The soups were great. Egg drop and hot & sour. The hot and sour was very thick and a little more on the sour side. Also, it had pork in it which is a little different. Not a bad addition. The eggdrop was very good. Thick and creamy, with tons of great egg  flavor. 

Lunch for the two of us was less than $20 and were super full. We didn't even eat dinner that night!

Next time we're shopping at HT on 51, Chi Thai will be an easy choice for quick takeout.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is positive because the reviewer highlights several aspects of their experience that they enjoyed. They mention the variety of options at Chi Thai, the fresh preparation of the food, the flavors and quality of the dishes they ordered, the reasonable price, and the fact that they were satisfied with their meal. Overall, the reviewer's tone is enthusiastic and they express a desire to return to Chi Thai for another meal, indicating a positive experience.

question: Precooked noodles in Ragu like sauce.  I got the Thai food (Phod Thai).  Don't do it!  There was a sprinkling of vegetables and not much else.  I asked for extra lime and onion and they gave me a tiny end of a lemon (not a lime) and no extra onions.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer had a disappointing experience with the food they ordered. The precooked noodles in Ragu-like sauce with minimal vegetables did not meet their expectations for a dish advertised as Thai food (Pho Thai). Additionally, their request for extra lime and onions was not fulfilled as they were given a small lemon instead of a lime and no extra onions. These shortcomings resulted in a negative review of the meal.

question: O M G!!! What a gem had I not read the yelp reviews, I would've passed this place by like a in house fast food joint.. boy would that have been an incorrect assumption! Flavor and freshness! Great customer service and interaction when they even bowed to my request of changing the type of curry I wanted in my dish! I ordered the vegetarian Kang Dang. On the menu it is described as, \"Thai red curry in coconut cream sauce with cabbage, tofu, straw mushrooms, onions, red peppers, asparagus, green peppers and bamboo shoots\".. but they willingly changed it per my request to yellow curry at no extra charge or major fuss. :D  After they obliged, I decided to also order the vegetarian Tom Kha, a Thai coconut cream soup with galangal and lemon grass, lemon leaf, tomato and straw mushroom. Since I got it veggie instead of meat, it also had peppers, onions, celery, broccoli and a slew of other welcoming and tasteful vegetables. Both dishes were surprisingly wonderful. I will gladly return, try other items, and suggest this eatery (there is a seating area behind the flowers, next to the Starbucks) to others! Happy eating!  ..and just to add their prices are high, but they are in point for quality.. and the owners/cooks are quite friendly.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the review describes the food as flavorful and fresh, with great customer service that accommodated the customer's special request without any extra charge or fuss. The reviewer enjoyed both dishes ordered and expressed a willingness to return and recommend the eatery to others. Despite noting that the prices were on the higher side, the reviewer still found the quality to be worth it and highlighted the friendliness of the owners/cooks. Overall, the review conveys a very positive experience at the restaurant.
