question: I am not a big fan of fast food but when I do get the craves this is where I go.  They have it all, good burgers, some on sour dough buns, tacos, egg rolls and a changing menu of  specialty sandwiches.  Plus a great breakfast menu.  Oh, and you can get burgers and breakfast all day long, can't beat that.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the user highlights a variety of food options available at the fast food restaurant that they enjoy. They mention good burgers, specialty sandwiches, and a great breakfast menu, indicating a positive experience with the food offerings. The user also appreciates the fact that they can satisfy their cravings with burgers and breakfast items all day long, which adds to their overall positive perception of the restaurant.

question:
I creepily eat here probably once every two weeks.  What can I say... there cheese fries are fabulous, and their salads are yummy.  
I also recommend getting the No Rules Pasta with no protein (vegetarian) and sub the normal sauce for the fuego sauce.  The sauce is spicy and absolutely perfect.  
If you go in and there is a long wait, it is good to remember that the bar is first come, first serve.  I never wait longer than 5 minutes because I typically get a seat in the bar area.  They also do call ahead seating, a definite plus.  So if you are going on a busy, just give them a buzz as you are leaving the house. 
The staff here and be hit or miss.  When they are good, they are GOOD and when they are bad.... let's just say I have a few that will not be my server again.
rationale: The review expresses positive sentiments overall, highlighting the delicious food options such as the cheese fries, salads, and recommended pasta dish with fuego sauce. The customer also appreciates the convenience of quick seating options like the bar area and call-ahead seating. Despite mentioning that the staff can be hit or miss, the reviewer acknowledges that when the service is good, it is excellent. Overall, the positive aspects of the food quality, seating options, and quick service outweigh any potential negatives, leading to an overall positive sentiment in the review.

question: Love the food at Outback but not a big fan of some of the appetizers. We usually hit this Outback about once a month for a good lunch because the service is great, the food has yet to disappoint and we never have to wait for anything. Outside of dinner after 7 pm here you can get in and out fairly quickly and feel that you got what if not more than you paid for.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer expresses love for the food at Outback and finds the service to be great. They also appreciate that they never have to wait and feel they receive good value for what they pay. Overall, they have consistently positive experiences dining at the restaurant and are satisfied with the food, service, and efficiency of their visits.

question:
I went here as a last resort after being unable to secure a table at Beef-n-Bottle, so my expectations in regards to meat quality that day were a little high.

The first thing to expect at Outback is a fairly long wait on weekends; if memory serves me correctly, the wait on a Saturday night was about 50 mins.  There is a small waiting area to the left of the door that has complimentary lemonade and they also pass out samples of appetizers.  This small space is a real life saver when it's really cold outside.

Regarding the food, I recommend either the Victoria Filet or the New York strip (rare or medium rare).  Since the prices are so reasonable, you're basically looking at a $10-14 steak if you get the sirloin and based on the comments from the table next to us, a $10 piece of meat is what you're gonna get.  While we enjoyed our filet and New York strip, the couple next to us was unable to finish more than half of their sirloins.  They said that the meat was kind of tough and dry.  I personally found my strip to be tender and juicy, however it was lacking in the seasoning department, let just say I needed a lot of steak sauce.  The loaded baked potato was cooked well, but the cesar salad that I had was very bland.  The dressing had almost no taste and the parmesan cheese was bland with an odd peppery taste.

The service was great, our waitress was very attentive and friendly.  If you asked me if I'd return, I'd probably say no.  The food quality just isn't what I'm used to in the realm of steaks.  To be honest, I've had better steaks at some of Charlotte's local bars.  If you're on a limited budget and want a steak dinner for $20 or less, you can't beat the pricing here.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is Negative because the customer had high expectations for the meat quality but found the sirloin steak to be tough and dry. Additionally, they mentioned that the steak lacked seasoning and required a lot of steak sauce. The Caesar salad was also described as bland with tasteless dressing and cheese. Although the service was good, the overall food quality did not meet the customer's expectations for a steakhouse experience, leading them to conclude that they would not likely return.

question: Outback food is fairly consistent.... Not bad for a Sunday night takeout....however they consistently FAIL to give us everything we order.  This was our last takeout night from them....  Shame....matching what's in the bag doesn't seem to be that difficult to me.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the customer expressed dissatisfaction with the service provided by the restaurant. They mentioned consistently not receiving everything they ordered, indicating a lack of attention to detail and poor customer service. Additionally, the customer stated that this experience was their last with the restaurant, suggesting a significant level of disappointment and frustration.

question: Ordered take out and wanted mashed potatoes....they have me a baked potato. I know it's not too big of a difference...but taste and accuracy are important to me. I waited over 30 minutes for my food that was supposed to take 15-20 and it was extremely cold. I work in the restaurant industry but I make sure my product is accurate and hot when it leaves the restaurant. I also ordered 2 breads with it and only received one. I'm extremely disappointed in this restaurant and it's not the first time I've had a problem.  Not just in this location but in a couple others.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the customer expressed disappointment with their order. The customer received the wrong item (baked potato instead of mashed), experienced delays in receiving their food (it was cold and took longer than expected), and did not receive all the items they had ordered (only one bread instead of two). They also mentioned this was not the first time they had issues with this restaurant or multiple locations, indicating a pattern of poor experiences. These factors contributed to the overall negative sentiment towards the restaurant.

question: After having a sub par meal last night a table that wasn't bolted to the base took a tumble and i ended up at urgent care for stitches.  The owner didn't bother comping our meal ($135) and my MIL had to fight for her to bring it down.  She ended up paying $24. What an insult.  Then, after getting the 8 stitches needed in my ankle, i called to speak with owner and she never called back.  Worst customer experience of my life.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the customer experienced a series of unfortunate events - from a subpar meal to a table collapse resulting in injury, then facing difficulties in getting compensation, and finally receiving poor customer service when trying to address the situation with the owner. The lack of acknowledgment, empathy, and resolution for a significant incident such as this understandably led to a negative experience for the customer.

question: The wait on weekends can be pretty bad, and if you try to call ahead, you may wait on hold for 10-15 minutes. Hopefully they're working on that. I've had many good meals here, usually ribeye, a baked potato and broccoli with a side salad. The food is consistent. I have a gluten allergy, and they have a good gluten free menu.
rationale: The review contains positive aspects such as enjoying good meals consistently, complimenting the ribeye dish and the gluten-free menu options. Despite some downsides mentioned about wait times and phone service, the overall tone of the review is positive due to the enjoyable dining experiences and the accommodation of the reviewer's gluten allergy.

question: The best Tex-Mex in town, and I've had them all.  Local recipes, not a chain.  Great salsa/chips!   Steak anything is great, especially the Burrito Tequilla.  Spicy, but wonderful!
rationale: The review highlights multiple positive aspects of the Tex-Mex restaurant, such as being locally-owned, having authentic recipes, and serving great salsa and chips. The customer also praises the quality of their steak dishes, particularly recommending the Burrito Tequilla for its spice and delicious flavor. Overall, the reviewer expresses satisfaction and enthusiasm for the restaurant's food, suggesting a positive sentiment.

question: I go here alot cause its right down the street and the waiters/bartenders are so cool.  I also eat the bean dip and one of the shrimp dishes.  Food is always consistent.
rationale: The review highlights positive aspects such as the convenient location, friendly staff, and consistent food quality. The reviewer mentions enjoying specific menu items and appreciates the overall experience, indicating a positive sentiment towards the restaurant.

question: *****this place has changed their name, its now cabo\"
rationale: The sentiment is considered positive because the reviewer indicates that the place has changed its name. The use of quotation marks around the new name suggests that the reviewer acknowledges and accepts the name change, indicating a neutral or possibly even positive attitude towards the rebranding.

question:
We've always loved Salsa's, but always had two reservations about going there: 1. the bar area (where smoking was legal) was too close to a lot of seats, therefore you'd inhale smoke all night and 2. it got crowded fast on "family" nights.  We would usually just go for lunch to avoid the crowd.

Well, two thing happened: 1. North Carolina outlawed smoking in all restaurants and 2. Salsa's expanded!  They've added a fresh tortilla maker and a place for a live band.  We went last Friday night to see our friend's band play and it was the same great Salsa's food in a wonderful atmosphere.  There was still a wait for a table, showing that the place is even more popular now!

Menu recommendations:

Pork Carnitas - I challenge any one person to finish this.  My wife usually has 2-3 meals from it.

Any other fajita - all of them are great, but now add in the fresh tortilla experience and they are no longer "just a fajita".

Tacos al Carbon - a great hot sauce and the onion/cilantro combination make these tacos jump

Enchilada Suizas - when you're in the mood for enchiladas done differently with a tomatillo sauce and queso!

And, getting back to the live band, they had the volume of the band set perfectly.  You could clearly hear them, but you didn't have to shout to have a conversation at your table.
rationale: The review expresses positive sentiments towards Salsa's restaurant after addressing previous reservations about the smoking policy and crowded environment. The positive changes mentioned, such as the smoking ban and the restaurant expansion, are highlighted as improvements that have enhanced the overall dining experience. The addition of a fresh tortilla maker and a live band further contribute to the positive atmosphere of the restaurant. The menu recommendations and positive remarks about the food and live band indicate that the reviewer had an enjoyable and satisfying visit to Salsa's. Overall, the review conveys a positive sentiment as the reviewer praises the improvements and highlights the quality of the food and dining experience at the restaurant.

question: i love this place. went here for my first time and got a little tipsy off their house margaritas, i had some tacos and an enchilada and ended up taking most of it home because i stuffed my face with chips and salsa. lol. But it was good and their customer service was good. My waiter was really nice:)
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the user expresses love for the place, enjoyed their experience despite getting a little tipsy off the margaritas, had a good meal with leftovers to take home, and appreciated the good customer service provided by the nice waiter. The user also mentions enjoying chips and salsa, showing a great overall dining experience.

question: The Food was good.. However, they were very shady at the end. The check came, I looked at it and it was right. I gave them my card and the manager (not the waiter) brought me back the check having been authorized for a different amount (about $10 more). He claimed \"things were missing\" from the original check. I asked for the detail and he left.. the Waiter came back in 10 minutes looking for the signed check. I told him the manager was bringing me the details, he left... 10 minutes later after asking 2 more times I decided $10 wasn't worth it and I signed it and left.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the customer had a negative experience with the restaurant at the end of their meal. The situation with the check being authorized for a higher amount without sufficient explanation from the manager and the delay in providing details caused frustration and discomfort for the customer. This incident reflects poorly on the restaurant's integrity and customer service, leading to a negative sentiment overall.

question:
First off, a heads up. Though the business is listed here as Salsa's, it's now actually Cabo's. 

I stopped here spur of the moment for takeout lunch and ended up ordering the Chicken Taco Salad. It wasn't exactly what I was used to--the black beans and chicken were both hot. I prefer my taco salad cold because lettuce with really warm food is a little gross, so I ended up sticking it in the fridge to cool down before eating more. 

I'll give them credit for the serving size (and the chips made for a nice snack later on). However, I wasn't overly impressed with the service. I was charged for the dinnertime salad rather than the lunch one (keep in mind I came in at 1PM), but the guy at the counter wouldn't admit to it. What happened to the mantra, "The customer is always right?" I'm no Albert Einstein, but just eyeballing the receipt (and with the help of my handy calculator), it wasn't hard to figure out that I was.

Ok, ok...time to cool off! All in all, I was only charged $1.00 extra, but it was a complete turnoff that the Cabo employee wasn't being honest and tried to make up a mysterious extra charge.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is Negative because the reviewer had several negative experiences during their visit to the restaurant. They were disappointed by the dish they ordered not being served at the desired temperature, the service was lacking when they were overcharged but the staff didn't admit their mistake, and the reviewer felt that the employee was not being honest about the extra charge. These experiences contributed to an overall negative impression of the restaurant.

question:
I think they must have changed owners. The place looked completely different. The service was slow. I ordered a lunch plate of taco, enchilada, rice and beans. For the Mexican restaurant expert, the "Speedy Gonzelas" 

I think it was the worst Mexican food I've ever eaten. Even Taco Bell's tacos were better tasting than this one. I took a few bites and asked for my check. The beans seemed to contain more lard than beans. The rice was dry and the salsa seemed to come right of the can.

If you looking for decent Mexican in the neighborhood, head to Cantina in Stonecrest or Senor Tequila on Rea Rd. Worth driving a few extra miles.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is Negative because the customer expresses disappointment with their dining experience at the restaurant. They mention that the place looked completely different, the service was slow, and the food quality was subpar compared to their expectations. The customer specifically criticizes the taste of the Mexican food, pointing out that even fast food chain Taco Bell's tacos were better in comparison. The mention of the beans containing more lard than beans, the dry rice, and the salsa tasting like it came from a can further highlight their dissatisfaction with the meal. In the end, they recommend other Mexican restaurants in the area over the one they visited, indicating that the overall experience did not meet their standards.

question: My wife and I donate blood and platelets every 6 weeks.  This is where we go and the people that work here are friendly, service is quick, and it's never really busy.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer had a good experience donating blood and platelets every 6 weeks. They highlighted that the staff at the donation center are friendly, the service is quick, and it's not usually crowded, indicating a pleasant and efficient donation process. Their willingness to donate regularly also suggests a positive attitude towards the facility and its operations.

question: Always a pleasure to come here!  Genuinely awesome staff, short wait time, painless  donation process.  I love the ARC and this is my absolute favorite place to donat
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer had a pleasant experience at the ARC, emphasizing the awesome staff, short wait time, and painless donation process. The reviewer also expresses love for the organization, making it clear that this is their favorite place to donate. Overall, the review showcases a high level of satisfaction and a strong recommendation for others to visit the ARC for donation purposes.

question: I have no idea what's wrong with me. Maybe it was because July 2008 is when I started Yelping, and maybe I was getting used to the website and how it works. At any rate, Uptown Retreat is a healthy, full five (5) stars. Not sure where that four came from. \n\nSince my review over two years ago, I've moved to Raleigh for a change from Charlotte and chopped off half my Rapunzel locks. In my year in Raleigh, I've tried three area hair places -- no one is Craig. I'll be making quarterly trips to Charlotte for Craig to continue doing my hair. I did find a local salon which sells Kerastase, but there is only one Craig...and he is at Uptown Retreat in Charlotte. The man is a genius!
rationale: The sentiment of the review is positive because the reviewer expresses satisfaction with their experience at Uptown Retreat and specifically praises Craig for his exceptional hair styling skills. Despite moving to a different city and trying other hair salons, the reviewer finds that no one compares to Craig at Uptown Retreat. They commend Craig as a "genius" and mention that they will continue to make quarterly trips to Charlotte just to have him do their hair. This effusive praise and loyalty to Craig indicate a strong positive sentiment towards the salon and the service provided.

question:
I would not recommend Uptown Retreat. First, the receptionist quoted me $20 less than it actually cost, so thinking I was getting a great price at a convenient place, I made an appointment. Then, a little confused at the price increase, I asked what services would have been at the price she quoted me and she couldn't give me a direct answer, she just waived it off. I don't like being lied to. 
The real problem was the hair cut. It was a disaster. I went back a week later to get it "fixed" and they had to cut off all of the layers, for which I never asked, and now my hair is just as short as it was seven months ago when I wanted to start growing it back out. 
Finally, to top it all off, my roots are already showing and this appointment was only just over two weeks ago. 
When I called to get a refund they told me they don't give refunds and when I explained how disappointed I was and that I had already been for a fix-cut, I was told I had to come back in for them to look at it-- and then I was hung up on. 

Save your time and frustration and go somewhere else.
rationale: The sentiment of this review is negative because the customer had a series of unsatisfactory experiences at the Uptown Retreat salon. They expressed disappointment with the misleading pricing, lack of transparency regarding services, a botched haircut that required further fixing, and poor customer service when seeking a refund. The overall tone of the review conveys frustration and a lack of trust in the salon's services and customer care.

question:
This place is alright.. It not what you would expect from Starbucks though.  They are usually much more spacious and helpful.. The staff here is snippy and not friendly.  

Hey.. Free Wifi!!  Cant complain about that.. I am yelping from here right now.. But it makes me wanna go try Caribou Coffee.  Eh..

-Ian M.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is negative because the user did not have a positive experience at the Starbucks location they visited. The user mentioned that the place was not up to their expectations, the staff was described as "snippy and not friendly," and it made them consider trying another coffee shop. These aspects reflect a disappointment and dissatisfaction with the overall experience, leading to a negative sentiment. Additionally, the user's tone was not enthusiastic or positive about their visit to the Starbucks outlet.

question: Starbucks - meh.  I've definitely had better. I prefer local, unique coffee shops instead of the chains any day of the week. However, I recently drove from Raleigh to Charlotte and had to have *something* before meetings...I couldn't wait until I got back to my hotel for room service. So this worked in a pinch. Not something I'd regularly do.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer expresses a preference for local, unique coffee shops over chains like Starbucks. They mention that they only visited Starbucks out of necessity and wouldn't make it a regular choice. This, along with the use of "meh" and describing having had better coffee elsewhere, indicates a lack of enthusiasm and an overall disappointment with the Starbucks experience.

question: Starbucks is generally 2-3 stars, quality of coffee-wise but, I give this location 4 because they seem to manage heavy volume well in the morning.  The lines move reasonably fast although I am usually just a Venti Bold kind of guy so, not sure how long the wait is when ordering something barista-centric.  This location is WAY faster than the one near BofA so, keep that mind if you are in the area, and in a hurry to get that caffeine jones cured.
rationale: The sentiment in the review is positive because the user praises the specific Starbucks location for effectively managing heavy morning volume, having reasonably fast-moving lines, and being faster than a nearby competitor. Despite the user's average rating for Starbucks in general, the positive comments about this specific location's efficiency and speed contribute to an overall positive sentiment towards this particular establishment.

question: This store has gone downhill gradually over the last year. The associates are extremely distant and spend more time talking to each other while people are in line waiting to order. I stood in line staring at a Starbucks associate for up to 5 minutes while she stood talking very loudly about something that had nothing to do with work.  The store was also very dirty.  There was milk and sugar all over the condiment station and trash was spilling over. The cleanliness may have been isolated but every associate's lack of care for customers is what really keeps me from coming back.  I used to stop by this location every day but now it's about twice a year. I choose to give my business to the Caribou located feet away.  The Caribou associates KNOW how to treat customers.  The Caribou associates call me by my name promptly, they remembered my usual order on the THIRD VISIT, and are able to laugh and have fun with the Caribou customers while providing stellar service.  Things HAVE to change for me to return to Starbucks otherwise I will continue to visit Caribou where I am treated like a valued customer EVERY time I walk into their store.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the customer had a consistently poor experience at the Starbucks store, mentioning issues such as distant and inattentive associates, uncleanliness, and a lack of care for customers. The comparison to the positive experiences at Caribou further emphasizes the customer's dissatisfaction with the declining service at Starbucks. The customer's decision to switch their daily visits to Caribou due to better treatment and service solidifies the negative sentiment towards Starbucks.

question: Showmars serves up deliciously unhealthy food. I usually get a cheeseburger or some kind of pita wrap there. This particular location has really friendly employees. I went to Showmars one day with two friends who go there A LOT. The employees recognized my friends and knew their regular orders. I like how Showmars employees bring your order to your table and return to offer you drink refills. The food is really cheap too. There aren't many places in uptown that you can get a $6 lunch.
rationale: The review describes positive aspects of the experience at Showmars, such as delicious food options like cheeseburgers and pita wraps, friendly and attentive employees who recognize regular customers and provide excellent service, as well as the convenience of having orders brought to the table with drink refills offered. Additionally, the reviewer highlights the affordability of the food, mentioning the value of getting a $6 lunch in uptown. These factors contribute to an overall positive sentiment towards Showmars in the review.

question: Breakfast was fast, cheap, and very good!!!  We are staying around the corner and looking for a place to get good cheap breakfast and we found it at Showmars!!!  Staff was friendly!
rationale: The review expresses satisfaction with the speed, affordability, and quality of the breakfast at Showmars, highlighting positive aspects such as the fast service and tasty food. Additionally, the reviewer appreciated the friendly staff. Overall, these positive experiences contribute to the sentiment being classified as Positive.

question:
This version of Dick's doesn't get me excited. Well...no version of Dick's gets me excited - but you can avoid this location and fear no missed opportunity.

This is a scaled down version with not much selection, especially in the winter department. I drove out of my way to visit this location- I will avoid in the future. 

Bonus- nobody is here so parking is a breeze.
rationale: The sentiment of this review is Negative because the customer did not have a positive experience at the Dick's location they visited. They expressed disappointment in the limited selection, specifically in the winter department, which led to them feeling like they wasted their time driving there. Additionally, the lack of customers at the store may indicate a lack of popularity or appeal, further contributing to the negative sentiment.

question:
Bank of America  ah yes the power of Ken Lewis squirming his way out of insider trading while he buys $100++ trash cans for his office and lays people off . Go figure ... screw the little guy. My trouble with B of A started I guess about well maybe 4 months ago . I decided on a Disney vacation and went on their web site ( Disney ) and booked everything with my Visa check card that is supposed to have fraud protection well it seems that the call center that Disney was using for these transactions had a team of scum bags that stole peoples credit card #s . Ok so I normally check my balance about every day or so anyway I checked it must have been 3 days after I booked and I had 3 charges one for nearly $10,000 another for about $12,000 then another for about $25,000 not only that everything that I charged bounced and there where about I guess $400 more dollars . 
       I called the bank two where used for cars and one for someones cruise  vacation I said wait a minute did it not raise a flag when a $25,000 purchase came threw  when I mostly just use it max of $1000. Well there must have been a "bank error " they said. You damm right there was !!
       Anyway the bank did put, the money back except and this is the shi..ty part they said I would have to pay the returned fees from the charges that I made and there was no money ? I said if you had caught those huge transactions it would have not been a problem. Any way we went round and round finally about 2 months later they fixed it then I closed my account I did not want to until this was settled .. Another Bank now 
Screw you Ken Lewis ...hope you go to jail for shi..ting on little people!!!
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the review expresses frustration, anger, and disappointment towards Bank of America and its CEO, Ken Lewis. The reviewer recounts a distressing experience of fraud on their account, where large unauthorized charges were made and the bank's response was deemed inadequate. The reviewer feels mistreated and let down by the bank's handling of the situation, leading to a strong negative sentiment towards the institution and its leadership. The use of strong language and the call for consequences for Ken Lewis indicate a deeply negative perception of the bank and its practices.

question: I hate Bank of America more than anything else in the world.  I am a peaceful person who would rather cut off my left arm than offend anyone or get into a fight.  But, I swear, B of A brings out a side of me that I wish I never had to see, and the unfortunate part is that I usually end up taking it out on the unsuspecting customer service rep on the other end of the phone line.  I have never in my life banked with a company that goes so far out of their way to screw people over and assess unnecessary fees.  I have paid B of A hundreds of dollars in overdraft fees over the last year due to their screwed up system and logic that they will undoubtedly try to convince you is somehow appropriate.  For example, I made a charge to Food Lion using my debit card and my pin number, which means that charge should come through on my account IMMEDIATELY.  Instead, it didn't come out for two days, on the same day as an automatic withdrawal for a student loan payment.  The financial geniuses at this corporate mega-money factory decided that since they waited for two days to take it out, now they would take the debits out from largest to smallest, with no regard for the date and/or method of payment used.  So, in a nutshell, I was charged two, count 'em two, overdraft fees and when I spoke to customer service, they simply read the policy out of their little manual, attempting to explain it to me like I have an IQ of 50 with no offer to make the situation better even when I threatened to close my account.  Bottom line:  they don't care about me, my money, my life, or my circumstances.  All they care about is whether or not I'm stupid enough to continue paying them overdraft fees.  I closed my account and switched to a smaller credit union and I couldn't be happier with my decision.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is negative because the customer expresses strong feelings of frustration, anger, and disappointment towards Bank of America. The customer recounts multiple negative experiences, such as being charged excessive overdraft fees and feeling mistreated by customer service representatives. The lack of empathy, poor communication, and perceived disregard for the customer's well-being mentioned in the review all contribute to the negative sentiment. Additionally, the customer's decision to close their account and switch to a smaller credit union indicates their dissatisfaction with Bank of America's practices and overall service.

question: I didn't not go to this branch specifically but I am writing a review on Bank of America in general not happy with here customer service. When trying to say something they pretty much tell you are even though I have papers in front of me showing when stuff have gone through and they are telling that stuff went through a different way. All I wanted was the fee taken off but they didn't even try they said they couldn't. I acknowledged I was going to go negative no matter what but it should of been a lower amount them what I was charged. Leaning toward leaving Bank of America because of poor service. C
rationale: The sentiment is Negative because the reviewer expresses dissatisfaction with the customer service of Bank of America and describes their experience as frustrating. They mention encountering difficulties when trying to communicate with the bank staff and getting a fee removed, which left them feeling unsatisfied and considering switching banks due to the poor service received.

question: I feel like I'm in the 80s at this movie theater . This place is in need of a major renovation and carpet cleaning
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the person feels that the movie theater is outdated and in need of renovation and carpet cleaning. This suggests that the individual is dissatisfied with the current state of the theater and feels that it does not meet modern standards for cleanliness and aesthetics.

question:
This is a great local Mexican joint..  modern priced, comfortable, good ritas and sangria and standard Mexican food done California style. I am from Los Angeles and there are a million of these sort of places here, so it was nice to have a local Mex place that was casual, consistently good, friendly, laid back and fun.

My faves are Tortilla Soup & Street Tacos.. 

I have also heard that they turn it into a Spanish club on the weekends, which is awesome.
rationale: The review highlights several positive aspects of the Mexican restaurant, such as the comfortable and relaxed atmosphere, good drinks, standard yet well-executed food, and a fun weekend ambiance. The reviewer appreciates the casual and friendly nature of the place, as well as the consistency in the quality of the dishes. The mention of favorite menu items indicates a positive dining experience overall. Overall, the reviewer's tone is enthusiastic and complimentary, expressing satisfaction with their visits to the restaurant.

question: I haven't been back here in years. The food is mediocre at best. Head to Monterrey's.
rationale: The sentiment is Negative because the user expresses disappointment with the food quality, describing it as mediocre at best. Additionally, the user recommends going to Monterrey's instead of returning to the restaurant, indicating a lack of satisfaction with their experience.

question: I have yet to find a dish I like there. I feel like there are better places for Mexican besides here. Food was mediocre I thought.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer expresses a disappointment in not finding a dish they like at the restaurant and believes that there are better Mexican food options available elsewhere. Additionally, referring to the food as mediocre further supports the negative sentiment towards their dining experience at the restaurant.

question: I like Zapata's! The decor is \"Mexicany\" without being cheezy and my Garden Burrito was delicious. The warm red sauce they served with the burrito was smoky and yummy!
rationale: The review expresses positive sentiments towards Zapata's, mentioning that the decor is tasteful, the Garden Burrito was delicious, and the red sauce served with it was smoky and yummy. The use of words like "delicious" and "yummy" reflects the customer's satisfaction with the food, while the positive description of the decor further contributes to the overall positive sentiment.

question: Very nice Mexican/Spanish food. I will drive 45 minutes into University to eat here. Service is always attentive. Patio and inside seating are nice. Very family friendly, although I don't have small children anymore. I am struck by the numbers of Latino patrons, and I think that attests to the quality of the food here. If you know the real deal, you don't patronize a crappy representation!\nI especially love the rice and beans, the cheeses (and the generous amount of cheeses!!!) and the beer. Did I mention the chicken dishes are all quite good. Have not tried the beef and fish entrees- yet.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer emphasizes the delicious Mexican/Spanish food, attentive service, pleasant seating options, family-friendly atmosphere, and the presence of Latino patrons which suggests authenticity and quality. The reviewer particularly loves specific menu items like rice and beans, cheeses, chicken dishes, and expresses interest in trying more options. Overall, the positive experiences and the reviewer's excitement about the food and atmosphere indicate a favorable opinion of the restaurant.

question:
I was pleasantly surprised by this place after going here for lunch.  For some reason I thought Zapatas was "upscale" mexican (with upscale pricing) but I was totally wrong.  I think this is due to the fact that the only other location I know of is in Ballantyne and things tend to be a bit elevated whenever you go to that end of town.

There's a decent lunch menu offered to go with the complementary chips and salsa - which was awesome.  I'm a huge cilantro fan and you can tell they make their salsa fresh (not out of the bottle).

I had a chicken taco salad and was surprised at how big the lunch portion was.  It was packed full of chicken and the sour cream and guacamole was off to the side so you can choose to make your salad "even healthier" if desired.

Service was great and quick.... definitely a great spot for lunch and I am assuming a good spot for dinner as well.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer was pleasantly surprised by their experience at the restaurant. They were initially mistaken about the upscale nature of the place, but found the prices reasonable and enjoyed the complimentary chips and salsa. The reviewer appreciated the fresh salsa, the generous portion size of their meal, and the option to customize their dish. They also praised the service as great and quick, overall deeming the restaurant a great spot for both lunch and dinner.

question: OK Mexican dishes. Not authentic but good and tasty. Quick fix if your in that neighborhood.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the review states that the Mexican dishes are not authentic, which may be disappointing to individuals seeking an authentic Mexican dining experience. Though the food is described as good and tasty, the lack of authenticity may lower the overall impression and value of the restaurant for some diners.

question:
Earlier tonight I had the pleasure of eating at a gem of a restaurant in the University Area of Charlotte, NC - Zapaata's Cantina Mexican Restaurant.  I have been eating at Zapata's since 2002, and like a fine wine, the place gets better with time. 

We arrived around 7pm on a rainy Thursday evening.  (If you've never been to Zapata's in University Area before, it can be kinda tricky to locate.  It is in the back left of the plaza.)  When my date and I walked in, we were greeted by a friendly gentleman host, who gave us the option of sitting upstairs or downstairs.  Since we've seen the place before, we chose to sit upstairs.  

No sooner were we seated, when warm tortilla chips, and two bowls of fresh pico were placed before us.  Tecate was on special, so I gladly order one, my date ordered a coke that didn't taste quite right. (YOU MIGHT WANT TO STAY AWAY FROM THE SODAS.)  Our drinks, including ice-cold water; were brought to us within minutes.  My drink came in a can, however it was accompanied with a frosted-mug and fresh lime.  

I order the fajitas-burrito, my date ordered the (grilled) shrimp tacos.  Both orders arrived promptly and smoking hot to our table.   On my plate was a giant burrito stuffed with chicken and steak (I always get the mix), beans, cheese, peppers, and onions, etc.  The outside of the massive burrito was smothered in melted cheeses including guacamole and sour-cream which were splattered across the top.  The shrimp-tacos looked just as appealing.  Both entree's were brought to our tables on extremely hot plates. and were surrounded by warm refried-beans and yellow rice - cooked to perfection.  

We both loved our meals.  We both had plenty to put in a box and take home for a late-night snack or lunch tomorrow.  

There is much debate amongst life-long UCBers about which is the best Mexican restaurant in the University Area; with the contestants being Monterrey, Los Arcos, or Zapata's.  My nod goes to Zapata's by a smidgen over Monterrey!


Our Bill: 1 coke, 1 Tecate, 2 waters, 1 fajitas-burrito, 1 shrimp-taco = $30.00

Service:  The service is simply amazing.  I've probably been to Zapata's over 20 times, and even though I've have had a few not so tasty meals, the SERVICE has always been top-notch. 

BEWARE OF:  **If you get the shrimp tacos, I recommend them grilled.  **Watch for the pulled-chicken.  It's not so tasty compared to the chicken-breast or steak.  **$2.25 Tecate cans on Thursday nights.  **You can get a steak/chicken mix with the burritos
rationale: The sentiment of the review is positive because the reviewer had a pleasant experience at the restaurant. They described the food as delicious, the service as amazing, and highlighted the generous portions that allowed them to take some leftovers home. Despite minor issues like the soda not tasting quite right, the reviewer still enjoyed their meal and appreciated the overall dining experience. Additionally, the reviewer expressed loyalty to Zapata's and gave them a nod as the best Mexican restaurant in the University Area, which further indicates a positive sentiment.

question: Not the best mexican restaurant. The food was very bland and a little bit over priced for what it really was. I ordered pollo fundido which is pretty good, but they served it with slices of american cheese on top, which is not how pollo fundido is supposed to be served. I would not recommend this mexican restaurant if you are looking for authentic mexican food.
rationale: The sentiment is Negative because the user expressed dissatisfaction with the food quality, mentioning that it was bland and overpriced. The incorrect preparation of a dish, specifically serving pollo fundido with slices of American cheese instead of following the authentic recipe, further added to the user's disappointment. Additionally, the user specifically stated that they would not recommend the restaurant for those seeking authentic Mexican cuisine.

question: Terrible, none of the owners or the cooks have been near Mexico or real Mexican food. avoid if you can.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the review indicates that the restaurant lacks authenticity in terms of Mexican cuisine, with neither the owners nor the cooks having any real connection to Mexico or knowledge of genuine Mexican food. This suggests a lack of credibility and expertise in preparing authentic dishes, which would likely result in a disappointing dining experience for customers seeking genuine Mexican cuisine.

question:
Terrible.  The food is bland and boring.

The service was fast and friendly, but that doesn't make up for the complete disaster of a meal that we were served.

I really can't overemphasize how bland everything was.   Don't go here if you require food that has some kind of flavor.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer expressed dissatisfaction with the food, describing it as bland and boring multiple times. Despite mentioning fast and friendly service, the overall experience was overshadowed by the lack of flavor in the meal, leading the reviewer to advise against dining at this establishment for those seeking tasteful food.

question:
Fist I will say the staff is friendly and the patio has a great view. They have pretty good drink specials. Really the only reason I would ever come here again is to drink on their patio.

The food is quite bland. I mean, the "salsa" is like runny marinara with some onions in it. I ordered the veggie burrito with no cheese. The thing was loaded with rice and lettuce, save for a few carrots, peas, and corn here and there. There was no seasoning, or none noticeable. It's wasn't all bad though, at least the ingredients were fresh and not over/under cooked.

As stated, this would be a good place to have a drink on the patio, not so much for lunch, and definitely not for impressing others.
rationale: The review expresses dissatisfaction with the food quality and taste, describing the salsa as bland and comparing it to runny marinara. The veggie burrito ordered was criticized for being mostly filled with rice and lettuce, lacking seasoning, and having minimal vegetables. While the reviewer appreciates the friendly staff and great view from the patio, they ultimately do not recommend the place for dining, indicating a negative sentiment overall due to the disappointing food experience.

question: I've eaten here for years.  I used to like it alot.  But over the past year or two, it's been downright mediocure.  Today it bordered on gross.  I ordered a beef quesidilla and thought I was getting steak.  I got some geasy ground beef I asume they use for tacos.  It bore no resemblance to a quesadilla.  It was just a taco with stuff on top. I  would have done better at Monterrey's, or even Taco Hell.
rationale: The sentiment in the review is negative because the customer states that the quality of the food has declined over the years and describes their most recent experience as bordering on "gross." They were disappointed with the misleading description of the menu item and felt that the dish did not live up to their expectations, comparing it unfavorably to other restaurants. Overall, the review expresses dissatisfaction with the food and the restaurant, leading to a negative sentiment.

question: This place has authentic Mexican cuisine. I came here with my sister who has been talking about the wonderful food here.We tried the vegetarian fajitas and Mexican stir fry. Both were delicious. Their tortila chips were served hot and the salsa was a little different but okay. The servers were courteous and the service was pretty quick. I will visit this place again!
rationale: The review expresses overall satisfaction with the dining experience at the Mexican cuisine restaurant. The customer had a positive experience with the food, describing it as delicious. They appreciated the hot tortilla chips and found the salsa to be acceptable. Additionally, the courteous servers and quick service added to their positive impression. The customer also mentioned their intention to return, indicating a high likelihood of recommending the restaurant to others.

question: Terrible food, service always rushed.  I've waited longer at Taco Bell, and had better tacos.  The food is greasy and tasteless.  \nZapata's has a few small positives.  Their outside patio looking over the man-made pond is nice.  Their margaritas are good, chips and salsa decent.  When I'm just meeting a friend for drinks, not a meal, this place is fine.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer expresses dissatisfaction with the food quality and service at Zapata's. They mention that the food is greasy and tasteless, comparing it unfavorably to Taco Bell. Although they acknowledge some positives like the outdoor patio and margaritas, overall, the negative experiences with the food and rushed service outweigh these few positives.

question:
I should've just gone to Taco Bell or Monterrey. After hearing rave reviews from Mexican, Puerto Rican, and Dominican friends, I finally got the opportunity to eat here last night. 

I arrived around 9:30pm and was sat instantly. we were the only party in the upstairs part. My friend, who is Mexican, chose to get the rice water (forgot the original name) and it was delicious! Chips and Salsa was plentiful, I didn't care for the salsa at all. Tasted bland and watered down to me. The chips were obviously out the bag, which I don't mind but some salt or some seasoning was needed. 

I ordered the Street Tacos and my friend got the Shrimp Fajitas. He loved his fajitas! Now, my Street Tacos on the other hand is a completely different story. The tortillas/soft taco shells were greasy and cold. I couldn't even eat them. The items inside the taco weren't that great either. Huge strips of chicken that tasted bland, barely there pico de gallo, and a sprinkle of cheese. There was lettuce and guac on the side. I also asked for sour cream on the side to try to make it taste good. It also came with rice and beans. The beans were beans, nothing special. The rice was the best part of the meal... but it was room temperature which I didn't like much.

Service is the reason why I will never give the food another chance. Our server was Ingrid. She was pretty great at first. When a Spanish speaking couple came to sit upstairs, she began talking to them so me and my friend had to wait about 10 minutes for the check once we were done eating. Then, she assumed the checks were together and seemed to have a shocked look on her face when I asked to get them split. We had to wait about another 10 minutes for her to finish talking to her manager/co-worker. The thing that that really put the icing on the cake was seeing a charge for sour cream. I wouldn't have minded if I knew when ordering sour cream with my tacos that there would be an extra charge, but to me that is just Serving 101 to tell a customer that all add ons were extra. Paying $1.25 to attempt to make the tacos taste a little bit better was ridiculous. When asked about it she told me, "All add ons have a charge to the ticket". No attempt to atleast say, "I'm sorry, but sour cream has a charge." I just don't like being surprised when the ticket comes. There was a man, maybe the expo manager or kitchen manager that refilled our chips, salsa, and drinks. I'm not the greatest tipper, but I always tip 25-50% on inexpensive meals so I felt obligated to leave a note telling her that I would've tipped if I knew about the charge and if I could've got the ticket faster instead of watching her chit chat literally right in front of me while waiting for my ticket One of the first times in a while that I didn't tip. I'm in the service industry and I know that if I ever treated a customer like that, I would've gotten wrote up and had to have comped their meal out of my pocket. 

Super long story short: Sub-par food, worse service.
rationale: The sentiment of this review is negative because the reviewer had a disappointing experience at the restaurant. The food quality was sub-par with greasy and cold tacos, bland flavors, and room temperature rice. Additionally, the service provided by their server, Ingrid, was unsatisfactory. The reviewer had to wait for a long time to get the check, encountered issues with splitting the bill, and was surprised by an extra charge for sour cream without prior notification. These factors contributed to an overall negative dining experience for the reviewer.

question: Had an amazing take out meal from here. The Hawaiian tacos were fantastic! Everything my party tried was great, very fresh and flavorful, and abundant portions. Excellent guacamole!
rationale: The review expresses overall satisfaction with the takeout meal, mentioning that the Hawaiian tacos were fantastic, the dishes were fresh and flavorful, and the portions were abundant. Additionally, the mention of excellent guacamole adds to the positive sentiment. Overall, the reviewer's positive feedback on the food quality, taste, portion size, and specific dish highlights a positive dining experience.

question: The manager was rude! He wouldn't honor his own coupon because he said the printing company messed up! Then he said I couldn't get the Thursday drink special because I didn't have two people in my party! I told him it was unacceptable and he said well leave then if you don't like it! Upon my exit he resorted to name calling! Unfortunately he lost our business forever! Take our advise go to Los Arcos! We did and loved it!
rationale: The customer's review indicates a negative experience due to the manager's rudeness, refusal to honor a coupon, and imposition of an unfair restriction on the drink special. The manager's response of telling the customer to leave and resorting to name-calling upon their exit further adds to the negative sentiment. The customer felt disrespected and mistreated, leading them to decide to take their business elsewhere. Overall, the review highlights a lack of professionalism and customer service, resulting in a negative sentiment.

question: The food was pretty good, But service was pretty bad. There were two waiters and about 4 tables but we had to wait almost half an hour to get a to go box and the check for some reason .
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the review highlights a significant issue with the service, specifically mentioning a long wait time despite the restaurant not being busy. The contrast between the positive aspect of the food and the negative aspect of the service further emphasizes the disappointment experienced by the customer.

question:
Some friends and I were staying at the Hilton Charlotte University Place just on the other side of the lake and walked over to Zapata's for dinner on a Saturday night, around 8 PM. The restaurant was busy, but there was an empty table right inside the back door. I walked over to the station at the base of the stairs and asked if we needed to wait or if we could just sit at the empty table and was told to go ahead and take a seat.

Fast forward a couple of minutes and an employee approaches the table to ask us why we're sitting there. I explained that I was told it was okay, and after a short conversation with the person who told me we could sit there, the employee went about his business. We were given chips and salsa (chips were slightly stale and had no salt on them at all; salsa was AMAZING but served in horribly inconvenient bowls that caused a mess every time you dipped into them) and ordered beers and waters. The beers arrived quickly, but we had to ask not one but TWO more times before we finally got our water.

Food-wise, I ordered the Enchiladas Suizas, which were extremely bland. My friend enjoyed his Pollo Borracho, mostly because of the sauce, but overall the food wasn't impressive. Getting our waitress to come back to our table to refill anything (salsa, chips, drinks) or to bring us our check was next to impossible. Honestly the only reason I'm giving Zapata's two stars instead of just one is because I know they were busy (and obviously that affects the quality of service) and because my friend enjoyed his meal, though I didn't like mine. That said, if I was to end up back in this area, I doubt I'd return to this restaurant.
rationale: The sentiment in the review is negative because the customer had multiple negative experiences during their visit to Zapata's. They were initially given conflicting information about seating, had to ask multiple times for water, found the food to be bland, and had difficulty getting service from their waitress. Additionally, the presentation of the chips and salsa was messy and inconvenient. The overall lack of attentive service and underwhelming food quality contributed to the overall negative impression of the dining experience.

question: Legitimately the worst Mexican food I've had in Charlotte. Possibly the worst Mexican food I've ever had. Tacos were cold, soggy and tasted microwaved. I think they might have given me an order that was sent back and was being held. The rice was pretty decent. I took my food to work because I didn't want to waste it, gave it to some friends and it was promptly thrown away.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer had a poor dining experience with the Mexican food in Charlotte. The reviewer states that the tacos were cold, soggy, and tasted microwaved, implying low quality and lack of freshness. Additionally, the reviewer suspects that they were given a previously rejected order, further suggesting a disregard for food quality and customer satisfaction. The only positive note was about the rice, but overall the experience was disappointing and resulted in the food being wasted by the reviewer's friends.

question:
Seriously?  Are these smoothies made with some prized Tibetan yak enzyme or something?  What on earth justifies a smoothie costing 8.99???

Even the smoothies that had nothing "special" about them except a little protein powder were 6.99 or so for a medium.

It's frozen fruit, people!  I'm from California, and was hoping to find a place to stop periodically, but at these prices, I just felt ripped off.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer expresses frustration and disappointment over the high prices of the smoothies. They feel that the smoothies are overpriced, especially considering that they contain common ingredients like frozen fruit and protein powder. The reviewer also feels ripped off, indicating a sense of dissatisfaction with the value they received for the price paid.

question: Being from Louisiana, I'm a huge Smoothie King fan.  Lately they've changed all of their recipes and no longer use any real fruit.  Their general smoothie recipe is now 90% ice and 10% fruit juice.  GIANT waste of money as it probably costs them about 50 cents to make a large.  You can do better.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the customer expresses disappointment in the changes Smoothie King has made to their recipes, particularly the lack of real fruit in their smoothies. They feel they are not getting value for their money, as the new recipe is predominantly ice and fruit juice, making it seem overpriced for what they are actually getting. The customer also believes that they can find better quality smoothies elsewhere.

question: The other Maggie Moo's locations have closed, but somehow this one hangs on.  I made the mistake of taking some friends in there the other night, though, and it was kinda gross.  The ice cream itself was OK, nothing to write home about but it did the job.  But, if you're an ice cream place that does mix-ins, your marshmallows should not be so stale they're positively chewy.  We sat and ate ice cream in the shop before going our separate ways home, and the place had a definite industrial cleanser stench that was hard to ignore.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is Negative because the customer had a disappointing experience at the Maggie Moo's location. They mentioned that the ice cream was average and the mix-ins, specifically the marshmallows, were stale and unpleasant to eat. Additionally, the mention of an industrial cleanser stench in the shop adds to the overall negative impression of the visit. These factors contributed to the reviewer feeling that their experience was not enjoyable, resulting in a negative sentiment overall.

question: Place is dirty.  Both bathrooms were out of order.  Young lady was very nice.  Will not go back.  Placed smelled like industrial cleaner.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the user experienced multiple issues during their visit - a dirty environment, both bathrooms being out of order, and an unpleasant smell of industrial cleaner. These negative aspects outweigh the positive interaction with the young lady, leading the user to conclude that they will not return to the place.

question:
Do not waste your money!

We purchased a Groupon for this ice cream, thankfully!!!  It was just terrible.  We had never been before, but love Cold Stone so we thought we'd try it since we were in the area.  The ice cream looked old, and after trying it, tasted like nothing.  :(

It is also very expensive (4.99 for a small).  Above all, it was incredibly dirty in there!  Both restrooms and the drinking fountain were out of order.  

We will not be back.  Not even worth a Groupon!!!  :(
rationale: The sentiment of this review is Negative because the reviewer had a poor experience with the ice cream quality, mentioning that it looked old, tasted like nothing, and was expensive. Additionally, they found the establishment to be dirty with out-of-order facilities, which further contributed to their disappointment. The reviewer concludes by stating they will not return, emphasizing their dissatisfaction with both the product and the overall experience.

question: Glass door shattered and sign says \"be gentle opening/closing door\", both bathrooms out of order and a hand written sign saying only 2 samples per customer. Ice cream is just ok IMO and overpriced for the quality.
rationale: The review highlights several negative aspects, including a shattered glass door, out-of-order bathrooms, limitations on samples, mediocre ice cream quality, and high prices. These conditions and experiences would likely leave a customer feeling disappointed, frustrated, or dissatisfied, contributing to an overall negative sentiment towards the establishment.

question:
This location is on the Southeast corner of Park Road and Woodlawn next to the Starbucks.  There are three Bombay Cuisine's in town now, even though it doesn't currently say so on their website.

You can order an entree but why do that in these hard economic times when they have an amazing buffet that includes a soda fountain drink!  There are four sections to the buffet which by far is the greatest value.  The chicken is nicely cut and the ground lamb and pea curry is rich and flavorful.  The Tandoori chicken which is bright red, isn't spicy at all but the curries all have varying degrees of hotness.  

If you've never had Indian food before, this is probably the best place in Charlotte to try it.  You can sample 8 or 10 curries and they also have a little salad and some dessert items.  I can't even pronounce half the items on the menu but they taste fantastic.

My only complaint is that sometimes the bread (naan) is fried, not baked, which makes for a much heavier meal.  When it's baked it's fantastic.  When it's fried it's just ok.  And sometimes the rice is a little undercooked (crunchy).  But overall a great, affordable addition to Charlotte restaurants.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer praises the buffet as an amazing value, highlighting the various delicious curry options and the opportunity to sample different dishes. The reviewer also recommends the restaurant, especially for individuals new to Indian cuisine, indicating that the food tastes fantastic. Despite mentioning a couple of minor drawbacks regarding the preparation of the bread and rice, the overall review emphasizes the affordability and quality of the dining experience, earning it a positive sentiment.

question: I prefer to go at lunch since it is a buffet and I can have a little of everything (plus fresh fruit for dessert). I went once for dinner but it was more expensive and took a long time. Good Indian food and a great value for lunch.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the review highlights the convenience and variety offered during lunch at the restaurant. The reviewer enjoys the buffet option that allows them to try a little of everything, including fresh fruit for dessert. Despite a less satisfactory experience at dinner due to higher prices and longer wait times, the reviewer still emphasizes the good quality of the Indian food and considers it a great value for lunch.

question: Restaurant is closed.
rationale: The sentiment is Negative because the restaurant being closed may have caused inconvenience or disappointment to customers who were planning to dine there. This unexpected closure may have also disrupted their plans, leading to frustration or dissatisfaction.

question: This is where i call home... The honeycomb hideout!!! My temple, my crib.. Very peachy spot lol.. Until the kids decide they wanna play tennis and football at 11pm, therefore the tennis court lights shine into my bedroom lol.. But its cool, im all about physical activity...
rationale: The sentiment is positive because despite the inconvenience of bright lights shining into the bedroom late at night, the person remains lighthearted and upbeat about the situation. They appreciate the physical activity and youthfulness associated with having kids playing tennis and football, showing a positive attitude towards their living environment.

question: The location itself is a little hard to get to (why is Charlotte so full of medians?).  The staff is generally pretty inattentive.  Often, I have to go in and stand around for a while before anyone offers to get my order.  Several times, I have asked for my order \"for here\" and received it \"to go.\"  They also run out of sweet tea a lot.\n\nPros:  At the end of the day, the food is tasty.  And for some reason, this location is cheaper than the 10525 Mallard Creek Rd one.  (The combo I usually get is 25 cents less here.)
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the review highlights several issues with the location, such as difficulty in accessing it due to medians, inattentive staff, mistakes in order fulfillment, frequent lack of sweet tea, and inconsistencies in pricing compared to another location. These negative experiences outweigh the positive aspects mentioned, such as tasty food and slightly lower prices on certain items, resulting in an overall negative impression of the establishment.

question: My first Jack in the Box East Coast sighting!  I was thrilled to go and get my oh so favorite breakfast bowl.  That was until I arrived and the menu was completely different than what I had remembered from the California Jack in the Boxes.  If the food was more consistent with the west coast this place would be a 4 star easily.  It is very clean, the staff was very friendly and the food although not being what I wanted or remembered was somewhat tasty.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is negative because the customer was disappointed by the differences in the menu at the East Coast Jack in the Box compared to the ones on the West Coast. Despite the cleanliness of the establishment and the friendly staff, the customer was dissatisfied with the lack of consistency in the food offerings and taste that they had come to expect from the chain.

question: I haven't even tried my food yet, Mrs Preacher is so nice and sweet the food could be terrible (not likely) and I'd still go back just to order a shake and see her smile. Brightened my day.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer expresses admiration for Mrs. Preacher's kind and friendly demeanor, stating that she has brightened their day. Despite not having tried the food yet, the reviewer's positive experience with the service is likely to influence their overall impression of the establishment. The reviewer's willingness to return just to order a shake and see Mrs. Preacher's smile indicates a positive emotional connection and highlights a strong likelihood of repeat business.

question: I really tried to like this place. A couple months ago I tried Jack in a Box for the first time because they sent me a free birthday dessert. After that, we kept receiving emails from them on their specials and we decided to try some of their deals. We tried the late night munchies deal and that was a disaster. The burgers had no flavor and they were poorly put together, the tacos are as flat as a sheet and the shells taste stale. The only thing I liked from the box was the French fries. We thought that the poor quality of the food was just because it was a late night special so we gave jack in a box another chance. A couple days later we tried one of their barbecue signature burgers, it was also disappointing. It tasted like someone took a cold patty and dipped it in BBQ sauce before they served it in a bun. I try to stay away from jack in a box because I have not been pleased with the quality.
rationale: The sentiment is Negative because the reviewer had multiple negative experiences with the food at Jack in the Box. They mentioned that the burgers had no flavor, were poorly put together, and the tacos were flat and tasted stale. Additionally, the BBQ signature burger was disappointing and tasted like a cold patty dipped in BBQ sauce. The reviewer expressed their dissatisfaction with the quality of the food from Jack in the Box and mentioned that they try to stay away from the restaurant as a result.

question: Being from Arizona and working in Southern California I grew up eating Jack in the Box.  Too bad Virginia doesn't have them!  Anyway, I already knew some cities in North Carolina have my favorite fast food restaurant!  So, I purposely planned my road trip route just to get my Jack in the Box fix!  Ordered a couple of Meat Lovers breakfast burrito's (with no egg, of course) and a good ol' Jumbo Jack with cheese.  Customer service was great and so was the food!  More details coming soon!
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer expresses excitement and anticipation about visiting a Jack in the Box location during their road trip, specifically mentioning their favorite menu items. They also praise the customer service and overall enjoy their dining experience. This positive feedback indicates satisfaction and a sense of enjoyment associated with their visit to Jack in the Box.

question: Worst Italian food I have ever eaten. Think Chef Boyardee at ten times the price.
rationale: The sentiment is Negative because the review describes the Italian food as the worst the reviewer has ever eaten. Additionally, comparing it to Chef Boyardee, which is often perceived as low-quality and mass-produced, at a much higher price suggests a significant mismatch in quality and value, further reinforcing the negative sentiment towards the dining experience.

question: Good food, good service, reliable and dependable.  I take clients there when visiting town on business, and have never been disappointed.
rationale: The review highlights several positive aspects of the restaurant experience, including good food, good service, and reliability. The fact that the reviewer takes clients there for business visits further indicates their satisfaction with the overall experience. The use of words like "reliable" and "dependable" also suggests a consistent positive experience, making the sentiment of the review clearly positive.

question:
I can't speak to the food, because for the first time in years, I walked out. 

After 20 minutes, I hadn't had so much as a drink order taken. I was willing to be patient, though, until two other tables were seated, and had multiple waiters take drink orders and bring bread. That was the final straw. 

My companion and I were casually dressed in jeans and plain t-shirts, with sneakers, but certainly not slovenly, dirty, or otherwise worthy of such complete and utter lack of response. 

The first thing that was addressed to us was as we rose to leave - and that was one of the servers helping one of the tables seated after us, to assure me that "someone will be here to help you shortly." No, thanks.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is negative because the customer had a very poor experience at the restaurant. Despite waiting for 20 minutes without even having their drink order taken, they saw other tables being attended to promptly. The lack of response and attention from the staff, particularly towards a casually dressed, well-behaved customer, resulted in the customer feeling ignored and ultimately deciding to leave without even trying the food. This kind of experience can be frustrating and disappointing for any diner, leading to a negative sentiment towards the restaurant.

question:
Solid place!  Great lunch prices too.  

I had the lunch special here recently which was a Tilapia Puttanesca and it was dinner portion for a lunch price!  A great deal.  And it tasted great.  At first when I ordered it, I immediately regretted it due to my recent reading of Anthony Bourdain's Kitchen Confidential (eating seafood on a Monday or Tuesday after a weekend is probably not a good idea)... but it tasted great to me and I was very happy about my choice.

Our server was very prompt and took care of our refills.  Even adding a little color and warmth to our lunch experience.  Almost as if he was a long lost distant italian uncle you've always wanted.  My friend and I cleaned our plates and he came over with a sad expression and said, "you guys didn't like it! [insert italian accent here]"  We had a good laugh.  He was very good about offering us fresh ground pepper for our salads along with the freshly grated cheese over your dish.

When you first walk in, Ciro's has a quality about it that almost makes it formal, but it seemed okay for a casual lunch.  I've had dinner here before and don't exactly remember feeling under-dressed... but that was a while back.

WARNING:  I enjoyed their bread WAY too much.  Especially when they drop a bottle of olive oil (looks like rosemary and garlic infused) and bottle of balsamic on the table for you to make your own dipping oil.  Be warned.... liquid crack soaked up in warm bread!
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer highlights several aspects of their experience at the restaurant that contributed to their satisfaction. They mention the great lunch prices, receiving a dinner portion for a lunch price, enjoying the food despite initial concerns, the attentive and entertaining server, the pleasant ambiance, and the delicious bread with olive oil and balsamic vinegar. Overall, the reviewer expresses happiness with their experience and emphasizes positive aspects of the restaurant.

question:
again, came here as it was within walking distance of our hotel. the restaurant wasn't very full, but service was super slow for our party of 7. i was really excited for the bread after reading the reviews, and i am the type that can kill a whole basket. i could barely eat one. it was dry and tasteless. 

then our side salads took forever and a day to come out. we also asked for extra ice and such, but our waitress never remembered. sigh. the salads finally came and it was a normal salad but good as i hadn't eaten much veggies during my stay. i had ordered the special of the day, pesto chicken (but i substituted for shrimp) florentino. when i was given my dish, it was a alfredo sauce. i pointed out to the server that i had ordered pesto, and she replies, yeah i thought that didnt look right. wow sherlock, since pesto is green! she took it back, and it came out a minute later. i think they just threw some pesto in and mixed it up as it came back way too fast. but regardless, i preferred that than having to eat 10 minutes after all my coworkers dug in. my dish was okay, heavier than i had expected (but maybe i wasnt expecting alfredo with some pesto), but the shrimp were huge and tasty. not as much food as i had thought it would be, which was good. i tried a little of the margherita pizza, and it was not good. it was sooooo soggy on the bottom. yuck. but their pizza portions are huge! tried my coworkers penne vodka, and that was tasty!

again, probably wouldnt come back, but if i did, id probably only order the penne with vodka sauce. to go.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer experienced slow service, disappointing food quality including dry and tasteless bread, incorrect dish served initially, lack of attention to requests, and overall dissatisfaction with the dining experience. These factors contributed to the reviewer's decision not to return to the restaurant in the future, with only one dish receiving praise while the rest of the items fell short of expectations.

question:
A great italian dining experience.

I like this place because it's upscale casual.
The menu is diverse and the food is excellent.

I had the grilled salmon with shrimp with linguini...goodness.
The service was great.

The romancing accordian player was a bit loud and annoying at times.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the review highlights the positive aspects of the dining experience, such as the diverse menu, excellent food, great service, and upscale casual atmosphere. The only negative mentioned is the loud accordion player, but it is not enough to outweigh the overall positive experience described in the review.

question: Had the worst Italian food ever.......
rationale: The statement "Had the worst Italian food ever" indicates a negative sentiment because it suggests that the person did not have a good experience with the Italian food they tried. The use of the word "worst" emphasizes the extreme negativity of their experience, leading to an overall negative sentiment.

question: Working in the University area, we bring clients to Ciros all the time.  I have been there at least ten times and I can honestly say I have never had a bad meal.  And I am usually with a large group of 5 or more people.  No one in my group has ever had a bad meal.  Everyone always raves about how delicious everything is.  There is bread served with oil/balsamic which is delicious.  The older man who places the accordion is very friendly and entertaining (although at times he plays too loud...he means well!) Overall, one of my favoriate restaurants in the area.  I am very surprised at some of the negative views, as I am a very picky food person! :)  I can always tell when food isn't fresh, or prepared too far ahead of time, etc.  Never noticed this at Ciro's.  YUM!
rationale: The review expresses overall satisfaction with Ciros restaurant, highlighting aspects such as consistently good meals, delicious food, enjoyable ambiance with live entertainment, and attentive service. The reviewer's positive experiences over multiple visits, including with a large group, indicate a high level of satisfaction with the restaurant's food quality and service. Additionally, the reviewer appreciates the attention to detail in terms of fresh ingredients and timely preparation, which align with their discerning palate. The positive tone and emphasis on favorite restaurant status further support the sentiment that the reviewer has a favorable view of Ciros.

question: Overpriced and underwhelmed. The excellent waiter could not make up for for overcooked broccoli and sausage over mediocre quality pasta. Pity as I like to support the local businesses.
rationale: The sentiment is Negative because the customer found the experience at the restaurant to be disappointing due to overpriced, underwhelming food that was poorly prepared. Despite having a good waiter, the quality of the dish was subpar, and the customer did not feel their dining experience met their expectations. Their disappointment was reflected in the review by highlighting the overcooked broccoli, mediocre pasta quality, and the sentiment of pity for wanting to support local businesses but feeling let down by their experience.
