You walk into Nakato and are greeted immediately. We made a reservation so we checked in and got a buzzer. Only strange thing was the 2 story lounge/bar area and the TV's in odd locations. No worries, just grabbed a spot on a couch while we waited. Only 2-3 minutes. Upon being sat, our waitress came by right away and she was very nice. I can tell they take their service commitment to heart. The menu is extensive with hibachi offerings. They also have sushi, so if you want that make sure to ask for that menu too. 

Went with the "Nakato Delight" which came with shrimp, chicken & NY steak for $23.95. Most of the entrees (combo) are around $20. For extra items or premium like filet or lobster expect and extra $5 or so. Also went with the fried rice which was $1.75...kind of annoying, but no big deal, as I like egg in my rice. Came with onion soup, salad w/ginger, shrimp app (small), noodles & veggies (surprised variety!), rice and of course the meat. I was doing fine on my "timing" until the the noodles & veggies came. Soup and salad...gone, no problem. Then a FULL plate of noodles/veggies...as I'm eating, I see the rice start an say oh "SH&T" and start to eat faster while my wife watches and is content letting her plate rise with goodness and not concerned about "timing". Little did I see/know as I finished shoveling the noodles/veggies that the rice had their own separate bowl and did not need a place on my plate...ha...oh well, there was room if needed now! 

Overall a great experience and for $20-$25/person average, so much food...can you say leftovers! As we got up to left I said to the table "nice shoveling with all of you". Not far from the truth...ha! So good!
rationale: The review expresses overall satisfaction with the dining experience at Nakato. The reviewer commends the prompt service, friendly staff, extensive menu options, and generous portions of food. The reviewer also finds humor in their own dining mishaps, adding a light-hearted tone to the review. The mention of enjoying the meal and appreciating the value for the price indicates a positive sentiment overall.

question: It's sushi, or hibachi whichever one you want to choose. I enjoy this restaurant. The sushi is fresh and the servers are friendly. When I have went it was never too busy. Even though some of the food is a little pricey, it is worth the money. \n\nThis restaurant is definitely a place to go for special dinners and occasions. The restaurant is very clean and spacious. Well worth the money and experience to try out sushi and hibachi.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the review highlights several aspects of the restaurant that the reviewer enjoyed, such as fresh sushi, friendly servers, cleanliness, and spaciousness. The reviewer also mentions that the restaurant is worth the money despite the slightly higher prices, indicating overall satisfaction with the dining experience. Additionally, the mention of it being a great place for special dinners and occasions suggests that the reviewer views the restaurant as a good option for memorable and enjoyable dining experiences.

question: I love Nakato!  They always have the freshest sushi, and I love the variety of special rolls.   I have never had a bad experience here.  The staff are fantastic as well.  This is the place to go if you're in the University area!
rationale: The review expresses overall satisfaction with Nakato, highlighting positive aspects such as fresh sushi, variety of special rolls, excellent service, and consistently good experiences. The reviewer mentions that they have never had a bad experience at the restaurant, indicating a high level of customer satisfaction. The positive tone and emphasis on the quality of food, service, and overall experience suggest that the sentiment is positive.

question:
I live in the San Francisco Bay Area, but my company has an office in the University area of Charlotte, and I often have to take colleagues to dinner.  Nine times out of ten, I'll pick this place because 1) it's fun, 2) it's reasonably priced,  3) it's delicious and 4) it's fun.

I love sushi, but I don't usually get it here because I'm all about the hibachi table.  Your party is seated at the table and the waitress and assistant take your drink and food orders (I always get the steak and shrimp combination), and soon afterwards you have a salad and soup in front of you.  A hibachi chef (admittedly of varying talents) arrives with a cart of food, and he confirms your orders.

Most of the hibachi chefs are pretty good.  They twirl the spatula a bit, serve the sauce, cut up some shrimp and set the table on fire (in an onion ring chimney).  Pretty fun.  The good chefs can do some pretty cool things with eggs and shrimp tails.  You wonder how they keep their fingers considering how quickly they throw their knives around, but last time I checked, they all had 10 fingers.

Then they start cooking the food en masse, and I'm always impressed with how quickly they serve an entire table of 14 within 20 minutes.  Next thing you know, the chef scrapes the table, cleans it, and bids you good night.

The food is usually excellent, they have perfect seafood and ginger sauces to complement the natural flavors, and they keep your drinks/water glasses full.

Great food, great time, and a reasonable price.  Hence 5 stars.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer highlighted several positive aspects of their experience at the restaurant in Charlotte. They mentioned that the restaurant is fun, reasonably priced, and serves delicious food. The reviewer enjoyed the hibachi table experience, praising the hibachi chefs for their skills and entertainment factor. They also appreciated the quick and efficient service, as well as the quality of the food and sauces. Overall, the reviewer had a great time and highly recommended the restaurant, giving it a rating of 5 stars.

question: This place is great.  My wife and I went there for our anniversary and it was delicious.  We had a sushi roll (don't remember which one) but it was very good.  We also had the hibachi dinner...I had chicken and steak, my wife and steak and shrimp.  Everything was VERY good.  Also, it is nice how they cook the food in front of you.  It is like a show and dinner.  Overall a great experience.
rationale: The sentiment is Positive because the review describes the dining experience as great, delicious, and enjoyable. The reviewer highlights the quality of the sushi, hibachi dinner, and the entertainment aspect of having the food cooked in front of them. Overall, the reviewer had a positive experience celebrating their anniversary at the restaurant.

question:
Lets just say... This place knows how to cut costs! I know that the economy has been hard on everyone, but whoa. I commend this restaurant for taking actions to minimize the amount they spend. This nice restaurant I believe sunk $5 million dollars on the property. Now, I'm going to update my review from my 2011 review. And the outcome, as you can tell by the stars is ummm... not good.

Now, lets start off by the menu. I came with a party of 5 and we all got seated down at the hibachi grill. Menu is pretty standard as far as hibachi grill food items goes. I came to Nakato because from word, the owner owns a farm out in Colorado and farm raises all the animals and also their freezer blast freezes their seafood. This is an important fact because when you blast freeze seafood, it's usually 50 or more below 0 degrees Fahrenheit keeping the seafood fresh and bacteria free. So, this was definitely a reason to try this restaurant out.

So, lets get back to the menu. Looking at the items something pops out. Fried Rice..$1.75. So, fried rice doesn't come standard with the meal that costs $15+? Steam rice on the other hand is free (which I picked). I ordered the combination of Chicken and NY strip. My party all got the fried rice when it was asked because they were under the assumption that it came with the meal, and I'll break down to you what that fried rice consisted of.

Fried rice: Eggs, Sesame seed, and Soy Sauce. That's it. No green onions, carrots, and all that other good stuff. On top of the lack of extras with the fried rice it had no taste. Bland.

Meats that I ordered weren't bad on the other hand, but the portions were a little too small in my opinion. Their noodles that also came with the meal wasn't filling, and just left me a feeling of not full but at the same time not hungry. And mind, I ate two of my party's portion on noodles.

We also had some tempura. The tempura, I had no taste for it. I've definitely had better. The batter had no taste, as well as the sauce. The veggies that was served in the batter surprised my mother, which found out it was just a whole half of an onion dipped and fried in the tempura. She also wanted to tell me that what made it worse was that the onion had no flavor, the batter, and on top of all that the sauce!

Finally lets get on with the end when we pay our bills.
Sitting with us at our grill was another party of 5, 3 kids and 2 adults. One of the child's birthday happened to be that day. So, you usually get a dessert, or a cupcake, or some ice cream right? Not here! This lucky girl got a nice candle, in a sauce dish. Well, they did sing the birthday song to her.

But wait! That's not it! The table sitting directly across from us also had a birthday. So, they take the candle the little girl just blew out and lights it again to give it to the other birthday person. Mind, these meals cost I believe $15+. Easily.

Way to cheap out your customers there, Nakato. Charge extra for fried rice that's bland, and some pretty expensive dishes, with no complimentary birthday dessert. Now, that's how you run a business: Cutting costs, and try to recuperate losses.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is negative because the customer had high expectations based on the restaurant's reputation and investment in the property, but was disappointed by the quality and value of the food and overall experience. The review highlights various issues such as bland fried rice, small portions of meat, tasteless tempura, and the lack of complimentary birthday desserts for customers celebrating birthdays. The customer felt that the restaurant was cutting costs at the expense of customer satisfaction, which ultimately resulted in a negative experience and a poor review rating.

question: Come here once a month (just for Sushi) - always delicious, always consistent.  Come with a group and we are located in various places around the US so we are comparing it to what we like in our respective cities.  All agree that this matches up to our local favorites and is definitely the best place for Sushi in this part of town.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the review praises the restaurant for consistently delicious sushi, indicating a high level of satisfaction. Additionally, the fact that the reviewer compares it favorably to their local favorite sushi spots in various cities further emphasizes the quality and appeal of the restaurant. The statement that it is the best place for sushi in the area reinforces the positive sentiment as it suggests that the restaurant exceeds expectations and stands out among competitors.

question:
It's fun and Yummy!

Had a blast with our group and our chef was impressive with his "art" and funny too...

Food was good, and surprising considering the chef was cooking it all there.

Fast! Fast service and delivery... It's not a place to string along a meal. You are served a lot o food and its one portion after another...

I'm coming back.
rationale: The review includes positive expressions such as "fun," "impressive chef," "good food," "fast service," and a statement of intent to return. The reviewer also mentions having had a blast with their group, indicating an enjoyable experience. Overall, the review highlights several aspects that the individual found satisfying, leading to a positive sentiment.

question: The early bird special is the way to go.. The wife ordered the veggie dinner as well.. Despite earlier post i read it was plenty!! Of food.. The waitress was top notch and the decor is one of the nicest ive observed.. Only reason its not a 5 star is our bill was still 40 for two of us with drinks, even with the early bird.. However, it was flavorful and better than your average hibachi place.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer highlights several strengths of the restaurant experience, such as the value of the early bird special, ample portions despite a previous concern, excellent service from the waitress, and appealing decor. They also mention that the food was flavorful and better than average for a hibachi place. Despite a slightly higher bill than expected, the overall tone of the review is positive and appreciative of the restaurant's offerings.

question: The place looks nice and the waitresses/chef are very nice. However, the salmon was not good. It fell apart and had bones in it. I first ordered salmon sashimi and then got salmon nigiri instead. I also got the Crunchy roll and it was soft...not crunchy. Overall, I was not impressed with the food but liked the people.
rationale: The sentiment is Negative because the reviewer experienced several disappointments with the food, including the poorly prepared salmon, bones in the dish, and inconsistency in the Crunchy roll texture. Despite positive comments about the staff, the overall dining experience was not satisfactory mainly due to the food quality issues mentioned.

question: I have to say overall I am not very exited about this place. The ambient is not so bad,  a lot of tables and the waitress was cute. ... About the Shusi... ;) Got Vulcano, Tuna and Superman roll. The Miso Soup was hot but the taste only average. You could get the Kirin beer only as draft when you don't want to drink the 12 oz bottle. I am not why draft beer has a frozen foam...\nThe rolls were as well nothing exiting average again someone said something about pricing and it is right 38$ is not ever age... Would I go again!? I might but will look for different places as well...
rationale: The sentiment in the review is negative because the customer expresses dissatisfaction with various aspects of their experience at the restaurant. They mentioned that they were not excited about the place overall, the miso soup had average taste, the sushi rolls were nothing special, and they found the pricing to be high. Additionally, the customer indicated they would look for different places to try instead of returning to this restaurant. These negative comments collectively contribute to an overall negative sentiment in the review.

question: I've been eating Sushi for 23 years and they serve the worst sushi I've ever had!!!!! The service was bad as well! The Sushi was served very fast because no one was ordering it!! I wish someone told me it would be the biggest waste of 120.00 I've ever spent!!! I'll never return!
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the customer expressed strong dissatisfaction with their experience. They mentioned that the sushi was the worst they've ever had in 23 years of eating sushi, indicating a major disappointment in the food quality. Additionally, they criticized the service as being bad and noted that the sushi was served quickly due to lack of demand, suggesting a lack of freshness. The customer regretted spending $120 on this experience and vowed to never return, emphasizing their overall negative impression of the restaurant.

question: This place used to be good. Keyword used to be!  The fried rice was over done by garlic and if you love garlic you would understand why I didn't like it cause I love garlic. It was absolutely too much. Nothing else complimented it. Short ribs were horrible we didn't eat it and still was charged for it even though we told our server it wasn't good. Service was fine... But I think their hibachi isn't worth the money. The chefs can hardly entertain!!!  Anyways. Good luck on you're trip.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer had multiple negative experiences at the restaurant, including the over-seasoned fried rice, horrible short ribs, lackluster hibachi performance, and being charged for a dish they did not enjoy. Despite decent service, the overall dining experience was disappointing and did not meet the reviewer's expectations.

question: I got take out. The sushi was edible but by the smell of it when I first took it out of the box, it was not as fresh as I would like. There is not much of a raw roll selection.\nI am used to more creativity in rolls and this place was lacking. I'm new to the area and this is the second place I've tried for sushi so far.\nIt's in 2nd place out of two. And it's pricey!
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the customer found the sushi to be lacking in freshness, creativity, and selection. Additionally, they were not satisfied with the price of their meal. These factors contributed to their overall disappointment with the dining experience, resulting in a negative review.

question:
We sort of liked parts of Nakato, but thought the overall picture didn't really add up.

The sushi was good, but was served very late in the meal, despite being ordered first thing. One of the pieces I received was totally different from what I ordered. When the waiter fessed up, I was still charged for it. That is the type of restaurant this is.

The show was not among the best I have seen, and the chef looked like he was not really interested in the performance. The food was VERY salty, with everything getting a healthy dose of soy sauce. The portions are quite large.  

The soup was watery, and did not have the obligatory fried onions, the salad was typical ginger dressing, but not sweet at all. 

Our meal was quite expensive, well over $100 for the 3 of us, not including tip.  

Ultimately, we feel this restaurant is yet another lame ripoff of Benihana, which is better, but no longer among the best of these restaurants either in my opinion.

We would not go again, having experienced far better. However in the current climate in Charlotte, this restaurant will probably be around forever.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer encountered multiple issues during their dining experience at Nakato. They received incorrect sushi orders and were still charged for the mistake. The quality of the show was subpar, and the chef seemed uninterested. The food was described as very salty with excessive soy sauce, watery soup, and a salad that lacked sweetness. Additionally, the high cost of the meal, over $100 for three people, did not justify the overall disappointing experience. The reviewer also compared Nakato unfavorably to another restaurant, Benihana, suggesting that Nakato falls short in comparison. These factors contribute to an overall negative sentiment towards Nakato.

question: Excellent food! We enjoyed that they are one of the hibachi places that actually uses the ginger sauce on the side to dip with. The early bird special they currently run at $13 for a chicken and steak combo is an amazing deal too. They also serve noodle as well as the normal fried rice.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the review praises the excellent food at the restaurant, highlighting the use of ginger sauce for dipping and the attractive early bird special deal for a chicken and steak combo. The reviewer also appreciates the variety of options available, mentioning the serving of noodles in addition to the traditional fried rice. Overall, the positive tone indicates a satisfied and happy dining experience.

question: I was super disappointed with my trip here.\nI got the filet and scallop lunch which ended up costing about $20+ dollars. The waitress didn't remember my friend wanted shrimp AND chicken... Also didn't remember my other friend wanted steak. Two of us said we didn't want noodles so she didn't give us noodles or veggies...my steak was cooked well done not med rare as I ordered. My scallops were extremely overcooked. I had to go to bathroom and spit it out it was so hard. Not worth the money. There are cheaper options that taste way better (ie Toyama)
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the customer was disappointed with their experience at the restaurant. The issues they mentioned, such as incorrect orders, overcooked food, and poor service, all contributed to their dissatisfaction. Additionally, the customer felt that the meal was not worth the high cost, especially compared to other restaurants that offer better tasting food at a lower price. These factors highlight their negative impression of the overall dining experience.

question:
Staff here is great... I think that makes it so much better for dining experiences.  I haven't run into any of the managers yet... 

I'm so used to the old sckool you get the food at the counter and bring it to your table, I'm still a little uncomfortable with them bringing it to us... they still manage to do it with a long line, which makes it that much nicer... but I could go either way.

This location is near my office so... I try to go for breakfast and a late lunch.... it gets super busy right around lunch time so I just avoid the rush.
rationale: The review expresses positive sentiments towards the staff, mentioning that they make the dining experience much better. The reviewer appreciates the efficient service, even with a long line. They also mention that the location is convenient for them, and they enjoy going there for breakfast and late lunch. Overall, the reviewer's comments indicate a generally positive experience with the restaurant, highlighting the friendly staff and convenient location as key factors contributing to their enjoyment.

question: Maybe I came on a bad night? Drive thru was pretty quick and I received friendly service. I ordered a meal and a milkshake and was told I would need to pull up a little to wait on my milkshake. I begin to munch on my fries and they were lukewarm. The milk shake was taking long so I begin eating my room temp nuggets. I'm not the type of person to send back food if I don't find if hot enough so I suck it up and eat it and wait for my shake. About 7minutes later I send the boyfriend in to get my milkshake and they told him that they thought we drove off so it was just sitting there and they didn't even remake it. Of course it was milky and melted. I've given up on most fast food places in the University Area because of awful service and quality and it looks Chick Fil A will be added to the list.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the customer experienced multiple issues during their visit to the Chick-Fil-A location. They received lukewarm fries, room temperature nuggets, and a melted milkshake. Additionally, there was a significant delay in receiving the milkshake, leading to further disappointment. The lack of proactive customer service, as indicated by the staff mistakenly thinking the customer had driven off without their order, also contributed to the negative experience. Overall, the combination of food quality issues and service mishaps left the customer feeling unsatisfied and led them to give up on fast food places in the University Area, including Chick-Fil-A.

question:
There's only one Sams on the Northside and whenever you go in there on a Sunday, it's going to be crowded. With that being accepted it took me at least 20 - 30 min to get thru check out and out the door. 

They do have the best Cinnamon pretzels, however, there's usually always just 1 person working or taking orders in the cafe. I mean it is super busy after church, so I wish they would have more people working there. Plus a lot of people get the large pizzas (which are comparable to delivery pizza or frozen store bought) to take home,  but still only 1 worker. 

Also, they don't accept all major credit cards, which is odd. Of course, I will keep going because there's not another closer. However, BJ's is worth a trip too.
rationale: The sentiment in the review is positive because the reviewer acknowledges that the restaurant is always crowded, but still mentions that they enjoy the Cinnamon pretzels there. Despite the long wait times and limited staffing, they appreciate the food offerings and note that they will continue to visit the establishment. Additionally, they even recommend another restaurant, BJ's, indicating that they are open to trying other places but overall have a positive outlook on their experience at Sams.

question:
Horrible management Drew (night manager) was very unprofessional with a refund I needed. After spending over 10,000$ on flooring and a new TV entertainment center they gave me a hard time over a 50$ refund. What a joke. I canceled my membership and they lost a customer for life. Way to keep business Drew. You may have saved the store 50$ but you lost a customer for life. I'm sure the upper management team would not agree with your business decision on this one.
store at 
Sam's Club

8909 JW Clay Blvd, Charlotte, NC
rationale: The sentiment is Negative because the reviewer expressed frustration, disappointment, and dissatisfaction with the night manager, Drew, at Sam's Club. They were unhappy with the unprofessional handling of their refund request, especially considering the large amount of money they had spent at the store. The reviewer felt that Drew prioritized saving $50 over customer satisfaction, leading them to cancel their membership and vow never to return. The overall tone of the review is critical and suggests a strong negative impact on the customer's experience and loyalty to the store.

question: Stayed here after a KISS concert at the Verizon Ampitheater. Super close to the venue, got a great rate ($75). Great if you are looking for a no frills place that is still comfy, but doesn't look like you landed in Skid Row. We missed the free Happy Hour, but that's a good perk as well. Room was very nice, clean, and the soap, shampoo, and conditioner dispenser in the shower was pretty cool. Would stay again!
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the guest had an overall enjoyable experience staying at the hotel. They highlighted the convenient location close to the concert venue, the affordable rate, and the comfortable yet no-frills accommodations. The guest also appreciated the cleanliness of the room and the amenities provided, such as the soap, shampoo, and conditioner dispenser. Additionally, the guest mentioned they would stay at the hotel again, indicating a positive impression overall.

question: Very friendly service; freebies galore: Internet, parking, breakfast, dinner, 2 drinks per night. Nice indoor/outdoor pool with swim-under divider and cozy jacuzzi. Easy access in and out. Love it!
rationale: The review highlights multiple positive aspects of the service provided by the hotel, such as friendly service, complimentary amenities like Internet, parking, breakfast, dinner, and drinks, as well as access to facilities like an indoor/outdoor pool and jacuzzi. The reviewer also mentions the convenient access in and out of the hotel. These factors contribute to an overall positive experience, making the sentiment of the review positive.

question:
The buffet is of a good size, and it does appear to be kept relatively fresh, but I'm going to have to say that the quality is... questionable.  I'm not trying to say that the food is undercooked or anything along those lines.  Just that when you bite into a piece of teriyaki chicken on a stick, it should generally taste like chicken (or at least a meat that tastes like chicken).

Doing so here tasted like, well, something else.  In fact, just about everything here tasted like something else.

Again, it wasn't that the food was bad or out-of-date or anything.  It is just that everything - meat, vegetables and even sauces - didn't taste quite right.  It's quite possible that the taste buds in my mouth were off or something, but a bite a short while later at the bakery was just fine.  So my money is on the Lotus Buffet.  You can draw your own conclusions.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer expresses disappointment and dissatisfaction with the quality of the food at the Lotus Buffet. They mention that the taste of the food is questionable and that it does not taste like it should, such as the teriyaki chicken not tasting like chicken. The reviewer also notes that everything tasted off, including the meat, vegetables, and sauces. The overall experience was not positive, leading to a negative sentiment towards the buffet.

question:
Not bad but not the best.

We've eaten here twice. The first time was so-so, the second time was better.  Food-wise

(Gross out side note: their bathrooms need better ventilation. The second time we ate here, we were seated on the side near the bathroom. Let's just say that after someone went in, we had to move to the other side of the restaurant to escape the smell.)

The price is okay. Better if you have a student ID.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the review mentions experiencing a so-so meal and encountering a strong unpleasant odor near the bathroom on one occasion. These negative experiences overshadow the slightly improved second visit and the decent pricing mentioned. The negative bathroom experience likely had a significant impact on the overall perception of the restaurant.

question: The epitome of the Americanized Chinese buffet. As much fried American food as there is Chinese. Sushi is all surimi. Everything tastes the same, the way food does when you have a cold and your nose is stuffed up. Service is usually decent. It's cheap and the place is always packed; there's obviously a big market for this sort of thing.\nThey really need an extra person doing some cleanup on the food bar. The last time I was there you could literally feel the grime of everyone who had picked up the food ladles. Really grossed me out and have never been back.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the review describes the food as lacking in quality and variety, with the taste being monotonous and unappealing. Additionally, the mention of feeling the grime of other patrons on the food bar is particularly off-putting and indicates poor hygiene standards. The overall experience appears to have been disappointing and unsatisfactory, resulting in the reviewer never wanting to return to the establishment.

question:
Literally the worst Chinese buffet I have ever been to. I'm shocked this place has 3 stars. My husband enjoys buffets so I allowed him to drag me here, but I will not be returning. 

-Execution of everything was poor. Sushi was mushy. Vegetables limp and overlooked. All sauces were too sweet and most tasted the same. Some items had no flavor at all. Just mush and a colorant. 

-Nothing on the buffet was hot. Nothing. It wasn't even warm. I have no idea how this hasn't failed a health inspection. 

-The ice cream variety was nice. But the amount of kids hanging into the case and slobbering into it was disconcerting.
rationale: The sentiment is Negative because the reviewer expressed disappointment with their experience at the Chinese buffet. They highlighted several issues, such as poor food execution, lack of flavor, cold food temperature, and concerns about hygiene with the ice cream display. Overall, the review conveys a strong sense of dissatisfaction and a clear intention to not return to the establishment.

question: Not the worst Chinese I've had, but definitely not the best.  Good for a cheap lunch, but very Americanized selection.  Wait staff is friendly and attentive, the food was hot, buffet was fairly well maintained.  \n\nMore like fuel than food!
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the review mentions that the Chinese food was not the best, indicating mediocre quality. Additionally, describing the selection as very Americanized suggests it may lack the authenticity and flavors typically expected from Chinese cuisine. Overall, the comment that the food feels more like fuel than a satisfying meal further emphasizes the negative sentiment.

question: Greasy unappetizing fried food. Low quality ingredients. Pretty much tastes all the same.\n\nNever again.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the customer describes the food as "greasy," "unappetizing," and made with "low quality ingredients." Additionally, they mention that everything tastes "pretty much all the same." These are clear indicators of poor quality and lack of flavor variety, leading to a negative dining experience. Lastly, the statement "Never again" further emphasizes the customer's strong dissatisfaction with the food.

question: Since there are more options in the area Lotus has really took the last place to go. The buffet area look very small compared to the other Chinese buffets. The pricing is a bit high. I would definitely choose a different buffet overall. The food is ok, I only go when we get their coupons in the mail or they have a promotion. Cause it's really not worth the $10.99 they charge
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer expresses disappointment with Lotus restaurant, citing factors such as limited buffet options, high pricing, and food quality that is only deemed acceptable when discounts or promotions are available. The reviewer would prefer to choose a different buffet overall, indicating an overall dissatisfaction with their dining experience at Lotus.

question: 10 years ago I came in regularly and enjoyed.  The bar lost its self and I stopped going in completely.  Earlier this year I got a coupon and decided to walk in to take a glance at the selection.  The restaurant wasn't crowded at all, but I was shocked how fresh the food looked so I settled down to enjoy excellent cooked crab legs, cray fish, shrimp. Salt/pepper octopus..  great cooks and fresh,  also ice cold beer.  The only thing that can use help with is the sushi.  They do not do any real selection but everything else out ways the sushi.  Enjoy!!
rationale: The sentiment of the review is positive because the customer experienced a pleasant surprise after returning to the restaurant many years later. They were impressed by the freshness and quality of the food, particularly the seafood items like crab legs, crayfish, and shrimp. The mention of great cooks and an enjoyable dining experience, along with the ice-cold beer, indicates overall satisfaction with the visit. Even though they mentioned the sushi could use improvement, the positive aspects of the food and service outweigh this drawback. Overall, the customer expressed enjoyment and recommended others to visit, making it a positive review.

question: My husband and I frequent this place pretty often. The food is always delicious and fresh. I love the crab ragoons! Best I have tasted! Staff is always friendly and service is nothing to complain about. We always get a friendly, \"come spend your money with us\" smile and greeting every time we come, which is wonderful in today's society. Considering the fact that some businesses feel they don't have to appeal to, or make any effort to earn your business. The watermelon is really sweet and delicious too! Health/Sanitation grade was 98.5. Enjoy! I always do! OMG! I almost forgot,  the Sake is the bomb.com!
rationale: The review expresses high praise for the restaurant's food quality, specifically mentioning the delicious and fresh food, particularly the crab ragoons and sweet watermelon. The positive interactions with the staff and excellent service also contribute to the positive sentiment. The reviewer appreciates the welcoming atmosphere and friendly attitude of the staff, which enhances their overall dining experience. Additionally, the mention of a high health and sanitation grade adds to the positive sentiment, indicating a commitment to cleanliness and customer safety. Overall, the reviewer thoroughly enjoys their experiences at the restaurant and highly recommends it, highlighting multiple aspects that contribute to a positive review.

question: I was looking for a Chinese food cater for a small group party. Lotus catered a couple of friends' wedding so I called them to give it a try, though I had not been there before. Linda was super nice and she definitely knows how to do catering business and make her customers happy. I ordered fan fried dumplings and chicken wings. They were delicious. My guests were happy with the food too. Linda not only asked if I needed extra paper products and dipping sauces also followed up and asked how the food was. Linda was also very flexible with order amount and offered great prices for my orders. Great experience, also cater!
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the customer had a great experience with Lotus catering. They enjoyed the delicious food, praised Linda for being super nice and knowledgeable, and appreciated her flexibility, great prices, and follow-up to ensure customer satisfaction. The positive feedback from the customer's guests further adds to the overall positive sentiment of the review.

question:
I'm a huge fan of Kohls and moving to the Charlotte area has pushed me to find a different Kohls than the one I always went to an hour away. And here it goes, from the many other Kohls that I've stepped foot on, this is the most disorganized department store I've been to. 

The prices are higher than other Kohls' for the EXACT same product. I purchased a cardigan for $21 at the Charlotte Kohls while the day after I visited my hometown Kohls and found the exact cardigan for $15. That was a return. 

The selection in this Kohls is so poor. I asked an associate if she could help me find a pencil skirt in the middle of the summer and she said that they don't carry skirts. How can they not carry skirts?!?! 

Last week I stopped by to get the battery of my watch changed. I purchased this watch for $250 at their store and when I asked the lady to change my battery she told me that she is afraid to do it because she broke her watch changing the battery. Are you kidding me? You also have to pay for a battery change while other Kohls change it for free. 

I love Kohls but everytime I've been to this store I've gotten an attitude from most of the associates and never been able to find a good deal so I've stopped going.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer expresses dissatisfaction with various aspects of their experience at the Kohl's store in Charlotte. They highlight issues such as disorganization, higher prices compared to other Kohl's locations, poor selection of products, unhelpful associates, and charges for services that are typically offered for free at other Kohl's stores. The reviewer's frustration and disappointment with these factors contribute to the overall negative sentiment of their review.

question: I received a PJ set as a gift from my Mom for Christmas. She paid $19.20 for the top and $19.20 for the pants which = $38.40 total.  Unfortunately, they were too big, so I had to return them for store credit. Upon doing so, I was told that the items were now on sale, and that they would only refund me the sale price, which was $14.39 per piece, plus they were deducting the $10.00 Kohl's bucks that she received for the purchase. So, my Mom paid $38.40 for the PJ's and because they did not fit and I had to return them, I was given $20.05.  \nThe Kohl's cash I almost get, but not refunding the original price paid for the items is bull! But the taking the Kohl's cash promo away from the gift receiver is crap as well. It's a promotion the store is doing and as it turns out, it's just a big money maker.   I will never shop at Kohl's again, and I will ask my friends to do the same. Especially if for a gift. Not a happy customer. Goodbye Kohl's
rationale: The sentiment is Negative because the customer had a frustrating experience with the PJ set gifted by their mom. They had to return the items as they did not fit, but instead of being refunded the original price paid by their mom, they were only given the sale price, with a deduction for Kohl's cash. The customer felt this was unfair and expressed disappointment in the store's handling of the situation, leading them to vow not to shop at Kohl's again and discourage their friends from doing so as well. These negative outcomes and feelings are clear indicators of dissatisfaction with the overall customer experience.

question: This branch of the credit union isn't really all the convenient for me on most days, but there are times that I'm out and about when I'll stop in.  Strangely, they have a K-9 unit parked there many afternoons.  I can't say that matters much for most people, I just thought I'd mention it in case it matters to you.\n\nMany services are available at this branch, and most days there are 3-4 tellers are available, so even on busy days, the line moves quickly.  There is also an ATM in the outside vestibule and a drive-through ATM in the parking lot, so you have many options.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the review focuses on the convenience and availability of services at the credit union branch. The reviewer notes that despite the branch not being very convenient for them personally, there are still many services available, multiple tellers on hand, and various ATM options provided. Additionally, the reviewer mentions the quick-moving lines even on busy days, which contributes to a positive overall experience. The mention of a K-9 unit parked there may be seen as a quirky or interesting detail rather than a negative point, adding a unique aspect to the branch.

question:
Definitely an excellent sports bar. There are TVs everywhere you turn, and is an especially raucous place to watch a big game. 

They do have live music intermittently on weekends, but it is much more a sports bar than live music venue.

My band performed there in May, during the NBA Finals. We were slated to go on at 10, after the first game but before the second game came on, which meant they would turn down the sound on the TVs. I thought we were going to get bum-rushed when some people learned what was going on. 

It turned out okay in the end, but it was an interesting evening to say the least.

Food-wise, the pizza and wings are delicious! I had excessive quantities of both, as well as draft beer.

Apart from the sports crowd, it seems this place does quite a bit of late-night business, as a lot of people make it one of their last stops of the evening before heading home to sleep it off.

Overall, a good scene, and definitely worth a stop just for the pizza and wingies.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer highlights several positive aspects of the sports bar. They mention the abundance of TVs, the fun atmosphere for watching games, delicious food options like pizza and wings, and the late-night crowd that frequents the establishment. Despite a potentially tense moment during a live music performance, the reviewer ultimately had an interesting and enjoyable experience. Overall, the review emphasizes the positive aspects of the sports bar, making it clear that it is worth a visit.

question: Picasso's is cool, my girlfriend used to live in the area so we frequently visit Charlotte. Picasso's is a great place with lots of TV's, seating and games. The drinks are inexpensive and the food looked good. My only complaint is that they didn't have the UFC fight on there. Had to walk to Buffalo Wild Wings
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer praises Picasso's as a great place with plenty of TVs, seating, and games, as well as offering inexpensive drinks and good-looking food. Despite the minor complaint about not having the UFC fight on, the overall review conveys a favorable impression of the establishment. The reviewer indicates that they enjoy visiting Picasso's frequently, which suggests they have had positive experiences there in the past.

question: A true sports bar with plenty of character; I would recommend this place to anyone.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer describes the sports bar as having "plenty of character" and would recommend it to others. This suggests that the reviewer had a good experience at the sports bar and enjoyed the atmosphere, making it a positive recommendation.

question:
I have visited this bar several times and must say I'm a big fan of this bar.  It is your average sports bar, with average drink prices.  Their bar food is out of this world.  Don't believe me?  Try the pizza rolls, buffalo chicken rolls, or wings.  Or all three.  Seriously.

Stopped there in the daytime once however to pick up some of the aforementioned deliciousness, and was put off by their carpet in the morning.  If you've had a bit to much too drink, don't stare at the carpeting while making your way to the loo.  You might fall over.  

Been here to watch some Phillies games before and even though the bartender was a Yankees fan, it was still a nice experience.  I will definitely go back to this place in the future.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is positive because the reviewer describes themselves as a big fan of the bar and highlights positive aspects such as the delicious bar food, the enjoyable experience watching sports games, and their intention to return in the future. Despite a minor issue with the carpet, the overall tone of the review emphasizes the great food and overall satisfaction with the bar, resulting in a positive sentiment.

question: Had the calzone Saturday. REALLY good. As usual, great service, friendly people, plenty of sports. A great spot.
rationale: The review highlights the positive experience the person had at the restaurant. They specifically mentioned the calzone being "REALLY good," which indicates a high level of satisfaction. They also praised the service, mentioning it was great, and noted the friendly staff and enjoyable atmosphere with plenty of sports. Overall, the review paints a picture of a great dining experience, making the sentiment positive.

question: Going to Picasso's was a real experience. When we walked in...we just walked in. No hostes what so ever. Everyone's been to a sports bar before, this was a little strange to me. None the less we found seats close to the big screen. It seems like there's thousands of tv's in this place! I think there were only two servers working that day. But they had it all under control. It's kind of a do as you please atmosphere. Everyone had on a jersey representing their team, it was live! I ordered the two foods their known for. Pizza. Wings. I had a medium cheese pie and the cajun garlic wing basket (or whatever it's called). The pizza, not really all that great. It was just a step up, maybe two, from frozen pizza. ( Our waitress noted that the dough is made in house dailey). Just didn't hit the spot for me. The wings on the other hand...marvelous! I don't know if I'd say the best in Charlotte, but they were pretty good! Sadly when I got to the bottom of my wing baskey ( because I ate all of them), my very last wing had a rather large feather still attached. This rendered it inedible in my book. Overall great spot. I'll be going back for sure.
rationale: The sentiment is considered positive because the reviewer highlights several positive aspects of their experience at Picasso's, such as the lively atmosphere with people in team jerseys, the variety of TVs, and the attentive service despite only two servers being present. The reviewer also mentions enjoying the cajun garlic wings and finding them "marvelous," indicating a positive dining experience overall. Additionally, the reviewer expresses a willingness to return to the restaurant, suggesting they have an overall favorable impression of Picasso's despite noting some issues with the pizza.

question:
Went to check out a game with some friends and was horrified at our service.

One of our party received a cold pizza roll and brought it to our server's attention. 

How tacky can one be in deciding to stick one's finger in a patron's food and declare the patron wrong?

Unbelievable. 

And then the manager decided to get in on the action. He made a special trip to our table to declare the server was correct in her statement and her action because she was requested to stick her finger in the food in question.

Really?

If this is any indication of how customers are treated at Picasso's, rest assured that members of my party took note and WILL spread the word.

My first and last visit. 

Thank you for a great football Sunday.
rationale: The sentiment is Negative because the reviewer expressed disappointment and frustration with the service received at Picasso's. They were horrified by the unsatisfactory response to a complaint about the food quality and felt disrespected by the server's and manager's handling of the situation. The reviewer's tone is overall critical and they indicated that they would not be returning to the establishment, which speaks to their dissatisfaction with the experience.

question: It's really a place to watch sports have drinks. That's it didn't like the food there. It's probably cause its just meant for sports and drinks. Since I'm not a fan of either its definitely the wrong place for me. But for those who like drinks and sports this would be your spot!
rationale: The sentiment is Negative because the reviewer did not enjoy the food at the place, indicating a significant aspect of their experience was disappointing to them. Additionally, it seems that the reviewer's personal preferences do not align with the main offerings of the establishment, as they are not a fan of sports or drinks, making it clear that this particular venue is not suitable for them.

question: Terrible. Ugly d\u00e9cor, bad food, poor service.
rationale: The sentiment is Negative because the review highlights multiple aspects of the experience that were unsatisfactory - the ugly décor, bad food, and poor service. These negative experiences would likely leave a strong impression on the reviewer and contribute to an overall negative perception of the establishment.

question:
I have been eating and playing poker at Picasso's for over a year now . . . and at the Uptown location for longer than that.
I should say that I'm not a sports fan . . . I come here to play poker and spend time with my poker buddies a couple of nights a week. BUT, for those who are sports fans and like to eat/drink while watching a game,  you should be very happy with this place.
Picasso's is very popular with the college-aged sports fan crowd -- particularly since it's located just up the road from UNC-Charlotte.
The food is standard sports-bar fare. Wings, pizzas, sandwiches, wraps, fries and other appetizers. These are of fairly average quality -- though I have heard some of my friends comment that they particularly like the fajitas. There are no desserts.
There is a good selection of beer & mixed drinks -- nothing fancy, but adequate and fairly priced for your average sports fan.
The staff is very friendly and professional and are able to accomodate large crowds with ease -- given a little advanced notice. As I mentioned, my poker league plays here twice a week (on Mondays and Wednesdays, 2 games each day at 7pm and 9:30pm FREE) and we usually have crowd of 20-30. Often, other college groups (clubs, fraternities, sports teams, etc.) share the same space.  It's a spacious establishments with lots of TVs and even a huge (I'd say 10 ft or bigger) projection TV for the big games.

In addition to the games on the TVs and twice-weekly free poker, there is also an electronic darts board and a "shuffleboard" game. The covered outdoor seating area is convenient if you happen to be a smoker or have smokers in your party. 

SO . . . being a foodie, I'd give Picasso's 3 stars. Since this place is a SPORTS BAR, however, and judging it on its' own merits, I'll give Picasso's 4 stars!
rationale: The sentiment of the review is positive because the reviewer highlights several positive aspects of Picasso's, such as the friendly and accommodating staff, good selection of beer and mixed drinks, spacious establishment with plenty of TVs, projection TV for big games, and additional entertainment options like electronic darts and shuffleboard. The reviewer also mentions that the food, although standard sports-bar fare, is of average quality and that their friends particularly enjoy the fajitas. The reviewer acknowledges that as a foodie, they would give Picasso's 3 stars, but as a sports bar, they rate it 4 stars, indicating overall satisfaction with the experience at the establishment.

question: I went to Picasso yesterday as a single lady just to get a drink & some food. The service is terrible! This is my second time going. Every time I go the lady behind the bar looks like her dog just died. It took forever for them to come to me. I didn't get one smile from either bartender. The roll I had was good. But I can find good food elsewhere I prefer good service!
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the customer experienced poor service during both of their visits to the Picasso restaurant. The staff members did not appear friendly or attentive, and it took a long time for them to serve the customer. Despite enjoying the food, the overall experience was hindered by the lack of positive interaction and customer service.

question:
12 hours in the North Carolina sun and we were beat!  100 degree temps, 98% humidity, and an empty stomachs - it was time for a climate controlled environment and a TON of food.

Our stop at MG was exactly what we were looking for.  Started off with a couple apps, into the salads, delicious dinner, loaves upon loaves of bread in between.  Plus, it felt about 50 degrees cooler inside than it was on their patio.  Almost too cold - when I wasn't eating I was shaking from shivering so hard.  Gotta love those speedy climate changes.

The amazing staff were right on top of everything - never an empty glass of water or question un-answered.
rationale: The review expresses positive sentiments by highlighting the relief from the extreme heat and humidity experienced outside, and the enjoyment of a satisfying meal in a comfortable, climate-controlled environment. The reviewer appreciates the variety of food options, attentive service, and the ambiance of the restaurant. Overall, it conveys a sense of contentment and satisfaction with the dining experience, resulting in a positive sentiment.

question: We have been staying very near to this place for the past 5 months... How many times we thought of trying this one out.. Finally we did :) .. Food was pretty good.. Chicken parm was awesome ( highly recommended )... However there were very few servers around and the service was'nt great either.. Food was pretty good though.. I am a fan of this place :)
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer enjoyed the food, specifically mentioning that the chicken parm was awesome and highly recommended. Despite noting a lack of servers and not great service, the overall review expresses enthusiasm for the place, with the reviewer even declaring themselves a fan. This indicates that the positive experience with the food outweighed any shortcomings in service.

question: The service was great but the food was not. All the pasta for our party was undercooked; there were 14 of us. Other customers also were returning meals. The manager told us they were using a new pasta and had to \"learn to cook it\". She did make an adjustment on our bill to make up for the bad meals.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the review mentions multiple issues with the food at the restaurant, particularly the undercooked pasta that affected an entire party of 14 people. In addition, the fact that other customers were also returning meals indicates a widespread problem. Although the service was described as great, the main focus of the review is on the poor quality of the food, leading to an overall negative experience for the reviewer and others at the restaurant.

question: This was by far the worse MG I have dined. All 5 entrees (big family) ordered were served cold. Not warm, not luke warm, COLD! After being re-heated undoubtedly in a microwave we discovered that each guess was discussing who had the more bland tasting dish. We have always enjoyed MG and it was a complete shock to have this type of experience. We will not return.  There were 2 exceptions to this tastless cold meal....the house salad dressing and the bread.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the customer had a disappointing dining experience at the restaurant. The food was served cold, lacked flavor, and had to be reheated in a microwave. The fact that the entire family found the dishes bland and cold indicates a significant failure in the quality of the food and service. Additionally, the customer mentioned that they will not be returning, further emphasizing their dissatisfaction with the overall experience.

question:
Stay Away!
I had two items: a Caesar salad, and a margherita pizza.
Caesar salad:
The outer leaves of the head, at the top, with brown edges.  Hacked into random too-large and too-small pieces.  With some of the stems that were turning translucent from being too old.  Overdressed.
Pizza:
Weird, bread-like crust.  And not bread-like in a good way.  With sauce that had no seasoning; I think it was just tomato sauce from a can (like hunt's).  The cheese was OK, the tomatoes were flavorless.  It was covered with chopped green herbs.  Basil, you think?  Hah: parsley!
The complimentary bread was good.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer expressed dissatisfaction with both the Caesar salad and margherita pizza. The Caesar salad was described as having poor quality lettuce with brown edges, over-dressed, and containing old and translucent stems. The margherita pizza was criticized for its weird, bread-like crust, bland sauce, flavorless tomatoes, and misidentifying parsley as basil. Overall, the reviewer's experience was disappointing due to the lack of quality and flavor in the dishes ordered.

question: I hadn't been to a Macaroni Grill in a number of years. I most likely won't be back to one for a very long time. Unlike other reviews, the service was actually very good, except for the copious amount of perfume our waitress bathed in. Very off-putting when so much of taste depends on smell. The food came out quickly but was still warm at best. I got the chicken scallopini and it was ok, other than the lack of heat. My wife got Mama's Trio. She didn't really care for any of it. I tried it and agree that none of it was very good, and also lukewarm.  The saving grace was that was that we had a gift card and didn't have to waste too much of our own money. If there is a next time, we'll re-gift it.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer describes their experience at the Macaroni Grill as disappointing and unsatisfactory. They found the service to be good but were put off by the overpowering perfume of their waitress. The food was described as only being lukewarm and lacking in flavor, with both the chicken scallopini and Mama's Trio dishes not meeting their expectations. The only positive aspect of their visit was that they had a gift card, indicating they felt it was not worth spending their own money on the subpar meal.

question: The worst Macaroni Grill I've ever been to!  Do not waste your time!!!
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer had a very poor experience at the Macaroni Grill, describing it as the worst they've ever been to and advising others not to waste their time. This indicates that the reviewer had a disappointing or unpleasant encounter at the restaurant, leading to a negative evaluation.

question:
Got together with a few former coworkers Saturday night early (5:00-ish) to catch up & have an early Christmas celebration.  Since it just so happened none of us had been to MG in a while, we decided this would be our spot (we used to go regularly as a group when we still worked together at a nearby office).  Things have changed.

ATMOSPHERE:
They still have this going for them.  This is one of the main reasons we used to gather here to begin with.  Still a great place to just kick back in a booth, relax with friends or loved ones, and not worry about having to be too quiet or having to talk over deafening music and patrons.  Noise level is just right, which is greatly appreciated.  Few places are able to balance debauchery and civility so well.

SERVICE:
We had a great waitress. She was really on-point, even as the crowds increased, being neither too obtrusive nor inattentive.  One thing I really appreciated was that she attempted to quickly "get to know us" a bit--this helped her help a few of US make decisions when too many things looked yummy or weren't in the mood for anything specific.   Friendly. Prompt. Attentive. Knowledgeable. What more could you ask for?!

FOOD:
NOT WHAT IT USED TO BE.  Don't get me wrong, it's still palatable; HOWEVER, you can tell the quality has diminished drastically.  I ordered the Mediterranean Olives ($2) in citrus marinade as an appetizer. Must say I really enjoyed those (sodium warning...whew!).  Another ordered the fried calamari appetizer ($9).  This was a disappointment.  While the price was average/reasonable, one expects more than just a few bland, nearly tasteless rings of the stuff.  It was mostly the tentacle ends of the poor lil' squid.  And lots of them.  Odd.  Her lobster ravioli ($18) was yummy according to her (looks a tad skimpy, but said it was quite filling).   My Pasta Milano ($12) was nothing like it used to be.  It's now made with rigatoni instead of bow-tie. In-and-of-itself, that's no big deal, but if you're a 'pasta person' you know how specific types of pasta can make a dish (along with the texture).  Another of us ordered the Chicken Parm ($13).  Nothing special there. Hafta say it kind of looked like something you could prepare at home & was told it tasted pretty much the same.

All-in-all I have to say they seem to have "gone cheap" on their food, ingredients, and preparation.  They seem to have soured along with the economy.  I hate to say it, but MG (at least this location) is pretty much off my radar now.  Their close proximity doesn't win out over quality.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is negative because the reviewer expresses disappointment with the decline in the quality of the food at the restaurant. They mention that while the atmosphere and service were still positive aspects, the food no longer met their expectations. The reviewer specifically highlights issues with the appetizers and main dishes, indicating that the quality of ingredients and preparation has diminished. They ultimately feel that the restaurant has sacrificed quality for cost savings, leading them to conclude that the restaurant is no longer a worthwhile dining option for them.

question:
We have dined at this chain for over 20 years. It was one of our favorites. Well bubba, those days are long gone. Ate at the one nearest us in Savannah and noticed the flavor and quality of my dinner (Pasta Rustica) was not up to par. Server said the new owners are all about the bottom line and are changing the recipes. Hello new owners; this is a recipe for disaster. "If it ain't broke, don't fix it." 

Decided to give them one more shot. Big mistake pigboy! The Carbonna was horrible, and that is as kind as I can get. Do they have a corporate taste kitchen? It was a bucket of dry pasta with some cheese and meat. A poached egg on top? Not the way to do it. Egg is an integral part of the recipe, not an add-on to pretend this is breakfast too. I tried to eat it but simply could not; even after dousing it with olive oil. There was no sauce; no moisture. Besides, the egg pasta was too thick. 

Server did a good job. I asked to speak to the manager. She was gracious and, to her credit, comped my dinner and gave us a free desert. Class act. 

But that was the last time. If you have patronized this place over the years before it was sold, you can now forget them. Do not waste your money.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the review expresses disappointment with the decline in quality of the food at the restaurant after new ownership took over. The reviewer mentions that the flavor and quality of the dishes were not up to par, specifically criticizing the Pasta Rustica and Carbonna dishes. The reviewer also mentions that the changes in recipes by the new owners were not well received. Despite receiving good service from the server and manager, the overall experience was disappointing, leading the reviewer to conclude that patrons should not waste their money at this establishment.

question:
We selected this restaurant because we had a gift card to use for our date night and on a Friday, had about a 20 minute wait.  So far, so good.  

Our waitress was really friendly, but not over the top and kept a check on us frequently. 

I had an Italian Mojito which I don't recommend, period...blech.  

We got the Zucchini Friti for an appetizer which was perfect and the dipping sauce was delish and the best part of our whole meal!  I got a salad with ranch dressing - it was fine...nothing special.  I ordered the Carmela's Chicken and it was bland, almost dry and overall just lacking.  I brought more home than I ate and reheated with some garlic sauce I had making it better than the original for lunch the next day.  I wouldn't get it again.  My husband got the steak and had fries that were better than the steak, which I thought was WAY undercooked, even for medium.  Blech!

I would give our waitress an extra .5 half star or maybe even a star, but our food was definitely not over a two star this visit.

Good thing we had a gift card.  We left a nice tip for our waitress with the balance since we had no plans of returning in the near future.
rationale: The sentiment of this review is negative because the customer experienced various disappointments during their dining experience. They did not enjoy the drinks they ordered, found the appetizer and salad to be average, and were dissatisfied with the main dishes. The customer felt that the food was bland, dry, and lacking in flavor, with one dish being undercooked. The only positive aspect highlighted was the friendly waitress. Overall, their experience was not satisfying, leading to a negative sentiment.

question: Nice ambiance but pasta was dry and cold
rationale: The review expresses dissatisfaction with the food quality, stating that the pasta was both dry and cold. These aspects directly impact the dining experience and suggest a lack of care in food preparation. This, combined with the positive comment about the ambiance, makes it clear that the main issue lies with the food quality, resulting in an overall negative sentiment.

question:
This place is only getting 2 stars as they comped my salad, meal, glass of wine, and soda without me asking to.

WORST dining experience EVER. First off, not even a fan of this place, but it was a coworker's birthday, and she chose to dine here. It was Race Week in Charlotte, but the restaurant was not overly packed near 7 PM. We were seated quickly, and our waiter took forever to even take our drink orders. 15 minutes in, he finally gets our drink orders. Then within the next 15 minutes, he brings out our drinks, one by one...30 minutes in, we finally get the freshly baked foccacia bread (which is really the only thing I like about Macaroni Grill). 45 minutes in, FINALLY takes our damn order. I was so irritated but tried to keep my cool since I was with coworkers. I asked about the pasta sampler which only caught my eye because of the proscuitto mac and cheese. It also included the sausage quadratini and carmela's chicken. I decided to order that to get a variety. We all ordered salads as well to start. About 20 minutes later or so, the diet coke I ordered never came, so I asked for it. Then he slowly brings one salad out at a time. REALLY? First one, no dressing. Second one, no bleu cheese. Third one, no bleu cheese or pancetta. Fourth one, no ranch dressing on the side or pancetta. Mine, no pancetta. Only the caeser salad was the one that came out how it should be. About...30 minutes later (we were there for over 2 hours...we had no issues talking and hanging out, but it was getting ridiculous!) our food finally came out. As the manager started bringing out the dishes, I mentioned that our salads were all wrong (I finally mentioned as I didn't want our food to be "messed up"), and he apologized. Then a server starts to hand me a dish that was completely off and not mine. So...I got to wait for 15 minutes while they re-created my dish, and being the slowest eater of the group, I was tempted to just take it to go. Another dish did not have the mozerrella cheese she had requested. When my food finally came, it was all lacking in flavor. The mac and cheese was as dry as can be, boxed mac and cheese would probably have been better, and I think there were two chunks of proscuitto, the size of a penny. I barely touched my meal, and pushed it aside.

When the bills came, I had heard him say they took the salads off the bills, which was great. I didn't see my bill, and was told everything was taken off. Which was a really nice gesture, but since we were expensing to the company, it was a time where I wished I was paying out of my own pocket. Overall, I would never dine here again. Servers really need to learn how to question the cooks if obvious ingredients are missing, and not hand dishes out one by one. The cooks should also know these standard dishes like the back of their hands and keep the food consistent.
rationale: The sentiment of this review is Negative because the customer had a terrible dining experience. They described multiple issues with the service, such as slow and disorganized waitstaff, incorrect salad orders, missing and poorly prepared food, and overall lack of flavor in the dishes they received. The customer also expressed frustration with the lack of attention to detail from both the servers and the cooks. These factors contributed to their strong dissatisfaction with the restaurant and the overall dining experience.

question: We have always loved Macaroni Grill in Winston and Greensboro.  We were visiting friends in Charlotte and chose Macaroni Grill to meet.  The restaurant was practically empty on a Sunday afternoon when we met.  The appetizers were great (baked prosciutto and mozzarella; zucchini fritti) but the service was mostly non-existent.  I was surprised  because the server didn't have a lot of distractions to consider (very few other customers).  The fettuccini alfredo was very dry (they forgot one order and rushed to make it).  The chicken under a brick was awesome and probably the only reason I gave 2 stars above.  Everything else (except the friends) was disappointing.
rationale: The sentiment in the review is negative because the customer expressed disappointment with their experience at the restaurant. They highlighted issues with the service being non-existent despite the restaurant being empty, the fettuccini alfredo being dry, and overall found everything else besides the chicken under a brick to be disappointing. The lack of attentive service, delays in preparing orders, and the overall dissatisfaction with the food contributed to the negative sentiment.

question: I have eaten here a dozen or so times in the past decade, and have always had a very good experience, so am baffled by the negativity. Food is SO much better than Carrabas, Olive Garden, etc., I don't know if locals don't know good Italian food when they taste it (I'm from Boston, which has many great Italian restaurants), or if it's a weekend problem (I almost never eat out on weekends, since service is always worse on busy nights at any restaurant). We went Wednesday for my birthday, and it was great; the Italian nachos appetizer was one of the tastiest dishes I have had in last few years, and the bill was less than I anticipated. My favorite Italian restaurant in Charlotte, not a 5 star Chicago/NY/Boston restaurant, but it is very good for the money, and I heartily recommend it.
rationale: The review expresses overall satisfaction and praises the food quality, comparing it favorably to popular chain restaurants like Carrabas and Olive Garden. The reviewer specifically highlights the delicious Italian nachos appetizer and mentions that the bill was less than expected, indicating good value for the money. Additionally, the reviewer recommends the restaurant as their favorite Italian spot in Charlotte. These positive comments and recommendations contribute to the rationale for why the sentiment of the review is positive.

question:
This restaurant is a huge surprise, and a good one, too!  Here's why:

For a chain, the menu is surprisingly upscale!  Lots of different choices, new and trendy flavor combinations, and different serving sizes available on some items.  The food is fresh and appears to be prepared with care and dare i say it, a sense of pride!

My latest visit here I found myself ordering the Parmesan Crusted Sole.  This is seriously one of the BEST dishes I've ever had in a restaurant.  Let me qualify that by pointing out that I've dined at some pretty special places both locally and across the country.  Seriously, one of the best meals I've had, period.  The fish was perfectly cooked, the lemon butter sauce was silky and perfectly balanced, and the side dish.. oh man!  It was Orzo with radicchio, spinach and sundried tomatoes.  This along with the delicious bread was perfect.

Before I left I glanced at the menu again, and even though I was stuffed, I found my mouth watering over things like Oven Fried Feta, Shrimp and Avocado Brushetta, and some amazing sounding pasta dishes.

This chain has changed a lot over the years.  Their food is much more modern and inventive than what you see at most Italian themed places.  There seems to be a broader influence to the menu.

As for service, I simply could not have asked for better service.  Polite, attentive, friendly and helpful with the menu.  This is a place I suggest you don't pass up!
rationale: The sentiment of the review is positive because the user expresses surprise and delight in discovering the restaurant's upscale menu offerings, fresh and carefully prepared food, and exceptional dishes like the Parmesan Crusted Sole. Their enthusiastic descriptions of the meal, including the perfectly cooked fish, balanced sauce, and delicious side dish, indicate a high level of satisfaction. Additionally, the user highlights the diverse and inventive menu options, as well as the attentive and friendly service, further contributing to their positive experience at the restaurant. Overall, the review conveys a strong sense of enjoyment and recommendation towards the dining experience, making it clear that the user had a great time at the restaurant.

question:
I try to stay away from the chain joints because I always find myself writing mediocre reviews...and I hate writing mediocre reviews.  This was a work lunch so I had to attend.  Well, on to the review...restaurant from the outside seems clean and welcoming.  All of the stone work gives you the feeling of an Olive Garden.  Hostess greeted the group quickly and was ready to seat us.  1.00pm on a Thursday must not be a popular time.  

We were quickly escorted to our table and I immediately noticed bags of rags(kitchen or waiter rags) scattered across one of the dining tables.  I have to say...I am glad we were not seated at that table.  I am making the assumption they were clean.  I sure do hope so because they could have just been sitting on our table prior to our arrival.  Not a great presentation of the dining area.  Waitress came by, wish I had got her name, but she was very..what's the word I am looking for?  Maybe invasive, like a bull in a china shop?  I have never been reached over so much in my life without an excuse me or pardon me.  Apparently, drink orders, appetizers, and entrees are written in crayon on the paper tablecloth in front of me.  Not really my favorite way of taking an order but...just my opinion.  

Had a warm spinach salad with shrimp.  Hmmm, I know it's lunch and everything, but 5 overcooked frozen shrimp?  Tough, clearly overcooked, and just downright horrible.  I think I would have had better luck buying frozen at the grocery store.  I rarely complain anymore because its just not worth it and I don't have the time.  Will not be visiting again.  I hope others have a better experience with different entrees.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer had a subpar experience at the restaurant. They found the cleanliness of the dining area questionable due to rags scattered on one of the tables. They also had a negative interaction with the waitress, describing her as invasive. The quality of the food was disappointing, with the reviewer specifically mentioning the overcooked and frozen shrimp in their salad. Overall, their visit to the restaurant left a lot to be desired, leading them to conclude that they will not be returning.

question: Have been going here for a while. I loved what they did to their menu last year, but the quality has dropped since my last visit 3 months ago. The Parmesan chicken was not cooked well - it was like a giant gelatinous chicken nugget. The brick chicken didn't taste fresh. It was like a fast food chicken with that really dried out taste. I can't describe it but it was like the graininess of processed chicken. I really supported this place for over a year, but their quality has noticeably dropped. The salad was meager - I mean very small. The staff was profusely nice; the managers were very apologetic, but I begged them to understand that the quality of the chicken was just low - not their preparation.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the customer is expressing dissatisfaction with their recent dining experience at the restaurant. They mentioned that the quality of the food has dropped since their last visit, describing the Parmesan chicken as gelatinous and the brick chicken as tasting like processed, dried out fast food. Additionally, they found the portion size of the salad to be very small. Despite the staff being nice and apologetic, the customer felt that the overall quality of the food, specifically the chicken, was low. Their disappointment in the decline of food quality is evident throughout the review, contributing to the negative sentiment.

question: Buyer beware! These fools will tell you that they have a reservation saved for you on the phone, but deny you made it when you show up. A late black woman who somehow plays the role of hostess is rude and doesn't care that they messed up and didn't log your reservation. The food is bland, and the pasta is overcooked and/or nuked. Furthermore, the COOKS got into a fist fight.
rationale: The sentiment in this review is negative because the customer had a poor experience with the restaurant in multiple aspects. The staff failed to honor a reservation that was supposedly confirmed over the phone, the hostess was described as rude and dismissive, the food quality was criticized for being bland and poorly prepared, and there was even a reported incident of the cooks getting into a physical altercation. These negative experiences would likely deter others from wanting to dine at this establishment.
