They expressed feeling ignored when they reached out to cancel their membership, were unhappy with being charged unexpectedly, and felt that the staff member they spoke to was unwilling to cooperate. The user also mentioned feeling offended by being banned after the incident, especially in comparison to past leniency shown towards others. Additionally, the user expressed a lack of trust in the organization due to their experience and indicated that they would be seeking alternative climbing options.

question:
Love this place. 

I'm nowhere near being a pro or even an enthusiast of rock climbing, but Inner Peaks makes it amazing. Every time I've had the pleasure of visiting, the staff has been funny and super friendly. Willing to show you around the facility and introduce you to all that they offer. 

One of my favorite things at Inner Peaks is the different walls. Some of the walls are only meant for bouldering and others are for top-rope climbing. Great to split up the areas as it can get super busy and super fast. 

My ABSOLUTE favorite thing about the gym is the slackline. I've been a slackliner for several years and love that there is always one set up (unless there is a class going on in that area) and super easy to use. 

If you're a regular climber and are looking for the killer workout a couple times a week, you'll look far past the coin it will cost you to join and maintain a membership. 

Go with another member first. If its your absolute first time and you go with a member, it's absolutely FREE! So rad. If you go in on Mondays, its half price admission. 

Definitely the premier climbing gym in all of Charlotte. Love it. Maybe one day I'll get a full-fledged membership!
rationale: The sentiment is Positive because the reviewer expresses their love for Inner Peaks climbing gym and highlights several aspects they enjoy, such as the friendly staff, the variety of walls for different climbing styles, and the presence of a slackline. The reviewer mentions the affordability and special offers for memberships, as well as the option to visit for free with a member, showing enthusiasm for the gym and a willingness to consider becoming a regular. Overall, the reviewer's tone is enthusiastic and appreciative, indicating a positive experience at the gym.

question:
I've been going to Inner Peaks off and on for seven years or so. What impresses me is that every few years they renovate, expand, freshen up or add something new.  

No, that's not a list of all the same thing- they have done each individually over the years.

The indoor climbing area includes:

1. Beginner Walls
2. Bouldering and lead cave
3. Free-standing boulder
4. More advanced routes (lead included)
5. Moon board
6. Slackline and training area
7. Upstairs cardio/weights (full dumbbell set, treadmill, bikes, kettles, etc)
8. Yoga studio with classes at 6:30pm 2x a week
9. Stuff for the kiddos- birthday parties and climbing team

I guess now I need a number ten...monthly memberships includes yoga + climbing but this is a great place to learn about climbing on a rainy day or take a second or third date.

If you have a buddy that's a member- Monday is where it is at- you'll get in for half price with them.

This is a solid gym for NC - the walls aren't the  tallest but they are constantly improving and striving to make climbing accessible for those looking for a fun thing to try and for those training for their next outdoor send.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the review highlights the continual improvements and expansions made by Inner Peaks over the years. The variety of climbing options, additional amenities like the yoga studio and cardio/weights area, and special offers like discounted entry on Mondays create a welcoming and inclusive atmosphere for both beginners and experienced climbers. The reviewer appreciates the efforts made to enhance the climbing experience and make it accessible to all levels of climbers, indicating a positive overall experience at the gym.

question:
Inner Peaks is THE place to climb in Charlotte. The staff is excellent and is the climbing community! They are always trying to make the facility better for new and seasoned climbers alike! 

Never been climbing before? Don't fret! The staff at Inner Peaks will take good care of you. There is a short orientation video, tour, and training to make you feel comfortable. The have rental gear to make sure you have everything you need. Just wear comfy/athletic clothes. 

Seasoned climber? There are 2 top-out boulders, bouldering walls, lead cave, and plenty of top ropes to suit your needs. There is also a workout area and climbing training area. 

Pro tips: Mondays are 1/2 price day passes for guests climbing with a member. Wednesdays are college days. Discounted day pass and gear rental with a college ID. There is also a great Power Flow yoga class offered on Wednesdays (included with the price of admission).

Second location coming to the SouthEnd in 2015!
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the review highlights several key positive aspects of Inner Peaks climbing facility in Charlotte. The reviewer praises the excellent staff and welcoming climbing community, emphasizing their efforts to improve the facility for both new and experienced climbers. Additionally, the reviewer mentions the supportive and accommodating approach towards new climbers with orientation, training, and rental gear available. For seasoned climbers, there are various climbing options and training areas provided. The mention of special discount days and additional offerings like yoga classes further adds to the positive sentiment. Overall, the review paints Inner Peaks as a welcoming, inclusive, and well-equipped climbing facility, making it a positive recommendation for potential visitors.

question: i get alright service sometimes, then terrible at other times. I guess it depends n who is working and what time I go. I ordered a bacon egg cheese McGriddle got to work... opened the sandwich, and there was literally just the pancake pieces slapped together. No egg, bacon, or cheese... no sandwich, I probably could have cried if I had dwelled on it longer.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the user experienced inconsistent service quality, leading to a disappointing and unsatisfactory dining experience. The fact that the user received an incorrectly made order with essential components missing further adds to their frustration and disappointment with the overall service provided by the establishment.

question: I live not too far from this taco bell, and go pretty often.  So I'm not sure if this is a practice across the board with taco bell or just this one.  They are really nice people, never had a problem with the food or any one.  Well I got the catina bowl the other day, and I've had a few of them.  I ordered a side of guacamole, because it's pretty good.  I took my food home, and it took me a little bit to eat it was busy running after my 2 year old.  But any who, the guacamole sat for a few moments and it turned a really funky green that I'm not use to.  Now I've had guacamole from other restaurants and I've never had it turn colors on me, so I'm not sure if this was chilled before I got it or not, but I know I will not order that again.  That's the first time that's ever happened to me.  Maybe it's just me.....
rationale: The sentiment is considered positive because the reviewer starts by mentioning that the staff at the Taco Bell location are really nice and that they have never had a problem with the food or service before. Even though they had a concern about the guacamole turning a funky green color, the overall tone of the review remains neutral-to-positive. They acknowledge that it may just be a one-time issue and express that they might not order that specific item again, indicating a willingness to continue visiting the restaurant. The reviewer's positive past experiences and the understanding tone towards the issue with the guacamole contribute to the overall positive sentiment of the review.

question:
I give this location 2 stars, yet I still visit it. I've been here a handful of times, and most of them has been at night.

When my fiance and I order from here at night, the food is always soggy. It's gross. I usually stay away from the Tacos or anything that involves wrapped in paper when I go at night. In the day time, I guess that's when the good managers are there. The food was never really soggy if we visited for lunch. 

I'm sure I'll go back, but like I said. I just won't order anything wrapped in paper unless it was during the day.
rationale: The sentiment in the review is Negative because the reviewer experienced consistently soggy food during their nighttime visits to the location, which they described as gross. Despite visiting the location multiple times, they found the quality of the food to be subpar during their nighttime visits, specifically mentioning that dishes wrapped in paper, such as Tacos, were affected. The reviewer did acknowledge that the food quality seemed better during daytime visits when "good managers" may be present. Overall, the negative experience of receiving soggy food repeatedly during nighttime visits influenced the reviewer's sentiment towards the location.

question: we ate lunch here yesterday and everyone left happy and full!!!! it was good!!1
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer stated that everyone left happy and full after eating at the restaurant. Additionally, they emphasized that the food was good. Overall, the review reflects a positive dining experience at the restaurant.

question: I had a great relationship with this particular Howie's store until a couple of weeks back, when I got a call from the manager informing me that his driver could not deliver to my area.  I explained to him that I had ordered from his store several times and the drivers always delivered it to me without any problem.  In fact, the Howie's website lists his store as the Howie's that is supposed to service my part of town.  He simply said that he couldn't help me and refunded my money (I had already placed the order and was waiting for my pizza for an hour.  The manager said he tried to call but apparently the low rent employee who took my order wrote down my number incorrectly.)  I love Howie's pizza but this particular store is clueless.  Don't depend on them for anything.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is negative because the user had a negative experience with the store manager and delivery service. The customer's issue was not addressed or resolved satisfactorily, with the manager simply stating they couldn't help and offering a refund after a long wait for the order. Additionally, there was a communication error regarding the contact number and a discrepancy with the store's service area listed on the website. The user found the store to be unhelpful and unreliable, leading to a disappointing customer service experience.

question: Stopped in here because the kids were hungry, yet again.  The pizza is made to order and their speciality is flavored crust made with different flavors including onion, butter cheese, garlic herb, and sesame.  We opted for original.  I like the pizza size options.  Medium is quite a bit and was plenty for the three of us to have a snack after we'd already had dinner.  The place was pretty busy as I guess there are a lot of hungry kids coming out of the dance studio.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer praises the customizable options and size choices of the pizza, stating that the medium size was plenty for their group as a snack. Additionally, despite the busy atmosphere, they mention that the establishment is popular among hungry kids, indicating a lively and bustling environment that adds to the positive experience.

question:
I've been craving breadsticks since I picked up some from Target. (Pizzahut breadsticks) (they're so good!)
Anyways ,So this is right by where we live, I ordered the howie bread. 
It's so chewy,not like jets doughy that you can actually chew , this is like chewing a piece of rubber. 
Whatever seasoning they put on top it has no flavor whatsoever with a hint of bitter.
I couldn't eat it after the first piece.
Bland $5 of waste!
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer did not enjoy their experience with the Howie bread. They described it as chewy like rubber, lacking flavor with a hint of bitterness, and ultimately found it bland and a waste of money. These factors contribute to an overall negative perception of the product.

question:
There are a number of swimming instruction services in the Charlotte area and having used others we prefer the Charlotte Swim Academy.

Classes are one-on-one with children from 18 months on up learning to swim, dive, float and overall learn how to be safe and survive in water.  The instructors are almost all young ladies who stay in the water with your child, taking through their paces.

A very sweet bunch, all neatly groomed and personable.  Our grandchildren LOVE their instructors and the instructors reciprocate.  Instructors pride themselves as family extensions helping in this one particular area of leaning.

There are changing rooms with showers and toilets and from there you hand off your child to their instructor for a 30 minute session.  Then you and any other people with you go into an observation room where you can watch through the glass wall.  When the session is over you reverse the process, picking up your child, showering, re-dressing and leaving.

There is also a "toy room" with books, blocks and other child safe materials for self-entertainment while they are waiting.

Very clean, efficient, friendly and professional operation.  You will leave each time with a slightly damp, but happy child.
rationale: The sentiment in the review is positive because the reviewer highlights several aspects of the swimming instruction service that they appreciate. They mention the one-on-one classes for children of various ages, the attentive and caring instructors, the family-like atmosphere, the clean and well-equipped facilities, and the overall efficiency and professionalism of the operation. The reviewer also notes how their grandchildren love the instructors, indicating a positive experience for the children as well. These positive experiences and features contribute to an overall favorable impression of the Charlotte Swim Academy in the review.

question:
Love it! The shrimp burritos are the best I've ever had. Also, the chicken tortilla soup is to die for. Pentiful baskets of thin/crispy chips and good but, not to hot, salsa are on your table immediately. (you can ask for hotter if you need to)

Outdoor tables-however are in a parking lot area.

Heard the atmosphere is better at the other Salsa's location on Carmel Road but, haven't made it there yet.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer raves about the shrimp burritos being the best they've ever had, as well as praising the chicken tortilla soup as being delicious. They appreciate the generous portions of thin/crispy chips and good salsa available at the table. Despite mentioning the outdoor tables being in a parking lot area, the overall review is positive and indicates a high level of satisfaction with the food and dining experience at the restaurant. The mention of potentially better atmosphere at another location does not diminish the positive sentiment expressed towards the food and service at the reviewed location.

question:
We've been to Salsa's already twice now in the past couple of weeks.  Why?  It's been convenient, we had coupons, and we were in the mood for Mexican.  

The interior of Salsa's is average, but it's just good enough to let you know that you're in a Mexican restaurant and not a diner or strip mall restaurant.  

To start, they bring you the traditional chips and salsa.  The salsa has a little bit of a kick to it and you can see the fresh cilantro in the tomato puree.  YUM.  

Our first visit in the past couple of weeks, I ordered the Burrito California with pork (to be different, since I always order chicken).  The mezquite grilled pork was/is phenomenal.  It was so flavorful and chunky.  It was so good in fact, that I didn't even consider anything else during our 2nd visit in two weeks.  I ordered it again.  The burrito is also topped off with a green tomatillo sauce, which I love, too.  

If you didn't have a coupon, I can see where the pricing might be a bit higher than other local Mexican restaurants, but what Salsa's does right is provide a high-quality, delicious, satisfying meal.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is positive because the reviewer highlights several aspects of their experience at Salsa's that they enjoyed. They mention the convenience, the use of coupons, and being in the mood for Mexican food as reasons for their repeated visits. The reviewer appreciates the authentic atmosphere of the restaurant, the flavorful chips and salsa, and especially praises the Burrito California with pork that they found to be phenomenal and flavorful. They also appreciate the quality of the food despite potential higher pricing compared to other Mexican restaurants. Overall, the reviewer's comments are filled with enthusiasm and satisfaction, indicating a positive sentiment towards their dining experiences at Salsa's.

question: CLOSED DOWN\n\nI just love circling around a shopping on a Friday night looking for a place that no longer exists...... not!
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer expresses frustration and disappointment in having wasted time looking for a place that is closed down. The use of sarcasm with "not!" at the end also indicates a sense of annoyance. Overall, the review conveys a negative experience and feeling.

question: I don't want to dedicate too much time to a BK review, but I've only been there twice and both times they failed to get my order right.  I simply ordered 2 Single stackers with extra ketchup and pickles, neither time was there a pickle in sight!  I did their online survey and addressed the problem, but I'm sure the bureaucratic process must be slow in ensuring that pickles are accurately represented.  They also never gave me my free cup of water that I asked for on my second visit.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the user expresses dissatisfaction with their experiences at Burger King due to repeated mistakes in their orders. They specifically mention missing items (pickles) in both visits and not receiving a free item (cup of water) that they requested. Additionally, the user criticizes the bureaucratic process for addressing issues, implying a lack of responsiveness or effectiveness in resolving customer complaints. Overall, the user's feedback highlights recurring errors and frustrations during their visits to Burger King, leading to a negative sentiment towards the restaurant.

question: i've gone here numerous times since my initial review, and only one time could've redeemed the initial low rating.  was here again and gave the woman 2.22 for my 2.17 bill and after she left and did something else for about 2 minutes despite the fact that i was otherwise all set, I finally got 3 pennies back.  2 cents isn't a huge deal, but it just is indicative of this BK's service
rationale: The sentiment in the review is negative because the customer had a subpar experience during their visit to the restaurant. Despite giving more than the exact amount due and waiting for a prolonged time, the customer only received a small portion of their change back. This indicates a lack of attentiveness and good customer service, leading to dissatisfaction with the overall experience.

question: Luckily I don't mind Coke....  I have been here several times and it's been... \"meh\"... but the last time I came through the drive thru and ordered a simple Medium #1 with onion rings.  I thought it was strange that the order taker did not ask what I wanted to drink, but just drove around (figured he would ask me when I got there).... NOPE just handed me a coke.  I try to roll with the punches more-often-than-not, but this was not the end of the world for me.  When I opened the bag, I had fries... and mentioned it to him.  There was no apology and he just went and got the onion rings and handed me the bag back.\n\nI guess  the phrase, \"you get what you pay for\" applies here.  I will probably give this place another shot since it's right near my house when I need a BK fix, but this is very disappointing in my book.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer expressed disappointment with their experience at the fast food restaurant. They mentioned receiving the wrong drink without being asked, encountering a mix-up with their order, and receiving poor customer service when they brought up the issue. Overall, the reviewer did not have a positive experience and indicated hesitance to return to the establishment.

question:
It's very pitiful that I have to give a 1 star to any restaurant or business. But this place deserves it.

Burger King hasn't really been good for anything, really. The fries stink and are usually cold, and the burgers have spots with color. I really have no idea what it is.

The few times that I've been to this location, we've only gone through drive-thru. The dining room always looks closed. There was one instance when I pulled up to the speaker, and no one answered for about 2 minutes. I drove around to the window, and the lady didn't really apologize and just took my order. 

I really didn't know what I was supposed to expect. The food always sucks, and so does the customer service. I won't be going back.
rationale: The sentiment is Negative because the reviewer had a poor experience at Burger King and highlighted several issues, such as cold and low-quality food, unresponsive customer service, and a lackluster dining environment. These negative aspects ultimately led the reviewer to conclude that they would not be returning to the restaurant.

question: This is the best Chinese food we've had since leaving NYC 4 years ago and living in many cities since.  It's amazingly delicious and fresh.  Don't be fooled by the appearance, it looks like a place you would want to walk right by, but because other Yelp users said it was so good, we decided to ignore the appearance and went it.  We are so very glad we did.  It's amazing.  We had the dumplings, sesame chicken and the orange chicken.  Everything we had was outstanding.  We will be back often.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer describes the Chinese food as the best they've had in years, finding it amazingly delicious and fresh despite the appearance of the restaurant. They specifically mention enjoying dishes like dumplings, sesame chicken, and orange chicken, calling them outstanding and expressing a desire to return often. Overall, the reviewer's enthusiastic and satisfied tone indicates a positive experience with the food and service.

question: I have been going to this place for the longest time.  Not only is it near my house, but the polish lasts awhile.  I have been to other places where the polish washed off the next day.  These people are nice and remember my mother and I everytime.  They even remember what type of style I  like my nails to be done.  I definately like this place
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer has highlighted several positive aspects of their experience at the nail salon. They mention that the polish lasts a long time, the staff is friendly and remembers personal details, and they appreciate the attention paid to their preferred nail style. Overall, the reviewer expresses satisfaction and a strong preference for the salon, making it clear that they enjoy their visits and have had consistently good experiences there.

question: Love this place. Not fancy but the ladies know what they are doing
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer expresses their love for the place and acknowledges that even though it may not be fancy, the staff are skilled and knowledgeable. This shows that the reviewer values the service and expertise provided by the staff, which contributes to their positive overall experience.

question:
Okay first off, the address is 9858 Monroe Rd.

Now, that we all can meet up at the right place....let's dig in:

I've eaten twice here now (shame on me for not reviewing sooner) and what I like most is the atmosphere.  They're not too busy, but they can accommodate any size group.  It's a family-run restaurant, and the owners are usually there working hard!! I love the food...Italian/Greek Cuisine with some American on the side.

The desserts, THE DESSERTS!!! Oh man! The chef usually has a special dessert of the day and then you have your typical Italian tiramisu, cannoli, and carrot cake.  The last time I was there they had this Chocolate Decadence cake and it was insanely rich and moist!!

I say give them a try because you can bring your friends, family, etc and have a great meal at a reasonable price.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer expresses overall satisfaction with their dining experience. They highlight the welcoming atmosphere, the accommodating nature of the restaurant for groups, the delicious food offerings, and the particularly enjoyable desserts. The reviewer also recommends trying out the restaurant due to the reasonable prices and the ability to enjoy a great meal with friends and family. The tone of the review is enthusiastic and complimentary, focusing on the positive aspects of the restaurant.

question:
I was having lunch at this location during the holidays  and I saw they were delivering dozens of large pizza pies. I figured people must like them. Last week I brought a couple of large pies to feed the men working at my house. 

Not only the guys loved it, but two of them asked permission to take the leftovers home! I've fed employees countless times over the years and this never happened to me before. 

As I mentioned it doesn't look or taste quite like a traditional pizza. The dough is some sort of deep dish, but nicely crispy. I think they use a fair amount of yest to make it rise and stay light. It's not Chi- style nor any of the pizza hut concoctions. also the tomato sauce is used sparingly which I like.  I asked the owner about it, he told me he's been making pizza for 30 years and everything was prepared in house, including the dough, sauces etc. 

My favorite still is the individual pie with mushrooms, well cooked onions ( I can't stand undercooked onions) a mild sausage more knockwurst than Italian and my twist: a fried egg on top, sunny side up.  No it's not pizza, a Tuscan style pie maybe. 

BTW the lunches are cheap, $6.95 for lasagna, ravioli etc. More to Charlotte's taste than to mine , but good in spite of being mild.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is positive because the reviewer had a great experience at the pizza place. They were impressed by the quality of the food, especially the unique deep-dish pizza with crispy dough. The fact that the workers at their house enjoyed the pizza so much that they wanted to take leftovers home indicates satisfaction. Additionally, the reviewer appreciated the owner's commitment to preparing everything in-house and liked the individual pie with their own twist. Overall, the reviewer had positive things to say about the taste, quality, and value of the food at this location.

question: ***WARNING!!!!!*** THIS PLACE IS HORRIBLE!  WHY?  Here it is.  My family and I went to this place Saturday evening based on the reviews here on Yelp and other sites such as Urbanspoon.  4 of us ordered chicken Parmesan, a pretty good yardstick for determining how the food is in any Italian restaurant.  After each of us took our first bite, we all lookedvat each other with the sort of face you make when you are wondering what was that.  The look was followed by universal disdain for this so called meal.  The chicken was inedible , the sauce was nothing resembling tomato sauce found on 99% of all Italian meals.  We should have been tipped off when the chicken was grilled not breaded as is the case with this dish.  BLAND.  GROSS.  TERRIBLE.  Now comes the part that totally caused me to write this.  We sent it all back.  We were asked \"would you like something else?\".  Not a chance.  If this was the indicator for the so called cuisine we wanted nothing to do with it.  The \"manager\" came to our table.  \"You have to pay for the entire meal\".  Seriously?  Seriously!  Now again in 99% of the time when food is returned, the normal proper way of doing business is to say \"sorry you didn't like your food.  We will deduct the cost from your bill\".  LADIES AND GENTLEMEN.  In the face of protecting my family from the embarassment of the police being called, I paid $83 for this CRAP. $83!!!  As I left I suggested the manager change this policy.  It was met with a smirk and defiance.  In the face of my saying the social media world will hear about this, she couldn't care less.  So, here it is. For those of you who gave this place a positive review, I have to ask \"Seriously?\". For those of you looking for something new in Italian food in Charlotte,YOU HAVE BEEN WARNED by someone who rarely sends food back and by someone who understands the customer is always right.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is negative due to the customer's experience at the restaurant being extremely unsatisfactory. The food, specifically the chicken Parmesan, was described as inedible, bland, and gross. The customer and their family were disappointed in the quality of the meal, leading them to send it back. The negative experience was further exacerbated by the restaurant's refusal to deduct the cost of the meal from the bill and the manager's dismissive attitude towards the customer's feedback and threat to share the experience on social media. Overall, the review conveys frustration, disappointment, and a lack of customer service, highlighting the overall negative impression of the restaurant.

question: Wow, this place has good pizza! Hidden at the end of a strip plaza it doesn't look like anything special from the outside and it's easy to miss - once inside the food is good and the service is even better.  Ordered the large pizza with pepperoni and mushrooms (they are fresh, not from a can) and it was excellent, one of the best pizza's I've had in Charlotte. Our server was very good, always filled our drinks before they went dry, came back often to see if we needed anything and was fast with the bill when we were finished. \nDon't let the outside appearance stop you from giving this place a try. I know I'll be back!
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer had a great experience at the pizza place. They praised the quality of the food, mentioning that the pizza was excellent and one of the best they've had in Charlotte. Additionally, they appreciated the attentive service, noting the server's efficiency in refilling drinks and checking in on their needs. The reviewer also expressed a willingness to return to the restaurant, despite its unassuming exterior. Overall, the positive feedback on both the food and service contributes to the overall positive sentiment of the review.

question:
I am confused. I am baffled. I am in shock. I am disappointed.  
When I read the reviews I was a little surprised but I figured somehow I must have looked over this place after all these years and I was actually regretting it!  Now...not so much. I quickly realized there was a reason I grew up right around the corner yet never visited this place.  I realized there was a reason I never even stepped foot in this place on a lunch break while working at the neighboring Food Lion as a squeaky teenager with braces. Back then I thought Ragu was gourmet so I wasn't even picky but STILL knew to stay away from Juliana's  There is a reason why our Italian family of 7 never bothered ordering from here even though it was cheap and close by!  You have to realize this was before the restaurant scene really even popped off in Charlotte!! There were no options!  Uptown was downtown, the arboretum was for the wealthy and Ballantyne didn't exist.  But still....Juliana's was never an option....now I see WHY!!

We opened the door and immediately fell back into 1973.  The diner feel of this place gave me the creeps and the whole restaurant turned to stare as we entered.  It was awkwardly quiet and just didn't have a comfortable feel AT ALL.  I wanted to leave from the moment I stepped in but I figured I needed to get over myself and give it a try.  Sometimes the best food comes out of little hole in the wall restaurants.  I wasn't expecting much but I realize decor is not the only thing that matters.

We decided to stick with the absolute basic.  I ordered Spaghetti and meatballs and my husband ordered the chicken parm 12 inch sub.  My husband isn't as picky as I am so I was counting on him to enjoy this sub.  It is pretty hard to mess up a chicken parm sub.

My pasta came out and all I can tell you is that the sauce was brown.  It looked like gravy.  When I mixed it in with the spaghetti it somehow just vanished so it was basically like eating noodles with a hint of brown gravy.  It was the most disgusting thing I have ever tasted.  I took one bite of the meatball and thought I was going to throw up.  It was atrocious.  It was spongey and tasted like deer meat.  It was so gross.  My husband's chicken parm sub had the same doo-doo brown gravy on it and the chicken was like rubber.  Literally.  He could hardly bite through it.  When he said he couldn't eat this sub, I KNEW it was bad.  He eats anything.  I for darn sure wasn't eating my dish so we just sat their staring at each other.  I forgot to mention the salad and texas toast that was served with the meal...the salad was frozen iceburg with nothing else and the toast was a piece of lilly white bread with some butter and garlic slapped on it.  BLLLLEH!!!!

Eventually the waitress made her way over to us and we weren't sure what to say but I can tell you I have only not been able to eat a meal due to COMPLETE dissatisfaction twice in my whole life.  The waitress noticed that we didn't eat our meals and asked if we wanted a box to go.  Um, WOW.  No, we want to just get out of here.  We asked for our check and told her we weren't really satisfied but that we didn't want to make a big deal, no need for managers, etc.  Well, one of the "managers" (son to the woman who owns and cooks) came over.  He offered us anything else off the menu to replace our meals.  We didn't want anything else from this dump.  We wanted to just LEAVE and go eat.  We were starving and on a time crunch.  

Long story short--They made us pay for the meal that we didn't even touch.  The owner came out and was extremely nasty.  She said she posted that they do not refund for food.  She then pointed to this itty bitty note on her cash register.  She said she can't please everyone's taste buds so she is not going to refund anyone.  What?  So does this happen often enough that you have to have a disclaimer on your food?  That is TERRIBLE servie for a small mom and pop, or just mom shop.  It was like they were used to people not liking their food so they were prepared to argue their point.  IT was bizarre.  I don't understand that concept.  They said you can order a pizza or something else so they are still losing money by having to make a whole other meal!  Either way, it was their approach and the fact that the food was absolutely disgusting.  I would NEVER want to support this place, local or not.

I asked them where they were from because no one that was born and raised in Italy would have created the mess that they did.  They were actually greek.  I suppose they just have a different way of preparing Italian food because it was NOT authentic.

I looked back at those who offered such stellar reviews and realized that most of the people were from random towns/areas.  Maybe they haven't been exposed to the real deal in terms of Italian food so somehow this place was okay to them.  Not me.  I'm telling you...If you love Italian food and have had real authentic Italian food...DO NOT GO HERE.  End of story
rationale: The sentiment of the review is negative because the writer expresses confusion, shock, disappointment, and disgust with their dining experience at Juliana's restaurant. They describe the atmosphere as uncomfortable, the food as unappetizing and poorly prepared, and the service as unsatisfactory. The interaction with the staff, particularly the owner's refusal to provide a refund and the confrontational attitude, further contributes to the negative sentiment expressed in the review. Overall, the reviewer's strong language and detailed criticism of various aspects of their visit indicate a very poor and unsatisfactory dining experience.

question: This is the most horrible dry cleaners I have ever experienced.  They completely destroyed a $200 shirt and just lost another silk blouse.  Throwing away your clothes would be easier than driving to this dry cleaner, dealing with rude service, and not getting your clothes back in the condition you gave it to them, or just not getting your clothes back at all.  They change their hours at will without updating their website to inform their customers, so you drive all the way out there after a long day at work, and find the doors locked without even an apology.  Very unprofessional... the worst ever!
rationale: The sentiment is Negative because the review describes a series of highly negative experiences with the dry cleaner, including completely destroying a valuable shirt, losing another item of clothing, rude service, inconsistent hours without proper communication, and unprofessional behavior. These issues suggest a lack of care and reliability on the dry cleaner's part, leading to a frustrating and unpleasant customer experience.

question: NEVER GO HERE! TAKE YOUR BISS. ELSEWHERE! THESE PEOPLE RIP YOU OFF! I just moved into the area looking for a dry cleaners. This one was close to my home but by far the worst experience i ever had. I brought my work shirts in and handed them to the woman to look at to give me a direct price. She looked at my shirts. I also had one apron, a sun dress and to 2 pair of jeans to be repaired. The first woman i delt with told me one price but when I came in to pick up my order. My shirtsand aprons still had the stains on them. I could have done a better job with some oxy clean, Reason i didnt was bc i didnt want to have to go through that. So now the woman tells me double the price then what the first woman said to me and didnt want to help me on there mistake! Then the jeans for repair she tells me it would cost me at most 7 dollars a pair of pants to get repaired! The other woman tell me i owe 16 dollars a pair! DOUBLE THEN WHAT I WAS TOLD! She said they needed to be cleaned? so you just add on services because its what you think and just charge them for the service! I was charged double for every piece of clothing. I asked for a manger it was the of course her! so i wanted to speak to someone else higher and she refused to give me any kind of contact with them? needless to say i had to pay way more then what i was told and when i was in there she kept pushing me aside to help other customers when I was there first and a PAYING customer too! Totally Unprofessional the way this biss is run! GO ELSEWHERE TRYING TO SAVE YOU FROM A NIGHTMARE AT THE DRY CLEANERS!!!
rationale: The sentiment of this review is negative because the customer had a terrible experience at the dry cleaners. They felt that they were overcharged for services that were not performed satisfactorily, and there was a lack of transparency about pricing. The customer encountered unhelpful and unprofessional staff, leading to frustration and disappointment. Overall, the review highlights several issues that contributed to a negative experience, warranting the negative sentiment.

question: I did business with this cleaners about every week for over 15 years. I recently left a custom made - $175 men's dress shirt for cleaning. The shirt is one year old but like new. Somehow, in the cleaning process, the shirt got stained to the point that it is now unwearable. Springfresh took two weeks to offer a small store credit and $25, which was unacceptable. I do not recommend them and will not go back.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the customer had been a loyal patron of the cleaners for over 15 years and entrusted them with a valuable, custom-made dress shirt. However, the shirt was returned in an unwearable condition due to staining during the cleaning process. The compensation offered by the cleaners was deemed insufficient, causing frustration and disappointment for the customer. This negative experience highlights a lack of adequate resolution and quality service, leading to the decision not to return to the cleaners in the future.

question:
I took my cat here this past weekend for a bath and to have her claws clipped.  I was not happy at all.  I specifically told them when I dropped off my cat that I did not want her fur trimmed at all.  When I picked her up I was told that they trimmed her sanitary area.  Trimmed...yeah right!  They shaved half of her belly.  There was absolutely no reason for that.  She was not dirty in her private areas.  Not only was she shaved but it was all crooked with tufts of hair sticking out on the sides.  I didn't see this until we got home since she was in the crate when I picked her up.  I called back to complain.  They told me to bring her in again and they would fix it.  100 degrees and back we go to the groomer.  They took her in the back and "fixed it".  Then they offered me a $5.00 discount on my next visit.  It's still not right.  They straightened out the line but now the whole thing is at an angle.  It looks ridiculous.  The groomer who shaved my cat needs to have her eyes checked.  For someone who does this for a living she did a pretty pathetic job.

The place is also pretty old, not very well maintained and dirty.  I wonder if the groomers know that everyone in the waiting area can hear all their gossiping they are doing while they are working.

Needless to say....It was not a good experience and I will not be going back there.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the customer had a poor experience with the grooming service for their cat. They specifically requested that their cat's fur not be trimmed, but the groomers shaved a significant portion of her belly unnecessarily. Additionally, the grooming job was poorly done, with the shaved area appearing crooked and uneven. The customer had to return to the groomer to try to fix the issue, but the result was still unsatisfactory. The customer also noted that the grooming facility was old, poorly maintained, and dirty. Overall, the customer was dissatisfied with the service, the quality of the grooming, and the cleanliness of the establishment, leading to a negative experience and a decision not to return.

question: Great service
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the user specifically mentioned that the service provided was great. This indicates a high level of satisfaction with their experience.

question:
So,  I am probably being very generous with 4 stars but what can I say besides I am a SUCKER when it comes to a good mom & pop spot! Yes, literally mom & pop....that's all folks!  How cute is that? The wife was the waitress and the husband was cooking. 

The run down tiny shopping center this place is in  could make one deduct a star or two but don't judge!
The food on a whole is more along the lines of 3 (bright shiny) stars .

 Definitely worth mentioning are the springs rolls, crispy and flavorful. Also their fried dumplings(4 in an order) were quite big and delicious with more filling then dough ratio which I enjoy .
One in particular dish I had was really tasty IMO. The garlic butter shrimp! Yum  yum yum. AND I could actually eat the broccoli as it was cooked  to perfection which is a big plus. NOT that hard as a rock crap they throw in for color OR that mushy, horrid texture in your mouth stuff either. My only minor complaint would be I would have liked it a bit more juicy.But the taste was great .

The sesame chicken, not crazy for it (maybe it was the lettuce thrown in there) No, it was the sauce and actually pieces of chicken that turned me off. The sauce had little flavor and the chicken was a bit chewy. Lo mien was just o.k.,  the noodles seemed overcooked causing it to be soggy. 

Even though I said I was generous with the stars I do consider myself a fan. They had a few diner's in there and a few people picking up to-go orders in this small little place in a not so great spot.  So, obviously there are other fans out there as well. After all,  we can't ALL be suckers.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is positive because the reviewer highlights several positive aspects of the restaurant, such as the flavorful spring rolls, delicious garlic butter shrimp, perfectly cooked broccoli, and the fact that they consider themselves a fan of the place despite some minor issues with certain dishes. The reviewer also appreciates the mom-and-pop setup of the restaurant, indicating a personal connection and fondness for small, family-owned establishments. They acknowledge that the restaurant has a loyal clientele, further emphasizing a positive overall experience despite mentioning some areas for improvement.

question:
It's a pretty standard Chinese place primarily focused on take-out customers.  It's definitely not the "Best Chinese in Charlotte", but it's OK.  It's pretty much a standard Chinese restaurant menu with very little originality, surprise, or excitement.  

The picture of Yen on the wall is from like 1994, where apparently he got some acclamation in the Observer.  Hardly worthy of mention here a decade later.

Had the dumplings, spring rolls, mandarin chicken and Moo Goo Gai Pan.  All of which was average at best.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the review mentions that the Chinese restaurant is not exceptional or exciting, describing it as average at best. The lack of originality, outdated decoration, and mediocre quality of the food items like dumplings, spring rolls, mandarin chicken, and Moo Goo Gai Pan contribute to the negative review. Overall, the reviewer's experience did not meet their expectations or leave a positive impression.

question:
I got introduced to this place by my co-worker... it's a street side old convenience store looking place by the airport, completed with the "Pepsi" store sign that says Dixie Grill & Grocery.  So it looks "questionable," but let me assure you that they do serve food here.

We normally go on Wednesdays (um hum, today) for the cheeseburger lunch special... for $5.25 you get a cheeseburger (I get mine with chili & slaw), side and tea.  The other lunch specials through the week are: Monday 2 hot dogs, Tuesday chicken tenders, Wednesday cheeseburger, Thursday BBQ, Friday porkchop sandwich and Sunday Dixie dog (not sure what that consist of).  I normally get onion rings as my side, but the tater wedges are great too.

Personally the owner lady is the highlight of the visit.  She's this feisty older lady who sometimes has a different sense of hospitality (especially toward the male patrons).  But to me, she's always nice and sweet.

I like this place... for similar price, I would much rather enjoy my burger here than any fast food joint.  It has characters, make a great quick lunch place.  And that beer walk-in chest is very tempting during lunch :)
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer highlights several aspects of the experience that they enjoyed. They praise the affordable lunch specials, mentioning that they prefer the cheeseburger at this place over fast food options. They also appreciate the unique character of the establishment, such as the feisty owner and the nostalgic feel of the place with the old convenience store vibe. Additionally, the reviewer mentions that they find the owner to be nice and sweet, emphasizing a personal connection that adds to their positive impression of the place. Overall, the reviewer expresses enjoyment and satisfaction with the food, atmosphere, and service, leading to a positive sentiment.

question: I love Dixie Grill! It's a fun little place tucked away from all the hustle and bustle of your work day. Family owned and has great atmosphere!  Peggy the owner is one of the funniest ladies that will have you rolling out of your chair. Great food, great people, quick to order and lots of fun. I recommend it any day of the week! You have to try the Italian sub.... yummy! If you can stay and play around, you can always grab it to go! Call ahead! (704) 392-8828
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the review highlights several aspects that were enjoyed by the reviewer: the fun and quaint setting of Dixie Grill, the great atmosphere, the humor and friendliness of the owner Peggy, the delicious food, the quick service, and the option to dine in or take out. Overall, the reviewer had a great experience and highly recommends the restaurant to others, particularly praising Peggy and the Italian sub.

question: I have been going this HT every since it opened, a long time ago. Good people and good customer service
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the user expressed satisfaction with the service provided by the staff at the business over a long period of time. The user values the good customer service and speaks positively about the people at the establishment, indicating a long-standing positive relationship with the business.

question: I wish NoVa had a place this size and this beautiful! We did four trails in about 2 hours and saw turtles, fish, birds of all kind! There were picnic areas with BBQ pits along the lake. I loved it!
rationale: The review expresses enthusiasm and satisfaction with the size and beauty of the location, as well as the variety of activities and wildlife observed. The mention of enjoying the experience, the positive descriptions of the amenities like picnic areas and BBQ pits, and the use of exclamation points all contribute to a positive sentiment. Overall, the reviewer's tone is enthusiastic and appreciative, indicating a positive experience.

question:
Great place to go year round!
I hike here all the time and love it. There are lots of short trails for quick hikes and you can loop a few together for a longer hike. 
Tons of picnic tables and lake scenery. 
Hiking and kayaking here is great. The nature center has some good displays as well. 
If you're lucky, you might catch a glimpse if some wildlife!
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the review highlights several positive aspects of the place, such as its suitability for year-round visits, the variety of hiking trails available, the beauty of the lake scenery, the enjoyable activities like hiking and kayaking, and the interesting displays at the nature center. Additionally, the mention of possibly seeing wildlife adds to the excitement and appeal of the location. Overall, the review expresses satisfaction and enjoyment with the place, making it a positive sentiment.

question: Trees. Trails. Picnic tables and camping spots. I only wish that there was a dog park here and then it would be perfect!
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the individual highlights several positive aspects of the location, such as the trees, trails, picnic tables, and camping spots. They express a desire for a dog park to make it even better, indicating that they already find the place enjoyable and are looking for additional features to enhance their experience. Overall, their review suggests that they had a positive experience and view the location favorably.

question: Don't you love it when you have to beg the restaurant to put food out on a buffet? Whenever I go here, the place is decently busy but they always seem to have a problem with having enough food out on their buffet. Everytime a tray of food is brought out, it's such a tiny portion that its usually emptied out within seconds by all the hungry customers! If you're going to run a buffet and expect people to come back, AT LEAST have enough food there for your paying customers!
rationale: The sentiment in this review is negative because the customer expresses frustration and disappointment with the restaurant's buffet service. They mention that the restaurant consistently has issues with keeping enough food available on the buffet, leading to small portions being quickly consumed by hungry customers. The customer feels inconvenienced by having to ask for more food and expects a better dining experience for the price they are paying. This negative sentiment is reflected in their overall dissatisfaction with the restaurant's buffet setup.

question: Chicken teriyaki is good. Ordered cashew chicken, hot and spicy beef and Kung Pao chicken. Sauces were extremely bland - no flavor and zero spice in the hot and spicy beef. The beef was slimy and had the texture of pre-chewed food. Do yourself a favor and go to Masa right next to the Bi-Lo across the street.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the customer did not have a good experience with the food they ordered at the restaurant. The sauces were described as bland, lacking flavor and spice. The hot and spicy beef was particularly disappointing as it had no spice, a slimy texture, and unappetizing appearance. The reviewer even recommends going to a different restaurant instead, indicating their strong dissatisfaction with their meal.

question: Consistently solid experience. Americanized Chinese food at a decent price. And they are open until around 11:00 during the week. It's my solid go-to spot when I need Chinese food.
rationale: The review highlights that the experience at the Chinese restaurant is consistently solid, indicating reliability and quality in the food and service. The mention of Americanized Chinese food being offered at a decent price suggests good value for money. Additionally, the fact that the restaurant is open until around 11:00 during the week adds to the convenience factor. Overall, the reviewer describes the restaurant as their "solid go-to spot," indicating a positive and satisfactory dining experience.

question: I was not impressed by the lunch buffet. Small selection and over priced compared to what is available next door at Harris Teeter. But I find the regular meals are great. Food is prepared fresh and is very tasty. Good portion size for the money.  A great place to get take out.
rationale: The sentiment is Positive because despite being unimpressed with the lunch buffet, the reviewer found the regular meals to be great, with fresh and tasty food, good portion sizes for the price, and overall a great place for take-out. The positive experience with the regular meals outweighed the initial disappointment with the limited lunch buffet, making the overall impression positive.

question: This place is a crapshoot.....sometimes you can go through the line with no problems, sometimes you wait in a long line. Sometimes you get nice people helping you, sometimes they won't even crack a smile. Sometimes you get a fresh, fluffy bagel, sometimes you get one that you gnaw at so hard you think your teeth are going to fall out. Sometimes they get your order right, sometimes they don't Unfortunately, the latter has been happening more frequently than I like so I only foresee myself heading back there (if that at all) if I get one of their coupons in the mail
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer had inconsistent experiences at the place described. question: If you like a casual place, with great bagels, then this is the place for you! I could eat breakfast or lunch here everyday! I am so thankful that I can just walk right across the street from where I live and eat here.
rationale: The sentiment of this review is positive because the reviewer expresses enthusiasm for the casual atmosphere, compliments the quality of the bagels, and shows appreciation for the convenience of the location. The reviewer's statement that they could eat breakfast or lunch there everyday further indicates a high level of satisfaction with the restaurant.

question: This location is no longer open.
rationale: The sentiment is Negative because the reviewer is expressing disappointment or inconvenience that the location they were referring to is no longer open. This suggests that they may have liked or valued the location and are now missing out on the benefits or experiences it provided.

question:
When I needed heel tips replaced in my heels, I found out how very difficult it is to find a shoe repair place. A simple Google search won't get you to what you're looking for, so I asked for a recommendation. Fortunately my boyfriend and my colleagues all suggested the same place: Top Shoe Repair. Dropped my first pair of heels off here and they were returned in a day with new heel tips for just $10 and I've been a customer here ever since. The pricing (for females) is $10 per pair for heel tip replacement, or I believe $7 for an individual heel tip replacement.

I know you can buy new heel tips online for much less than $10, but I've tried the DIY thing (total failure) and I am more than willing to pay for the convenience of having someone else pry out the old nails and hammer those new little suckers into my shoes. And, maybe it's just me, but I've noticed they seem to do minor touch ups of the heel stem (for lack of a better word... I'm thinking of the part above the tip and below your heel that gets nicked up if you sit in a office chair all day) at no extra charge. Awesome!

Cash and credit accepted, but you must pay in advance. I've never had a misplaced shoe, so don't let that fact deter you from having Top Shoe repair your shoes.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer had a smooth and convenient experience at Top Shoe Repair. They received a quick turnaround time for their heel tip replacement at a reasonable price. The reviewer appreciates the quality service provided by the shop, including minor touch-ups without extra charge. Additionally, the reviewer feels confident in the shop's reliability, as indicated by the fact that they have never had a misplaced shoe. Overall, the positive experience, efficient service, and attention to detail contribute to the positive sentiment expressed in the review.

question:
When traveling on business, there's very little time in between meetings to get a descent bite to eat unless you're with clients. Charlotte, NC is know for their gerbil tunnels between office complexes. To save time,  each office complex houses the usual fast food chains.

I was told Chick-fil-A was one of the best fast food chains in the southeast.  Being from Nor Cal, my business trip to Charlotte gave me an opportunity to try this out.  I was not disappointed. Connoisseur of this fast food joint told me to order the Chicken sandwich with extra pickles, waffle fries and an Icedream. Great suggestion. 

I wish there was one closer to home.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is positive because the writer had a positive experience trying out Chick-fil-A for the first time during a business trip to Charlotte, NC. They were satisfied with the recommendation they received for their meal, enjoyed the food, and expressed a desire for a Chick-fil-A location closer to their home. The positive feedback on the food and the wish for a more convenient location indicate that the overall experience was enjoyable and left a good impression on the writer.

question:
This is by far my most favorite Chick Fil A to go to.Maybe because it's right across the street from work or maybe because the staff is so friendly (seriously, how can you not smile when someone says "My pleasure" in a sincere way?) There's always a line however it moves fast even with the lunch time rush. They take expired coupons so if you have one from a couple years ago, take it in and they will honor it! 

Around Christmas time, if you buy a $20 or $25 gift card, you get a free Chick Fil A calendar for the next year with coupons for each month. It's becoming a running joke in my family that I always ask for this for Christmas because it's such a great deal. They sometimes hand out samples of their milkshakes while you wait in line which is a nice gesture while you wait. Everything at Chick Fil A is bomb from their waffles fries to spicy chicken sandwich and they offer healthier alternatives such as their salads, wraps, fruit cups, etc. 

Be sure to check your receipt when you go because it may have a survey that you can do online in a minute or two and you get free code for one of their sandwiches or a drink. Eat mor chikin!!
rationale: The sentiment of the review is positive because the reviewer praises various aspects of their experience at Chick Fil A. They highlight the convenience of the location, the friendly staff, the fast-moving lines, and the accommodating policy of accepting expired coupons. The reviewer also mentions the great deals such as the free calendar with gift card purchases and the samples given out while waiting in line. They appreciate the variety of menu options and the healthier alternatives available. Additionally, the mention of receiving free items through surveys adds to the positive experience. Overall, the reviewer expresses enthusiasm and satisfaction with their visits to this Chick Fil A location.

question: I was down in Charlotte on business for five days and I ate here four of those days for lunch.  NEED I SAY MORE?
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer ate at the restaurant for the majority of their time in Charlotte, indicating that they had a consistently good experience and enjoyed the food enough to keep returning. This suggests that the food, service, and overall experience at the restaurant were satisfying to the reviewer.

question: Sweet tea and spicy chicken sandwich was yummy! Spicy chicken was actually spicy which was nice. Also criscut fries were seasoned appropriately.
rationale: The review expresses positive feedback about the food items mentioned - the sweet tea, spicy chicken sandwich, and criscut fries. The use of words like "yummy," "actually spicy," and "seasoned appropriately" indicates that the individual enjoyed the flavors and found the spiciness and seasoning to be to their liking. This positive feedback suggests that they were satisfied with their dining experience.

question: If McDonalds is the Toyota Corolla of the fast food world, Chick-fil-A is the Rolls Royce or Range Rover.  Yes, you will pay a little bit more than the dollar menu options at McDonalds or Taco Bell, but the quality is also light years ahead.  Chick-fil-A has pioneered the chicken sandwich, and they do it better than anyone else in town... yes, even better than Bojangles.  And the Plaza location has their act together; every day, they get slammed with a hungry lunchtime crowd of bankers, Duke Energy-ers, etc, and they consistently manage to fill orders correctly, quickly, and tastily.  Their hours are a bit shortened compared to other locations, as they close at 4pm, but stop by for breakfast or lunch (or an afternoon ice dream or milkshake snack!), and you won't be disappointed.
rationale: The sentiment is Positive because the review highlights several positive aspects of Chick-fil-A, including superior quality compared to other fast food establishments like McDonald's and Taco Bell, efficient and accurate service despite a busy lunchtime rush, and the deliciousness of their chicken sandwich. The reviewer also praises the specific Plaza location for consistently meeting customer expectations. These positive experiences and observations contribute to an overall positive sentiment towards Chick-fil-A in this review.

question: Great lunch spot. To repeat other reviews, the service is fast; probably the quickest I have ever experienced. As with most other locations I have visited, the staff is genuine and friendly.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer has highlighted positive aspects of their dining experience at the lunch spot. They mentioned that the service was fast, which is likely a desirable quality for most people when dining out. Additionally, the reviewer commented on the genuine and friendly nature of the staff, indicating that they had a pleasant interaction with the restaurant employees. Overall, the reviewer's comments demonstrate satisfaction and a willingness to return to the establishment, reflecting a positive sentiment.

question: Food is standard fast food, but... They have very impressive operations to handle the heavy foot traffics during lunch hours. DMV needs to take note here. Also the workers there are surprisingly friendly.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer highlighted several positive aspects of their experience: the impressive operations to handle heavy foot traffic during peak hours, the friendliness of the workers, and the suggestion that the DMV could learn from their efficiency. These positive points offset the initial mention of standard fast food, ultimately leading to a positive overall sentiment.

question: Five stars for being the fastest fast food place I have ever been to.  I get my food within 30 seconds of paying every time.  Food wise its a chick fil a, so not great.  Bit if I need a fast unhealthy lunch its great to have a place I can get in and out of in 2 minutes with my food.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer commended the fast food place for being extremely quick in delivering their order, with food ready within 30 seconds of payment. Despite acknowledging that the food quality may not be the best (not great), they appreciated the convenience and speed of the service, especially for a quick and unhealthy lunch option. Overall, the reviewer found value in the efficiency of the fast food place, leading to a positive sentiment in their review.

question: Best fast food in the biz imo.  Uptown location's service is impressive.  Hit lunch rush @ 12:30...line was easily 25+ deep.  In & out in 5 minutes.  Nailed my order (special requests to boot).  A++++++++
rationale: The review describes the fast food establishment as the best in the business, praises the impressive service, and highlights the efficient handling of a busy lunch rush with a long line. The reviewer also mentions that their special requests were successfully fulfilled. Overall, the review expresses high satisfaction with the overall experience, leading to a positive sentiment.

question: Fantastic Burrito! So much better than any of the other burrito places in Downtown (Uptown?) Charlotte. The line moves surprisingly fast and the service is great. Owner of the place was working the cash register and thanks you for coming in. \n\nOh...Guacamole is included for free.
rationale: The sentiment in the review is positive because the reviewer praises the burrito as being fantastic and better than other options in the area. They also appreciate the quick-moving line, great service, and personal touch of the owner thanking customers for visiting. Additionally, the mention of free guacamole adds to the positive experience. Overall, the reviewer had a satisfying and enjoyable dining experience, leading to a positive sentiment in their review.

question:
Felt compelled to write a quick review after having a phenomenal burrito here today. I've been going here for about three years and had some fine meals, but today was over the top. 

I usually get the regular size, but this time went for the big, along with the spicy chicken in green chile sauce. Since I was in a hurry, I just told them to load it with "everything". That included, rice, black beans, three kinds of salsa, cilantro, onions, sour cream, guac, chopped jalapenos, lettuce, and tomato - it was monstrously large! Still not sure how they wrapped it but they did. 

The taste was perfect - spicy, smooth, crunchy, warm. A lot of different flavors that together were a symphony in my mouth! Utterly and totally hit the spot. Added bonus - local place with local owners just putting out great product. 

Thumbs up Johnny B's!
rationale: The sentiment of the review is positive because the reviewer had a phenomenal dining experience at the restaurant. They were impressed by the quality and taste of the food, specifically highlighting the delicious flavors and perfect balance of spicy, smooth, and crunchy elements in their burrito. Additionally, they appreciated the large portion size and variety of fresh ingredients included in the dish. The reviewer also praised the local ownership of the restaurant, indicating satisfaction with supporting a small business that serves great food. Overall, the review expresses enthusiasm, satisfaction, and endorsement of Johnny B's, resulting in a positive sentiment.

question: I always forget about Johnny Burrito, its tucked away in the wachovia atrium building where its not front of mind. But when I do remember I am very excited to go there! \nThe food here is pretty good. I usu sally get the salad (with chips and lettuce). They have very fresh ingredients to top your burritos and salads. It is a little more expensive than salsariats and qdoba but you get more food for your money and you are helping a small business by going here! \nThe line looks so long but as others have said it's fast moving! It's another great place when you want to change it up with your lunch options!
rationale: The sentiment is Positive because the reviewer expresses excitement about going to Johnny Burrito when they remember it, praises the freshness of the ingredients, appreciates the portion sizes for the money spent, and highlights the efficiency of the service despite the appearance of a long line. Additionally, the reviewer encourages supporting a small business, which adds to the positive sentiment.

question:
The owner is there everyday, which is cool.
The prices are decent if u don't mind basically paying for a Rice/Bean Burrito with a dash of meat!!!!! 
(I don't want a bunch of filler, i want meat w/ filler..not Filler w/ meat)

They have a special on Friday's but.. its no good for me because I doubt I'll try it again. (I've been here 3x)
rationale: The sentiment is negative based on the customer's dissatisfaction with the portion size and value for money. They mentioned feeling like they were mainly paying for a Rice/Bean Burrito with a small amount of meat, which implies that they were not satisfied with the balance of ingredients in their meal. Additionally, their statement about not wanting "filler with meat" suggests a preference for a meatier dish. Furthermore, the customer tried the special on Fridays multiple times but was still left unimpressed, indicating a lack of enjoyment and willingness to return.

question: This is the best burrito in Charlotte in my opinion.  I have been to Phat Burrito too and was unimpressed.  They have more meat selections than your typical Moe's, Chipotle, Qdoba, etc.  They load the burrito up with toppings and they don't charge extra for guac (YES!!).  The hot sauces they have are HOT and I love it!  It sucks this place is uptown or else I would be a regular.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer praises the quality of the burrito, highlighting the variety of meat selections, generous toppings, free guacamole, and flavorful hot sauces. Additionally, the reviewer expresses a desire to frequent the establishment more often if it were more conveniently located. Overall, the review expresses appreciation for the positive aspects of the burrito and the restaurant, indicating a positive sentiment.

question:
This is my go-to place for lunch when I work downtown.  I like to eat healthily for lunch so I don't feel like I'm in a food coma after, and they have many healthy options.  

Also, you feel like you're walking into a friend's kitchen to grab lunch with the chatter going on. You get to pick all of your (probably 20 different ingredients) for your salad or burrito and... Bonus:  they have Twizzler Tuesday's, free chicklets (old school - love it!) etc. - that stuff cracks me up.  

The ingredients you can build for your burrito, salad, etc. are fresh and delicious.  Love this place and everyone who works here!
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer expresses satisfaction with the overall experience at the restaurant. They highlight the healthy food options available, the friendly atmosphere reminiscent of a friend's kitchen, and the fresh and delicious ingredients. The mention of fun promotions like Twizzler Tuesday and free chicklets adds a sense of enjoyment to the dining experience, showcasing the reviewer's appreciation for the quality of food and the friendly staff. They also express love for the place and everyone who works there, indicating a strong positive feeling towards the establishment.

question: Good food, pretty hard to find.  We were visiting from out of state and felt like Mexican.  So I found this restaurant with an app and it took a while walking up and down the block before we realized it was inside another building.  Even then, you have to search for it as it is tucked away.\n\nAnyway, once we found it we were pleased with the choice.  The burritos get to be pretty big and filling and the salads (my wife had the salad) is also large.  The chicken had good flavor and just a hint of spice.  The overall price was very good for the amount of food you get.  There was a long line and I now understand why, good food for a good price.  Also, the sweet tea is delicious if you like it pretty sweet.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the review highlights several positive aspects of the restaurant experience. The reviewer was pleased with the choice of the restaurant, enjoyed the food in terms of portion size and taste, found the prices reasonable for the amount of food received, and appreciated the delicious sweet tea. Despite the initial challenge of locating the restaurant, the overall experience was satisfying, as indicated by the positive comments on the food quality and value.

question:
4 food. 5 service. 

Pork & Chicken: regular on wheat
Black olives, cilantro, sc, guac, cheese, hot salsa. 

Good, but sloppy to eat. It was a while back & it didn't stick out to me enough to remember more than that...
rationale: The sentiment is considered positive because the review mentions "4 food" and "5 service," indicating satisfaction with the food quality and service. question: Friendly service, fresh and delicious food -- A truly local and consistently excellent establishment!
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the review highlights several positive aspects of the establishment such as friendly service, fresh and delicious food, and being consistently excellent. The use of words like "friendly", "fresh", "delicious", "local" and "excellent" all contribute to a positive overall tone in the review. The reviewer provides specific compliments and praises, indicating satisfaction and a high level of enjoyment with their experience.

question: A little expensive but first class customer service and fresh veggies and food all the way around.  Very personalized and very fast.  This is hands down the best burrito place in Charlotte and I am a burrito aficionado.  Sorry, but Phat Burrito has nothing on this unique dining experience.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is positive because the customer praises the first-class customer service, freshness of the veggies and food, personalized experience, and fast service at the restaurant. Additionally, the customer asserts that the place is the best burrito spot in Charlotte, even comparing it favorably to another popular establishment. question: This place is overrated. The food is no better then the other burrito places in uptown. I guess the private ownership and legacy reputation leads people to give it more credit than it deserves. You also get lip from the owner if you want to pay credit.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer expresses disappointment with the overrated food, suggesting that it is no better than other burrito places in the area. question: Best gas prices in Tega Cay.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the review is emphasizing the positive aspect of the gas prices in Tega Cay being the best. This implies that the reviewer is satisfied with the cost of gas in the area, which reflects a positive experience for them.

question: Terrible customer service.  Watch out!  I agree they are an unethical company.  I was with them for 10 years. I called to cancel my service months before the actual cancel date and the not so friendly customer service rep said I owe 90 days per an agreement back in 2002.  They dismissed my original cancel notice and said I have to pay at least 30 days more!!!  And she was doing me a favor and hung up on me!!!
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the customer experienced poor customer service, feeling mistreated and frustrated during their attempt to cancel their service. The interaction with the representative was described as unfriendly and dismissive, with the customer feeling unfairly treated and misled regarding the cancellation terms.
