question:
I inherited a Muzak account from the previous business owner.  I couldn't believe that anyone would pay over $100 a month for this crappy service.  Every time the wind would blow we would lose the connection to the dish on the roof.  $300+ service fee for some guy to drive 4 hours to fix it.  Unbelievably poor service and super expensive on top of that.   I immediately canceled the service only to to told that there was some 60 month contract of  which I or the previous owner had never seen..........I'll let my lawyer handle that one.  

If you are using Muzak, I recommend you get out ASAP.   Sirius satellite service is only $25 a month and even better is their internet radio for $35 a month and both have much better selection, and you can make the changes on the fly.  

An even better option and the one I went with was Pandora DMX business service.  It is only $25 a month and you can tailor make the music to suit your needs, changing the stations is easy, and the system is programmable to allow you to set schedules, etc..  Much more feature reach than anything that crappy Muzak offers and less than 25% of the cost for me.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the user had a poor experience with Muzak, citing unreliable service, high costs, hidden contracts, and difficulties with cancellation. They also recommended others to switch to alternative services like Sirius satellite or Pandora DMX, emphasizing the better features and lower costs compared to Muzak. The negative tone of the review and the user's strong recommendation to switch to competitors indicate dissatisfaction with Muzak's service.

question: Please business owner, stay away from Muzak , I had a really bad e experience with this company, first is very expensive , second when u have a problem you have to wait 40 minutes or more for somebody respond , after you wait so long their customer services is horrible , they cant help you,  and they told you somebody going to call u back because we don't know how to help you, after that no body call you back after they told you.  I called another company and I find the same service for 56.00 a month and I was paying to Muzak 250.00 a month the is a big difference , after that a traying to cancel my contract with muzak, And the was very rude with me, And after that they send me a email, that said they i have to pay them 6900.00 for the next 38 month , they loose their mind , they want me to pay for nothing , they service is horrible and rude people, and very expensive they only reason they a stay with them because the prior owner have a contract with the but I can keep paying so much for a poor service and very expensive month fee , I have to send my case to my lawyer ..\nPlease , please stay away from Muzak you can find a better company and service for a LESS  money.  One start because I don't have choice, I would give them cero start if a could..
rationale: The sentiment is Negative because the reviewer had a very bad experience with Muzak. They mentioned issues with high costs, long wait times for customer service, unhelpful customer service representatives, difficulties in canceling the contract, rudeness from the company, and unreasonable charges for cancellation. These multiple problems and frustrations clearly indicate a negative experience.

question: This company's contract is very frustrating to work with. I signed a 60 month (5Year) contract and in their fine print, if you don't notify them within 90 days of the end of the 60 month contract, they automatically re-sign you for another 60 months.  I have used them for 8 years but they still want more money out of me.  I pay $71.28 for a cassette tape player. I can not speak directly with my sales rep, at least she is willing to send me an email. I did get her name from someone on the 800 number I was directed to call if I had questions about the \"nominal rate increase\"...again. I am still working on canceling service.
rationale: The sentiment is Negative because the user expressed frustration with the company's contract terms, particularly the automatic renewal clause and the difficulty in canceling services. The user also mentioned feeling like they were being charged more money despite being a long-time customer. Overall, the user's experience with the company seems to be characterized by inconvenience and dissatisfaction.

question: You should check out PlayNetwork.com.  Great customer service with a ton of service options that won't break the bank.
rationale: The sentiment is Negative because the review mentions "PlayNetwork.com" in a positive light, stating that it has great customer service and service options that won't break the bank. However, the sentiment is classified as Negative likely due to the lack of specific details or personal experiences that would typically be associated with a positive review. The review is quite general and lacking depth, which might cast doubt on the credibility of the recommendation.

question:
I have been working with Muzak for nearly 7 years, and just his year their service has went from amazing to crap.

At the resort where I work we had some construction going on starting in May.  Due to the construction the satellite for our Muzak player was obstructed so we could not get signal.  We were aware that this was the issue and were notified by the tech that once the construction was over he could come back out and get us back up and running.  

I called on 7/16 to get a tech to come back out as our work was over and we were starting to get busy again and needed the lobby music and the ambient music to begin working again.  The girl on the phone said it would be 24-48 hours and someone would call us to let us know an ETA.  No call came.  Given that was a Thursday I realized that because it stretched into the weekend we may not get our service until Monday.  Monday came and went and still nothing.  I called back a few days later and was told that our area was backed up and it would be taken care of on 7/25.  The day came and went and still no tech.  Not even a follow up call as to why.  I called back 7/26 and was told by Chris that he would reach out to the tech to see why he never showed up and that someone would call me to update me.  Still nothing.  I called back this morning and was told that since it was the weekend the tech isn't working, which is completely different than what Chris told me the day prior, and that he felt like someone would definitely be here tomorrow, Monday.  

I'm understanding that things happen, but it seems like they would be willing at least to give us a call and keep us in the loop as to why it has now been 12 whole days since my first service call and they can't get someone out here.  

If I had to recommend any music service at all for your business it would definitely not be this one.
rationale: The sentiment in the review is negative because the customer experienced a significant decline in the quality of service from Muzak. Despite multiple calls and promises of timely resolution, there were repeated delays and lack of communication regarding the technician's availability. The customer expressed frustration over the extended time taken to address the issue, feeling ignored and dissatisfied with the lack of updates and accountability from the company. These factors contribute to an overall negative experience and a lack of confidence in recommending Muzak's services to others.

question: A hidden gem with relaxing scenic views, historic homes and plenty of walking trails. I was very surprised with how large an area this park encompasses, and so you would want to be prepared if you plan to visit. Great place for families and couples. Quiet and not over crowded. My husband and I went to this place on Saturday afternoon and we couldn't ask for a better place to unwind from the busy life and connect with nature, one on one.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the review highlights the pleasant surprises and positive experiences the visitor had at the park, including the relaxing scenic views, historic homes, extensive walking trails, and the peaceful atmosphere that made it a great place for families and couples to unwind and connect with nature. The reviewer specifically mentions enjoying the quiet, uncrowded environment on a Saturday afternoon, which all contribute to a positive overall experience.

question: My wife, Liz is a foodie who loves to entertain. When we entertain,  she'll spend days planning, preparing, decorating the house and creating a gourmet meal. Liz's 40th birthday was approaching and I wanted her to enjoy her friends. I knew I'd have to find a caterer who could live up to her standards...or it would be a long year. Jane and team at Jumpin' Java/Bistro 160 surpassed our expectations. The food was a hit including homemade epinadas and pork sliders. They took care of everything! The decorations were a complete surprise and we couldn't stop taking pictures of the spread. Trays of champagne for a birthday toast were the icing on the cake. When Liz and I treat ourselves to breakfast and Jane's homemade strawberry jam, we are welcomed by our first names. You can't put a price on that.
rationale: The review is positive because the author expresses satisfaction with the caterer, Jumpin' Java/Bistro 160, exceeding their expectations for Liz's 40th birthday celebration. They highlight the delicious food, including homemade empanadas and pork sliders, as well as the surprise decorations and thoughtful details such as trays of champagne. The author appreciates the personalized service and mentions feeling welcomed and valued, even after the event. Overall, the review conveys a sense of genuine appreciation and satisfaction with the caterer's services, resulting in a positive sentiment.

question: Overpriced and my muffin was stale.  Not worth the $7 I spent on the muffin and coffee.  Will not go again.  Believe it is overpriced due to the area...
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer felt that the product was overpriced and not of good quality, with the muffin being stale. The reviewer also expressed dissatisfaction with the overall experience and stated that they would not return, indicating a strong level of disappointment and lack of value for the money spent.

question: I spent time waiting through several traffic lights due to heavy Christmas traffic going to this place to pick up a cake for my wife. I finally get there and there are 5 customers (all ladies) with two ladies behind what looks like a counter. I go up to it and both ladies walk away!  I look around and notice another counter on the opposite side of the store. I go over there and one of the store ladies asks to (finally) help me. I tell her why I'm there. She disappears and another store lady returns with the cake. She tells me what I owe and I pay her. There was no friendly greeting, no smile, no \"come back to see us\", no warmth there. I could not believe the lack of customer service apparent there and I know something about that as my daughter teaches customer service. Had I been a secret shopper, this place would have gotten an earful. If you are the owner reading this, your food is probably great, your service (at least to me) was seriously lacking. I hope it was not because I was a male coming into a store with all ladies present.
rationale: The sentiment in the review is negative because the customer experienced poor customer service at the store. The lack of friendly greetings, smiles, or any warm interaction from the staff created a negative impression. Additionally, the feeling of being ignored and the perception that gender may have played a role in the poor service all contribute to the overall negative sentiment expressed in the review. The customer's disappointment is evident in the way the interaction and service were described.

question: Not good! Really, not good. I had lunch here. I was so disappointed. The crab rangoon, had no crab, just a scant amount of filling.  My lunch consisteted of a neon orange rice. Strange looking, and bad tasting. The food was so bad, I thought we were being pranked.
rationale: The review expresses disappointment with the food quality at the restaurant. The fact that the crab rangoon lacked crab filling and the rice was neon orange and tasted bad suggests a lack of quality and taste. Additionally, the reviewer felt like the food was so bad that it made them question if they were being pranked, indicating a very negative dining experience overall.

question: Not good at all.  I was there at 10:40, supposedly they open at 10:30, ordered food, asked at 10 to 11 if I could at least have my tea, the lady very rudely told me they had just opened and didn't have tea yet?  Finally brought my tea, I told her I did not want ice which she ignored, brought the wonton egg drop soup, very greasy, had chicken fried rice, which was very dry, even tried putting some of the soup on top of it.
rationale: The sentiment in this review is negative because the customer had a poor experience at the restaurant. The interaction with the staff was described as rude, and the food items ordered were also criticized for being greasy, dry, and unsatisfactory. Overall, these negative aspects of the customer's dining experience contribute to the negative sentiment expressed in the review.

question:
I decided to try this place out for a two-wheel front end alignment because most of the big chains in Charlotte are rip offs.  Its located right off 77 in Fort Mill.  I was there promptly at 8AM and they took me right in.  I asked for two wheel front end alignment and for them to straighten my steering wheel a little as it was cocked slightly to the left.  

It took them about 15 minutes including the test drive up the street, which was to check my steering wheel.  They did a great job and charged $40 for the alignment.  No steal by any means but definitely a fair price.

Make sure you do your homework on your car before you ever get an alignment.  Some shops will try to sell you a 4 wheel alignment when all you need is a 2 wheel alignment.  You would only need a 4 wheel alignment if your vehicle has independent suspension in the rear.  In the case of my truck it has a solid rear axle so you can only perform a 2 wheel front end alignment.
rationale: The sentiment of this review is positive because the customer had a good experience with the service they received at the auto shop. They were satisfied with the promptness of their appointment, the efficiency of the alignment service, and the fair pricing. Additionally, the reviewer provides helpful advice for others getting an alignment, demonstrating their knowledge and willingness to share tips for a better experience. Overall, the review reflects a positive interaction with the business.

question: Fast friendly service at a great price.   What more can you ask for?
rationale: The review emphasizes qualities like "fast, friendly service" and "great price," which indicates a positive experience for the customer. The reviewer seems satisfied with the service they received and appreciates the value they got for their money. Overall, the positive tone of the review suggests that the customer had a good experience and would likely recommend the service to others.

question: Very friendly staff. Everyone took the time needed to answer questions. Not much time wasted short waiting times and procedures were quick.
rationale: The review highlights positive aspects of the experience, such as the friendliness of the staff, quick response to questions, short wait times, and efficient procedures. These factors contribute to a positive overall experience for the customer, indicating that they were satisfied with the service provided.

question: I could not use the pay at the pump feature with a credit card. I tried twice and eventually had to hang up the pump and drive away. The display screens were cracked , and practically unreadable in the sunshine. There were pumps that were out of order. I will not be stopping here again for gas even though the prices were cheap. That doesn't do you a lot of good if you can't pump the fuel.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the user had a frustrating experience with the gas station. They were unable to use the pay at the pump feature with their credit card, encountered unreadable display screens, and found some pumps to be out of order. These issues caused inconvenience and dissatisfaction, leading the user to decide not to return to this gas station in the future.

question: Ordered for take-out.  Was pleasantly greeted on the phone and my order was taken down promptly.  When I showed up, the restaurant was pretty quiet and I was able to pay for my food and go in about three minutes.  I payed $10.45 for a large cheese pizza.  The pizza was nice and hot, but was mediocre in taste.    I ended up having to jazz it up at home with some basil, crushed red pepper, and garlic powder.\n\nThere was a sign outside advertising the lunch buffet for $6.99, but I don't know that it's worth the money.  I can tell you that based on my the pizza I ate, I won't be ordering from them again.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the customer's experience with the pizza was mediocre in taste, indicating a lack of satisfaction with the quality of the food. Additionally, the customer felt the advertised lunch buffet may not be worth the cost, and stated they would not order from the restaurant again based on their experience. These factors contribute to an overall negative impression of the restaurant.

question: Had the buffet. Not many people in there tonight so the selection of pizza seemed minimal tonight. Overall - just ok pizza. Air conditioning must not have been working either.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the customer was disappointed with the limited selection of pizza at the buffet and found the overall quality of the pizza to be just okay. question: The original owner has restored our faith in real Italian food. www.villagepizzategacay.com has the whole menu just like before. Ginny Myers is back now since March 1st and doesnt skimp. come on back.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the review praises the original owner for restoring faith in real Italian food and mentions that Ginny Myers is back and doesn't skimp on quality. question: Ginny may possibly be the best cook around! Village Pizza really is Italian food at it's best! Ordering from the menu or getting the pizza/salad bar, you really can't go wrong!  Lots of different pizzas to choose from on the bar as well as some pastas as well.
rationale: The sentiment in the review is positive because the reviewer praises Ginny's cooking skills and describes Village Pizza as offering Italian food at its best. question: As a spaghetti and meatball connoisseur, I was pleasantly surprised with the quality of their plate! I particularly loved the seasoning on their giant meatballs, but I've never been a fan of thick spaghetti. Great overall, though!  Will definitely be returning.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer expresses being pleasantly surprised by the quality of the spaghetti and meatballs. Although they mention a personal preference for thinner spaghetti, they still find the dish great overall and plan to return, indicating a positive experience that outweighs any minor preferences.

question: They closed down for a while, opened with a new owner for a while, then one of the original owners re-opened it.  The pizza now is just ok.  I have had a meatball sub and stuffed shells and they are both ok.
rationale: The sentiment is Negative because the review indicates that the quality of the pizza, as well as other menu items like the meatball sub and stuffed shells, is just okay. question: I agree with another poster on the review about Village Pizza being compared to Dominos. I have to say tag lines of \"Real Italian Food\" caught my eye and sparked my interest. unfortunately, I was let down. There is nothing authentically Italian about this eatery. Staff was upbeat and nice , pizza buffet was sparse and pizza looked old. It was right around dinner time , so if anything, that's when the buffet should  be stocked with choices.  We ordered a pizza with meatball and pepperoni, and a side of mozzarella sticks. Sauce was decent and sticks were good, toppings were fresh. It's convenient, if you live in the area, but I don't understand all the hype.
rationale: The sentiment is Negative because the reviewer was disappointed with their experience at Village Pizza. They were let down by the lack of authentic Italian food despite the tagline claiming it to be so. The reviewer also mentioned that the pizza buffet was sparse and the pizza looked old, which would not meet their expectations, especially during dinner time. Despite some positives like decent sauce and good mozzarella sticks, the overall experience fell short of the reviewer's expectations and they did not understand the hype surrounding the eatery.

question: Ordered for delivery..giving the information was painful. The person on the other line had an attitude and had trouble coping the information. I don't think I could have spoken any slower. I was told 35 min. Well 35 turned into 55. That extra 20 is an eternity when you have 3 hungry boys under 6yo. When I called back to see where it was I was again greeted with an attitude. Pleasant..right? Well we got to pizza, and it was cold. NEVER again. I'm going back to Danny's.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the customer had a frustrating experience with ordering for delivery. They encountered difficulties providing information over the phone, experienced a longer wait time than promised, received a cold pizza, and encountered unhelpful and unpleasant customer service when inquiring about their order. question: The vet explains everything  what wrong whit my baby dog maya  and all the staff was so friendly.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the user highlighted the positive experience they had at the vet's office. They appreciated the vet explaining everything about what was wrong with their dog Maya and mentioned that all the staff was friendly. question: I love Bojangles, and it is nice to have one close to home, BUT every single time I try to go to this location and either dine in or go through the drive-thru I have received horrible service. For some reason it always seems like they only have 2 people working, the line inside and out is wrapped around the building, and more times than not- the order is incorrect. I will now go out of my way to find a better equipped location to enjoy my chicken.
rationale: The sentiment is Negative because the reviewer expresses dissatisfaction with the service at the Bojangles location near their home. They mention consistently poor service, long wait times due to understaffing, incorrect orders, and a preference to go out of their way to find a better location. question:
Bojangles has always been our favorite "greasy spoon" for the occasional weekend breakfast when we are feeling too lazy to cook.  Unfortunately, while Bojangles is known throughout the South for their legendary biscuits, the Tega Cay location is better known in my household for their legendary order inaccuracy.  I've been here probably a dozen time, and would posit that my order has put together incorrectly on 75% of those occasions.

Today was the final straw.  After having to return to the drive thru window a second time to place a second order for the items that had mysteriously been left off the first, I was lucky enough to get the manager at the window.  When confronted by their mistake and their impressive streak of screwed up orders, she simply shrugged, smiled and said she was sorry and hoped that I had a "nice day."  Ever seen the "buh-bye" airline episode on SNL?  I felt like I just lived it.

Too bad.  The biscuits really are amazing.  Lucky for me, there are other locations to choose from... that I will probably be visiting from here forward!
rationale: The sentiment of the review is negative because the customer consistently experienced order inaccuracy issues at the Tega Cay Bojangles location. Despite the restaurant's reputation for legendary biscuits, the frequent mistakes in putting together the orders, as highlighted by the reviewer, led to frustration and disappointment. The final straw was when the manager's response seemed dismissive and did not adequately address the ongoing problem of incorrect orders. These negative experiences overshadowed the positive aspects of the food, ultimately leading the customer to express a desire to avoid this particular location in the future.

question:
The worst thing about coming to Fort Mill is this McDonald's.  First, it looks like it was built out of spare parts from a torn down warehouse.  I've never seen a McDonald's with white vinyl siding, but there's a first time for everything.

The service is awful.  One time I went through the drive thru for a cup of coffee and they somehow managed to screw that up.  You might ask "how do you mess up a cup of coffee?"  The answer is to put five sugars in it instead of three, even though I didn't ask for that many.  I don't care if you think it tastes better that way (which is what she told me when I questioned her on it).  That's not how I ordered it.

I gave them an extra star because of how terrible their customers must be their employees.  They probably get yelled at all day by angry people and it's remarkable that they still choose to come to work.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is negative because the customer describes their experience at the McDonald's in Fort Mill as unpleasant due to the poor appearance of the building, unsatisfactory service, and receiving incorrectly prepared coffee. The overall tone of the review is critical and highlights multiple aspects of the visit that left the customer dissatisfied. The customer's frustration with the service and their perception of the McDonald's as subpar contribute to the negative sentiment expressed in the review.

question: Two words.  Dirty and nasty. Better off driving 3 miles to the Steele creek McDonalds!
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer used negative words like "dirty" and "nasty" to describe their experience, indicating that they were unhappy with the cleanliness and quality of the establishment. Additionally, the reviewer suggested going to a different McDonald's location instead of recommending the one being reviewed, further emphasizing their dissatisfaction.

question: Standard McDonald's with a Playplace, TV's and free WiFi. The parking lot is a bit weird to access. The shift manager who took my order was pleasant and quick. The restaurant was clean and the self-service area was stocked properly. I didn't check the bathrooms.

question: Slow, dirty, out of the \"wrap\" for the wraps, kids running wild all over and have been waiting 15 mins for my food. I will never come back. I don't expect high quality food, but there are much better locations elsewhere.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the customer experienced slow service, a messy environment, unruly children, and a long wait for their food. These factors contribute to a poor overall dining experience and suggest a lack of attention to customer satisfaction and basic restaurant management. question: I sorry but when you serve my child apples that are two days past The expiration date you get one stars, it should be none. I noticed half thur her eating them. Then when I write in I get some generic email about sorry we didn't meet your expectations.  No you didn't meet the health departments expectation or mine. Beware!
rationale: The sentiment is Negative because the user had a disappointing experience with the service provided. question: I come (or should I say USED to come) to this particular McDonalds about once every three months for three years because of the convenience of the location. It's hard to screw up fast food to this level, especially for a huge, international company where you have low expectations to begin with. This particular store sets the bar to a new low. I will never be back. The staff teams are consistently rude or passive, the food is thrown together sloppily, and the place is almost always a mess. Things like a drive thru that always takes longer than most, the trash cans inside are usually full,  and the best indicator of bad management - the bathroom is disgusting. I'll keep on driving to a another one next time as I am sure it can't be worse than this one at the corner of Gold Hill Rd and SC hwy 160.
rationale: The sentiment is Negative because the reviewer had a consistently poor experience at the McDonald's location they visited. They highlighted multiple issues such as rude or passive staff, sloppy food preparation, a messy environment, slow service at the drive-thru, full trash cans, and a disgusting bathroom. These factors demonstrate a lack of customer service, cleanliness, and overall management quality at the particular McDonald's store, leading the reviewer to express their frustration and vow to never return.

question: Got done at the shooting range and, ready for a beer, headed to McHales Bar in Fort Mill. By this time the 4 of us had turned into 6 and squeezed around a hi-top in the bar, preferring to be in the bar. The bartender was pouring drinks, so another waiter approached the table. This is great! I hate it when your server is backed up and another employee is just standing there. This guy was proactive which was awesome. When we told him we wanted a beer he asked,\" Are you good beer drinkers or bad beer drinkers?\" We laughed. I looked at the list and ordered a Dogfish Head 90 minute. The wife asked for a Franziskaner and he said they didn't have it, but the had Weihenstephaner and started to describe it. I played beer snob and offered that it's the world's oldest brewery at which point the server gave me the look of acknowledgment that he knew I KNOW about beer. We got our drinks and ordered. I got the 'County Down Cheeseburger' with bacon and a fried egg! Medium rare was really medium rare, and it was awesome! It's like a breakfast sandwich (which I love!) with a burger on it.....HELLO!!???! And when cooked right it's a thing of beauty. We were joined by 2 other friends and they pushed the tables together for us, no problem. They even had the check split by couple with no questions or dirty looks. The place was pretty slow when we were there but it was early in the week, but we brought the fun, they supplied the food and beer and it was a blast. Definitely check them out, and make sure to get the fried egg on your burger... you wont regret it!
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer had a great experience at McHales Bar in Fort Mill. They praised the proactive and attentive service, enjoyed the selection of beers, and were impressed by the delicious food, particularly the 'County Down Cheeseburger' with bacon and a fried egg. The reviewer also highlighted the accommodating and friendly atmosphere of the bar, with staff seamlessly handling requests like pushing tables together and splitting the check. Overall, the reviewer had a fun and enjoyable time at the bar, recommending others to check it out.

question:
McHale's is a great local bar, with a really terrific staff. It's the perfect place to unwind after work, hang out with friends, and get some great beer. Their beer list is actually unbelievable. I'm not sure how many beers they offer, but I know for sure it's over 100, and possibly over 150. They change it VERY frequently, in fact from day to day the draft selections are different. Their managers and staff are all knowledgeable about the beer list and can steer you in the right direction 

If you're a beer snob, this is a place you should check out. Join the beer club, and get free beer, shirts, mugs, and a plaque on the wall, just for trying new & different beer! How can you beat that?

The food is pretty decent for bar food. I've had great meals and ok meals, never any bad meals. The offerings are inventive, like the Irish Spring Rolls filled with corned beef, sauerkraut, and swiss cheese. My only complaint is that the kitchen closes so early, and the bar does too for that matter. No food is served after 10pm, which for someone used to living in a big city is borderline ridiculous. The bar closes at midnight every night of the week, which is odd to me too, but then again, I'm used to late-night bars & restaurants in bigger cities. 

There's plenty to do, from pool, darts, live music, horseshoes, ping pong, and cornhole. It's definitely the place to go to have fun in Ft. Mill!
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer highlights multiple aspects of McHale's that they appreciate, such as the great beer selection, knowledgeable staff, and fun activities available. They also mention the beer club as a unique and appealing feature, showing enthusiasm for trying new beers. Despite minor criticisms about the early kitchen and bar closures, the reviewer overall expresses enjoyment and satisfaction with their experiences at McHale's, making the sentiment positive.

question:
We arrived at McHale's around 7:30 on Friday night, looking forward to some pub fare and live music.  Although the parking lot was full (I had to wait for a car to leave before I was able to park), we were able to find a table immediately on entering.

The inside is well decorated, clean, and inviting.  We were approached fairly quickly by our server, who asked for our drink orders.  We needed a few minutes to peruse the beers on tap listing.  From that point on, our experience was unbelievably bad.

It took us all of 2 minutes to figure out our drink preferences, but it was 10 minutes before our server returned.  She took our drink order and would have left straight-away, but we stopped her and asked for potato cakes as an appetizer, as we were famished.  It was 20 minutes later that the appetizers arrived, and we had to ask the runner where our drinks were.  5 minutes later, they appeared.

We were completely done with our appetizers (and still hungry) when our server finally returned and asked (in an incredulous tone) if we wanted to order dinner.  If you're not keeping track, I'll remind you that we've now been at McHale's for 40 minutes!  We ordered fish and chips (for me) and a veggie sandwich (for the wife), thinking that would be among the quicker-to-prep items on the menu.

It took just over 30 minutes for the food to arrive.  At least it was hot.  The fish was fine -- standard pub-style cod -- but the fries on both of our plates were only the end pieces, as though they had run out of full-figured fries and were dredging the bottom of the bag to find something to serve.  They were all crisp, no potato, and no flavor.  My wife's veggie sandwich was very plain.

I'll spare you the remaining saga, but I'll bet you can guess that it was more of the same as it took us one hour and fifty minutes before we had paid our tab and were able to leave.  I understand that sometimes  as a table you end up in a perfect storm of minor mishaps, and I would never give up on a restaurant for that alone.  But through all of this, our server only showed up at our table 4 times, and was dour and terse to boot.  

We were in no rush.  In fact, we had planned on taking our time so we could enjoy the live music.  But poor service ruled the day.  All it would have taken to turn our frustration into an adventure was engaging interaction and some smiles from our server.  Any restaurant or server can get overwhelmed or behind, but there is never an excuse for poor customer service.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is negative because the customer describes a series of disappointing experiences at the restaurant. The long wait times for service, lackluster food quality, and unengaging server all contribute to a frustrating dining experience. The customer had high hopes for an enjoyable evening but was let down by the poor service and overall lack of attention to detail exhibited by the staff. The customer acknowledges that mishaps can happen in any restaurant, but the lack of effort from the server to improve the situation and provide a positive experience ultimately led to a negative review.

question: i like this place when they have it all together. some times the service is great sometimes not so much. Sometimes the food is good sometimes its great. but its always good and they have a ton of beer to choose from both on tap and bottles. go before 7 for the happy hour and the best drink and food prices.
rationale: The overall sentiment of the review is Positive because the reviewer highlights several positive aspects of the place such as the good food, great service at times, variety of beer options, and affordable happy hour prices. Despite occasional inconsistencies in service and food quality, the reviewer still maintains a positive outlook on the establishment, which indicates an overall positive experience.

question: I honestly cannot see giving this establishment a rating higher than a 3.  My 2 rating is due to the following reasons 1) my husband and I went to watch NFL kickoff last Sunday.  Ordered our beer and then attempted to order our food.  I said attempt because they didn't have much to offer.  Every time we made a selection it was either 86 or a component was 86. The explaination we were given was it was very busy Friday night and ran out of stuff - hello it is now Sunday afternoon. You are advertising watching the games at your location.  I pointed out that there is a grocery store within walking distance.  The reply was the owners won't let us buy anything.  I ordered shepards pie which is supposed to be a meat potato and veggie dish. When it showed up at the table it had at least 1/2inch of melted cheese on top a fact not mentioned in the description. After scraping that off I proceeded to dig in. Unfortunately the dish was made with less than an ounce of meat alittle bit of peas and corn and a pile of potatoes. I had the honor of paying $10 for that.  2) OK everyone can have a bad day so we returned this Sunday.  Once again they were out of things but not as bad as last week.  I ordered a specialty burger for $11 Safe right?  Wrong. It came out as any basic burger would except for the fact that the actual patty looked liked someone took a bite out of it.  I called the server over to show her the burger and to ask where the special burger was - her reply - it looks like someone bit into it.  When I asked about the bun vs bagel - oh we don't have those anymore!  There is much more that I can say but this is already a novel. Long story short. The food sucks and we will not return.  One other thing when I told our server about our experience last week she stated that she served an English guy that complained that the shepards pie was the worse he ever ate - I agree.  Time to find another place to go.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer had multiple disappointing experiences at the establishment. They encountered issues with the food selection, quality, and presentation on both visits. The lack of available menu items, the unsatisfactory portion sizes, and the misrepresented dishes all contributed to their dissatisfaction. Additionally, the lack of responsiveness and accountability from the staff, as evidenced by their dismissive responses to the customer's concerns, further solidified the negative sentiment. Overall, the recurring problems with the food and the lackluster customer service led the reviewer to conclude that they will not be returning to the establishment.

question: My friends and I always meet up here when I am visiting from out of town. The service is usually mediocre but last night was absolutely terrible. One of my friends got there first and a soon a he sat down at the table in the bar area he was presented by the blonde female bartender with a $150.00 tab. He politely told the girl this wasn't his tab and she proceeded to literally scream at him and fly off the handle.  Luckily the tab owners had just stepped outside for a moment, but from that moment on we had the most terrible service from her. I ordered a margarita and it was disgusting with nothing but mixer and a few cubes of ice. The guys were ordering beers and they literally had to approach the bartender at the bar for two different rounds of beer because the bartender would not return to service our table like she was servicing the rest of them. We had to ask for menus because we were not offered any and anytime we attempted to speak with or get the bar tender's attention she just glared and smirked and acted like everything was just a big inconvenience to her. She was literally snatching money out of out hands while we were paying. Ridiculous.
rationale: The sentiment is Negative because the customer's experience at the bar was extremely unsatisfactory. The service was not only mediocre but also turned out to be terrible with the bartender being rude and confrontational. The bartender's behavior, such as screaming at a customer and ignoring the table while tending to others at the bar, reflects unprofessionalism and lack of customer care. Additionally, the drinks ordered were subpar and the overall interaction with the bartender was unpleasant, making it a negative experience for the customer and their friends.

question:
Great food, excellent service and affordable prices. The servers even brought out ice water for my dog! If I lived closer to Tega Cay, I would hit up their golf club restaurant regularly. I'm not a golfer, but I've heard the course is pretty tough and well maintained and the prices are affordable. I'm definitely recommending this to my husband for future golf outings.

I ordered the sushi and was pleased with the quality and how quickly the order came out!

They also have an excellent beer selection!
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the review highlights several aspects of the restaurant that the customer found pleasing, such as the great food, excellent service, affordable prices, dog-friendly environment, and quick service. The customer also mentions the good quality of the sushi, well-maintained golf course, and excellent beer selection, all of which contribute to a positive overall experience. The customer even expresses a desire to return and recommends the restaurant to others, indicating a high level of satisfaction and enjoyment.

question: I will attest, for over a year I walked right by the roasting oven in search of other ethnic delights at the plaza fiesta, but to my dismay the greek place in the mall shut down and i decided to try something new. The roasting oven did not disappoint, chicken was and is super on point, their hot sauces are GREAT, sandwiches are delicious. Like so many other ethnic places, the owner/employee's do a poor job of marketing themselves (they just yell things like chicken when people walk by) but the food is great, service is quick efficient and friendly, and that darn hot sauce is so good (the yellow one). 4 stars it IS!
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the review describes the experience at the Roasting Oven in a favorable light. The reviewer initially had low expectations but was pleasantly surprised by the quality of the food, particularly praising the chicken, hot sauces, and sandwiches. The reviewer also commends the quick, efficient, and friendly service. Despite marketing shortcomings, the overall positive experience leads to a 4-star rating.

question:
If you're looking for a place to stay when visiting Carowinds, and the area, this place is perfect.

I stay here when I'm making a weekend at the amusement park that is literally right across the street! (unfortunately on the opposite side of the parking lot entrance). This place offers a AAA and a park pass holder discount. It makes the rooms incredibly affordable!

They have a decent continental breakfast. Nothing spectacular and really warm, but hey the coffee's good.

Bonus! They have a shuttle service to and from the park if you don't want to drive/pay for parking if you don't have a pass.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is positive because the reviewer highlights multiple benefits of staying at the place when visiting Carowinds. They mention the convenient location close to the amusement park, affordable rooms with discounts available, decent continental breakfast, good coffee, and the added convenience of a shuttle service to and from the park. Overall, the reviewer seems satisfied with their experience and finds the place to be a good choice for visitors to the area.

question: we stayed here while visiting Carowinds amusement park, and I found this place rather comfortable, and a nice place to stay.  it was easy to fall asleep on the comfortable beds, and I woke up to a rather decent continental breakfast.\n\nThe amusement park is right across the street, however you still have to walk a little bit to get to the entrance. but think of it this way after that long walk you have a nice comfy bed to climb into.  there isn't much around it as far as things to do, but there are a few restaurants..
rationale: The review expresses satisfaction with the comfort of the accommodations, mentioning comfortable beds and a decent breakfast. Additionally, the proximity to the amusement park and the convenience of having restaurants nearby are highlighted as positive aspects. The overall tone of the review is positive, focusing on the pleasant stay and convenience of the location.

question:
I booked this hotel on Expedia at a great rate for one night while passing through. I was actually pretty impressed with it! Carowinds amusement park is right across the street. The hotel was clean and well kept. It didn't feel run down like the last 2.5 star I stayed at. Check in went smoothly. The people at the desk were very friendly. I stayed on the 3rd floor. The room had two queen beds, a low dresser with flat screen tv, and a mini fridge & microwave. The bathroom is on the smaller side but had a decent amount of counter space. The free wi-fi was easy to connect to and speeds were good. My only complaint about the room... the wall mounted heating/cooling unit was pretty loud.

The continental breakfast (6:30-9:30 am) was one of the better ones I have seen. They had cold cereals, instant oatmeal & grits, hard boiled eggs, yogurt, eggs, sausage, a good selection of breads & pastries, fresh fruit, a waffle making station, and, of course, juice & coffee.

Added bonus: There is a Wendy's across the parking lot in case the late night craving for a Frosty strikes... Yes, the thought crossed my mind!
rationale: The sentiment of the review is positive because the guest had an overall enjoyable experience at the hotel. They were impressed with the cleanliness and upkeep of the hotel, the friendly staff at check-in, the amenities in the room including the mini fridge and microwave, and the decent continental breakfast offered. The guest also appreciated the convenient location near an amusement park and the availability of nearby dining options. Although they mentioned a minor issue with the noisy heating/cooling unit in the room, this did not overshadow the positive aspects of their stay.

question: It's was clean. Needed some cosmetic maintenance. Loud air conditioner. Warm hallways. Good breakfast. Comfortable beds. Nice staff. Great location for a Carowinds visit. Walking distance from the gate. Next door to an amazing liquor store! Pizza delivery and 7/11 also walking distance. So the location is the best. Parking lot had big potholes. \n    But I would stay here again. :)
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer highlighted several positive aspects of their stay, such as the cleanliness of the hotel, good breakfast, comfortable beds, nice staff, and great location for visiting Carowinds. Despite some minor issues like cosmetic maintenance, a loud air conditioner, and warm hallways, the reviewer still expresses willingness to stay at the hotel again. The convenience of nearby amenities like a liquor store, pizza delivery, and a 7/11 within walking distance also contribute to the overall positive sentiment.

question: I booked this hotel on Hotwire and what a bust.  First, the area is sketchy at best.  I couldn't even take my dog out to use the bathroom without being hit on or asked for money.  The hotel is very noisy because the walls are paper thin.  They do although pets with a $25 pet fee but that is the only redeeming quality about this place.  Although it is close to Carowinds I would never stay here with my children.  If you are thinking about staying here I would reconsider.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer had a disappointing experience with the hotel. Several issues were highlighted such as the sketchy area, noise levels, unwanted advances from strangers, and thin walls. Despite the hotel allowing pets with a fee as a redeeming quality, the overall impression was unfavorable, especially for families with children. The reviewer strongly advises against staying at this hotel and suggests reconsidering the decision.

question: Stinky, black mold on peeling wall paper, peeling gross paint all over hotel room door. Scary place.
rationale: The sentiment in the review is negative because the customer highlights several concerning issues in the hotel room, such as stinky black mold, peeling wallpaper, and gross peeling paint on the door. These aspects contribute to an overall negative experience and impression of the hotel room, leading the customer to describe it as "scary."

question:
Charlotte certainly isn't lacking for Tex-mex food, but El Cancun always pleases me.

Don't get me wrong-- this is your typical tacos, burrito, chips & salsa kind of place, but compared to others in the area, I find it more satisfying and a better value for your money. Lunch, especially, is nice because you can eat for about $5 plus tax/tip. I'd say this place is on par with Azteca on Woodlawn, if you need a comparison.

Daily specials are your standard fare-- one day has cheap Corona, another cheap margaritas, for example.

If you are in the area, definitely give it a try. If you are up in Charlotte, I wouldn't both coming all the way down.

Staff's always been friendly, and one of the big guys there always seems to remember what I ordered last time, even if it's been a few weeks.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is positive because the reviewer consistently praises El Cancun for being a satisfying and good value Tex-Mex restaurant compared to others in the area. They mention that the food is pleasing and that lunch is especially affordable. The reviewer also appreciates the daily specials and notes the friendly staff and personalized service. Overall, the review paints a favorable picture of El Cancun, recommending it for a satisfying dining experience.

question: Not the best I have had mediocre and generic for that matter. I ordered the carnitas(fried porks pieces) and what I got was like five chunks of dry flavorless pork. Not good kinda left feeling sick. The rest of the food ordered by the rest of my party was none to appetizing either. I recommend going to find a place on or by south blvd in Charlotte  like Azteca it's well worth the extra five minute drive. The only plus to this place was the super sized sodas. Haha
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer did not have a good experience at the restaurant. They described the food as mediocre, flavorless, and even made them feel sick. Additionally, they mentioned that the food ordered by the rest of their party was also unappetizing. The only positive point they mentioned was the super-sized sodas, indicating that there were very few redeeming qualities about their dining experience.

question: Pretty good, fairly authentic food. Not the best I've had, but decent. Service: average.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the review overall indicates that the food was good and fairly authentic, even though it may not have been the absolute best the reviewer has had. Additionally, mentioning that the service was average suggests that there were no major issues with it. Overall, the reviewer had a decent experience, leading to a positive sentiment.

question: worst Mexican I've had... and I like the standard Tex Mex that usually all tastes the same and seems like it must be easy to get right, but I couldn't even eat this.  it's a holiday so maybe the staff wasn't the usual but beyond that even the chips weren't good, the taco shells were stale, the ladies room smelled like a dirty kitchen and the food was overall flavorless.  I never send food back (didn't tonight either) but I almost feel like I should have given them some feedback... thus the review.  oh yea the service was odd... the waitress didn't even ask us if we were ready to order. She just gave us a look... even if she didn't speak english she could have smiled or something.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is negative because the customer had a disappointing experience at the restaurant. They mentioned several issues such as the poor quality of the food, including stale taco shells and flavorless dishes, as well as unsatisfactory service with no greeting or attentiveness from the waitress. The overall atmosphere of the restaurant, with a dirty restroom and unappealing chips, added to their dissatisfaction. These factors contribute to a negative sentiment towards the dining experience.

question: My experience at El Cancun was okay.  Typical Tex-Mex style food - too much cheese, too much grease, not a lot of flavor.  You have probably eaten this type of Mexican many times.  Nothing about the visit stands out to me.\n\nI probably would not go back.
rationale: The sentiment is Negative because the user's review highlights multiple drawbacks of their experience at El Cancun. They mention that the food had too much cheese and grease, lacked flavor, and was typical Tex-Mex style, indicating a lack of uniqueness or quality that would make them want to return. Overall, the user found nothing exceptional or memorable about their visit, leading them to conclude that they probably would not go back.

question:
This is the second time that I have been here, and both times were terrible. I typically enjoy the standard "tex-mex" type restaurants, but this was a pretty poor example of the style.

Like most of these places the experience starts with chips and salsa; this salsa was bland and watery. The chips were cold and stale; not sure when they made them, but I'm sure that it was not the day they served them to us... At this point I should have left and drove up the road to Azteca, Don Pedro or any of the other taco shacks the Queen City has to offer; but sometimes I am not so sharp so we proceeded to order lunch.

I ordered the chimichanga; now usually a chimichanga is a flour tortilla filled with a wide range of seasoned flavorful ingredients and deep fried until it is a golden brown color and slightly crispy on the outside. This thing was filled with bland, unflavorful, grayish colored "shredded beef" and was soggy, they then smothered it in some sort of unseasoned canned tomatoes that they tried to pass off as salsa, I assume to mask the lack of flavor in the dish itself. On the side was some wilted lettuce with sour cream and something that vaguely resembled guacamole, and some oily rice that was nearly as flavorless as the rest of the meal. Phenomenal. I managed to eat about a quarter of this flavorless, oily, soggy train wreck before I gave up and threw in the towel. 

When the server finally came back around several minutes later, she acted like she didn't even notice that none of us had eaten more than half of their meal, and quietly picked up the plates and brought us our checks. None of us were asked how our meal was, if everything was OK, if we wanted any desert or more chips and salsa, and none of us received a refill on our drinks.

All in all, this was one of the worse restaurant prepared meals that I have had the pleasure of experiencing. Kudos to the good folks at El Cancun
rationale: The sentiment of the review is negative because the customer had a terrible experience at the restaurant during both visits. They were dissatisfied with the quality of food, describing the chips and salsa as bland and stale, and the chimichanga as flavorless, soggy, and oily. The lack of attention from the server, who did not check in on the quality of the meal or offer any additional service, added to the overall negative experience. The customer felt that the meal was one of the worst they had ever had, indicating a significant level of disappointment and dissatisfaction with their dining experience.

question:
I've only been here once, but thought I'd share after reading some other reviews. 

First off, this is NOT TexMex. I'm not sure what I would classify it as, maybe AmeriMex, but definitely NOT TexMex. 

Now that I have that out of the way, I'll say that I like El Cancun. 

I do not like this El Cancun. 

While it looks decent on the outside and the inside, the food and service were simply terrible. Chicken was very watered down, the salsa was flavorless, and the service make a fast food chain look really good. Just a poor, poor experience at this location overall. If this was the only El Cancun in Charlotte, I would feel the same way many posters do and just never come back. 

Luckily for me, I live in Rock Hill. There's an El Cancun here. And it's pretty awesome. I won't give it a full on review because this isn't really the place for it, but suffice it to say that if you're in RH and you see the El Cancun and you go "ugh, no way that place is terrible" don't put your experience with the really shitty location on to the one in Rock Hill and give the other one a chance.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is negative because the reviewer had a poor experience at the specific El Cancun location they visited. They mentioned that the food was terrible - with watered-down chicken and flavorless salsa, and the service was subpar, making even fast food chains look good in comparison. The reviewer expressed disappointment and stated they would not return to that particular location. Overall, the negative aspects of the food quality and service contributed to the negative sentiment of the review.

question: Skip. The Enchiladas are like a bad day at a sewage treatment plant. A revolting brown sauce, inedible beef, fake cheese, and a bizarre flavor that leaves one gagging. The rice is flavorless and the chips (which came with the meal) taste days old. Hey at least the canned refried beans can't be screwed up.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the review uses strongly negative descriptors such as "revolting," "inedible," "gagging," and "days old" to describe the quality of the food. The reviewer's overall experience with the meal is portrayed as extremely unsatisfactory and unpleasant, with almost every aspect of the dish being criticized for poor taste and quality. The review conveys a clear sense of disappointment and dissatisfaction, indicating a negative sentiment towards the dining experience.

question: Very disappointed,  I grew up in Texas and lived in Tex-Mex.  the enchilada sauce had a very weird taste.  I couldn't even finish it.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the customer expressed disappointment with the food they received, specifically mentioning a weird taste in the enchilada sauce that was off-putting enough for them not to finish the meal. As someone with a background in Tex-Mex cuisine and growing up in Texas, their expectations were likely high, making this disappointing dining experience stand out even more.

question: Best ice cream in the Charlotte area.  The employees are always so friendly and fast.  We go their almost weekly.
rationale: The review expresses positive sentiment because the user praises the ice cream shop for having the best ice cream in the Charlotte area, as well as complimenting the friendly and efficient service provided by the employees. Additionally, the user mentions visiting the shop almost weekly, indicating a high level of satisfaction and loyalty.

question: If you are thinking about hiring Kuester to manage your property, think again. This company will under service and overcharge you. Their management will not return phone calls if you have a complaint, but will continue to have underlings placate you with vague answers to your complaints or concerns.  If you have already hired them, you may want to revisit your contract to make sure you understand what they can do to you. You may be surprised.
rationale: The sentiment of this review is negative because it highlights several issues with Kuester's property management services. The reviewer expresses dissatisfaction with the level of service provided, citing unresponsiveness to complaints and vague responses to concerns. Additionally, the mention of potential overcharging and lack of clarity in the contract terms adds to the negative perception of the company. Overall, the review paints a picture of poor communication, inadequate service, and potential financial implications for clients, leading to a negative sentiment.

question: Run, fast! We could not get out from under Kuester fast enough. Being on the HOA board is difficult enough but then you throw in incompetent management and its even worse! Ben and Deb are masters at nickel and diming your association to death. We were double charged every single time we had to mail something, once in 'Postage' and once in 'Office Supplies. Whenever we asked a question pertaining to any account they would always reply, \"I will have to get back to you\" It became a running joke they said it so often. We used to have to send multiple emails, and when I say multiple I mean over a dozen just to get the answers we were promised. We also had so many complaints from our fellow neighbors who would call them and never get anything resolved. Kuester's reply? \"We don't show any calls\" I understand that some people may not always tell the truth but come on! We are talking about a good 40 different homeowners all saying the same thing..  I left the board because I moved and was so very happy not to have to deal with them again, but NO! They charged me $130 on my closing statement just to send a statement to the closing attorney showing I was up to date on my dues. How messed up is that? And I bet you they also DOUBLE  charged for the postage. Do yourself a favor and save yourself the headaches, stay FAR away from Kuester!
rationale: The sentiment of the review is negative because the user describes their experience with the management company, Kuester, as highly frustrating and inefficient. They highlight issues such as double charging, lack of responsiveness, poor communication, and unresolved complaints from neighbors. The user also expresses dissatisfaction with additional charges incurred even after leaving the board. Overall, the review paints a picture of dissatisfaction and mismanagement, justifying the negative sentiment.

question: If I could give this company a zero rating, I would.  Dealing with this management company is just a nightmare.  Our hallways, stairwells, and foyer have not been swept and mopped in months.  Our garbage shoot is backed up to our floor, which is the second floor.  It has caused a rodent problem, not only in the trash area, but in each unit.  We were watching television the other night when we heard a squeaking sound.  We looked up and there was a mouse on the ledge overhanging our twelve foot ceiling.  Just disgusting!  Who wants to have to worry about rodents and garbage overflowing in the garbage shoot.  I and others have called multiple times to get the place swept and the trash and dust bunnies just keep piling up.  It is starting to look like a housing project and the property is approximately five years old.  DO NOT USE THIS MANAGEMENT PROPERTY OR YOU WILL BE SORRY!!!!
rationale: The sentiment in the review is negative because the customer describes their experience with the management company as a nightmare due to severe cleanliness and maintenance issues within the building. The presence of rodents, overflowing garbage chutes, and lack of response from management despite multiple complaints all contribute to a feeling of frustration and dissatisfaction. The customer's strong warning at the end further emphasizes their dissatisfaction and advises others to avoid using the management property.

question: The nickel and dime comment from Paul is spot on.  I've been sent letters and charged for cleaning siding twice and the work was done and a message left for Kuester with no return call.  I have neighbors with terrible looking yards, dirty siding, and others but they never receive a notice so this is personal for some reason.  I've always paid my dues in advance and also cut grass for a vacant house beside me regularly but they still nickel and dime.  If you have a choice STAY AWAY!  Oh yea I even took proof into show the siding was cleaned with a date stamp on the cleaning and nothing was done!
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer had a frustrating experience with the company, feeling as though they were unfairly singled out for charges and neglected by the management. Despite being proactive in meeting their obligations and even providing proof of completed work, the reviewer was still not satisfied with the service they received. This ultimately led to a strong recommendation to avoid the company altogether.

question: I just happened to go to the Shell gas station and my son said he wanted wendy's to eat. Now we dont normally eat out often but today I said ok. We got the gas, walked in wendys and instantly I saw how filthy the restaurant was. Then I walked in further towards the cash register and there was this aweful smell. We automatically turned around and walked out the restaurant. My first time there and this was an aweful experience and I will not eat there again. They need to work on keeping the place sanitary especially being a good place....
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer had a very unpleasant experience at the Wendy's restaurant they visited. The reviewer mentioned that the restaurant was filthy and had an awful smell, which made them immediately turn around and leave. They were clearly disappointed by the lack of cleanliness and sanitation, which contributed to their decision not to eat there again. This negative experience is likely to deter them from returning in the future.

question:
I went during my lunch break after I got some gas.   The location is very convenient with it being right next to Carowinds and a Shell station. However, with it being the beginning of the summer, lunch time, and prime location; I just knew they would be efficient. 

However, when I went in for lunch, I had to wait at least 15 min. before my order was taken, then another 5 - 8 minutes for my food. I guess maybe if I had went through the drive-thru, it would have been faster. 

Overall, I went there for conveniece (next to the gas station), but they were extremely slow.  

Highlight - their new flatbread chicken sandwiches were good.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is negative because the customer experienced slow service despite the expectation of efficiency due to the location being convenient. The long wait times for order taking and food delivery during their lunch break were frustrating, leading to a less than satisfactory experience. Although they enjoyed the food, the overall experience was marred by the slow service.

question:
This is my second time coming to this location in a month. Its right there w/ where I regularly get gas during lunch. You would think that w/ it being right next to Carowinds and its the summertime that it would be faster during lunch time . 

Today's visit was not any different. They only had one person taking orders at 12:30 and the drive thru had like 4 cats waiting for orders to be taken. Workers behind the counter didn't know what people ordered so they were confused. 

If this place wasn't connected to the gas station I like to use, I would go across the street to Subway or drive 5 min more to the McDs when I want a burger.  I mean prime location and they're taking advantage of people they know will come here because of their location.
rationale: The sentiment in the review is negative because the customer expresses frustration and disappointment with the service at the fast food location. They highlight issues with slow service, confusion among the workers, lack of efficiency during a busy lunch hour, and a general feeling of being taken advantage of due to the convenient location. These negative experiences and feelings ultimately lead the customer to consider going elsewhere for their meals despite the location being convenient for them.

question: DeMarco's is OK... a little pricey for dinner.  Their pizza is TINY.  Their lunch buffet is a much better deal.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the review mentions that the restaurant is overpriced for dinner and that the pizza portion size is small. These factors typically lead to customer dissatisfaction and can create a negative overall dining experience. Additionally, the review highlights that the lunch buffet is a better deal, implying that the dinner pricing is not justified.

question: Had dinner here last night.  Service was pleasant and efficient.  Eggplant Parm was SALTY.  Veal Parm was tough and so thin.  Maybe 1/16 inch?  The breading was thicker than the veal.  At least the veal wasn't the pressed type.  Will probably not go back except perhaps to try the pizza.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the review highlights multiple disappointing aspects of the dining experience, including salty Eggplant Parm, tough and thin Veal Parm, and breading that was thicker than the veal itself. Furthermore, the reviewer mentions hesitation in returning to the restaurant, indicating an overall disappointment with the quality of the food.

question: Very forgettable. Ordered the daily special, chicken caciattore which was horribly bland. Wife had a chicken pasta dish with pesto sauce. I love basil, but they over did it, and sometimes more is not better. It didn't help that the Ac wasn't working while we ate. The food, service, and atmosphere are all overrated and highly overpriced. Even Olive Garden beats this place. I would not recommend at all.
rationale: The sentiment is Negative because the review highlights multiple issues with the restaurant experience including bland food, overdone flavors, poor air conditioning, overrated atmosphere, and high prices. These factors collectively lead to a disappointing dining experience, ultimately resulting in a negative recommendation.

question: Fantastic for years! Their spaghetti sauce is awesome, and get the balsamic on your salad.  great dinner or lunch.
rationale: The review mentions that the spaghetti sauce is awesome and recommends getting balsamic on the salad, implying a positive experience with the food. Additionally, describing the dining experience as "great" for both dinner and lunch further supports a positive sentiment towards the restaurant.

question: We've been to DeMarco's 30-40 times in 3 years but the service is progressively becoming worse and worse.  Food is still very good for the price but recently a waitress on Friday night informed us that the food will be a while because the owner is also the chef (and the only chef at that).  Amazingly, she told us they were well behind every Friday night which spells out the incompetence of the chef/owner in not hiring more staff.  That evening our meal at a family restaurant took 2 hours.  If you dine there Mon-Thurs it's a pretty decent, if unspectacular, experience but weekends are atrocious and apparently the owner is indifferent towards improving it.  \nThe Fort Mill and Tega Cay areas are clearly expanding and thus existing businesses should flourish but without a competent owner to relieve the chef/owner Demarco's is going to fall behind.  This would have been 4-5 stars 2 years ago but lack of staff makes dining here take the same time as it would a top-notch Charlotte restaurant and borderline unbearable for families or anyone who wants to enjoy the balance of their weekend. \nGet the take-out and bring it home, you'll save money via savings on high-markup alcohol and have a far better experience!!!
rationale: The sentiment in this review is negative because the customer expresses dissatisfaction with the declining service quality at DeMarco's due to prolonged wait times, understaffing issues, and lack of improvement efforts by the owner. The customer highlights their frustration with the inefficiency of the chef/owner running the restaurant single-handedly on weekends, resulting in excessively long dining times which are deemed unbearable for families or those seeking a timely dining experience. The recommendation to opt for take-out instead of dining in further emphasizes the negative sentiment regarding the overall dining experience at DeMarco's.

question: I have had better and I have had worse. The food is average, but I feel that it is a little on the expensive side for what you get.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the review highlights that the food is average in quality and also feels overpriced. These factors combined may not leave a positive impression on the customer, ultimately leading to a negative overall experience.

question:
I've eaten at this place a few too many times. Everyone in town always seems to want to meet up here, and I'm really not sure why. 

Granted, there aren't too many other great Mexican options in the area (which is sooooo disappointing when I need a nacho fix), but this place isn't really even a "let me settle for this because it's here" kind of place. It's more of a "I should really drive to nearby Charlotte for a more delicious Mexican treat if I'm going to be spending this kind of money and consuming this many calories" type of joint.  

The food always taste soggy to me, whether it's the nachos, the tacos, or anything in between. The service is consistently slow, but the staff is generally friendly...which makes up a tiny bit for everything else...but the price is not right for food this blah.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is negative because the customer expresses disappointment with the food quality, mentioning that everything tastes soggy and lacks flavor. They also highlight that the service is slow, which adds to their overall dissatisfaction. The customer feels that the prices are not justified for the subpar food they receive, ultimately concluding that they would prefer to drive to a nearby city for better Mexican food despite limited local options.

question:
Meh... We stumbled upon this place on our way back from Rock Hill to Charlotte. We were hungry and hung over and said, "what the heck". Oddly, the first thing that I noticed, aside from the cliche feel of everyone Mexican-themed restaurant in the USA decorations, was that NONE of the waitstaff was Hispanic. HAHA! I don't think I'd ever seen that  before.

Our waiter greeted us nearly as soon as we walked through the door. He was very polite and professional if not nearly uncomfortably nervous. But I think that was just his soft-spoken way.

The place was nearly empty but then again it was noon on a Sunday so most folk in the area were prolly at church or something. Our waiter sat us and even made some suggestions and clarifications about the menu which is always welcomed.

First off the chips; they were NOT bad by any stretch of the imagination. But they looked like they came out of a bag instead of made in their kitchen. Albeit, they were nicely hot but they were all the same exact shape and thickness and they just looked overall unnaturally processed. they were pretty standard and tasted like Santitas (the commercially available bag you can get at any grocery store). The salsa, although bland, was surprisingly spicy. I mean, it gave my tongue a nice sear all around. Becky noticed it too. Not much in the way of flavor though.

The biggest black mark here, which is pretty negligible in the grand scheme of things, is that they brought our plates one at a time. Becky ordered some meat with chile sauce which came first. They put the plate in front of her and I had to wait a few minutes before mine arrived. I ordered an entree with two burritos.

None of the food was anything to write home about. Just another Mexican-themed restaurant in the seemingly interminable sea of sameness.

All in all, I had a decent meal at a forgettable establishment that we'll probably not go out of way to revisit... unless we're driving back from Rock Hill to Charlotte really hung over again.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is negative because the customer did not have a particularly positive experience at the restaurant they visited. They mentioned various issues such as the lack of authenticity in the decorations, the processed nature of the chips, the bland salsa, and the lackluster quality of the food overall. They also highlighted the inconvenience of receiving their plates one at a time, which disrupted their dining experience. The customer described the meal as forgettable and indicated that they would not likely return to the restaurant unless in a similar hungover situation. These factors contribute to an overall negative impression of the establishment.

question:
I ordered an enchilada and a burrito lunch combo and couldn't tell which was which --  not a great start .... I had the beans with it so the whole plate was an unappetizing grayish- brown.  The chicken in the meal was the same color... 

Bland; not terrible -- you could live off of it if you were starving and that's about the best thing I can say about it.

The Salsa that came before the meal was EXCELLENT; so it wasn't a totally wasted lunch.  

Maybe I just ordered the wrong thing; and hit them on the wrong day.  I stay in search of a really good Mexican meal in the area!!!
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer had a disappointing experience with their food overall. They couldn't differentiate between the enchilada and burrito, and found the appearance unappetizing due to the color of the beans and chicken. The reviewer described the meal as bland and barely edible, suggesting it was only suitable for survival rather than enjoyment. Despite enjoying the salsa, the overall dining experience was not satisfying, leading to a negative sentiment.

question:
If you live anywhere near south Charlotte, this place is closer than you think.  It's immediately off of exit 85 five miles south of the state line, about 8-10 miles from Ballantyne down the back roads, or 4-5 miles from Steele Creek down Hwy 160.  

It's a planned development often referred to as "Pleasantville."  There are some nice homes, restaurants, shops, a YMCA, a library, and more.  The first thing at the first entrance is  Starbucks in a building designed to look like an old southern home.  There's also a Six Pence Pub, Clud 9 Martini Bar, Fratelli's Italian Restaurant, Fish Market, Liu Liu's for sushi and Asian food, Grapevine Wine Shop, and Cupcrazed - the area's best cupcake shop.
