They opened about a year ago and recently won the season finale of Cupcake Wars on the Food Network.  

It's a nice area to walk around, and they also have many pub crawls and festivals.  There are also some trails in what's left of the trees that were torn down to make this place.  There really aren't any major chain stores or restaurants in here, which is nice.  Almost everything is local, except for Starbucks and the Beef O'Brady's (which is a locally owned franchise).  Baxter is worth checking out if you're near the state line.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is positive because the reviewer highlights the convenient location of the place, the variety of amenities and services available, such as restaurants, shops, and recreational facilities like the YMCA and library. They also emphasize the sense of community with events like pub crawls and festivals, as well as the focus on local businesses rather than major chain stores. The mention of the area being a planned development referred to as "Pleasantville" suggests a pleasant and welcoming atmosphere. Additionally, the specific recommendations for local establishments like Cupcrazed, which recently won a competition on the Food Network, further add to the positive sentiment by implying high quality offerings in the area.

question: I love this little place!  It is so cute and perfect for a nice cool evening.  The other reviews are right about Starbucks.  It's the most adorable Starbucks I've ever been to!  I suggest a stop in there for coffee, and then some wandering around.  There are a ton of little shops, restaurants and even a wine shop.  The neighborhood in the back is pretty sweet too, providing a little walking trail complete with a map and bridge.  This is a great spot for a date night, or meeting friends for drinks.  \n\n...I may even wander around with my dog and pretend we live in the neighborhood.  If you see the girl with a Starbucks and sheepdog, please wave!
rationale: The sentiment of the review is positive because the reviewer expresses love for the place, appreciates its cute and perfect ambiance for a cool evening, and praises the inviting atmosphere of the Starbucks located nearby. They also highlight the variety of shops, restaurants, and amenities available in the area, such as a wine shop and a walking trail. Furthermore, the reviewer mentions the neighborhood's charm and suitability for different types of social gatherings, such as date nights or meeting friends for drinks. They even humorously mention pretending to live in the neighborhood with their dog. Overall, the reviewer's language is enthusiastic and complimentary, indicating a positive experience and a high level of satisfaction with the location.

question:
Jackpot!  The correct answer is: South Carolina.  Frugal's is the best location to buy beer, wine and liquor or spirits in the same place if you live in Charlotte.  Seriously!  It's just a fifteen minute drive down by Carowinds.

The store is literally divided in two - liquor on the left side, beer, wine and everything else on the right side.  Two separate doors.  You need a law degree to understand why they have to do that.  But everything you could possibly need for a huge party is under one giant roof and they take credit cards.

Their website is confusing.  ".com" is the Nashville store and ".net" is the Carolinas store.  The marketing person who told them that was a good idea should be shot, tarred, feathered and then shot again.

Not open on Sundays!  Sometimes the Lord giveth.  And sometimes she taketh away...
rationale: The sentiment of the review is considered positive because the reviewer praises Frugal's as the best location to buy beer, wine, and liquor in the Charlotte area. They highlight the convenience of the store being divided into two sections, offering a wide selection of products under one roof. Despite mentioning the confusing website and being closed on Sundays, the reviewer's overall tone is approving and complimentary towards the store's offerings and convenience.

question: Frugal's has excellent service and a decent selection of beer and wine on one side of the store and a good selection of the stronger stuff in the spirits section.  The place gets packed on weekends and around holidays.
rationale: The review mentions that Frugal's has excellent service, a decent selection of beer and wine, and a good selection of spirits. Additionally, it notes that the place gets packed on weekends and holidays, suggesting it is a popular spot. Overall, the positive attributes mentioned in the review, such as good service and variety of drinks, contribute to the positive sentiment. The mention of crowds on weekends and holidays also indicates that the establishment is in high demand, adding to its positive reputation.

question: Frugal MacDoogal's is a nice beer and liquor warehouse located on the state line next to Carowinds.  One side is for beer and wine and the other is for liquor.  They are carrying more and more craft beers, but the masses generally aren't buying them.  I've seen Fat Tire, arguably the most popular craft beer next to Sam Adams, close to expiration.  People tend to go here to get a lot of cheap beer for a party and not necessarily to find local or micro brews,  They recently installed a growler station which is decent, but doesn't compare to Grapevine's just a few miles down the interstate.  Two of the four taps were from New Belgium, another one was from a different Coloroda based brewery, and the only Carolina one was Thomas Creek.  I wanted some of that but the keg was spent.  They brought a keg of yet another New Belgium beer - the Ranger IPA.  I got that because it was relatively inexpensive and it's similar to the Thomas Creek IPA.  The actual growler bottles were cheap though at only $3.  Most places charges between $10-20 for your first time purchase.\n\nYou will find the major beer you want in here, although you will really only save money if buying a lot of it.  Also, they offer a cash discount, so if you pay with a credit/debit card you'll pay more (yes, this is perfectly legal). They also do beer and wine tastings, so check their site for details.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is positive because the reviewer highlights several positive aspects of Frugal MacDoogal's, such as its wide selection of beer and liquor, including craft beers, and the recent addition of a growler station. The reviewer also mentions specific beers they enjoyed, like the Ranger IPA, and praises the affordability of the growler bottles. Additionally, the reviewer notes that the store offers cash discounts and hosts beer and wine tastings, showing that they appreciate the value and experience provided by Frugal MacDoogal's. Overall, the review reflects satisfaction with the store's offerings and indicates a positive overall experience.

question:
Frugal MacDoogal's gives me the same giddy tingling feeling that I get from going to Earthfare.  Why?  Maybe it's because I always hit Frugal's before a road trip (The alcohol is for the destination...or is it?)  Maybe it's because the sight of Carowinds excites me.  I think it's because Frugal's is kind of like a candy store for adults that drink alcohol.

The liquor side and the beer/wine side are both filled with domestic and imported gems of adult mood enhancers.  If I'm looking for something a little unusual, Frugal's has a good chance of having it.  They didn't have the Pumking beer from Southern Tier I was looking for last time I was there though...Booooo (no Halloween pun intended...or was it?)

If you're really in to your wine...Frugals is hit or miss...it's not exactly a place to go discuss the nose and finish of your favorite Cabernet.  The best part about the place is that it's across the state line...and we know we'd rather purchase booze in SC than in NC.  The prices aren't coupon quality...but they're not horrible either.

Try:  Those buckets you fill with liquor...yes...the ones you've always rolled your eyes at.  You will be surprised at how convenient they are to stick in the freezer at the beach.

Avoid:  Urinating on the side of the building.  I mean really...what the hell dude!
rationale: The sentiment of the review is positive because the reviewer expresses excitement, enjoyment, and satisfaction with their experiences at Frugal MacDoogal's. They mention feeling giddy and tingling, likening the store to a candy store for adults who drink alcohol. The reviewer appreciates the selection of liquor and beer/wine at Frugal's, noting the variety of domestic and imported options available. Despite a minor disappointment with a specific beer not being in stock, the overall tone of the review is positive, highlighting the convenience and appeal of the store, especially for stocking up before a road trip. Additionally, the reviewer recommends trying out certain products, showing a level of engagement and enthusiasm towards the offerings at Frugal's. Overall, the review conveys a sense of enjoyment, fun, and satisfaction, indicating a positive sentiment.

question:
Pros:
Selection of liquor, beer, wine, chasers and gifts
Rarely out of anything
Discounted price if you use cash (debit card with pin # qualifies)
Tastings!!

Only con is parking. It's not the most convenient place to get to unless you know exactly where you're going. Compound that with a busy weekend or holiday and its bananas,
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the review highlights several strong points of the liquor store, such as a wide selection of products including liquor, beer, wine, chasers, and gifts, rarely running out of items, offering discounts for cash payments, and hosting tastings. The only noted downside is related to parking convenience, which is a minor issue compared to the many positive aspects mentioned in the review. Overall, the positive features outweigh the negative, leading to a positive sentiment.

question:
I am in total adoration of this place.  Like a kid in a toy store, I explored all the merriment and wonder around me with a youthful giddiness nearly long forgotten.  Seriously, this place is pretty darn magical.

The selection here is pretty amazing.  My partner and I were able to find several interesting beers we had not seen at other locations in Charlotte.  The liquor side was awesome as well.  I had never seen some of the brands sold there.  They had rum tastings going on that day (I mean, who turns down a chance to try free booze??), so I tried some of the rum varieties they had out.  I think I discovered a new favorite (and reasonably priced) coconut rum.

The prices on both sides were pretty good.  I really loved that they offered cash discounts.  I only wish this place was closer, although I'd probably drink more if it was.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is positive because the reviewer expresses adoration for the place, using enthusiastic language like "magical" and "youthful giddiness." They appreciate the selection of beers and liquor, finding unique options not available elsewhere. The positive experience of trying rum tastings further adds to their enjoyment. Additionally, they mention reasonable prices and the bonus of cash discounts, indicating overall satisfaction with the value offered by the establishment. The only downside mentioned is a wish for the place to be closer, which is a minor drawback compared to the overwhelmingly positive aspects highlighted in the review.

question:
This is my go-to liquor store. On my way home. Relatively easy in and out. Good prices for hooch, particularly if you pay in cash. As a craft beer fan, I always peruse the oat soda section. The selection is decent, but be careful, there can be some expired suds lurking. The prices vary - usually good, if you pay cash - but not always. Shop accordingly.

The growler filling station needs help. Last time I used it, a dude who I wasn't sure could spell bee-er filled up a growler of (I think) Heavy Seas in a *clear* growler. I asked if he had a towel I could wrap it up in for the trip home. He simply stared at me. I let it go, and made a dash for home with all haste.

Beyond that, the staff there always struck me as sad and apathetic, trudging through the day, one day closer to retirement or eating a bullet, whichever comes first. A few nice smiling faces here and there, but the friendly visages only mask the gray, limp existence that their collective lives seem to have become.
rationale: The review contains positive aspects such as the convenience of the liquor store being located on the way home, relatively easy in and out access, and good prices, especially if paying in cash. The reviewer also appreciates the decent selection of craft beers despite some potential issues with expired products. Even though there are some criticisms regarding the growler filling station and staff demeanor, the overall sentiment is positive due to the reviewer's continued patronage and positive experiences with pricing and product selection.

question:
I finally got the chance to stop in here and check out what they have to offer.  Very clean space, kind of tight to maneuver in there but nothing un-manageable.  I was most impressed with the cash versus credit pricing.  You can save over 10% using cash there and that's at least a tax savings.  

The pricing and selection in general is along the lines of most warehouse places like Total Wine, etc. so I don't know that you'll find any crazy deals.  I did however like their new growler station.  

Be wary, the weekends can be a madhouse here and the parking lot gets tricky because of it's size.  Be patient.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the review highlighted several positive aspects of the experience, including the cleanliness of the space, the savings offered for paying in cash, and the presence of a new growler station. Even though there were some minor drawbacks mentioned, such as the crowded weekends and parking challenges, the overall tone suggests that the reviewer had a good experience and found value in visiting the establishment.

question: I'm amazed that I just learned about this place. If I was smarter about it, I would take the cash discount and go so far as compare prices with ABC stores. I'll just believe all the other reviews about pricing since it's just a fun place to shop.
rationale: The review expresses amazement at discovering the place and mentions a positive experience of comparing prices and considering cash discounts. The reviewer also notes that it's a fun place to shop despite not being knowledgeable about pricing. Overall, the review highlights a positive attitude towards the shopping experience and the value offered by the store.

question:
Who doesn't like Frugal MacDoogal??!!
I'm sure everyone has mentioned it already: BRING CASH. Cash prices are better than credit prices.
This giant fun store for grown ups is divided into liquor side and beer & wine side. Last few trips I found myself in the beer side. They offer lots of craft beer options, seasonal stuff and even single bottle.
This past weekend I was looking specifically for a pumpkin dark beer (stout/porter). The staffs here were helpful, and the beer guy knew exactly where the only 1 pumpkin porter was ($6.99 for a 6-pack of Red Hook Pumpkin Porter). Believe me, that's a talent in its own given the amount of products they have here.
Personally I think SC should put Frugal MacDoogal down as a tourist attraction. If you live nearby, or ever stop nearby for cheap gas, take a quick side trip and stock up!
rationale: The sentiment of the review is positive because the reviewer expresses enthusiasm and satisfaction with their experience at Frugal MacDoogal. They highlight the convenience of the store being divided into liquor and beer & wine sections, the helpfulness of the staff in assisting them to find a specific type of beer, and the wide variety of craft beer options available. Additionally, the reviewer appreciates the better cash prices and the overall value they received during their visit. They go on to recommend Frugal MacDoogal as a must-visit destination, further emphasizing their positive impression of the store.

question: There is nothing not to like! Frugal MacDoogal's is just on the other side of the state line. Prices are cheaper (cash prices are even better than credit) and the selection is great! Take the drive and fill up on booze (and gas while you are down here!).
rationale: The sentiment is Positive because the reviewer highlights multiple aspects they appreciate about Frugal MacDoogal's, such as lower prices, great selection, and the convenience of being located near the state line. They also encourage others to visit by suggesting it's worth the drive for their liquor and gas needs. The overall tone is enthusiastic and complimentary, indicating a positive experience.

question: The atmosphere is fun and lively!  The staff is good and the food is pretty decent for the theme.  It's the hopping place for the area!  The only thing I don't like is: 1)Smoking 2) the Dead animals inside the lounge.  I was advised they were going to BAN smoking from the inside soon, so that will make it better.
rationale: The sentiment is Positive because the reviewer highlights the fun and lively atmosphere, good staff, and decent food at the establishment. They also mention that it is the popular spot in the area. The only concerns raised by the reviewer are smoking and the dead animals inside the lounge, but they express optimism that smoking will be banned soon, which indicates that they have a positive outlook on the potential improvements to the establishment.

question: T-Bones is that place you go if you're boating on Lake Wylie and want to grab some bar food on the patio. Think Rusty Rudder on Lake Norman, but not as good. Went here for a quick business lunch with a colleague and sat inside as it was a hot day. The place reminds me of a 1970's/1980's outback steakhouse if they existed. Long walkway to get tot the restaurant onto the water/dock. Service was good, though the food was nothing special. Ordered the burger and it was decent though the fries were a little soft. Started with the crab dip and it was just ok...nothing I would recommend. \n\nLike a said, great patio area if you're there for some drinks and maybe a few apps. For a destination dinner, I think not.
rationale: The sentiment in the review is negative because the reviewer mostly had critical feedback about their experience at T-Bones. They mentioned that the food was nothing special, with the burger being only decent and the fries being soft. The crab dip was described as just okay and not something the reviewer would recommend. Additionally, the comparison to a more favorable establishment, the Rusty Rudder on Lake Norman, indicates that T-Bones fell short in terms of food quality and overall experience. The reviewer did acknowledge that the service was good, but overall, the review highlights more drawbacks than positives, leading to a negative sentiment.

question:
I'm so over T-Bones.

I used to relish the thought of hanging out on their big deck on one of the first warm days of the year, treating myself to their yummy grilled chicken salad or wings--the only 2 things on their menu that I liked.  I was even willing to tolerate the funky smell of the main restaurant on my way out to the deck.  But the last 3 times I've been to T-Bones, the food and service have been awful.  And they changed the menu, removing the grilled chicken breast salad that I liked.  The sweet tea was almost as clear as water, and painfully sweet--undrinkable.

I'm sorry, T-Bones.  We tried to make it work, but it takes two.  Please stop relying on the fact that you're the only place (I know of) in the area where you can eat the water's edge.  It's just not enough to keep us coming anymore.  You actually have to serve good food and decent drinks.
rationale: The sentiment is Negative because the reviewer expressed disappointment and dissatisfaction with their recent experiences at T-Bones. They mentioned that the food and service have been awful on their last three visits, with specific complaints about the quality of the sweet tea and the removal of a favorite menu item. Additionally, the reviewer expressed that the unique selling point of being a waterfront dining location was not enough to justify the poor food and drinks being served. Overall, the reviewer feels let down and no longer enjoys dining at T-Bones due to these negative experiences.

question: This place has went downhill bad. I remember going here for prom or when people would visit from out of town. Now im not so sure. The service sucks. The food is pretty mediocre. I was there on a Friday night and ordered the prime rib only to be informed that they were out. So I ordered a ribye and it was ok. The steak was cooked right but just didn't have much flavor. After dinner we went on the deck so my daughter could feed the ducks. When I got out there I grabbed a chair so she could see over the deck and the bartender rudely told me that I can't use the chair. It is only for people sitting at the bar. I hope this place fixes some of these problems because I want to like it again
rationale: The sentiment is Negative because the reviewer expresses disappointment and dissatisfaction with multiple aspects of their experience at the establishment. They mention poor service, mediocre food, an out-of-stock item, lack of flavor in the meal they received, and a negative interaction with staff regarding using a chair. These issues collectively contribute to an overall negative perception of the restaurant, leading the reviewer to question their desire to return and hoping for improvements in the future.

question:
I visited this place this weekend, already aware of the reviews.

The highlight has got to be the location. By the water, with great parking. The decor was less-than-impressive (borderline tacky - too many stuffed animals).

The food was above-average (especially the Wings and the Golden Fried Shrimp), and the beer was COLD - which was good.

The down-side was definitely the staff (uninterested and not very good overall) and the portions/presentation (our wings had 3 celery sticks and a runny blue-cheese dressing).

Not sure I'm going back at all...
rationale: The sentiment in the review is negative because the visitor highlights both positive and negative aspects of their experience, but ultimately expresses disappointment. The location, parking, food quality, and cold beer were noted as positive aspects. However, the negative aspects, such as the tacky decor, unimpressive portions and presentation of the food, and the uninterested and overall subpar staff, weigh heavier in shaping the overall negative sentiment. The visitor seems dissatisfied with their visit and is unsure about returning in the future.

question: My husband and I came here for lunch on a Thursday. The wait staff was helpful and service was quick. The views were nice, but the food wasn't something I'd return for. I ordered the classic Reuben sandwich; however, there was so much butter on the bread that it was soggy and way too salty. My husband ordered the T-bone steak which was okay, but not seasoned very well and at about $28 we've both had way better steak. I may return, but it would be for a drink at the outdoor bar and to enjoy the views.
rationale: The sentiment is Negative because the review highlights several unsatisfactory aspects of the dining experience, including the soggy and oversalted Reuben sandwich, the poorly seasoned T-bone steak, and the perception that the food did not meet the price point in terms of quality. The reviewer suggests that they may only return for drinks and the view, indicating that the food alone was not enough to make them want to dine there again.

question: Classy.\n\nThat is sarcasm.  But, it's only restaurant on Lake Wylie. So there.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is negative because the word "sarcasm" implies that the reviewer does not actually believe the restaurant is classy. Additionally, the tone of the review is dismissive and implies that the lack of other restaurant options on Lake Wylie is the only reason to consider dining there. This overall conveys a negative attitude towards the restaurant.

question: T-Bones is well below average. Starting with the drinks. Tea was very weak and the glasses were very small. Appetizer, hot wings, were mediocre at best. Not hot and sorta greasy. Wife got salad, which was unimpressive and a little wilted. Wife had filet, which she described as  a poor cut of meat, tough with gristle. I got a ribeye, if you could call it that. It appeared to be pan fried, as is was greasy. It was a very poor cut of meat, with much fat and gristle. Sweet potato was good, except it was very small. \n  Service was good, as we were in a group of 12.  Glasses were kept full and service prompt. Cost is hard to believe! You pay for a choice cut of meat and get Waffle House food. \n I went to this place probably 15 years ago. Was not impressed then. Has gotten worse. Not inclined to go to places were they have to have armed police officers on duty for the protection of their patrons.   This placed is off the list. Will not return!
rationale: The sentiment of the review is negative because the customer had a poor dining experience at T-Bones. They highlighted several issues, including weak drinks, mediocre appetizers, unimpressive salads, poor quality cuts of meat with gristle, and small portions. The customer also mentioned that the cost did not match the quality of the food received, equating it to Waffle House food despite paying for a choice cut of meat. Additionally, the mention of having armed police officers on duty for patron protection reflects negatively on the overall atmosphere and safety of the restaurant. The customer's overall dissatisfaction and lack of intention to return contribute to the negative sentiment of the review.

question: Service was good, but food NOT.  You don't realize how awful the food really is until about 30 minutes after you have eaten it.  5 of us eat there tonight, we each had different items, pasta, fish and chips, potato skins, combination of vegetable sides, a sandwich, and other items.   Everything was GREAZY and salty.  But you don't realize how much grease until 15-30 minutes after eating when your skin gets oily, you feel sludgy, thirsty, and loose your energy.  I don't know what grease or ingredients they use, but it's terrible.  We all went home after and didn't feel like doing anything after this.\nI've been there before for beer on the deck, the beer is good, but don't eat the food.  \nContrary to many of the other reviews, the service was very good.  Meghan was our waitress.
rationale: The sentiment is Negative because the review highlights multiple issues with the food quality, specifically mentioning that the food was greasy, salty, and caused physical discomfort after consumption. The reviewer also noted feeling oily, sluggish, thirsty, and lacking energy after eating at the establishment. These negative experiences overshadow the positive aspect of good service provided by the waitress. Overall, the focus on the poor food quality and its negative effects on the diners' well-being contributes to a negative sentiment in the review.

question: Unfortunately this is the only place on Lake Wylie to eat when you are out on your boat other than a snack bar. The deck and the boat docks are the only reason they are still in business. If you want a drink order beer or wine. The drinks are watered down and shots are limited because the premium liquor selections are limited.  The food leaves a lot to be desired.  We ordered the smoked chicken quesadilla, mozzarella cheese sticks and a burger because we thought it would be hard to mess that up. We were wrong.  The chicken had some artifical smoke flavor added and that was the only flavor.  The filling ingredients were not evenly distributed so there were areas overloaded and areas with nothing. The cheese sticks were a lukewarm frozen product, the marina was much hotter and appears to be a frozen product nuked in little cups because the plastic was melting.  The hamburger was not seasoned and mediocre.  The fries were mushy and limp.   On top of all this the place appears grungy and dated.  The place is falling apart and obviously being run into the ground in an attempt to just milk every possible dime out of it. This is the last chance we are giving this place.  Hopefully everyone will also give up on it so a decent place can be moved in, but I think the building is beyond saving at this point.
rationale: The sentiment in this review is negative because the customer had a poor experience at the restaurant. The food was described as lacking in flavor, poorly prepared, and unappetizing. The reviewer also mentioned issues with the drinks, ambiance, and overall cleanliness of the restaurant. The negative comments about the quality of food, service, and atmosphere contribute to the overall negative sentiment expressed in the review.

question: I never realized how gross this place was, until I went sober with a group of 13 from work. Yes, it is great to be on the lake, but the place needs some major renovations. The inside smells horrible... like old and soggy and dusty. I ordered a salad with salmon which was disgusting. I think the salmon took on the flavor of the smell of the inside which was nasty. I have enjoyed the chicken quesadilla and drinks before, but that's about it. Actually, I forgot, their Sunday brunch is pretty good and they do a bloody Mary bar that is good too. Don't take a large group because they act like accommodating you is painful. They also took forever when the restaurant seemed fairly dead. They need to remodel and hire a new chef to re-write the menu because you cannot beat the location. They also need more boat slips... it always fills up fast on the weekend!
rationale: The sentiment in the review is negative because the customer had multiple negative experiences at the establishment. They found the place to be gross and in need of major renovations, with a horrible smell inside. The food they ordered, specifically the salad with salmon, was described as disgusting, possibly affected by the unpleasant smell inside. Although they mentioned enjoying some menu items and the Sunday brunch, overall, their experience with the food and service was not satisfactory. The customer also highlighted issues with accommodating large groups, slow service, and a lack of sufficient boat slips, which impacted their overall enjoyment of the location. These factors contribute to the negative sentiment expressed in the review.

question: Nice night for a ride across the border but sadly that place just sucks. I was better when it was the Hungry Fisherman like 25 years ago.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the user expresses disappointment and dissatisfaction with the current state of the place they visited across the border. They reminisce about how the place used to be better 25 years ago, indicating a sense of decline or deterioration in their experience. The term "just sucks" further emphasizes their negative sentiment towards the current condition of the location.

question: If you get the chicken club you're okay otherwise  stay away from pretty much anything else but the salads.   We were there tonight and got the food in a somewhat timely fashion the waitress hostess however would not seat us until our entire party of 12 arrived otherwise she would in \"get in trouble\" Which was ridiculous so we had to wait around and not able to sit down.    Then, one person in our party didn't get her chicken sandwich until about 10 minutes later and then got charged an extra dollar for it to be blackened but it wasn't blackened and the manager told her no when she tried to take the dollar off how crazy is that?  I can't believe this place has been around so long and is still in business with such poor management.  Unfortunately this is the only restaurant on the lake and they know it.  Such a shame they should really get their act together.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer had multiple issues with their experience at the restaurant. Complaints about the service, food preparation, extra charges, and poor management all contribute to a sense of disappointment and frustration. The reviewer also expresses disbelief that the restaurant is still in business despite these issues, indicating a lack of confidence in the establishment. Overall, the numerous grievances raised by the reviewer support the negative sentiment expressed in the review.

question: T-Bones is always a fun spot to hangout with a nice view of Lake Wylie, but I will say that the food is mediocre. The service is usually pretty good and the beer is cold.
rationale: The sentiment in the review is positive because the reviewer appreciates the atmosphere and view at T-Bones, as well as the good service and cold beer. Despite mentioning that the food is mediocre, the positive aspects of the experience outweigh this negative point, resulting in an overall positive impression of the establishment.

question: No good. And it's a big shame because with the awesome location If they actually had decent food this place could be jumpin every night. My mom who's been here several times warned us before we left \"we go here for the views and to be outside some nights, but really you can only get a few of the appetizers and vegetables if you want anything ok\".
rationale: The sentiment is considered negative because the reviewer expresses disappointment in the quality of the food at the restaurant despite acknowledging its great location. They mention that the food is not decent and that only a limited selection of items, such as appetizers and vegetables, are satisfactory. The reviewer's overall experience seems to have been impacted by the subpar food quality, leading to a negative impression of the establishment.

question: Great atmosphere and location, but the food is sad, just sad. Won't be coming back. It's fine if you want to enjoy a few beers by the water, but don't come hungry.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the review expresses disappointment in the quality of the food, stating that it is "sad." The reviewer also mentions that they won't be returning to the restaurant and advises against coming hungry, indicating a lack of satisfaction with their overall dining experience. Despite the positive aspects of the atmosphere and location, the negative focus on the food quality leads to an overall negative sentiment.

question: Food and decor are horrific. Only redeeming factor is its location; well that and the fact that it's closed 8 hours a day.....
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the review highlights the poor quality of both the food and decor at the establishment, labeling them as "horrific." The only positive aspects mentioned are the location and the fact that the place is closed for a significant period each day, indicating that the limited operating hours are seen as a preferable state compared to when it's actually open. Overall, the review conveys disappointment and dissatisfaction with the overall experience at the venue.

question: Been here 3 times and no more for me. No matter if I go for lunch or dinner, weekday or weekend, the food quality is poor. Steaks are tasteless and tough, chicken is overcooked and dry. My friends had ribs and won't order them again. Salads are extra with the meal and pretty sad. Only thing I really like was the fried pickle appetizer. Prices are above average for everything, and the mixed drinks are weak. Place is in need of an overhaul on remodeling, lobby is musty and outdated. Location is prime and the place really makes a killing on boat and lake traffic docked onsite, which is probably why they stay in business.
rationale: The sentiment is Negative because the reviewer had poor experiences with the food quality, mentioning tasteless and tough steaks, overcooked and dry chicken, and unappealing salads. They also noted that their friends did not enjoy the ribs. Additionally, the reviewer expressed dissatisfaction with the high prices, weak mixed drinks, and the outdated appearance of the restaurant. Overall, the review highlights multiple aspects of the dining experience that were unsatisfactory, warranting a negative sentiment.

question: As everyone that goes to TBones remarks, WHY DON'T THEY UPDATE THE DECOR AND MENU IN THE WINTER WHEN IT IS SLOW???  The only draw TBones has is the location (only place on lake really - that is a shame) and the bartenders who do a great job of serving from dilapidated old bars and a crowd in warm weather.  The deck is great, but needs to be scraped and repained, updated.  The furniture on the deck is the cheapest they can find, and is just uncomfortable and always broken. The stools make you sit way lower than the bar and you feel like a 5 year old - they weren't made for this.  They are breaking too.The horrible 'decorative' paint job and poly on the bar and railings from 20+ years ago is peeling off and needs to be removed.  Looks like the removed a lot from the interior ceiling of deck bar, which is great because it was nasty hanging over where drinks were made.  I know they probably can't expand deck, but no reason they cannot update it in the current footprint.  Food just isn't great, never has been.  Work on the menu and find people committed to putting out good product, revamp the old, tired decor and clean up the restrooms, and you won't have a slow season...
rationale: The sentiment is Negative because the reviewer expressed dissatisfaction with multiple aspects of TBones - from the outdated decor and uncomfortable furniture to the subpar food quality. The reviewer highlighted the need for updating the establishment's appearance, menu, and overall cleanliness. Additionally, the negative remarks about the overall atmosphere and lack of improvement suggestions indicate a generally unsatisfactory experience.

question:
I feel as though I needed to write this review. This is just tragic that such a prime  location on the lake has terrible food, service, and if that isn't enough, even their drinks are so so...live in town and never been happy with the food. Only up is the location!!! Do not waste $$ on food!! I have had 
Ribs: too soft and drenched in BBQ sauce
Fish sandwich: fish sticks.. Brown lettuce 
Hamburger: dry bun, no flavor..
Wings: the worst, slimy 

And others as well.. 

You've been warned!!

Best and only thing is good music, nice deck w water views and drinks on a summer night or day.. Live music is fun.. Awesome for hanging out w drinks.. Not a food place
rationale: The sentiment of the review is negative because the reviewer expressed disappointment with multiple aspects of their experience at the establishment, including the food quality, service, and drink offerings. They specifically mentioned various menu items that they found to be unsatisfactory or poorly prepared. The reviewer warned others against spending money on the food and highlighted only a few positive aspects of the location, such as the live music and water views, suggesting that the overall dining experience did not meet their expectations.

question: Location is perfect. Live music was super good on the deck.  But the food... oh my.. Expect fast food quality here. The fish taco tastes like something you get from a frozen box. There is absolutely no flavor on it.  I wish this place was more unique. Not just the typical lower end American Cuisine  (burger/fries/fried chicken tenders/fried fish..) that you get at any Walmart. Service was not bad. I only wrote this review, because I think this place has a huge potential, but I think it needs that  kitchen TV Show to come by and completely change it upside down. :)
rationale: The sentiment is Negative because the review highlights multiple issues with the food quality at the restaurant, specifically mentioning that the fish taco tasted like it came from a frozen box with no flavor. The reviewer also expresses disappointment in the lack of uniqueness and variety in the menu, comparing it to typical lower-end American cuisine found at Walmart. While the live music and location were praised, the overall critique of the food quality and lack of a unique dining experience contributes to a negative sentiment towards the restaurant.

question: Disappointed! Menu looked good but very expensive. The food was average. I can see no justification for their prices. Our main entrees were delivered to the table before our appetizer and salads. I can understand having problems if it's busy but it wasn't. I'm very disappointed in everything about this restaurant. We won't be coming back unless we have to, and if we do, we'll make sure we eat somewhere else first.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer had high expectations based on the menu but felt disappointed by the expensive prices compared to the average quality of the food. The reviewer also experienced poor service with the main entrees being served before the appetizer and salads, indicating a lack of attention to detail and proper timing. These factors combined led the reviewer to have an unfavorable overall experience.

question: This is the worst example of a \"Steakhouse\" ever.  The owner is a self righteous fool that loves to cause trouble if you give feedback.  Lousy place on Lake wylie, sc
rationale: The sentiment of this review is negative because the customer expresses strong dissatisfaction with the steakhouse, criticizes the owner, and describes the overall experience as lousy. Additionally, the mention of the owner's negative behavior towards feedback adds to the negative sentiment of the review.

question: We have been going to TBones on the Lake for years.  We live on Lake Wylie so it is a nice boat ride.  The reviews I read about the cleanliness is right on. Tonight was the worst in service and food.  The kid that waited on us got our order incorrect.  My fish and chips came without the chips.  I had ordered slaw as an extra side.  The slaw came and was awful. I was afraid to eat a lot of it.  My fries came after we were pretty much through eating.  They tasted like they had been cooked in burnt grease.  Then he charged me for them.  We always leave a great tip because we know how hard it is to be a server but tonight my husband left a tip saying  bad service ; bad tip. This place needs renovation and cleaned up desperately.  Some of the best flounder I have ever eaten used to come from here.  I am sad to see it go down hill.   We also had a family near us that couldn't control their kids and I think they thought we were at a McDonalds Play land. Tonight was a miserable time here. We will probably come back home to eat from now on when going on a boat ride.
rationale: The sentiment in the review is negative because the customer had a disappointing experience at TBones on the Lake. They encountered incorrect orders, poor quality food, slow service, and unsatisfactory side dishes. The customer also expressed disappointment in the decline of the restaurant's quality compared to previous experiences. Additionally, the presence of disruptive children nearby added to their dissatisfaction. The overall tone of the review reflects a sense of disappointment and frustration, hence indicating a negative sentiment.

question: Lake is very nice. But, I just noticed servers have tables inside and out. That makes them late to the tables they need to take care of and the decor was poor. I got a chipotle chicken sandwich and the bun was really soggy from the pickle juice, but the chicken was really tasty, and juicy. \n\nIn conclusion, it needs some work (decor, waiters and waitresses dealing with tables in and out.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer pointed out several issues with their experience at the restaurant. The delayed service due to servers having tables both inside and outside, poor decor, and a soggy bun in the sandwich all contributed to their overall dissatisfaction. Additionally, the reviewer mentioned that improvements are needed in various aspects of the restaurant, indicating a negative overall impression.

question: Location is perfect view to the lake but services pretty slow, food average a place to get a beer and see the lake ......
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the review highlights that the services are slow and the food is average. These factors significantly impact the overall experience for the customer, overshadowing the perfect location and view of the lake. The mention of slow services and average food suggests that the customer did not have a pleasant or satisfying experience at the establishment.

question: Ok.  I try this place 2 or 3 times a year praying it will get better.   I live i n the lake and its the only place to go if your out for a boat ride.  Without fail its always the same.   Dirty.... I'm looking at a spider web hanging from a moose head as I write this.   Sloooow service.   Poor to standard food.  If it wasn't for the monopoly of being on the lake they would be out of business.
rationale: The sentiment is Negative because the review highlights consistent issues with the cleanliness, service speed, and food quality at the place being reviewed. The customer mentions encountering a spider web and expresses disappointment in the overall experience despite visiting multiple times in the hopes of improvement. The review indicates that without the lake location monopoly, the business might struggle due to these ongoing shortcomings.

question:
I would have given it 2.5 stars but you have to go with 2 or 3. 

Pro's: location, location, location. Large outdoor deck and bar. Live music. Great gathering place for the locals or those who want to enjoy a view of the lake. Excellent after work stop also. The tall thin woman really works hard and is on top of things. 

Con's: Outdated decor and seating, average food to sub par food. Can be difficult to get a drink sometimes as it does get busy. Drinks outside of the happy hour can be a bit pricey, $4 for a bottle of Corona for here is a bit much I could see that at an uptown bar or something but not T-Bones. Idiots that sit there and throttle their outboards and choke out the people on the deck with their exhaust. 

The place is quirky and odd, the can be a pro or a con for some. It is a part of Lake Wylie as much as the lake it seems. Go for the entertainment and think of this place more like a start to the night. They get bands and their is no cover.
rationale: The sentiment of this review is negative because the reviewer highlights several cons of the establishment, such as outdated decor and seating, average to subpar food quality, difficulty in getting drinks when it's busy, and pricey drinks outside of happy hour. Additionally, the reviewer mentions disturbances caused by loud outboard engines and characterizes the place as quirky and odd, which may not appeal to everyone. While the location and live music are praised, the overall tone of the review leans more towards highlighting the negative aspects of the experience.

question:
After reading other reviews, I'm glad I'm not the only one who has experienced the bad food and service.  I've been there twice, both times it took some effort to get served.  Today was the worst, though.  My husband got to the table first and ordered his drink. When my daughter and I sat down, it was several minutes before we got any attention from the server.  We then (finally) were able to order drinks - I ordered a Bushwacker, but got what I think was a terrible Pina Colada instead.  I couldn't drink it, so terrible, so I sent it back and ordered a beer.  Finally got menus after asking.  Ordered an app (the Filet Bites, actually really awesome) but once it was brought to the table, asked our server twice for silverware and then had to go up and get it ourselves.  Ordered a bacon cheeseburger and rack of ribs for dinner. My daughter loved the ribs, the cheeseburger was minus the bacon, but otherwise not bad.  

When I asked our server to remove the charge for the bacon and the drink I had sent back, she said she could take off the bacon ($1) but not the drink without asking the manager.  

I don't think I'll go back there, unless it is by boat for a quick beer and the view.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer expressed disappointment and frustration with the dining experience at the restaurant. They encountered issues with service, receiving incorrect drinks, lack of attention from the server, difficulty in getting silverware, missing items from their order, and a dispute over the charges. Overall, the review indicates a lack of satisfaction and a reluctance to return to the establishment.

question:
On a whim tonight, we decided to try T-Bones. I've driven by many times, and the location, right on the lake, looks very nice.  You can tell from the general exterior decor that this place was probably last remodeled back in 1975.... but I'm not going to pass judgement on that. As we all know, sometimes places like this can have excellent food, be quite charming, and a good time.

Since it's November, it was dark, and there of course was no outside seating.... no boats bobbing in the water... so other than a nice clear night with glassy water in the moonlight, there was not much to see. We did get seated at a very nice window seat, thanks to the hostess, who had orders barked to her by the "manager", who resembled a female version of Jabba The Hut from Star Wars... I felt bad for the hostess.

I think the food was very good.... I had the Fantail Shrimp, our son a burger, and my wife the Gorgonzola/Walnut stuff chicken. We had an appetizer of the stuffed mushrooms. As far as the food goes, the mushrooms were probably really the only letdown of the evening.... slightly over-priced and underwhelming.... the gravy they were sitting in left much to be desired..... not terrible..... but not $9.95 appetizer good.....  ya know???

Initially, when we sat, our server greeted us promptly, which I thought was great. Sadly, this was the only server-like action she took for the rest of the evening. After bringing our drinks, and taking our order, she was not to be seen again until after the main course had been delivered. My drink was empty, my wife's water was empty... she had wanted to order a beer. When our server finally did stop by, she did not ask about our food.... but at least we were able to order more drinks. When my wife asked what beer was on tap, she had no idea..... and didn't really seem to care to have an idea.

I noticed that our server would disappear for long periods of time. In the time it took her to come out once, the server in the next section had made the rounds 4-5 times.... making sure everyone was ok, filling sodas/waters, etc. We were left sitting, alone.

When we were finally done, she came to get plates. There were a few, since of course she hadn't been around to gather anything through the course of dinner. Since she couldn't take them all, she left a stack of dirty plates on our table - disgusting.  

At that point, I laid down 4 crisp $20's for our $75-ish tab, and we got the heck outta there...... as we departed the "manager" (Jabba The Hut) wished us good night in a very un-caring tone, and we noticed upon leaving the dinner specials - not mentioned to us by our server at all!!!!  Absolutely terrible.

So.... this place could be a solid 3-ish.... IF you get a good server... and if it's summer, and you sit outside, and it's nice..... you might hit a 4.  Again, our main courses we ordered were pretty good.... but with the poor service, our dinner basically sucked.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is negative because the customer experienced multiple issues during their visit to T-Bones. These issues include outdated decor, poor service, lack of attention from the server, unprofessional behavior from the manager, unimpressive appetizer, and overall disappointment with the dining experience. The customer felt that despite the decent main courses, the service and overall experience overshadowed any positive aspects of their visit.

question:
Gone Downhill from the last time I was here.

We have a friend from Ohio who used to work for Continental Tire and we went here with here several times over the years and always enjoyed it. I can remember several great steaks here and the name implies.

Been a number or years since we have been so since my wife and I were in the area today, I decided to give it another shot.

Turned out to be a big disappointment.  My wife ordered a Peanut Butter Chicken Sandwich with Sweet Potato Fries and a side of fruit.  I had a Roast Beef Sandwich with fries and a Cup of Texas Chili.

I guess we were expecting something else.  My wife has had chicken before with a peanut butter sauce in either Asian and Latin Cusine.  In this case, Peanut Chicken is a grilled Chicken Sandwich with a big "glob" of Peanut Butter thrown on top. She had asked is the fruit salad was mostly melon before she ordered it and was told it was not. Turned out it was mostly melon with three slivers of Strawberry added.

The Texas Chili could have been very good.  It had the chemical heat to it but was served only luke warm at best.  The Roast Beef had a very non-descript sauce on it and the au jux was so weak, it had no flavor. French Fries were under cooked.

The indoor theme is a fun place with lots of stuffed animal heads on the walls and signs from Texas all over the place. This could be a fun place to be and to hang out with friends if it had more to offer.

The service on the otherhand was the one bright spot. Our server was great and we appreciated her attentiveness.  We never lacked for anything.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the review describes the dining experience as a big disappointment. The food did not meet the expectations of the customers - the Peanut Chicken Sandwich was not as expected, the Texas Chili was served lukewarm, the Roast Beef lacked flavor, and the fries were undercooked. Additionally, the false advertising regarding the fruit salad and the lackluster atmosphere despite the potential fun theme also added to the negative experience. The only positive aspect mentioned was the good service received from the server.

question: As you can tell from all the other ratings, the food here is not very good. The drinks are great, the outside deck is great, and they are ALWAYS crowded with folks, but it is not for the food! The buffalo shrimp for a snack very tasty, but the steaks, the steak sandwiches, and the burgers are not. ONE EXCEPTION--The Ribs are not bad and edible! Go, have a drink, eat a snack, for that it's all good!
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the review highlights that the food at the restaurant is not very good, with specific mentions of the steaks, steak sandwiches, and burgers being subpar. While the drinks and outside deck are praised, the overall focus on the lackluster quality of the food results in a negative evaluation of the dining experience. The mention of one exception being the ribs being edible underscores the generally poor quality of the other menu items.

question: Great location in the old Hungry Fisherman restaurant on the water on Lake Wylie. Lousy food.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer mentioned that the food was "lousy," indicating that they were highly dissatisfied with the quality of the food. Despite the great location, the poor food experience likely overshadowed any positive aspects of the dining experience.

question:
Certainly will not be back! Disgustingly filthy and the decor is atrocious to say the least. By the time I left and by the way my stomach felt, I was afraid I was going to be the next dusty cob-web covered taxidermy victim on the wall. The food was pretty bad...frozen dry potato skins that tasted like they were made back in the summer and microwaved. Roast beef sandwich that was basically 3 or 4 pieces of processed store bought roast beef on a roll with cheese and grilled onions and peppers (clearly frozen prior to grilling). The French fries were undercooked and even the iced tea had a nasty taste as if their tea container hadn't been cleaned in months. After refusing to finish any of the meal, I had to rush to the bathroom with bad stomach cramps. Having grown up on the Chesapeake Bay and experiencing so many great waterfront resteraunts I had high hopes for this place. It could be so much better. 

PLEASE, if nothing else, clean that place before someone really gets sick! Probably one of the filthiest dining rooms I have seen in a long time. Really makes me wonder how dirty the kitchen is. The owners and managers can't be so blind not to see the decades worth of dust and cob-webs on all the junk and dead carcasses located throughout this place.

Reluctant to even give this place 1 star! Time for "Kitchen Nightmare" intervention maybe?

UPDATE.....
Okay, it now 7 hours after my not so tasty (questionably safe) lunch at T-Bones today and my stomach is still doing flip-flops even after a bout of diarrhea (sorry to give such detail but important to note). The health department really needs to take a much closer look at this place...honestly folks!
rationale: The sentiment of the review is Negative because the reviewer expresses strong dissatisfaction with various aspects of their experience at the restaurant. They mention the place being disgustingly filthy, with atrocious decor and questionable cleanliness in both the dining area and potentially the kitchen. The food is described as bad, with specific complaints about frozen, poorly cooked dishes that tasted unpleasant. The reviewer also mentions feeling unwell after the meal, indicating potential food safety concerns. Overall, the review is filled with criticisms and a sense of disappointment, culminating in a warning for others to potentially avoid the restaurant due to hygiene and food quality issues.

question: Best thing about here is the view.  Went for Sunday brunch and was very disappointed.  Poor selection, just a mix of your average breakfast fair; grits, eggs, biscuits.  Eggs were cold and the fresh fruit wasn't fresh.  There wasn't much to choose from on the lunch menu.  Worst thing was the loud dance music.  I actually really like electronic music, but not at 1pm on a Sunday overlooking a lake.  Next time I'll just drive 5 more minutes for a better restaurant and enjoy the view as I drive over the bridge.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the customer was disappointed with their experience at the restaurant. They found the selection at Sunday brunch to be poor with cold eggs and not so fresh fruit. Additionally, the lack of variety on the lunch menu was unsatisfactory. The presence of loud dance music, which didn't fit the serene setting, was off-putting for the customer. The overall experience fell short of their expectations, leading them to express their intention to search for a better dining option elsewhere.

question: Always good inexpensive food and margaritas. Friendly staff. You might even see Elvis there!
rationale: The review mentions positive aspects such as good inexpensive food, margaritas, and friendly staff. Additionally, the mention of possibly seeing Elvis adds an element of fun and uniqueness to the experience. Overall, the reviewer's positive experiences with the food, drinks, and atmosphere contribute to the positive sentiment.

question: Great little place just across the border.  Food is always great as well as service.
rationale: The reviewer expresses positive sentiment by stating that the food is always great and the service is excellent at the place they visited. This indicates that they had a good experience overall, which is why their sentiment can be classified as positive.

question:
Yummy! Love the salsa and homemade tortillas! So far haven't had anything bad! Love the Cozumel burrito! But be warned, it's HUGE and is served with sides of refried beans with cheese on top, and  mexican rice. 

I recommend the chicken soup, served with fresh avacado on top and a lime on the side to squeeze into it just before you eat it. It's to die for!

This place tends to be packed on Friday nites, but go during the week and it's great.

Casual atmosphere, has outside seating when it's not broiling hot outside, and altho they do have a bar, it tends to lean towards a family dining kinda place.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer expressed genuine enthusiasm for the food at the restaurant, highlighting dishes like the salsa, homemade tortillas, Cozumel burrito, and chicken soup. They also provided specific recommendations for must-try items and described the atmosphere as casual and family-friendly. Overall, the review is filled with praise for the food quality and dining experience, making it a positive endorsement of the restaurant.

question: Hola amigos.  Rey Azteca is your typical Mexican restaurant... the music, the decor, the ambiance... I actually like the II location up the street better... its newer and definitely cleaner.\n\nAs to the food, Yelp's default wording \"Meh, I've had better\" is the perfect description.  The service is pretty good though.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is negative because the reviewer describes the food at Rey Azteca as mediocre ("Meh, I've had better") and mentions that they preferred the newer location up the street. While the service is noted to be pretty good, the overall impression is not positive due to the mediocre food quality and comparison to a different location.

question: Meh, at best.  We were seated immediately but it took our server 7 minutes to acknowledge we were there.  The queso dip was cold & thick.  The food was very mediocre.  I will never spend another dime here.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the review highlights several key issues with the dining experience. The delayed acknowledgment by the server, cold and thick queso dip, and overall mediocre food quality indicate a lackluster dining experience that fell below the diner's expectations. Additionally, the strong statement that the diner will never return suggests a significant level of dissatisfaction with the restaurant.

question: This was the worst Mexican food I've ever had!! First off ordered a margarita came to the table looking very weak and it tasted even worse I had to send it back! I decided to just go with a draft beer which is very hard to screw up. They give you free chips with salsa the salsa was nothing special either no kick, then came the enchiladas I ordered one word Terrible too much cheese on top, shredded chicken with no flavor inside and not one decimal of spice! The service was slow and prices were way too high for this place! The only thing positive I have to say is the cervaza was cold
rationale: The sentiment is Negative because the reviewer expressed dissatisfaction with various aspects of their experience. They described the margarita and salsa as weak and lackluster, the enchiladas as terrible with no flavor or spice, slow service, and high prices. The only positive aspect mentioned was that the beer was cold. Overall, the reviewer's comments convey disappointment and frustration with the quality of the food, drinks, service, and value provided by the restaurant.

question: Don't expect great results no matter how much money you spend.  Kim will only try to talk you in to more treatments and when you get little results there is always an excuse.  There are several places in the Madison area that offer similar services and actually spend time with you versus allocating the smallest amount of time possible in order to make the most money.  It's similar to an assembly line.  I recommend that you shop around.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer expresses disappointment in the results of the service provided by Kim, feeling that they were pressured into more treatments with little improvement. The reviewer also criticizes the lack of personalized attention and compares the experience to an assembly line, indicating a lack of care and individualized service. Additionally, the suggestion to shop around implies that the reviewer does not believe the service received was worth the money spent.

question:
I had a fraxel treatment done here to remove some hyperpigmentation.  Along with the $1000 treatment (and this was 5 years ago), I also had to purchase the Obagi Nu Derm system.  I was told that the treatment felt "tingly" and that I would experience some "bronzing" afterwards- like a mild sunburn, but that I would be just fine by Monday (treatment was on a Friday).  

First of all, the treatment felt like they were rolling a rolling pin covered in hot needles all over my face.  Anyways, I went home, washed my face with the appropriate product, put on some ice, and slept with my head elevated per their instructions.  

The next morning my face felt like orange peel and was so swollen I couldn't even open one eye.  I was completely unrecognizable.  Over the next few days my skin started massively peeling and crusting.  It was excrutiating to smile, chew, talk, etc.  I wiped away built up scabbing with sterile water and used antiobiotic ointment on the open wounds, but other than that I could not/would not touch my face- the exfoliating and bleaching obagi system was out of the question.  Eventually my face healed, but I couldn't go out in public for almost a week.

The kicker? After all that, the treatment didnt work at all.  The hyperpigmentation came back worse than ever.  Of course, when I complained I was informed that this was actually my fault for not following their recommended skin care regimen.  6 months later I went to a dermatologist who prescribed triluma.  1/10th the cost, very little irritation, and it actually worked.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the user's experience with the fraxel treatment was extremely painful and resulted in severe swelling, peeling, and crusting of the skin, making it impossible for them to go out in public for almost a week. Additionally, the treatment did not effectively address the hyperpigmentation concern, rendering it ineffective and leaving the user feeling dissatisfied with the results. The user also expressed frustration over being blamed for not following the recommended skincare regimen, which contributed to their overall negative experience with the treatment.

question: Pretty good dinner with a nice selection of food. Open 24 hours and provide nice service. I usually go here after a night of partying. My favorite dish is the Fried Chicken Eggs Benedict.
rationale: The sentiment is Positive because the review highlights positive aspects such as a "nice selection of food," being open 24 hours, providing good service, and offering a favorite dish, the Fried Chicken Eggs Benedict. Additionally, the reviewer mentions going there after a night of partying, indicating a positive and enjoyable experience at the restaurant.

question: Good truck stop dining at the right price. We love coming here on the weekends when we don't feel like cooking.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the review clearly states that the dining experience at the truck stop is good, indicating a satisfying meal. Additionally, the mention of the right price suggests good value for money. The reviewer also expresses enjoyment in visiting the truck stop on weekends, indicating that it is a preferred dining destination, especially when they want to take a break from cooking at home.

question: Only went here once about a year and a half ago, but they had great pancakes! My only problem with it at the time was that they allowed smoking, so I left smelling like a cigarette. With the change in law, I'm sure the atmosphere has improved!
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer had a good experience at the restaurant, specifically enjoying the great pancakes. They mentioned a negative aspect of their visit, which was the smoking allowance, but expressed hope that the atmosphere has improved due to changes in the law. Since the overall tone is hopeful and optimistic, the sentiment is considered positive.

question: Great truck stop restaurant.  I've had breakfast and dinner here and it has always been good.  Huge portions and reasonable prices.  The bakery I guess is legendary.  They have doughnuts the size of your head!  Eclairs the size of your arm and Cream Puffs that are about 10\" high.  On our most recent trip in the area, stopped at the gas station attached to the restaurant fo some quick snacks and of course BAKERY.\n\nIf you are driving by and see the sign for The Pine Cone Restaurant - Take the next off ramp and stop it.
rationale: The review contains multiple positive aspects of the truck stop restaurant, such as good food, huge portions, reasonable prices, and legendary bakery items. The reviewer highlights their positive experiences with both breakfast and dinner, as well as their satisfaction with the bakery treats. The enthusiastic recommendation at the end further reinforces the positive sentiment expressed throughout the review.

question: This is one of the best breakfasts I have had! Is the decor dated? Absolutely but it just adds to the nostalgic charm! The place just reeks of beef cooking... Ahhh delicious! Check out the pastry cases!!!! OMG, is all I have to say!
rationale: The review expresses overall enjoyment of the breakfast experience, highlighting the delicious food and charming, nostalgic atmosphere. The mention of the dated decor adding to the charm and the excitement over the pastry cases indicates a positive sentiment. The use of words like "best," "delicious," and "OMG" reinforces the positive impression left by the breakfast place.

question: I was dining here with my boyfriend when I was served chili and mac with HAIR wound into my fork. I had barely taken 3 bites when I noticed this, and the manager, Debbie, FLAT OUT-REFUSED TO COMPENSATE - Neither my boyfriend or I approached her in an uncivil manner - I simply asked to not be charged for the food which I had barely taken a few bites out of and found hair in! I was running short on time and did not have the time to wait around for another 15 minutes for them to give me more food with hair in it. Even though I had barely eaten she absolutely refused to simply not charge me for the hair-food which I had been served. When we called back later to speak to a manager, the same manager from earlier picked up and tried to insist that she could help and that we didn't need to speak to her superiors, and then simply said that she didn't know when or how we could get in contact with a store manager when we insisted - incredibly rude and unhelpful. To reiterate I was CHARGED FULL PRICE FOR FOOD WITH HAIR IN IT WHICH WAS NOT EVEN 1/4 EATEN, AND TOLD THAT THERE WAS NOTHING THEY COULD DO. We used to eat there a lot but never, ever again will I eat here! It is the absolute worst service I have ever received, and the only place that the manager has acted irritated when consulted with a problem like hair in the food. I would never recommend this restaurant.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer had a negative experience at the restaurant. The presence of hair in the food is a health and hygiene concern, which understandably led to dissatisfaction. Additionally, the lack of willingness from the manager to provide any form of compensation or resolution to the issue further contributed to the negative sentiment. Customer service plays a crucial role in shaping a customer's experience, and in this case, the reviewer felt let down and frustrated by the restaurant's handling of the situation.

question: Some times Jane and Michael Stern are on point and other times the story of the place beats the food.  I would definitely return to the Pine Cone.  It's a bakery and diner attached to a truck stop on the Wisconsin highway.  I live in Chicago and work in a famous Mexican restaurant and I get up to Wisconsin for the old school steak and butter as much as possible: it gives me the energy to do my job.  Pine Cone has eclairs and cream puffs the size of my cat.  And I got a pig cookie.  This little truck stop gives me the big energy to get even deeper into steak and butter territory.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer expresses an overall enjoyment of their experience at the Pine Cone bakery and diner. They highlight the size and quality of the pastries, such as the eclairs and cream puffs, and the novelty of the pig cookie. Additionally, the reviewer appreciates the energy and satisfaction they get from indulging in the food at the truck stop, which fuels them for their work. The use of phrases like "definitely return" and "gives me the big energy" indicate a favorable impression of the place, making the sentiment positive.

question:
I like this location better than the one near Johnson's creek.  It is a bit tight when you walk in, but the charm soon takes over.  

I was not really impressed by the food.  However, their pastries won my over.  Try it all!  The pie was delicious.  I went with a simple apple selection.  Delicious, perfection.  It is nothing crazy, no fancy name but truthfully one of the best piece of classic apple you can find around here.  

The service is a little slow but once again, it is a small restaurant with lots of charm.  You get what you get and I love it.  It is near a Christmas tree farm so it is the perfect place to stop and get some cocoa on your way.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer appears to have an overall enjoyable experience at the location. Despite some minor drawbacks such as a tight space and slow service, the reviewer appreciates the charm of the place. They particularly praise the delicious pastries, with the apple pie being described as "perfection." The reviewer also highlights the location near a Christmas tree farm, adding to the positive experience. Overall, the reviewer expresses fondness for the charm and offerings of the location, resulting in a positive sentiment.

question: This place was excellent. We were a little nervous because it is in a truck stop but the food was absolutely delicious and the service was fast and friendly.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer was pleasantly surprised by the quality of the food and the friendly service at a location that they initially had reservations about due to its setting in a truck stop. Despite their initial nervousness, the reviewer ultimately had a great experience, indicating that the overall impression of the place was positive.

question:
This place is actually a pretty good diner, which is surprising considering its a truck stop.

I'd say that even though it's pretty similar, this Pine Cone is actually a smidge better than the one out in Johnson Creek. It's still a truck stop, mind you--the food is still greasy and hearty, but this location always seems a little bit cleaner and the servers a bit more on-the-ball. I've had messed up orders at the one in Johnson Creek, but never here.

The bakery of course, is the main draw. They have a huge variety of sweets and  they're always very delicious. I'd say for the baked goods alone they're worth checking out if you haven't been--in that respect they could easily compete with standalone bakeries.

The prices are extremely low compared to a lot of places around Madison, as well.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is positive because the reviewer highlights several positive aspects of the diner at the truck stop, such as being pleasantly surprised by the quality of the food, cleanliness of the location, efficiency of the servers, delicious variety of sweets in the bakery, and lower prices compared to other places in Madison. Overall, the reviewer praises the diner and bakery, indicating a favorable experience and a recommendation for others to check it out.

question: I may not be a truck driver, but I do appreciate the portion sizes.  If you are looking for big cookies and other bakery items, be sure to stop here!\n\nI love their chicken and dumpling soup.  It's always warm, and hits the spot!
rationale: The review expresses appreciation for the portion sizes of the bakery items and highlights the positive experience with the chicken and dumpling soup, noting that it is always warm and satisfying. The overall tone is positive, with specific praises for the food offerings at the establishment, indicating a pleasant dining experience.

question: Very nice and clean place to have breakfast or lunch
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer describes the place as "very nice and clean," indicating a pleasant environment. Additionally, the reviewer mentions that it is a good spot for breakfast or lunch, which suggests they enjoyed the dining experience. Overall, the positive description of the setting and food options indicates a favorable experience at the establishment.

question:
Went here for lunch with two co-workers, checked Yelp before we went and the reviews were very positive so we decided to give it a try.

Yikes! How can the reviews be 4-5 stars and the service at best "average", the food was terrible and myself and my co-workers all agreed, this restaurant doesn't rate two stars.

I had one of the special Friday offerings, Smelt. It came with a salad (very average but fresh), fries (ordinary) and the Smelt. After a 20-25 minute wait our server came with our orders. I looked at my plate and was shocked! There was 12-15 so-called Smelt about 3" long and deep fried. They looked like little fat cigarettes! I bit into one and it was all batter, I tried another and it was the same. I had deep fried batter for lunch!!
I haven't had a meal this bad since I got out of the Navy! 

 My co-workes meals were not much better, one had Chicken Fried Steak and he said it was made out of the box. My other co-worker had the Cod and he said it was mushy and brown colored! YUK! 

I hate to write such a negative review but this restaurant earned "one" star. Maybe they have great breakfast! I hope they do because their lunches are sub-par. 

There are other restaurants on this street/highway, I'd give them a try before I stopped here. I know my co-workers and I won't be coming back.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is negative because the customer had a poor experience at the restaurant. They expressed disappointment with the service, the food quality, and the overall dining experience. The customer found the special Friday offering, Smelt, to be unsatisfactory as it was mostly deep-fried batter. Additionally, their co-workers also had negative feedback about their dishes, with one mentioning the Chicken Fried Steak was like it came from a box and the other finding the Cod to be mushy and unappealing. Overall, the reviewer concluded that the restaurant deserved only one star and suggested trying other dining options on the same street/highway instead.

question: Huge menu, fresh tasty food, reasonable prices.  Beats a chain highway place for sure. The chicken dumpling soup alone is worth a trip (fresh made every day and it caused my vegetable-phobic daughter to eat carrots and celery of her own voltion!);  the steak-cut French fries were great and the coconut cream pie was wonderful.
