rationale: The review highlights several positive aspects of the restaurant, such as a huge menu with fresh and tasty food at reasonable prices, which is a great alternative to chain highway places. The mention of the delicious chicken dumpling soup, steak-cut French fries, and coconut cream pie further emphasizes the positive experience. Additionally, the fact that the food was able to encourage a vegetable-phobic daughter to voluntarily eat carrots and celery indicates a successful and enjoyable dining experience, ultimately leading to a positive sentiment overall.

question:
My boyfriend and I came here to have breakfast after New Years. We weren't expecting much being not at our best either. 

The service, as mentioned several times in yelp, is really slow. My drink was forgotten about and the next time our waitress came around she was serving our meal about 30-40 minutes from taking our order. The restaurant was probably half full of people. My boyfriends meal was mediocre "at best" as he put it but my meal was worse. My bacon and egg omelette was burnt and the cheese was scarce. 

At the end of our meal, our server still charged us for the missing drink but they were kind enough to take it off the bill, that is while we waited 10 minutes standing at the register. I wouldn't go back to this restaurant because I think my time is worth more than they treated it but could be nice for those who think differently.
rationale: The sentiment in the review is Negative because the customer had a subpar experience at the restaurant. They mentioned slow service, mentioning that their drink was forgotten and their food took a long time to be served even though the restaurant was not fully occupied. Additionally, the quality of the meals was lacking, with one of the dishes being described as burnt and poorly made. These experiences led the customer to feel that their time was not valued and they would not return to the restaurant.

question: Nice clean place with a very friendly staff.  Great homemade chicken dumpling soup and a very tasty club sandwich.  Decor is outdated, but not sloppy. Good local place to bring the family.
rationale: The review expresses positive aspects of the restaurant, such as the cleanliness, friendliness of the staff, great food (chicken dumpling soup and club sandwich), and suitability for families. While the decor is noted as outdated, it is not described as a major issue. Overall, the reviewer has highlighted more positive aspects of the dining experience, making the sentiment of the review positive.

question: Had a great breakfast. Staff was the best--fast and friendly service, very attentive without interrupting us.  Ordered eggs as soft scrambled and they were just right, fluffy instead of those sheets of egg product that other restaurants serve. I'm picky about French toast too, and this was served hot and just right with warm syrup. Lots of locals here but we felt very welcome. Menu is huge, and we don't know how other meals are. If I had one suggestion, it would be to get new plastic menu covers or new menus period--could get the advertisers to chip in for them. A nice start for the last leg of our road trip.
rationale: The review expresses positive feedback about the breakfast experience, highlighting the great service, delicious food (soft scrambled eggs and French toast), and welcoming atmosphere despite being among locals. The reviewer also offers constructive feedback about the menu covers, indicating they have a strong desire for the restaurant's improvement. Overall, the review paints a picture of a pleasant dining experience with minor suggestions for enhancement, ultimately portraying a positive sentiment towards the establishment.

question: I wanted ice cream so my husband pulled off the highway at this Culver's. We opted to get the flavor of the day (cookie dough craving). I was disappointed to find that it was a chocolate custard with TONS of cookie dough chunks because I like custard and not just the mix-ins, etc. but it was overall a decent sundae. I'll just stick to vanilla next time!
rationale: The sentiment is positive because even though the reviewer was initially disappointed that the flavor of the day was not exactly what they were expecting, they found the sundae to be decent overall. They appreciate the abundance of cookie dough chunks even though they preferred custard, and they express their intentions to try a different flavor next time. Overall, they still enjoyed their experience at Culver's.

question: Go-to meal: cheddar butter burger, fried cheese curds, and flavor of the day custard.\n\nThe difference between a deluxe burger and cheddar butter burger is that in the deluxe, you'll get American cheese.  And you have to pay 25 cents extra to add lettuce, tomato, etc. to the cheddar butter burger.  File that away in your memory bank.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer seems to enjoy the meal they had, specifically highlighting the cheddar butter burger, fried cheese curds, and flavor of the day custard. They provide detailed information on the menu items, showing knowledge and appreciation for the offerings. Additionally, the mention of specific details like the difference between the deluxe burger and cheddar butter burger, and the suggestion to remember the additional cost for add-ons, indicates a thorough review that is likely helpful for others considering dining at this establishment.

question: Stopped here on our way home from the dells for a quick lunch. The staff was friendly and the restaurant  was clean. \nOur kids each had a cheeseburger kids meal which came with fries or applesauce and choice of a drink (we did milk). Also on the kids bag there is a coupon for a free scoop of ice cream with your choice of toppings! Even on this cold day the custard was amazing! My husband had a butter burger and fries. Everything was tasty!!
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer had a pleasant experience at the restaurant. They highlighted the friendliness of the staff, cleanliness of the restaurant, and tasty food. Additionally, the reviewer mentioned the extra perks such as a free scoop of ice cream for kids, showing that they were happy with the service and value they received. Overall, the reviewer had a satisfying and enjoyable meal, leading to a positive sentiment.

question: Extremely well run ! Great breakfast , clean rooms and a respectable work out room . Only downfall is they can be a wee but friendlier at the front desk .
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the review highlights several positive aspects of the hotel, such as being well run, having a great breakfast, clean rooms, and a respectable workout room. Although there was a mention of the front desk staff possibly being friendlier, overall the review focuses on the hotel's strengths, resulting in a positive overall sentiment.

question:
A modern shopping experience (back in the 80s)

I paid a visit to the DeForest Pick n Save earlier today and it was exactly as I remembered it when I lived in DeFo 15 years ago, as in, it hasn't changed one bit.  This is a store that could really use a face lift.  The industrial grade linoleum, the high metal ceilings, the harsh florescent lighting give the place that institutional warehouse vibe that just screams 1980.

It wasn't a real productive shopping trip. The produce quality was not very good.  The celery looked past its prime (think pale green with browning tips).  The same could be said of the salad greens.  There was little in the way of organic produce, but I did like the country of origin signs on the produce. (The poor quality of the produce surprised me since both Pick n Save and Copps are owned by Roundy's and the produce quality at Copps in generally pretty decent.) 

The selection in the deli counter was limited and the meat department was hit or miss.  (I did find some decent looking beef tenderloin, but they did not carry the Smart Chicken brand that prefer)

The international food section consisted of a third of a row of taco kits, salsa and soy sauce.  The selection of dry goods followed the theme of limited selection with prices 15% to 25% higher than Woodmans.

I ended up leaving and picking up the items I needed at the local Piggly Wiggly that looked downright palatial in comparison to this Pick n Save.  So much for my trip down (grocery) memory lane...
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer describes their shopping experience at the DeForest Pick n Save as disappointing and outdated. They were dissatisfied with the store's appearance, mentioning the need for a facelift due to its 1980s warehouse vibe. Additionally, they were disappointed with the quality of the produce, limited selection in the deli and meat departments, and the lackluster offerings in the international food and dry goods sections. The reviewer ended up leaving the store without completing their shopping and opted to go to a different store with better quality and selection.

question: Not impressed. The prices here seem to keep going up and up and nothing changes in the store design or layout. Seems dated. Produce could use a makeover.\n\n8 out of 10 times I will drive all the way to Madison to another store.
rationale: The sentiment in this review is negative because the customer expressed disappointment with the prices continuously increasing and the lack of changes in the store design or layout, which they perceive as dated. Additionally, the customer mentioned that they often drive to another store in Madison, indicating that their overall experience at the reviewed store is not satisfying enough for them to prefer shopping there.

question:
This is a sorry excuse for a grocery store, and it stinks that it's all we have in De Fo. The redheaded stepchild of the Copps family, this Pick N Save can always be relied upon for brown, slimy produce, generally rotten selection, and long check out lines. If I have shopping that involves any serious produce, I head to Sun Prairie. I mean, any store where you find LETTUCE and BROCCOLI in various stages of wilt--seriously, this is basic stuff, folks!!!!--has no justification for being in existence. The other day I grabbed the only remaining spaghetti squash in the store and neglected to notice (as did the checkout person) that one entire side was completely soft and rotten. I guess spaghetti squash is EXOTIC for these parts, but STILL. I've decided that the produce department's MO is to either sell the stuff or wait until it dissolves into sludge. Preferably evaporating afterward. 

As an added bonus, the ethnic section is a joke. 

Can we PLEASE have a new grocery store already????
rationale: The review expresses numerous criticisms towards the grocery store, highlighting poor quality produce, limited selection, and long check out lines. The reviewer also mentions a specific instance of purchasing rotten produce and criticizes the store's lack of basic standards in maintaining fresh produce. The mention of the ethnic section being a joke further adds to the negative sentiment. Overall, the review conveys frustration and disappointment with the store's offerings, warranting a negative sentiment classification.

question:
My arch-enemy.

I've never encountered a company with such an astounding lack of customer service.  Their monopoly on the local market doesn't help either.

UPDATE: after posting this review, a customer service rep contacted me regarding my problem.  I had a rather pleasant email exchange with the reps.  We still weren't able to correct my problem but for finding an employee that was willing to go above and beyond, they gain an extra star.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the initial review expresses frustration and disappointment with the company's lack of customer service, exacerbated by their monopolistic position in the local market. Although a positive element is introduced with the update acknowledging a responsive customer service representative, the overall tone remains critical due to the initial negative experience and the fact that the issue was still not fully resolved.

question: They charge more than the services they provide are worth.  Since they currently have a monopoly on cable tv in the madison area there is nothing anyone can do about it.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer is expressing dissatisfaction with the pricing of the services provided by the company. The mention of the company having a monopoly on cable TV also adds to the negative sentiment, as it implies a lack of competition leading to potentially inflated prices and limited options for consumers. Overall, the reviewer feels that the high prices charged by the company do not align with the value of the services received, which contributes to a negative perception of the company.

question:
To be fair, I am not yet a customer, so I cannot rate the actual quality of their cable/internet.  That said, I have so no such qualms about revealing their absolutely HORRENDOUS customer service practices.

I spoke to a representative yesterday to sign up for internet service at my new apartment.  I specifically asked the representative if there were any promotions currently available, in order to receive the best price possible.  He quoted me 39.99 as their only current promotion for basic internet (not including moden/router rentals, upgraded speed, etc.) Taking him at his word, I accepted, and scheduled an installation.  Thus begins the tale of woe:

-------------------------------------------------------------
-  Later that night, on the internet:  I see advertised in giant, bold, colorful letters, $24.99 for basic internet.  Just about half the price of the "promotion" the representative offered me.

-  I call the representative line to find out what I was told a blatant lie (in nicer terms, of course).  He confirms the promotion is available, but he doesn't have authority to change me to that price. TRANSFER 1, TO SALES!

- Sales also confirms the much cheaper promotion, but says it is an online-only offer, and she absolutely cannot give it to me:  I can only receive it online, and I will need to reschedule my installation.  TRANSFER 2, TO THE INTERNET!

- The internet promotion finds my address alright, but instead of being able to sign up online, every time I reach the promotion page for my address, I receive the same error message:  "Your session has timed out or encountered an error. Please start over or click the "Back Button" on your browser. If you still wish to contact us."  This occurs over 3 different computers and the same number of unique browsers.  TRANSFER 3, TO THE ONLINE-CHAT REPRESENTATIVE!

-  Online chat confirms again that the service is available, but I cannot achieve it online, only over the phone.  Having just been told the *exact opposite*, i attempt to point out the circular logic there, but to no avail. Apparently, reducing my price to their own advertised offer would be considered "downgrading" a customer, and he is not allowed to do that. TRANSFER 4, TO THE PHONE REPRESENTATIVE (AGAIN)!

-  The new phone representative tells me that as I am NOT a customer, she cannot help me at all.  Still loving the contradictions (the last one claimed that she could not downgrade customers, now I'm not even a customer?  Really?), I try to argue, but she claims sales needs to handle me, and transfers my call.  TRANSFER 5, TO SALES (AGAIN)!

- And at this point, after another few minutes of lovely Charter advertisements and soothingly torturous elevator music, I am transferred to... a voice mail.  This proceeds to Inform me that the Sales Depts. hours are over, so please call back later, and then terminates the call.
---------------------------------------------------


3 fun filled hours of lies, contradictions, and a misinformation campaign that would dazzle ANY public figure later... absolutely nothing was accomplished, except a gigantic waste of my life and a review that will hopefully reveal these horrifying business practices to all those unsuspecting cable-seeking fellows on Yelp.

Beware.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is negative because the customer had a frustrating and disappointing experience with the company's customer service. The customer was misled by a representative about the pricing and promotions available, encountered multiple contradictions and obstacles when trying to rectify the situation, and ultimately wasted a significant amount of time without any resolution. The review outlines a series of frustrating interactions and a lack of transparency and efficiency in the company's handling of the customer's concerns, leading to a negative perception of their business practices.

question: Used Charter for a couple of years. Just ditched them and I couldn't be happier. Shortly after we first started with Charter our connection went out, took them days to send someone out and it turned out they'd disconnected us for no reason at all. Thanks Charter. Fast forward to the recent past when our bill went up, I called up to try and get a new promotional rate because I'm no paying $60 for internet that bombs out briefly a couple times a day. They said they couldn't do anything better than their listed rate. \nAfter that I decided to downgrade to their lowest speed for the time being in order to save some money. When I called up to do so they transferred me to retentions and magically they offered me a better rate. Turned out they were lying and there was an additional charge on top of that because I wasn't bundling serviced (I have no interest in rotting my brain out watching cable TV or having a phone that I can't take with me in my pocket), when I complained and asked for the original rate the supervisor did not apologize and said the last person I talked to must have assumed I knew about the extra fee. When I told her I wanted the original rate she said there was nothing she could do, what is the point of having a retentions department if the best they can do is what is listed on the website?\nFinally I organized DSL with AT&T which was simple and easy and did not require a visit for installation. I just plugged the DSL modem in and called customer service who guided me through the set up. When I called to cancel with Charter they offered me the original rate but I'm pretty sure it would have been the same thing again. After calling to disconnect I got several calls from Charter trying to get my business back if perhaps they offered me a really good rate but by that point they'd managed to blow whatever shred of credibility they had left in my mind. Since I don't trust their billing practices I had no interest in continuing business with them any longer and am now much happier for it!
rationale: The sentiment in this review is negative because the reviewer had multiple negative experiences with Charter. They faced issues with their internet connection being disconnected without reason, unhelpful customer service representatives, billing discrepancies, and feeling deceived by the retention department. Additionally, the reviewer found switching to AT&T for DSL service to be a simpler and more pleasant experience, leading them to ultimately cancel their service with Charter. The overall tone of the review reflects frustration and disappointment with Charter's service and practices.

question:
I signed up for Yelp solely so I could post a review of Charter. That is how much I hate them. 

If you are new to Madison and you don't live downtown - go with someone else. If you are living downtown, sorry, like me, you're probably stuck with Charter. 

I have been their customer for 7 years, so my list of woes is long, but I'll just sum up the current one:

I canceled my account towards the middle of June. The account was to be canceled as of 7/1. 

On 7/2, I moved. 

On 7/8, I returned all my equipment to Charter. 

7/9 - present, I am STILL receiving bills for this account (now up to $280!). I have called 4 times and received INCREDIBLY poor service. People who were supposed to call me back have not. All have admitted that, yes, my account is showing up as canceled on 7/1, but that some mysterious "work order" has not been completed. The current agent I am speaking with told me they actually OWE me $19, but that the account still will not be canceled until the "work order" is complete. 

Do yourself a favor and get U-Verse or WHATEVER else is available in your area. Charter has a monopoly on downtown Madison and as such, treats its customers like crap.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is negative because the user expresses a high level of dissatisfaction with Charter, the company being reviewed. The reviewer describes experiencing ongoing issues, such as being billed after canceling the account, encountering poor customer service, and feeling frustrated by the lack of resolution despite multiple attempts to address the problem. The reviewer's overall tone is one of frustration and disappointment, making it clear that they are dissatisfied with their experience with Charter.

question: In my opinion, Charter Communications is just terrible.  They have been unreliable, unhelpful, rude and incapable of providing an acceptable level of service.  The customer service representatives are like talking to pre-programed robots, even in the midst of a prolonged service outage, their main goal is to sell more worthless services. Avoid this company like the plague.
rationale: The sentiment in the review is negative because the customer had a poor experience with Charter Communications. They described the company as unreliable, unhelpful, and rude, indicating a lack of satisfactory service delivery. The customer also mentioned feeling frustrated by the customer service representatives' behavior, which they perceived as impersonal and focused on upselling rather than resolving issues promptly. Overall, the review conveys a strong sense of dissatisfaction and warns others to steer clear of the company, emphasizing the negative aspects of their interactions.

question: Do NOT. I repeat - do not do business with this company. \n\nWe purchased a furnace with an extended warranty. The warranty was for 650.00 and we were told it would cover any defects, issues etc. Within 2 years the blower motor went out on a Friday. They advised us it would be 198.00 per hour since it was overtime. This was at 3pm on a Friday. They told me to read the fine print..... you know the drill. Finally after much run around I was told we would have a man out for no charge Monday morning at 8am. Of course no one showed up. after 3 more calls and missed times finally we had a tech arrive at 12noon. They do NOT do what they say, they are rude, and not the least bit proactive. Beware of any promises the sales persons make and any comittments the company makes.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer had a negative experience with the company after purchasing a furnace and an extended warranty. They felt deceived by the company's promises of coverage for defects and issues, only to be charged unexpectedly for repairs. The lack of timely service, unfulfilled commitments, and rude behavior from the company's staff added to the negative sentiment of the reviewer. Overall, the reviewer's experience highlighted a lack of transparency, poor customer service, and unmet expectations, leading to their negative perception of the company.

question: We called them once to fix our heat, -$200. We called them, again, -$500. Oh and that was without giving us an estimate. Just making the repairs and sending us a bill. And the system was still broken. We finally called another company and the problem was fixed. HVAC problems can be tough, but there isn't much reason to take a chance with this company. There are plenty of other HVAC companies who are more competent and communicative.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the customer had a poor experience with the HVAC company. They were charged twice without receiving an estimate, the repairs did not fix the issue, and they had to ultimately hire another company to resolve the problem. The lack of communication, competency, and transparency displayed by the company left the customer dissatisfied and feeling that the company was unreliable.

question: Scheduled appointment and repeated the date and time to confirm... The technician was a no show. So i called, and was told hat the appointment was for another day and time. Ok, a misunderstanding. They said someone would come out in 2 hours. In 3 hours I called and they said something else came up. I said, \"it's now or I am calling someone else\". The guy on the phone just said \"ok\".\n\nThese people are disorganized, do not respect your time, and clearly don't care about making customers happy.  Don't waste your time on these losers.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is negative because the user experienced frustration and disappointment with the scheduled appointment process. The technician did not show up as confirmed, there was a misunderstanding with the appointment date and time, and the company failed to provide timely and satisfactory service. Additionally, the user felt unappreciated and dismissed by the unhelpful response from the company representative on the phone. These experiences collectively contribute to the negative sentiment expressed in the review.

question: Needs more books and homeless people. DVD collection didn't include Jingle All The Way and the place feels off putting. One star.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the user's review highlights specific lacks and disappointments they experienced. The absence of certain books and DVDs they were looking for, as well as the perceived lack of diversity in the clientele (homeless people) may have contributed to their negative impression of the place. The user found the collection and ambiance off-putting, ultimately resulting in a one-star rating.

question: I've had a copy of Jingle All The Way since it came out and they haven't charged me a late fee yet. Talk about refusing to enforce the laws.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the user is expressing frustration and annoyance about a perceived lack of enforcement of rules or policies. The tone conveys a sense of dissatisfaction with the situation, as the user suggests that not charging a late fee for a long period of time is a form of negligence or failure to uphold rules.

question: I have never eaten at the Green Lantern, but whatever.  What I HAVE done is gone to karaoke there.\n\nI am not the kind of person to enjoy a \"hip\" bar.  I don't want ironic metal on the jukebox or $8 flirtinis.   What I want is totally unpretentious karaoke renditions of Unskinny Bop from people that still look like they graduated high school in 1991, and $2.50 vodka and cranberry juices.
rationale: The overall sentiment is positive because the person expresses enjoyment of the karaoke experience at the Green Lantern. They appreciate the unpretentious atmosphere, affordable drinks, and nostalgic music selections, indicating that they had a good time and found the experience enjoyable. The use of humor and lighthearted tone in the review also suggest a positive impression of the venue.

question:
I'm sure if I drove far enough outside of Minneapolis I'd find a place about as awesome as the Green Lantern. Instead of doing all of that work, I just wish the Green Lantern would move into my backyard.

I HATE bars where I feel like I have to do a lot of work just to try to have a good time. I'm not dressing up or drinking a certain drink just to feel like I have a shot of being accepted somewhere, believe me. The Green Lantern rules because it's completely laid back and totally unpretentious. I've seen such a wide variety of people there and everyone is always having a great time.

Besides, the drinks are super strong and cheap - that alone is good enough for me.
rationale: The sentiment in the review is positive because the author expresses strong admiration for the Green Lantern bar. They highlight the bar's laid-back and unpretentious atmosphere, where they feel accepted without having to conform to a specific dress code or drink choice. The author praises the diverse crowd at the bar and emphasizes that everyone is always having a great time. Additionally, the mention of super strong and cheap drinks further adds to the positive sentiment towards the Green Lantern. Overall, the review conveys a sense of enjoyment and satisfaction with their experiences at the bar, reflecting a positive sentiment.

question: We love The Green Lantern. The food is wonderful and the price is great. We have never had a long wait for a table and once we are seated we are always waited on right away. All the staff is very friendly and atmosphere is welcoming. We have taken several friends here for dinner and always have a great time.
rationale: The review mentions several positive aspects of the dining experience at The Green Lantern, including praise for the food quality, affordable prices, efficient service, friendly staff, and welcoming atmosphere. The reviewer also highlights that they have had consistently positive experiences at the restaurant, both with their own visits and when bringing friends along. Overall, these comments indicate a high level of satisfaction and enjoyment, making the sentiment clearly positive.

question: We love this place!  This restaurant has excellent food!  It has been family owned for years and that is what makes the difference.  Love being regulars here!  Friday night fish fries are always good.  Scallops are really worth trying.  Salads are always fresh.  Chili is very thick and meaty. This place and staff are always welcoming even when you arrive by boat!  Highly recommend it.  Be sure to  check out their specials on their awesome website!  http://www.thegreenlanternrestaurant.com.
rationale: The review shows a strong positive sentiment towards the restaurant. The reviewer emphasizes their love for the place, excellent food, long-standing family ownership, and being regular customers, which all contribute to their positive experience. Specific praises for dishes like scallops, salads, and chili indicate that the food quality is consistently impressive. The welcoming staff and the unique experience of arriving by boat further add to the positive sentiment. The recommendation to check out the specials on the website suggests an overall high level of satisfaction and enjoyment with the restaurant, resulting in a positive sentiment.

question:
Looking for "that" spot where the moment you walk in, you fit in?  

Looking for a home cooked meal...without having to lift a finger? 

Looking for a place to pop a squat and shoot the shit?

Look no further than the Greenie!  

Breakfast, lunch, happy hour or dinner....it always fills the bill. 

Love taking the family there for weekend breakfast.  From the waffle sundae for my youngest to the seafood omelet for me...they have it all.  Huge portions...great prices! 

Swing in and ask for my favorite bartender, Joy to make you her ultimate bloody mary made with Effen Cucumber Vodka.  Yeah...she rocks it.  

It's all good...
rationale: The review expresses positive sentiments throughout, highlighting the welcoming atmosphere of the restaurant ("where the moment you walk in, you fit in"), the convenience of enjoying home-cooked meals without having to cook, and the camaraderie experienced at the establishment. The positive experience is further emphasized by the mention of enjoying meals with the family and the satisfaction with the variety and quality of the food offered at reasonable prices. The enthusiastic recommendation of a favorite bartender and a special drink adds a personal touch and further enhances the positive sentiment. Overall, the review conveys a strong sense of satisfaction and enjoyment, making it clear that the customer has had a great experience at the Greenie.

question: Always good food. Menu seems to have been updated recently. Lake perch really nicely done. Upper dining room has been remodeled. Quite nice!  A favorite.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the user mentions that the food is always good, the menu seems to have been updated which indicates they are happy with the variety offered, and that the lake perch dish was enjoyed. Additionally, the description of the upper dining room being remodeled and "quite nice" suggests overall satisfaction and enjoyment of the dining experience, making it a favorite spot for the user.

question:
Pros:
Drinks are ok
Rib eye steak good medium rare with baked potato
Service was friendly and food served warm
Food affordable
relaxing environment, local feel

Cons:
Scallops was to salty
furniture outdated
walleye fish was eh, not enough flavors

It's very Divey, not impressed even when my meal was free.
rationale: The sentiment in this review is negative because the customer mentions multiple drawbacks of their dining experience, such as overly salty scallops, outdated furniture, lackluster walleye fish, and an overall "Divey" atmosphere that failed to impress them even though their meal was free. Additionally, the customer's dissatisfaction is evident in the fact that they label the walleye fish as lacking flavor and express disappointment despite some positive aspects like friendly service and affordable prices. Overall, the negative feedback outweighs the positive aspects, leading to a negative sentiment in the review.

question: are favorite fish fry in madison area get there before 530 if you dont want to awhile friendly staff both the bar and the waitstaff good burgers and steaks recomend the sea fod platter nice view of the lake good stop for lunch when out boating easy access pier go most for fish fry good hashbrown solid kids menu very reasonable prices can feed family of 5 for around 40 to 50 dollars with cocktails
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the review highlights several positive aspects of the restaurant: it mentions friendly staff, good burgers and steaks, a recommended seafood platter, a nice view of the lake, a convenient location for boaters, a good fish fry, solid offerings on the kids' menu, and reasonable prices. Overall, the review is filled with praise for various aspects of the dining experience, indicating a positive sentiment.

question: We went to the Green Lantern last Friday and it was our first visit there.Several of our friends had always spoken highly of it so we thought we would give their Friday Fish fry a try. I had made reservations for us and when we got to the restaurant they informed us it would just be a few more minutes and that we could take a seat at the bar.The bartender was very nice and intuitive, he noticed I was eying up the pickled mushrooms and gave me some for my cocktail.A few minutes later we were promptly seated so the wait was not long at all.We were seated at a nice table by the window with a view of the lake.So far so good.We ordered a kalamari appetizer to share, three beer battered cod fish fry dinners and one breaded shrimp dinner.The kalamari came first and it was ok. Our drinks were finished so we ordered more.Finally she came with our entrees but still no beer we had ordered to go with our meals.So we reminded her again.My fish fry was warm and the fish was flaky.My moms fish fry,however, was cold and soggy and we had ordered the same thing.The cole slaw was good and tasted fresh and the hash browns I had ordered were good as well.My partners shrimp though was awful.It was greasy and mushy and tasted awful.The French fries accompanying it were undercooked and looked anemic, some of them had black coloring on them like the bad part of a potato that has rotted.Our server was still no where to be seen in order to ask about our drinks or inform her about the cold fish,soggy shrimp and undercooked fries.Finally we asked another waitress if she could find her.When we told her we were disappointed in the food,particularily the shrimp and undercooked potatoes she asked why we hadn't told her sooner, to which I really wanted to respond that not once did she check in with us to see how our meal was.She did handle it all professionally in the end and apologized, even took half off of our bill so that was nice.However, between one of us having basically no good entree at all and this being our first time there it really was a disappointment.Like I said the hashbrowns and coleslaw were good, the bartender and hostess service was good but we came there for a good fish fry and dinner service.Next time we are going to Tobys nearby instead.They consistently serve quality food along with good service.
rationale: The sentiment of this review is negative because the customer experienced multiple issues during their visit to the Green Lantern. They had to wait despite making reservations, experienced delays in getting their drinks, received food that was not up to standard (cold and soggy fish, greasy and mushy shrimp, undercooked fries), and felt neglected by their server in addressing their concerns promptly. While the situation was somewhat redeemed by the server's handling of the complaints and the discount provided, the overall dining experience fell short of expectations, leading the customer to express disappointment and make plans to visit another restaurant instead.

question: For the price my just warm baked cod was okay but had little taste sitting in  water. Sides of hot baked potato and basic iceberg lettuce salad were fine. Waitress Amber was courteous and attentive. I enjoyed dinner until our party of 5 was asked to leave because they needed the table. Really? We were quite dismayed and told the male cashier whose response was defensive and frankly, rude. He even said if he were here co-owner Al would have asked us to leave just as the other co-owner did tonight. Wow. If true I am disappointed, Al. Your staff just lost us as customers including the other party waiting in line who walked out after us upon hearing our complaint and the cashier's response. Boo, bad customer service and not worth the food.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is Negative because the customer experienced several disappointing aspects during their dining experience. The lack of taste and quality in the baked cod, the abrupt request to leave to make space for other customers, the defensive and rude attitude of the male cashier, and the knowledge that the co-owners may have a similar approach all contribute to a negative overall experience. These factors overshadowed any positives, such as the courteous waitress, ultimately leaving the customer feeling dissatisfied and leading them to not recommend the establishment to others.

question: Awesome food, awesome prices, awesome service!  Decor is something to be desired but the view and food more than makes up for it.  Go and enjoy some of Wisconsin's very best fried cheese curds.  Go for Breakfast  and order a pancake, you will only need one.  For Dinner try any of their specials, I've had them all!  Makes me want to go there tonight.\n\nJust a local
rationale: The review contains several positive statements about the food, prices, and service at the establishment. The reviewer specifically mentions the "awesome" qualities of the food and service, indicating a high level of satisfaction. They also provide recommendations for specific menu items to try, highlighting their positive experiences with the offerings at the restaurant. Overall, the reviewer expresses excitement and enthusiasm about returning to the establishment, which suggests a positive sentiment.

question: Service was terrible! I will never return!!! We waited in the bar and were never greeted or spoken too. People walked in after us and were seated. Not sure what their structure is for seating, but they suck at it. I will not be back.
rationale: The sentiment is Negative because the customer expressed dissatisfaction with their experience at the establishment. They highlighted poor service, feeling ignored and overlooked while waiting in the bar, and being confused by the seating process. Overall, their negative experience led them to state that they will not be returning in the future.

question: Nasty & Dirty.  Food is okay.  They do a great steak.  The place is full of regulars drinking cheap beer.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the review highlights negative aspects such as describing the place as "nasty & dirty" and mentioning that the food is only okay. Additionally, despite the positive note about their steak, the overall tone is negative due to the presence of regulars drinking cheap beer, which may contribute to an unpleasant atmosphere for some customers.

question:
I really wanted to like this place but it wasn't what we were looking for.

They have a great spot on the lake but it is a pretty dumpy little fish shanty.   If that is what you are looking for, you will love it.  There were a bunch of locals there having a good time and if we were there with a group of our friends it might be ok for a few beers.  But still way way too crowded.  Like sardines in a can.
There was no one to greet us so we just took a table by the window.   Then we waited and waited.  Then someone came over and said hi.  Then we waited and waited.  I was about to get up and leave when someone came over and said, "oh, you haven't been waited on yet?"  So she then tried to help things along.   
The menu was average for sandwiches but overpriced, we felt, for entrees as we ordered the Ahi Tuna and the Bluegill.   The Tuna was very good and perhaps appropriately priced but the Bluegill was not proportionately enough.  It was made well enough and had ok flavor but should have been a few dollars less.
Salad was ok.  At least had a variety of greens but still needed a little more.
If I ever went back it would be for a few beers and the view, that's it.
It's too bad because we really need some nice places on the lake and with all the lakes around here there aren't as many lakeside restaurants as you would expect.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is negative because the reviewer expresses disappointment with their experience at the restaurant. They mention that the place was not what they were looking for, describing it as a "dumpy little fish shanty" and feeling like it was too crowded. The lack of attentive service, overpriced menu items, and the average quality of the food also contributed to their negative sentiment. Overall, the reviewer only found the view and the option for a few beers as redeeming qualities, indicating that they were not satisfied with their dining experience.

question:
This is the quintessential mom and pop bar / restaurant on a lake. They specialize in cheap beer and great food. Staff is friendly and down home, but you'd better leave your big-city attitude at home.

We went for a Friday night fish fry. I live in Seattle these days and was not about to miss the opportunity while in town.

Started with a couple of Spotted Cows (on tap!) while the rest drank Miller Lite. (Told ya...) There were five adults plus a 12-year old.

Walleye was excellent, the waitress was too. We made reservations and the table was ready well ahead of time. Our one tactical error was sitting in the bar for the view. It was LOUD! Think that the dining room is much quieter.

Notice that I am not saying much about the food? Here's the deal:
- It was Friday
- It was Hot
- The beer was Cold
- The fish fry was exactly what you would expect in a place like this: great walleye!

'Nough said...
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer had a good experience at the mom-and-pop bar/restaurant by the lake. They appreciated the cheap beer, great food, friendly staff, and the overall down-home atmosphere. Despite the loudness in the bar area, they still enjoyed their time there. The reviewer specifically highlighted the excellence of the walleye fish fry, indicating satisfaction with their dining experience. Overall, the review denotes a positive tone and portrays the establishment in a favorable light.

question: Excellent dinner. Had a New York Strip steak and Scallops for $22.00
rationale: The positive sentiment is justified because the user described their dinner as excellent and mentioned specific dishes they enjoyed - the New York Strip steak and Scallops. Additionally, the user highlighted the price of $22.00, indicating they found the value for money reasonable or even impressive. Overall, the user's review indicates a positive dining experience with a satisfying meal at a perceived good price point.

question: I've been to this place a couple of times and we've always had good food. Service was a bit slow, but will definitely keep going back. Love being so close to Lake Waubesa and watching the sunsets too.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the review highlights the positive aspects of the dining experience, such as enjoying good food and the beautiful sunset views near Lake Waubesa. Despite mentioning slow service, the reviewer expresses a willingness to continue visiting the place, indicating an overall positive impression. The positive experiences of good food and scenic ambiance outweigh the minor issue of slow service, leading to an overall positive sentiment in the review.

question: Food and service have always been good.  The seafood dinner was done perfectly.
rationale: The review mentions that the food and service have always been good, and specifically highlights the seafood dinner as being done perfectly. This overall positive sentiment is based on the satisfying dining experience the customer had, which indicates a high level of enjoyment and satisfaction with both the quality of the food and the service provided.

question: I got a Groupon for here for my fiancee and mine's anniversary, and we finally were able to get there a month later.  The restaurant was super easy to find and I loved how it was right on the lake.  I spent a lot of time the last few summers in northern WI on a lake, so it was nice to be back on a lake again- brought back good memories!  We did not make a reservation, so it was an hour wait for a table when we arrived.  We hung out in the slightly crowded bar and had a few drinks while we were waiting.  The drinks were good and the bartenders were attentive, so no complaints there!  We were seated at a table that had a great view of the lake.  They had lots of specials going on that night (Friday night fish!), and we started with pepperjack cheese curds.  Delish!  They had a really nice bite at the end of them from the peppers.  I got the blue gill/lake perch combo and my fiancee got the Caribbean salmon.  I know blue gill is a thinner fish, and while my dish was good, there was not a lot of actual fish under the batter.  I got a salad with my fish with a tomato basil vinaigrette, which was surprisingly good and coleslaw which was pretty standard.  The salmon with the Caribbean dipping sauce was fantastic, but the veggies he got as a side was just some steamed broccoli and carrots- not very creative!  Our server was attentive all night, even though the restaurant was super busy all night.  By the time we left, I was very full and satisfied.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is positive because the reviewer highlights several positive aspects of their dining experience. They enjoyed the location of the restaurant by the lake, appreciated the attentive service from the bartenders and server, and found the drinks and food to be good. They also mentioned that the blue gill/lake perch combo and the Caribbean salmon were delicious, with the only minor critique being the portion size of the blue gill. Overall, the reviewer left feeling full and satisfied, which reinforces the positive sentiment of their experience.

question: Stopped here while on a Sunday drive.  Tried sitting outside and the waitress did not make us feel welcomed.  She was rude and careless.  We walked inside to the bar where the bartenders were a lot better.  Unfortunately the same lady came in and started venting about her customers.  Seems like they have enough customers and do not need to be nice anymore.  Too bad because the beer was nice and cold.  Great views too.
rationale: The sentiment is Negative because the customer's experience at the restaurant was significantly affected by the rude and unwelcoming behavior of the waitress. This negativity was further reinforced by the waitress venting about customers, creating a hostile atmosphere. Though the beer and views were positives, the overall tone of the review was marred by the poor service received.

question: It was ok - waitress was very good - even with 7:45 Friday night reservations no tables were available and had a very long wait - drunk patron at the bar swearing very loud with the F-bomb and other words and slamming items on the bar - first ordered the salmon special and of course it was already sold out - two of us then ordered the fish fry mine was lukewarm and the other one was cold. Don't plan on going back.
rationale: The sentiment is Negative because the user experienced multiple issues during their visit to the restaurant, including a long wait for a table despite having reservations, disruptive behavior from a drunk patron, lack of availability of the salmon special, and receiving cold or lukewarm food. These negative factors would likely lead the user to have an overall unsatisfactory experience and not want to return to the restaurant in the future.

question: I took my mom and grandma to the Beach House last night for dinner thinking it would be better than getting a Papa Murphy's pizza. There weren't many patrons in the dining room. Our waitress was very short with us, demanding our drink orders before taking any questions or orders for our food. I ordered scallops, and when they came to the table they were overcooked, but also cold. It took me at least 15 minutes to find the waitress to ask if I could get warmer food. She said that she would have the kitchen make up a new meal, and about 15 minutes later she returned with my same plate, with my original fork and original food. They scallops were now warm, but lacked flavor, and were even tougher than before. The waitress didn't seem to care about the quality of the food and seemed to be either having a terrible night or was on the influence of something. Needless to say, I will not be returning. On a positive note, the sunset on the lake is pretty.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the customer had a poor experience at the Beach House restaurant. They received overcooked, cold scallops that were not properly replaced, indicating a lack of attention to food quality and customer service. The waitress was described as being short, unresponsive, and possibly under the influence, leading to a frustrating dining experience overall. The customer was dissatisfied with both the food and the service provided, indicating a negative sentiment towards the restaurant.

question: Later in the night, not very crowded yet they insisted we sit crowded next to another pair of people.  Service was slow, just getting a drink was an effort.  Food was poorly prepared and over cooked, or as in my partners case cold.  No way coming back other than drinks in the summer.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the user had a poor overall experience at the establishment. They were seated too closely to other patrons, experienced slow service, received poorly prepared and overcooked food, and their partner's dish was even served cold. The user concludes by stating that they have no interest in returning other than for drinks in the summer, implying that they were highly dissatisfied with the quality of service and food.

question: I would not have known about this place had it not been for the Holiday Groupon. I redeemed mine with my bf over the weekend, and the food was delicious and cooked well (see Holiday Groupon pic).\n\nThe restaurant was packed on Saturday night; I'm glad I called in a reservation. Local town folk. Not a huge place but still cozy. The servers were running around and busy but made sure that our table was attended well. Ask for Dee Dee; she's a trip! I'll be back again for more food once the snow has melted to try the other items on the menu.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer had a pleasant experience at the restaurant they visited. They enjoyed the food, found the atmosphere cozy despite it being busy, and appreciated the attentive service from the servers. They even made a specific recommendation to ask for Dee Dee, indicating a personal connection with the staff. Additionally, the reviewer expressed an intention to return to try more items from the menu, showing a willingness to revisit the establishment. Overall, the positive comments about the food, service, and ambiance indicate a satisfied customer.

question: It you're basic bar food.  Nothing more.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the review indicates that the bar food is only basic and nothing more. This suggests that there are no standout qualities or unique offerings that set it apart from standard bar food options, leading to a less favorable impression.

question: Great place on the water. Beautiful views. Good fish fry. Very reasonable prices with nice selection of fish and sides. The staff are great!
rationale: The review emphasizes positive aspects of the experience such as the beautiful views, good fish fry, reasonable prices, nice selection of fish and sides, and the staff. The use of words like "great," "beautiful," "good," "very reasonable," and "great" in describing the place and the staff indicate a positive sentiment. question: This place was amazing!! The cucumber dill sauce for the salmon was out of this world!!! I've also never had cinnamon butter for my rolls before I came here. A must try if you are near by
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer had a great experience at the restaurant, highlighting the amazing cucumber dill sauce and unique cinnamon butter for the rolls. They found the food to be delicious and were impressed by the unique flavors offered by the restaurant, recommending it as a must-try for others in the area.

question: This was a good restaurant but the menu has been downgraded to Bar Food, too bad as this was our go-to place when out on the lake.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer expresses disappointment that the restaurant they once enjoyed has downgraded its menu to bar food. They express a sense of loss for a previously favorite spot, indicating a decline in the dining experience.

question:
I am a huge believer in bed & breakfasts, especially in the winter when you are bound to spend more time indoors.  This is a very cute one; bf and I stayed here on our visit to Madison.  Hosts were VERY friendly, so we started our (very big) breakfasts around 9 and usually ended around 10.  They were very accommodating and solicitous of our feedback.  

We stayed in the Mentor room, which was spacious and had a hot tub but no shower, so I used the shared shower across the hall since there weren't many guests during that weekend.  It really felt like we were staying at a friend's house, except I didn't need to help with the dishes.

Some things that didn't bother me but might other people:
1)  Note that they have two large dogs
2)  If you're averse to flowered wallpaper, this is not the place for you.
rationale: The review reflects a positive sentiment because the guest had an overall enjoyable experience at the bed & breakfast. They appreciated the friendly hosts, the generous breakfast offerings, and the comfortable accommodations in the Mentor room. Despite minor inconveniences like the shared shower and presence of dogs, the guest felt welcomed and at home during their stay. These positive aspects outweigh any potential negatives mentioned, resulting in a positive overall sentiment.

question: We stayed in the B&B for the Memorial day weekend. Like the other reviewers mentioned, Craig was a very personable  and accommodating host and cooks a mean breakfast.  The room (Sonenson) was clean and bed comfortable. Most of all, the space was decorated with lots of personal touches, making it warm and welcoming. The place is kids friendly and is only about 10 minute drive from downtown Madison. \n\nOverall, it was a pleasant stay and we would recommend it to our friends who would consider b&b in madison. Four stars only because my ideal B&B would  be on a farm, where I can enjoy produce and eggs from the land itself.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the review highlights several aspects of the stay that the guest enjoyed: the personable and accommodating host, the clean and comfortable room, the delicious breakfast, and the warm and welcoming atmosphere created by personal touches in the space. The guest also mentions that the B&B is kid-friendly and conveniently located near downtown Madison. Despite one minor preference for a farm setting, the overall tone of the review is favorable, indicating a positive experience worth recommending to others.

question: Do you like it when your bowels want to explode?  Then this is the place for you.  The sad thing is, the aroma coming from the restaurant is hypnotizing as it drifts through the neighborhood, and the staff is really nice, but holy jeebus, does the pizza suck.  Every time we went there we spent the rest of the night in the bathroom.  Awful.
rationale: The sentiment in the review is negative because the reviewer expresses dissatisfaction with the quality of the food (stating that the pizza sucks) and highlights the negative physical consequences of dining at the restaurant (resulting in spending the rest of the night in the bathroom). Additionally, the exaggerated statement about the bowels wanting to explode further emphasizes the negative experience the reviewer had. Overall, the review indicates a strong sentiment of disappointment and discomfort associated with the dining experience, leading to a negative overall evaluation.

question: Good pizza (not like Pizza Hut, more like home-made) with a great bar with nice, friendly service.
rationale: The review mentions that the pizza is good, comparing it favorably to homemade pizza. This implies a positive opinion on the taste and quality of the food. question: kind of disappointing pizza
