question: I desperately needed some lunch and came on this gem. I had the Almond Chicken Salad sandwich on a fresh 7-grain bagette with corn & bean salad. The sandwich was amazing. I didn't really care for the salad, but that didn't taint my experience.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer highlights the positive aspects of their experience by emphasizing how amazing the Almond Chicken Salad sandwich was. Despite not caring for the salad, the reviewer clarifies that it did not ruin their overall experience, indicating that they still enjoyed their meal. The positive tone in the review and the focus on the delicious sandwich contribute to the overall positive sentiment.

question:
I used to love this place - I came here once every week or two for breakfast and to sit and write for an hour or two (I'm a grad student working on my thesis). The food is expensive (~$12 for two eggs, toast, bacon, coffee) and the coffee isn't great, but the atmosphere is nice and I didn't come all that often so it seemed like sort of a luxury. The staff also isn't particularly outgoing, though not downright rude... until today. 

Today is Sunday, and I arrived around 8am. I usually try to get there kind of early and leave before it gets busy so I'm not taking up a table. I bought a big breakfast (as described above) and sat down to work. Just over an hour later, I was approached by a middle-aged man whom I assume is the owner or manager but whom I've never seen before. He asked if I was aware of their "new policy" about Wi-Fi on Sunday mornings, and how they don't want people just hanging out using the internet when it gets crowded. (No sugar coating, that's almost verbatim what he said.) For the record, I wasn't actually using their wi-fi, I was writing. Whatever. His point was obvious. I stared at him for a few seconds because I couldn't believe that a proprietor was actually asking me, a paying customer, to leave when I had been there only an hour and in fact still had toast on my plate. He suggested it was fine for now but that when it started to get crowded I should get out. I said that if that's how they felt I would leave now, and he responded, "That's exactly how we feel." I was shocked, and still am. I have never, NEVER been treated so disrespectfully in a place of business. And I'm a regular, paying customer!! I always leave a tip! I still can't believe I was treated this way.

I will no longer recommend this place, now that they've shown their true colors. If the food was exceptional I might try to swallow my pride, but it's really nothing special. There are several other breakfast/coffee shops in the area (including a Starbucks across the road) and I will be patronizing them instead from now on.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer used to love the place and frequented it regularly for breakfast and work, but had a negative encounter with the owner/manager who asked them to leave due to a new Wi-Fi policy. The reviewer felt disrespected and shocked by this interaction, and as a regular paying customer who always leaves a tip, they were deeply disappointed by the treatment received. The reviewer also noted that the food was expensive and not exceptional, further contributing to their decision to no longer recommend the place and to patronize other establishments instead.

question:
From scratch pastries, breads, breakfast, lunch, dinner options
Cozy coffee shop atmosphere, fireplace, plenty of tables.
Cash only. Pay at front and they will bring the food out to you.
Free refills on coffee.
Never dissapointed.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer highlighted several positive aspects of the coffee shop, such as freshly made food, a cozy atmosphere, ample seating, and free coffee refills. Additionally, the fact that the reviewer has never been disappointed suggests a consistently high level of satisfaction with their experiences at the coffee shop. Overall, the review emphasizes the enjoyable dining experience and the quality of service provided, leading to a positive sentiment.

question: Such a cute place!! I was there for breakfast, and had eggs, bacon, homefries, toast and a pancake. I like variety, what can I say?? Eggs were good. Bacon and toast ok. Homefries were kinda greasy, but tasted awesome. Totally looked like they would be gross, but were delicious. Pancake is where it's at. Seriously. Just perfect. \nAlso, I believe they make their own pastries. Several coffee options, too. \nThe outside seating is so cute, too. I was there on a weekday morning, so there wasn't a whole lot going on, but it was still fun to sit outside on a perfect day, and watch the traffic and people go by.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer had an enjoyable experience at the restaurant. They expressed enthusiasm about the variety of food options, highlighting the delicious eggs, tasty homefries despite being a bit greasy, and a perfect pancake. The positive comments on the food quality, particularly the pancakes, indicate satisfaction with the overall dining experience. Additionally, mentioning the pleasant outdoor seating and ambiance adds to the positive sentiment. The reviewer seemed to have a good time and appreciated the homemade pastries and coffee options, contributing to their positive overall impression of the place.

question: Seemed like a nice place. However, after waiting in line for 20 minutes and taking quite a while to give our order (because it was VERY loud) we were told that it would take about 30 minutes to get our food. Not exactly what I wanted to hear after waiting 20 minutes but fine. When I try to pay I am informed that they do not accept debit/credit cards. Cash or check only!! No where on the door or while in line does it say cash or check only! There apparently is a very small sign on the register that says that but there is so much other crap posted in that area 99% of the people there probably never saw the sign. This is just ridiculous in this day and age to not accept cards. Even worse is the BS sign on the register. I will never eat here again just because of this!
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the customer had a negative experience at the restaurant. They had to wait in line for 20 minutes, struggled to place their order due to noise, were informed of a long wait for food after already waiting, and then discovered at the point of payment that only cash or checks were accepted, which was not clearly communicated in advance. These frustrations led the customer to feel disappointed and unwilling to return to the restaurant.

question: Nice atmosphere. Like an upscale Starbucks. We ordered coffee, chai, a breakfast sandwich and quiche of the day. Was told drinks would be out in a few minutes but food would take 40 minutes. Don't know if its always like that or if they were just short staffed. But seriously 40 min for a slice of quiche and a breakfast sandwich? We told them just make the drinks, forget the food. Even so the drinks took 11 minutes. This place has potential but a wait like that is crazy. Would not recommend until they work their production issues out. One star. Disappointed.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the customer experienced long wait times for both beverages and food items, which resulted in disappointment. The customer felt that waiting 40 minutes for a slice of quiche and a breakfast sandwich, and even experiencing an 11-minute wait for drinks, was excessive. The review mentioned potential production issues and suggested that the establishment needs to improve its efficiency before being recommended to others.

question: Looks great. Smells great. When they told me it would be a 30-40 minute wait for a breakfast sandwich I cancelled my order. Seems like an unworkable business model. \n\nHire another cook and install another stove. Came all the way here from Spring Green--sad face.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the customer was discouraged by the long wait time for their breakfast sandwich and considered it an unworkable business model. The suggestion to hire another cook and install another stove indicates that the customer believes the current setup is inefficient and affecting their overall experience negatively. Additionally, the customer expressing disappointment about traveling to the location adds to the negative sentiment.

question: I had the Tuscan chicken & 3 cheese.  Very yummy and served with a side choice.  I chose the sliced fruit.  I can say it was worth the $10...not for just the food but the ambiance.   I'd come back here to try another hot sandwich.   Just keep in mind, at this moment the caf\u00e9 is still cash only.  Walk across the street grab yourself some cash and get here for a nice sandwich.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer enjoyed the Tuscan chicken & 3 cheese sandwich, finding it very yummy and worth the $10 price. They also appreciated the side choice of sliced fruit and the ambiance of the cafe. Additionally, the reviewer expressed interest in returning to try another hot sandwich, indicating overall satisfaction with the dining experience. The only minor inconvenience mentioned about the cafe being cash-only did not diminish their positive feelings about the food and environment.

question: Great location, nice atmosphere, good food. But very slow service, and overpriced. I ordered a breakfast sandwich with no meat --  it took 20 minutes and cost $6.75.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the review mentions the slow service, indicating a lack of efficiency and potentially poor customer experience. Additionally, the mention of the breakfast sandwich taking 20 minutes to prepare and being overpriced may lead to feelings of dissatisfaction. These factors contribute to the overall negative sentiment expressed in the review.

question: Weak food for yuppies. Overpriced. Underwhelming.  And you're surrounded by West Siders who should really know better... but of course don't.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the review highlights multiple drawbacks of the dining experience. The food is described as weak and overpriced, which indicates poor quality and value. Additionally, the mention of being surrounded by West Siders who are perceived as lacking discernment further adds to the negative impression of the establishment. Overall, the review conveys disappointment with the food, pricing, and atmosphere, leading to a negative sentiment.

question: ONLY TAKES CASH OR CHECK!!!\n\nSo, this is not always a deal breaker, and I have been here before and went out of my way to return. I didn't either remember this rule, or it changed since I last visited, since I usually don't carry either. They won't pay the fee for the credit card machine, but want me to dish out money for checks or ATM fees...makes me mad on principle. And there is a Starbucks literally across the street or other local joints that will gladly take my debit/credit cards down the a little ways away that I will now know to frequent instead.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer expresses frustration and disappointment about the payment policy of the establishment. The inconvenience of only accepting cash or check, especially when other nearby businesses accept cards, has led the reviewer to feel dissatisfied with the service provided. Additionally, the reviewer feels that the establishment's unwillingness to cover credit card fees while expecting customers to bear the burden of additional charges for checks or ATM withdrawals is unreasonable.

question: I went there for Sunday brunch. I had ordered a breakfast burritto and a cup of lentil soup. Both of them were served with a few slices of fresh fruit (pineapple and orange to be specific). The burritto was just perfect. It was quite filling without making me fall asleep as typically happens after eating at brunch places. The soup was good as well although not as good as the burritto. I would visit this place again for sure.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer had a good experience overall at the restaurant. They enjoyed their breakfast burrito and found it to be perfect and filling without feeling overly heavy. Although the lentil soup wasn't as good as the burrito, the reviewer still appreciated it. Their intention to visit the place again confirms their positive feelings towards it.

question:
I cannot say enough things about the staff and food quality at Blue Plate Catering! They catered our recent wedding and we were absolutely thrilled with the results. We had a small wedding in Olin Park and we really wanted the food to be the center of the day. We wanted local, seasonal food and were on a tight budget. Originally, Underground Food Collective seemed to be the most logical place for us, but after meeting with them and feeling like we had to change what we wanted to be "hipster" enough to fit their vision and seeing the outrageous price tag that comes with their catering, we knew we had to look elsewhere. Blue Plate listened to what we wanted and was so accommodating. I suggested some recipes and they whipped them right up. They worked with other local businesses, like Batch Bakehouse, and also didn't bat an eye when I suggested two craft cocktails for our bar, one that required the orange peels to be smoked. I wanted to do a lot of the wedding myself and they were happy to allow me to drop off the drink mixes store before the wedding, as well as using my DIY place settings. I have a recipe that my dad has been making since I was a toddler that I wanted for the main dish and they were able to recreate it for us without a problem.

The day of, the service staff was friendly and professional. The food tasted amazing, and there were lots of local foods highlighted. My dad's featured dish was delicious. We had a great bartender who made our fancy drinks taste just like I had imagined. I highly recommend this awesome catering service!

If you want to see our wedding photos and some food pics, you can see them here: http://runningblonde.com/tag/wedding-photos/
rationale: The sentiment of the review is positive because the reviewer expresses extreme satisfaction with the staff and food quality provided by Blue Plate Catering for their wedding. They highlight the attentiveness of the catering service to their specific requests, such as incorporating local, seasonal food within their budget constraints. The reviewer praises the professional and accommodating nature of the staff, as well as the delicious taste of the food and drinks served on their special day. Overall, the reviewer highly recommends Blue Plate Catering and shares their positive experience for others to consider.

question:
I hired Blue Plate Catering to cater my wedding in October of 2013.  If you are looking to hire a caterer for an event, I hope that this review is helpful for you.  

I first want to say that it was a pleasure to work with everyone!  From calling in to request some info, to meeting in person, I could tell that Blue Plate was full-service in every aspect of the word.  If Tim was out for the day, I was able to speak with David or Marcia, and everyone was on the same page:  it felt like I had an entire team dedicated to help me every step of the way.  Not only that, but by having Blue Plate do the food, bar, and even chair and table rentals, I was able to save A LOT of money.  

The room was set up early, so we were able to arrive and decorate without having to wait for any tables to be set up, linens to be put on tables, etc.  The room looked exactly like we had discussed in our meetings.  Blue Plate even coordinated with the DJ, florist, photographer, and videographer so that I wouldn't be bothered that day.  Tim had mentioned that Blue Plate was full service, but I had no idea how much they really would do for us.

We had 265 guests, and my wife was a little nervous about running out of food, but Blue Plate, again, hit it out of the park!!  The roast beef was phenomenal (I had tons of guests say it was the most tender beef they had ever eaten), and the executive chef even went out of his way to order in our special food requests just for us.  He even made the entire menu gluten free (many family members have celiac's or are gluten intolerant, myself included).  As a food service worker for my entire life, I was more focused on the level of service...Right on cue, everything was taken care of.  We were even ready to eat 30 minutes early, and the staff got the buffet fully set up within minutes of being informed.  I didn't hear a single complaint the entire night about any of the staff.  To make it better, I didn't even notice that they were there: and that's a great thing!

Overall, my wife and I are so happy with the choice that we made:  if I could go back, I'd do it all over again.  A huge thank you goes out to everyone at Blue Plate Catering who made the biggest and most important day of my life flawless.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is positive because the reviewer had an exceptional experience with Blue Plate Catering for their wedding. They highlighted multiple aspects of the service that exceeded their expectations, such as the full-service approach, the coordination with other vendors, the high-quality and delicious food, accommodating special dietary needs, efficient set-up, attentive staff, and seamless execution of the event. The reviewer expressed gratitude and satisfaction with their choice of caterer, indicating that they would choose Blue Plate Catering again if given the chance. Overall, the review is filled with praise and gratitude, showcasing a high level of satisfaction and appreciation for the services provided.

question:
Just did a tasting for my daughter's wedding.  The menu is very unique and expansive.  The appetizers and entrees were excellent, comparable to fine dining.  The food definitely sold us.

David was phenomenal, very friendly, professional and extremely helpful in helping us plan the event.  He made everything so easy and was very flexible to accommodate our wishes.  David was definitely icing on the cake.

While we are from Milwaukee and the wedding will be at Old World Wisconsin it was well worth the drive to Madison.  Skip Milwaukee caterers and go with Blue Plate based on quality, service and price.

I'll update after the wedding.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer had a great experience with the catering company, Blue Plate. They emphasized the uniqueness and quality of the menu, comparing it to fine dining. The reviewer also praised the exceptional service provided by David, describing him as friendly, professional, and accommodating. Additionally, they expressed willingness to recommend Blue Plate over local caterers, citing factors such as quality, service, and price. The reviewer's intention to do an update after the wedding suggests they are looking forward to a successful event, further reinforcing the positive sentiment.

question: It delivers on the name. I stopped in after work for a drink and never tried the food but this is not my kind of place.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the customer only mentioned stopping in for a drink and not trying the food, implying that they did not have a good experience or found the place to be lacking in some way. Additionally, stating that the place is "not my kind of place" suggests a mismatch between the customer's preferences and the atmosphere or offerings of the establishment.

question: Good food, drinks are priced decently, super friendly staff.  We stop in at least once a week.
rationale: The review contains positive attributes such as "good food," "decently priced drinks," and "super friendly staff." Additionally, the fact that the customer stops in at least once a week indicates a high level of satisfaction with their experience, overall making it a positive sentiment.

question: Would normally give Pauls 4 stars,but have reduced it due to a recent customer service issue.I am a 'sorta regular' here. They have very good fish frys and equally tasty breakfasts [bacon is exceptional] ,along with generally friendly service...That  changed Sunday..Was here with companions .. Decided to play the \"'cherry master video machine\" during our visit..Got to a $50 credit when we HAD to leave...Asked Julie to just clear the machine as she was very busy,and I would return later for the money...Please keep in mind clearing machine involves pressing a button and one second of time. Reply was \"can't now\". Waited ten minutes as she walked by me 3 times..Finally told here again we needed to leave...She basically went into a public rant yelling to the bartender to \"give this guy $50\"...We just can not justify returning after this experience..Darn, cause it's generally a decent place...
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the customer had a disappointing experience with the customer service at the restaurant. Despite being a 'sorta regular' customer and enjoying the food and atmosphere in the past, the encounter with a staff member named Julie was frustrating and unprofessional. The customer felt ignored and embarrassed by Julie's public outburst, which ultimately impacted their overall perception of the restaurant. This negative interaction overshadowed the positive aspects of their previous visits and left them feeling unwilling to return in the future.

question: A great place for a Friday night fish dinner. The baked fish is my favorite.  The prices are very reasonable with good drink specials. The wait staff is very friendly. Ask for the hash browns with cheese and onions and you won't be disappointed.  They can accommodate large groups and are willing to make special orders.  Give them a try and you will walk away satisfied.
rationale: The review mentions several positive aspects of the restaurant, such as the quality of the food ("baked fish is my favorite"), reasonable prices, good drink specials, friendly wait staff, and the ability to accommodate large groups and special orders. Additionally, the recommendation to try the hash browns with cheese and onions further adds to the positive sentiment. Overall, the reviewer expresses satisfaction with their experience, making the sentiment positive.

question: Okay, sorry guys..but I was NOT impressed. Just happened to be in the neighborhood...so I decided to go to Chin's because I could sit outside. I ordered the lettuce wraps and the fried rice. The meat in the wraps was sub-standard and reminded me of dog food. The sauce was pretty much the only good part. The fried rice was described to have veggies and shrimp and crab...when it came out, it was so obviously KRAB. Ugh. I won't be wasting my money again.
rationale: The sentiment in the review is negative because the customer was disappointed with their experience at Chin's restaurant. They were unimpressed with the quality of the food, describing the meat in the lettuce wraps as sub-standard and comparing it to dog food. They were also dissatisfied with the fried rice, noting that it did not meet their expectations as it included imitation crab (KRAB) instead of real shrimp and crab. Furthermore, the customer expressed that they felt like they wasted their money and implied that they would not be returning in the future.

question:
I'm confused why anyone would choose to go here.  
To be clear, my expectations were that it would be an all Asian version of Noodles & Co.  Cheap, decent, fresh food.  
Cheap - yep
Decent - no
Fresh - maybe at one point
I ordered the Thai curry noodles.  Not impressed.  I've never tasted something that claimed to be curry with so little flavor.  My vegetables were obviously charred and they still sent me the dish.  Yuck.  My boyfriend ordered the teriyaki udon, and the noodles were too skinny to be udon with the same flavor issues.  Not even the chili garlic sauce did much to it.  
Chin's - good concept, but a waste of money even at $6.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer expressed disappointment with the food quality and flavor at Chin's, as well as feeling that it was a waste of money. The reviewer's expectations were not met, as they found the dishes lacking in flavor, with charred vegetables and noodles that did not match their expectations. Overall, the reviewer did not enjoy their experience with the food at Chin's and felt that it did not live up to the anticipated cheap, decent, and fresh qualities they were hoping for.

question:
Ashley V said it best "why would anyone choose to go here?" I am still traveling, and the indignities of the Midwest continue. I didn't think it was cheap. I knew I was not going to get real Chinese food, I knew I was coming in to get a pseudo version of Americanized Chinese food. My first indication that I was not in Peking, was the Hispanic girl struggling to understand my English ordering and the POS system which was also in English. Damn oppressive society.

Anyway, I really should not disparage global initiative the restaurant is embracing. We are all going to be working for Indian companies, as Obama went specifically to India to procure 15 million jobs to alleviate the unemployment crisis in this country. I welcome TATA motors and their cardboard framed cars. I digress.....

Rosa, or whatever her name was, with the help of her friend, Miguel (probably not his name, and he was clearly only working there because it was too cold for his primary profession, that being a jockey) managed to screw up my order twice, overcharged me twice and never apologized. Almost thought I was in Los Angeles again.

The cream cheese puffs were soggy, greasy and about as far from "puffy" as one could get. The chicken was white, but it was also fatty and grisly.
The Thai spring rolls were not bad flavor but they too were greasy and not very crispy. The fried rice was disgusting, just a greasy mush of dirty looking rice, mushrooms and egg. Finally, the pot stickers, ah the pot stickers, they should have stuck to the pot. The filling was some processed mash of something, while the outside was supposed to have been lightly pan fried, let's emphasize the word "lightly."

This is not very good Asian food. I would suggest that there must be a better choice in Madison. I am sure there are Asians in Madison. I have not seen them, but somewhere in this land must lay a pocket of Asians. There is a university, with a math and an engineering department . There has to be Asians somewhere, I would suggest to find them, and ask them where to eat. I am sure Chin's would not be on their list.
rationale: The review expresses dissatisfaction with the restaurant's food quality, service, and overall experience. The customer highlights multiple negative aspects such as the confusion in ordering, overcharging, mistakes in the order, lack of apologies, and poor food quality including soggy cream cheese puffs, greasy Thai spring rolls, unappetizing fried rice, and disappointing pot stickers. The reviewer also makes derogatory remarks about the staff, suggesting incompetence and lack of authenticity in the restaurant's offerings. Overall, the tone and detailed complaints in the review clearly indicate a negative sentiment towards the restaurant.

question:
For what it is, a fast food Americanized Oriental restaurant, it's not overly bad, as long as you don't order shrimp.

Service: I've never had a problem here. While not always the most outgoing service, they are friendly. My order is always ready in a decent amount of time. I've never dined in, so I won't comment on atmosphere.

Their menu and nutritional info is easily accessed on line. 

For the most part, I've had OK experiences with the food selections. I don't expect spectacular food from this place, it is, after all, 'Fast Food' from a restaurant chain. It's nothing really special. 

However, today I had an experience that sort of turned my stomach a bit. I ordered a Shrimp and Veggie Stir fry to go. When I got back to work and went to dig in, I was a little disgusted to find that the shrimp were not deveined prior to cooking. For those of you who don't know what that means: The Shrimp's digestive track (seen as a dark brown 'vein' along the spine of the shrimp) wasn't removed, which means that the digestive track and it's contents were left in place. Yes, I know it's not horrible to eat it, but if you know what it is, it can turn your stomach. I assumed that a restaurant such as this would devein shrimp prior to cooking. 

I pulled all the shrimp and deveined them myself, but I'd already lost my appetite. I did put the shrimp aside and ate some of the brown rice and veggies, but with my stomach already feeling a bit nauseous, that didn't go well. So now I'm left with an $8 meal sitting on my desk (soon to hit the garbage) with only about 1/8th of it consumed and having to find an alternative for lunch. 

Lesson learned, if I'm craving a good stir fry with shrimp, shell out the extra cash for PF Changs.

**** I thought eventually I'd go back, but I haven't been since then. We had some of their food catered in for work, it was overcooked, rubbery, and chewy. yeah, next time I'll get my own lunch.
rationale: The sentiment in the review is negative because the customer had a disappointing experience with their food order. The fact that the shrimp in their stir fry were not deveined, resulting in a stomach-turning discovery, led to a loss of appetite and ultimately a waste of money on an unsatisfactory meal. Additionally, the negative catering experience at work further solidified the customer's decision to avoid returning to the restaurant. These experiences reflect a general dissatisfaction and lack of confidence in the food quality provided by the establishment.

question: I've definitely had better. The overall quality of all the food....veggies and chicken, was definitely poor. I ate it but will definitely not go there again!
rationale: The sentiment is Negative because the user expressed disappointment with the overall quality of the food, describing it as "poor." Additionally, the user stated that they will not be returning to the establishment, which indicates a strong level of dissatisfaction with their experience.

question: We LOVE this place. Food is excellent, service fast, huge portions, reasonable prices. Egg drop soup, spring rolls, bourbon chicken with veg fried rice--fantastic. You will not be sorry you visited. On nice evenings or lunches, eat outside .
rationale: The review contains multiple positive aspects such as excellent food, fast service, huge portions, reasonable prices, and fantastic menu items like Egg drop soup and bourbon chicken with veg fried rice being highlighted. The reviewer also expresses a high level of satisfaction and recommends dining outside for a pleasant experience. Overall, the review exudes a sense of enjoyment and endorsement for the restaurant, making the sentiment clearly positive.

question:
I was in the area.  I was about to go to Pho Nam but decided to try Chins.  
My first impression was that this was a lot like Noodles and company with a Chinese decor.  It fell short in ambiance and flavor for me.
I ordered the Thai Noodles.
Thai Noodles: wide Asian noodles with bok choy, red onions, pea pods, and water
chestnuts in coconut curry with Thai seasonings, garnished with lime,
red pepper, and sprouts.
I didn't feel like this had a lot of flavor.  It was barely coconut curry and actually had a flavor that was different from anything I have ever had before.   The vegetable were fresh and the portion was good.
My overall experience was so so but I still ended up having a good time because I was able to witness an exchange between some people that was something like a scene out of the movie Slacker by Linklater.  
What happened is a person came in and recognized an old classmate.  They were friendly and greeted the other person with a hearty, "Hey! How have you been."  The other person didn't recognize them.  He introduced himself and then they knew who he was but they were completely distant and uninterested.  It was awkward.  A true cringe moment.  Some people can be so cold and insensitive.  It went on for about 5 minutes and really made my stop there interesting. 
There were a lot of people here from what it looked like they were on lunch from nearby businesses.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is negative because the customer found the restaurant ambiance and flavors lacking, specifically noting that the dish they ordered, Thai Noodles, lacked flavor and did not meet their expectations. Additionally, even though they found some fresh vegetables and a good portion size, the overall experience was rated as so-so. The customer only had a good time due to witnessing an awkward and uncomfortable exchange between two people at the restaurant, which added to their negative perception of their visit.

question: We love Asia Fresh. bourbon chicken with veg fried rice-perfect. Take away done quickly. service great. Great price.
rationale: The review expresses positive sentiment by highlighting several aspects of the experience that the customer enjoyed. They mentioned that the bourbon chicken with vegetable fried rice was perfect, the take away service was quick, the overall service was great, and they found the price to be great as well. These positive remarks indicate satisfaction with the food quality, service efficiency, and value for money, leading to an overall positive sentiment towards Asia Fresh.

question:
We did takeout from here and both thought our dinners were awesome.  We ordered:

 - Chicken wings with Sesame Szechuan sauce (you can get them with any stir fry sauce choice)
- Hot and sour soup
- Thai spring rolls
- Sesame chicken
- Sweet and sour chicken. 

Then we got stuck in rush hour/post blizzard traffic and had a 40 minute commute home.  We were both impressed how well the food held up after that amount of time! The flavor of the wings was good, but they were obviously no longer hot.  Next time we will try those when we dine in.   Everything else had lots of heat and flavor.  The hot and sour soup looked different than any other I have eaten, but it was still good and plenty hot.  I did not detect much sour in it, my only small complaint.  We both felt we had more than enough food for $23, and the quality was great.  We will definitely go back.  I am actually a little shocked at all the bad reviews on this place after our dining experience.  Not sure if they have improved things or we just hit it on a good night.  Service was fast, friendly and accurate...no complaints there.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer had an overall great dining experience. They enjoyed the variety of dishes they ordered, found the food to be flavorful despite being stuck in traffic for 40 minutes, and felt they received a good amount of quality food for the price. Additionally, the reviewer highlighted the fast, friendly, and accurate service they received. Their intention to return and the lack of major complaints indicate a positive impression of the restaurant.

question:
A fast-casual spin-off of a Minnesota-based, fast-food Chinese-American chain that likewise serves nothing special, Chin's gets one star for being the only Asian-American place I know of in Dane County that serves fried cream cheese wontons without crabmeat. I require a side dish of epinephrine if I eat crab, so I appreciate this omission. Now that I have established that I go here just for the cream cheese puffs, it should be clear that I'm far from an expert on Asian food. So take the rest of my review with a grain of salt; there should be plenty to spare in your entree. 

I used to think this place was ok -- it still has plenty of variety, a very friendly staff, good chili-garlic sauce, decent potstickers, above-average lettuce wraps, no grisly or fatty pieces of meat -- but lately the preparation has been sloppy and the presentation just as bad. I suspect the quality of the ingredients has come down a notch. 

After cream cheese wontons, Pad Thai is one of my favorite Asian entrees. My last order looked like Goldilocks's porridge in the "Three Little Bears" Golden Book I had as a kid. Dull gray, soupy, greasy, salty and watery, yet somehow sticky. The chopped peanuts added no crunch at all, which is too bad because other than the chicken pieces I picked through the mess to find, I was hoping to find something else edible. Epic fail on this entree. 

On my next visit, I ordered the Firecracker noodles with chicken, as a side to my beloved wontons. Slight improvement from last time but still salty as the Dead Sea and enough grease to de-squeak every door hinge on the west side. The bag was so heavy I skipped my biceps workout for a week. The red peppers had no life left. Again, I hunted and pecked for the chicken, which is consistently decent-quality, well-prepared white meat. My wife's veggie fried rice would have been ok -- they ease up on the salt and Valvoline for this entree -- but the vegetables were overcooked and charred in places. Fresh veggies should present as a bright spectrum of colors -- orange from the carrots, bright green from the scallions, broccoli and pea pods, yellow from the corncobettes. Instead, however, they were the same brown color as the fried rice. 

My last fortune cookie said I'll probably return to Chin's. It's on the way home from work, the food comes out fast and I can't resist those damn cream cheese wontons. Maybe I'll throw in some potstickers or wraps and call it dinner.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is negative because the reviewer describes several disappointing experiences with the food at Chin's, such as sloppy preparation, bad presentation, and low-quality ingredients. They express dissatisfaction with the Pad Thai and Firecracker noodles, criticizing their appearance, taste, and texture. Additionally, they mention that even dishes like veggie fried rice suffer from issues like overcooked vegetables. Despite their fondness for the cream cheese wontons and some other menu items, the overall negative experiences with multiple dishes contribute to the overall negative sentiment of the review.

question: We tried to order for delivery because we are 4 miles away. On their menu it says $15 minimum. We called to place the order and we were told today it's a $75 minimum. We found that insane so never ordered.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the customer had a frustrating experience with the restaurant's delivery policy. The sudden increase from a $15 minimum to a $75 minimum was perceived as unreasonable and "insane" by the customer, leading them to decide not to place an order. This change in policy likely left the customer feeling disappointed and inconvenienced.

question: I always get the lemon chicken and it's delicious! Nice light batter and very crispy with a good amount of sauce. The potstickers are also very good.
rationale: The review mentions that the lemon chicken is delicious, with a nice light batter, crispy texture, and good amount of sauce. Additionally, the reviewer enjoys the potstickers as well. These positive descriptions indicate that the overall dining experience was enjoyable, making the sentiment of the review positive.

question: Only thing less disappointing then the food is the staff.   Ordered Chin Wings, Hot & Sour soup and Sesame Chicken to go.. What I get in return is Chin Wings with the wrong stir fry sauce, a cup of hot & sour and lemon chicken.  They charged me for what I ordered, yet they still refused a refund me or to replace my food.. Avoid this place like the plague.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the customer experienced multiple issues with their order, including receiving incorrect items, being charged for the wrong order, and not receiving a refund or replacement despite the mistakes made by the staff. These errors resulted in a disappointing experience for the customer and a lack of satisfactory resolution from the restaurant.

question: The food was decent.  But yet again, the staff managed to screw my order up and ended up charging me more then what I should of payed for.
rationale: The sentiment is Negative because despite the decent quality of the food, the customer was dissatisfied with the service from the staff. The mistake in the order and the overcharging left a negative impression, overshadowing the positive aspect of the food. Customer service plays a crucial role in overall dining experience, and in this case, it fell short of expectations.

question: This is poor quality ingredients in a fast food, order at counter from the wall and they'll give you a number and bring it to you. Staff was sullen. Noodles were greasy and flavorless as were the spring rolls. Won't go back. I will say that the place looked clean.
rationale: The sentiment is Negative because the user expressed dissatisfaction with the quality of the food, describing it as greasy and flavorless. Additionally, they were unimpressed with the service, noting that the staff was sullen. Despite the cleanliness of the restaurant, the overall experience fell short of their expectations, leading them to not want to return.

question: I will never order from there again. I called to find out what was on the hot and spicy chicken. The person who answered informed me that it was both hot and spicy but it was serves with broccoli, snow peas and onions. Once I got my entree it was neither hot nor spicy. On top of that, there was no broccoli. Too many onions, barely any snow peas AND a very small amount of chicken. Did I mention that I don't think the chicken was actually chicken? It was cut so thin and had no chicken flavor. The white rice that accompanied my dish was mushy and clumped together. I've made better rice boiling it. My mom had the Kung pao chicken and she was also dissatisfied with her meal. The crab Rangoon was ok... Fairly basic. \n\nI won't return there. I would prefer to give it a ZERO
rationale: The sentiment is Negative because the customer had a negative experience with both the hot and spicy chicken dish they ordered and the Kung pao chicken their mom ordered. They were dissatisfied with the quality and taste of the food, mentioning that the hot and spicy chicken was not as described, lacking flavor and ingredients, and the chicken possibly not being genuine. Additionally, they were unhappy with the mushy, clumped white rice and found the crab Rangoon to be only average. Overall, the customer felt let down by the food and service and expressed a strong preference to never return to the restaurant.

question: I have ordered food from here on numerous occasions. It's always been good and reasonably priced. I wish they delivered. That is the only drawback.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the user consistently enjoys the food from the restaurant, finds it reasonably priced, and mentions that the only drawback is the lack of delivery service. The user's overall satisfaction with the quality and affordability of the food reflects a positive experience.

question: If you and your dog want to feel at home this is the place to go. My wife and I were walking through a park of John Nolan dr. Seen a beautiful dog. We got talking to the owner. We asked her where she had her dog groomed at lori's was the place. Next day we had our dogs with us. We stopped at Lori's just to meet and greet and ask a lot of question. Lori said she has been doing this for 20 plus years wow. She said she had one cancellation. We felt very welcomed and were happy with all the answers. We did leave one of our dog Angel for a full spa treatment. We were so happy with the shampoo nail and all other cleanings. We are glad we seen Maggie and her owner that day. I have always believed in supporting local businesses and products thanks again
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer had a pleasant experience at Lori's grooming salon. They felt welcomed and received satisfactory answers to their questions. The fact that the reviewer left their dog for a full spa treatment and were happy with the services further demonstrates their satisfaction. Additionally, the reviewer expresses appreciation for supporting local businesses, indicating a positive overall experience.

question: Went to Denny's this morning for breakfast with my twins and fiance. We walked in the door and their was no hostess which is understandable if they are busy but they really weren't. We had at least five servers look dead at us as well as cooks and stood there for a good five minutes and still no one said anything to us so we walked out and went to the McDonald's across the street.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the customer experienced a lack of proper attention and service at Denny's. Despite multiple staff members being present and noticing the customers waiting, no one acknowledged them or offered assistance. This led to the customers feeling ignored and ultimately choosing to leave and go to a different restaurant.

question: it's a starbucks...what can I say other than it's as great as every starbucks I've been to!  Friendly service and a consistant product.  yay!
rationale: The review expresses positive feelings towards the Starbucks store, highlighting the friendly service and consistent product quality. The reviewer's use of words like "great" and "yay" indicates a sense of satisfaction and enjoyment with their experience. Overall, the review conveys a positive sentiment towards the Starbucks location, reaffirming the reviewer's positive impressions of the brand in general.

question: I haven't been to this location as much as I have some of the other locations but I do enjoy this location. Again they are all kind of the same in a sense but its about the interior and the experience. I actually quite like the people who work at this location. I have seen the same people working here for a while now and they always make me feel so welcome. They are usually a couple of early 30's to middle aged women working here that make ya feel like mom is welcoming you home. \"What can I get ya hun,\" \"How's your day going sweety,\" that kind of stuff. And some people may not like that but I enjoy it because it makes you feel way more comfortable to be somewhere. They are always fast and efficient and any extras you may want are stocked plentifully. The one small thing I don't like is that they are tucked away and really have to be looking for it to know where it is and it is sort of a small building. It can get really cramped if there is a line in there and pushed against some of the valuables. Nice place to stop after some shopping if ya know where it is.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer expresses genuine enjoyment of the location, specifically highlighting the welcoming atmosphere created by the friendly staff members. The reviewer appreciates the personalized attention and efficient service provided by the employees, which contributes to a sense of comfort and satisfaction. Despite minor drawbacks like the location being tucked away and the small building size, the positive interactions with the staff and the well-stocked extras contribute to an overall positive experience for the reviewer.

question: It is so-so.   I went in on  a Sunday morning so it was pretty slow.   The employees were busy talking so they did not great me when I came in and then I asked for them to clean some tables.....I got a sigh and the guy went and cleaned the tables.   Not a single clean table in the place.   You would think if it was that slow the place would be clean!
rationale: The sentiment of the review is negative because the customer experienced slow service upon entering the establishment, with employees not acknowledging them and being preoccupied with talking. The request to clean tables was met with a dismissive attitude, further adding to the negative experience. Additionally, the lack of clean tables despite the slow business suggests a lack of attention to cleanliness and customer satisfaction. All these factors contribute to the overall negative sentiment expressed in the review.

question:
The ice cream is excellent but a little pricey.  The service is less than stellar.  Our daughter bought a cone and discovered a hair in it.  When we returned to the counter and informed the employee that sold us the cone she actually said "We've been getting that a lot lately".  Great!

Also, if you order anything to be picked up later, like a birthday cake or cupcakes, make sure you call before you go to pick it up as they seem to be less than organized with their orders.

I gave them a 2 star rating based on the excellent flavors... it should have been at least a 4.5 with some attention to customer service.
rationale: The sentiment is Negative because the review highlights multiple issues with the ice cream shop, including finding a hair in the ice cream, poor customer service exhibited by the employee's casual response to the issue, and disorganized order management for pick-up items. These factors significantly detract from the overall dining experience and indicate a lack of attention to customer satisfaction. Although the flavors were praised, the negative aspects outweighed the positive, resulting in a low rating.

question: Agreed with Dave's review about the staff and service being a hit or miss. I normally don't make stops anymore to cold stone restaurants because their ice cream is so expensive. Plus, I don't care for the taste of their ice cream. Maybe it is just me, but I think it's overrated.
rationale: The reviewer expresses dissatisfaction with the staff and service, mentioning it being hit or miss. Additionally, they find Cold Stone's ice cream expensive and do not enjoy the taste, ultimately deeming it overrated. These negative experiences and perceptions contribute to an overall negative sentiment in the review.

question:
Time has not been kind to this Cold Stone Creamery location.  For a while, it was the next great thing - there always were long lines of families anxious to get their butterfat and sugar fix.  The buzz has faded and now those same families flock to the local froyo joints to get their frozen dairy fix.  I stopped by this weekend while shopping at Greenway Station and found the store devoid of patrons.  I know it's been a long, cold winter, but we Wisconsinites love our ice cream and Babcock Hall was standing room only when I visited later that same day.

So why does my ice-creaming loving family now generally eschew Cold Stone?
* Texture - I really prefer a firm scoop of ice cream and that's not what you get at Cold Stone.  The texture is far too gooey for my liking.  It's not terrible, but I much prefer the denser texture of the product at Babcock Dairy or The Chocolate Shoppe any day of the week and twice on Sunday.  The other textural problem is that Cold Stone ice cream melts too fast, so bring a gross of handi-wipes when bringing the kiddos here. 
 
* Flavor - The ice cream here is too sweet.  At Cold Stone, it is all about excess, whether it be about the butterfat content, the sugar content or the oversaturated flavorings.  Again, it's not terrible, but it's just not my cup of tea.

* Serving Size - The theme of excess carries over to the over-the-top serving sizes.  While I am not a huge fan of froyo, at least I can control my serving size when I visit the near-by Menchies or Orange Leaf.  In addition, while I'm on the topic of serving sizes, can I just add that I detest the cutesy "Like It", "Love It" and "Gotta Have It" serving size names.

* Service - When the place first opened, the staff was energetic and responsive.  I admit it was hokey, but I kinda liked the dorky songs they sang when you left a tip.  But now, a trip to Cold Stone is more like visiting a gulag.  Leaving a tip rarely triggers a response, much less a chorus of "Ice cream, baby" sung to the tune of Ice, Ice Baby.  My other pet peeve is that the tables always seem to be sticky, thanks to the soupiness of the ice cream.  It's really kind of a depressing place to visit now.

* Pro tip: If you have a peanut allergy, have them clean the stone before they mix your ice cream or you risk cross contaminating your treat.  (I learned that the hard way.)
rationale: The sentiment is Negative because the reviewer expresses disappointment with various aspects of their experience at Cold Stone Creamery. They mention issues with texture, flavor, serving sizes, and service quality, all of which contribute to their overall dissatisfaction with the establishment. The reviewer's critique of the ice cream's texture, sweetness, and melting rate, as well as their negative comments about the serving sizes and declining service standards, collectively paint a negative picture of their visit to Cold Stone. Additionally, the reviewer's account of a sticky environment and potential health risks for those with allergies further supports the negative sentiment expressed in the review.

question: I don't recommend going there.  My wife and I decided to go there for some dessert after a very nice dinner.  I wanted an \"Apple Pie A la Cold Stone\".  I have had this before and it is normally very good.  I was told that they had been out of the pie filling for a while.  Yet this is one of their \"Signature Creations\".  I would expect that if this is something that they always have that they would have on their menu, they would have the ingredients for it.  Then, My wife ordered their seasonal \"Funnel Cake Sundae.  My wife ended up waiting 15 minutes for this.  Jacob and Chad told us that they had to reheat the Funnel cake for the sundae twice.  This made is rock hard and she had to throw most of the funnel cake away because she could not eat it.  As we were waiting, I noticed how dirty the entire interior was.  It looks like the floors and base boards have not cleaning in months.  Tables and floors were dirty and sticky-GROSS.  I did not check the bathrooms, too scared to try.  On top of all this, the price for their \"Creations\" is way too high!!!  I am tempted to call the health department for an inspection.  DON\"T GO THERE!!!  it is a waste of time and money.
rationale: The sentiment of this review is negative because the customer had a disappointing experience at the dessert place. They were unable to get the item they wanted due to unavailability of ingredients for a signature creation, the dessert they did receive was of poor quality, and the overall cleanliness of the establishment was lacking. Additionally, the high prices added to the dissatisfaction. The customer's mention of being tempted to call the health department further emphasizes the negative sentiment due to concerns about cleanliness and possibly food safety issues.

question: First off,I feel I am friendly and easy to get along with, but this was the worst \"bartending experience\" I have ever encountered! [It was Thanksgiving Eve 6:15 in case the owner/manager might read this]. Either I was 1] not a regular or 2]a bother. NEVER again!
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the customer expresses dissatisfaction and disappointment with their bartending experience, describing it as the worst they have ever encountered. The customer also indicated that they felt unwelcome or undervalued, suggesting a lack of good customer service or hospitality. Overall, the review conveys a strong sense of displeasure and frustration, leading to a negative sentiment.

question:
So the Boar, as we affectionately call it. It's good for a lot of things. Darts, pool, Tuesday blues night (live blues band!), fun times, decent beer, waffle fries, and fried cheese curds (if you don't mind the sort that come from the freezer). The food? Not so great. It's not so bad, but it's just not that good.

I think everything is frozen at this place. Everything. We had pizza there the other night and I could taste the freezer burn. We still had a blast, but it would be nice if the food wasn't so obviously frozen. Everything is ordered from the bar, which is fine but a little weird.

There isn't too much to say about this place other than what I've just said. I'll go back because my friends at work like it, but it wouldn't be my top choice. There are definitely other places that can fill my dart needs while providing me with at least decent, non-frozen food.

Sorry, Boar - the truth can hurt.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is negative because the customer expresses disappointment with the food quality at the Boar, mentioning that everything seems frozen and even tasting freezer burn in their pizza. Although they enjoy certain aspects like the activities and atmosphere, the overall dining experience seems to be lacking due to the perceived low quality of the food. The reviewer notes that they would prefer other establishments with better food options, indicating a general dissatisfaction with the dining experience at the Boar.

question: This place is actually pretty neat. I loved the Boars heads on the wall and the old western type feel to it. The drinks were really good, well made and strong but for some reason I really enjoyed the food. For being bar food it was actually pretty spectacular. Any drink ya like at a cheap price and some cool stuff to look at. Whats not to like? They got big TV's and fast service. (eBay style) A++++++++++++ Great Seller!!!!!! Will do business again!
rationale: The review expresses multiple positive aspects of the experience at the place, including the ambiance, quality of drinks, unexpectedly enjoyable food offerings, affordable prices, cool decor, large TVs, and fast service. The reviewer explicitly states their enjoyment and satisfaction with the experience and even adds humor with an "eBay style" reference and a playful A++++++++++++ rating. Overall, the review conveys a clear sense of happiness and enthusiasm about the establishment, hence justifying the positive sentiment.

question: My family has been going to Dr. Killian for years now and he has always been an extremely good dentist, very kind, professional, and comforting when it comes to some of the more serious procedures. Not only that, he has just recently updated his facility via a $1 Million investment! He now has luxorious massaging dental chairs, state-of-the-art equipment and even a moveable LCD TV above the chair so as to relax you while you're worked on! The lobby is gorgeous with a massive 60\" some odd LCD HDTV etc. This is an EXCELLENT dentist. He has been in the business for, well since before i was even born! which is over 20 years, so he knows exactly what he is doing. Also his son just moved into the building so there are now 2 great dentists working in the same building.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer highlights several positive aspects of their experience with Dr. Killian's dental practice. They emphasize his professionalism, kindness, and comfort during procedures, as well as the recent $1 million investment in updating the facility with luxurious amenities such as massaging dental chairs and a moveable LCD TV. The reviewer also mentions the extensive experience of Dr. Killian, spanning over 20 years in the field, which instills confidence in his expertise. Additionally, the addition of another great dentist in the building adds to the positive experience for patients. Overall, the review portrays Dr. Killian's practice in a highly favorable light, indicating a positive sentiment.

question: Dr. Killian is our family's favorite dentist, including my husband the dentalphobe, and our two young daughters. We appreciate the beautiful facility, private rooms, gentle hygienists and top notch dental care.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the review highlights several positive aspects of the dental practice: being a favorite dentist for the whole family, including a dentalphobic husband and young daughters, indicates a high level of satisfaction and trust. The mention of a beautiful facility, private rooms, gentle hygienists, and top-notch dental care further emphasizes the positive experiences and quality of service received from Dr. Killian's practice.

question: Hard to rate a McDonald's well.  I go through the drive thru most mornings for coffee and will eat lunch there from time to time.  Drive thru service is always great and restaurant is always clean.  They hire and retain good help.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer consistently mentions good and satisfactory experiences when visiting the McDonald's location. They praise the drive-thru service, cleanliness of the restaurant, and the quality of the staff. Overall, the reviewer seems to have a positive impression of the establishment based on their regular visits for coffee and occasional lunch meals.

question: I ate here on Dec 1st (big mac combo) and it did not feel well after words. I learned that they and all Mc D's use ammoniated beef, it is frank'in food. Madison is full of privately owned restaurants that serve real food, not chemical and byproducts dressed up as food. Save your kids, save your self. Just say no to the evil fake food
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer had a negative experience after eating at the restaurant. They mentioned feeling unwell after consuming a Big Mac combo and expressed concern about the use of ammoniated beef and the perception of fast food as "fake food." This review reflects dissatisfaction with the food quality and the overall experience at the restaurant.

question:
Seriously, I love this place! I wish I could give them ten stars! I've got three corgis and after a co-worker referred me here in 2009, I'll never go anywhere else. Every vet my dogs have seen is wonderful...between the three pups I've met with three of the doctors. They're all sincere, empathetic, thorough, understanding, engaging, respectful, and love to share their knowledge. Dr. Haroldson is a sweetheart and can probably put any nervous pet-parent at ease. Dr. Erickson is calm and laid-back, and I can talk to him about even the most awkward pet problems. Dr. Schweitzer is lively--a total hoot. Anyone who likes The Walking Dead AND Downton Abbey is alright in my book!

All Pets has been able to see me with very short notice, has never rushed me in and out the door, and always made me feel like my dogs were their top priority, even on busier days. They communicate clearly about diagnostic and treatment options. Their prices are very reasonable, and they try less expensive solutions first, instead of immediately recommending the most costly. Not that I'm cheap, it's just that having three dogs adds up. When they weren't 100% positive about something, they aren't afraid to ask each other for second opinions, which I appreciated when my dog Harry swallowed a corncob and had to have emergency surgery.

That's another thing I love about this place, is that they remember all my dogs names when I walk in the door. Not only the vets, but the front desk staff. Maybe it's my fiction-writer's imagination, but they really make me feel like a VIP. Kenna is always so excited to greet my pups and I love hearing about hers. Dana has a killer sense of humor and if you're lucky, she'll grace you with one of her zingers. Having three rambunctious corgis that get into trouble (catching rabbits and getting worms, swallowing corncobs and needing surgery, attacking car windows and breaking teeth, spraining toes from too much running) means I get to visit more often, and I honestly do not mind at all.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is positive because the customer expresses love and admiration for the veterinary clinic they visit. They highlight the excellent care provided by the veterinarians, the attentive and friendly staff, the reasonable pricing, and the personalized attention given to their dogs. The customer also appreciates the thorough communication, the lack of rushing during appointments, and the sense of being valued and welcomed as a client. Overall, the review is filled with praise and positive experiences, indicating a high level of satisfaction with the services received.

question: great hotel for the price. the rooms are more like a boutique hotel with mid century modern kind of look and feel. decent breakfast and friendly staff.
rationale: The review indicates that the hotel is perceived as a good value for the price, with rooms that have a favorable boutique and mid-century modern aesthetic. Additionally, the positive mention of a decent breakfast and friendly staff implies a satisfactory experience overall. These observations contribute to an overall positive sentiment about the hotel.

question:
The rooms were clean, and all of the furniture was very new. Water pressure in the shower was excellent. Quite a selection of channels on the "idiot-box" and free internet in all of the rooms.

The breakfast buffet in the morning was one of the best I have seen in these small travel motels. Lots of food choices, and they kept it well stocked through the rushes.

We will stay here again next time in this area and would definitely recommend if you are visiting Madison, WI
rationale: The review mentions several positive aspects of the accommodation, such as clean rooms, new furniture, excellent water pressure in the shower, a wide selection of TV channels, free internet, and a satisfying breakfast buffet with plenty of food choices. The reviewer expresses intent to return to the hotel and recommends it to others visiting the area. Overall, the review highlights various amenities and services that exceeded the reviewer's expectations, leading to a positive sentiment.

question:
They have decent drink specials. However the bar is sometimes filled with older trashier drunks. Its defintely an older crowd where Cougars are lurking. 

On the weekend they have free live music. Its usually too loud to converse with your group but the bands usually arn't terrible.  

Ive never had their food but Ive heard its pretty decent. 

Overall it an ok place to go to get a few drinks. Sadly its one of the better bars in Middleton. Not as much of a dive as the Club Tavern or Bristled Boar and not as Towny as Pauls grill ....And if your into older trashy women this place is for you.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the review mentions that the bar is filled with older, trashier drunks, implying a negative atmosphere. Additionally, the reference to "older trashy women" may come across as derogatory and disrespectful. While there are some positives mentioned, such as decent drink specials and live music, the overall tone of the review is critical and suggests that the bar may not be appealing to everyone.

question: Absolutely the best club sandwich I have had in a looong time. I order it everytime I go and it has never been less than awesome. And it's priced really well. \n\nAnytime I've gone at night the crowd is a little rough looking and the music is too loud. But going in the early evening or for lunch usually works pretty well.
rationale: The sentiment is Positive because the reviewer clearly expresses enthusiasm and satisfaction with the club sandwich, describing it as the best they have had in a long time and consistently awesome. Despite some minor criticisms about the atmosphere at certain times, the overall tone of the review is positive, emphasizing the value and quality of the food.

question: Happened to be here for a recent Packer game, partly cuz they advertise half price apps during the game and partly cuz of their presence in 'Madison Cocktail' book.Service was sketchy at best.Waited 10-15 minutes for a beer and then was advised only 'select' apps were half price [2-3 of 16 on menu]?! Hmmm.Also use of the cocktail book was viewed as a nuisance. I say if you sell them readily accept them ...In summary,felt like the customer catered to the server rather than vice versa To their credit Hody club sandwich was very good.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is Negative because the customer experienced poor service, including long wait times for drinks and limited selection for the advertised half-price appetizers. Additionally, the customer felt that using a cocktail book was viewed as a nuisance by the staff, indicating a lack of attentiveness and willingness to accommodate customers. Overall, the review suggests a feeling of disappointment and frustration with the service received at the establishment.

question: A wide variety of people mingle at this bar...classy, trashy, young, old, professional, you name it.  The band was o.k., the beer was not very cold but the prices were ok for the area.  This place needs to place more emphasis on bartenders that are courteous and clean in appearance.   Probably the longest wait for a drink in an unpopulated establishment!!  Tip accordingly
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer highlights several issues they experienced at the bar, including slow service despite the lack of a crowd, lukewarm beer, and a band that was just okay. Additionally, the reviewer points out the need for the bar to prioritize hiring courteous and clean bartenders. These factors contributed to an overall unsatisfactory experience for the reviewer, leading them to recommend tipping accordingly.

question: I was really excited to come here and usually really like cajun food. What I got was a plate full of super-salty rice and beans. I couldn't finish it and left hungry. I'm hoping it was just a mistake. I'll give it another try one of these days.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer expressed disappointment with their dining experience, mentioning receiving salty food that was difficult to eat and ultimately leaving the restaurant hungry. Their statement that they hope it was a mistake and that they may give the restaurant another chance in the future indicates a mixed sentiment with an overall negative impression.

question:
I decided, after much positive feedback from clients of mine(and a peek at my fellow yelpers reviews), to surprise my BF with dinner at Louisianne's for our third anniversary tonight. From the moment we walked in, I was really charmed. It has this cavernous feel(in a good, cozy romantic way--not a dank, moldy creepy way) with nice lighting and just all around nice ambiance. 

Our waitress was good, if a bit overzealous...and I loved the fact that she automatically brought me a small carafe of iced tea when she brought my filled glass. Nice. I'm a heavy(tea) drinker, so this was great! I enjoyed my shrimp and corn chowder, but I would have liked to have seen a bit more shrimp(but when is TOO MUCH shrimp ever possible). I also had roasted shrimp for my entree, which were delicious! Nice spicy flavor, with a ton of rosemary. I wasn't too impressed with the side of spinach and tomatoes, however. The Cabernet reduction that they came DOUSED in was a bit too rich. I wish it had been more of a glaze than a heavy sauce. No matter, I was too full to eat much of it anyhow. My boyfriend seemed surprised and delighted by the coffee roasted chicken with the orange-ricotta sauce( the bite I had was quite tasty). 

Also, I love the fact that they have live jazz on the piano tues-sat nights starting at 6pm(although tonight he started more like 6:30). It was really nice. We said that we would definitely go another night for drinks and appetizers(which looked tempting) in the bar/lounge area with friends.
rationale: The sentiment in the review is positive because the user expresses overall satisfaction with their experience at Louisianne's for their anniversary dinner. They highlight the charming ambiance, good service, enjoyable food like the shrimp and corn chowder and roasted shrimp, and the live jazz music which they found to be really nice. The user also mentions future plans to return for drinks and appetizers with friends, indicating a desire to revisit the restaurant. Overall, the user's positive feedback and enthusiasm throughout the review convey a sense of enjoyment and satisfaction with their dining experience.

question:
Louisianne's has seared it's place inside of my restaurant experience. The food is so good, that every time my girlfriend and I consider going to any other restuarant, we would have to consider the huge opportunity cost of not going to Louisianne's.

The place is dungeon-esque, but not in a bad way. It's dimly lit, underground, but often times has a pianist setting the New Orleans mood.

The food is incredible. Every time we go there we try to get something different, and we're floored by how good the meals are, and how much of it you get. The appetizers were delicious (we've had the platter for two, and the pulled pork crepes), the soup we've had with our entrees were amazing each time, with an intense flavor.

Their specials change every time we've been there, and if they don't interest you, their regular menu is always exceptional. We've had the roasted shrimp, the tasso and shrimp fettucine, the maple-cured duck, the steak, the seafood au gratin, and each time not only did we get one delicious meal, but enough to have an amazing lunch the next day.

The only con I can give Louisianne's is that they give you so much good food that you can never get to the desserts. This restaurant is the one that my girlfriend and I benchmark all other restaurants by, and before we go out to eat anywhere else, we have to strongly consider the consequences of NOT going to Louisianne's.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer expresses high praise for Louisianne's in multiple aspects. They consistently highlight the quality and quantity of the food, the appealing ambiance with live music, and the variety on the menu. The reviewer even mentions how they compare all other restaurants to Louisianne's and acknowledge the "consequences" of not dining there. Overall, the reviewer's enthusiastic and complimentary language clearly indicates a positive sentiment towards their dining experiences at Louisianne's.

question: In case you don't know, Louisianne's has started serving lunch, The good news is that it is inexpensive and delicious. I had a cup of shrimp bisque that was outstanding, and the grilled chicken po'boy tasted very fresh (the shredded romaine lettuce was much appreciated). The only bad news is the general ambience of the upstairs lunch area . . . rather dark and uninviting.
rationale: The sentiment is Positive because the review highlights the positive aspects of the dining experience, such as the delicious and inexpensive lunch options at Louisianne's. The reviewer praises the outstanding shrimp bisque and fresh grilled chicken po'boy, showing appreciation for specific ingredients like the shredded romaine lettuce. Despite mentioning a downside about the ambience of the lunch area being dark and uninviting, the overall tone of the review remains positive due to the emphasis on the tasty and affordable food offerings.

question:
Yelpers, you let me down! 

I was on my business trip to WI, and i was very excited about trying this restaurant!  boy, it was a huge disappointment.  

have crab puff pastry as appetizer.  this was pretty decent dish.  the puff pasty came out flaky, just how it should be.  i could taste the crab flavor and almond crisps. it was very delicious. 

I also ordered the lobster bisque.  bisque was on the salty side, but it was ok with the bread.  i wish i could have stopped my meal here....  

Everyone on yelp was raving about their raspberry sauce on the house salad.  so i ordered that just to try the raspberry dressing, and huge disappointment.  it came with this layer of oil, and not enough "sauce".  when i poured onto my salad it was just drenched in oil.  i didn't even eat the salad.  

I had the steak special of the night and it was not good at all!  the meat was over cooked charred (i like my meat medium rare), the rice was undercooked, it was crunch, and the sauce was not good at all, it did not compliment the dish.   i only ate the shrimp.  it was $35 dish i only picked shrimp from it

The service was soooooo slow that night.  usually i enjoy my meals like these but that night i wanted just GET OUT OF THERE! the server took forever to bring out my dishes and i was getting really impatient.  for the amount of time at was at the table, she didn't come by to check up on me when i needed anything.  ugh.  never again.
rationale: The sentiment of this review is negative because the reviewer expresses disappointment and dissatisfaction with multiple aspects of their dining experience. They mention that the lobster bisque was too salty, the raspberry dressing was oily, the steak was overcooked, the rice undercooked, and the service was slow. Overall, the reviewer did not enjoy the food or the service at the restaurant and felt let down by the experience.

question: if you're looking for a nice night out, keep looking...
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer implies that the place being discussed is not a good option for a nice night out. They suggest that others should continue their search for a better location or experience, indicating disappointment or dissatisfaction with the place in question.

question: We decided to sit at the bar and have our dinner there so we could listen to the piano player.  We waited a very long time to place a drink order, while watching the bartender stand and converse with other patrons. Then, it was an even longer wait to order dinner.  (empty tables all over, so it wasn't due to being busy)  We weren't sure who was supposed to be taking care of us, the bartender or a waitress.   The bartender took our drink order after a long wait, and then after that, finally a waitress came by as asked,  \"I guess you want to hear our specials?\"  She took our order and we never saw her again.  Water came half way through our meal from the bartender.  Our empty plates sat on our table for 25 minutes.  We felt very unattended to and almost a bother to the staff.  The food is excellent, however, and that just makes it tolerable to go there.  It is not an inexpensive place to eat, and it feels like a place where you should have excellent service.  I got tired of trying to flag someone down all evening.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is Negative because the customer experienced poor service during their visit to the restaurant. They had to wait a long time to place a drink order, felt unsure about who was supposed to be serving them, encountered delays in receiving water and having their plates cleared, and overall felt neglected and like a bother to the staff. Despite the good quality of the food, the lack of attentive service significantly impacted their experience negatively. This review highlights the importance of good customer service in providing a positive dining experience.

question:
The moment you walk in you are transported into another time and place. They had live music that fit the scene, made the atmosphere, and stayed background enough to have a conversation - check it out Tuesdays through Saturdays.

Order the pecan catfish with the crawfish BBQ on top, aka "Maria's special". It sounds wacky but the pecans really go with the blackened catfish. The tasso and shrimp fettuccine - a combination of shrimp, smoked ham, and mustard cream sauce sounds like a questionable combination but it is soothing, hot soul food at its fanciest.
