Everything we ate had depth, richness, and finesse. If you are a soup snob, definitely get the soup over the salad option. Presentation was lacking but I don't think that's the point of soul food.  

Service is sassy but whole-hearted. We walked in without reservations at 7pm on a Friday and when we asked if we could sit at the bar we were told "yeah, if you can find seats".  We found a couple stools and ordered dinner at the bar. It isn't bend over backwards service, but they are real people and sometimes that's better. Maria, our bartender who's worked there 13 years, gave excellent food and drink recs and was really attentive despite the rush - she basically made our night. 

It's a great place to bring guests if you want to head off to a chill and unexpected place. Even better if you're prepared to stuff your faces with well-executed comfort food. Try the Sazerac if you want a stiff, sweet drink and the Hurricane if you want a fruity, refreshing beverage that punches like a Long Island. The crowd here is mature and casually well-dressed.
rationale: The review expresses admiration for the atmosphere, live music, and unique food offerings at the restaurant. The reviewer praises the flavors, richness, and depth of the dishes, as well as the attentive service provided by the long-time bartender Maria. Despite some minor criticisms about presentation and sassy service, the overall tone is positive and highlights the enjoyable dining experience. The reviewer recommends the restaurant for its unexpected charm and well-executed comfort food, making the sentiment of the review positive.

question:
Emeril Lagasse would have been disappointed. There was no Bam! during our visit to Louisianne's on 9/10/13.

The good: my wife's company, the wine list, the evening's piano player, the salad, and the crawfish corn chowder.

The bad: the thick, yellow, and salty cream sauce our mussels swam in and the worn out carpet on the stairs leading down to the restaurant.

The ugly:  The not so special blackened swordfish entrée with salty sides and the shrimp etouffee.  The classic Cajun dish was a generous amount of white rice with salty ketchup sauce.  :-(
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the review highlights several disappointing aspects of the dining experience at Louisianne's. Specific criticisms of various dishes, such as the mussels in a thick, yellow, and salty cream sauce and the shrimp etouffee with a salty ketchup sauce, indicate a lack of satisfaction with the food quality. Additionally, negative comments about the worn-out carpet and the lackluster blackened swordfish entrée further contribute to the overall negative sentiment expressed in the review.

question:
Stopped in for a drink on Monday night. A few observations:
   Drinks: My martini and cosmopolitans were delicious. S. really enjoyed his whisky sour. Drinks were very good.
   Food: For an appetizer, we ordered the crab cakes. I had the Pecan-Encrusted Catfish and the seafood bisque, and S. had the pork entree and the pork and sweet potato soup. We were both very impressed. I don't even eat meat, but I tried S.'s pork entree and it was A M A Z I N G. And I can't say enough good things about the catfish. I was so glad to have some left over, which I ate cold the next morning!  
   Service: Our server was so, so wonderful. I wish I could remember his name. Young guy, dark hair, thin. He recommended essentially all of our food to us, and we were happy with all of it. The bartender also came by and checked to make sure I liked my cosmo (I wasn't sure I'd like it). She was quite friendly.

Will definitely go back the next time we are in Madison.
rationale: The sentiment in the review is positive because the customer had a great experience overall. They enjoyed their drinks, the food was impressive and delicious, and the server provided excellent recommendations. The customer described the food as amazing and expressed satisfaction with the service. Additionally, they mentioned they would definitely return to the restaurant in the future. These points indicate a positive sentiment towards the dining experience.

question: Fun, warm, lively catacomb place, often with piano music. Food is always really good. I want to hang out here more.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer uses positive adjectives like "fun," "warm," and "lively" to describe the atmosphere of the catacomb place. Additionally, they mention that the food is "really good," indicating a satisfying dining experience. The reviewer also expresses a desire to spend more time at the venue, further emphasizing their positive feelings toward it.

question: I've brought business contacts and executives from my firm to Louisiannes'.  Always they have been impressed with the quality of the food, the ambiance of the facility and the attentiveness of the staff.  It compares well with top quality restaurants all over the world.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the review emphasizes the consistent satisfaction of the reviewer's business contacts and executives at Louisiannes. The high praise for the quality of the food, the ambiance, and the attentiveness of the staff indicates that the restaurant consistently meets or exceeds expectations. Additionally, comparing Louisiannes favorably to top quality restaurants worldwide indicates a high level of satisfaction and a positive overall experience.

question: I love this place.  I love the ambiance, the food, and the drinks.  It's even better when they have a lounge singer in the background.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer expresses love for the place, specifically mentioning the ambiance, food, and drinks. The mention of enjoying a lounge singer in the background further adds to the positive experience. Overall, the reviewer's words convey a strong sense of enjoyment and satisfaction with their experience at the place.

question: My husband took me here in our very first date (7years ago) and every year we make a visit. I am absolutely addicted to their crawfish cheesecake and my goodness the crab puffs are amazing. Every visit I contemplate getting a platter of the crab puffs for myself and no one else. The bartenders have always been outstanding with their recommendations and drink specials and extremely friendly when waiting for your table. I love the atmosphere and the waitresses are usually on point and keep our water glasses full which is my biggest pet peeve. Definitely make this a stop if you enjoy and intimate atmosphere with rich food. I am still keeping it 5 stars despite my one issue which is there has rarely (if any) been a menu change in the 7 years of me eating there. Their nightly/weekly specials --when available are delicious, too!
rationale: The sentiment in the review is positive because the reviewer expresses their strong attachment to the restaurant over the years, highlighting their addiction to specific dishes like the crawfish cheesecake and crab puffs. They also mention the outstanding service from bartenders and waitresses, as well as the enjoyable atmosphere. The reviewer appreciates the consistency of the menu and enjoys the occasional specials offered by the restaurant. Overall, the reviewer seems very satisfied and enthusiastic about their dining experiences at the restaurant, hence the positive sentiment.

question:
Found this little gem of a place while in Madison last weekend.

The restaurant is in the basement of a building which you access through an outside stairwell on the side. A cheerful hostess greeted us as we descended the stairs into the restaurant. 

We were seated in an area where we couldn't see the piano, but we could hear it. The live music and singing were very soft and relaxing. The mood lighting is dark but warm, and along with the decor gives this place a nice, cozy, romantic feel.

We had an 8:30 pm dinner reservation, so most of the people already there were finishing up as we came in. So this made for a nice, quiet, charming evening after the day's noise and hustle.

I ordered the Crawfish Etouffee and my date ordered the Seafood Au Gratin. The Etouffee was SUPURB. Not too spicy, but just enough. Lots of marvelous flavor, and a good sized portion served on a plate surrounded by white rice. 

The Seafood Au Gratin was OUTSTANDING. The cheese sauce was very hearty and rich, served over linguini pasta. 

The food took a little on the long side to come out, but it was well worth the wait. The waitress was cheerful and attentive, and the manager stopped by to check on us, which is always appreciated. 

We walked out of there well-fed and very happy. If you're looking for a charming restaurant for a nice evening out, Louisianne's is the place.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is positive because the reviewer describes the restaurant as a "little gem" with a cozy and romantic atmosphere, soft live music, good service from a cheerful waitress and attentive manager, and delicious food that they thoroughly enjoyed. The reviewer specifically highlights the excellent taste of their dishes, the pleasant dining experience, and the overall feeling of being well-fed and happy after their meal. The positive descriptions throughout the review indicate a high level of satisfaction with their dining experience at Louisianne's.

question:
What a mess of a hotel. I guess that maybe I grew up in an era where the Marriott name meant class and luxury. 
I can't blame Marriott for the fact that the hotel was hosting the Little Miss (Jon Benet) America contest. The hotel was overran with 6 year olds wearing make up and donning skimpy outfits. It's disturbing that Parent's lives are so unfulfilled that they have to dress their children like Cocktail waitresses at a seedy bar. 
The hotel was totally booked. You had ten floors worth of rooms, but yet the hotel only had two elevators. It was pretty annoying to wait 15 minutes every time you wanted to go up to your room. 
And the kicker was on Sunday morning when we wanted to have breakfast at the hotel restaurant. The hotel had nobody on duty to bus tables, so while it was obvious that the restaurant was half empty, but there was a 15 minute wait to be seated. Of course the hostess acted like an office temp, with a bad attitude. That was a perfect ending to our hell stay at the Marriott-Madison West. I couldn't check out of that hotel fast enough. 
In the future, I would rather stay at a hotel with sticky sheets, that rents it's rooms by the hour than ever stay at a Marriott again.
rationale: The sentiment in this review is negative because the guest had a very unpleasant experience at the Marriott hotel. They expressed disappointment in the quality of the hotel, mentioning issues such as overcrowding due to a children's contest, long wait times for the elevator, poor service at the restaurant, and unprofessional staff. The guest also indicated a strong aversion to staying at this Marriott again in the future. Overall, the review conveys dissatisfaction and frustration with their stay, leading to a negative sentiment.

question:
My boyfriend and I Pricelined a room for our anniversary trip this weekend. We were super excited to get a "3.5star plus" hotel for a really good deal. It's too bad there were so many things that worked against making this a truly awesome hotel: 

- The fact that there is no carpet between the pool and the elevators, so the floor is often dangerously wet. 
- The fact that the bathroom door opened onto the toilet - you had to sidestep it in order to close the door. 
- The fact that the night desk clerk, when counting the register, set the cash tray on the counter nearest the customers. It would have been an easy, quick jaunt out the front door with it.
- The 20min it took to get extra towels
- The empty ice bin in the vending area
- The desk clerk who came out to talk to customers while still chewing food

By far the worst offense was the fact that check-out time was noon, yet housekeeping tried to enter our room at EIGHT IN THE MORNING. I can't imagine it's that hard to find out which rooms are ready for cleaning, and which are not. 

The only real pro was the bedding, which was luxe and fluffy. Not even close to being worth the $2800 they sell it for, but fun for a night. 

The room ended up being cheap for the name-brand, but more satisfaction could have been found from a lesser-name place. Lesson learned for next time.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer experienced multiple disappointments and inconveniences during their stay at the hotel. The issues mentioned, such as wet floors, awkward room layout, security concerns, slow service, cleanliness issues, and early housekeeping intrusion, greatly impacted their overall experience. The positives mentioned, like the bedding, were not enough to offset the various negative aspects of their stay. The reviewer also expressed that they felt the hotel was not worth the high price they paid.

question: Although most of the workers were very pleasant, the customer service by one female during check-in as well as another at the breakfast buffet was so unprofessional that I will not be a patron at this location again. After complaining of the rude service, for which we were given the excuse of a busy weekend, we asked to be connected with management, who never followed up. Unacceptable!
rationale: The sentiment in the review is negative because the customer had a poor experience with the customer service at the establishment. The reviewer encountered unprofessional behavior from staff members during check-in and at the breakfast buffet, and despite expressing their dissatisfaction and requesting to speak with management, they were not provided with a resolution. The lack of follow-up and the excuse of a busy weekend further contributed to the negative sentiment expressed in the review.

question:
I can't stand to sit here and read these horrible reviews. 
When my son was receiving treatments for spine/ brain cancer, at UW Hospital, we did not  have many choices at that time of where to stay during and between treatments. My son would become so ill from all the radiation plus chemo, and the radiation treatments were at two 6 hour intervals every day, So we couldn't venture far most days.
Altho we had spent time at the Ronald McDoanld house, after a time I needed to make my son feel less a patient and more like a celebrity for a day. So I decided to take a paycheck, and chose a day between visits to get a suite at the Marriott West. 
Altho my son had to use a mobile IV unit, and was scarred on his  head from radiation burns, this Marriott was most accomodating and incredible.
We had a gorgeous suite, exquistie room service and gracious attentions.
These attentions were NOT triggered by my sons illness, but sincerely born from true proffesionalism and great training. 
This is a beautiful establishment, and I personally cannot stand the voices of spoiled whiners on these previous reviews. 
This Marriott will hold dear to me always and is worthy of your travel time relaxing time, and most of all your needs no matter to what extent.
Stop being so ridiculously spoiled and realize. 
This Marriott is above average.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer had a very positive experience at the Marriott West during a difficult time when their son was receiving treatments for spine/brain cancer. The staff at the hotel were accommodating, attentive, and made the reviewer and their son feel special. The reviewer emphasizes the professionalism and great training of the staff, highlighting the exceptional service they received. The positive experience at the Marriott West helped alleviate some of the challenges faced during the medical treatments, making it a source of comfort and support for the reviewer and their son.

question:
Was here for a gala at the adjoining conference center.  Service was terrible. The waitress kept slamming food and drinks on the  table. She only brought dinner for half the table and the rest had to wait for 15 minutes. One of the guests had to wait about 20 minutes for the meal. Horrible!
I've been to many Marriotts before and hold a frequent visitor card, but this one has been the worst experience so far.

I know this isn't a review that completely reflects the hotel or any restaurants inside it, but the fact that this service was under the Marriott name prompted this review and rating
rationale: The sentiment in this review is negative because the customer had a poor experience with the service at the Marriott during a gala event. They specifically mentioned problems with the waitress being rude and slow, as well as issues with food delivery. These factors likely left a bad impression on the customer and led to their overall negative rating and review of the establishment.

question: It's hard to believe this is a Marriott property.  I've logged over 50 nights at this hotel so I think I'm decently qualified to offer a balanced review.  This last stay will be my last overall.  Although the staff is generally friendly & professional, their competence is questionable.  I could offer a list of offenses but it would take too long & most aren't major, just a little annoying. Concierge lounge is fine, no complaints.  Overall, the hotel gives the impression that it is too large for its operating budget and the competence of the staff.  It greatly lacks attention to detail.  I frequently have to call for things that have been left out of the room (missing hairdryer, washcloths, double body wash but no shampoo...and so on).   The linens are old and tired (holes in the sheets & duvet covers, limp towels, some with stains).  I am a platinum member of Marriott and am always booked into a King room.  This time, they put me in a room with 2 doubles for no reason.  I immediately changed rooms and the TV did not work.  I then plugged my laptop into the lamp and it made a loud \"pop\" and blue sparks came out.  All of the power in the room was then knocked out.  This is unacceptable, as the wiring in that lamp was obviously faulty & dangerous.  I was lucky my computer was not fried.  The last straw came when I killed a large fly in the room with the first thing I could grab, which was the paper breakfast menu.  I then crumpled the menu and threw it away.  The next day, the housekeeper had removed the menu from the garbage can and placed it on my pillow.  I know it was the same menu b/c it was creased exactly where I crumpled it up.  Outrageous.  Anyone who would think this is acceptable service is out of their mind.  I will not stay here again and do not recommend it for business travelers.  During a single stay, I have never heard so many staff say, \"I apologize for that\".  Sorry isn't enough, I'll be trying the Hilton Garden Inn next time.  Good service speaks for itself and does not require apologies.
rationale: The sentiment of this review is negative because the reviewer highlights a number of significant issues with their experience at the Marriott property. They mention shortcomings in staff competence, lack of attention to detail, unsatisfactory room conditions such as old linens and faulty wiring, incorrect room assignment, and poor response to a safety hazard. Additionally, the incident with the reused breakfast menu demonstrates a lack of respect for the guest and falls well below expected standards of service. The reviewer ultimately states they will not return to the hotel and do not recommend it for business travelers, emphasizing their dissatisfaction with the overall experience.

question:
If you've ever wondered what it would be like to attempt to sleep on the infield of the Indy 500, while the race is in progress, and you don't care to spend the money on race tickets, just book a room at this hotel.
The property is immediately, I mean immediately adjacent to the infamous "Beltline" highway, and the sound attenuating properties of the windows are non-existent. 
I thought the heavy curtains that frame the sheer might help to reduce the mind numbing highway noise.  But guess what, they're decorative only and can't be closed.
I spent $65/night through Price Line, and that was about $50 too much.
A few annoyances, in addition to the brain gelatinizing cacophony:

1) What the hell is with the 30 lbs. down duvets that these hotels seem to think add a half star to their rating?  They're excessively hot on all but the coldest nights, they weigh a freaking ton, and when they end up on the floor (as is always my deal) you have nothing left but the thread bare, pallid, dirty sheet. Which isn't enough.

2) Setting the alarm clock requires an advanced degree in electrical engineering.  Seriously, you really expect people to use these pieces of junk? Which leads me to annoyance number 3:

3) When I tried to use the dirty, circa 1981 phone to set my wake up call, and I successively pressed all four of the "At your service" buttons I got nothing.  I messed around with the phone for 15 minutes before I finally reached a guy working in the bar (I could never hope to duplicate this feat).  He was kind enough to transfer me to the front desk.

4) I was going to use the in-room coffee maker but it had been filled, at some point, with sour smelling water.  On my worst day of caffiene deprivation, I wouldn't have used that disgusting and antiquated little machine.

A flat screen TV and a weighty down (or down substitute, as it where) duvet do not make a 3.5 star hotel! This place needs a major capital infusion.  Thank you for your time.
rationale: The sentiment is Negative because the reviewer had a number of complaints and expressed frustration with various aspects of their stay at the hotel. They mentioned issues with noise from the nearby highway, discomfort with the bedding, difficulty with the alarm clock and phone in the room, and a problem with the coffee maker. Overall, the reviewer was not satisfied with their experience and felt that the hotel did not meet their expectations.

question: I don't think I've been to a dirtier Marriott. I've been here for three days so far, and i don't think the cafe in the lobby has been vacuumed once, as I've monitored the pile of crumbs underneath the tables and am finding more crumbs (and wrappers and chicken wing bones) each night. My room was dirty (including large stains on the bedskirt and chair) upon arrival, and since I was here for a week for business, I decided not to look around my room too much to save myself from being completely grossed out. Some of the shuttle drivers think they're Indy 500 drivers, swerving around corners so fast that everyone grips the sides of the vehicle. Our driver also asked two people to share one seat in the van, never mind the rules about seatbelts.  Also, if you come in the evening hours and want to eat at the bar, expect to wait no less than 1 hour for your food.
rationale: The sentiment of this review is negative because the guest experienced multiple issues during their stay at the Marriott. They mentioned the overall cleanliness of the hotel, specifically the lobby cafe and their room being dirty upon arrival with stains on the bedskirt and chair. Additionally, the behavior of the shuttle drivers raised concerns about safety and comfort, as well as the long wait times for food at the bar in the evenings. These factors combined create a negative impression of the guest's experience at the Marriott.

question: Stained sheets, hair and food byproduct on nightstand When we got our replacement sheets there was no offer to change them as they were thrust into our hands. Burned out lightbulbs and towels that look like what I use to dry off the dog.
rationale: The sentiment is Negative because the review highlights multiple issues with the cleanliness and maintenance of the accommodation. Stained sheets, hair and food residue suggest poor housekeeping standards, while burned out lightbulbs and low-quality towels contribute to an overall negative experience for the guest. The lack of proactive resolution by the staff also adds to the negative sentiment expressed in the review.

question: Great rooms, great rates. I've stayed in Middleton before but this location can't be beat. They have a shuttle that will even take u to the convenience store. Spacious, clean, an very friendly staff.
rationale: The review mentions positive aspects such as great rooms at great rates, a convenient location, a shuttle service to a convenience store, spaciousness, cleanliness, and friendly staff. These points collectively highlight a satisfactory and enjoyable experience for the reviewer, leading to a positive sentiment in the review.

question: Service was great, including providing a local 3-mile and 5-mile running maps  Breakfast was excellent. We will be back.
rationale: The review highlights positive aspects such as the great service provided, the availability of running maps for guests, and excellent breakfast. Additionally, the statement "We will be back" signifies the customer's intention to return, indicating a high level of satisfaction with their experience. Overall, these positive elements contribute to the sentiment being described as Positive.

question: Bedding was stained on pillow and comforter.  Asked front desk to have this changed upon leaving for dinner.  After arriving back at the hotel, bedding had not been changed.  Called front desk and was told that housekeeping was gone for the night.  At check-out I mentioned the issue and was simply verbally told \"Sorry.\"\n\nNot acceptable.  My 2nd Mariott stay this year, and I am not giving up my Priority Club Platinum membership to ever try Mariotts again.
rationale: The sentiment in the review is negative because the guest experienced cleanliness issues with the bedding, despite requesting a change. The lack of follow-up and resolution from the hotel staff, as well as the dismissive response at check-out, left the guest feeling unsatisfied with their experience. Additionally, the guest's disappointment is amplified by their loyalty to the Marriott brand and the unfulfilled expectations associated with their Platinum membership.

question: Would recommend this hotel. Beds are comfy, rooms are nice and clean, staff is very accommodating and goes above & beyond what's expected. We loved Tomeka at the front desk :)
rationale: The review expresses positive feedback about the hotel, highlighting key aspects such as comfortable beds, clean rooms, and exceptional customer service from the staff, particularly Tomeka at the front desk. The reviewer specifically mentions that the staff goes above and beyond, indicating a high level of customer satisfaction. Overall, the positive comments showcase a pleasant and enjoyable experience, leading to a positive sentiment.

question: The room was fine, obviously outdated but it looks as though they are upgrading currently. The food on the other hand was overpriced and gross. Do yourself a favor and do not order room service. It looked as though it was prepared at a truck stop, nuked and then brought up to my room. I complained, they said sorry and that was it. No new food, no help from the front desk and still charged me for it. Platinum member service my butt.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the user had a disappointing experience with the room service at the hotel. The food was described as overpriced and gross, akin to being prepared at a truck stop and reheated. Despite complaining, the user did not receive appropriate assistance or resolution, and was still charged for the subpar meal. Additionally, the user mentioned feeling let down as a Platinum member based on the lack of satisfactory service received.

question: Stayed here  on 4/7 prior to a business meeting.  It had many of the usual Marriott niceties but no Starbucks or availability of coffee that was any better than Folgers or Yuban.  Maybe it's a Wisconsin thing but I thought that nearly every Marriott had reliable, dark roasted coffee.  The room was OK except that they put me in a second floor room that had windows which started at about 5 feet above the floor and the only view was of air conditioning/heating units and I am a lifetime Platinum.  I am not sure if the desk clerk felt it made little difference or what but this is not a crown jewel by any means.  I understand that this place was a Holiday Inn previously but usually hotels converted to the Marriott brand are better than this one was.
rationale: The sentiment is Negative because the guest expressed disappointment with multiple aspects of their stay. They were dissatisfied with the quality of coffee offered, the room assigned to them on the second floor with a poor view, and felt that the hotel did not live up to the standards typically associated with the Marriott brand. Their expectations as a lifetime Platinum member were not met, leading to an overall negative impression of the hotel.

question:
I would imagine things would be different if I stayed here when they did not have a convention in town but I did!

Checked in to a room on the 6th floor (out of 10).  I had pounding and banging all round me due to remodeling.  They did finish by late afternoon but the hallways were full of beds and other room furniture.  Besides being unsightly, that wasn't a big deal.  My problems started at night  and the next morning.   

When the meeting in one of the ballrooms ended apparently most of the people didn't have enough!  Because of the set up of he hotel every room in the hotel faces the bar.  Even though the bar is on the ground floor the noise funnels up and it becomes a big echo chamber!  Noise continued until about 1am.  I'm not sure if I was pissed because I couldn't sleep or if I was just jealous that I sounded like they were having a lot of fun!

The next morning was a JOKE!  Trying to leave wad impossible.  Why they would build a hotel with 10 floors and only 2 elevators is beyond me!  With people checking out, going to breakfast or just moving around it was Impossible to get on an elevator unless you were on the top 2 floors.  People were lined up on every floor trying to get somewhere.  The smart people started getting on using the "up" button and just going for a ride.  I finally have up and lugged my bags down six floors of stairs. What I found has a huge line of others doing the same.  I felt like a refugee!!!  Some women a head of me were having troubles because they had multiple bags.  Eventually one of them fell.... I wasn't pretty.  

I found that this hotel looked nice, had a nice pool.  But I would never stay here on a weekend or when it was busy ever again!  They need to find a away to build another elevator and bite the bullet and shut the bar down much earlier or move it into one of the ballrooms.
rationale: The review expresses negative sentiment due to several issues the guest encountered during their stay. The noise from the remodeling, the loud bar noise that continued late into the night, and the difficulty in accessing the elevators all contributed to the guest's dissatisfaction. The overcrowding in the hotel and the challenge of leaving due to the lack of elevators also added to the negative experience. The guest's frustration with the hotel's layout and lack of efficient services led to their conclusion that they would not stay there again, especially during busy times.

question:
***This Marriott definitely feels dated and it is not in Downtown Madison; it is a comfortable enough hotel, service is good and room rates are reasonable; however, the hotel has kind of a depressing look and feel to it; it needs an update***

This Marriott kind of feels like an airport hotel.  Airport hotels tend to be very outdated and there is typically little incentive to do a renovation because the hotel has a steady stream of customers due to its proximity to the airport and convenience of airport shuttle transportation.  This Marriott has a similar look as the Philadelphia Airport Renaissance.  Both hotels feature an open atrium that goes up 9 to 12 levels high.  You do get a nice look onto the open atrium as you ascend on the quick glass elevators at this property.

Unfortunately, this hotel is very out-of-date.  The lobby and cafe looks like something from the early to mid-80s.  The rooms are a little more contemporary though parts very dated; at the kitchenette sink, there was a bottom cabinet that may have been a dishwasher at one time; instead, it was empty with lots of dust and exposed piping (not nice to find at any hotel).

The breakfast buffet did not inspire freshness either.  The food quality was not horrible, but a lot of the food was quite salty.  Food options included bacon, sausage, breakfast potatoes, scrambled eggs, smoked salmon, continental breakfast options, and an omelet bar.  In addition, the poor lighting in the lobby and throughout the hotel made the food and other stuff maybe feel worse than they actually were.

This Marriott is still a comfortable place to stay and has good customer service.  The rooms are comfortable with good beds and linen.  The room temperature was fine though the unit did not seem to consistently keep the room cool.  The shower was fine.

This Marriott has many suites so you have a good shot of getting upgraded if you are a Marriott Rewards Gold or Platinum member.  The suites are spacious and the bedroom is separated from the living room area with a door.  Their suites are outfitted with a mini fridge, kitchen sink (as mentioned) and a microwave.

On weekends, Marriott Rewards Gold and Platinum members get an offer of full breakfast buffet for two per Saturday and Sunday or 750 Marriott Rewards points per Saturday and Sunday.  This is a new nationwide Marriott benefit for Marriott Rewards Gold and Platinum members and the hotel is only obligated to offer a continental breakfast.  I have been to a few properties (Santa Clara Marriott, Minneapolis Marriott City Center) that are only doing the bare minimum--continental breakfast--so this Marriott is definitely going above and beyond in this area (though the quality of the full breakfast buffet, as already mentioned, was not that great).

The front desk was nice and helpful.

Room rates are good, but this hotel is not in Downtown Madison.  It is only a 7 to 10 minute drive to Madison though.  However, I am not sure if getting to Downtown Madison on a Wisconsin football game day is challenging.

This Marriott would not be a good property for a long stay.  This hotel just does not feel fresh enough.  It is a comfortable enough spot for a short stay though due to their comfortable rooms and good service.  If you are a Marriott Rewards Gold or Platinum member, they do treat you well here and maybe even better than some Marriott properties.

This Marriott has its own free parking lot.  It is easy finding an open space.
rationale: The sentiment of this review is negative because the reviewer highlights multiple aspects of the Marriott hotel that they found to be outdated and unappealing. They mention the hotel's overall depressing look and feel, outdated lobby and rooms, poor food quality, lack of maintenance in certain areas, and subpar lighting. While the reviewer acknowledges some positive aspects such as good customer service and comfortable rooms, they ultimately express disappointment with the overall condition and atmosphere of the hotel, resulting in a negative sentiment overall.

question: It's loud, the employees are not friendly, and you simply can't trust them for a wake up call... I didn't even get an \"I'm Sorry\" when they entered a 6am wake up call for 7am!\n\nAnd I've been Marriott Platinum for 10 years! If they can't be courteous to their elite guests, how are they to everyone else? Skip this hotel...
rationale: The sentiment is Negative because the guest experienced multiple issues during their stay at the hotel, including loud noise, unfriendly employees, and a lack of trustworthiness regarding wake-up call requests. Additionally, the guest, who is a long-time loyal customer with elite status, felt that their loyalty was not respected based on the poor treatment they received.

question: Worst marriott experience in twenty years of traveling. The hotel manager is a joke and very rude. I complained about the service at the hotel and asked for the phone number to complain. He responded by threatening to call the police. Just crazy to think this hotel would rather call the police on a Gold member than give the number to customer service.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the review describes a highly unpleasant experience with the hotel manager, who is portrayed as rude and unhelpful. The manager's threat to involve the police in response to a simple request for customer service contact information is extreme and inappropriate, leaving the guest feeling unvalued and disrespected. Overall, the reviewer's dissatisfaction with the manager's behavior and the hotel's apparent lack of customer service resolution contribute to the negative sentiment expressed in the review.

question: Terrible value. This place should be like $70 a night. \nNo free breakfast, expensive wireless, pillows were either laughably huge or flat as a pancake, bad smells, no ventilation in bathroom, filthy carpet, cuddled creamer for the coffee. These are just some of the complaints that our entire group had, across over a dozen rooms.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer lists numerous complaints about their experience, including the lack of value for the price, poor amenities such as no free breakfast and expensive wireless, uncomfortable pillows, bad smells, lack of bathroom ventilation, filthy carpet, and subpar coffee creamer. These issues highlight a dissatisfaction with various aspects of the accommodation, leading to an overall negative impression.

question:
This is in regards to their Events Department - 

I had my wedding reception here last year. I complained about the management and received little compensation for all that had gone wrong. 

In the 6 months it took to begin planning my wedding reception to briefly following the reception I had 3 different events coordinators. The first two were amazing, but they left for good reason, the hotel events department was barely a-float. 

There's literally a list of things that went wrong, but the two most concerning: 
1) The hired serving staff (many from temp agencies) didn't do their jobs! 
2) One of the hired staff were high/drunk, and when he and others were asked for help by my family were giving them sass and they still didn't help. 

During the wedding, all I saw was how things were going wrong. So unfortunately, I didn't enjoy majority of my reception. When you spend all that time planning and spending $$$ and things are being executed half ass or not at all.. it's pretty distressful for an already stressed bride. I complained about this, but it wasn't until I got in touch with Marriott International that anyone called me back. They admitted they were going through many staff changes and apologized for the various incidents. 

When you spend about $14,000 for SOLELY service and drinks (we catered food). I expect top notch service. My overall bill still had the 22% service gratuity (which they deserved NONE of - which I argued). In the end they reimbursed me $990 which was half the service gratuity. I hate to be ungrateful but that's ridiculous. 


My only reason to write this review is because I wish I had known that their events services had gone downhill in past few years. I held an event there in 2010 and the events coordinator at the time, Diana??, and the service were great. People plannng events here should ask the following questions: 
1) Are they still using temps and what experience/requirements do they have?
2) If things don't go right (which they have someone from the staff on floor during your events - so they can see it themselves), how can they offer compensation or fix the situation??

At the end - the temps were what were blamed for all the awful service (not clearing plates - my family cleared plates, serving drinks in CANS - when i made it a point everything should be served in glassware, etc...) So that's who I would ask the most questions about. 

I hope that things change for the Marriott in the future. They used to be one of the best places to hold large scale events in Madison. In the end, I do wish them the best in getting back to where they once used to be.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is negative because the customer experienced multiple issues during their wedding reception organized by the Events Department at the Marriott. The customer faced challenges due to frequent changes in events coordinators, poor service from hired staff (including one being high/drunk), lack of proper execution of services despite significant spending, and overall distress during the event. The customer also mentioned dissatisfaction with the compensation received from the hotel and highlighted that the service gratuity was not deserved. These negative experiences led the customer to express disappointment and a wish for improvements in the Marriott's events services.

question:
First night not so great. Immediately apparently means 30 minutes later AFTER you call again to the front desk. No one in the room next to me, alarm clock goes off. After waiting 10 minutes, and then knocking on door with no response, call front desk and am told it will be taken care of immediately. Waited 30 minutes, and called back. Then someone came up to take of it.
It been a bad day, and this is an excellent end to it.
3 more nights to go, woo hop!
Ambiance C
Cleanliness C (generally grungy everywhere)
Customer Service D
(Only selected 1 star because I couldn't post with none)
rationale: The sentiment in this review is negative because the guest had a frustrating experience with delayed responses to their issues, particularly with the alarm clock disturbance. The lack of prompt and efficient customer service, along with the overall feeling of dissatisfaction, is reflected in the low ratings given for ambiance, cleanliness, and customer service. This review conveys disappointment and sets a negative tone for the remaining stay at the hotel.

question:
After spending a month in Europe, I was very excited to come back to Madison and rediscover Clasen's European Bakery. Though the shop is about ten times bigger than any bakery in Europe, you can find some pretty authenic goods, and the kitchen is said to be staffed by German master bakers. Of course, nothing tasted quite the same as the real European thing, and you are sure to find some pretty standard American bakery there as well.

Clasen's doesn't look like too much when you first walk in, but who cares when you have a warehouse of good to gawk at? There are shelves and shelves full of cookies, desserts, breads, sweetbreads, etc! Everything I've tried is quality and very fresh. Be sure to come early for the best selection.

Prices are decent, but the staff can be grumpy. There is ususally a sale or special deal to look for on one of the store's front tables, and a wide selection of holiday items. Also don't miss the sampling area near the back.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is positive because the reviewer expresses excitement about rediscovering Clasen's European Bakery after returning from Europe. The review highlights the bakery's extensive selection of authentic European goods, mentioning that the kitchen is staffed by German master bakers and that everything tasted fresh and of high quality. The reviewer also appreciates the variety of items available and recommends coming early for the best selection. Despite mentioning that the staff can be grumpy, the overall tone of the review is positive, praising the bakery for its offerings and suggesting visitors not to miss the sampling area near the back.

question: This one is a big fail. After having been told numerous times that I had to go to Clasen's Bakery, I finally went. What I found was a large room filled with unappetizing, boring baked goods. Nothing in here did I want, or have any desire to try. There were loaves of bread, but the selection is better at Whole Foods or Willy Street Co-op. The cookies had the panache and flair of the garbage that is sold in Starbucks. Chocolate chip, peanut butter, sugar? What is so European about any of this? Greenjim H said about high prices? I am not sure what he bought, I saw nothing that would be classified as high priced. The pastries were as boring as the cookies, danish, morning bun?\n\nI don't know how this classifies as a European bakery. This is an average bakery, in a very far out of the way place. I am sure there are better places to go to grab a loaf of bread and a cookie.
rationale: The sentiment of this review is negative because the reviewer expresses disappointment with the selection and quality of baked goods at Clasen's Bakery. They describe the products as unappetizing, boring, and lacking flair, comparing them unfavorably to other stores like Whole Foods and Willy Street Co-op. The reviewer also questions the bakery's classification as European, suggesting that it falls short of meeting their expectations for a European bakery experience. Overall, the review conveys a sense of dissatisfaction with the offerings and atmosphere at Clasen's Bakery.

question: I ordered a birthday cake for the first time through Clasen's. Due to the flu going through our house, I had to reschedule the party and the cake for the following week. the Baker did not get my cancellation and baked the cake. Clasen's said they were sorry and not to worry about it. When I picked up the cake the following week it was stale. my guess is they just kept the cake in the fridge until I picked it up the following Friday. I called to let them know they apologized and said they would call me back. I never heard from them. :( Disappointing.
rationale: The review is negative because the customer experienced multiple issues with Clasen's bakery. The original party had to be rescheduled due to illness, but the bakery baked the cake anyway without the customer's consent. Moreover, the cake ended up being stale, suggesting poor storage or handling practices. The lack of effective communication and follow-up from Clasen's when the customer raised these issues further contributed to the negative experience. Overall, the customer's expectations were not met, leading to disappointment and a negative sentiment towards the bakery.

question:
It was near my birthday, I was in the area, and I wanted a croissant.

It wasn't as good as I had hoped. I like my croissants light, buttery, and flakey. A nice exterior with a good "bite" to it is a must. Sadly, my croissant was none of these things. It was doughy and heavy. I wasn't pleased with it.

Before the disappointment of the croissant, I managed to get a simple of a brownie they had on special. The brownie was good. Not life changing, not memorable, jut good. Unfortunately, "Good" does not bring me back into places too often, and especially when things are overpriced.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the customer expressed dissatisfaction with the quality of the croissant they purchased. They had specific preferences for a croissant that is light, buttery, and flakey with a good exterior, but found the one they received to be doughy and heavy, falling short of their expectations. Additionally, although they found the brownie to be good, it was not enough to overcome the disappointment of the croissant, leading them to feel that the items were overpriced and not worth revisiting the establishment.

question: After walking around & viewing their huge selection of goodies, I had to look  up to avoid temptations hahaha.... they offer free samples of current goodies & coffee... had every flavor you could think of for cookies, cupcakes, muffins, breads, some candies..... I WILL RETURN....
rationale: The review highlights the positive experience the reviewer had at the store, emphasizing the large selection of tempting treats, free samples, and the promise to return in the future. The use of capital letters and multiple exclamation points in expressing excitement about the variety and quality of goods indicated overall satisfaction and a likelihood of recommending the establishment to others.

question: I usually pick up their buns at outpost in Milwaukee and I've been a fan.  We stopped at the bakery in Madison and was impressed at their selection.  For natural ingredients and consistent quality baked goods this place is it.
rationale: The sentiment in the review is positive because the reviewer mentioned being a fan of the bakery's buns from their outpost in Milwaukee, and expressed being impressed with the selection and quality of baked goods at the bakery in Madison. The reviewer highlighted the use of natural ingredients and consistent quality as factors that they appreciate about the bakery, indicating an overall positive experience.

question: Stayed here with a friend while she was in the Madison area for Epic training. I was seriously impressed with this HGI. I had previously stayed in one in Chicago that was pretty ghetto. Bed was comfy, and the pool area was very family friendly. I have never seen a hotel pool with that kind of stuff for kids. They also have a hottub, and the gym/workout area is very nice. Desk staff were super nice(I left my key in the room once). We had drinks at the bar, and I will say that my wine was a bit pricey. I did not have the breakfast, so I can't speak to that.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is positive because the user highlights several aspects of their stay at the HGI in Madison that they were impressed with, such as the comfortable bed, family-friendly pool area with amenities for kids, nice gym/workout area, and friendly desk staff. They had a good experience at the hotel bar, even though they found the wine to be a bit pricey. Overall, the user's review focuses on the positive aspects of their stay at the hotel, reflecting an overall good impression and satisfaction with their experience.

question: Ace's employees have been incredibly helpful and nice every time I've gone to the store. The store itself is chock-full of great home- and yard-improvement stuff (tools, accessories, gadgets, etc), and the prices are very fair (especially when one considers the convenience of Ace's location and the idea of supporting a local business). For most of my small-to-medium-size home and yard needs, I'll skip the trip to Home Depot or Menards and stick to my neighborhood Ace Hardware.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer highlights the exceptional customer service received from Ace's employees, praises the store's wide selection of useful products for home and yard improvement, emphasizes fair pricing, convenience of the location, and supporting a local business. These positive aspects contribute to the reviewer's overall satisfaction with Ace Hardware, making it their preferred choice over bigger competitors like Home Depot or Menards.

question:
I'm having a rough go learning how to use power tools and drill ish into drywall, but a great time going to ACE and learning what I did wrong and buying the appropriate things to remedy the problem and try again. 

Some might say, "measure twice, drill once" or even, "if you don't know what you're doing... ask first!" But I was talking to my bud Annette J in Detroit and realized that part of owning a home is making improvements/adjustments, doing it completely wrong, then learning a ton from your mistakes. (Thanks Annette!) 

This week I learned that joint compound comes in an easy squirt tube and corner bead makes that nice 90 degree angle where pieces of drywall meet. I also learned that you can't secure anything into corner bead, which is why having a stud finder helps if you're looking to hang a 72" long roman shade. I also learned that I can easily patch my mistakes with some handy dandy supplies from ACE and although it took a few employees to find "the patch guy" he was super informative about exactly what I would need to fix some holes and a chunk of dry wall where my poor shade decided it would rather hang than be secured to my window frame. 

Oh gravity. 

Jason H is right, these are some of the nicest people you'll meet with loads of info to help you do it right the second time. 

I wouldn't have it any other way.
rationale: The sentiment in the review is positive because the individual acknowledges their initial challenges with learning how to use power tools and work with drywall, but they express a great sense of determination and willingness to learn from their mistakes. They highlight the positive experience of getting help and guidance from the employees at ACE Hardware, specifically mentioning the helpfulness of Annette and Jason. Despite encountering difficulties, the reviewer appreciates the learning process and the support they received, ultimately concluding that they wouldn't have it any other way. This overall tone of resilience, gratitude, and optimism contributes to the review being categorized as positive.

question: The staff is very rude. As soon as I find another place to fix my watches, I will go there. VERY disappointed.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer described the staff as "very rude" and expressed disappointment, indicating a poor experience. The intention to find another place to fix the watches further supports the negative sentiment.

question: I order it for my employees occasionally.  The pizza is what you expect, nothing better than OK.  They throw on an extra $1.50 for delivery charge and the drivers tell us that most goes directly to the managers pockets.  That Sucks.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the customer expresses dissatisfaction with the quality of the pizza, describing it as only "OK." Additionally, the complaint about the extra delivery charge implying that most of it goes to the managers' pockets suggests a lack of transparency or unfair business practices, which contributes to the negative sentiment.

question: Gross! I generally love Papa Johns, but this one is lacking in all areas. I ordered PJs for lunch and once it finally arrived (1 hour later), it was luke warm and soggy. Apart from that, the staff lacks any work ethic or customer service. The three people I dealt with were all rude and careless. Initially, they ended up giving me a $5 credit. Ha! As if I would order again anyway.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the user had a disappointing experience with Papa John's. The food arrived late, was not fresh, and the customer service was described as rude and careless. The user was not satisfied with the quality of the food or the level of service provided, leading to an overall negative impression of their experience.

question:
A 5 star gem!

I echo Jenny D's comment on the hash brown. Super crispy exterior and moist fluffy inside - it's a piece of art.  My friend and I enjoyed the generous portion of scramble egg ($7.50), and 2 layers blueberry pancake ($5.00). Everything tasted like "mom's food." Made fresh to order, and very satisfying. 

No frou-frou typical Middleton gimmick. The basic decore, and the down to earth service - the perfect spot to watch regulars enjoy the hearty breakfast.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the review praises the quality and taste of the food, particularly highlighting the crispy hash browns, fluffy scrambles eggs, and blueberry pancakes. The reviewer also appreciates the home-cooked feel of the food, describing it as reminiscent of "mom's food." Additionally, the review emphasizes the lack of gimmicks in the restaurant, focusing on the simple decor and friendly service, which contributes to a positive dining experience. Overall, the reviewer's comments reflect satisfaction with the food, service, and atmosphere, making it a positive review.

question: I had one of the best breakfasts I have ever had here! This must be a Wisconsin thing, but their scramble (eggs with various other ingredients-like an omelet by scrambled eggs) was delish. I noticed the scramble at other places too. I had the Denver scramble, which had the perfect amount of cheese on top. The hashbrowns were pretty good too. I also had one pancake. Very good. The staff were all very chatty and engaging everyone in conversation. Service was fast. After reading a few reviews on Yelp, I guess I was expecting a little larger restaurant, but this is in a small place, basically a diner. \nFYI, they are closed on Monday, I heard them tell someone.
rationale: The sentiment in the review is positive because the person had one of the best breakfasts they've ever had at the restaurant. They specifically mentioned enjoying the scramble dish and the pancake, as well as complimenting the staff for being chatty and engaging. The reviewer also remarked on the fast service despite the restaurant being small. Overall, the review highlights a satisfying dining experience with delicious food and friendly service, resulting in a positive sentiment.

question:
I was so disappointed after reading all of the reviews.  Firstly, breakfast stops at 11:00 on weekdays and noon on the weekends, NOTE THAT because when we showed up today after my husbands late night shift the night before they would not serve us breakfast.

CASH OR CHECK ONLY

Worth noting, both menus are pretty slim, but breakfast is larger than lunch.  

They were out of the fried chicken "dinner" (you mean lunch, since they were only open till 2, right?). We ended up ordering the patty melt, ok, fish sandwich, subpar, and onion rings, good but not $3 good. Sandwiches come with chips, not fries.  But was definitely not the pancakes that everyone else was raving about that I was craving.  The coffee was sting but a bit bitter. The total was just under $20 without tip. 

The decor is old, doesn't bother me too much, but looking at the filthy carpets, it was disgusting and I was a bit afraid since I was wearing flat sandals.  Before I forget to mention it, the place smells like smoke when you first walk in, I was completely expecting to see ashtrays at the booths.

The service was excellent... If you are a regular. If not, plan on spending about three times too much there. We waited for about 5 minutes for our waitress ( one of the owners) to shout sit where you want.  We grabbed a table. My husband had to take a work call, but had given me his order. After waiting 10 minutes, I had to flag our waitress down to place our orders, and she looked at me shocked that I would want something to eat. Trying to get the check out of her was terrible. By 12:15 the lunch regulars had started coming in, so she was chatting about a recent wedding, showings hem the wedding pictures, talking about what the place looked like, etc. by 12:30 I had out cash on the end of the table hoping to move things along.  She walked past us three times without making eye contact, finally, I put my arm out and asked for the check, which had not been prepared, wait for another 5 minutes while she served more regulars and FINALLY she got back to using we were out of there by 12:50. 

In short, we will never return.  It is expensive for what you get, food is unremarkable, serve is terrible, and it seemed like it could use a food service inspection because it was pretty dirty.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is negative because the customer had several complaints about their experience at the restaurant. They were disappointed by the limited breakfast hours, the payment options being cash or check only, the slim menu choices, the quality of the food, the cleanliness of the establishment, and the overall service. The customer felt that the food was unremarkable, the service was poor, and the restaurant was overpriced for what was offered. Additionally, the customer mentioned concerns about the cleanliness of the restaurant and felt that it may need a food service inspection. These factors contribute to an overall negative sentiment in the review.

question: The scene reminds me of...a garage.  A garage with fairly rude servers and overstuffed patrons with nothing to say.  We waited ... And waited.  The menu had the basics- no problem there.  We waited. Oh, everything is made to order that is why it takes so long... Seriously that is what we were told.  Other reviewers say \"it is like their mothers used to make\".  Sorry to hear your mom was a lousy cook.  And she must've been a grouch.  Yes the food is pretty bad.  Why people go here I can't understand.  I gave it three visits before passing judgement.  The verdict - AVOID.
rationale: The sentiment in this review is negative because the author describes their experience at the restaurant as unpleasant and disappointing. The servers are characterized as rude, the wait time is excessive, the food is described as bad, and the overall atmosphere is compared to a garage with overstuffed patrons. The author also expresses confusion as to why people would choose to dine at this establishment and ultimately advises others to avoid it. These critical observations and negative impressions contribute to the overall negative sentiment of the review.

question: First we waited 20 minutes which was ok with us but then we waited 45 minutes for our two items to show up that too incomplete. As one of the reviewers mentioned the breakfast was very oily. Taste was just ok. Won't be going back.
rationale: The sentiment is Negative because the reviewer experienced a long wait time for their order, received incomplete items, found the breakfast to be very oily, and rated the taste as just okay. Additionally, they expressed that they do not plan on returning to the restaurant in the future. These factors collectively contribute to an overall negative experience for the reviewer.

question:
How this place has 4 stars I do not understand. I can totally get into a "mom and pop" style breakfast place, but Three Sisters is just plain dirty. The carpet is filthy, booths are tearing, and the place is just lacking in basic upkeep. 

Now to the food: it's not the worst I've ever had, but a far cry from the best. I had the 2, 2, 2, 2 (eggs with 2 slices of bacon, 2 sausage links and 2 pancakes). The eggs were cooked well and the sausage links were actually very good. But the bacon was under cooked and pretty soggy. The pancakes were pretty tasty, though. My boyfriend ordered eggs with bacon and toast and complained about the same things. His eggs were under cooked and the bacon was again, soggy. The toast was fine but how can you really mess up toast?

Service was super slow. I think it took 40 minutes for us to get our food which is outrageous. The food was also kind of pricey for what you get. Our meal was $18 and probably should have cost around $12. Not to mention the surprise that they don't take credit cards. There aren't any signs posted anywhere that they only accept cash, they don't even post it on the menu. Plus the closest place to grab some cash is to walk down to the PDQ and use their ATM, absolutely ridiculous! I definitely won't be returning anytime soon.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the review highlights several aspects of the experience that were disappointing, such as the dirty and poorly maintained environment, undercooked and soggy food, slow service, high prices, and the inconvenience of not accepting credit cards without proper notification. The reviewer was unsatisfied with both the quality of the food and the overall dining experience, expressing frustration and disappointment throughout the review.

question:
A textbook example of the classic barbershop. Good conversation, no frills, and a darned good haircut from an experienced barber, all at a very reasonable price.

Made my appointment earlier today, got right in, and had a great experience. Dick cut my hair, did a wonderful job, and wouldn't even accept a tip afterward.

Don't expect a salon experience; it's a true barbershop. Loved it, and I'll definitely be back.
rationale: The review highlights several positive aspects of the barbershop experience, including good conversation, skilled barber, reasonable pricing, efficient service, and refusal to accept a tip. The reviewer specifically mentions enjoying the traditional barbershop ambiance and emphasizes their intention to return in the future. These positive remarks overall reflect satisfaction with the service received and a genuine appreciation for the straightforward and quality haircut experience provided by the barbershop.

question: I honestly dread getting haircuts, because it always seems like such a crapshoot.  I decided to try Dick and Arnie's based on the 1 or 2 reviews I read, and my desperation to find something better than the corporate salons (cost cutters & supercuts mostly).  Also Dick and Arnie's happens to be right up the road from my house.  Ka cut my hair.  He was very cordial and paid great attention to detail.  The prices were as low at any place I've been, but I felt the quality of cut was better.  I was very happy with my experience and will return to this establishment in the future.
rationale: The sentiment in the review is positive because the customer expressed satisfaction with their experience at Dick and Arnie's. They mentioned that the stylist, Ka, was cordial and paid great attention to detail, resulting in a better quality haircut compared to other salons they have visited. The customer also indicated that the prices were affordable and that they were happy with the overall experience, stating they would return in the future. These positive remarks reflect a pleasant and satisfactory experience at the salon.

question:
In spite of being "Dick and Arnie's" barber shop, I've only managed to ever get my hair cut by Ka. He's a really friendly guy and gives a great haircut, but I'd like to meet Dick at least once.

Contrary to the other review posted, my experience has been that you need an appointment any time you want to get a trim. It's not that bad, but there have been times when I've needed to reschedule 2-3 times due to work, and I just feel bad about that. I'm more used to walk-in barber shops, but since this is the only "real" barber shop in the area, I'll cope.

The haircuts I've had so far have been stellar. Ka does a great job every time, and asks all the important questions up front. The first time I went, I didn't realize they didn't take credit cards, and Ka even waited for me to go to the bank and get some cash!

I'd recommend Dick and Arnie's to anyone who likes the "classic" barber shop feel, and isn't a fan of "Cost Cutters" or "Sport Clips", or whatever other chains are out there now. While it doesn't have all the amenities, they give a great haircut.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer praises Ka for being friendly and providing great haircuts consistently. Despite the inconvenience of needing appointments and the lack of certain amenities, the reviewer appreciates the classic barber shop feel at Dick and Arnie's. The fact that the reviewer recommends the shop to others who prefer traditional barber shop experiences further indicates a positive sentiment towards the establishment.

question:
Went there not knowing what I was in for.  I made an appointment same day and had Ka cut my hair.

He was exceptional and I am very fussy.

He took his time, listened closely to what I was looking for and nailed the cut.

He is quiet, soft spoken and very nice.

Most importantly he does an excellent job of cutting a guy's hair.

And for $15.00 you can't ask for anything better.

I went to an expensive "salon" in Madison and the woman did a crap job.  I paid 1/2 the price at this spot and Ka was awesome.
rationale: The review expresses high satisfaction with the hair cut provided by Ka. The reviewer highlights that Ka was exceptional, attentive to their requests, and delivered a great haircut despite being very picky. The reviewer also praises Ka's skills in cutting men's hair and appreciates the affordable price compared to a more expensive salon experience they had previously. Overall, the reviewer's positive feedback and specific compliments towards Ka indicate a high level of satisfaction with the service received, resulting in a positive sentiment.

question: I called in and made an appointment for 1:30 giving me plenty of time to get my haircut and make my massage appointment 1/4 mile down the street.  I show up at 1:25 and someone is in George's chair just starting to get their hair cut.  When I walk in nobody says anything to me so I sit down and wait.  At 1:45 (15 min past my appointment time and still no one has said a word to me) the guy is still getting his hair cut and he is not even close to being done.  So I tell George I can't wait any longer because I will miss my other appointment.  He tells me we still got time to hang out a little longer.  At 1:50 he finally decides he doesn't have enough time to cut my hair.  You are supposed to be hair cutting professionals.  You should know how long it is going to take to cut someone's hair.  If the person before me showed up late for their appointment why should mine be pushed back? or When I walked in why not tell me hey we are running 30 minutes behind can you wait?  Instead you say nothing absolutely no common courtesy nor do you care that you wasted an hour out of my work day with this.  Someone at Dick and Arnies explain this to me WHAT IS THE POINT OF MAKING AN APPOINTMENT IF YOU ARE NOT GOING TO STICK TO THE TIME SCHEDULE?  I AM A BUSY PERSON AND DO NOT HAVE TIME TO SIT AROUND ALL AFTERNOON FOR A HAIRCUT!   Needless to say I am in the market for a new barber.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the customer had a frustrating and unprofessional experience at the barbershop. Despite making an appointment for a specific time, the customer was not attended to promptly, resulting in a significant delay and ultimately having to leave without receiving the service. The lack of communication and consideration for the customer's time contributed to the dissatisfaction expressed in the review. The customer felt their time was wasted and emphasized the importance of sticking to scheduled appointments for busy individuals.

question: I have been getting my hair cut every month for the last few years by Ka at Dick and Arnie's Barbershop. He consistently does a great job. He takes his time even if there are people waiting. It is a good idea to make an appointment even though they take drop-ins. Men's Haircuts cost $16 and usually take 30 minutes.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer consistently expresses satisfaction with the service provided by Ka at Dick and Arnie's Barbershop. They highlight that Ka does a great job cutting their hair, is attentive to detail, and takes his time even with a busy schedule. Additionally, the mention of a reasonable price and the recommendation to make an appointment further support the positive sentiment by indicating good value and convenience in the service provided.

question:
I was looking for a new salon or barber after getting some rushed through poorly done cuts at cheaper places around town.  I used to go to more expensive salons for cuts but the price was hard to keep up with and even there I wasn't too happy with the haircuts at times.  You also had to schedule far in advance and couldn't come in over a work lunch or break.

Stumbled across Dick & Arnie's on Yelp and am definitely a big fan!  Nice old school place with the original barber chairs (reupholstered), and the type of care and charm you'd expect from a vintage barbershop.  Dick was there at the time but was busy with another cut so I got mine done by Ali.  She did a great job, was easy to talk through what I needed even with me not being terribly helpful (I don't always remember everything when it comes to this stuff).  She took a lot of time to do the cut, carefully going over areas and the end result was exactly what I wanted.  

Price was nice too, only $16 for their standard haircut which is pretty much on par with the cheapo places around town but infinite more value here.  My only qualm with Dick & Arnie's is that they accept cash or check only so be aware of that before making a visit.  I fortunately had some on me but it didn't sound like an ATM was terribly close and in 2014 I'd much prefer to use a card.  Other than that, highly recommend and I will be making a return visit
rationale: The sentiment of the review is positive because the reviewer had a great experience at Dick & Arnie's barbershop. They found the atmosphere to be charming and appreciated the vintage feel of the place. The reviewer received a quality haircut from Ali, who took the time to understand their needs and delivered the exact result they wanted. The price for the haircut was reasonable, providing good value compared to other cheap salons in town. The only minor downside mentioned by the reviewer was the limited payment options, but overall, they highly recommend the barbershop and plan to return in the future.

question: The worst. They tried to have my car towed for parking in their \"delivery spot\" that was marked with a sign so small you'd need binoculars to see it. Not cool.
rationale: The sentiment is Negative because the customer had a frustrating experience with the business trying to tow their car unnecessarily, citing a small and hard-to-spot sign as the reason. The customer felt that their actions were unreasonable and not cool, indicating dissatisfaction with the service provided by the business.

question: This is by far the worst UPS store I have dealt with. A package was not delivered to my work because it didn't have a suite number on the address, a suite number is not necessary because we have a front desk that handles deliveries. Then they mailed me a letter stating that I had to go to Middleton to pick it up or they would send it back to the store. I live no where near Middleton and refuse to pick it up. So hope and pray that you do not have to deal with this store.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the user describes a highly unsatisfactory experience with the UPS store. The user faced difficulty in receiving a package due to an unnecessary suite number requirement, was inconvenienced by the pick-up location being far from their residence, and expressed frustration at the lack of flexibility and customer service demonstrated by the store. This negative review highlights multiple issues that contributed to a poor overall experience for the user.

question: Cheap food, but everything fried on a Friday tastes like fish.  Probably not a big deal if you like fish taste, but I don't.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the individual experienced a negative taste association with the food, which affected their overall enjoyment of the meal. The fact that everything fried on a Friday tastes like fish, despite not being intended to, suggests a lack of quality control or attention to detail in the cooking process, leading to disappointment for the customer.

question:
Let's start this review at a 3-star (A-OK = not good/not bad) rating.

+1 star: They have a Badger Bus for home-game weekends. It costs $5, and includes a coupon for a free drink when you get back from the game.

+1 star: The bowling alley looks nice. It's a small space, but clean-looking. I don't know prices. I'll give them the +1 for appearances.

-2 stars: The food is terrible. TERRIBLE. After the WIS v UTEP game, the wife ordered boneless Buffalo chicken wings. They came out deep fried and hard, with almost no flavor -- there was NO BUFFALO SAUCE ON THE WINGS! (We think the B-sauce might have been fried onto the chicken, but, if so, the flavor was lost in frying).

-1 star: The service was lacking. Following the game, with all 50+ people who had just come back on the Badger Bus, there were only 2 servers, and they were also the bartenders! Service was slow, haphazard, and careless -- the guy never once asked how the food was, nor did he ever actually stop at the table except long enough to take our order. Drinks were dropped on the fly, the food was all but thrown as he whizzed by ...

Overall, 2 stars. I'll go back for the Badger Bus and the bowling, but I will NEVER eat there again.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the user had a poor dining experience at the establishment. The review highlights the terrible quality of the food, specifically pointing out the lack of flavor and proper preparation of the chicken wings. Additionally, the user expressed dissatisfaction with the service, citing slow and careless behavior from the staff. These negative aspects overshadow the positive points about the Badger Bus and the appearance of the bowling alley, resulting in an overall negative sentiment towards the establishment.

question: This is my go-to library, because it's closest to home. There always seems to be a decent selection of the new releases, and I can always get in and out quickly. PLUS, I can always go grab a slice of pie next door at Hubbard!
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the user appreciates the convenience of the library's location, the decent selection of new releases, and the quick in-and-out experience. Additionally, the user enjoys the added bonus of being able to grab a slice of pie next door, enhancing their overall experience at the library. These positive factors contribute to a pleasant and satisfying experience for the user.

question: One of our first restaurant visits when we moved here.  We have since learned to avoid any restaurant a local recommends.  Menu was full of bland comfort food.  Wife had chicken and dumplings that tasted like they came out of a can  My steak was tough and flavorless.  Restaurant has been in the same location for about 100 years and it shows, it's badly in need of a remodel.  Entire place smelled like vomit and was dirty.  I could smell the bathrooms ten feet away and when I had to visit they were even worse, layer over layer of dirt.  Where's the health inspector.  Service was extremely poor, especially considering we were the only people in the place.  I guess the highschooler that was serving us was too busy talking on her cell phone to help us.
rationale: The sentiment is Negative because the reviewer had a poor experience at the restaurant. They mentioned the bland and unappetizing food, with specific complaints about the chicken and dumplings tasting like they came from a can and the tough, flavorless steak. Additionally, the dirty and smelly environment, including the strong odor of vomit and dirty bathrooms, contributed to their dissatisfaction. The lackluster service, highlighted by the server's inattentiveness due to being on the phone, further added to their negative impression of the restaurant.

question: Used to be a classic. However, it's come under new ownership and everything has suffered across the board. Average service, below average food and terrible atmosphere.\n\nNeeds a shot in the arm because it'd be a shame to see a classic Wisconsin supper club disappear.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the review highlights multiple issues with the restaurant since it came under new ownership. These problems include average service, below-average food quality, and a terrible atmosphere. Additionally, the reviewer expresses concern about the decline of what used to be a classic Wisconsin supper club. Overall, the review conveys disappointment and dissatisfaction with the restaurant's current state.
