question:
I wanted to like it, I really did. The Stamm House is walking distance from home, so I figured we HAD to try it... 

First off, let me say that the atmosphere is typical old(emphasis on the old)-school Wisconsin restaurant. Wood paneling, dated tables and chairs, and GOD AWFUL seventies music piped in. When we walked in(at six on a Saturday night) there was one couple at the bar, and another couple dining upstairs near us. The waiter seated us--close to the kitchen, I realized with disappointment. If I want to hear dishes clanging and the hustle and bustle, I'd be cooking at home. Dining out is for pretending that there's no work involved. It also didn't help that because it was so slow in the restaurant, I could hear every comment the waiter said to the cook-staff, some of which wasn't patron-friendly. 

The BF ordered the fried walleye,and I the beef tips Moutarde. His french onion soup was decent, but my salad was lacking. When the meal arrived, I was so excited because I was STARVED. I picked up a piece of beef with my fork and bit down into tender, juicy...FAT. Fatty fatty fatness. Ewww. I did the not-so-sexy-spit-it-onto-the-side-plate maneuver. All right. Every now and then you get a fatty piece of meat in a dish. A girl can move on. MY next bite was better, and although the sauce was decent, it was nothing fabulous. I was disappointed when my next piece was also quite fatty. You know when you get that cheap meat that is mostly sinew and fat. *Sigh* I'm done. I pushed the dish off to the side and settled for my potato. 

To give credit, the waiter noticed I wasn't eating the dish, and asked me if something was wrong. I told him, and he offered to get me something else, which I declined(by the time it was made, Chris would have been done with his dish). Later, he also offered a free dessert, which we really didn't want. He ended up knocking almost half off my dish, which was appropriate, I think. 

Over all, it just wasn't enjoyable. I could have gotten over picking a bad dish if the experience itself was nice, but it wasn't. Average at best. The waiter was decent and tried to be accommodating, but on the whole, it was just sub-par. I left wishing that I had picked another spot to spend my hard earned date-night budget! I realize that a place like this isn't going to be gourmet, but I've had MUCH better casual dining experiences...for less money!
rationale: The sentiment of the review is negative because the customer had several disappointing experiences during their visit to The Stamm House. From the outdated atmosphere with old-school decor and unpleasant music, to being seated close to the noisy kitchen, the initial impressions were not positive. The food also fell short of expectations, with the beef dish being overly fatty and disappointing, leading to a lackluster dining experience. While the waiter tried to make amends by offering alternatives and a discount, the overall experience was underwhelming, leaving the customer feeling like they had wasted their money on a sub-par meal.

question:
2-stars may be a bit generous if we're just measuring food quality.  

Quick-n-dirty review: Stamm House features a lot of character, history, and good service.  Unfortunately, that's about all it has to offer, unless you enjoy food that is extremely greasy, and of mediocre quality.

Detailed review: Our fish fry crew decided to give Stamm House a try after we'd read good things about it on a fairly well known fish fry review website.  Normally, those guys (the reviewers) are pretty spot on, but they've completely missed the mark when it comes to the Stamm House.  Not even close to being a top-10 place, no way, no how.

We sauntered in to the Stamm House at around 5:45 on Friday night and were shocked to find the place darned-near empty.  The bartender greeted us immediately - very friendly guy - we ordered a couple of New Glarus Nakeds and a Spotted Cow.  After downing the first round, we went to order a refill, and whoops - Naked went empty, and there wasn't any more left.  Drat.

After downing a second round of beers (Cows all around this time), it dawned on us that we probably needed to inquire about a table.  So, we wandered upstairs where a friendly lady told us she'd have an opening at around 6:45 or 7:00.  Odd, the place was empty... but, we took it and went back downstairs.

We ordered some cheese curds and the onion rings.  The bartender warned us ahead of time that the curds were "standard-from-the-bag" curds, but said the rings were hand-battered and delicious.  They arrived quickly, and once again, the bartender was spot-on with his description.

The curds were Sysco curds and were not cooked well at all.  I don't think the fryer was hot enough, because these curds were drenched in grease - so much so that we couldn't eat them.  Disgusting.  And the ranch dipping sauce was like water... you know what they say about oil and water... 

The rings were decent, but again - the grease was ridiculous.  It really made for a bad first impression.  So, we ordered some Whiskey Old Fashioned Sours to help cut through the grease film that was sitting so heavily on our palettes.  

Our table was ready by 7:00-ish, and much to our surprise, when we went upstairs this time, the place was packed.  Where those people came from, and how they got up there without us noticing remains a mystery... our waitress stopped promptly, checked our drinks, and took our order - fried perch all the way around with hash browns on the side.

Dinner salads came first and were nice; fairly fresh, fairly tasty, and just the right size.  Fish came out slightly later - served family style - along with our hash browns.  First bite of the fish?  UGH - it tasted awful.  Extremely fishy flavor (and I love fish).  Think "stinky NJ ocean shore line flavor" - not delicate, flavorful, flaky, and enjoyable.  No sir, this was the nightmarishly bad fish that we all remember from our grade school days - you know, the stuff that was about 2-3 days away from being used as feed for the sea lions at the zoo  

So, we doused it with lemon and gave it another go - and once again, the fish was so overpoweringly fishy that we reached for the (gasp!) ketchup.  That helped a bit, but it still wasn't an enjoyable fish fry.  The fish was cooked well - not too greasy, and it was breaded rather than battered.  If only it weren't so obscenely fishy...   

Hash browns were tasty - fried nicely (crisp and tasty).  Service was fantastic - our waitress was fun, helpful, and did a great job of checking in with us.  Total bill for three with a round or two of drinks was $45-ish.

Stamm House = FAIL

Food: 1 star (grease, grease everywhere; horrible fish fry)
Service: 4.5 stars 
Value: 3 stars


Summary: waaaaay too greasy + waaaaaay too fishy fish = fail.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is negative because the reviewer extensively discusses various disappointments with the food quality at Stamm House. The greasy and poorly cooked cheese curds, overly fishy and unpleasant-tasting fish fry, and mediocre hash browns all contribute to a negative dining experience. Despite positive comments about the service and decent value, the overall tone of the review reflects a significant dissatisfaction with the food offered by the restaurant.

question:
Let me start right out by saying that this review has nothing to do with  food!!!  (Unless you count the onion rings appetizer which tasted like most deep-fried onion ring appetizers.)

Some of you know me now as someone who LOVES tradition and history and preservation and stuff-like-that.  

So we came here for the tradition (great old supper club from the 40's), the history (an1847 stagecoach inn, later a stop on the Underground Railway, and a Speakeasy circa Prohibition) and the preservation (it's hard to keep a 150-year old lady going in style).

So we came to DRINK and PLAY, in other words, on a busy Friday night, in spite of, or because of, the fish fry.  We grabbed some stools but found ourselves giving up our seats to some lovely ladies who were waiting to be seated for the fish fry.  (Like I said, we weren't here for the food, but I gotta wonder why the fish fry was JAM PACKED CONSTANTLY.)

After bugging the extremely convivial bartender about the history of the place, and begging to see the "wine cellar"/slave-holding-tank in the basement, he tossed his apron at someone and announced an impromptu "tour".  WOW!

It was cool to say the least, imagining the terrified slaves packed into the "secret" cellar, with its curved brick walls.  So we took turns squeezing in and out, then returned to the bar and proceeded to enjoy tons of conversation with the locals.  So, I'm a fan!
rationale: The review expressed enthusiasm and appreciation for the tradition, history, and preservation of the establishment. The reviewer enjoyed the unique experience of learning about the venue's past, including its role as a stagecoach inn and stop on the Underground Railroad. The impromptu tour provided an exciting and memorable moment, adding to the overall positive experience. Additionally, the reviewer engaged in enjoyable conversations with locals, highlighting the social aspect and community vibe of the place. Overall, the review exudes a sense of enjoyment, fascination, and satisfaction, leading to a positive sentiment.

question: FYI - this place is closed.  It is for sale.
rationale: The sentiment in the review is Negative because the reviewer is informing others that the place is closed and for sale. This implies that the reviewer had a negative experience or disappointment in finding out that the establishment is no longer in operation.

question: I started bringing my Audi here about 3 years ago. The staff is friendly and forthcoming. Generally speaking, car repairs suck but the mechanics here make the process here easier. Most importantly, I feel like I can trust them. I never feel pressured to get more work done than I can afford and they take the time to explain the repairs to me and answer my questions clearly and respectably. They are just stand up guys.
rationale: The review uses positive language to highlight the customer's satisfaction with the service provided by the mechanics at the auto repair shop. The customer appreciates the friendly and forthcoming approach of the staff, expressing trust and confidence in their work. The emphasis on clear communication, lack of pressure for additional services, and respectful attitude towards the customer's questions all contribute to a positive sentiment. Overall, the customer's positive experience and high level of satisfaction are evident in the review.

question:
It was a rare for me that during my college years of blossoming into manhood that I didn't start my night by a trip to Walgreen's. It was also rare that I didn't traumatize the clerk with my purchases.

During the period of time when Keith Charles was known as " Whiskeysaurus Rex" or "Bad Fritz"  and it was common that the following items were being purchased prior to a big night out on the town.

1. Glow Sticks
2. Condoms
3. Met Rx Protein Bar with 32 grams of whey protein isolate
4. Altoids- Cinamon
5. Marb lights
6. Monster Energy Drink (low carb to keep my girlish figure)
7. Motivational stickers 
8. Spare lighter
9. Cherry flavored chap stick
10. Plastic hip flask
11. Corn cob pipe (merely for style)
12. 1 liter of Bubble Gum flavored Pedialyte 

With all of these item stowed safely in my man bag, or "murse" I was ready for any adventure that the night may hold.

Now I know that major corporations are horrible for small business and are generally bad, but where else can a list like this be purchased with one stop ?

Hauki !

Light blue trojans please
Spermicidal for the win !
Do I need road flares ?

Talent ? When you are carrying the above listed items all in one basket, women tend to avoid making eye contact with you, thus making talent hard to judge
rationale: The sentiment of the review is considered positive because the tone of the writing suggests a light-hearted and humorous recounting of past experiences. Despite some potentially controversial or risque content, the overall presentation seems playful and nostalgic, focusing on a specific time period in the author's life. The use of humor, exaggeration, and self-awareness throughout the review helps create a positive and engaging atmosphere for the reader.

question: Gotta give a big THANKS! to this Walgreens.  I found myself there shoeless with an overheated dog and they had no problem letting me come in with the dog to buy some water for him.  It is rare for a big chain store to be so dog and barefoot friendly!
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the user expressed gratitude towards the Walgreens for their understanding and accommodating attitude. The user was helped in a situation where they were in need with an overheated dog and no shoes, and they appreciated the store's willingness to allow them to come in with the dog and provide the necessary assistance. This positive experience highlights the store's compassion and flexibility, making it a noteworthy exception in the user's eyes.

question:
Why do I torture myself by shopping at Walgreens? Desperation drives most of my visits, I suppose, and this one was no different. The Cross Plains State Bank (located just down the road from here) has recently closed, and I was in need of cash prior to my hair cut. I figured Walgreens would have an ATM, or at the very least, would provide cash back with a purchase.

- ATM (from BMO Harris) is about 91 years old, charges a $3 fee, and is slower than molasses. Worse yet, after staring at the screen as it read "Transaction Processing" for 6-minutes, the ATM failed to work. It spit out a receipt that said, "Transaction Failed." Be warned - the service fee is an unreasonable $3; however, since I doubt this thing ever works, you won't pay the fee (you also won't get any cash).

- Prices are outrageous. With the ATM down, I made my way to the soda area so that I could buy a Diet Coke and then get cash back from the register. Their soda prices are a good $0.30 higher than anyone else. I shouldn't be surprised, nor should I be complaining about this, as it's no secret that Walgreens generally charges a premium for anything in their store.

- Checkouts are slow. I got into line to check-out with my Diet Coke. I was 7th in line. One cashier. After 5 people were checked out (only one more person in front of me), the cashier fires-up the microphone and asks for more checkout assistance. Ugh.

- When I went to check out and hit the "cash back" option, the kid who was running the newly opened register informed me that he didn't have $20 in his drawer to give me for change. Really? He had to get a $20 from the other checker.

- You can't enter/exit from University; you have to enter from Branch Street

+ At least it's bright in here and the store feels fairly clean.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer highlighted several frustrating experiences at Walgreens, such as the malfunctioning ATM with high fees, high prices on products, slow checkouts, unprepared staff, inconvenient entrance/exit, and generally feeling dissatisfied with the overall shopping experience. The tone of the review conveys disappointment, annoyance, and dissatisfaction with the services provided by Walgreens.

question:
I like this place because it usually isn't very crowded.  There's a Culver's down the street that always has about five times the business as this place.  The burgers are really good, the best fast-food burgers in my opinion (yes, better than Culvers, gasp), and the fries are excellent as well.  The best part is that if you get there at any time other than lunchtime, you get fresh fries.

The only thing I don't like is how they put mayo on some of their burgers, but they never have a problem with making one without mayo.  Service is always friendly, but sometimes a little slow.  Oh yeah, you should also stay away from the chicken strips.  They're bad.

The decor here is awesome, with wood paneling straight out of the 80's and cheap plastic booths.  There's even a sterile-looking wall clock on one of the walls.  If you want to reminisce about a time before fast-food restaurants tried to be all trendy and hip, you should stop in at Hardee's.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer overall enjoyed their experience at Hardee's. They praised the quality of the burgers and fries, mentioning them as the best they have had compared to other fast-food chains. Although there were some minor issues with mayo on the burgers and slow service, the reviewer highlighted that the staff was friendly and accommodating. Additionally, they appreciated the nostalgic decor of the restaurant, adding to their positive impression. Overall, the reviewer's positive comments outweigh the few negatives, resulting in an overall positive sentiment towards Hardee's.

question: Worst drive thru service ever....they didn't tell me the total cost of my order till I got up to the window.  It took a couple mins. before anyone even came to the window, and then I had to sit there for almost 10 mins before I got my food.  A drive thru is suppose a little quicker service of getting your food.  And the food was not worth the price I paid for it.  This is not the first time I've had this kind of service there.  The people working there also don't seem like they want to be there.  I don't know why I even tried going back.
rationale: The sentiment in the review is negative because the customer experienced poor service during their visit to the drive-thru. They were not informed of the total cost of their order until reaching the window, had to wait for someone to assist them, experienced a long wait time to receive their food, and found the quality of the food not worth the price paid. Additionally, the customer mentioned that this was not the first time they had encountered such poor service at this location and felt that the employees did not seem motivated or engaged. These factors contribute to an overall negative experience and perception of the establishment.

question: 27 holes and a nine hole par 3. Nice course, great price!
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer compliments the course by describing it as nice and highlighting the fact that it offers a variety of holes—a total of 27 holes and a nine-hole par 3 course. Additionally, the reviewer appreciates the course's affordability, describing it as a great price. These positive comments indicate that the reviewer had an enjoyable experience and found good value in the course.

question:
I really like the location of Pleasant View - just on the west side of Madison, it's quick to get to.  The course itself is very nice.  I like the variety of the holes and it's always in pretty good shape.

Prairie:  The "Prairie" nine is probably the course I've played the most.  I like how it has thee par 3's, 3 4's and 3 5's.  That's different, but still adds up.  The holes have character, and if you're a long hitter, the par 5's are a chance to help your score.

Woods:  The "Woods" nine is probably the most scenic.  Obviously, you'll encounter some trees.  Again, holes with character.  Bring your bug spray in the summer!

Lake:  The "Lake" nine is my least favorite of the three, but it's still decent.  There is some water on the hole, but it's named because you can see Lake Mendota from the hill it's on.  

The clubhouse is very nice - good food and a great patio to sit on after a round and enjoy a cold one.  The staff there are always very nice.  If you watch sites like golfnow.com you can find some great deals throughout the year.  I think Bucky Book and/or Entertainment Book have BOGO coupons, but watch for when they're applicable!

This is a very nice course that is great for all levels of play.
rationale: The sentiment in the review is positive because the reviewer expresses a genuine appreciation for the location and condition of the Pleasant View golf course. They highlight the variety of holes on each of the three nines - Prairie, Woods, and Lake - and find something enjoyable about each of them. The reviewer also praises the clubhouse facilities, staff friendliness, and the availability of deals through various channels. Overall, the reviewer describes Pleasant View as a very nice course suitable for all levels of play, indicating a positive and favorable experience.

question:
It's a nice course, but my review is more for customer service/policy. I've never had issues with rain checks at golf courses before, most places will provide them if the weather is bad without hesitation. We were about halfway through the fifth hole when it started to rain and then heard thunder when we were finishing it up the hole, so we returned to the clubhouse. 

We asked for a rain check and mentioned where we were when the thunder started, and they said that they considered that a "completed game". I didn't see anything on the website that indicated that was their policy, and they didn't mention anything beforehand. It certainly didn't feel like a completed game, it felt more like getting ripped off. 

If you go there and feel like you're owed a rain check, make sure you tell them you didn't finish the fifth hole.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the customer felt that they were treated unfairly and that their experience did not align with the typical industry practice of providing rain checks in similar situations. The customer expected to receive a rain check due to the inclement weather interrupting their game, but was denied based on a policy that was not clearly communicated beforehand. This led to feelings of being ripped off and dissatisfaction with the customer service provided by the golf course.

question:
I went to have their buffet with my family on a Saturday. The selection looked appetizing, but tasted HORRIBLE. A salt lick was disguised as dinner (fortunately, I probably will not need embalming fluid once I pass -- considering the incidental preservation). Since i picked it out, I was trying to trick my wife into thinking I liked it, but I could not make it through a 2nd plate. 

The waitress was poor. Her shrill manner and punch-drunk words almost equaled the disgusting taste of the food. 

Sadly, EVEN Old Country Buffet's service and food far exceed that of this sh*thole at a 1/3 of the cost.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer had a terrible experience at the restaurant. They mentioned that the food tasted horrible, to the point where they couldn't even make it through a second plate. Additionally, they criticized the waitress's poor service, further contributing to their negative overall impression of the establishment. The reviewer also made a direct comparison to a different buffet restaurant, highlighting the subpar quality and high cost of their experience.

question:
Quick review: classic supper club with a decent bar area and a large seating area.  Skip the buffet fish - definitely subpar.  Perhaps "menu" options are better?  

Detailed review: Went here for Friday night fish fry, as we'd heard their cod and haddock were some of the best around.  

Wandered in to the bar area, which is actually quite nice and very large.  Found two seats at the bar, ordered a Rocky's Revenge (on tap) and a Whiskey Old Fashioned Sour.  The bartender seemed confused by the old fashioned request - she didn't know if she should muddle it with oranges or cherries or both... we coached her and she got it done, but I'm sad to report the Old Fashioned was average at best.

The bar features bowls of free snacks - Gardetto's and freshly popped corn.  Drink prices were reasonable, and the other folks sitting around us were friendly and personable.

Our table became ready at around 6pm, and after browsing the menu options we decided to go with the buffet.  In hindsight, this was probably a mistake.

The buffet features broasted chicken, two types of baked haddock (seasoned/buttered and plain), deep fried cod, several casseroles, some veggies, and several potato options (baked, broasted, or steak fries).  There's also a salad bar, although it costs $2.99 extra.

The baked plain haddock was firm and largely flavorless.  It didn't have a light, flaky texture, or a good mouth feel.  It was really quite lifeless and unexciting.  

The fried cod reminded me of a frozen Vande Kemps fish fillet.  Really crispy, but lacking in flavor.  Truly a disappointment.

The broasted potatoes were good, as were the casseroles.  My baked potato was still quite firm in places - I wonder if it wasn't fully cooked?  Finally, the veggies seemed like frozen veggies that had been steamed to serve.

Fitzgerald's buffet fish fry = FAIL

Service = 2 stars (rarely saw our waitress)
Food = 1.5 stars (really uninspiring and tasteless)
Value = 2 stars ($13 + $2.99 for salad bar)
MISC = 3 stars (nice bar area; I'd go back here for drinks with the family)

Summary - there are many better options available, and who knows - the menu fish may be better than the buffet, but I don't feel like trying it again to see.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is negative because the reviewer had a disappointing experience at the supper club. They found the food, particularly the buffet fish, to be subpar and lacking in flavor and quality. Additionally, the service received a low rating as they rarely saw their waitress. The reviewer also expressed regret over their choice of buffet over menu options, indicating an overall unsatisfactory dining experience.

question: Yeah, I have to agree with the other reviews. Had the fish fry last week. Really tasteless and not good. Some pieces were way over cooked. Salad bar was ok, but all the prices are high for what you get. Bar area was nice and bartenders nice and quick to get drinks. I think this place must be better for steaks or breakfast - skip the fish.
rationale: The sentiment is Negative because the reviewer expressed dissatisfaction with the food quality, specifically mentioning that the fish fry was tasteless, overcooked, and not good. Additionally, they highlighted high prices relative to the quality of the food received. Despite some positive aspects such as the service in the bar area, the overall negative experience with the food leads to a negative sentiment towards the restaurant.

question:
Wish I would have consulted Yelp before dining here... 

I'm new to the area, and drive past this place quite often, and thought I'd give their Sunday brunch a try. Big mistake. The food was awful. With the exception of the salad bar and fresh fruit, everything tasted and looked like it had been previously frozen or canned. 

Simply put - I've had continental breakfasts at the Holiday Inn that were better.

Our waiter was a nice guy. Very pleasant. Too bad the food wasn't.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is negative because the reviewer expresses disappointment and dissatisfaction with their dining experience. They mention that the food was awful, implying poor quality and taste. They also make a direct comparison to a continental breakfast at a budget hotel chain, indicating that the food at the restaurant was subpar. While the waiter received positive feedback, the overall negative tone of the review stems from the poor quality of the food, leading to the negative sentiment.

question: If you like fresh, good, normal food check out the Brunch at Fitzgerald's. The restaurant is a nice break from the \"fancy & eccentric\" food from other places nearby. Food on brunch buffet is fresh, simple and some of the best I've had on a buffet in the Madison area. I would highly recommended a visit to Fitzgerald's any Sunday morning.
rationale: The review highlights the positive aspects of the brunch experience at Fitzgerald's, emphasizing the freshness and quality of the food compared to other nearby places. The reviewer appreciates the simplicity of the food and considers it some of the best they've had in the area. Additionally, the recommendation to visit on a Sunday morning further reinforces the positive sentiment, indicating a desire to return and enjoy the pleasant dining experience again.

question: Tried to purchase some DJ equipment from this company. My order was denied because my billing address for my credit card was different from my shipping address. Really?! I run several companies and have never run into to this. One of my companies the billing address is our PO Box and the mailing address is the store front or what if I wanted to send a gift to someone? I obviously can't do it through Full Compass.  Also why do you offer the option of a alternate billing or mailing address? Doesn't make sense especially in this economy. I'll be sure to send along my $600+ receipt from the company that's okay with a different mailing address.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the user had a frustrating experience trying to make a purchase from the company. They encountered an issue with their billing and shipping addresses not matching, which resulted in their order being denied. The user feels that this policy is unreasonable, particularly in situations where addresses may legitimately differ such as for business or gift sending purposes. The user is expressing disappointment and frustration with the company's inflexible approach, which has led them to feel dissatisfied with their customer experience.

question:
Wouldnt even rate then as 1 star but yelp wont let me dk anytjing less than that. 

To start Don't waste your time or money ordering ANYTHING from Full Compass. I recently made a large purchase from their website which took over four hours of my time back and forth with their "customer service" sales rep. Not only will they not allow you to ship to a business address they flat out won lt ship the package to any where but your on file billing address.
And further more they couldn't en provide me with a tracking number for my package. I paid for the shipping, it's only natural I get to be informed or aware of when FedEx will be delivering it to me!!! This is one of their illegible polices is the only explain soon I've received, why would anybody give someone payment for sometime that you can even track it's arrival. I'm over it. I will not do business with this company in the future and I would advise anyone else to do the same.
Save youraelf the frustration and time!
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the customer had a frustrating experience with Full Compass. They encountered difficulties with the ordering process, including not being able to ship to a business address and not receiving a tracking number for their package. The customer felt that Full Compass had unclear policies and did not provide adequate customer service, leading to disappointment and a decision to not do business with the company in the future.

question: Done a service repair for a broken Sub.. FAST TURNAROUND! Crazy! I called them 3 days, and they`re done and the sub is ready to go! NICE!
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer received quick and efficient service for the repair of their broken Sub. The fast turnaround time of only 3 days exceeded the reviewer's expectations, resulting in a positive experience. Additionally, the reviewer expresses satisfaction with the outcome, indicating that the Sub was fixed and ready to use, further contributing to the positive sentiment.

question: Recently rented speakers and microphones for an event and was very pleased with the service and quality. I emailed Full Compass, described my needs, and received a prompt response with a quote (within a couple hours). \n\nEasy pick up during regular business hours. I was showed how to use the equipment and it was loaded into my car. Equipment was easy to set up during our event and the sound quality was great! Quick and simple return. Will definitely use them again!
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the user had a smooth and efficient experience with Full Compass. They received a prompt response to their inquiry, found the equipment easy to use and set up, and were satisfied with the sound quality. The user also had a positive interaction during pick up and return, indicating a high level of customer service. Overall, the user expresses intent to use the service again, highlighting their satisfaction with the experience.

question: I always buy my Reel to reel tapes from these guys. They have the best prices for them + they always take care of my orders in a timely manner. I would not go anywhere else but here. Recently I bought a yamaha hifi CD player from them. Very competetive prices. Also wanted to buy a Turntable, they could not help me since they don't carry the brand but my sales Rep TW helped advised me and even directed me to a place which does TT sales in large scale. It does not get any better than this. Thanks so much!
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer expresses satisfaction with the prices, service, and timeliness of their orders from the retailer. They appreciate the competitive prices, the helpful advice from their sales representative for a product they didn't carry, and the referral to another place for a turntable purchase. The reviewer acknowledges the exceptional service they received and expresses gratitude, indicating a positive overall experience with the retailer.

question: Classic neighborhood bar.  Good strong drinks at good prices. I think the bar food is great (try the spudsters!)
rationale: The review mentions that the neighborhood bar offers good strong drinks at good prices, which suggests a positive experience in terms of affordability and quality of beverages. Additionally, the reviewer enjoys the bar food, particularly recommending the spudsters, indicating a positive impression of the food offerings as well. Overall, the positive description of drink quality, pricing, and food suggests a positive sentiment towards the bar.

question:
After the hype about their burgers I was really looking forward to trying the food here. 

The meh: The hushpuppies were 1/2 way decent, but nothing extraordinary. Edible. No honey offered with them though.

The ugh: With the all of the acclaim their burgers get, you would think that they were doing something special here. They aren't. The burgers are frozen patties and look like they're right from Sysco. The reason that people are probably saying they're so good is because the patties aren't cooked within an inch of a briquette. Normally I would say that's a good thing, but when you're making me a burger from an unknown origin handled by who knows how many people....needless to say, medium rare frozen beef patty is doesn't = amazing burger in my book. 

I can't say that I would visit again. There are far too many amazing hamburgers on the west side made with real beef from local butchers to waste my time with this place.

UPDATE: I've spoken with a couple of people that are thinking it may be a fluke that I ended up with frozen patties the time I was there. Apparently they have a machine there that they make their patties with. I'm going to have to revisit in the near future to investigate.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer had high expectations for the restaurant's food, especially their acclaimed burgers, but was disappointed with the experience. The reviewer found the hushpuppies to be average and the burgers, despite the hype, were made with frozen patties that were not particularly special. The lack of quality in the food compared to the reputation of the establishment and the availability of better options in the area led to the decision not to visit again. The mention of potentially revisiting to investigate further indicates a lack of confidence or satisfaction with the initial experience.

question: Want a burger?  Go here!  Price is a little on the high side for some of their dishes, but if your looking for a casual place to grab a beer and burger, this is the place.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the review highlights the positive aspects of the restaurant, such as offering great burgers and a casual atmosphere for enjoying a beer. Though the price may be slightly higher for certain dishes, the overall experience is still considered enjoyable and recommended for those seeking a burger and beer spot.

question: Great old school bar. Burgers are fantastic. The service is good .the price point is good for Middleton. Will be going back again.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the review highlights various positive aspects of the bar, such as the great old school atmosphere, fantastic burgers, good service, and reasonable prices for the area. Additionally, the reviewer mentions their intention to return, indicating a high level of satisfaction and likelihood of recommending the place to others.

question: If you're looking for a super fancy place, keep looking...this is your typical neighborhood tavern and it made me feel like I was back home in the Milwaukee area.  The best burgers in Madison...hands down!  Good fries and cheese curds too...they had a number of other dishes that sounded yummy too.  Super friendly staff.  We will definitely be back!
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the review highlights several positive aspects of the experience. The reviewer mentions the pleasant feeling of being back home, describes the food as the best in Madison with good fries and cheese curds, and notes the friendly staff. Overall, the reviewer expresses satisfaction with their visit and expresses intent to return, indicating a positive experience.

question: The Village Green, I call it the VG for very good. If you want a good greasy burger, crispy golden fries, non-greasy crunchy cheese curds, a nice selection of local brews on tap and fast friendly service this place is for you.
rationale: The review highlights several positive points about The Village Green, such as the delicious greasy burger, crispy fries, non-greasy cheese curds, local brews, and fast friendly service. These aspects are all praised by the reviewer, indicating a positive experience overall. The use of words like "very good," "nice selection," and "fast friendly service" further reinforce the positive sentiment expressed in the review.

question: The Village Green is a Classic Small Town Tavern... That's that. The Double Cheeseburger came on a soft white bun. The patties were well seasoned - something many burger joints can't seem to figure out. My burger came with American cheese. Although I could have specified Swiss or Pepper Jack - but I'm glad I didn't. The Village Green burgers sort of yearn for American Cheese. I ordered my burger medium-rare and Bazinga... It actually came medium-rare. If you follow my reviews, you understand that I'm a stickler for properly cooked burgers. Few burger joints get this right - So when they do, it's worth noting. \n\nCompanion had a Bacon Cheeseburger. She claimed it was tasty... Given companion isn't really a bacon cheeseburger sort of gal, this was high praise. Although she did enjoy it with the Classic Wisconsin cocktail, an Old Fashioned. Said cocktail may have improved  her review.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is positive because the reviewer had a great experience at The Village Green and thoroughly enjoyed their Double Cheeseburger, highlighting the well-seasoned patties and the fact that it was cooked to their preference of medium-rare. The reviewer also noted the positive feedback from their companion who enjoyed the Bacon Cheeseburger with a Classic Wisconsin cocktail. Overall, the positive comments about the food quality, preparation, and accompanying drink options indicate a satisfying dining experience, making the sentiment positive.

question:
I work near this Walgreens and often find myself dropping-in to grab a quick water, soda, or bottle of meds (Tylenol, Advil, etc).  The location is clean and well lit, which is a plus.

The downsides:
- All Walgreens are pricey
- Slow checkout process, despite having 4+ available registers/lanes
- The intersection of Junction/Old Sauk is a pain to get in and out of
- New "rewards system" stinks

Allow me to expand on the last "downsides" item... 

Walgreens initiated a rewards system that allows you to earn points from purchases that can then be applied to "cash back" rewards that can be used against future purchases.  

Where this fails is with the posted specials.  You can't take advantage of the specials (like buy one, get one free) unless you're a rewards system member.  I'm not a fan of that... I have about 800-billion rewards programs that I have to keep track of (and that keep track of me); the last thing I need is another rewards program.  I miss the good 'ole days when Walgreens used to offer bargains without the strings.

I think I'm done visiting Walgreens.  It's convenient, but the cons outweigh the pros.
rationale: The sentiment expressed in the review is negative because the reviewer highlights several drawbacks that they have experienced while visiting Walgreens. They mention that the prices at Walgreens are generally high, the checkout process is slow despite multiple registers being available, the location is inconvenient due to the difficult intersection to access, and they are not satisfied with the new rewards system. The reviewer specifically points out that the rewards system limits their ability to take advantage of specials without being a member, which adds to their frustration. Overall, the reviewer feels that the disadvantages outweigh the advantages of visiting Walgreens, leading to a negative overall sentiment.

question: Totally agree with Steve L comments in his prior review,especially the rewards card usage to get specials. A real pain! I would also add that check out personnel were not the friendliest.
rationale: The sentiment in the review is negative because the reviewer mentions that using the rewards card to get specials was a real pain, indicating frustration with the process. Additionally, the reviewer states that the check-out personnel were not the friendliest, suggesting a lack of positive customer service experience. These negative aspects mentioned contribute to an overall negative sentiment in the review.

question:
Walgreens has become a travesty of retail. During my most recent visit for a pack of gum and a bottle of water, I waited in line for nearly 10-minutes and watched two cashiers swap registers no fewer than 4 times, and I have no idea why. 

The gentleman with his wife in front of me said, "This is the most ridiculous thing I have ever seen at a store, ever." And I couldn't have agreed more.

When it came time for me to check-out, my total came to $3.16, and I was asked if I was a member of their rewards club, followed by "why not" followed by, "why not join? it's free!" 

When I declined, and opted to pay in cash, the guy took my $4 and then didn't give me any change. He wished me "well" and when I asked for my change, he looked at me like I was crazy... I reminded him that I paid $4 for a $3.16 item. He then said, "Oh, did you want your change?"

Ugh.
rationale: The sentiment in this review is negative because the customer describes a frustrating and inconvenient experience at Walgreens. The long wait time, confusing cashier behavior, pressure to join the rewards club, and lack of proper change given all contribute to the negative perception of the store. Additionally, the customer's interaction with the cashier regarding the change needed for their purchase adds to the overall feeling of dissatisfaction and incompetence on the part of the staff.

question: My favorite Madison clothing store by far.  I coveted a pair of gold shoes they had over Christmas ($135!)  and managed to save enough to buy them....totally worth it!!  They are italian leather and SO beautiful.  Everything else in the store is the same way....it makes me wish I had unlimited funds and could get one of everything.  The guys clothing is fantastic too, although getting your boyfriend to shell out that kind of money to look \"metrosexual\" is sometimes a challenge. Something nice to keep in mind as well is that they have free alterations on non-sale clothing....I had a pair of jeans done and they actually put the detailing around the bottom back on....AMAZING!  5 stars.
rationale: The review expresses strong admiration and satisfaction towards the Madison clothing store, highlighting the quality of the products, in particular, a pair of gold shoes made of Italian leather. The customer expresses happiness and excitement about the purchase, emphasizing that the item was worth the price. The positive sentiment is further supported by the mention of free alterations provided by the store, showcasing its dedication to customer satisfaction. Overall, the reviewer's enthusiasm, appreciation for the store's merchandise, and the excellent customer service indicate a positive sentiment in the review.

question: My Experiences in this store have not been good for some years now.  GAP, Banana, and Old Navy used to make affordable and quality clothing, but in the past few years, the prices have increased and the quality has gone to shit.  Clothes I have bought have had their hems fall out after one wearing and their buttons fall off quite easily.  Not only is the quality bad, but the service is horrendous.  Last time I was in the store, a worker said hi to me, but after looking around for a while, never checked in with me, and when I needed a fitting room they were locked and I had to wait almost 10 minutes to get the gals attention to let me in.  \nThe last pair of shoes I bought there were quite comfortable, but within the first 30 minutes of wear, the heel feel off completely.  If you are looking for work attire/dress clothes, I would recommend passing on Banana Republic and trying your luck at Macy's or another retailer.
rationale: The sentiment is Negative because the reviewer expresses dissatisfaction with the quality of the products, citing issues such as hems falling out, buttons coming off easily, and shoes falling apart. They also mention poor customer service, highlighting instances of neglect and inconvenience during their shopping experience. These negative encounters have led the reviewer to discourage others from shopping at the store, particularly for work attire or dress clothes.

question: When you hear Banana Republic you think quality clothing store?  At least that's what I think.  However, BR in the mall is a shotty example for quality.  They are anything but quality.  The clothing in the entire Gap Inc. company has declined in quality over the years.  The service, unforutnatly, has also diminished.  The workers at BR, I find, are unfriendly, unpersonable, and not ever around.  Getting a fitting room in that place is a disaster.  I always have to wait for someone to be done using one, so I get to one that is opened.  Nobody is ever back to there to unlock the doors.  I had a problem once with an associate, or who I thought was an associate, and asked to see the manager.  Well, she was the manager.  Totally unacceptable for a store with such clout.  I don't know if all Banana Republics operate this way, but if they do, they will most certainly be losing my business.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is negative because the reviewer expresses dissatisfaction with the quality of clothing and service at Banana Republic. They mention a decline in quality over the years, unfriendly and unpersonable workers, difficulties with getting assistance and using fitting rooms, and encountering a situation where the manager did not meet their expectations. These frustrations and disappointments highlighted in the review contribute to an overall negative sentiment towards the Banana Republic store in question.

question:
I feel like I should preface this review by saying that my current resolution to eat better (mainly STARVING MYSELF until I fall asleep) has nothing to do with recent, shall we say less than positive reviews for businesses in Madison. Even if I wasn't hungry all the time, I'd still say this store blows and here's why. 

1. Nobody greets you when you walk in. (Customer Service 101).
2. You can walk around for 15 minutes with an armful of clothing and nobody will ask you if you need a fitting room. (Customer service 101 & Loss Prevention 101).
3. Nobody will come by the fitting room to see how you're doing and if you need alternate sizes. (Customer Service 101, Loss Prevention 101 & Sales 101). 

I've been three times and each time sucked more than the time before. (Grammar 101). I started as a Gap Inc. employee in 1996 working my way up from Gap Baby to Gap Kids, Gap and finally Banana Republic in 2009. I worked as a sales associate, a visual specialist and most recently men's merchant in Arizona. The three times I've been here the store has always been in disarray which certainly doesn't create for a very stimulating shopping experience and the uninterested staff have made it so I'll simply only shop online now. 

Sorry BR, you're store's bananas and you've lost me.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is negative because the customer outlines several specific instances of poor customer service and store conditions that have left them dissatisfied with their experiences at the store. They highlight issues such as lack of greeting upon entry, no assistance with fitting rooms, disarray in the store, and uninterested staff, all of which contribute to a negative overall shopping experience. These factors have led the reviewer to decide to only shop online from now on, showing a clear disapproval of the physical store and its operations.

question: Disgusting. \nThat's the only word that comes to mind after walking front of store to back and seeing piles upon piles of clothing and items askew on every table, shelf and rack. I'd understand if it was 7pm on a Saturday (weekend) but this was Monday morning y'all, and the place looked like the pits! What the heck BR? You are a mess! An absolute mess. And you're consistently a mess. \nI walked in today with the intent to buy a suit (40% your entire purchase... sign up for their emails) but I couldn't even shop the racks with crammed half on hangers, half off hangars pants and jackets. This place needs an iron fist. A store manager who can shape this thing up and restore BRs name as a Gap Inc brand. Someone would have to tell me they did a complete 180 for me to return.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer expresses strong disappointment and disgust with their experience at the store. The reviewer highlights the messy and disorganized state of the store, pointing out that it looked like a mess even on a Monday morning. They express frustration at not being able to shop properly due to the chaotic presentation of clothing items. The reviewer calls for better management and a complete overhaul to improve the store's reputation. Overall, the tone of the review is critical and unsatisfied, leading to a negative sentiment.

question:
This past weekend I was visiting Madison for a conference and ate at the Nitty Gritty with a group of 50 people. The service was outstanding, friendly, attentive and quick. My water glass was never empty. The restaurant has two levels with high ceilings and polished wood floors. A relaxed, clean atmosphere.

My table of 5 started with chicken strips, good and standard and spinach dip. The spinach dip is excellent, extra cheesy and hot served with chips, and fresh veggies- carrots, celery, broccoli and cauliflower.

We all had burgers and fries. The burger was enormous I could only eat 1/2. Pretty good deal for around $6.

If you are in the area I recommend  the Nitty Gritty.
rationale: The sentiment in the review is positive because the reviewer praises the outstanding service, friendly and attentive staff, and quick service at the Nitty Gritty. They also enjoyed the atmosphere of the restaurant, highlighting the high ceilings and polished wood floors. Additionally, the reviewer found the food items they ordered, such as the spinach dip and burgers, to be excellent and good value for the price. Overall, the reviewer recommends the restaurant to others in the area, which reflects their positive experience.

question:
Maybe I missed something about this place, but after three tries, I just had to stop going back hoping I would finally feel the magic. The burgers are okay, but there are better ones in Madison. 

The last time we were there, my son's chicken sandwich was overcooked, and they charged more money since he got it on a pretzel bun instead of the regular bun. Our burgers were unremarkable - not that flavorful or moist. The buffalo wings were greasy and actually not hot when we got them. And the last night we were there, a Friday at about 6:00, the place was full and the service was terrible. As in waiting over fifteen minutes after I had piled all the dirty dishes at the end of the table as a hint that we were way done before the server came by wondering if we wanted anything else. 

And somehow, with four people, no alcoholic drinks, two appetizers, and four sandwiches, our bill was over $70. That's US dollars. Before the tip. They charge extra for everything - ranch on the side, cheese on a burger - everything. For a really marginal meal and lousy service, that was way too much money.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is negative because the reviewer had multiple negative experiences at the restaurant. They mentioned that the food was unremarkable, with overcooked items and greasy buffalo wings. The service was also described as terrible, with long waits and unresponsive staff. Additionally, the reviewer felt that the prices were too high for the quality of the food and service they received. These factors contribute to an overall negative impression of the restaurant.

question: Tonight the fam got Nitty Gritty takeout, and for me it was a disappointment. I had suggested the NG because I'd been craving chicken tenders all day. In the past, NG's chicken appeared to be hand-breaded and had a decent dose of pepper in the breading to give it some flavor. Tonight's offering was a step above cafeteria chicken strips. Flat, factory-breaded, flavorless, and all of them with that gross gooey translucent strip of whatever you get in cheap chicken. Making it worse was the addition of soggy fries and not-as-good-as-I-remembered Gritty sauce. For almost $10, I'm calling this a total bust. Yet another restaurant I can cross off the list for upping price and cutting quality.
rationale: The sentiment is Negative because the individual had a disappointing experience with the Nitty Gritty takeout they ordered. They had high expectations based on past positive experiences, particularly with the quality of the chicken tenders, but found the current offerings to be subpar - describing them as flat, factory-breaded, flavorless, and with unpleasant textures. The additional points about soggy fries and a decline in the quality of the accompanying sauce further contributed to their dissatisfaction, especially considering the relatively high cost of the meal. Overall, the individual's specific criticisms and sense of regret over spending on a disappointing meal clearly indicate a negative experience.

question: Their prices have gone up.  The quality has gone down.  Medium-well burger was well done (crispy, burnt).  23 bucks for one gritty burger, one small cheese curd order and two draft beers.  Wow, times have changed.  They just lost my future business.  Judging by how few people were there, it looks like they may be losing a lot of business.  Such a shame, because it used to be fantastic.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the customer expresses disappointment and frustration with the changes they've observed at the establishment. They mention price increase, decrease in quality, and dissatisfaction with the food they received. Furthermore, they feel that the value for the money spent is not justified, leading to the decision to not return in the future. The mention of few customers present also suggests a decline in popularity, reinforcing the overall negative sentiment towards the establishment.

question: Meh. This place doesn't suck, but it's not very good. The only time you should really go is if it's your birthday so you can have free beer.\n\nTheir menu is incredibly boring and extremely overpriced for the quality of ingredients that they use. On my most recent visit, our table got an order of Nachos to share. With chicken, it cost $12.50. It was nothing more than a plate of tortilla chips covered in Day-Glo orange cheese, jalapeno slices, and gray (eww) dried out chicken pieces. I also had a burger as my entree, and the beef tasted a little funky, like it had been reheated in a microwave--almost metallic. My dining partner had a salad that she seemed to enjoy, but it's hard to mess up a simple green salad. Sadly, I've been here more often than I'd like to admit because they host Team Trivia on Tuesday nights. My boyfriend and I decided to start going somewhere else for trivia when we recently won and got a $40 gift certificate and weren't excited to use it because it meant we'd have to try to consume more of their crappy food. We spent it mostly on booze instead.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is negative because the reviewer expresses disappointment and dissatisfaction with multiple aspects of their experience at the restaurant. They mention the boring and overpriced menu, low quality of ingredients, unappetizing dishes like the Nachos and the burger, and the perceived reheating of food. Additionally, they highlight their lack of excitement about using a gift certificate due to the quality of the food. Overall, the review conveys a sense of regret and frustration with their repeated visits to the restaurant.

question: This place is great for birthdays. You get your glass mug filled with beer, soda, or juice with unlimited refills, while also getting a very small ice cream sundae at the end.  The burgers were very tasty and cooked as requested. Our server was very good and on top of refills and food came out of the kitchen pretty quick.   I liked the atmosphere in the dining area with tv's mounted throughout the restaurant.  The bar area was not huge, but I could see it being a fun atmosphere later on in the night.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer highlighted several aspects of their experience that were enjoyable and satisfactory. They praised the drinks with unlimited refills, delicious burgers, attentive server, quick service, and pleasant atmosphere with TVs. Additionally, they mentioned the potential for a fun atmosphere in the bar area later in the night. The combination of these positive elements in their review contributes to an overall positive sentiment.

question:
Nuh uh. Nope. No no no. My daughter wanted to eat here for her birthday this year, having eaten at the one downtown successfully 4 years ago. Her birthday, her pick. Plus, she delights in the free mug of soda and balloon. She's a birthday sell-out and I think that must be how they suck you in. 
But, I digress. Our order took an aggravatingly long time to arrive and our glasses remained empty after having drunk their contents while waiting. There was a Packers game on and many of the wait staff were watching that. I don't know if that was the hold up, but it was a bit irritating. 
When our meals finally arrived, my children discovered that the insides of their burgers were very pink. Waaaaay too pink for medium well, which they ordered. It was scary pink and super soft--like raw hamburger generally is. When I told our waiter about it, he was completely uninterested in helping fix the situation, and instead, argued with me about it for quite a while, finally saying, "That's what medium well looks like" in a tone that suggested that I was simply too stupid to know the difference. I'm not. Finally I convinced him to humor me and take them back to be cooked through. He did so with a smidgen of contempt.
As a side-note, my husband's burger was to be well done and was also pink, though not raw.
Still no drink refills.
No one offered a discount, a refund, a free soda while we waited, and especially not an apology. Obviously we won't be back.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is negative because the customer experienced multiple issues during their visit to the restaurant, including long wait times, inattentive service, improperly cooked food, and a lack of resolution or apology from the staff. The customer's concerns were not taken seriously by the waiter, who seemed dismissive and argumentative instead of addressing the problem professionally. Overall, the customer felt dissatisfied with the experience and expressed that they would not be returning to the restaurant.

question: Meh... short review for posterity sake... bland burgers make me sad.wont be going back... unless its my birthday... then its free right?
rationale: The sentiment of the review is negative because the user expresses disappointment with the food, describing the burgers as bland and making them sad. Additionally, they mention that they won't be returning unless it's their birthday and they can get a free meal, indicating a lack of desire to dine at the establishment again. These negative experiences and feelings overall contribute to the negative sentiment expressed in the review.

question: The Nitty in Middleton seems to live off of its name recognition. The food is so-so at best. I had the premium Prarie Farms burger. To bad it was completely unseasoned. Toasting the bun on a $10 burger would've been a nice touch and would have added som texture. Why bother to pay for a premium products if they aren't properly prepared. I also think the menu is in the pricey side for basic so-so bar food. The choice of sides did yield a nice surprise - fresh asparagus spears.  \n\nThis meal was a disappointment. There are few places that can pull off a decent burger. You want a great pub burger... Hit the Eastside - go to Players.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer expressed disappointment with their dining experience at The Nitty in Middleton. They disliked the unseasoned premium burger and felt that the food was only average at best. Additionally, the reviewer found the prices to be on the pricey side for the quality of the food offered. The lack of proper preparation of the premium burger and the overall underwhelming dining experience led the reviewer to recommend going elsewhere for a better burger, indicating a negative sentiment towards their experience at The Nitty.

question: Doctor Brandon is fantastic. his equipment is first class, and he will help you with anything. He also won't sell you things you don't need. He is the one Doctor I have that I feel like actually listens to me and my family, and helps us with all the health problems we have to find solutions. Focusing, Allergies, diet help for eyes etc. They always offer snacks and drink when we are there and see us fast and get us in fast. They are not inexpensive, but their glasses are quality. They don't sell any plastic lenses. So you are not going to find cheap glasses here. That being said my glasses have been dropped and stepped on and never break.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the review highlights Doctor Brandon's exceptional qualities and services. The reviewer praises the doctor for having top-notch equipment, being attentive and helpful, and for not pushing unnecessary products. Additionally, the reviewer appreciates the personalized care provided to their family and the efficient service they receive. Despite the higher cost, the reviewer acknowledges the quality of the glasses offered. Overall, the review emphasizes Doctor Brandon's expertise, attentiveness, and the high-quality service provided, leading to a positive sentiment.

question: Just visited and had a really good experience.  The vet technician (who came from the Chicago and whose name I forgot - sorry!) was fantastic! Very nice and listened to all my concerns (I don't take my cat to the vet much so I wait and lump it all together). The doctor was very nice and very thorough - went down the checklist and checked everything. They got 4 stars instead of 5 because they made me feel a little guilty like I should be doing more. I can't afford everything they recommended and I think they were going above and beyond with the recommendations otherwise, very good experience.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer had a "really good experience" at the vet's office. They specifically praised the vet technician for being fantastic and attentive to their concerns. The doctor was also noted as very nice and thorough in their examination. The reviewer appreciated the detailed checklist used by the doctor. Despite feeling a bit guilty about not being able to afford all the recommended treatments, they still acknowledged the team's care and effort in providing recommendations. Overall, the reviewer described it as a "very good experience," highlighting the positive aspects of their visit.

question: Ok, I heard from someone that Culver's had cheese curds.  (For those that don't know what a cheese curd is then ready this wiki article.  Don't worry I didn't know about them until I came to Wisconsin.  http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cheese_curds)    So, when class got out early today, I decided that I needed to hunt for the elusive curds.  The easiest place to come was here.  But the curds are not the traditional curds, they were fried curds, like fried mozzarella.   A nice snack but not exactly was I was looking for .... on with the search.
rationale: The sentiment is Negative because the person's expectation was not met when they found out that the cheese curds they tried were not the traditional curds they were searching for. The description of the fried curds being like fried mozzarella rather than the desired traditional curds may have left them disappointed, hence the negative sentiment.

question:
5 stars because 

1) it's Culver's and 

2) I refuse to let an LA resident (Tracy G) weigh down the supreme awesomeness that is Culver's based on her misunderstanding of cheese curd availability!
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer appreciates Culver's and defends its reputation against a negative review by highlighting the excellence of Culver's and addressing a specific complaint made by another customer. The reviewer's loyalty to the restaurant and their enthusiasm for Culver's shines through in the review, earning it a positive sentiment.

question: I don't get it? I don't understand the fascination with Culvers? The food costs twice that of Wend's, Mc D's, Hardys, or Burger King, and with the doubling of the price it has double of the grease! They figured if you \"butter toast\" the buns you can serve stale bread and know one will know. If you order through the drive through you will be given a number and have to wait. Worst yet if you order a sundae you will get it first while you wait 15-20 minutes for you order to cook. Just in time for you to enjoy you sundae as soup. Worst yet it is not ice cream it is \"custard\". A frank'en food knock off of real ice cream. Oh, and the fry's are soggy. I don't get it. Amongst my friend I'm apparently the only one that doesn't like this place?
rationale: The sentiment in the review is negative because the reviewer expresses multiple complaints and dissatisfaction with the experience at Culver's. They mention high prices in comparison to other fast food chains, excessive grease in the food, long wait times, issues with the quality of the buns and fries, disappointment with the type of dessert served, and overall lack of enjoyment with the food. These negative experiences contribute to the reviewer's overall negative perception of Culver's as a restaurant.

question: I bought four woven shades at Home Depot on October 23, 2013 that Springs Window Fashions manufactured. After installation it is obvious that they do not line up horizontally. I have contacted customer service four times and \"Pedro\" has still not responded. Today is January 7, 2014.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the customer experienced a problem with the product they purchased (woven shades from Home Depot) manufactured by Springs Window Fashions. The issue of the shades not lining up horizontally after installation reflects a quality or installation problem. Additionally, the lack of response from customer service, specifically from the representative named Pedro after multiple attempts at contacting them, suggests poor customer service and a lack of resolution for the customer's concerns.

question: I purchased 4 large window shades including multiple shades on one headrail for a large patio door. They are beautiful fabric and were installed easliy. I had one that was faulty and after contacting Costco.com through which they were purchased, a new shade was sent within a few days. The customer service rep was professional and friendly. Many people have said they are some of the nicest shades they have seen. The fabric is stunning.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the customer had an overall good experience with their purchase of window shades. The shades were described as beautiful, the installation process was easy, and the faulty shade was promptly replaced by the seller. Additionally, the customer service received was professional and friendly. The positive feedback from others who saw the shades further reinforces the positive sentiment.

question: There are hardly words to describe how poorly made their products are, but they've managed to dig a little bit deeper with their customer service. We purchased a home that had what we thought were Hunter-Douglas window coverings, but turned out to be Springs. The plastic clips had cracked and broken in direct sun (funny, but you put window coverings up to keep out the sun). Our licensed installer called them to get replacements, they sent the wrong thing. Then it turned out the battery packs weren't working. They wouldn't send them, telling him I (the customer) had to call. When I finally got through (no mean feat) they told me they don't sell directly to customers. ? After expressing my extreme displeasure he agreed to send me the battery packs. He told me 5 days. They didn't run the credit card until  a week later, Then it turns out a motor is bad. As the blinds are \"just\" 5 years old, they don't warranty them. My guy talked to them two weeks ago and we were told a \"motor resetting tool\" (really?) would be here by Tuesday. It's been two weeks. No reset tool.  I know the original owners went for Springs to save a few dollars, but this is where the cheap turns out expensive. And time consuming. AVOID. AT. ALL. COSTS. (costs being a key word here)
rationale: The sentiment of the review is negative because the customer experienced multiple issues with the product and the customer service provided by the company. The customer encountered problems with the product quality, incorrect replacement parts being sent, delays in receiving necessary components, and lack of warranty coverage for a faulty motor. The overall experience was frustrating, time-consuming, and did not meet the customer's expectations, leading them to advise others to avoid the brand at all costs.

question:
As the previous reviewer mentioned, this is a newly remodeled facility which has turned out wonderfully. All new equipment and works great. 

I have been using this place since I discovered it about a year ago. The remodeling took place in November and December 2012. Previously this was just car wash station with about 8 self serve stalls and 2 or three automatic. The remodeling removed some of the self service stalls (there are approx. 4 now) and used this space for a new Laundramat and a dog wash station, which i hear is one of the only ones in the Madison area. 

I have been there mostly on Sundays and they have an attendant who is an older gentlemen and is very friendly and fun to shoot the breeze with if you use the self service stations. Personally, I believe you cant get a better car wash than using the self service stations if you have the time and strength (your arms do get a little sore after!). For 5 dollars I believe, you get 12 minutes which is plenty of time to do a thorough wash, rinse, wax and time to use scrubber on front end/rims as needed. The soap is not watered down like other places. They also take credit card at the self service station, so no need to fill a sock full of quarters. The only other self service I know of in the Madison area is off Rimrock road, which is cheaper, but for less time, in a rough area, in terrible shape,  and the soap is MUCH more watered down. 

I have also used the laundramat there recently and received exceptional serivce. They have a special going on in March that all dryers are free! All new machines, therefore clothes come out smelling and looking great. In addition, this is a full service laundramat, therefore there is a regular attendant on duty who will do the washing, drying and foling for you. I believe the charge was 49 cents for every lb. They also have a promotion going on right now for the first 10lbs are free. It is a very convenient service if you have a lot of errands to run and dont want to waste an afternoon at the laundramat. I had quite a bit of laundry one day, and the attendant gave me a very good deal in addition to the 10 lbs free. Make sure to tip the attendant if you use this service, she did an excellent job and saves you a ton of time!

I have not used the dog wash, as I do not have a dog, but I imagine it could be something fun to do.

The only negative I have about this place is that is hard to get in and out of, as you have to pull in behind the building and turn the corner of the building at a blind spot. Its about as narrow as one lane, and people come in and out of same drag.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer highlights numerous aspects of the facility that they appreciate, including the recent remodeling, the quality and convenience of the car wash and laundry services, the friendly and helpful attendants, and the overall value for the price. They also mention the unique offering of a dog wash station, further adding to the positive experience. Although they point out a negative aspect regarding the location's accessibility, the overall tone of the review is enthusiastic and satisfied, leading to a positive sentiment overall.

question: The manual car wash is very expensive. I am going to do my car at home from now on. The price of the manual to do a good job approaches a full service wash with interior clean up.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the user is dissatisfied with the high cost of the manual car wash compared to the value they perceive they are getting. Additionally, the user feels that the price of a manual wash that provides good results is too close to the cost of a full-service wash, making it less appealing to continue using the manual car wash service.

question:
1. They moved, and their website still shows the old address.  The new location is "hidden" behind a larger building, and to get into the salon, you have to enter in through an "outer" building; it's a suite inside of a building. Didn't matter much since they were closed by the time I found the place.

2. They were closed by 4:50pm, and they don't have their hours posted anywhere at their new location. I'd refer to their website for info, but it's apparently out of date.

I love Aveda products; I will apparently have to go elsewhere to buy them.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer experienced multiple frustrating issues when attempting to visit the salon. These issues include difficulty finding the new location due to outdated website information, confusion about entry through another building, and arriving to find the salon closed before the stated closing time. Additionally, the lack of posted hours at the new location added to the overall negative experience. The reviewer also expresses disappointment at not being able to access their preferred Aveda products at this salon due to the encountered challenges.

question:
I bought a Groupon for a half price reflexology pedicure.

This is an Aveda salon, so if you like their products you at least have that going for you. The salon isn't the easiest to find- it's a plain storefront in a strip mall. Pedicures are done in a small room in back. There are two chairs and they bring a bowl of water for your feet. It's not bad, but it's right by the salon's back room so you can hear employees talking on their breaks. It's not the most well-ventilated room either, so it's a bit warm.

What I was expecting was something more than a regular pedicure, since with was supposed to be a "reflexology" pedicure. What I got what less that what most basic nail places do- no scrubbing, exfoliation, or even light massage.  They put Aveda lotion on my legs at the end and lightly worked on my nails and cuticles before putting on polish.

They didn't even use a basecoat or topcoat on my nails, which is really strange for a salon! I would never pay full price for even a regular pedicure here. They have a very small polish selection as well.
rationale: The sentiment is Negative because the reviewer had high expectations for a reflexology pedicure but was disappointed with the lack of services provided. The reviewer noted that the treatment did not meet their standards, with minimal pampering such as scrubbing and massage, and expressed dissatisfaction with the salon's lack of attention to detail, such as not using a basecoat or topcoat on their nails. Additionally, the reviewer mentioned the lack of ambiance and ventilation in the salon, further contributing to their negative experience.

question:
For a salon with a name as refreshing as Tangles Salon, this business sure has a its Goldilocks well....tangled. Although this location carries the Aveda name, it appears to be buckling under its weight. There are many issues at this salon, and only a few will be mentioned here.

Tangles Salon has had a somewhat tortured existence here in the Madison area, what with experiencing not-so-smooth management changes, relocating attempts, massive employee walkouts, and even a fire in the past 2 years alone. One begins to wonder how they have stayed afloat as long as they have.

After a devastating fire destroyed Tangles, it was clear that many once loyal customers had been caught in the middle of the chaos. Some arrived at the salon for their appointments, only to find the building in charred ruins, and most never got a courtesy call from the owners. Furthermore, the fire raises red flags related to safety, Although not mentioned in the police report, many ex-clients have speculated that the entire situation was suspicious.

A receptionist named Deeon, was at the front desk when I last entered Tangles. He welcomed me to the salon, but his demeanor was cold and businesslike. He seemed very out of place in the salon, and didn't seem to really enjoy being there as he led me to the chair. I waited for 10 minutes for my stylist to come over from the very noisy break room I was unfortunate enough to have been next to. As I was waiting, I noticed an accumulation of hair and dust around the edges of the station.
