There were also many dead insects in the overhead fluorescent lighting, indicating lack of cleanliness throughout the salon.

On the plus side, Tangles does have some talented stylists. But without the proper management and support, their work remains spotty and inconsistent at best.

I wanted to like this salon, but found it difficult to look past the issues. It is important to note that it is difficult for any business to survive changing locations multiple times. However, when combined with the suspicious fire, the disgruntled clients, and the unstable behind the scenes management, it is safe to say that Tangles needs a deep conditioning treatment if they want to remain relevant in this city.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is negative due to the multiple issues highlighted within the Tangles Salon that reflect poorly on the business. The incidents of management changes, employee walkouts, a fire with questionable circumstances, lack of communication with loyal customers, uncleanliness in the salon, and overall inconsistent service all contribute to a negative impression of the salon's operations. Despite having talented stylists, the negative aspects mentioned overshadow any positives and indicate a need for significant improvement in various areas of the business.

question: I recently purchased a Group On for a salon pedicure and called to make the appointment which they were booked two weeks out.  I made the appointment and the day before the appointment they contacted me to  tell me that the nail tech that I was scheduled with called in sick.  When I stated that my appointment was for the next day at 11:30 , they indicated that she was going to be out then as well.  Ok, I was fine with this, and they offered to get me in at 2:00 or 3:00.   I indicated that I would have to check my calendar and would call them right back, but she put me in  for 3:00 temporarly.  I called back 10 minutes later to let them know that I could not make 3:00 work due an appointment I had at work and would need to have my pedicure at 2:00.  This was done via voice mail and asked them to call me back to confirm this was still available.  I did not receive a call back, and followed up with a new call to Tangles the following morning, which was the day of my appointment and I left a new voice mail message to confirm that they received my previous voice mail and please call me back.   I did not receive a call, so one would assume that they had me down for 2:00.  I took a late lunch from work, and drove over to their location on Whitney Way which is a good 20 minute drive and when I arrived, was told they had me down for 3:00 and that they were booked and could not get me at 2:00.   At this point I was very frustrated, due to the lack of not responding to my voice mail messages. The receptionist told me she was aware of my calls, but did not have the time to call me back, since they were so busy.    This took an hour of my day, and a gallon of gas to drive there, and  was not offered any  compensation for their lack of not informing me that they were now booked at 2:00, even though I told them I would call right back to confirm either 2:00 or 3:00.      This is the poorest customer service I have ever recieved by far from a salon!!   I wonder how they plan on staying in business, when they treat clients in this matter and have no regard for their time and money, ($3.80 a gallon for gas).  I understand that sometimes it is necessary to adjust an appointment, but the lack of respect for my time is over the top for me.   Also when a salon signs up to offer a Group On deal, I would assume the goal for  doing this is to try and build their business wth new clients.   If they do not have the capablity to handle new clients, then they should not be offering this type of promotion.     Not A New Client!
rationale: The sentiment of the review is negative because the customer experienced multiple frustrations and disappointments during their interaction with the salon. The lack of communication, disregard for the customer's time, and failure to address the customer's needs effectively all contributed to a poor customer service experience. Additionally, the customer felt unappreciated and undervalued, especially considering the inconvenience and cost incurred due to the salon's handling of the situation. Overall, the customer's negative sentiment is justified based on the series of unsatisfactory actions and lack of professionalism displayed by the salon.

question: Aveda salons, in my opinion, have a reputation of being soothing, presentable and tasteful.  Unfortunately, Tangles Salon lacked all three of those attributes.  I'd been to the former Tangles locations for pedicures a handful of times and decided to visit their new location when a Living Social coupon was recently offered.  I received a shellac manicure, partial highlight and conditioning treatment and based on what I spent on the Living Social coupon I am satisfied with the results, but if I had paid full price for these services I would be very dissatisfied.  \n\nThere was just something \"off\" about my entire experience at Tangles.  The salon and nail room looked messy and unorganized, as did most of the hair stylists and nail technicians.  I didn't get that \"Aveda vibe\" at all, more like the \"Cost Cutters vibe\" (nothing against CC, but if I'm paying $75 for highlights I'd like the atmosphere to match the price).  Next time I'll resist the lure of a good deal and go elsewhere.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer had high expectations based on the reputation of Aveda salons, but Tangles Salon failed to meet those expectations. The reviewer found the salon to be messy and unorganized, lacking the soothing and tasteful atmosphere usually associated with Aveda. Additionally, the reviewer felt that the services received did not justify the price paid, further contributing to their dissatisfaction with the experience. Overall, the reviewer was disappointed and felt that the salon did not live up to its potential.

question:
try their appetizer of steamed mussels and their excellent bread pudding (huge portion).  Their bread was mediocre. I couldn't remember what seafood pasta I ordered; it was satisfactory but not a surprise. 

The manager is very nice while the cook has a funny attitude. We went there craving for bread pudding at 5p right after they opened. As the waitress submitted our order to the chef, he said, "we don't serve desert at 5." Anyway, we got our sweet tooth satisfied along with some tea for an hr. 

I give 4 stars for the atmosphere and the menu selection.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer highlights the positive aspects of their dining experience, such as enjoying the appetizer of steamed mussels, the large portion of excellent bread pudding, the satisfactory seafood pasta, the nice manager, and the pleasant atmosphere and menu selection. Despite a minor issue with the bread being mediocre and a miscommunication about dessert service, the overall impression is favorable, leading to the reviewer giving a 4-star rating.

question: Delicious!! Huge portions of very authentic Italian dishes.  All entrees, salads, apps and desserts can easily be shared.  Very cozy and wonderful servers.  Can't wait to go back!
rationale: The review is positive because the user highlights the delicious and authentic Italian dishes with huge portions that can easily be shared. They also mention the cozy atmosphere and wonderful servers, expressing excitement to return in the future. These positive remarks indicate a highly satisfying dining experience, leading to an overall positive sentiment.

question:
We fell into Vin Santo on a busy Friday night before a recent marathon that the PIC was running in.  Despite the wait (45 minutes) the owner (a sweet and thoughtful English woman) made every effort to accommodate us and move us up the list, even asking other patrons if they minded waiting just a couple more minutes.  

As for the food, none of us could complain about being short-changed...especially the PIC who was carb-loading.  The plates were absolutely delicious and huge (I thoroughly enjoyed the Salsiccia Rossa--pasta with so much homemade Italian sausage that I had to take it home without noodles!).  We all walked away thinking we couldn't have picked a better spot nor gotten a better deal.

The decor was very nice and clean and the staff as mentioned previously was very helpful.  We'll definitely be back.
rationale: The review reflects a positive sentiment because the reviewer had a good experience overall at Vin Santo. Despite a short wait, the owner made efforts to accommodate them, showing thoughtfulness and customer service. The food was described as delicious and generous, particularly fitting for carb-loading before a marathon. Additionally, the ambiance was praised for being clean and the staff helpful. The reviewer expresses satisfaction and mentions a willingness to return, indicating an overall positive experience.

question:
"Ummm Good. Yummy. Tasty. What is this delicious piece? Do you wanna try this? It's good."

Those are pretty much what my bf and I said to each other during our Valentine's day dinner. No footsies or romantic hand holding but just shuffling forks with an extreme eager to try each other's plate. Vin Santo is THAT good. 

I got seafood Ravioli with pine nuts, which completely blew me away. It is by far the best Italian food I've ever had. They made their own bread: crisp and tender. Their Tiramisu will brighten up all of your taste bulbs. Appetizers and desserts are made for sharing, so be friendly to each other, less conservative and share. Go make a reservation now. You'll love this place.
rationale: The review expresses positive sentiments throughout, such as using words like "Good," "Yummy," and "Tasty" to describe the food. The reviewer also highlights the enjoyment they experienced during their Valentine's Day dinner with their boyfriend, showcasing a sense of excitement and satisfaction. The detailed descriptions of the food, including the seafood ravioli, homemade bread, and tiramisu, further demonstrate the positive experience the reviewer had at the restaurant. Additionally, the recommendation to make a reservation and the overall enthusiastic tone indicate a positive sentiment towards the dining experience.

question: I would love to rate their food, but never got the opportunity.  Happened to stop there on a Saturday evening at about 5:45p and could not even get in the door because the hostess was blocking the area with a party of four.  Instead of taking the party aside so we could enter, and I should point out I was on crutches, she had us wait outside until she could seat them.  We entered AND STEPPED ASIDE so others could enter.  There were three in a our party.  When she asked if we had reservations, I replied no,  and she commented NO?  You KNOW IT IS SATURDAY.  I wanted to say yes, yesterday was Friday and tomorrow is Sunday.  Instead I replied that I was TERRIBLY sorry i did not realize i needed a reservation, and she once again reminded me it was SATURDAY.  I had never been there and did not realize that it was a quaint, small place.  Had I known, I would certainly made a reservation.  I probably will not make a reservation and try the menu since the hostess obviously thought I did not know what day it was.  Yes, it is probably my loss, but I don't enjoy being insulted.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the customer experienced poor customer service from the hostess. The customer felt ignored, disrespected, and insulted by the hostess's behavior, which included blocking the entrance, making dismissive remarks about not having a reservation on a busy Saturday evening, and implying that the customer was ignorant. These interactions left a negative impression on the customer and made them feel unwelcome at the restaurant.

question: GET THE BREAD PUDDING!!!\n...This is a nice restaurant that is cramped and casually decorated. The food is the stand out. The front is run by one of the owners and her service is very brief as she seats you and quickly moves on to the next task. The waitresses do a great job with the specials and describing the menu. Food is delivered in an acceptable amount of time. You can see the chef and the kitchen through the window between the kitchen and the dining room which is always fun. Their red sauce has a bit of spicy heat to it. \nMy wife and I really do like this place for its great food and for its character.
rationale: The review reflects a positive sentiment because the customer is enthusiastic about the food, specifically recommending the bread pudding. They appreciate the nice restaurant atmosphere despite it being cramped and casually decorated. The efficient service and detailed menu descriptions by the waitstaff also contribute positively to their experience. The mention of seeing the chef and kitchen adds to the ambiance, and the note about the spicy red sauce further highlights the positive dining experience. Overall, the customer expresses genuine enjoyment and appreciation for both the food and the character of the restaurant.

question: I had an unbelievable experience yesterday. I went to Vin Santo hoping to order some food to go. Upon brief greeting the owner informed us that they \"don't do takeout on the weekend\". This is astonishing and something that has never happened to me before.  I am a foodie an have dined on 5 different continents, including Michelin rated restaurants. Shocked, we went to Villa Dolce where the owner was very accommodating to our take out request. The food was delicious and very reasonably priced. Your loss Vin Santo. We are never coming back.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the user had a disappointing experience at Vin Santo where they were denied takeout service on the weekend, despite being a seasoned foodie who has dined at prestigious establishments globally. This negative encounter led them to express their dissatisfaction and ultimately choose to patronize a different restaurant, Villa Dolce, who was more accommodating to their needs. The user's decision to not return to Vin Santo in the future also underscores their negative sentiment towards the establishment.

question: One of Middleton's hidden gems.  It's our favorite place to go for special occasions! Be sure to try the \"lasagna of the day\". It's always worth it.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the review highlights the restaurant as a hidden gem and a favorite spot for special occasions. The suggestion to try the "lasagna of the day" indicates that the food is consistently delicious and worth trying. Overall, the reviewer's experience seems to have been enjoyable and memorable, leading to a positive sentiment.

question: it was okay.....small place but the food was good....large portions....
rationale: The sentiment in the review is negative because the use of ellipsis and the overall brief and non-descriptive nature of the comment typically indicate lukewarm feelings or lack of enthusiasm about the experience. While the food being good and portions being large are positives, the comment "it was okay" suggests a lack of excitement or strong endorsement, leading to an overall negative sentiment.

question: Unbelievably disappointed.  I'm in town for business, and went on a week night.  They were not terribly busy, but as a solo diner, I was treated quite poorly.  Mostly ignored during my meal, I had to get up to chase someone down just for a water refill.  Not once did anyone check on my meal (I would have loved a second glass of wine), which wasn't stellar anyway.  \nI did stop and tell the woman at the front that not every diner has the luxury of being able to eat with family or friends, and that I felt my service was horrible.  Maybe it'll spare the next person eating alone and hoping for good service.\nI travel to Madison Wi frequently for work, and I can tell you that they'll not get repeat business from me.
rationale: The sentiment in the review is negative because the customer expresses disappointment and frustration with the experience they had at the restaurant. They highlight feeling poorly treated as a solo diner, being ignored during the meal, and having to chase down staff for basic service like a water refill. The lack of attention to their needs, coupled with mediocre food and no follow-up on their satisfaction, contributes to the negative sentiment expressed in the review. The customer also mentions that they won't be returning to the restaurant in the future, further emphasizing their dissatisfaction.

question: I absolutely loved this little restaurant! Its tucked away and has a very intimate atmosphere. The Italian food tastes homemade and authentic.\n\nThis is a great place for a date but not for a family.
rationale: The review expresses appreciation for the restaurant's intimate atmosphere and authentic Italian food, highlighting the positive experience the reviewer had. The use of words like "absolutely loved" and "great place for a date" indicates a strong positive sentiment towards the restaurant. The minor drawback mentioned (not suitable for a family) does not outweigh the overall positive sentiment conveyed in the review.

question:
Authentic Italian food! Our goal of the night was to have a nice Italian dinner and not feel rushed to eat. Vin Santo successfully met our goal and went beyond. Walking in to Vin Santo felt like walking into your Italian Grandmothers kitchen (in the best ways). Our server was fantastic and remained attentive to us throughout the meal. Most may find it expensive, however, for $99 two people were able to share a bottle of wine, share a desert, and we both had an entree that provided leftovers for the next day. 

CON: Too many good options and I could only order one entree.

We will definitely be going back there soon to try their other items on the menu.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is positive because the user describes their experience at Vin Santo in a highly complimentary manner. They mention that the food was authentic Italian and that the ambiance gave them the feeling of being in an Italian grandmother's kitchen, which are both positive aspects. Additionally, the user praises the excellent service provided by their server and highlights the value for money they received, as they were able to have a full dining experience for $99. The only downside mentioned was the difficulty in choosing from many good options, which is a minor complaint in the context of an overall positive review. The user also expresses their intention to return to try more items on the menu, indicating a desire for future visits, reinforcing the positive sentiment.

question: Great food great wine I would recommend we had kids went early everything was splendid
rationale: The review expresses positive sentiment by describing the food and wine as great, recommending the place, and stating that everything was splendid. Additionally, the reviewer mentioned having kids with them and that they went early, indicating that the restaurant likely catered well to families and provided a pleasant dining experience for all guests.

question:
I stopped in for a salad and glass of port in the early evening, wanting to relax before an evening of paperwork and a late supper. The salad and port were good. The hostess was pleasant. But otherwise the service was unprofessional and dispiriting, hence the two stars.

The server was middle-aged but acted as sullen as a teenager. He didn't check in at all after bringing the food, not even to top up the water. When he collected the plate, I told him, "It was wonderful"--which it had been. "Good," he chirped. When he brought the check, I thanked him and he actually responded "Yeah."

I might go back, because it's generally a nice ambience and the food was good. But not anytime soon.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer had a disappointing experience due to unprofessional and dispiriting service. The server's attitude was described as sullen and disinterested, failing to engage with the customer throughout the meal despite positive feedback given by the reviewer. Such lack of attentive and courteous service can greatly impact the overall dining experience in a negative way, leading to the low rating given by the reviewer despite the decent food and pleasant hostess.

question: The soup wasn't bad, but the guy who was serving it was really creepy and totally ruined the entire experience. Plus, they were out of my first and second choices even though they were supposed to be open for 2 more hours.
rationale: The sentiment is Negative because the customer had a disappointing experience due to the creepy behavior of the server, as well as their unavailability of the desired food choices despite the restaurant being open for more hours. These factors detracted from the overall enjoyment of the dining experience, leading to a negative review.

question: I didn't know what to expect from The Soup Factory, but I liked what I found! I visited around noon on a weekday and the place was hopping with what seemed to be a local business crowd. I ordered the Cheesy Caprese sandwich and loved it. I sampled some of the soups as well and all were good, but maybe not great. There are about 8 different varieties of soup to choose from each day, everything from different chilis to stews to bisques--you won't get bored. And a regular menu of salads and sandwiches is available. Friendly, hard-working staff.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the review highlights several aspects of The Soup Factory that the reviewer enjoyed. They liked the bustling atmosphere with a local business crowd, enjoyed the Cheesy Caprese sandwich, found the soups to be good, appreciated the variety of soup options available each day, and mentioned the friendly and hard-working staff. Overall, the reviewer's experience at The Soup Factory was positive, and they expressed satisfaction with their visit.

question: I've gone here a few times to see bands. It's alright. The bar is fairly large, and they have volleyball outside. I've never been impressed with the barstaff. Not exactly running up to greet you and get your order, and the mixed drinks are always a bit off. I've never had any of the food, but I've heard it's decent. I will go here again if there's a band I want to see(because it's only a few blocks from home), but you'll never hear me say \"Whadya say we go to the Tavern for a night of fun?!?!\"
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer has expressed several drawbacks about their experiences at the bar. They were unimpressed with the barstaff's service and the quality of the mixed drinks. The lack of enthusiasm from the staff and the subpar drinks contributed to the overall negative impression. Additionally, the reviewer did not have high expectations for the food based on word-of-mouth. Despite the convenience of the location, the reviewer does not view the bar as a place for a fun night out.

question: The wait staff were non-existent, the food was atrocious, the mixed drinks weren't drinkable, and the atmosphere was filthy. What more can I say? Ick.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the customer had an extremely unsatisfactory experience. They described the wait staff as being non-existent, indicating poor service. The food was described as atrocious, suggesting that the quality was very low. Additionally, the mixed drinks were deemed undrinkable and the atmosphere was described as filthy. Overall, the customer had multiple negative encounters, leading to a highly negative review.

question:
A quiet bar out in Middleton, it's certainly not the worst, but it ain't the greatest either.

Having now played 2 sessions of their "intermediate" volleyball leagues, I'm wishing the second one ended sooner.  They need to drag folks in, so they make you play, come hell or high water.  I've heard rumors of sand volleyball...in the snow.  Maybe I'm just bitter. cold.

The food is nothing worth writing home about.  The sandwiches are pretty standard fare and nachos are decent.  I'm a sucker for seasoned fries and they're pretty decent here, so I'll add another star.  Unfortunately, the beer isn't cheap, nor were there other obvious specials.  Look around and find somewhere else if you're out for an evening of drinking.

The TVs aren't all that great for a sports bar, which the Club Tavern tries to achieve, as far as I can tell.  There is a projector and large screen, but I haven't seen it used.They've got a couple of pool tables and dartboards as well.

The bartenders aren't terrible, it just takes some time for them to warm up to you.  After my 4th or 5th trip there (again, because of the volleyball league), they were friendly and joking around with the crew.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the review highlights several shortcomings of the bar, such as the lackluster experience in the volleyball leagues, mediocre food, expensive beer, lack of good TV setups for a sports bar, and slow warmth from the bartenders. The reviewer seems disappointed with various aspects of their visits to the bar, leading to an overall negative impression.

question:
I want to like this place - I really, really do.  But it's fairly rundown, the bar staff makes you feel as if you're ruining their day by asking for a drink, the food is average, and the bathroom conjures memories of b-list horror movie finales.  

I've spent a few afternoons here watching the game, and even while sitting at the bar and tipping well with every drink, service is lackluster at best.  I've had their breakfast and some of the lunch fare - meh, nothing spectacular by any means.

Very much "the working man's bar," and I appreciate that aspect, but I can't help but feel like I'm just a step away from getting jabbed with a broken bottle or otherwise needing a tetanus shot whenever I stop by The Club Tavern.  

Middleton has better bars - try The Midtown Pub or Paul's Neighborhood Bar for a more personable and less sketchy experience.
rationale: The sentiment of this review is negative because the reviewer expresses disappointment in multiple aspects of their experience at the Club Tavern. They mention that the venue is rundown, the bar staff is unwelcoming, the food is average, and the overall atmosphere is not inviting. The reviewer also compares the tavern unfavorably to other establishments in the area, indicating a preference for other bars that offer a more positive and personable experience. Overall, the review conveys a sense of dissatisfaction and implies that the Club Tavern falls short in various aspects, leading to a negative sentiment.

question: 745 on a Friday night with two of my buddies.   We all got the fish fry plus some deep fried shrimp.   Service was attentive, but everything seemed to go wrong.  Out of sirloin and a certain beer.   Forgot to give us the soup until after the entree arrived.  Fish was average for the price, I couldn't imagine it was made to order.  Cole saw sucked,  it was soggy lettuce smothered in warm mayonnaise.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the review mentions multiple issues that affected the dining experience, including items being out of stock, slow service in delivering the soup, average quality of the food for the price paid, and dissatisfaction with a specific dish (coleslaw). These factors contribute to an overall feeling of disappointment and frustration with the dining experience.

question: Horrendously managed. Terrible service. Very rude and the managers seem to treat their employees with no respect. The drinks a watery and the tap selection is average. Food is ok but not worth a trip over to this joint. I don't recommend.
rationale: The review highlights several negative aspects of the experience, including poor management, terrible service, rude behavior, lack of respect for employees, subpar drink quality, and average tap selection. These issues create an overall negative impression of the establishment, leading to the reviewer's recommendation against visiting the place.

question: Do not get involved in their Brewer giveaway nights! No bartender is aware of promotion or rules which are clearly printed on posters.!  Wearing Brewer gear a requirement to win tickets and jersey. Three people in the place with gear on,not one of those won!? Hmmmm.........When asked,reply was Ben won[10 seconds after game concluded..]..Of course\"Ben\" could not be found! . A fraud! Doubt anything awarded!
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer had a disappointing experience with the Brewer giveaway nights at the establishment. The lack of awareness among bartenders about the promotion, the requirement to wear Brewer gear to win but still not seeing any winners with gear on, and the suspicious circumstances surrounding the supposed winner "Ben" all contribute to the overall negative impression of the event. The reviewer perceives the situation as fraudulent and expresses doubt about the legitimacy of any awards given out.

question:
A friend proposed Club Tavern for fish fry.  None of us had ever been there.
While the food overall wasnt the WORST I've had, I wouldnt recommend eating there unless someone buys your meal for you, or youve been stranded on a desert island for 5 years and this is the first "real" meal you've had in ages.  To some, it may make you want to go back to the island...atleast food is fresh.

We arrived 10 mins after the 4 other people of our party, after 20 more minutes the waiter came back to see what we wanted to drink.  Forgot to note, for a Friday night at 7:30 the place was pretty much empty in the dining area.

I ordered a diet pepsi and the others ordered random alcoholic drinks.  My soda was flat, watery and had some kind of scum on top of it.  I thought I may be crazy, so everyone at the table tried the soda and agreed it was disgusting.  Waiter came back and I asked for a diet dew instead.  Received a diet dew that tasted a little less flat.....but now the glass had a leak in it while went everywhere.  Asked for a glass from the bar w diet pepsi.  It seemed a little less flat, but not by much.  Atleast that glass was clean.
Friend ordered the hog heaven, bloody mary with bacon infused vodka.  He said it wasnt the worst drink, but mainly tasted like greasy bacon fat, not a smokey bacon flavor.  Didnt try it myself.

After the soda ordeal, it had been 20 mins since we arrived I ordered some Moo-skis as an appetizer, which are listed as hashbrowns covered in bacon, onion, and cheese from what i remember.
20 mins after that waiter came back to take our order.  I gave him my order of all you can eat fish and asked about the appetizer.  He said "oh ya, forgot about those, theyll be right up."
5 or 6 minutes later, he came back to check our drink status, and said "Aaaaaaaaaaaaaaand.....you had moo-skis.....theyll be here soon."
5 or 6 mins later again he brought out the moo-skis.

They were hashbrowns on a small side plate with a small layer of shredded mozza on top.  Very plain and greasy tasting.  Realized there should be bacon and onion...which i found tiiiiny few far between pieces inside hash later.  For the 3 or 4 dollars, would have been better used for just plain hashbrowns at a diner for a dollar.

Finally get the all you can eat fish which had 2 pieces of pollock, beer battered fries, tartar, and coleslaw:
Fish: ok sized. breading was hard(which i like), taste ok. Not worst Ive had, but no where near good.
Fries: Were best part of the meal.
Tartar: Different, paprika or something in it for a red color.  didnt taste any dill.
Coleslaw:  Im not sure you could even call this slaw.  It was literally a small cup of mayo, with maybe 2 tiny forks of cabbage.  Im not exaggerating that it was a little liquidy...it was literally SOUP.

Ordered a 2nd piece of fish which I got 5 mins later w more tartar.

We were still eating and I ordered a 3rd piece of fish.
He came back with our checks after 10 mins.  We laughed that the forgetting of the fish was on par w our night.  2 friends paid seperate and we had 2 parties of 2.  Super simple orders, but he ended up bringing the bills up wrong 3 times so we had to continue to correct.  Had to take our payments one at a time which added another 10 mins.

Finishing up our bills........and kitchen staff brings me the last piece of fish about 30 mins after ordering it and when we were getting up.

Maybe it was a one time bad experience, but considering how dead it was on a friday night....Im guessing our experience is pretty representative of the food/wait staff which is a shame since the place really has a nice flair or feel inside it.

The best part of the experience was the upbeat classic 80s music.

We  all received buy one get one coupons upon leaving.  Not sure if it was just us or everyone gets them.

30 mins after getting home, I spent lots of time in the bathroom as it all came rushing out the bottom pipes.  I have an iron stomach and don't get messed up by much.

girlfriend edit:  Reminded me she didnt get the salad she ordered and had to ask.  Also noted her old fashioned came w cherries and olives in it, which is taboo? Supposed to be one or other?  Im a crazy WI who doesnt order many OF's, so not sure about this.
rationale: The sentiment is Negative because the review expresses disappointment and dissatisfaction with multiple aspects of the dining experience at Club Tavern. The customer encountered issues with the quality of the drinks, appetizer, and main dishes, describing them as subpar and not meeting expectations. Furthermore, service was lacking, with orders being forgotten, mistakes in billing, and a delayed final dish. The review also mentions a negative physical reaction after eating the food, contributing to an overall negative impression of the restaurant.

question:
Went to The Club this morning for Sunday brunch (which we normally do). Usually have eggs/bacon/muffin or toast but today splurged on French toast. Was VERY good - Love my French toast crispy and this totally hit the spot. We always ask for our bacon crispy, and today's was no exception. We also stopped in Wednesday for Bingo/Trivia night. I thought I was good on trivia, but Moose came up with stumpers I couldn't even find on my phone on Google - but others got them. We had burgers that night and they were great. Exactly what we ordered. Even the onion rings were hot and quite tasty.

Wait staff is a hoot - they enjoy shaking things up with different songs that all present can enjoy - who doesn't like Muppets doing Queen's "Bohemian Rhapsody"?? They're all very accommodating with tv channel change requests, please turn up/down the music, etc.

BEST NIGHT TO GO: Badger Band Concert Day in April! The Club gets a bus for Thursday night's concert and you are fed a catered dinner prior to boarding. There's way too much food and it's all really good - don't get me started on the Jambalaya! - whole thing is a great deal.

My husband and I have enjoyed The Club for years ... and will continue to.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer had a great experience at The Club for both brunch and Bingo/Trivia night. They enjoyed their French toast, crispy bacon, burgers, and onion rings, highlighting that the food was exactly what they wanted and tasty. The reviewer also commended the attentive and fun wait staff, mentioning their entertaining song choices and flexibility with requests. Additionally, they highly recommended attending the Badger Band Concert Day in April, emphasizing the delicious catered dinner and overall great value. The reviewer's long-standing enjoyment of The Club further reinforces the positive sentiment.

question: Not my favorite live music venue in town.  They pull in good local acts weekly, and the drinks are tasty and inexpensive enough, but it's a bit too loud to enjoy the performances without blowing out an eardrum.  Do stop-in to see Moose, though - he's cool.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer indicated that the live music venue is not their favorite due to being too loud to enjoy the performances without the risk of damaging their ears. While they acknowledge the good local acts and affordable drinks, the overall experience seems to be overshadowed by the excessive noise level.

question: New kitchen manager is making some great food these days! AWESOME fish fry on Friday night. Soup is outstanding and service is friendly and fast, and fun! There's also a new appetizer on the menu that is quite tasty  - spring rolls with a raspberry sauce and a cucumber/garlic pepper sauce - just outstanding! Service is friendly, too!
rationale: The sentiment in the review is Positive because the customer describes the food as great and outstanding multiple times, highlighting the quality of the dishes such as the fish fry, soup, and new appetizer. Additionally, they appreciate the friendly and fast service provided by the kitchen manager and staff, making their overall experience enjoyable and fun.

question:
I've been back to the Club a few times since my initial review; unfortunately, the experiences have been very similar.

I've sampled other food items - burgers, fish fry, and appetizers... The fish fry was perhaps the worst experience of them all... I won't elaborate, but the fish was dry, bland, and so terrible that I left a full filet behind - something I never do.

I just don't get this place. The live music is cool, but beyond that, the place is just skeevy. Sorry Moose.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer had multiple negative experiences at the Club, including a particularly disappointing one with the fish fry. They described the food as dry, bland, and terrible, to the point where they couldn't finish it, which is a strong indicator of a negative experience. Additionally, the reviewer mentioned feeling skeptical about the overall atmosphere of the place, referring to it as "skeevy." These repeated poor experiences and the overall unimpressive impression of the establishment contribute to the negative sentiment expressed in the review.

question: Great for their sand volleyball leagues and a super fun referee, but double check the schedule as the games magically seem to shift without notice. \n\nThe food is not so great and neither is the beer on tap. I've felt the repercussions of their dirty tap lines way too many times the next day after one beer or two, so stick with canned and bottled beer. Their seasoned french fries are delicious if they're served fresh and their wings are ok.
rationale: The sentiment is Negative because the review highlights several negative aspects of the experience, including unreliable scheduling, poor quality food and beer, and potential health issues from dirty tap lines. It also suggests that the only positive points are limited to the sand volleyball leagues and some specific menu items, indicating an overall dissatisfaction with the establishment.

question: Probably would have rated a 5 but our waitress could have been a little more attentive (another waitress stepped in and was great). Our fries were a little cold but the scoop of loaded potato salad was awesome!
rationale: The sentiment is Positive because despite a minor issue with the waitress not being attentive and the fries being a bit cold, the customer still had a positive experience overall. The fact that another waitress stepped in and provided great service, and that the loaded potato salad was described as awesome, indicates that the customer enjoyed their visit to the restaurant.

question:
Update - this was the fourth or fifth visit to C's over the past few years; my coworkers have a breakfast club where we frequent various places once a month or so.

The breakfast grub is straight-forward, no-nonsense, standard fare. Think: eggs, bacon, hash browns, pancakes, and skillets. Filling and satisfying. The breads remain excellent, as are the bakery items.

I've bumped it up a star from the earlier review because the service has been stellar with our past few visits. The waitstaff is friendly, attentive, and fast. We've never waited for a refill of coffee or water - they're on it right away.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer had a good experience with the service at the restaurant on their recent visits. They specifically mention that the waitstaff was friendly, attentive, and fast, providing excellent service by ensuring quick refills of coffee and water without having to wait. This positive interaction with the staff contributed to the reviewer's overall positive impression of the restaurant, leading them to rate their experience higher than before.

question:
I was actually a bit disappointed by my latest experience at C's. I've had better. Typically I would give it a 3-star but some of the service wasn't the greatest and my food was cold...

C's is the kind of family-friendly experience that makes it a 3 to 4 star restaurant on a good day, but on this particular day, our primary server was impatient and lacked a customer-first attitude and the quality of food was lacking. However, the service for a never less then half empty coffee mug, was superb. 

I do love the bakery items so couldn't resist the pecan roll, but my egg sandwich with hash browns could have been better. The hash browns were cold and the croissant was dry. The bacon however, crispy, just like I requested.

But, I was with my family, we were tucked in a cozy corner booth, had great conversation and due to the history of this restaurant and the many times I've been there before, it would be a place I would recommend. I guess the day I was there was just an "off day". That happens.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is negative because the customer expressed disappointment with their experience at C's. They mentioned that the service was not the greatest, the food was cold, and some items like the croissant were dry. They also highlighted the impatient and customer service lacking attitude of the primary server, which impacted their overall dining experience negatively. While there were some positives such as the superb service for coffee refills and the cozy atmosphere, the customer's overall impression was that their visit was below their usual standard and not deserving of a higher rating.

question: This is by far the best breakfast place in the Madison/Middleton area.  Great food and outstanding service.  Definitely has grandma's kitchen feel to it!!
rationale: The review expresses high praise for the breakfast place in the Madison/Middleton area, highlighting the great food, outstanding service, and a nostalgic grandmother's kitchen vibe. The positive sentiment is evident in the reviewer's enthusiastic language and strong endorsement of the dining experience. The mention of the pleasant atmosphere and quality of both food and service indicate a highly satisfying and enjoyable dining experience, leading to the conclusion that the sentiment is indeed positive.

question: Crappy customer service.  I was the only minority in the store the whole time (wearing Ann Taylor clothes I had previously purchased at other stores) and these biotches followed me around like I was going to steal something.
rationale: The sentiment is Negative because the user experienced discriminatory behavior and felt targeted based on their race while navigating through the store. The use of derogatory language and feeling singled out solely based on their minority status contributes to a negative customer service experience.

question: Worst service ever.
rationale: The sentiment is Negative because the review states that the service received was the "worst ever," indicating a highly unsatisfactory experience. Such extreme wording suggests that the service did not meet expectations and likely resulted in a very poor customer experience.

question: Terrible customer service. Was denied the option to return items out of return window that was easily taken back and reimbursed at an alternate location. Was not allowed to talk to a manager when requested.  Disappointed this represents the LOFTs brand.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the customer had a bad experience with the customer service at the store. They felt they were unfairly denied the option to return items, were not provided with adequate assistance, and were disappointed by the overall service they received, leading them to feel let down by the brand as a whole.

question:
First, the good stuff: the staff are really nice.

That being said, the units are ghetto. Burglars smash and grab in broad daylight. Domestically violent neighbors require police assistance in the night hours. The door locks are a joke. Snow removal seems to be done on an "at will" basis. Units haven't been renovated in decades, aside from the incidental balcony that needs to be brought up to code -- seriously, is this carpet original? The water literally takes 5min to rise in temp from frigid to lukewarm, and another 5min to rise to shower temp. All the sockets are so old and worn-out that plugs fall out under their own weight -- WTF?

It could be worse I guess. I could live next to a crack house.
rationale: The sentiment in this review is negative because the user describes multiple issues with the living conditions in the units, highlighting safety concerns like burglaries, domestic violence problems, and poor door locks. Additionally, the user mentions inadequate maintenance and outdated facilities such as old sockets and slow water heating. These factors contribute to an overall negative experience for the reviewer, leading to a negative sentiment overall.

question:
I lived here following college, and I enjoyed the laid-back atmosphere and relative peace and quiet. I believe this started to change about the time that I left, but at the time it was pretty nice. 

I had a ground floor one bedroom that looked out at the pond and the pool. I especially enjoyed sitting outside on the patios, although there was an inordinate amount of insects in the summer. There was always a decent amount of parking, but it seemed that there were many cars that were virtually abandoned in the parking lot. The office staff were pretty laid back, but I never had anything wrong so I can't rate that aspect.

I've had a couple of friends and acquaintances that had lived there after I had left, and they've consistently panned the place.  It has also been in the news from time to time due to shootings, stabbings and other assorted crime.  It's really too bad, since they have a decent location and grounds, and with some upkeep it could be a low-cost option in Middleton.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is Negative primarily because of the deteriorating situation of the place over time. The reviewer mentions that the atmosphere started to change for the worse after they left, alluding to potential issues that arose subsequently. Additionally, the presence of a high number of abandoned cars in the parking lot, along with reports of crime such as shootings and stabbings, contribute to an unsafe and undesirable living environment. These factors collectively indicate a decline in the overall appeal and quality of the place, leading to the Negative sentiment expressed in the review.

question:
My rating used to be four stars, yes that's four stars. I wouldn't even give this ONE star now.

Living here has turned out to be a complete nightmare. They are not military friendly at all, they claim to be. We are in TX on orders, they assured us they would renew our lease over and over including several times in September, October, November and December when we inquired about terminating our lease for military orders. We were repeatedly reassured that it would not be an issue to renew in April (while we would still be gone). However, in February, after swindling us for 7 months of extra rent, they informed us they would not be renewing our lease. Fine, their prerogative in the end (although I was BEYOND ticked over this). Now they have been giving "notices" to enter our apartment while we're gone even though every single person in their office is full aware that we're in TX and they can't be bothered to send an email to actually make 24 hours notice. 

Carla in the front office is great and Mike who heads up maintenance is a saint, but otherwise, the staff here is AWFUL, the walls are thin, the rules are not enforced for quiet time, smoking policy or anything else listed in the lease except when they want to harass you and take advantage. 

I would hope that any decent person is able to stay clear of this apartment complex!
rationale: The sentiment in the review is negative due to the numerous issues experienced by the reviewer while living in the apartment complex. The inadequate communication and broken promises regarding the lease renewal, along with the intrusion of privacy with unauthorized entry into the apartment, demonstrate a lack of respect for the tenant's rights. Additionally, the fact that rules are not consistently enforced adds to the negative experience described. Overall, the reviewer expresses dissatisfaction with the management and living conditions, leading to a negative sentiment towards the apartment complex.

question: The Bruce Company is very, very expensive.  That being said, the quality of their plants is exceptional.  The customer service is hit-or-miss.  I went looking for a new gas grill today.  They have a great selection, however no one wanted to help me.  There were several employee wandering about.  I tried for about 10 minutes to get someone to help me - no luck.   I absolutely refuse to beg retailers to let me spend money at their establishments.  I left and went to Ace Hardware on University Avenue.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the customer had a frustrating experience at The Bruce Company due to poor customer service despite acknowledging the exceptional quality of their plants. The customer was unable to get assistance in finding a gas grill despite a great selection available, leading to a feeling of being ignored and unimportant as a customer. This lack of attention and assistance ultimately caused the customer to leave the store in frustration and seek out a competitor instead.

question: They no longer have a flower shop.  I went in looking for a BIG \"vase\" to hold a big bunch of flowers.  After poking around for a couple minutes I asked an employee for such.  He walked me over to another woman who repeated my request a couple times (a vase?  a VASE?).  Ok, wft woman, I have a bunch of flowers for my dad's memorial service, I've got 10 minutes to find something to put them in before I shove them up your a$$.  Yes, I was a little stressed.  She went in to this long thing about how they didn't have a flower shop any more and they might have a few in the back but they weren't priced to sell.  I interrupted her and said, \"So the answer is no?\"  I asked twice.  She wouldn't give me an answer.  I started walking out.  There were a bunch of, forgive me, \"Hurricane glasses\" which would suit my needs just marvy.  I picked one up and started looking around for something better.  Bitch woman saw me and said, \"Oh, well, we DO have CANDLEHOLDERS\".  Didn't offer to help me anymore.  I made a point of picking up just about every single one I could find.  Apparently, \"vase\" is a technical term reserved for something very special.\nAnyway, I bought something and ended up returning it the next day because the same thing at Cost Plus was $9 rather than $27.\nPoor service, high prices, crappy selection.  Fail.
rationale: The sentiment of this review is negative because the customer had a frustrating and unhelpful experience at the store. They were in a time-sensitive situation looking for a specific item for a memorial service, but the employees were unresponsive and unaccommodating. The customer felt ignored, misled, and ultimately found the prices to be unreasonably high compared to elsewhere. Overall, the lack of assistance, high prices, and poor selection mentioned in the review contribute to the negative sentiment expressed by the customer.

question:
This garden center has several sections-a bunch of high-end garden decor, etc. (I just walk right past that stuff), an outdoor section with landscaping plants, etc. (I have also never looked at that), houseplants and pots (they seem to have a decent selection from cheap plastic to expensive pottery) and a gardening section with seeds, tools, fertilizers, etc (this is the part I frequent and what I based my star rating on). 

Gardening section:  
a good selection of garden seeds from a variety of suppliers including Seed Savers Exchange, Renee's garden seeds and similar companies-a good place to shop for seeds if you are looking for something a little more unusual although they are a little more expensive (they often discount the leftovers in the late fall/early winter and I pick up some seeds for the next year while getting my bulbs). 
They have several brands of organic fertilizers and similar products-again, a little more expensive than other places but they have some selection. 
Some nice garden tools and doodads-a nice place to find a special gift for a gardening friend.

It seems several other reviewers had trouble with the customer service here. I have not had such problems-everyone has been nice and friendly when I went to check out. However, I can't remember anyone ever asking me if I needed any help while I was shopping-I did not need any help so that didn't bother me but perhaps if you are the type that needs a lot of assistance, this isn't the place for you.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is positive because the reviewer highlights the positive aspects of the garden center's gardening section, such as the good selection of seeds from various suppliers, availability of organic fertilizers and tools, and the potential for finding unique gifts for gardening friends. Additionally, the reviewer mentions their positive interactions with the staff at the garden center, noting that everyone has been nice and friendly. Despite the lack of proactive assistance from the staff, the reviewer did not view it as a negative experience because they did not require help while shopping. Overall, the reviewer's experience with the gardening section and customer service at the garden center was satisfactory, leading to a positive sentiment in the review.

question: I ordered three trees to planted by the Bruce company early summer.  I was told they wouldn't be able to get to it until early September.  What?, well, ok I'll wait because they have nice nursery stock.   I called mid September when they still hadn't planted the trees and I was given a date of Sept. 25.  Not to my surprise, no one showed.  I called and they said everything was delayed due to the rain.  It hadn't rained for weeks, but they would be there next Tuesday.  Tuesday has come and gone and no trees.  I called and cancelled my tree order and asked for my 50% , $500 deposit back.  It is now too late for trees to be planted and established by winter.  I am waiting to hear back from them.  I will give an update later on as to whether I get my deposit back!  I have had trouble in the past with them not showing up for a job..no call ..nothing.  I should have learned my lesson then!
rationale: The sentiment in the review is negative because the customer experienced multiple instances of poor communication and unfulfilled promises from the Bruce company. The company repeatedly failed to meet set deadlines, provided inconsistent reasons for delays, and ultimately left the customer with unresolved issues regarding their tree order. The lack of accountability and prior negative experiences with the company contribute to an overall negative sentiment towards their services.

question: I have been a long term customer at The Bruce Company. I always had a more than positive experience. However, the Customer Service I received this past Spring was inexcusable. I did receive a call from the General Manager after I complained, and I  did except his apology.  However, the experience was very negative and I will no longer shop there.
rationale: The sentiment is Negative because the customer highlights a specific negative experience with the customer service at The Bruce Company, describing it as inexcusable. Although the General Manager apologized, the customer's overall experience was very negative, leading them to decide to no longer shop at the company. This negative experience outweighed any previous positive experiences they had as a long-term customer.

question: 1)  The customer service at this store is terrible.  The employees are rude, particularly Scott who works in the plant section.   \n2)  The plants this past summer were infested.  I had to return two mandevillas because of aphids, and Bruce gave me a hard time about refunding me.  Last straw:  the $50 rubber plant I purchased in August came home with some time of mite infestation, I was able to treat the plant successfully, but recently noticed that the plant was ailing.  Upon close inspection, I noticed it was full of aphids.  Disgusting.  I am fortunate that my other plants, which came from different nurseries, were not infected.  Rubber plant went in garbage, and I will never waste another dollar at Bruce Company again.
rationale: The sentiment in the review is negative because the customer experienced multiple issues with the store. From encountering rude employees, dealing with infested plants, facing difficulty with refunds, and ultimately having to dispose of a pricey plant due to repeated infestations, the customer's overall experience was disappointing and frustrating. The lack of quality control, poor customer service, and the hassle of dealing with infested plants all contribute to the negative sentiment expressed in the review.

question: I am new to the Madison area and a avid gardener some friends told me to check out this store for seeds. I found there selection very good they carry the whole selection from seed savers and a good amount from baker creek as well as a number of others. the customer service was wonderful a clerk named Alyssa helped me with my selections of seeds and an orchid. I did look around it looked like they were doing some remodeling. prices were average for a garden center except for the furniture which looked of high quality but not cheap. the check out was fast and the clerk wrapped up my orchid so it would not be affected by the cold not something you would get at home depot when I bought one there.I will go back when its warmer to check out their plants since I want to start landscaping my new lawn.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the user expresses satisfaction with their experience at the store. They found a good selection of seeds, received wonderful customer service from a clerk named Alyssa, and appreciated the extra care taken in wrapping up their orchid to protect it from the cold. The user also mentions their intention to return to the store in the future, indicating that they were pleased with the overall experience and are looking forward to exploring more offerings.

question: Jackie sewed my rather complicated and silly wedding dress and did quite a job with it.  It took 5 fittings and a lot of patience.  She excelled at being cautious with my mother, honest, and quite capable.  If only she was not located in Middleton I'd be taking her a lot more business in the future.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the review highlights several positive aspects of Jackie's work. The reviewer acknowledges that Jackie did a great job with a complicated wedding dress, showed patience during the process, was cautious with the reviewer's mother, and was honest and capable. Despite the inconvenience of Jackie's location, the reviewer expresses a desire to give her more business in the future, indicating overall satisfaction with the service provided.

question: I had good experiences with Jackie at Patches and Pieces. I have taken in both my wedding gown and a bridesmaid dress. On the wedding gown, the only thing I needed was a bustle put in and that only ended up being one loop so it was very simple. However, she showed me different options and offered her advice and suggestions. The bridesmaid dress needed to be taken in on the sides and again I think she had good advice and offered her thoughts to make it more fitted while still allowing me to move. I think Jackie has good knowledge and does an excellent job, she is personable and she has great prices. I never feel like I am being taken advantage of like at bridal salons that do tailoring. I would definitely recommend Patches and Pieces.\n\nMy only negative about the service is that both times I had to call her to find out when my pieces would be finished. I brought them both in well in advance, so I know she ther more pressing pieces. However, both times I called well after the date she told me they would be done and then she would tell me they would be done by the end of the week (they always were). This was fine for me since they were not rushes and she asked when the events were, so she knew they didn't need to be done right away. It's just something to keep in mind that you may need to call about your pieces if the are taking longer then promised.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is positive because the reviewer had good experiences with Jackie at Patches and Pieces. They appreciated Jackie's knowledge, advice, and suggestions provided during the alterations of their wedding gown and bridesmaid dress. The reviewer also praised Jackie's excellent work, personable nature, and reasonable prices. Though there was a minor inconvenience of having to call to follow up on the completion of their pieces, it didn't significantly detract from their overall positive experience. This review highlights Jackie's professionalism, expertise, and customer-centric approach, making it clear why the sentiment is positive.

question: I went on a tour of several breweries last summer and Capital Brewery was one of my favorites. The tour guide was EXTREMELY annoying (very, very peppy) but the tour was still pretty interesting. The best part was the end. The brewery makes several excellent beers (they were rated as the #1 brewery in the US by someone, sometime). I had never been there before but we stuck around after the tasting and ended up right in the middle of an enormous party! Apparently all of Middleton comes out on Friday night after work to relax and have a good time. They don't serve food but several people brought in picnic baskets and I saw a few grills around. Fun place to hang out with friends, I'll be back sometime.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the user had an overall enjoyable experience at Capital Brewery despite encountering an annoying tour guide. They found the tour interesting, enjoyed the beer selection, and had a fun time at the impromptu party. The user expressed a desire to return, indicating that they had a good time and viewed the brewery as a fun place to hang out with friends.

question: My parents live very close to the brewery/beer garden and it is so much fun to hang out there in the summer.  The garden often hosts events and fundraisers.  Sometimes there is a band or live karaoke!!  There is a neat stage and tons of picnic tables.  The brewery has a sitting area inside where the tour ends.  The tour is a good time as well!  The only downside is the lack of parking.  They have a small lot but we usually have to park on the street.\n\nI wish this beer garden was located in warmer weather so I could enjoy it all year long!
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer describes the brewery/beer garden as a fun and entertaining place to hang out in the summer. They highlight the events, fundraisers, live music, and karaoke that add to the enjoyment of the venue. The positive aspects mentioned, such as the neat stage, picnic tables, fun tours, and sitting areas, contribute to a lively and engaging atmosphere. Although there is a downside mentioned about the lack of parking, overall, the reviewer expresses a wish for the beer garden to be open year-round, implying a desire to continue enjoying the positive experiences there.

question: The beer garden rules.  Great place to spend a summer evening with friends.  I wished they served their own food, but its good that you can order from nearby pizza places etc.  It goes without saying that they've got great beer.
rationale: The review describes the beer garden as a great place to spend a summer evening with friends, highlighting the enjoyable atmosphere. The mention of being able to order food from nearby places, even though the beer garden itself doesn't serve food, suggests flexibility and a convenient dining option. Additionally, the statement about having great beer further contributes to the positive sentiment expressed in the review.

question: Showed up for a tour, but they had already finished for the day. Still one of the guys took us on a private tour. Started off with a free beer, had the Octoberfest. Very good beer. The guy was very informative and showed us the whole place. Answered some questions we had about beer also.
rationale: The sentiment is Positive because even though the tour was initially missed due to it being already finished for the day, one of the employees went out of their way to accommodate the visitors by providing a private tour. Additionally, starting the tour with a free beer and offering informative insights about the brewery created a positive and enjoyable experience for the visitors. The visitors seemed to appreciate the staff member's effort and knowledge, which contributed to the overall positive sentiment of the review.

question: Came here on a tour with a big group from meetup.  The tour guide was nice, and did his best to keep the group entertained and under control.  $5 for a tour, with a good amount of samples and a free glass.  If you're looking for something fun to do, I'd recommend it.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer mentions the tour guide being nice and making an effort to keep the group entertained, as well as the affordable price for the tour, which included samples and a free glass. Additionally, the reviewer recommends the activity to others looking for something enjoyable to do, indicating an overall positive experience.

question:
Went for a tour of the brewery.

The tour guide was great, the brews were incredibly fresh and tasty, and we overall had the best experience of being a tourist in Madison, WI here.

The beer garden aspect is tempting for a possible future return, but we'll see. Look out for a potential future review, Yelpers!
rationale: The review describes a positive experience during a brewery tour in Madison, WI. The reviewer compliments the tour guide and praises the fresh and tasty brews. Additionally, they highlight that they had the best tourist experience in Madison at this brewery. The mention of possibly returning to explore the beer garden shows enthusiasm and satisfaction. Overall, the reviewer's comments indicate a positive sentiment towards the brewery tour.

question: Get out!\n(No seriously... get out.)\nNothing beats a brew in one of Madison's best beer gardens. With a shady roof overhead (love that newer addition) and tables for you and an army of your friends, this is quickly becoming my fave locale for keeping hydrated.
rationale: The sentiment in the review is positive because the reviewer expresses their enjoyment of the beer garden in Madison, calling it their favorite spot for staying hydrated. They appreciate the shady roof, spacious tables, and the opportunity to gather with friends, indicating a sense of satisfaction and pleasure with their experience at this location. The use of phrases like "quickly becoming my fave locale" and "nothing beats a brew" further emphasize the enthusiastic tone of the review, highlighting the overall positive sentiment.

question:
Love the outdoor area here. They have a good selection of beer and a giant outdoor bar area. They also have a great tasting room inside for when it's cold or rainy. 

The brewery tour is short but interesting (it's not a huge place after all). Their beers are decent, not the best in town, though. They offer seasonals and new brews on occasion.

As far as beer is concerned, there's much better out there in Madison. The outdoor space, however, is great.
rationale: The sentiment is considered positive because the review highlights several positive aspects of the brewery, such as the great outdoor area, good beer selection, and interesting brewery tour. Even though the reviewer mentions that there are better beers to be found in Madison, they still appreciate the enjoyable outdoor space the brewery provides. Overall, the positive aspects outweigh the negatives in the reviewer's perspective.

question: Went for the tour and drinking on a summer Saturday. Pretty nice little Saturday! Tour is $5 and they just take you through the warehouse and some of the brewing area. It isn't anything overly special. If you've been on other brewery tours before it is a pretty standard one.\n\nBeer I great though. With the $5 tour you get a small tasting glass and three different tastings. They have the staples along with more seasonal and experimental type brews. Pretty reasonable prices too if you want beers/pitchers also (which you will). Pitchers are generally around $11.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer had a good overall experience. They enjoyed their Saturday visiting the brewery, found the beer selection great, and appreciated the reasonable prices for both the tour and for purchasing beers or pitchers. Even though they mentioned that the tour was standard and not overly special, their positive comments about the beer quality, variety, and affordability indicate that they had a pleasant and enjoyable time at the brewery.

question:
Capital is my go to Friday night spot!

I love visiting Capital Brewery anytime of year. The beer garden is a great place to enjoy a cold brew, sunshine and live music in the summer time. In the winter the bier stube is cozy and fun.

The staff is awesome and the beer is delicious. Plus you can bring your own snacks!
rationale: The sentiment of the review is positive because the customer expresses love for visiting Capital Brewery at any time of the year, highlighting the enjoyable experiences in both the summer beer garden and the cozy winter bier stube. The customer praises the staff as awesome, the beer as delicious, and appreciates the ability to bring their own snacks, overall conveying a sense of satisfaction and enjoyment with their experiences at the brewery.

question: The bier garden was great since the weather was perfect in Madison while I was there. The taster flights were served in plastic cups (I hate plastic cups). I tried all the beers (13 total) and only two really stood out, the others were eh. Ghost Ship White IPA and Capsized Imperial IPA. \n\nRating is really 2.5 and based upon the beers sampled. Lots of options but not that great. If I could bring my own beer to the garden, it would be awesome.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer had high expectations for the bier garden but was disappointed by the quality of the beers served. Despite the perfect weather and variety of options, the plastic cups and lackluster beers led to a less enjoyable experience. The fact that only two out of the 13 beers stood out as being good while the others were considered average or below-average greatly affected the overall rating. Additionally, the reviewer mentions that being able to bring their own beer would have made the experience better, indicating a level of dissatisfaction with the offerings at the bier garden.

question: We keep coming here and having a great time!  Always great beer and good live music.  The library fundraiser on Father's Day was a hit with the kids.  I even met Bo Ryan!
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer mentions repeatedly having a great time at the establishment, enjoying the great beer and good live music. Additionally, the successful library fundraiser on Father's Day and meeting Bo Ryan add to the positive experience. Overall, the reviewer has had multiple enjoyable and memorable experiences at the location, emphasizing a positive sentiment.

question: First off - where I'm from, brewery tours are free and there isn't a limit of beers that you can try. I found it odd that the brewery had 8 or so beers on tap but I could only try 4 with my $7 paid admission. The bartender was super sweet and allowed me to charge my phone and even gave me an extra taste of a beer. The amber is delicious!!
rationale: The sentiment is positive because despite a minor disappointment about the limit of beer tastings, the reviewer appreciated the kind gesture of the bartender allowing them to charge their phone and providing an extra taste of beer. The positive experience with the bartender and the compliment on the delicious amber beer contribute to an overall positive impression of the brewery visit.

question: Great service behind the bar, and a really informative tour. The beer garden wasn't open this time of year, but still had a great visit and tried some pretty solid brews.
rationale: The review mentions positive aspects of the experience, such as great service, informative tour, and trying solid brews. While the beer garden not being open could be seen as a downside, the overall tone of the review is positive, indicating that the visitor still had a great visit despite this minor inconvenience. This overall positive experience is reflected in the reviewer's feedback.

question: Our tour guide was the worst tour guide I've ever had. I've been on many brewery tours and grains do not get their flavor from being in honey or dipped in chocolate. Many of us realized she was completely clueless. The number of uhs, ums, and ahs overwhelmed me. At least 21 in one room of the tour. I had to stop counting for my own sanity. By the end, most people had stopped listening or began to have their own conversation. It's unfortunate for a place to lose customers due to their tour especially when they have good beer. I'd love my money back but I doubt I'd get it.
rationale: The sentiment is Negative because the review conveys disappointment and frustration with the tour guide's lack of knowledge and presentation skills. The reviewer found the guide to be clueless about the content of the tour, leading to a disengaging experience with excessive use of filler words. The lack of professionalism caused the reviewer and other participants to lose interest and feel like their money was wasted, tarnishing the overall experience despite the good beer offered by the brewery.

question: One of the best bakeries in town! Try the German Cholate cake for a real treat.
rationale: The review indicates that the bakery is one of the best in town, highlighting a high level of quality and satisfaction. Additionally, the recommendation to try the German Chocolate cake implies that it is a delicious treat, further emphasizing the positive sentiment. Overall, the review conveys a positive experience and recommendation for others to visit the bakery.

question: Delicious donuts. Especially the ones with caramel frosting. I would stay away from the \"elephant ears\". They look better than they taste.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the review highlights the deliciousness of the donuts, especially those with caramel frosting. Despite cautioning against the "elephant ears," the overall tone is positive as the reviewer enjoyed the donuts with caramel frosting.

question: A little pricey for what you get.  I got 3 dozen donuts, and it was $40!  Yikes!  Maybe they deserve 2.5 stars.\n\nI do like the NAME of the place, of course.
rationale: The sentiment is Negative because the review states that the price of the donuts was considered high for what was received. The exclamation "Yikes!" also indicates disappointment. Additionally, the reviewer only awarded 2.5 stars, suggesting that they were unimpressed with the overall value of their purchase.

question: I recently had a birthday and as part of the celebration my partner ordered a cake from Scot's. The cake was beautifully decorated and tasted delicious. I would highly recommend them for any of your dessert needs! I should also mention we split a cookie and it was fantastic as well!
rationale: The sentiment in the review is positive because the user had a good experience with Scot's bakery for their birthday celebration. They described the cake as beautifully decorated and delicious, highly recommending Scot's for dessert needs. Additionally, the user enjoyed a cookie from the bakery, which they found fantastic. Overall, the review highlights satisfaction with both the quality of the products and the overall experience at Scot's, resulting in a positive sentiment.

question:
I spent the better part of seven years of my life as an automotive technician at a fairly large (20+ techs) dealership, and as such fully and completely appreciate the expertise, knowledge, and service that a dealership provides.

Whenever possible, I purchase parts and services from local dealerships.  Yes, I could save a ton of money on parts by buying items online, but as mentioned, I respect dealerships and understand the benefits of supporting local businesses.  

That said, this particular VW dealership (the Zimbrick on Century Avenue is only a VW dealer, BTW - no Acura any longer at this location) shocked me with their inability to comprehend a simple request for oil, an oil filter, and a fuel filter.

I called to check the price and availability for some common, everyday maintenance items for my VW Jetta.  My Jetta has the 1.9L BRM Diesel motor ("PD" style), and as such has some unique requirements as identified by Volkswagen, specifically when it comes to oil.  VW mandates that you use their 505.01 approved oil in the BRM diesel motor.  Failure to do so may result in a voided or compromised warranty.

So imagine my shock when the parts guy told me to use "any old oil" while on the phone.  When I tried to correct him and request the 505.01 Castrol VW oil, he seemed to get a bit unnerved.

I then asked about a fuel filter, and despite having told him the make, model, year, and engine type of my VW on three separate occasions, he still misquoted my filter.  I then gave him my VIN, and he was still confused.  A few minutes later, he quoted me the correct filter, but at a price that was easily 2x higher than what I would pay from any other online VW parts dealer.

So, I declined to purchase anything from this local resource, and will now have to shop online with an out-of-the-area dealership.  I'm sorry, but my confidence was shaken immediately, and I was floored by the sky high price (they quoted $60 for the filter; everyone else is $25).
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the customer had a disappointing experience with the VW dealership on Century Avenue. Despite the customer's clear request for specific VW-approved products due to unique requirements for their VW Jetta, the parts guy demonstrated a lack of understanding and provided incorrect information.
