The reviewer's enthusiasm and satisfaction with these features contribute to an overall positive sentiment towards the place, despite the initial apprehension about the location and machine quality.

question: Standard family diner. Nothing surprising here. A decent place to stop for breakfast.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the review describes the diner as standard with nothing surprising, indicating a lack of distinguishing qualities or standout features. Additionally, while it is mentioned as a decent place for breakfast, the overall tone is neutral and does not convey enthusiasm or endorsement.

question:
Oh. My. God.

One would think that any restaurant in America's Dairyland, especially a chain restaurant that has been around for decades, could serve breakfast without screwing it up.

Our family of three ordered breakfast for dinner tonight and this Perkins disappointed the heck out of us.

One order was steak and eggs: the steak was supposed to be medium and the eggs over hard. What came to the table was a bloody, raw steak -- not rare, mind you, but raw -- and eggs with a translucent, inedible crust around the outer edge.

Some of that crust ended up in one of the other orders, which was scrambled eggs with biscuits and gravy. One does not expect the possibility of breaking a tooth when eating scrambled eggs, but not one, not two, but three two-inch long pieces of that translucent crust ended up in the folded, dry "scrambled eggs."

Another order of scrambled eggs -- mine -- had a long, thin, hair-like thread of indeterminate origin. Was it the same substance as the translucent crust? Was it a string from a hairnet? Was it a human hair? When I pulled it from my mouth, it split in two and curled up like elastic might curl up.

Our server was appropriately apologetic and tried to make things okay -- the service was good, but the food was absolutely horrid!

The manager asked us how our dinner was when we went to pay, so we told her. She took 20% off of our bill but, truly, the food we ate was overpriced at any discount. If we all hadn't been so darn hungry and tired, we'd have left without eating. And if I had it to do over, I would have insisted we all leave after finding the inedible translucent hard gluey stuff in the eggs and find somewhere else to go.

Do NOT repeat our mistake. AVOID this restaurant. Try the IHOP down the road if you want breakfast. Go across the interstate to Texas Roadhouse if you want a steak. Go hungry if you must, just don't eat here. Please.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the review highlights multiple issues with the food served at the restaurant. The customer received undercooked steak, eggs with inedible crust, and a hair-like thread in their food. The quality of the food was described as horrid and overpriced, leading the reviewer to advise others to avoid the restaurant. Despite good service from the server, the overall experience was extremely disappointing due to the poor quality of the food.

question: Was staying at the comfort inn next to Perkins and the clerk told me they gave 10% off for guests. I figure I'd get a late night burger and I wasn't disappointed. I called and ordered. It was coming off the grill in the time it took me to walk over. Burger was good and staff was friendly.
rationale: The review mentions that the guest received a discount at the hotel and enjoyed a delicious burger at Perkins during their stay. The fact that the burger was served quickly and tasted good, coupled with the friendly staff, suggests a positive experience overall. The positive feedback on both the food quality and the customer service contributes to the positive sentiment expressed in the review.

question: This is so below average. The restaurant decor is out dated and worn out.  Poor service below average breakfast and how do you even screw up breakfast. Manager asked how was everything I said \"just ok\"he said ok did not inquire. Food did not have quality flavor it was very bland.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the user provided several specific reasons for their dissatisfaction with the restaurant experience. They mentioned issues such as outdated decor, poor service, below-average breakfast quality, lack of flavor in the food, and an unresponsive manager. These factors collectively contribute to an overall negative perception of the restaurant.

question: Well, The pie is good. The coffee is good. The restroom was gross. But they did have lots of parking. My breakfast was 75% correct. As the Yelp 2 Star rating says: Meh. I've experienced better.
rationale: The sentiment is Negative because the customer's review expresses dissatisfaction with the overall experience. Despite the positive aspects of the pie and coffee, the negative points about the gross restroom, incorrect breakfast order, and mediocre rating suggest a largely disappointing visit. The use of words like "meh" and "experienced better" indicate a lackluster and unsatisfactory experience, leading to an overall negative sentiment towards the establishment.

question: Was not feeling well yesterday so I ordered some food online for delivery from Chang Jiang.  Originally I though I had enough cash to pay for the order but realized as I was finishing my online order I'd have to pay by credit card.  I took the $23 and threw on the table next to the door so I could tip in cash. When the guy delivered,BTW he was in my neighbors driveway about 2 feet into his lawn, I grabbed what I though was a $3 tip.  Woke up this morning and realized that I had given him $23 instead of 3.  I forgot to remove the $20 bill when I handed him the cash. I didn't look at it, like I said, I was sick.  I called this morning to and began the conversation with him like this \" Hi, you delivered food to me yesterday on ____ St. and I think I may have mistakenly given you too much for the tip.  He started yelling in to the phone that I gave him a $3 tip not a $23 dollar tip.  He was ranting and raving.  The weird part is that I had not even said the amount I though I had mistakingly tipped him. I was talking calmly and he was ranting that I also had stolen his pen from him(a 20 cent pen!)  \nWhy would someone react like that to a simple inquiry??I was not accusatory, I was simply inquiring.  And then for him to say he wanted to come over and pick up the pen I had taken from him? WTF?  \nEver heard of Karma dude?
rationale: The sentiment in the review is negative because the customer had a bad experience with the delivery driver from Chang Jiang. The customer mistakenly gave a $23 tip instead of $3 due to their illness and forgetfulness. When the customer politely called to inquire about the mistake, the delivery driver reacted angrily and accused the customer of stealing his pen. The customer was surprised by the aggressive and irrational response from the driver, leading to a negative experience and questioning why someone would react that way to a simple inquiry.

question:
My wife and I have been talking about checking this place out for years but since we live out of town it's not that easy to just stop in.

Finally we have a chance to check it out last night.... and they're closed for inventory. Judging by the FedEx notices on the door, it's been closed for 3 days. No other info other than a note that says "Sorry FedEx :(" and a cardboard cutout of a scantily clad woman in the glass doorway that's meant to obscure your view of the inside.

Maybe one of these days we'll see what it looks like on the inside... if it's not still closed for inventory.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer had been looking forward to visiting the place for years, made the effort to finally go there, only to find it closed without any prior notice or explanation. The disappointment of the closure, the lack of information, and the odd presence of a cardboard cutout instead of a proper notification would understandably result in a negative overall experience for the reviewer.

question: Ah, Red Letter. I heard they got rid of their jerk off booth. Which maybe helps their case of being less skeevy. I'm not really against jerk off booths, but I have heard some crazy stories about this particular one. It didn't seem well monitored. I really hate the selection here and the prices are higher than other's. They seemed to have more fetish stuff than Selective though. So I guess there's that. Overall I'd suggest staying away, Red Letter has a bad rep for a reason.
rationale: The sentiment is Negative because the review highlights several concerning aspects of the Red Letter store, such as the removal of a potentially unsavory feature (jerk off booth), inadequate monitoring, limited selection, high prices compared to competitors, and a reputation for being sketchy. These factors contribute to an overall sense of discomfort and dissatisfaction with the store, ultimately leading to a negative recommendation to stay away from Red Letter.

question: I've been to cracker barrel twice. The food was ok, I agree with Thomas that the food can be bland. Warning-if its busy don't expect to be able to carry on a conversation very easily. Can be really loud
rationale: The sentiment is Negative because the reviewer mentioned that the food was "ok" and agreed that it can be bland, indicating a lackluster experience with the food. Additionally, the warning about it being difficult to carry on a conversation due to the noise level suggests an unpleasant dining environment, contributing to an overall negative experience.

question: It had been quite a while since we ate at a Cracker Barrel. We stopped there when shopping at East Towne Mall. I ordered the pot roast and my husband ordered chicken and dumplilngs. Yuck! It had more salt than you'd find in food at McDonalds. The meat in the pot roast tasted processed. The dumplings were slimy. The vegetables were so salty, they were inedible. Pros: The shop is very cute. Cons: Don't eat the food.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer had a disappointing dining experience at Cracker Barrel. They found the food overly salty, processed, and unappetizing. The specific criticisms about the pot roast, chicken and dumplings, and vegetables being inedible due to excessive saltiness highlight the overall poor quality of the meal. Despite acknowledging the cute shop as a pro, the negative aspects of the food heavily outweigh any positive factors, leading to an overall negative sentiment.

question: I nicknamed my \"lunch special\" the \"recession plate,\" as my portion was significantly smaller than my table mates. The food was okay, just kind of fatty. The corn muffins had so much butter it was nauseating - and i love butter. \n\nThe only thing that saved this place was the chocolate bar i purchased in the store area. That shit was good.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer described feeling disappointed with the portion size of their meal compared to others at their table. They also commented on the food being fatty and the corn muffins being overly buttered to the point of being nauseating. Although the reviewer found the chocolate bar they purchased enjoyable, the overall experience at the restaurant was underwhelming and unhappy.

question: Not sure if I'm not used to the type of food they serve here,  but it's never been good.  Last time I ordered french toast.  Got 4 slices of soggy french toast. The egg wasn't even cooked on it! Potatoes and grits were very bland. But I love the golf tee game!
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the user expressed dissatisfaction with the quality of the food served at the restaurant. They mentioned that the french toast was soggy and undercooked, and the potatoes and grits were bland. These aspects of the meal did not meet the user's expectations, leading to a negative experience overall.

question:
Food was horrible. Service was mediocre. Atmosphere was alright. 

My boyfriend dragged me here since we were on the road and needed some food to get us through the long trip. You enter into a little country store that was cute but over priced. Then we went into the restaurant part. Service was super slow even though half the tables were empty. Took forever to get water. 

Our food took about 45 min and tasted like crap. I got bbq chicken with broccoli and a sweet potato. The chicken was lacking in flavor and moisture. The sweet potato was more like a cup of brown sugar with a bit of potato. Disgusting. The broccoli was good at least and the only thing I actually ate.

I won't be going back. No matter how stranded and hungry we are.
rationale: The sentiment is Negative because the user had a negative experience with both the food and the service. They felt the food was horrible, describing the chicken as lacking in flavor and moisture, the sweet potato as too sweet, and only found the broccoli palatable. Additionally, the user noted that the service was slow despite the restaurant not being busy. This overall negative experience led the user to conclude that they would not return to the restaurant in the future.

question: Generally substantially slower and noticeably more expensive than badger cab.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the review highlights that the service is both slower and more expensive compared to a competitor, Badger Cab. Customers generally expect a service to be efficient and cost-effective, so being slower and more expensive would likely result in dissatisfaction and a negative experience for the user.

question: Not always reliable.  Long wait times.  Friendly cab drivers.
rationale: The sentiment is Negative because the review mentions that the service is not always reliable, indicating inconsistency in their service. Additionally, the long wait times suggest poor efficiency and inconvenience for customers. Although the cab drivers are friendly, the overall negative aspects of unreliable service and long wait times outweigh this positive aspect.

question:
having taken my share of cabs as an adult, i've happily settled on union as a first choice.

i've always hopped into a well-kept, clean, stink-free cab when ordering union. every driver i've had in the past four years has been courteous, friendly, and can tell if they should or shouldn't engage in conversation; i can't say the same for the other, long-running companies in madison.

i am at least acquaintances with more than a dozen drivers, and have heard plenty of stories (anonymous to the passenger, of course) of them going out of their way to help someone to their door, carry groceries, and get blacked-out people home safely; that last one speaks volumes...

in general, when you put your transportation needs in the hands of someone else, you're giving up a privilege, which other reviewers appear to have taken for granted. you put your wallet, time, and safety in the hands of someone else for the convenience of getting to or from somewhere without needing to rely on your own car.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the review highlights several key positive aspects of the taxi service provided by Union Cab. The reviewer praises the cleanliness of the cabs, the courteous and friendly nature of the drivers, as well as their willingness to go above and beyond to help passengers and ensure their safety. The reviewer also appreciates the convenience and reliability of the service, emphasizing the trust they have in Union Cab to meet their transportation needs. Overall, the review reflects a high level of satisfaction with Union Cab as the preferred choice for taxi service.

question: I had a great experience with Union Cab when I used them to take me to my rental car for a trip out of town.  The phone answerer set up a time call for me, and the driver arrived two minutes before the time I requested, so I didn't have to wait at all.  On the way there, he advised me on how to get reimbursed for my cab ride by the car rental company and a good place in town to purchase tires for my car without breaking my budget.  Really nice guy.  Clean car.  Altogether, above and beyond.
rationale: The review outlines multiple positive aspects of the experience with Union Cab, such as prompt service, helpful advice, friendly driver, and a clean car. The customer specifically highlights the driver's proactive assistance regarding reimbursement and budget-friendly recommendations, indicating excellent customer service. The overall tone of the review is appreciative and satisfied, leading to a positive sentiment.

question: Disclaimer: I've only used union cab when I've made a telephone booking 24 hours in advance.\n\nI've been in a union cab for about 4 round trips in the last year. Every time I've called ahead and scheduled, the respective cab drivers have either been there 5 minutes early or on time. I've never had a rude driver, and each driver was really helpful with heavy luggage at the airport. They are not as cheap as the share-ride cabs (like badger), but I felt a lot safer and more comfortable in a union cab.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the user had consistently positive experiences with Union Cab when making pre-booked trips. The drivers were punctual, courteous, and helpful, making the user feel safe and comfortable during their rides. Additionally, the user highlighted the drivers' assistance with heavy luggage, further indicating a high level of customer service. Despite not being the cheapest option, the user's overall satisfaction with Union Cab reflects a positive sentiment.

question: Quick, clean no muss no fuss, keeper!
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer's comment indicates that they found the experience quick, clean, and hassle-free, suggesting high efficiency and convenience. The use of the word "keeper" also implies that they were satisfied with the service or product and would likely use it again in the future.

question: This cab company is the best in the city in consistency.  Consistently polite, clean, reliable, and safe.  I heart Union Cab!
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the review praises the cab company for being consistently polite, clean, reliable, and safe. The reviewer expresses their admiration for the company by saying they are the best in the city in terms of consistency, indicating a high level of satisfaction with their services. Additionally, the use of "I heart Union Cab" at the end suggests a strong emotional connection and loyalty to the company, further affirming the positive sentiment.

question: I'm so disappointed in Union Cab. A company that usually has excellent customer service refused my husband and me a ride not once, but twice, to a location less than five minutes away from the airport. While I understand it was busy, the rudeness and refusal of a short fare for a larger or is completely unacceptable. It will be a long time before I choose to use them again.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the customer expresses disappointment in the poor customer service received from Union Cab. They highlight the company's refusal to provide a ride on two occasions, despite the short distance involved. The customer also mentions experiencing rudeness from the company, further adding to their dissatisfaction. The overall experience has left a lasting negative impression, leading them to reconsider using Union Cab in the future.

question:
The Saturday before Halloween is apparently not something the good folks of Madison, Wisconsin take lightly. #Freakfest

I found myself in town visiting friends who live in the Madison-metro area and make it a point to celebrate the State street festivities every year. They live about 5 or so miles from the actual fest and because drinking and driving is never in style, they'd gone ahead and arranged a day in advance for 2 cabs to come pick our group of 7 up at their place of residence at 8:45pm. 

Now, this was my virgin visit to Madison at Halloween time so I wasn't quite sure what to expect, though I can't say I wasn't warned. I knew streets would be closed down and blocked off and this wouldn't be your typical Madison experience, but without seeing the Mad city madness first-hand, it was hard to anticipate just what we were up against when it came to our group versus on-time transportation on this hallowed eve. 

Union Cab did miss the mark as far as sending the two cabs that we'd ordered more than a day in advance to arrive at 8:45pm. The first cab arrived at 9pm to pick up the first half of our group off at the fest, but when the first group arrived at said bar and realized that the second group had still not been picked up, they asked if that cab could go back and get us, ya know, since there was supposed to have been another cab there 30 minutes earlier anyway. But the driver said they were unable to locate the second cab and that it was against the rules to come back and pick up the second group who were still waiting since they were not the assigned cab. Makes very little sense, but at the same time is sort of understandable on such a crazy eve, but the reservation should've counted for something. 

When we (the second group still at the house) tried calling Union, all we got were busy signals being that it's one of Madison's busiest cab nights of the year. So naturally, we did the only thing we could... crack open another beer and wait and chug and wait and chug and wait. It was just before 10pm when our cab finally arrived. The driver was super fun, quirky and costumed for the holiday and quickly made us forget about how Union had failed to provide us with transportation until over an hour after the previously scheduled and agreed upon time.

Also worth noting, because it won Union back a lot of stars that would otherwise have been missing given the tardiness, is how immaculate the shiny, gleaming Toyota Prius cab was. It smelled divine, and not overpowering or like it had something to cover up. And -get this- it had cloth seats. CLOTH SEATS. It didn't smell like sh*t. ZERO crumbs. Sans stains. Not even a whiff of urine or vomit. Where the hell was I? Bizarro World, surely. 

So, while I don't know that I'd trust Union as my chariot on a big day where I needed to be somewhere in a timely manner (ala the airport), they were plenty fine for a casual booze-bender and the amenities (no puke stains or pee smells) made the ride a pretty enjoyable one.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is positive because the reviewer acknowledges the challenges faced with transportation on a busy night like Halloween in Madison. Despite the initial issues with Union Cab's tardiness in sending the cabs, the positive aspects of the experience, such as the fun and quirky driver, the cleanliness and pleasant smell of the cab, and the comfort of the cloth seats, contributed to a more enjoyable ride. The reviewer highlights these positive elements, ultimately leading to a positive overall sentiment towards Union Cab despite the initial inconvenience.

question: Not the cheapest but nice clean cab very clear with costs.
rationale: The review mentions that the cab is clean and very clear with costs, highlighting positive aspects of the service. It acknowledges that while the cab may not be the cheapest option, the overall experience is still positive. This indicates that the reviewer values cleanliness and transparency in pricing, making it a positive review overall.

question: After waiting 45 minutes for a cab, our taxi (#69) left without us because we took over one minute to leave the restaurant. I learned my lesson, and will never take anyone other than Green Cab again. Union Taxi is a joke of a company, and I strongly discourage you from booking through them.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the user experienced a frustrating and unprofessional situation with Union Taxi. The user had to wait for 45 minutes for a cab, only to have the taxi leave without them after just one minute delay in leaving the restaurant. This indicates poor customer service and lack of consideration from the company, leading the user to feel disappointed and dissatisfied with their experience. Their strong discouragement from booking through Union Taxi further reinforces the negative sentiment.

question: My cab was 30 minutes late -  I didn't receive a heads up from dispatch,  and they were reluctant to give me an  estimated arrival time. I almost missed my flight and will not be taking Union cab again.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the user experienced significant inconvenience and stress due to the cab being 30 minutes late, almost causing them to miss their flight. Additionally, the lack of communication and transparency from dispatch regarding the delay and estimated arrival time added to the user's frustration and dissatisfaction with Union cab's service.

question: When Green cab said it would take an hour to get a cab it took Union cab less then 5 minutes!!! GARY, ANDY & NICK are the greatest!\n\nHad a girls weekend night out and they got us everywhere we needed to go in a timely fashion! The only issue we had was I told them 45 minutes they showed up with 10 minutes. Dispatch was a bit slow/ rude. I would still recommend them, but be very clear and ask them to repeat themselves!!
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer praised the prompt service provided by Union cab drivers Gary, Andy, and Nick during their girls' night out. Despite a slight miscommunication regarding the pickup time, the reviewer still expressed satisfaction with the overall experience and recommended the service to others. The reviewer's positive comments about the drivers being the "greatest" and getting them to their destinations in a timely manner outweigh the minor issue with dispatch, resulting in an overall positive sentiment.

question: if i could give them 0 reviews i would. i am in town from CA for epic training & we decided to go to a cheese shop, which is less than 2 miles away. i called twice to confirm the price and also book the cab. the guy told me it would be less than $15 considering it is only 2 miles away. we get there and the driver tells us it is $10 plus $12 for staying in Verona (pretty much getting an extra fee for not going too far). we told him we weren't informed about the fee so he calls the dispatcher who asks \"are they unable to pay?\" so pretty much, if we would've said we're unable, the fee was not required NOR were we informed we had to pay. we give the guy $25, definitely asked for the change back & vowed to never call union can, screw this cab company.
rationale: The sentiment is Negative because the user had a poor experience with the cab company. The user felt misled by the initial price quote given over the phone, only to find out about additional fees upon arrival. The user felt that the cab company was unfair and unprofessional in their handling of the situation, leading to frustration and a vow to never use their services again.

question: We called to confirm price AND went online for estimates. The dispatcher told us it would be less than $15. We got to our destination the clock said 10.50 but they said they had to charge us an additional $12! He blamed it on a new dispatcher. Sorry that is not our problem. We will choose another company next time.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the customer went through the effort of confirming the price beforehand, only to be charged significantly more upon reaching their destination. The additional charge was unexpected and unjustified, leading to a feeling of disappointment and frustration. The customer's statement of choosing another company next time also indicates their dissatisfaction with the service provided.

question: I live in Texas and my wife took a business trip to Verona.  She realized she left something very important at home, so I contacted a business in Madison to purchase it for her.  I contacted Union Cab for their courier service to get her item to the hotel. While I had some difficulty using their web site to place my order, Robert helped me get things done over the phone.\n\nHe also gave me a follow-up call to let me know that everything is processed and my package should be delivered on time.  I appreciate all the trouble he went through to help me take care of this problem.  He also let me know that he'd be working with his IT resources to make sure the web site works correctly in the future.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the customer's experience with Robert from Union Cab was helpful and efficient. Despite facing difficulties with the website, Robert assisted the customer over the phone and ensured that the package would be delivered on time. The customer appreciates Robert's efforts and dedication to resolving the issue, as well as his proactive approach to improving the website for future users. Overall, the customer's experience was positive, leading to satisfaction with the service provided.

question: I arrived Dane County Airport at 10:45 on this cold night.  There was a shortage of cabs, so the driver announced he would take several people at once.  Even though I much prefer my own cab, I've learned that cabs in madison much prefer the group rides especially when there is a shortage of cabs.  I was one of 3 passengers and the first to be dropped off, downtown Madison.  The ride was 10 minutes, and since I fly every week I know the fare is usually $14-15.  So I expected a discounted price given the shared nature.  But no, I was still charged a flat rate of $14.  I told the driver that I usually pay $14 for a solo ride, and thus I was surprised at the high rate for a shared ride. He insisted that was the fare, despite my protests that he was charging triple for the same fare then!  Unless I am stuck again with the possibility of not getting a cab for hours in the cold, I will NEVER use this company again.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is negative because the customer had a disappointing experience with the cab service at Dane County Airport. The customer expressed frustration over the shortage of cabs, being charged a flat rate for a shared ride, and feeling overcharged compared to their usual solo fare. The customer's dissatisfaction with the service and the perceived unfair pricing contribute to the negative sentiment expressed in the review.

question:
Their rates are very reasonable, the staff is friendly and helpful, and on the extremely rare occasion that any issue arises, they take care of it promptly and beyond my satisfaction.  

I've never really had a bad experience with Enterprise, but this location in particular is just full of really nice people.  Fatima in particular is so sweet, remembers my name and where I live, and goes above and beyond to make me feel like a valued customer. 

It's really nice to feel like employees of anywhere recognize you as a good customer and treat you with mutual respect, kindness, and reward your loyalty. We all know that the squeaky wheel gets the oil, so it's nice to see positive karma reinforced at Enterprise. 

Once they called me to let me know I had left a burned cd in their disc player and offered to drop it off with me while they were out doing their pick-ups. WHO DOES THAT? These guys do. Because they are awesome.

 Another time, there was a bit of a wait (they were insanely busy just before a holiday weekend, but still smiling and keeping it cool, even though I could see the exhaustion in their eyes) because they were backed up on getting their cars cleaned on the inside before they could ok them for rent.
 I told them I didn't really care, had no one to impress, and they could give me a dirty car as long as there wasn't literally bodily fluids inside it. Save yourselves a few minutes on cleaning that, I'm probably going to put new trash and crumbs in it shortly anyway. 

They looked at me, and told me that they appreciated my sentiment and apologize for the wait, but they would feel bad about giving me a crumby car. So, tell you what. Lets just bump you up the list of cars and give you a free upgrade to a higher class of car, of which we already have one cleaned and ready.  I said that wasn't necessary, I wasn't in a rush.  They said they wanted me to have it, because I was so nice and a good customer besides. Well. I guess if you insist on a free upgrade... I'll take it. 

I like that the corporate Enterprise seems to value this sort of behavior in it's employees, and fosters a positive work environment. From talking to their reps, it seems like they work hard, but are fairly rewarded for work well done. And it shows. East Washington Enterprise is great.  And, of course, they pick you up. :)
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the review highlights the exceptional customer service provided by Enterprise at the East Washington location. The reviewer specifically praises the friendly and accommodating staff, citing instances where employees went above and beyond to ensure customer satisfaction. The interactions described, such as going out of their way to return a forgotten item and offering a free upgrade due to a delay, demonstrate a commitment to excellent service and personalized care. Additionally, the reviewer appreciates the positive work environment fostered by the corporate Enterprise, recognizing and rewarding employees for their hard work. Overall, the reviewer's experience reflects a high level of customer satisfaction and emphasizes the value placed on building strong relationships with customers.

question:
I stopped here on the way to my hometown from the airport one of the last times I was in the Madison area. I'm normally a huge fan of the Wisconsin Swiss Melt, but the one I had here was not so good.

First, the sandwich was exceptionally greasy. I don't think I've ever had a patty melt-type sandwich that was that greasy in my life. Yeah, I understand this is a joint that specializes in butter burgers, but this was extreme, even for Culver's.

Second, the size of the burger was pathetic. Admittedly, I've been out of Wisconsin for a few years now, so maybe my recollection of the size of Culver's burgers isn't so good, but the patty on this particular sandwich was seriously thin, and the burger came no where close to covering the bread.

If you're just passing through the north side of Madison and have a sudden craving for Culver's, I'd suggest you keep going and stop at the location in Waunakee or the location near East Towne Mall, depending upon which direction you're heading.
rationale: The sentiment of this review is negative because the customer expresses dissatisfaction with the quality of the food they received. They specifically mention that the sandwich was exceptionally greasy, which they found excessive even for a place known for butter burgers like Culver's. Additionally, they were disappointed with the size of the burger, describing it as thin and not filling enough. The reviewer ultimately advises others passing through the area to avoid this particular location and visit other Culver's locations instead. Overall, the negative experience with the greasy sandwich and the unsatisfactory size of the burger led the customer to give a negative review.

question: This Culvers gives Culvers a bad name. Ive had excessively slow service, hair in my ice cream and burgers that resemble dog food and that's enough for me. Ive never quite seen a burger paddy so thin and greasy before in my life. You've  got to be desperate to eat there.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer had a poor experience at the Culvers location, emphasizing slow service, hair in the food, unappetizing burger quality, thin and greasy patties, and an overall impression of desperation associated with dining at that particular establishment. These negative aspects collectively contribute to the reviewer's unfavorable opinion and overall dissatisfaction.

question: The bastard child of two sexy Culvers.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because describing something as a "bastard child" can be seen as derogatory and disrespectful. Additionally, using the term "sexy" in this context could be considered inappropriate and objectifying. Overall, the tone of the review is dismissive and disrespectful.

question:
I find myself eating here from time to time as they are close to where I work.  I usually go through the drive thru and head back to the office to eat.  More times than not, I find myself ordering their cashew chicken salad and if I'm feeling rebellious I'll get some cheese curds too.
EVERY time I order the salad, I find myself waiting way longer than I would expect. How long does it take to heat up some chicken that was probably already pre-cooked and throw it on top of some greens? Apparently much longer than it takes to cook a burger. Other people in line behind me were receiving their meals.
One instance I watched the clock and it took 9 minutes from when I paid for my order to when I received the order. THEN I got back to the office to find half of the lettuce was slimy and old. I couldn't even eat it.  I went on their website to provide feedback about my experience and never heard any kind of response.
It's disappointing for the North side of town. There aren't many options for "fast" food.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the customer experienced several disappointing aspects during their visit to the restaurant. They were frustrated by the long wait time for a simple salad, only to find that the lettuce was slimy and old once they received it. Additionally, the lack of response from the restaurant after providing feedback contributed to their dissatisfaction. Overall, these negative experiences led the customer to feel let down by the service and quality of the establishment.

question: Just like every other Home Depot. Lots of inventory. A few American-made products and lots of cheap foreign knock-offs. A small handful of the staff knows what they're talking about, but the vast majority don't have a clue. And they're quite illusive; good luck finding somebody if you have a question.\n\nDon't buy paint here, it's really inconsistent. And they've mixed the wrong color for us more than once.
rationale: The sentiment is Negative because the review highlights several issues with the Home Depot store, such as the presence of cheap foreign knock-offs, lack of knowledgeable staff, difficulty in finding assistance, and inconsistent paint mixing services. These negative aspects demonstrate a lack of quality in the products and services offered by the store, leading to a dissatisfying customer experience.

question: What the eff Home Depot! I've been 3 times now and each time nobody has any idea what's going on there! Well, nobody until I reach the 3rd associate who's able to guide me right where I need to be. But by then I've made my way through the entire store looking for a product that's generally right where my journey began. If you're looking for humidifier filters or a pumice stone to make your toilet bowl shine... you're screwed. Wait no, here's the deal. Humidifiers are up front near the exit, filters are located in the same aisle. Pumice, your guess is as good as mine. I've found them in the cleaning aisle and the hardware aisle. Last time I threw in the towel after 20 minutes of searching (just keep them in the same place) and bought a grill stone which I'm told works the same.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is negative because the customer expressed frustration and inconvenience in navigating the Home Depot store to find the products they were looking for. The lack of clear organization and inconsistent placement of items caused the customer to waste time searching and resulted in a feeling of being overwhelmed. The customer's overall experience was marred by the confusion and inefficiency of the store layout, leading to a negative impression of Home Depot's customer service and organization.

question: We had special ordered doors which were delivered late. We received no notice that there would be a delay and calls to the millwork department went unanswered or a long time was spent on hold waiting for someone to be tracked down. In-person visits were very stressful because there was never enough staff in the department and oftentimes there was no one around at all. Overall we've not had problems with the store but after the experience we had with the millwork department it is doubtful we will ever return.
rationale: The sentiment is Negative because the customer experienced significant issues with the millwork department, including late delivery of special ordered items, lack of communication about delays, unresponsive phone calls, and a stressful in-person experience due to understaffing. These negative experiences have left the customer feeling doubtful about returning to the store in the future.

question: I stayed here with my fiance for a night a couple of Saturdays ago.  Upon entering the hotel we noticed that they had won a single diamond star 2010 and my fiance followed up with that by asking what has happened since then.  The lobby of the hotel seemed to be pretty nice and check in was quick and easy.  Our room was on the second floor and upon entering I was surprised at how small it was.  It reminded me of hotels over in Europe and barely had room to move around in.  We weren't planning on spending much time in the room and so I didn't pay much attention to it.  I guess that I should have paid more attention to the name of the hotel though as that could have been a clue.  As we were leaving the room and headed toward the elevator we noticed a vending machine that was probably 90% empty.  Odd but it seemed to fit with the rest of the dingy decor of the place.  After we got back to the place and my fiance climbed onto the bed it immediately sunk down pretty far.  Not a good thing.  In the morning we ended up checking out early and skipping the free breakfast as we were happy to get out of there.\n\nThe bottom line for me is that I probably wouldn't stay here again in the future.  Yes, this place is cheap but I would rather pay the extra money and stay somewhere else that feels cleaner and has some more room.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is negative because the guest highlighted several issues they encountered during their stay that left them dissatisfied. These included the small room size reminiscent of European hotels, the dingy decor and poorly stocked vending machine, the uncomfortable and sinking bed, and their overall desire to check out early and avoid the provided breakfast. The guest expressed a preference to pay more for a cleaner and more spacious accommodation in the future, indicating a general feeling of disappointment with their experience at the hotel.

question:
The only reason I put one star is because I had to. One of the poorest managed and run motels that I have ever seen. The rooms were very sub-par with mold on the bathroom ceiling. There were crumbs in the bed and they weren't very clean.

The rooms' walls were very thin and you could hear everything that went on from people stomping around upstairs to listening to doors banging constantly. There was a ton  of noise from these places as well as the highway running parallel to the hotel as well as adjoining rooms.

Management was the worst of all. Horrible at enforcing the rules so other guests can be very discourteous as well as riff raff running around outside peeking into locked vehicles almost as if they were trying to find a way to break in. Head manager is very hard to understand as he doesn't speak English clearly with no common sense on how to run a business.

Overall, one of the poorest run hotels I have seen in a long time and for the money, many other choices in the area which provide way better service and accommodations. So overall, easy to make a better choice anywhere else. Beware.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is negative because the guest highlights various issues with the motel, including poor room conditions, thin walls leading to noise disturbances, lack of management enforcement, and security concerns with people outside the motel. The reviewer expresses disappointment with the overall experience and recommends avoiding this motel due to the subpar service and accommodations.

question: Stopped for an early dinner with my wife,she wanted to try the two for twenty special.\nAs soon as we told the server what we wanted the service went downhill. We did not order any alcohol and we were having the special so this was not going to be a big check for the server but restaruant was not busy so any check should be better than no check.  Used the kiosk to pay for meal since i couldn't get the server to come back to check on us.Discount did not show up on kiosk I shouls have been  more aware since i had heard a similar comment from another table when we came in. Server said not to worry that the amount was correct. I pushed for reciept showing what was actually being charged to ny card. server said she needed my card and would have to talk to the manager. Finally got my paper reciept with correct charges but kiosk on table showed the over charge and had not adjusted. My wife thought we were going to be billed twice for the same meal, so she has been watching the debit card account.\nThis incident killed my night and the weekend with my wife constantly checking the bank account. This incident is all that my has been talking about to her friends all weekend long, I am sure that this will continue once she gets to work tomorrow.
rationale: The sentiment of this review is negative because the customer experienced poor service and a frustrating situation with the payment process at the restaurant. The server's lack of attentiveness, the issue with the discount not being correctly applied, and the confusion surrounding the payment all contributed to a negative dining experience for the customer. Additionally, the incident left a lasting impact on the customer's enjoyment of the evening and weekend, leading to ongoing concerns about potential overcharges and a sense of unease. Overall, the customer's dissatisfaction with the service and payment process significantly impacted their overall perception of the restaurant experience.

question:
Ordered a cup of the chili and the steak fajitas.  The quality was consistent with other Chili's I've eaten at in the past.  Nothing spectacular but then nothing terrible either.

The atmosphere is typical of the chain, and kept clean enough.

The only downside was the waiter.  He messed up the drink order by bringing a Corona instead of the Blue Moon and included the up sell beans and rice, which I had told him I didn't want at time of order.  Both mistakes seemed to be intended to get the ticket price up to increase his tip.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the customer experienced multiple issues with the service. The waiter made mistakes with the drink order and added side items to the meal despite being told otherwise, which may have been perceived as an attempt to increase the bill and tip. These errors negatively impacted the customer's dining experience and reflected poorly on the service quality provided by the restaurant.

question: Well to start, it's Chili's, you know what they serve up. I've been to this location on several occasion and have always left satisfied. The greeting, service & food have always been what you should expect from this chain. Pretty good happy hour specials as well! Cheers!
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the user's review highlights multiple aspects of their experience at Chili's in a favorable light. They mention being satisfied on several occasions, praise the greeting, service, and food quality as meeting expectations, and note the attractiveness of the happy hour specials. These positive indicators collectively contribute to an overall positive sentiment towards the restaurant.

question:
We have been shopping at this location since we moved into the neighborhood this past year. Copp's (the past year or two) has really gone down hill. We normally do our big shopping at Woodman's because it's cheaper. We'd go to this Copp's more but 1, the prices are higher MUCH higher than almost any place in Madison.

 Also they have a horrible time having things in stock. A lot of shelves are barely stocked (during the week even) and the signs in the frozen area are dumb, having lame pictures isn't helping me find products.  

If they updated a few things, had more things in stock and even regular items in stock I'd give a better rating. Also the parking lot is pretty dim/dark. Makes me feel unsafe.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is Negative because the customer expresses dissatisfaction with multiple aspects of their experience at the store. They mention that the prices are much higher compared to other places in Madison, the shelves are frequently understocked, the signage is unhelpful, and they feel unsafe due to the dim parking lot. These issues contribute to an overall negative experience for the customer, leading them to express disappointment with the store's current state.

question:
You can't be 100%, 100% of the time. 

It's something I tell friends, 
business owners, 
internal me 
all the time. 

But you have to strive for consistency, you can't be so vastly different time to time because people won't know which way is up. They'll start to lose faith and worry about what next time will be like.

No worries here, there won't be a next time. 

I'm appalled, angered and actually contemplated removing my first review (5-stars) but I felt it was important to see just how abysmal my experience was today as compared to last time. 

3:50pm

It started with a woman at the front who asked me to fill out new patient paperwork even though as she was pulling out folders, shuffling papers and readying a clipboard I explained 3 times I had been there before. 

She told me she'd find my paperwork and asked me to sit down. 

Another woman called me up, the associate director of operations. She asked me for my insurance card and I again explained it should be on file... I had been there twice this year. 

She told me they had a new system and asked me to pull it up if I could. I took my seat and did just that. 

I went back up to the desk with my ID card on my phone, she said she found a copy in my folder and told me I could take a seat. 

Same woman called me back up to the desk and said it would be $105 today. Huh? For what? I haven't seen anyone or been diagnosed with anything? I told her that I thought it was $10 for an office visit. She said last time we didn't charge you enough, so it'll be $105 today and asked me if I wanted to pay the whole thing up front or in installments. Really now, WHAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAT?! 

I HAVEN'T SEEN A DOCTOR! What is $105? Seriously, where did you get that number? What am I paying for? 

She told me they'd "figure it out" and told me to take a seat. 

Time passes. (A lot of time.)

4:30

I'm finally taken back. 
Height. 
Weight. 
Blood pressure. 
Then the nurse leaves and the Doctor comes in.
I explain my symptoms, she says she wants to run a throat culture. I'm guessing here she only listened to the fact that I have throat pain, a mild cough and post nasal drip, and neglected to hear the fact that I've had a low grade fever, chills and a lack of appetite. 

Times passes.

A medical assistant comes in with not one but TWO throat cultures. Offices can run a quick test for strep on the spot, they can also send one out to a lab. The Doctor decided she wanted both. In my foggy haze I'm trying to put the pieces of this puzzle together but I just can't quite get there, but I also know it doesn't add up. 

Time passes. 

Doctor comes back and says their test shows it's not strep. (I'm shocked. ) She says they aren't going to send the other test to the lab because the in office test is 95% accurate. THEN WHY DID YOU PERFORM BOTH? Why not the in office test first, followed by the other? Advanced apologies to my insurance which I sincerely hope denies Concentra's claim. 

Time passes.

I finally have some scripts for what this Doctor deems is acute sinusitis. 

5:40

The place is dark. I'm talking lights off y'all, everybody went home. There isn't even anybody at the desk anymore who could take a payment. 

I'm walked to my car because I'm the last person there.  

But it doesn't end there. 

Now I'm at Walgreen's where I'm told one of the prescriptions has a $40 copay, and it's the equivalent of cough syrup and an antihistamine. The pharmacist points me towards OTC drugs that total $10 and achieve the same desired effect.

Concentra, you've lost me.

Not only in the confused WTF way, but as a patient too. 

You are just too inconsistent for me to trust you with my well being.

Your slogan is "Treated Right." Put some power behind that because right now those are meaningless words.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is negative because the user had a very disappointing and frustrating experience at Concentra. They encountered multiple issues including confusion with paperwork, unexpected charges, unnecessary tests, lack of professionalism in handling payments, and receiving costly prescriptions when cheaper alternatives were available. The user felt that their concerns were not properly addressed, leading to a loss of trust in Concentra's reliability and consistency in providing quality care.

question:
The only reason why I went to Concentra is because I will be starting a temp job through an agency who uses Concentra for their clients. I had to get a TB test and showed up as scheduled: 8:30, Easy right? Wrong... let me back up.

To my own fault, I didn't realize there were parking spaces in the back of the building. I ended up parking at the PDQ where the sign clearly states " Parking Only for PDQ Customers. Violators will be towed". Because I'd arrived a bit earlier than my appointment time, I didn't think it would be a long wait and parked my car there ( huge gamble). 

Walk into the facility and am instantly turned off. I cannot stand being in any kind of office that doesn't give you and the staff member privacy. The line was nearly out the door. Everyone had to get in line just to sign in, THEN take a seat. Once the line was clear, they called you up by name in the order you signed in. This completely defeats the purpose of having an appointment. Does this make sense to anyone? Certainly not me. Keeping in mind... I am parked in a place I shouldn't have parked my car. Afraid to move it, I crossed my fingers I wouldn't be towed or tickets. I didn't to to leave, have them call my name and miss my slot. 

My name gets called and I think it's time for my to get my TB. Instead, I must go up and fill out paperwork. Why couldn't this be done sooner? The receptionist was quite rude. She was trying to do too many things as once instead of giving me proper attention. No professionalism at all. At any rate, I filled out the paperwork and went to sit back down. If I am becoming repetitive, it's because my actions were repetitive. 

One receptionist, instead of calling the gentlemen to approach the desk, she begins asking him questions across the facility. Not only is this rude but considering the waiting area is the size of an average living area for a home, it causes distractions. Confidentiality should ALWAYS be maintained at such facilities. 

I am clock watching like crazy and getting nervous. Every second that goes by, I am risking my car being towed. 9am rolls around.... still waiting... 9:10 rolls around... still waiting... Finally at 9:25 I was called. Almost 1 hour AFTER my scheduled appointment time.

The TB shot took 2 minutes. Literally 2 minutes and I was out the door. 

I am not sure what kind of system Concentra seems to be working with but they need to squash it and rebuild including offering some classes for their front desk staff on learning how to be professional in the work place. 

A side note, when I went back 2 days laters to get my TB read, the waiting time was 3 minutes which I appreciated. I was also seen by a Medical Assistant Student. I have nothing wrong with this but as a note, please do keep in mind that Concentra does staff students. Some may take no issue with this while others do. Considering it was on a TB read, I was cool about it. That being said, I will NOT be coming back here. I take my confidentiality seriously and hold my health care providers to a higher level. Considering I am paying a crap ton of money for health insurance, I demand better service. If my primary health care provider treated me like I was treated at Concentra, you better believe by that night, I would have dropped my coverage. Avoid this place if you can. If not... Godspeed to ya. 

Oh... and I didn't get a ticket or was towed. Happy, happy, joy, joy.
rationale: The sentiment is Negative because the review highlights several poor experiences at Concentra, such as a lack of privacy, long wait times, unprofessional behavior by staff members, and overall dissatisfaction with the service provided. The reviewer felt frustrated by the inefficient processes, the lack of professionalism, and the overall experience at the facility. Additionally, the reviewer emphasizes the importance of confidentiality in healthcare and suggests that the quality of service at Concentra did not meet their expectations. Overall, the review paints a negative picture of the reviewer's visit to Concentra.

question: Due to the third annual Schizophrenia hardcore/gabber event, my friend Aaron and I found ourselves on the outskirts of Madison and in need of whiskey.  Luckily the warehouse we were destined for was by Slices' (Slice's/Slices).  Boy, oh boy, factory bars in Wisconsin pour stiff drinks!
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer expresses enthusiasm and satisfaction about finding a nearby bar called Slices that served strong drinks. The use of phrases like "Boy, oh boy" and "stiff drinks" indicates a sense of enjoyment and appreciation for the experience, despite the unexpected detour to the outskirts of Madison. This highlights a positive aspect of the overall situation.

question: Pricey and bad quality service.  I immediately had to re-do my hair upon leaving and did a much better job myself with products from Sallys.  (and for less than half of what I was charged..)  Bottom line:  Dont waste your money or time at this salon.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the user expressed dissatisfaction with the service received at the salon. The user felt that the service was overpriced and of poor quality, as they had to redo their hair themselves after leaving. Additionally, they found better results using products from another store at a much lower cost. Overall, the user concluded by advising others not to waste their money or time at the salon, indicating a negative experience.

question: I created a yelp account to write this review.  I came in for a trim that I had scheduled the day before.  Only one stylist working and no receptionist.  After waiting for her to finish up with her client the stylist informed me I had no appointment.  She checked the computer we found my name written under the wrong day and time.  She was not very apologetic for my inconvenience and nothing was offered to me to insure my return.   I will advise my friends and family not to visit this salon.
rationale: The sentiment is Negative because the reviewer experienced inconvenience, lack of apology, and lack of any effort to rectify the mistake by the stylist or salon. The reviewer's expectations were not met, and there was no indication of concern for customer satisfaction or willingness to ensure a positive experience in the future. These factors contribute to a negative impression of the salon and would likely deter others from visiting as well.

question: I saw Bonnie at DBTB several times before I left Madison.  For me, it was the best balance of quality and cost that I found after trying half a dozen different stylists while in school.  The staff is super friendly and really put me at ease (I can be shy and dread too-chatty stylists) and I was always satisfied with the result.  Maybe not blown away, like if you're looking for something really edgy this might not be the place for you, but I'm picky and have difficult hair and Bonnie gave me exactly what I was looking for.  I also got it colored once by her, too; just an all-over so I guess it's hard to mess that up, but I had no complaints!\n\nIf I hadn't moved I'd still be going!
rationale: This review is categorized as positive because the reviewer highlights several aspects they appreciated about their experience at the salon. They mention the great balance of quality and cost, friendly staff, and how the stylist, Bonnie, listened to their preferences and delivered satisfactory results. Despite not being wowed by any particularly edgy styles, the reviewer acknowledges that for their specific needs and preferences, the salon and stylist were a good fit. Additionally, the positive mention of the coloring service reinforces their overall satisfaction with the services provided. Overall, the reviewer's enthusiastic tone and praise for the salon indicate a positive sentiment towards their experiences there.

question: Nom nom nom. Yummy teriyaki and big portions. One of the few places to get nearly-fresh 'fast' food.
rationale: The review expresses positive sentiment by praising the delicious teriyaki and generous portions offered at the restaurant. The use of terms like "yummy" and "nearly-fresh" implies satisfaction with the quality of the food. Additionally, mentioning that it is one of the few places providing such good 'fast' food suggests that the reviewer highly values this particular eatery for its tasty offerings and convenience.

question: I wish this place was a drive through instead of in a mall.  I only do take out on my way to work. And the \"10 minute food take out\" spots a full half the time with people who do not have regard for the sign.  Getting take out at Sarku usually take 7-10 minutes if they don't have any ready when you have walk up to order. But this stuff is like crack
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer praises the food by stating, "But this stuff is like crack." This indicates that the food served at the location is highly addictive and enjoyable to the reviewer despite the inconvenience of not being a drive-through and encountering delays during takeout.

question:
I will never deal with these people again. In a town like Madison, where are so many decent bike shops, why would I?

I went because I got a flat.

Trip #1. My boyfriend drops off my bike on a Monday. They say they can't have it ready until the NEXT Thursday (11 days). The also say they're going to lube the brake lines. 

Trip #2. My boyfriend comes by to pick up the bike, as stated, a week and a half later. They haven't even touched it yet. They say, "Did we call you? We'll call you." They had never told him to wait until they called. He says that they seem to have totally forgotten about the bike. 

A few hours later, they call.

Trip #3. He gets the bike. My flat is fixed. $43 dollars.

I get on the bike to ride it to work. The front brake is rubbing. There were no problems with the brakes when we gave the bike to them.

Trip #4. I have to go back to have them adjust the brakes. The guy running the show takes about 20 seconds. Hands it back to me. "There you go." He says. By the time I get home, the brake is rubbing again, now worse than before. 

I call and say, "Can you tell me how to adjust this? I cannot come to the bike store for a 5th time." He says, "Well, there must be something seriously wrong with your brakes if we adjusted them and they're still rubbing." There was nothing wrong with my brakes before I handed the bike over to them. At this point, I am so angry I can barely see straight. 

Trip #5. I take the bike in. They take it aside, work on it for 2 minutes, and viola! the brakes work. There's nothing wrong with them. They were just incorrectly adjusted twice. 

I'm sorry to have to give a bad review to my local bike shop, but our experience was that they were disorganized and took three times to get something right.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is negative because the customer had a series of frustrating experiences at the bike shop. The delays in completing the repair, lack of communication, repeated issues with the brakes, and the dismissive attitude of the staff all contributed to the customer's dissatisfaction. These factors highlight poor customer service and a lack of competence on the part of the bike shop, leading the reviewer to express disappointment and frustration with their overall experience.

question: Friendly people, good service.  We had two bikes serviced there in the fall with the intent to use them as winter bikes.  Once the snow flew we realized that my bike was skipping a gear and my wife's had a brake issue.  We rode down, and received the same friendly service we received the first time in.  They remembered our bikes and solved our bike repair issues on the spot.  Great business to support.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the review highlights the friendly service provided by the staff at the bike shop. Despite experiencing issues with their bikes during the winter, the customers were able to receive prompt and effective assistance when they returned to the shop. The fact that the shop staff remembered their bikes and were able to quickly address the repair issues demonstrates good customer service and a commitment to quality care. Overall, the review reflects a positive experience and encourages supporting the business.

question: These guys and gals a this shop are great.  Fair service prices and will always help you find a way to get your bike going no matter your budget.  I highly recommend.  Cool atmosphere too!
rationale: The sentiment of the review is positive because the reviewer highlighted the great service and fair prices at the bike shop. They also emphasized the staff's willingness to help customers find solutions within their budget, which shows a customer-centric approach. The mention of a cool atmosphere further adds to the positive impression, indicating an overall enjoyable experience.

question:
Busse's is very much a typical neighborhood tavern, with cheap drinks (cheapest in the city that I've found) and nice down to earth people.  Recent updates have been made as far as tv's, games, sound system, etc., so if you haven't been in a while to catch a game or hear some music (the old juke box was circa 1970's) you might give it another shot.  

If you are into "bomb" shots the Chuck Norris shot is something you need to try.  If you like tap beer the selection is limited, but very inexpensive, and the lines are always clean (hint: the owner drinks tap beer).  Cocktails are stiff, and REALLY inexpensive.  

If you're a northsider looking for a new local hangout, or someone heading to a Mallard's game looking for a spot near Warner to hit up before or after the game (they always have Mallard gameday specials) this is the place.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer highlights several positive aspects of Busse's, such as cheap drinks, friendly atmosphere, recent updates, good selection of shots and tap beers, strong cocktails at a low price, and its convenient location for those attending Mallard's games. The reviewer also suggests giving the tavern another try, indicating an overall satisfaction with their experience.

question: I will never do business with any Half Price Books store again after my experiences with the staff at this store. I have been here multiple times and have yet to find someone who is polite or pleasant to talk to. When I asked for help trying to find the cooking section I was told \"Why don't you just read the signs?\" I tried to sell a nonfiction manual and was told it was out of date even though it was the most current edition available. When I tried to protest the woman at the counter told me she \"clearly knows more about this\" than I do. I came back a few weeks later to sell another manual that had ICDM on the front and the girl actually tried to tell me that meant there was a CD that was supposed to go with it. I tried one more time to sell some novels and after the clerk gave me a pay slip he threw my book in the garbage right in front of me. I also tried to sell a like new condition $30.00 novel only to be offered a dollar for it. I asked why and was told \"it's a short book.\" I have never encountered anyone here who didn't make it very obvious that it is a waste of their time to serve customers. Even when I greet them with a smile and say \"excuse me, could you help me find something?\" They still give me attitude and act as though I am just in their way. It is very clear to me that the people here believe that it would be so much easier to do their job if those damn customers would just stay out of their way. I have already ordered my kindle and whatever books I have left are going to goodwill (which is just around the corner from this store.) I would rather give my books away for free than have an illiterate, incompetent and grossly uneducated person attempt to determine the value of a book they are unable to appreciate.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is negative because the customer had multiple unpleasant experiences with the staff at the Half Price Books store. The staff members were described as impolite, unhelpful, dismissive, and disrespectful. The customer felt belittled, frustrated, and unappreciated during interactions with the staff, which led to a general feeling of dissatisfaction with the service received. Overall, the review conveys a strong sense of disappointment and frustration towards the staff's behavior and handling of customer interactions.

question: First off, this is a USED bookstore, yet a large majority of their books are in almost new shape. Great selection. The last 4-5 times I went to Barns n Nobel at east town and found a book I wanted, I decided to check to see if they had it at half price books, and THEY DID! ALMOST EVERY TIME!!! And for half price, or less!! The staff is very helpful, and you can call ahead and see if they have the book you are looking for. If they do, they will gladly put it on hold for you at the front desk for up to a week at NO CHARGE! Staff is very friendly, and store is always neat and clean. Definately a winner. Always call and check here before paying full price for any book!!! They also buy/sell used records, cd's, movies, and computer software and games.
rationale: The review conveys a positive sentiment based on several key points. The reviewer highlights the great selection of books, the consistent availability of desired titles at a reduced price compared to a major bookstore, the helpful and friendly staff, and the convenient option to have books held without any extra charge. Additionally, the reviewer appreciates the cleanliness of the store and the fact that they also offer a variety of other media products for sale. Overall, the reviewer's experience at the bookstore seems consistently positive and they recommend checking there before purchasing books at full price elsewhere.

question: i usually just go here to sell things; but my mom comes here all the time and loves it, she always walks away happy!
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer's mom, who frequents the establishment, consistently has positive experiences and always leaves happy. This indicates that the business likely provides good service, offers fair prices for selling items, and creates a pleasant overall environment for customers. The reviewer's statement reflects a high level of satisfaction and suggests that the business consistently meets their expectations.

question:
Remember when East Towne mall was nothing?  A big building full of emptiness, speckled with a few pathetic stores here and there?  Ten to 15 years later, and now its been completely revamped and is all dolled up with white twinkly lights, and cheesy holiday decorations.  Hell, even Santa shows up there now.  

But guess what?  You can't just walk around the mall without some dipstick wanting you to try on their lotion or straighten your hair for you!!!  Isn't that exciting?  It's like being harassed by a car salesperson, only these people want to let you know how ugly you are, and how they can improve you with their shit products.  

Do you want to try this wonderful lotion?  Can I straighten your hair for you?  Can I ask you a question about your skin??!  Can I ruin this trip to the mall for you by refusing to leave you alone every time you walk by?!?!  

YES!!!!  It's like getting a root canal and then asking for a do over.  Because, even if you politely say no thank you, they persist, and harass, and then as you are walking away, you hear them say snide little things about you.    

I hate those pushy bastards.  They ruin every, single trip to the mall.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is negative because the author expresses frustration, annoyance, and disdain towards the pushy salespeople at the mall. They feel harassed, insulted, and inconvenienced by the aggressive sales tactics employed by the staff trying to promote their products. The author's negative experiences with the pushy salespeople have tainted their overall impression of the mall despite its renovation and festive decorations. The use of strong language and negative descriptions indicates a clear dislike for the pushy behavior and its impact on their shopping experience.

question: Not exactly an upscale mall by a long shot.  Service is horrendous and it is crowded and messy, with a poor selection of low grade stores.
rationale: The sentiment in this review is negative because the reviewer uses words such as "horrendous," "crowded," "messy," and "low grade" to describe their experience at the mall. These are all indicators of dissatisfaction and disappointment with the overall quality of the mall, particularly mentioning poor service and a lack of upscale stores.

question: It's a mall. In Madison. It's exactly what you'd expect. \n\nThe interior has been spruced up and there are some new stores, but West Towne still wins.  If you really need to shop, get outta town and head to Milwaukee or Chicago.
rationale: The sentiment in this review is negative because the reviewer expresses disappointment with the mall in Madison, stating that it is just what one would expect with nothing exceptional to offer. They also suggest that West Towne mall is better and advise shoppers to travel to Milwaukee or Chicago for a more satisfying shopping experience. Overall, the review conveys a sense of unimpressed and underwhelmed feelings towards the Madison mall.

question: I am finding it extremely unappealing to shop at East Towne Mall nowadays. There are just no good stores there. I do shop at Lane Bryant when they have sales but lately, their seasonal lines have been horrible or Bath and Body Works whenever they have Areomatherapy on sale for $5. Until then, there is no point in shopping here. There are certain wings of the mall that I hardly go down because they are just crappy shops put in to fill space. Also, the food court sucks. No good eatery places here at all. Just...nothing. It's really unfortunate because Madison doesn't have much retail stores to offer and there is a ton of potential for East Town mall if someone put the investment into it and clean up the atmosphere more. Location is great, stores are not. Please, someone with money and time help East Towne Mall!
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the review expresses disappointment and frustration with the current state of East Towne Mall. The reviewer highlights the lack of appealing stores, poor seasonal lines, and limited dining options as reasons for their dissatisfaction. Additionally, the mention of certain wings with subpar shops and a lackluster food court contributes to the overall negative sentiment. The reviewer suggests that the mall has potential with its location but lacks the necessary investment and upkeep to improve the shopping experience.

question: Low cost good work. Two macaws in the waiting room.  Right by the mall on the East side.
rationale: The review mentions that the service provided is good despite being low-cost. Additionally, the presence of two macaws in the waiting room could create a unique and enjoyable experience for customers. Furthermore, being conveniently located right by the mall on the East side can be seen as a positive aspect, making it easily accessible for customers. Overall, the review highlights some positive attributes of the establishment, leading to a positive sentiment.

question: A wash may be better priced than others but you'll get what you pay for. My husband brought out 2008 Prius for a wash and vacuum and it doesn't look like anything has been cleaned! The carpet in the hatch and floors are still dirty and none of the interior was wiped down. We will be going to Octopus or we'll just do it ourselves next time.
rationale: The sentiment is Negative because the customer expressed dissatisfaction with the car wash service they received. They noted that despite the lower price, the quality of the cleaning was poor, with specific areas of the car remaining dirty and not properly cleaned. The customer also mentioned considering switching to a different car wash service or doing the cleaning themselves in the future, indicating their disappointment with the outcome.

question: This time around wasn't so great. The interior of my car was wiped with dirty rags, and my car smelled like dirty rags until I got home and was able to wipe down the interior myself. They also didn't do quite so well on drying the car off - although I should have probably said something to the guys about doing a better job. Nevertheless, a very disappointing experience, after such positive one just a few months back.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the customer had a disappointing experience with the car wash service. The interior was wiped with dirty rags, leading to a lingering unpleasant smell, and the drying of the car was not done well. The customer had to clean the interior themselves and felt let down compared to a positive experience they had previously. Overall, the customer's expectations were not met, resulting in a negative sentiment towards the car wash service.

question: I paid $17.50 for an inside-outside cleaning and was given a dirty car. After agreeing that the car was dirty, the manager refused to have them vacuum it again.
rationale: The sentiment is Negative because the customer paid for a service - an inside-outside cleaning - but received a dirty car instead. Despite acknowledging the cleanliness issue, the manager failed to address the problem by refusing to have the car vacuumed again. This indicates a lack of customer care and accountability on the part of the car cleaning service.

question: I've given Mermaid quite a few chances.  I have never been pleased with the work.\n\nThe outside of the car is always dripping; the interior glass/dash was smeared and looked worse than when I went in.  I make the extra drive down to Octopus.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the customer expresses dissatisfaction with the work done by Mermaid car detailing service.
