The issues mentioned such as the car being dripping outside and the interior glass/dash being smeared indicate a lack of quality and attention to detail in the service provided. question:
It took them two washes and a visit with the owner to get it partially right.
The owner thinks the only way to dry windows and windshields is with a wet cloth.
I couldn't convince the owner of using dry cloths.
I won't go back - The guy is brusque, and not ethical.  
They have hardly any business - I wonder why?
They will be out of business soon.

Go to OCTOPUS for the BEST WASH.
rationale: The review contains several negative points, including the struggle to achieve satisfactory results after multiple attempts, the owner's insistence on using a wet cloth to dry windows despite the customer's preferences, and the perception that the owner is brusque and lacks ethical behavior. Additionally, mentioning the lack of business and predicting the business will fail further contributes to the negative sentiment. Overall, the customer's experience and interactions with the owner portrayed in the review suggest dissatisfaction and a lack of trust in the business, resulting in a negative overall sentiment.

question: I've been to this location a couple of times.  I had a free coupon for them from a place that I got my oil changed at.  Let me tell you, if I didn't get that for free, I would have been asking for my money back.  I don't get my car cleaned (inside) on a regular basis. I have a black lab, who sheds like crazy.  I wasn't expecting my car to be spotless by any means, but when I got back in to my car - there were still things on the foot rugs, the dash wasn't dusted off. It hardly looked like I just got my car cleaned.  Will not be going here to throw away my money.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is Negative because the reviewer was disappointed with the car cleaning service they received. Despite having a free coupon, they felt that if they had paid for the service, they would have asked for a refund. The reviewer expected a better job considering the condition of their car (due to having a shedding black lab), but found that the car was not thoroughly cleaned. Overall, the reviewer felt that the service was not worth the money spent and has decided not to return to the location.

question: The epitome of a crap chain.  Why did I get talked into going here?  Because I am a tool.  Crowded, loud, mediocre food, slow service, and on this particular occasion a strange man two tables down and across the aisle staring at me and not his dining companion, during the entire meal.  I should have just yelled, \"watch my head spin\" and vomited there at the table.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the review expresses strong dissatisfaction with the restaurant experience. The reviewer describes the establishment as crowded, loud, and having mediocre food with slow service. Additionally, the unsettling presence of a stranger staring at them throughout the meal adds to the discomfort and unpleasantness of the experience. The reviewer ends with a statement that conveys a feeling of regret for choosing to dine at this particular restaurant. Overall, the review is filled with negative commentary on various aspects of the dining experience, warranting a negative sentiment assessment.

question: It's an Applebee's...what do you expect?  Every Applebee's I've ever been to has sticky tables...must be something in how they are made or cleaned.  The shot glass desserts aren't bad, but if you go here, you know what you are getting in to.
rationale: The sentiment is Negative because the review describes the dining experience at Applebee's in a disappointed and critical way. The mention of consistently sticky tables implies poor cleanliness standards, which is generally not a positive reflection on a restaurant. Additionally, the overall tone suggests a lackluster dining experience and sets low expectations for visitors. The comment on the shot glass desserts being "not bad" further emphasizes that the positive aspects are few and far between, contributing to the negative sentiment of the review.

question: My folks love this place and I can't imagine why.  I had the chicken wrap and it could not hold a candle to the wraps at the Great Dane.\nThe fries are so overly seasoned they are almost impossible to eat without a huge glass of water.  Don't go there.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer expresses disappointment in the food quality at the restaurant. They mention that the chicken wrap did not meet their expectations compared to other places and that the fries were overly seasoned, making them difficult to eat. Additionally, the reviewer advises others not to visit the restaurant, indicating their overall dissatisfaction with the experience.

question: This needs no explanation.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer has dismissed the content as not needing an explanation, implying that it is unimportant, uninteresting, or not worth their time to elaborate on. This lack of interest or engagement suggests a negative reaction towards the subject being reviewed.

question:
TERRIBLE!!!!!!

I have been in the state for 4 months and this is the WORST restaurant choice we have made so far. I had a bad feeling and should have listened to my instinct. Wasted $40.

Let me start by saying the host/hostess were the nicest staff at the place. 

My husband ordered the 7 oz sirloin with riblets, seasonal vegatables and mashed potatoes. The sirloin was mostly fat and rubbery. There was no meat to be eaten. It was just a hunk of fat. The riblets even had a weird smoke flavor that he compared to cigarette smoke. We do not go places looking for an all smiles server, but this guy did not smile and when he saw we were not enjoying our meal and my husband's plate was still full, he did not even ask if the food was okay or if there was something he could do. We don't like to complain and just were not in the mood to even let him or the manager know. I really did not expect the food to be so bad. I will stick to TGIFridays, Texas Roadhouse and Outback Steakhouse from now on;they never disappoint and we have no problem putting down $50 or $60 plus a $10+ tip. For the same $40 spent, we could have gotten a meal we actually enjoyed. The only good part was my daughter's chicken fingers, fries and pepsi. Sad. We will not be returning. For such a nice "looking" exterior, you would think they'd have more quality food and servers. I guess you get what you pay for..sadly.

Do not go here! We will be voiding it like the plague.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer had a terrible experience at the restaurant. The food quality was described as poor, with the sirloin being mostly fat and rubbery, and the riblets having a strange smoke flavor. Additionally, the server did not check in on their satisfaction or offer any assistance. The reviewer also mentioned that they felt the $40 spent was wasted and that they would not be returning to the restaurant. Overall, the review highlights multiple disappointments and issues with both the food and service, leading to a negative sentiment.

question: Last time I went I was very disappointed in the service. We had a large group so I can understand it taking a little longer than normal but our server took forever to ask us what we wanted to drink (we were a little later than the rest of the party who already had a drink). Also all the TVs were on a preface channel while there was another game that was actually on. I don't think I'd ever pick to go there again. Will only go if someone else wants to.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the customer experienced a significant level of dissatisfaction with their dining experience. The prolonged wait for the server to take drink orders, particularly when compared to the rest of the party, contributed to a feeling of neglect. Additionally, the issue with the TVs not showing the desired sports programming could be interpreted as a lack of attention to detail and customer preferences. Overall, these missteps created frustration and disappointment, leading the customer to express reluctance towards returning to the establishment.

question:
We like it here.  The two of us went in today for lunch and there was a short wait (15 minutes) so we decided to grab our drinks at the bar while we waited.  The Bartender was visually a bit flustered as there were three unsavory looking and sounding women seemingly trying his patience with their drinks and menu ordering.

When her got to use I ordered a Cadillac Margarita on the Rocks in the Big glass and he got a tall Spotted Cow on tap.  I continued to be friendly to the Bartender as I know the type and he was tipped $3 for the drinks.  While we got down off our bar stools he did say 'thank you, enjoy your meals.'

Our waitress was Tasha and she was very pleasant; we ordered the mozzarella sticks as an appetizer and chatted in between watching basketball and Men's gymnastics on one of their many TV's.   I ordered the bacon cheeseburger with the works (hold the cheese) and he ordered two (2) trios; one for now and one for later.

The food was good, but the fries were sparse and non-crispy while they were seasoned OK.  He had another Spotted Cow and we cashed out.

All in all another nice afternoon at Applebee's.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the review highlights several positive aspects of the dining experience. The customers enjoyed their time at the restaurant, found the staff to be pleasant, and the food to be good overall. They especially appreciated the service from the bartender and waitress, as well as the friendly atmosphere of the restaurant. Despite a few minor issues with the food, overall, the customers had a nice afternoon at Applebee's.

question: The bacon commercial with non stop fries, only says \"HEART ATTACK!!!!!\"   Thanks Applebee's
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the commercial is associating consumption of bacon and non-stop fries with the phrase "HEART ATTACK!!!!" This can be seen as irresponsible and insensitive, as it trivializes the serious health risks associated with high-fat, high-calorie foods like bacon and fries. The message comes across as promoting unhealthy eating habits and glamorizing potentially harmful food choices.

question:
Great layout, very nice bar/restaurant and good people.

The layout is fair and wisely not long. IMHO any idiot can make a course tough by making it long. Bridges is within the ability of most golfers and yet is challenging enought for, say, a college team (that I recently watched). 

My only criticism is that it is not an easy course to walk with long distances between holes. I think courses should be walked.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the review praises the layout of the golf course, describing it as fair and challenging without being overly long. Additionally, the reviewer compliments the atmosphere of the bar and restaurant, as well as the people. While the criticism about the course not being easy to walk due to long distances between holes is mentioned, the overall tone of the review remains positive. The reviewer's enjoyment of the course and belief that it is suitable for a variety of skill levels contributes to the overall positive sentiment.

question: Stopped here for a little golf while on vacation. 9-holes w/ cart during peak hours on a weekend was only $27, very inexpensive I thought! Practice area was basic but nice. Range looked fine and the range balls were some of the better I've seen around. $5 for a small bucket. Greens, tees and fairways were slightly, if it all, above average. The dirt cart pathways left a coating of dust on my glasses, skin, bag and clubs by the end of my round, didn't care for that and is the reason why I gave a 4/5, wish they were paved! Beverage cart was basic, but inexpensive. No wine. Inside bar had good, inexpensive food. I hear the fish fry's are good. \n\nOverall, a pretty good course with cheap green fees. Will certainly be back, though they need to pave the cart pathways....
rationale: The sentiment is Positive because the reviewer highlights several positive aspects of their experience. They mention that the golf course offered a good value for a 9-hole round with a cart, enjoyed the range facility and quality of range balls, found the greens, tees, and fairways to be above average, and appreciated the affordability of the beverage cart and food at the inside bar. Although they had a minor issue with the dirt cart pathways, they noted it as a drawback but did not outweigh the overall positive experience they had. Additionally, the reviewer expressed an intention to return to the course in the future, indicating a favorable impression.

question:
I broke down and was craving McDonald's and wanted to check out the newly built one. Ordered the new bacon clubhouse burger. It was tasty but on the cooler side of hot. Once again though fries as bad as you can get. Cold, dried out and down right uneatable. I do like that they have coke zero even as it wasn't mixed properly. 
Service, what service. No warm welcome or even a smile and it was a manager who was besides himself for having to leave his set position to help me the only customer at noon in line. 
Dining room looks great new. Dirty as all hell. Looked to sit at 3 high tables and all the seats had greasy soda spots all over them. 
How hard is it to manage a place like this. I've done it quiet successfully for many years. 
And yes someone can contact me if they'd like.
rationale: The sentiment is Negative because the review describes various negative experiences at McDonald's. The customer received a burger that was not hot enough, fries that were cold and inedible, and encountered poor service with a lack of welcoming attitude and inadequate attention. The cleanliness of the dining room was also criticized, with greasy soda spots on the seats. Overall, the reviewer had a disappointing visit due to multiple issues with the food, service, and cleanliness of the restaurant.

question:
I am 95% sure I acquired a nasty food based illness here. I ate some of the chicken nuggets, and within 2 hours I was terribly ill, vomiting the entire contents of my stomach into my kitchen sink because I was not able to get to the bathroom. 

It was that bad. 

As for the service, the 'help' if you can call it that clearly did not want to be working at the place, and I observed several questionable hygiene related issues in regards to how the staff handled themselves - and the food. 

How was I able to do this, you ask? Well good reader, the reason is that I was standing for 10 minutes at the counter waiting for my order, a Hamburger, a single order of chicken nuggets, a baked potato, and a large soft drink. I had ample time to observe these things. 

I know only the most 'interesting' person would actually enjoy working at a fast food place, but the help here set a new bar of horribleness - if the bar was buried 3 feet into the ground that is. 

Add in the for lack of a better term - 'wiped out' dining room which was filthy, and you get fast food hell. Avoid at all costs - go to another Wendy's - any other Wendy's.
rationale:
The review expresses a negative sentiment due to the following reasons:

1. Severe food poisoning: The reviewer mentions becoming terribly ill and vomiting after consuming food from the establishment, indicating a serious health issue. This negative experience is a significant factor in their overall perception.

2. Poor service: The reviewer criticizes the staff for their lack of interest in their work and questionable hygiene practices. This reflects poorly on the service quality and creates a negative impression of the establishment.

3. Unsanitary dining environment: The reviewer describes the dining room as filthy, which contributes to an overall negative dining experience.

4. Recommendation to avoid the establishment: The reviewer advises others to steer clear of the place and go to a different Wendy's location, underlining their dissatisfaction with the experience.

Overall, the combination of food poisoning, poor service, unsanitary conditions, and a strong recommendation to avoid the place contributes to the negative sentiment expressed in the review.

question: Don't even want to give this place any stars. I found a chunk of tin foil in my burger. I took it up to get a new one and the person didn't say one word to me. No sorry no nothing. Just took the burger, made me a new one and gave it back...without saying one word to me. Customer service is absolutely terrible which is a shame because the food is usually good there.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the customer had a disappointing experience at the restaurant. Finding tin foil in their burger is unappetizing and may raise concerns about food quality and safety. The lack of apology or acknowledgment from the staff member when the issue was brought up reflects poor customer service. Despite the usual good quality of the food at the restaurant, this negative encounter with the service aspect overshadowed the positive food experience.

question: Not sure what happened to the beef at Wendy's, BUT I have been to this location and the fish hatchery location and the newer thicker beef patties have a strange old meat flavor. Not sure when or if I will go back. This used to be a favorite. Very disappointed. I wish they would go back to the old style of burgers.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the customer expresses disappointment with the newer beef patties at Wendy's, mentioning a strange old meat flavor that they do not enjoy. They also indicate uncertainty about returning to Wendy's due to this change, emphasizing their disappointment and wishing for a return to the previous style of burgers they enjoyed. Overall, the customer's review conveys dissatisfaction with the food quality and changes made by the restaurant.

question:
My parents stayed here during a recent visit. 

Really, for the price, this is an excellent place to stay. The outside and the common areas look a little old (and the elevators smell a bit funky -- but it's the hydraulics, not bad stuff), but the rooms themselves are nice. The room my folks stayed in was $73 a night, and it had a separate "living room" area as well as a balcony, mini-fridge, and microwave. They also said the bed was comfortable, and we enjoyed being able to chat with them out on the balcony as well as in the "living room" on the couch. Apparently the breakfast was also very good, and even had hot foods, like sausage. That's not something you get everywhere, so definitely a plus there!

Whenever friends and relatives come to visit, I will definitely recommend this place. Affordable and not skeezy, plus yummy breakfast!
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer highlights various positive aspects of the hotel, such as the affordability, nice rooms with amenities like a balcony, mini-fridge, and microwave, comfortable bed, and a good breakfast with hot food options like sausage. Additionally, the reviewer intends to recommend the hotel to friends and relatives, further emphasizing their satisfaction with the overall experience. The reviewer's tone is enthusiastic and appreciative, focusing on the value and enjoyable aspects of their stay.

question: I have stayed here in the past and am a frequent traveler in the area for business. Due to the winter weather warning and storm going on currently I am not able to get from Milwaukee to Madison to make my reservation. Hotel would not make any exceptions due to weather to get me a refund, or even a partial refund. You think they would have some sort of sympathy considering the circumstances. I believe that the safety of their customers and securing future business would be more important than a one night stay tonight. Really disappointed.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer expresses disappointment and frustration with the hotel's lack of flexibility and understanding regarding their situation. The reviewer expected the hotel to show some sympathy and make an exception due to the severe winter weather conditions preventing them from traveling, but the hotel did not offer any form of refund or compromise. The reviewer feels that the hotel prioritized their reservation over the safety and well-being of their customers, leading to a negative experience and overall sentiment.

question: I have stayed here before without any issues. This last stay of 6 nights was a different story. The first night we had loud and rude neighbors. The sixth night and seventh day our room smelled like pot. The cleaning people did a crappy job and the hallway looked like it hadn't been vacuumed in quite a while. I will not be staying here again.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the user experienced multiple issues during their recent stay at the hotel, including loud and rude neighbors, a persistent smell of marijuana in their room, poor cleaning standards, and neglected maintenance in the hallway. These factors would undoubtedly lead to dissatisfaction and a decision to not return to the establishment in the future.

question: No one cleaned our room. And it reeks like cigerate smoke. Will NEVER stay here again!!!
rationale: The sentiment is Negative because the guest experienced poor service as their room was not cleaned, resulting in a negative impression of the hotel. Additionally, the presence of cigarette smoke odor further contributed to their dissatisfaction. These factors would likely lead the guest to have a strong negative reaction and decide not to stay at the hotel again in the future.

question: The hotel was a little run down around the edges but I wouldn't complain about that - the price was competitive.  However, my husband woke up with some kind of bug bites.  We told the desk guy about it and all he said \"we don't have insects.\"   This lack of interest in confirming or clearing up a serious problem was disconcerting.  We won't be staying there again.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the guest had a poor experience due to finding bug bites in the hotel room and the lack of proper response from the staff. The dismissive attitude of the hotel employee towards the issue raised by the guest reflects a lack of concern for customer well-being and satisfaction. This disregard for the guest's complaint contributes to a negative overall experience, leading the guest to decide against staying at the hotel again in the future.

question:
The staff at this location is fantastic. When there was a mixup at the national level, the second shift manager (Sarena) made it right. She went above and beyond what was required. They have better customer service than most "luxury" hotels I've stayed at over the years.

Does the building need updating? Sure. 

Does the free breakfast feature Lobster Benedict? No man, you're staying at a Best Western in Wisconsin.

And the wifi is free. The W Hotel in Beverly Hills doesn't even have free wifi.

They've got a customer for life.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer expresses praise for the fantastic staff at the hotel, highlighting their exceptional customer service. Despite acknowledging areas for improvement such as the building needing updating and the lack of extravagant breakfast options, the reviewer appreciates the staff's efforts to rectify any issues and cites examples of going above and beyond. Moreover, the reviewer compares the hotel favorably to luxury establishments, emphasizing the value they provide, including free wifi that is not even offered at higher-end hotels. The closing statement of being a customer for life indicates a high level of satisfaction with the overall experience.

question: Friendly, organized and professional.  As the other reviewer said, she tells you what the dress needs and the costs up front. She is fast and works with your schedule. She really seems to care that you are happy with her work.  Definitely recommend!
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the review highlights several key positive aspects of the service provider, such as being friendly, organized, and professional. The reviewer appreciates the transparency in communication about the dress alterations and associated costs upfront. Additionally, the fast service, flexibility in scheduling, and genuine care for customer satisfaction contribute to a positive recommendation. Overall, the reviewer had a pleasant experience and is satisfied with the service received.

question:
OUTSTANDING IN EVERY WAY. 

Darlene is the owner and #1 World Champion Queen of the Alteration Universe. I really cannot say enough good things about her. Her friendliness, dedication, and skill are unmatched. 

I started taking my dress pants here to be taken up almost 8 years ago when I was still in school at Ye Olde UW. At the time, it seemed a pretty far way to go for an alteration place (ALL the way on the east side LOL). But after the first experience, I would never go anywhere else. 

I took my wedding dress here for alterations too. As expected, a fantastic job. Now that I live 3 states away, I still bring stuff with me when I visit and have her ship it back to me! Yes, this place is THAT good. Friendly, prompt service, and very reasonable prices. 

Darlene and her staff (one other person who I've never met but must be equally as amazing), are just the BOMB plain and simple. Never had a problem with anything done here. Back in the day Alterred States was just a teensy little store in a strip mall on Northport. Now, she's taken over the big middle part! Just goes to show I'm not the only (extremely fanatic) satisfied customer! 

Best spot ever. Take your stuff here. You won't be disappointed.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer expresses extreme satisfaction with the alterations done by Darlene and her staff at Alterred States. The reviewer highlights Darlene's friendliness, dedication, and unmatched skill, indicating a high level of professionalism and expertise. The reviewer also praises the consistency of the service over the years, even going as far as bringing items from 3 states away because of the exceptional quality. Additionally, the reviewer mentions the growth of the business, indicating a successful and reputable alteration service. Overall, the review is filled with praise and recommendation, showcasing a strong positive sentiment towards Alterred States.

question: Darlene is awesome. I had to have my bridesmaid dress taken in in the bust and had to have it done in under a week. Darlene did an awesome job on the alteration and had it done in six days. I paid $45, which seems totally reasonable to me. I'll definitely go back to Darlene for my other alterations and repairs.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer had a great experience with the service provided by Darlene. The reviewer specifically mentioned that Darlene did an awesome job on the alteration, completed it in a timely manner, and charged a reasonable price. Additionally, the reviewer expressed intention to return to Darlene for future alterations and repairs, indicating a high level of satisfaction with the service received.

question: Did great work the first time. The second time I brought a pair of new jeans in for hemming that had been worn for a few hours to make sure they fit well. The woman working the counter claimed that the small amount of dust on the original hem from this wear constituted soiling, a part that would be cut off prior to hemming. Being that these are raw denim, washing them to remove some extremely insignificant dust would ruin the point of having purchased raw denim. Ridiculous, I'll take my tailoring needs elsewhere from now on.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the customer had a poor experience at the tailor shop. They felt that the staff's reaction to a minor issue with the jeans was unreasonable and impractical, leading them to decide to seek tailoring services elsewhere in the future.

question:
Speedy, friendly service, rarely messes up my order, even if it is complicated, which it usually is. 

Late night staff get swamped regularly, but handle it well. Great vegetarian and vegan options. 

(I feel I need to say that my five stars is versus other fast food restaurants, but for the money it definitely still holds its own. )
rationale: The review highlights several positive aspects of the restaurant, such as speedy and friendly service, accurate order fulfillment even for complicated orders, and a great selection of vegetarian and vegan options. The reviewer also acknowledges that the late-night staff handle busy periods well despite getting swamped. The overall tone of the review is complimentary, praising the restaurant's efficiency, customer service, and food options. The final statement expressing preference for this restaurant over others in the same category further supports a positive sentiment.

question: After months of inadequate staff who constantly messed up our order and took forever, something changed, and this Taco Bell has returned to what it had been.  Friendly staff, reliable service.  And that tasty Taco Bell quality I've come to enjoy when I'm good and hammered or just not in the mood to cook or drive very far.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer acknowledges a significant improvement in their experience at the Taco Bell location. They mention that the staff is now friendly and service is reliable, which contrasts with their previous encounters of inadequate staff and order mistakes. The reviewer also expresses their enjoyment of the "tasty Taco Bell quality," indicating their satisfaction with the food. Overall, the reviewer appreciates the positive changes in service quality at the restaurant, leading to a positive sentiment.

question: Easily the best TB in Madison (though with State St and University/Segoe closed, it's not much of a competition). Everything is made very well, very fresh, and very fast. Great service. The location rocks too right between 30 and Milwaukee. No complaints and this one is much less sketchy than the one on Park.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer praises the taste and quality of the food at the Taco Bell in Madison. They mention that everything is made well, fresh, and served quickly, with great service. The location is also highlighted as convenient. Furthermore, they express satisfaction by stating no complaints about the restaurant. Overall, the positive feedback indicates a pleasant dining experience at this particular Taco Bell location.

question:
It's a Taco Bell. Certainly you haven't come here with Rick Bayless expectations, but it's still a top tier fast food choice. The interior is great and clean, and the staff is generally friendly, but that's about where the good vibes start falling. 

Go between lunch and early dinner hours, and you'll never have an issue.  At least, I haven't. 

After 730pm, however, avoid it. Mistakes aplenty (two tacos had no meat!) from the drivethru, the waits get longer as the night goes on, and if you think you want to stop here around "fourth meal" time, prepare to be overwhelmed by how much they've run out of. It's a little disheartening due to the proximity of our drill location, but we still forget the late night issue and get suckered in once a month.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the review highlights several issues with the Taco Bell experience after 7:30 pm, such as mistakes in orders, long waits, and running out of items. The reviewer also mentions feeling overwhelmed and disheartened by the late-night service. While the interior and staff are praised, the overall experience during late hours is portrayed as disappointing and not meeting expectations.

question:
I am almost embarrassed to write a review about Taco Bell but this Taco Bell is always SOOO slow!  I went today and the did not have chicken.  I went a few months ago and the actual store was closed and drive thru was only open because they did not have enough staff.

I had to laugh because today, when we went through the drive thru, the guy told us we could start our order, so we did.  After the first item, he said "hold on, I was doing something."  Well, yeah...that is kind of the nature of the job, right?  I usually give people the benefit of the doubt but it was pretty bad.

I do have to say that the food generally looks neater than other TBs, if you do get the correct food or the food at all.
rationale: The sentiment in this review is negative because the customer had multiple negative experiences at the Taco Bell location. The review mentions slow service, lack of available menu items like chicken, store closures due to staffing issues, and unprofessional behavior from the drive-thru employee. These factors contribute to an overall negative perception of the restaurant.

question: A friend suggested that I begin my bike search here. Boy was he wrong. Maybe the West Wash location has better customer service, but after standing around bikes for 10 minutes without so much as a \"hello\" or \"can I help you?\" I took my business elsewhere - I ended up spending $2K+. \n\nMy suggestion: Madison has great bike shops so don't waste your time at this place.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer had a poor customer service experience at the bike shop, as no one greeted or assisted them during their visit. This lack of engagement made the reviewer feel unwelcome and pushed them to take their business elsewhere, resulting in a negative perception of the shop overall.

question:
We are BIG fans of Area 51 as well as the former 21st Century Antiques, and everything that we have bought from Michael over 20 years in Madison is not only worth a great deal MORE than we paid for them, WE love them even more than when we bought them and couldn't find them again.

Michael has a fantastic eye and the largest warehouse collection of eclectic modern furnishings, lighting and accessories in the area - art deco, arts & crafts, industrial-mid-mod century. Best to call for an appointment as hours are varied. 

Bring your truck, tape measure and imagination as Area51 of course has a lot of truly one of a kind BIG pieces in addition to upscale kitsch, whimsy and collectible bling.
rationale: The sentiment in the review is positive because the reviewer expresses being a big fan of Area 51 and the former 21st Century Antiques. They mention that everything they have purchased from Michael over the past 20 years in Madison has not only increased in value, but they love the items even more over time. The reviewer praises Michael's eye for design and the extensive collection of eclectic modern furnishings, which indicates a high level of satisfaction with their purchases. Additionally, the reviewer recommends bringing necessary tools and highlights the uniqueness and variety of items available at Area 51, conveying an overall positive experience and recommendation.

question: Would love to see the place and browse, but despite what the Yelp page says, their web site is quite clear that there are no regular hours. \"By Chance or Appointment\". Well, I'm not up for driving several miles and using up expensive gas just to see if anyone is there, and I've left voicemail messages to make an appointment but no one returns the call. Also added my name to the \"mail list\" form, but haven't ever received anything. In 25 years of collecting, I've discovered that mid century modern dealers can be somewhat flaky, so I wasn't too surprised. Still, I wish they'd get their act together so people could spend money there.
rationale: The sentiment in the review is negative because the customer expressed frustration and disappointment with the business. They were unable to visit the store due to inconsistent hours and lack of responsiveness from the staff. The customer also highlighted issues with communication and follow-up, indicating a lack of professionalism on the part of the business. These factors contributed to an overall negative experience for the customer.

question: We had lunch at this place on X'max Eve, it was such a disappointing lunch given the food was not served 30 minutes after we finished ordering. After calling the manager the food was finally on the table but apparently there is something within this restaurant. The manger was friendly but the waiter at our table was showing us some attitude after manager was called up. So, service-wise, it was such a failure. Food is okay, just like any other red lobster place, but please keep in mind that waiting for 30 minutes is never acceptable.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the customer had a disappointing experience at the restaurant on Christmas Eve. The main issues highlighted include a significant delay in serving the food after ordering, poor service from the waiter who displayed attitude, and an unacceptable wait time of 30 minutes. Despite the food quality being described as average, these service-related problems overshadowed the dining experience, resulting in an overall negative sentiment.

question: I am so happy they aren't keeping this crab and scallop \"pot\".  It was overly messy and no return of flavor.  Better off just having steamed crab legs instead.  Overall, Red Lobster is a great place for me to get my crab fix when I need it.  There isn't any other affordable place in town to support my cravings.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer expresses happiness that the restaurant is no longer serving a dish they didn't enjoy (crab and scallop pot), implying that the restaurant listened to feedback and made a positive change. They highlight other menu options they prefer (steamed crab legs) and overall praise Red Lobster as a great place for satisfying their crab cravings at an affordable price. The reviewer's overall experience at Red Lobster appears to be positive despite their specific feedback on one dish.

question: I absolutely Love Red Lobster.  I will go out of my way to eat at a Red Lobster for shell fish.  Unfortunately, I have never had a good meal at this Red Lobster.  They do not know how to cook seafood.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer expresses a strong love for Red Lobster and goes out of their way to eat there for shellfish, yet they have consistently had bad experiences with the food at this particular Red Lobster location. The reviewer specifically mentions that the restaurant does not know how to cook seafood, which is a significant complaint considering that seafood is the main draw for dining at Red Lobster. This indicates a high level of disappointment and dissatisfaction with the food quality, leading to an overall negative sentiment.

question: Visited this location on 2/27 with a friend for Lobsterfest. I ordered the Lobster in Paradise.. The lobster was NOT fresh, it was tough and very chewy. I was really bummed out by this because I was really looking forward to trying this dish and I don't normally have any complaints about Red Lobster. The service was excellent, our waiter was very friendly and attentive.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the customer expressed disappointment and dissatisfaction with their dining experience at the restaurant due to the poor quality of the Lobster in Paradise dish. Despite acknowledging good service from the waiter, the main issue of the tough and chewy lobster affected the overall enjoyment of the meal, leading to a negative sentiment overall.

question: My boyfriend and I visited for the first time ever on Thursday. I work for Darden, so I was expecting great service and delicious food. The food was nothing amazing, but it was still a decent value for the price. However, our waiter was extremely rude. He acted like it was a burden to serve us. I'm assuming it was our age, but that shouldn't matter. I'm a server myself and it's wrong to treat your guests like they are wasting your time. It made the entire experience quite disappointing.
rationale: The sentiment is Negative because the customer had high expectations due to their experience working for Darden and was left disappointed by the service they received. The rude behavior of the waiter made the entire dining experience unpleasant, despite the food being described as decent. The negative interaction overshadowed any positive aspects of the visit for the customer.

question:
Red Lobsters Biscuits is what drives me to dine at their restaurant. However, now that they sell their brand of biscuits at Costco, I fail to see why I would ever dine here again. 

I love seafood. It's my favorite food. However, Red Lobster seems to think that the best way to cook a good seafood dish is to drown it in garlic and butter. My goodness, it's ridiculous how much butter and oil is used in any given dish. I am (was) a huge fan of their Salmon New Orleans. It came with wild rice, broccoli, broiled salmon and shrimp covered in a tabasco butter sauce. I always got the sauce on the side because again, the add too much butter/oil. Since the dish is super easy to make, I decided to make it on my own with less butter. Viola! Dish turned out better than Red Lobster (IMO which is very bias I will admit) For what you pay to get a good meal, the food is very average while being coated in nothing but butter. Even the salads are iffy. 

Their food is nothing special. The most decent cooker can make anything on their menu. I never understood why the lines are always out of the damn door when I drive by on a weekend. Convenience? Must be. However, people must REALLY like it considering the wait time on a Friday or Saturday night can be up to a hour. 

If I am to leave one positive comment, the service has always been great in my past experience dining here.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is negative because the user expresses disappointment in the quality and value of the food at Red Lobster. They criticize the excessive use of butter and oil in the dishes, finding them to be average and lacking in speciality. The user also mentions that they were able to recreate a dish at home with better results, indicating overall dissatisfaction with the dining experience. Despite noting good service, the negative comments toward the food and value overshadow any positive aspects.

question: I don't know what has happened to RL, but the food is not nearly as good as it used to be, with the exception of the cheddar bay biscuits. My last two visits there were very disappointing. The food was bland. The lobster was tough and lacked flavor. Not interested in returning.
rationale: The sentiment is Negative because the reviewer expresses disappointment with their recent dining experiences at RL, noting that the food quality has declined and is not as good as it used to be. The specific complaints about bland food, tough lobster, and lack of flavor indicate a significant decline in overall dining experience, leading the reviewer to feel uninterested in returning to the restaurant.

question:
I'm going to start by saying I really miss Yee's Laundry on Park street and that I've tried to fall in Love with Block Cleaners. I really want to support them... I'm a local guy - but they have lost my order twice, which required having to go back or stand around waiting while they look for my clothing and tell me how hard it's going to be to find. 

They are tough on buttons and if they break a button and bother to fix it at all, it's likely the button won't even be a serviceable match.

While they advertise same day service - I've never found this to be the case. I'd like to find another small dry cleaner and laundry that has an attention to detail. I'm open to suggestions
rationale: The sentiment of the review is negative because the customer expresses dissatisfaction with their experiences at Block Cleaners. They mention issues with lost orders, long wait times, poor handling of clothing like breaking buttons, and a lack of the advertised same-day service. These negative experiences have led the customer to express a desire to find another dry cleaner that pays more attention to detail.

question:
Quick Review: If it weren't for the stellar fish fry and the awesome beer selection, this place would be a solid 2.5-star establishment.  Alas, the fish is unreal and the beer selection rivals many (if not most) of Madison's finest.

Detailed Review:
The Fish Fry Fanatics stumbled into Dexter's Pub this past Friday and decided to give their fish fry a shot.  The menu selection is vast - we counted at least 6 or 7 solid fish fry options, from shrimp to Lake Perch to Walleye.  

We put our name in for a table, and were told it would be a 35-40 minute wait, so we ordered some of our customary Old Fashioneds.  We were pleasantly surprised to find that the bartenders muddle their Old Fashioneds, but were disappointed by the inclusion of a huge chunk of orange.  I'm sorry to say, but a Whiskey Old Fashioned Sour should *not* include half-of-an-orange as garnish.  

Regardless, the Old Fashioned was solid - very good, actually.  So much so that when we ordered a second round and requested they drop the orange, it wasn't a problem.  Dexter's recovered nicely, and as luck would have it, our table became available soon after we grabbed round 2 of drinks. 

We immediately ordered cheese curds, salad, and soup.  I went with the vegetable garden soup; others at the table went with chili and salad.  The soup and salads arrived within seconds; the soup was good - not great, but good - and it could've been a little warmer.  I'm told the chili was good as well - not life altering, but good.

The waiter came back to take our dinner order: two orders of beer battered cod, an order of lake perch, and an order of shrimp.  He said he'd be back in 10 minutes with our fish.  

Nearly an hour later, we flagged down a waitress for: refills on our drinks, and to inquire about our curds and fish.  She apologized profusely... curds came out a few minutes later - apparently they forgot about us.  The only benefit to being forgotten was that we had plenty of time to read the beer menu, which features a nice selection of craft beers from microbreweries - Dexter's doesn't strike me as a place that would feature such a wide selection of unique beers, but I guess it goes to prove that you can never judge a book by its cover.  

Curds were excellent - not your typical "from the bag" curds, which was a nice surprise.  They were breaded and featured a mild white cheese; they were cooked perfectly.

Fish arrived within minutes, and it was well worth the wait.  The cod was phenomenal.  Three huge pieces with a mound of fries - now that's what we're talkin' about.  The batter was light, crisp, and flavorful.  The fish was thick, meaty, and perfectly flavored.  I loved every single bite of it.

I also sampled the Lake Perch and shrimp - both of which were excellent as well.  Huge props to Dexter's for their fish fry - it's definitely a top-10 offering.

In the end, they also made things good as the waiter comp'ed us our drinks and curds, so we got out of there for under $40.  We tipped well and called it a night.  I'd definitely go back to Dexter's - sure, they dropped the ball, but they did an honorable thing and made everything right by us.  Thanks, Dexter's!!

Dexter's = WIN

Food = 4.5 stars (excellent fish; curds and fries were stellar)
Service = 2 stars (they forgot about us, but made up for it)
Value = 2 stars (would've been over $85 for the 4 of us)
Misc = 3 stars (the place isn't much to look at, but has an excellent beer selection...)

Oh - also, parking is hard to come by, so be prepared to park on the street and/or walk a bit to get there.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is positive because the reviewer highlighted several positive aspects of their experience at Dexter's Pub. They praised the exceptional fish fry and beer selection, enjoyed the food quality, and acknowledged that the establishment made up for service shortcomings by compensating for their oversight. Despite some hiccups with service and wait times, the reviewer expressed gratitude and a willingness to return to Dexter's Pub, ultimately giving it a positive overall rating.

question:
So, I have been to Dexter's before to play some cards a few months ago, but it wasn't until I moved into the neighborhood that I decided to give the food service a shot. 

   I ordered a steak sandwich and some fries, it was one of the 3 specials being offered. The fries were decent enough, but the sandwich was bland dry and just quite dreadful, even for a pub. My friend then joined me and we ordered the worst cheese curds I've ever had in my life, and then we had the ironically named "super" nachos. The Super Nachos are anything but super. The ground meat (not positive what animal it came from) was again under seasoned and the chips were stale. I thought about sending them back, but I am chalking this up to the back of the house just doesn't give a shit about their job.

   The server was the three P's, Pleasant, Prompt, and Pregnant. She was the reason I will return and give the food another shot, and why this Pub is getting even two stars.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is negative because the customer describes the food they ordered as bland, dry, dreadful, and the worst cheese curds they've ever had. They also mention that the "Super" Nachos were not super at all, with under-seasoned ground meat and stale chips. Additionally, the customer expresses disappointment with the quality of the food, indicating that they considered sending it back but attributed the poor experience to a lack of care in the kitchen. Despite praising the server, the overall experience with the food was unsatisfactory, leading to a negative sentiment in the review.

question: Great food. Has a local feel, not quite dive-y but pleasantly local. Not unexpected based on the location. Went for the Bell's tap take-over for Mad-Craft-Beer-Week. Wife and I had the fish, right tastee.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the review mentions that the food was great and had a local feel, which suggests authenticity and a unique atmosphere. Additionally, the reviewer enjoyed a tap take-over event and found the fish dish to be delicious. These positive experiences contribute to an overall favorable impression of the establishment.

question: Had a great 5 piece perch fish fry with yummy waffle fries.  Good food, neighborhood bar.
rationale: The review mentions a "great" perch fish fry and "yummy" waffle fries, indicating that the customer enjoyed their meal. They also highlight that the food was good and describe the establishment as a neighborhood bar, suggesting a positive overall experience.

question: I love their friday night fish fry . The price is right and great bluegil and perch. I have to keep going back there. love it! I defeintely recommend fish or even sandwiches, burger. Oh, don't forget their greasy chili gralic fries :)
rationale: The review contains positive language such as "love," "great," "recommend," and "love it!" The reviewer also mentions specific items they enjoy, such as the bluegill and perch, fish fry, sandwiches, and burgers. Additionally, referencing the chili garlic fries in a positive way further enhances the overall positive sentiment expressed in the review.

question:
I've been to Dexter's several times before for drinks and really liked the place, and a few months ago we went for the Friday fish fry and the food was delicious- some of the best fish fry we've had in Madison.  However, when we went back a month or so later, we had a horrible experience.  We had to wait nearly 45 minutes for our food and then when we got it- it was terrible.  My boyfriend had the garlic chili fries and they arrived not only COLD, but DOUSED in disgusting grease- they were inedible.  We mentioned it to the waitress and she offered to bring a new order, but it turned out the new order was just as terrible as the first one.  I had the roast beef sandwich and it was horrible- very dry and bland.  To her credit, the waitress did give us free cupcakes to take home to make up for the horrible food (although it turned out the cupcakes were also inedible and terrible).  

We hoped this was just an unusually busy night and not the norm, and because the fish fry is so good, we went back again tonight, hoping for a better experience.  We were wrong!  We went around 7 and waited 15 min or so for a table.  Once we were seated we placed our order right away with the waiter, since we already knew what we wanted.  An hour later, we were still waiting for our food.  All we ordered was the fish and waffle fries- so nothing complicated- and on such a busy night, you'd think they'd be making sure to keep batches of fish and fries going steadily into the fryer.  When we finally got our food, it was the tasty fish we'd remembered from before, but by that time, we were so tired and crabby from having to wait for so long, it wasn't quite so enjoyable.  After our meal, we had to wait quite a long time for the waiter to bring the check, and then he didn't come back to pick it up for a good 15 minutes.  We would still go back to Dexter's just for drinks, but I don't think we'll be going there to eat the food anymore.  Two terrible experiences with inexcusably long waits is enough to keep us from going back for dinner.  It's too bad because the fish is good, but not good enough to justify the SLOW service.

Edit: Turns out the fish wasn't so good- ended up being up all night with food poisoning.  Yup, definitely will NOT be going back there for dinner!
rationale: The sentiment of the review is negative because the customer had multiple negative experiences at Dexter's, including long wait times for food, receiving cold and greasy dishes, poor quality food, unsatisfactory customer service, and ultimately getting food poisoning. These experiences led the customer to conclude that they would not return to Dexter's for dinner, despite acknowledging that the fish fry was initially good. The overall dissatisfaction expressed throughout the review clearly indicates a negative sentiment towards the restaurant.

question:
Decided to stop in on a recent Friday to try the fish fry based on reviews. Worried that would be waiting for a table, we went in hopeful. Got a booth right away for four and it was very busy. I had been in here pre-Sandlot days and wasn't impressed but this "make-over" is proving positive.

Key points:
 - waitress was great, offered tastes of beer to help my decision
 - perch and cod, both good and plenty of it
 - pub fries were great, not overcooked like so may places
 - echoing other compliments on the beer selection, nice
 - fine for the kids too, at least earlier around dinner time (5-7)

I'd come back to try non-fish fry some night.
rationale: The sentiment expressed in the review is positive because the reviewer had a good overall experience at the restaurant. They were pleasantly surprised by the efficient service, enjoyed the food (perch and cod) and found the portions satisfying. The reviewer also appreciated the beer selection and the fact that the restaurant was family-friendly. The only thing they mentioned they weren't impressed with previously was improved upon with a positive "make-over," indicating that they would consider returning for a different dining experience.

question: Lot's of things going right for this place, as long as you get there at the right time. Great selection of micro brews. Interesting and delicious food. The last time I went in for food and a beer it was lovely. However on previous occasions, I was freezing in winter, or deafened on trivia night. I hope they get a better announcer and a better PA system so customers don't have to suffer through the distortion.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the review highlights several positive aspects of the place, such as a great selection of microbrews and interesting and delicious food. The reviewer also had a lovely experience the last time they visited for food and a beer. While they do mention some drawbacks, such as being cold in winter and experiencing loud noise on trivia night, they express hope for improvements in the future rather than complete dissatisfaction. Overall, the positive elements outweigh the negative ones in the review.

question: In on Tuesday, 7/24.  Tried the pizza burger after someone finally decided to come A. get a drink order after sitting down 5 minutes prior.  B.  Recite the specials off the chalk board because they didn't know what the specials were.  The  burger was ok, but didn't have the peperoni flavor I would have expected.  I've been here a ton of times, and the food is for the most part, very good, but service this evening was horrible.  I had to ask for another beverage 1/2 way through my meal, and ultimately walk to the bar to pay the bill.  Go drunk.  You may not notice that the staff doesn't give a crap about you, or getting your money.  We could have walked out...and almost did without paying.
rationale: The sentiment in the review is negative because the customer experienced poor service during their visit. They had to wait for a long time to get a drink order, the staff seemed uninformed about the specials, and they had to ask for another beverage during their meal. Additionally, the customer felt disrespected by having to walk to the bar to pay the bill. These factors contributed to a negative overall experience, leading to the customer feeling like the staff did not care about their satisfaction or receiving their business.

question:
I frequent this place because it's close to where I live, and I do team trivia on Wednesdays.  The beer selection is both expansive and fresh (they open new taps frequently), and the food is excellent bar-food fare with some healthy salad-type options.  But hey, you're there for bar food, right?  The burgers are yummy (you can sub in chicken or black bean), the fries and rings are tasty.  I've heard good things about the pizza, but haven't tried it.  There are lots of TVs, so if you care to watch some sports it's a great place to do so.

The servers are very nice, but on busy nights they can be super slammed and stretched thin, so you may have to wait several minutes for service.  The kitchen isn't all that large and they actually cook food to order, so do plan to wait a bit for your meal.  In fact, that's the only down-side I can think of about this place - the service can sometimes be slow.

If you're not into trivia, I suggest that you avoid Tuesday and Wednesday nights after 8:00 PM or so, because that's when the trivia crowd is there and the place is packed to the gills.
rationale: The sentiment in the review is positive because the reviewer highlights several aspects of the establishment that they enjoy, such as the proximity to their home, the expansive and fresh beer selection, the excellent bar food options including burgers and salads, and the inviting atmosphere with plenty of TVs to watch sports. They also speak highly of the servers, acknowledging that while they can be busy at times, they are still very nice. Despite mentioning some occasional delays in service on busy nights, overall, the reviewer focuses on the positive aspects of the place, indicating an overall satisfaction with their experience.

question:
I'm not sure what happened to Dexter's fish fry, but wow - it seems like it's on a downward spiral, which is unfortunate, because it used to be one of my very favorites.

I've revisited this fish fry three times this year, and each time has been underwhelming - I'm not sure if they've switched fish suppliers or what, but I've got serious reservations about returning for the fish fry.

We arrived last night (9/21) at around 8:30pm, and the place was packed to the gills.  As luck would have it, a table opened up near the bar, so we snagged it and decided to eat in the bar area.  An extremely helpful waitress immediately took our drink and appetizer orders; we browsed the menu until she returned.

With drinks in hand and the appetizer (IPA hummus plate) underway, she regrettably informed us they had run out of cod.  We opted for 2 plates of the lake perch and 1 plate of the walleye instead (I was dining with a couple of friends).

The service was excellent; she regularly checked on us, refilled drinks, and kept us in the loop the entire night.  5-stars for service.

The fish arrived and it was swimming in grease.  Gone was the excellent batter that I had experienced in the past; the perch was rubbery and extreeeeeeemely fishy tasting.  The walleye was equally greasy, over-battered, and also very fishy tasting.

I love fish, and my friends are huge fishermen - they take trips to Canada, the boundary waters, and all sorts of other places to fish.  But even they agreed that the fish didn't taste like it should - one barely finished his smallish plate of perch; the other left at least half of the walleye.  I felt especially terrible when they asked me why I felt the fish was so good here... :-(

The rest of their food remains superb, especially the IPA hummus.  I'm certain you won't find a better hummus in the area.  I would also recommend the habanero shrimp and any of their burgers - they're excellent.

Our check arrived; we settled-up and left, disappointed by the fish.  It's a shame, because I like Nick, and I really like the crew here, but something is amiss...

:-(
rationale: The sentiment of the review is negative because the reviewer expresses disappointment with the declining quality of the fish fry at Dexter's. They mention multiple visits resulting in underwhelming food, specifically noting the fish being greasy, over-battered, and overly fishy in taste. Despite praising the service and other food items on the menu, the focus of the review is on the unsatisfactory fish dishes, leading to an overall negative impression of the dining experience.

question: Best clam chowder I've ever had! My husband loves their chili and I believe all their soups are made from scratch and I've always been pleased.... We typically only go for Friday Fish Fry and are never disappointed, just be prepared for a long wait for both a table and the food but I believe it is worth it... great beer choices that change frequently and we were pleasantly surprised by their sandwiches as well. We went in on an off night (Monday) to watch a football game... We were seated right away and the game atmosphere was great with many televisions so you don't have to worry about where you are seated.
rationale: The review expresses a high level of satisfaction with the food and dining experience at the restaurant. The customer praises the clam chowder as the best they've ever had, compliments the chili, and appreciates that all soups are made from scratch. They also enjoy the Friday Fish Fry and are satisfied with the beer choices, sandwiches, and the game atmosphere when they visited on a different night. Furthermore, despite acknowledging long waits on busy nights, the reviewer finds the overall experience worth it. These positive remarks indicate that the customer had a pleasant and enjoyable experience at the restaurant, resulting in an overall positive sentiment.

question: After reading several rave reviews for the fish fry we decided to try this place.  We arrived at 5:30 on a Friday in Lent and knew we were already in trouble when parking was hard to find.  The dining room was packed and we were told there would be an hour wait.  Since we had driven across town, we decided to wait it out in the bar.  There is plenty of room to wait and have a beer from the huge selection they have.  In 30 minutes we were called for our table.  Two of us ordered the lake perch and one ordered the deep fried cod.  There is also baked cod, walleye, blue gill and shrimp to choose from.  The fish comes with your choice of  - baked potato, waffle fries, pub fries, homemade potato chips, and some other things like cottage cheese etc.  We had waffle fries, potato chips and the pub fries, which are beer pattered.  You also get a small container of cole slaw and a white grocery store roll.  There was a short wait for our fish, but the dining room was still packed.  When it arrived, it was hot, tasty and a generous serving.  We were all very satisfied with our dinner.  I thought the homemade potato chips were excellent, they came out warm and crispy.  The only thing I did not care for was the tartar sauce, can't place what it was, but had a funny taste to it to me.  Everyone that waited on us was friendly and efficient without being intrusive.  Wish this place was closer to my side of town, but we will definitely try it again.  Get there early or expect to wait!
rationale: The sentiment in the review is positive because the customer enjoyed the food and overall dining experience. They mentioned that the fish was hot, tasty, and served in generous portions. They also appreciated the variety of side options and found the homemade potato chips to be excellent. Additionally, the efficient and friendly service from the staff left a positive impression. Despite the wait for a table, the customer expressed satisfaction with their meal and mentioned a willingness to return to the restaurant.

question: Absolutely the best place to get a delicious Reuben and brew fries in town! My favorite dive on the Eastside of Madison.
rationale: The user's review expresses positive sentiment by highlighting the deliciousness of the Reuben sandwich and brew fries at the establishment, indicating satisfaction with the food quality and taste. Furthermore, describing it as their favorite dive on the Eastside of Madison suggests a strong preference and loyalty to the place, overall portraying a positive experience and recommendation.

question: Easily one of my favorite local hangouts, Dexter's is a \"dive\" bar without the \"dive.\" The beer selection is wonderful, bartenders and staff are knowledgeable and attentive, and the food is well above typical bar food standards. There are tables for dining, a long bar for sitting and watching the game, and volleyball courts out back for summer fun. If you're going for the food, I have to recommend the fish fry and/or nacho platter. If you're going for the beer, you won't be disappointed. And if you're looking for a fun place to watch a Badger victory with friends, you've got the right bar.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer highlights multiple aspects of Dexter's that they enjoy, such as the great beer selection, attentive staff, tasty food, and fun atmosphere with activities like volleyball. They specifically mention recommendations for food items and express enthusiasm for watching sports games at the bar with friends. Overall, the reviewer's language is enthusiastic and complimentary, painting Dexter's as a favorable and enjoyable hangout spot.

question: No carry out on Friday nights!?!  I'm new to the area and was looking to trying Dexters Friday fish fry after hearing so many great reviews. Unfortunately I didn't get the chance as they do not provide a carry out option on Friday nights. I was speechless went told this over the phone!  I did try another place (Brothers Three) that was happy to provide carry out to this customer and it was wonderful!
rationale: The sentiment is Negative because the user was looking forward to trying the fish fry at Dexter's based on great reviews, but was disappointed to find out that they do not offer carry out on Friday nights. This led to a feeling of being let down and the user had to go to another place, Brothers Three, to satisfy their food cravings. Overall, the experience did not meet their expectations and left them feeling speechless and frustrated.

question: As a non beer lover (I know, I know), I wasn't expecting to fall in love with Dexter's.  I don't think one has to worry about that considering my experience.  Our food was just so...terrible.  I ordered the salmon salad, not having any huge expectations with it due to ordering it at a hipsterish hole in the wall type establishment.  The salmon was a weird color...it had greasy fried peppers, croutons, tomatoes and cucumber...I was pretty sure I was going to get food poisoning but miraculously, I did not.  My husband ordered a burger....the bun was dry and crusty, he asked for it medium well and it was slightly alive still.  Plus, they didn't even provide a leaf of lettuce or tomato.  Just cheese, a ball of raw hamburger and 1/3 of a slice of bacon.  Our meal was so unsatisfying but at least the waffle fries were the highlight of the night!
rationale: The sentiment of the review is negative because the customer had a poor dining experience at Dexter's. They describe the food as terrible, with the salmon salad being unappetizing and potentially concerning in terms of food safety. The burger was not prepared as requested and lacked basic ingredients expected in a burger. Overall, the meal was unsatisfying, with the only positive being the waffle fries. The customer's disappointment and dissatisfaction with the quality of the food reflect a negative sentiment towards their experience at the restaurant.

question: Just in case anyone was wondering... the Italian beef sandwich and hot wings are just as tasty when you take them to go. You know... in case you needed that information. \nI crisped up the waffle fries in the oven when I got home, and it was like sitting there. But without the friendly faces and awesome tap line up.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer expresses satisfaction with the taste of the food even when it was taken to go. They specifically mention the Italian beef sandwich, hot wings, and waffle fries being tasty, indicating a positive dining experience overall. The reviewer's comparison of the home-cooked waffle fries to the dining experience highlights their enjoyment of the food and the establishment itself, despite missing the ambiance and service of the restaurant.

question:
I love Dexter's. It's a short walk away, so I go there a lot. I've been there dozens of times.

Their daily specials are usually what I check out, and they come with a cup of soup. And that soup is usually amazing. Their chili is always fantastic. Their fish fry is also very good. They have a beef brisket sandwich called the BBLT that is always really good.

They have plenty of beer on tap, and plenty of televisions for your viewing pleasure. The staff is always friendly and willing to recommend something.
rationale: The review provides several positive points about Dexter's, such as the proximity, delicious daily specials with soup, fantastic chili, good fish fry, and a tasty beef brisket sandwich. The mention of plenty of beer choices and TVs adds to the positive experience. Additionally, the friendly staff who offers recommendations further contributes to the positive sentiment expressed in the review.

question: We went to Dexter's on Friday for the fish fry at the start Craft Beer week.  So we knew the wait would be long.  It was about an hour or more wait to eat.  But that didn't matter because we got to have a couple of tasty beers.  Once we sat down to eat, we started off with the clam chowder.  I loved it.  The chunks of clam were huge and tender, not chewy.  The soup wasn't too thick that it overshadowed the clams, onions and potatoes.  We both ordered the deep fried cod.  One of the best we've had.  It came out hot and crispy.  The batter wasn't too oily and you could taste the flakey cod.  The waitress was very busy but always available if we needed anything.  I can't wait to eat there more.  \n\nI love the atmosphere at Dexters.  It's a great mix of people who are friendly and there to enjoy the beer/food.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the review highlights several positive aspects of the experience at Dexter's. The reviewer enjoyed the wait, found the clam chowder and deep-fried cod to be delicious, appreciated the attentive waitress, and loved the atmosphere of the restaurant. Overall, the reviewer expresses excitement about returning to Dexter's, indicating a positive experience and satisfaction with the food and service.

question:
This place will always have a special place in my heart for reasons known by me and Steve L. :-)

I'm fairly new to the world of craft beers, but I'm a big fan of the beer list here. Always something new and interesting to try.

I haven't had a proper dinner here yet, just appetizers. They have been just "ok". The menu sounds promising, though.

I like the open style of the kitchen area, always curious to see what folks are up to in there. The wait staff was very attentive, if slightly impersonal, as well. I found it odd that a waitress was allowed to work wearing flip flops, though. (I notice details.)

It was a nice cozy place to wind up the end of my work week last night. To be continued...
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer expresses a special fondness for the place, particularly mentioning the beer list which they are a big fan of. Despite finding the appetizers only "ok" so far, they are optimistic about the promising menu. The open kitchen style and attentive wait staff also contribute positively to their experience. Overall, the review conveys a sense of enjoyment and anticipation for future visits, making it a positive sentiment.

question: Great service, great food plain and simple! Oh, and awesome beer selection that is always changing.
rationale: The review is positive because the customer is satisfied with the service, food quality, and beer selection. They use positive words like "great," "awesome," and "always changing" to describe their experience, indicating a high level of satisfaction. Overall, the customer's feedback highlights their positive experience with the establishment.

question:
I don't care how good the food is or the beer selection. This was my first stop on my return to Madison, and it was horrible. 

To our waitress, who had no notion of hospitality or customer service: you messed up, and taking 90 minutes to get our order to us is totally unacceptable. Not even an apology? You should be ashamed. 

That's all I need to say, really. Piss-poor service that warrants nothing more than a single star. Bartenders were great, waitress was embarrassingly bad. Not going back.
rationale: The sentiment is Negative because the customer had a very unsatisfactory experience at the restaurant due to the poor service provided by the waitress. The customer expressed frustration over the slow service and lack of apology, leading to a clear dissatisfaction with their overall visit. The negative review emphasizes how bad service overshadowed any positive aspects of the establishment, ultimately leading to a decision not to return.

question: Went for lunch had the fish fry. Really bad over cooked just bad. Will not ever go back
rationale: The reviewer expresses disappointment with their experience, stating that the fish fry they ordered was overcooked and bad. Additionally, they emphasize that they will not return to the restaurant in the future. This indicates a strong sense of dissatisfaction with the quality of the food and overall experience, leading to a negative sentiment.

question: Old Country Buffet is above average as far as American buffets go. If you're in the mood for it, it's pretty tasty.
rationale: The review describes Old Country Buffet as above average and pretty tasty, indicating that the overall dining experience was positive. The reviewer acknowledges that the food is enjoyable if you're in the mood for it, suggesting that there are satisfying options available. Additionally, the use of terms like "above average" and "pretty tasty" conveys a favorable impression, showcasing a positive sentiment towards Old Country Buffet.

question: For those that like an abundance of mediocre food that is poorly cooked than this is the place to be. For those that actually like good food I would suggest another restaurant and preferably not a chain.  \n\nThe only saving grace was the frozen yogurt and the fried shrimp.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the review mentions that the food is mediocre and poorly cooked, which are not qualities one would look for in a dining experience. The suggestion to try another restaurant, particularly a non-chain one, indicates a lack of satisfaction with the quality of the food. The only positive aspects mentioned are the frozen yogurt and fried shrimp, which suggests that the overall experience was disappointing.

question: This buffest reminded me of a Las Vegas buffet except all the food gave me heartburn.  I'd been to a hometown buffet before so when my bf suggested it I relied on my memory of the experience and agreed to go.  Unfortunately my memory must have been jilted by the occasion or this Hometown Buffet was just bad, I dont know.  what I do know is that the food is cheap, about 10$ per person.  It is also soft.  And by this i mean everything is overcooked.  And it all gave me heartburn that lasted all day.  So will I be back?  Maybe in about 10 years when I've forgotten about this experience.
rationale: The sentiment is Negative because the reviewer had a negative experience at the buffet. They mentioned that the food gave them heartburn, everything was overcooked, and they felt unsure about returning in the future. These factors contribute to an overall negative impression of the dining experience.

question: I have been to this hometown buffet multiple times, a lot for family holidays. Recently we moved to California, went to a hometown buffet here, and were severely disappointed. Hopefully we won't get food poisoning, but it isn't looking very promising I wanted to write a review on the Madison one since it is sooo much better. \n\nFirst off, great selection of food! Beyond great. I don't think I have tasted something I didn't like. We normally always have the same waiter, his name is Carlos, and he is great! The manager Tony is THE BEST! Seriously! I miss going to this place.
rationale: The sentiment in the review is positive because the user highlights the great selection of food at the hometown buffet in Madison, enjoys the service provided by the waiter and manager there, and expresses missing the experience at that particular location. They specifically mention enjoying the food and having a positive interaction with the staff, which contributes to an overall positive perception of the establishment.

question: @holverson: SCREW YOU Valvoline Instant Oil Change! I schedule a 3 hr appt. & you close without canceling. Make me drive 1 hr w/kids. You suck!! #FAIL
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the user expressed frustration and anger towards Valvoline Instant Oil Change for closing without canceling their scheduled appointment. They highlighted the inconvenience of having to drive for an hour with kids, and overall conveyed a sense of dissatisfaction with the situation, stating that Valvoline Instant Oil Change "suck" and adding a #FAIL hashtag.

question: Wow this place is the suck.  We ate there twice.  The first time the tofu was massively burned to a crisp and the second time I found a rusty fishing hook in my pasta bowl.  WTF??  I've eaten at other locations and they are just fine, but this one must have bad staff and management problems because they are the SUCK.  Stay away.
