Are east siders so beholden to their institutions that they are afraid to be critical of poor value, and sub par food? Service was service... nothing memorable, but then again I'm not expecting expert service at a place that serves soda in a plastic cup. Sorry if I sound bitter, but I'm really starting to get irritated w/ all this Madison dining nonsense. I have yet to be really thrilled by what I eat. Oh, and who toasts a hot dog bun? Cooking school 101 will tell you the bun will fall apart.
rationale: The sentiment of this review is negative because the writer expresses disappointment and frustration with their dining experience. They feel that the turkey club sandwich they ordered was overpriced for the quality and quantity of ingredients provided. The writer also criticizes the service and small details like serving soda in a plastic cup. Overall, the review conveys a sense of dissatisfaction and a lack of enthusiasm for the food and overall experience at the restaurant, leading to a negative sentiment.

question: Corned beef hash, please marry me. You come with eggs, fruit, and a delicious biscuit. You are potatoey and oniony and wonderful. \n\nCoconut cream pie, you make my booty more bootylicious. Mmm.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer expresses strong admiration and affection towards the food items mentioned. They use phrases like "please marry me," "wonderful," and "make my booty more bootylicious" to convey their enjoyment and satisfaction with the corned beef hash and coconut cream pie. Overall, the reviewer's comments convey a sense of delight and pleasure, indicating a positive sentiment.

question: My wife and I have been here twice and have loved it each time!  This is not only a nice place to go if you're craving something vegetarian.  They have great sandwiches and bowls that are enjoyable,  The pies are usually fantastic!  So many choices...I don't think you can go wrong.  For a place that looks like your classic greasy diner, it offers a more home-cooked feel with a veggie vibe.  Definitely worth checking out!
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the review highlights multiple positive aspects of the restaurant experience, such as enjoying the food during both visits, the variety of tasty options, the quality of the sandwiches, bowls, and pies, and the welcoming ambiance with a homely and veggie-friendly atmosphere. The reviewer expresses enthusiasm and satisfaction with their experiences, suggesting that the restaurant is worth visiting.

question:
I love Monty's. The atmosphere is kitschy and cool, and they have something for everyone (even the vegetarians and picky eaters).

The wait can be a little on the excessive side, so don't hold off until you're hungry. 

I never manage to save room for dessert, but I hear the pies are excellent.
rationale: The review expresses several positive aspects of the restaurant, such as the atmospheric charm, diverse menu options catering to different dietary preferences, and the high quality of the pies mentioned for dessert. Despite mentioning a relatively long wait time, the reviewer's overall tone remains positive, indicating that it is a place they enjoy and have positive experiences with.

question:
They always have better than average waitstaff. They have plenty of vegetarian options for classic diner food that they do very well. Many other places try to awkwardly replace meat with tofu and end up failing. Monty's mostly knows when to use seitan, beans, walnut burgers, tofu and has a nice variety.

They're often busy, so don't go if you can't wait. Some of the dishes are phenomenal and some are simply okay. I think it makes getting an average dish more disappointing when last time, you got something so wonderful, but c'est la vie. Remember what you like and see what others have enjoyed. (TNT BLT is amazing, the Sheldon is meh.)

Also, remember to eat your dessert first, the portions are generous and you don't want to miss out on such an important part of the meal.
rationale: The sentiment is Positive because the review highlights several strengths of the restaurant, such as having a well-trained waitstaff, offering a variety of delicious vegetarian options, and serving generous portions. The reviewer acknowledges that while some dishes may be average, they still find some dishes to be phenomenal. Additionally, the reviewer recommends specific menu items that they enjoyed, showing an overall positive experience at the restaurant.

question:
Monty's is one of my fave brunch-or-lunch places, especially on lazy weekends when I want breakfast food at 2pm but do not want big-chain food.  They have a wide array of something for everyone from vegan offerings to biscuits and gravy to slices of cake taller than your head, and it's all tasty.  

It does get really crowded at peak times, and the service can be hit-or-miss to an extreme:  sometimes I've gotten a server who hangs around making hilarious jokes and sometimes I've been in parties that were actually forgotten about after we were seated and then have the orders wrong when we finally did get our food (although the bad service is definitely more rare than the good).  

All-in-all the tasty food and the kitschy atmosphere make it worth the wait.
rationale:
The sentiment is positive because the review highlights several positive aspects of the restaurant:

1. The reviewer mentions that Monty's is one of their favorite brunch/lunch places, indicating a high level of satisfaction with their dining experience.
2. They appreciate the wide array of menu offerings catering to different dietary preferences, indicating that the restaurant goes above and beyond to please all customers.
3. Despite occasional service issues, the reviewer acknowledges that the tasty food and kitschy atmosphere make the overall experience worth it, emphasizing that the positives outweigh the negatives.
4. The reviewer concludes by stating that the restaurant is worth the wait, reinforcing their overall positive sentiment towards Monty's.

question:
Love this place. Gets crowded around the normal brunch time, so go early or go late. Otherwise, it's probably going to be at least a 30 minute wait.

Huge portions. Love their omelets. Lots of vegetarian options (if that's your thing - not mine). Haven't tried their desserts, but they always look tasty.

Service: Good. I've always had very nice servers. And I'm willing to cut them slack since they're always really busy. Plus they're pretty quick with the coffee refills.
Environment: Old school diner feel - with booths and stools! Doesn't feel cramped even when it gets crowded.

Side notes: I LOVE diners. Also, if you eat the biscuit, you're a fatty.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is positive because the reviewer shares their love for the place, enjoys the food offering mentioning huge portions and delicious omelets, appreciates the vegetarian options available, and has positive comments about the service provided by the servers. Additionally, the reviewer describes the environment as having an "Old school diner feel" and mentions that even when it gets crowded, it doesn't feel cramped. Overall, the reviewer has highlighted several positive aspects of the restaurant, making the sentiment of the review positive.

question: Hash was a smash for me. Also Tim the owner sang us a Dylan song. Great biscuits, also liked the potatoes. It is a must try if you are in Mad-town.
rationale: The review contains multiple positive statements - "Hash was a smash," "Great biscuits," "liked the potatoes," "must try." The reviewer also mentions enjoying a performance by the owner and overall had a good experience at the restaurant. These positive comments and the enthusiastic language used throughout the review indicate a positive sentiment.

question: Fantastic vegetarian and nonvegetarian food alike, great ice cream, adult beverage selection is to die for. Bloody mary's on a sunday morning? Yes please.
rationale: The review highlights multiple positive aspects of the restaurant, such as fantastic vegetarian and non-vegetarian food, great ice cream, and an excellent adult beverage selection. The mention of a Bloody Mary on a Sunday morning adds to the positive tone, suggesting a enjoyable and satisfying dining experience. Overall, the review conveys strong enthusiasm and satisfaction with the various offerings at the restaurant, leading to a positive sentiment.

question: Great service and atmosphere.  The food is good - comfort food for the soul.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the review mentions great service and atmosphere, indicating a pleasant overall experience. Additionally, the food is described as good and comforting, emphasizing a positive association with the dining experience. The use of words like "great" and "comfort food for the soul" further support the positive sentiment expressed in the review.

question: Really cool & interesting veggie options, cool atmosphere, nice area, what more could you ask for? They even have a giant selection of pies! Voted best veggie restaurant in madison, but half of the menu or more isnt veggie, so everyone will be happy. Check it out.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the review highlights the positive aspects of the restaurant, such as the cool and interesting veggie options, a nice atmosphere, a good location, and a diverse menu that caters to both vegetarians and non-vegetarians. The mention of a giant selection of pies also adds to the excitement, suggesting a wide variety of offerings for customers to enjoy. Overall, the reviewer seems genuinely pleased with their experience and recommends others to check it out, making it a positive review.

question: Won best greasy spoon in Madison, yet has vegan options and bean salad as an alternative to fries! Yes, a great retro diner, but with modern options. And a dessert case. Awesome!
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the review highlights the positive aspects of the diner, such as winning an award, offering vegan options and bean salad as alternatives, having modern options in addition to its retro vibe, and having a dessert case. The use of words like "awesome" further emphasizes the positive impression the diner has left on the reviewer.

question: Yum.\n\nHave been here a few times, and have never left disappointed. It's an easy choice on my \"vegan\" days when I still want something that feels sort of bad for you and diner-y (versus Green Owl, which is fantastic but sometimes feels TOO healthy). All the sandwhiches I've tried have been great, and the pie is SOOO good - especially any one with peanut butter in it. Service can be a little slow and invisible, at times, but the food makes it totally worth it. Looking forward to hitting it up again in the fall.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer had consistently good experiences at the restaurant, mentioning that they have never left disappointed. They specifically enjoyed the food, highlighting the sandwiches and pies as great options, especially praising those with peanut butter. Even though the service was noted to be slow at times, the overall positive experiences with the food make it worth the wait for the reviewer. Additionally, the reviewer expresses eagerness to visit the restaurant again in the future, indicating a positive impression overall.

question:
Oh my why didn't I review this place, like, a year ago?  

What's not to like about Monty's.  The only bad thing (which is really a great thing) is all menu choices, especially if you're a vegetarian.  It's sort of scaled-up-diner-food-meets-comfort-food, then add a fair share healthy options.  And great prices.  And great service.  Although it's not on Willy St. it still has the same friendly neighborhood atmosphere.  

So I've been to Monty's twice, both times late morning, and was seated and served quickly.  The first visit a friend and I split the spinach and feta omelet which was great and large enough for both of us, and a third friend had the salmon hash.  After our meal Monty himself (well, not sure if it was the Real Monty, so lets say the chef) came out to ask us how our meal was.  The second visit I went with a lunch item and ordered chicken fried steak, also great and the portions were easily enough for two people.  Once again Monty came out and greeted his diners!  Ordered a piece of Fat Elvis cake to go, which is banana cake layered with peanut butter fudge icing and topped with chocolate icing. Yum!
rationale: The review expresses overall satisfaction with Monty's restaurant, highlighting various positive aspects such as a wide range of menu choices, vegetarian options, reasonable prices, great service, and a friendly neighborhood atmosphere. The reviewer also praises the quality and portions of the food they tried, indicating that they enjoyed both their visits and appreciated the personal touch of Monty (or the chef) coming out to check on their dining experience. Additionally, the reviewer mentions the delicious Fat Elvis cake they ordered to go. These positive comments and detailed descriptions indicate a favorable sentiment towards Monty's, making the overall sentiment of the review Positive.

question:
In my opinion, almost all restaurants in the Madison area are bland. People may hate me for thinking it, but I don't care. There's no spice, little flavor, and it's gotten to the point where I just don't really go out, because I'm sick of wasting my money on mediocre food.

It got to the point where I thought my tastebuds were dying.

Enter Monty's Blue Plate. I had the meatless loaf sammich, and it was awesome, though it tasted nothing like meatloaf. The waffle fries? delicious. The dipping sauce? Don't even think of stealing a dip. I will bite you.

There was so much I wanted. I will be back, perhaps tomorrow. I will find excuses to wander to the east side, then say "While I'm here, I might as well hit Monty's".

All-in-all, Monty's is making my life better. Thank you Monty's.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer expresses strong enthusiasm and appreciation for Monty's Blue Plate restaurant. They highlight the delicious food and express a desire to return, even planning future visits. The reviewer's tone is enthusiastic and grateful, indicating a positive experience that has made their life better.

question: Eh. This place is \"fine\". I'm not terribly impressed with it. I could probably get better breakfast somewhere else. Plus its ALWAYS so so so busy in there. I like that they have a ton of vegetarian options. Which is rare for breakfast places. But meh. Its not amazing food.
rationale: The sentiment is Negative because the reviewer expresses disappointment and lack of enthusiasm about the place. They are not impressed with the food quality, find the restaurant to be always busy, and although they appreciate the vegetarian options, they overall consider the food to be average at best. The use of words like "meh" and "not amazing" further emphasize the lack of positive sentiment.

question:
Pros:
Vegetarian Meatloaf of the Gods (with a yummy peanut gravy)
Lots of cakes/pies

Cons:
Slow and often rude service
Awful bloody maries (suuper salty) 
Overcooked poached eggs
Is it just me or is it always cold in there?
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the review outlines several issues with the dining experience, such as slow and rude service, oversalted drinks, overcooked food, and discomfort due to the temperature being too cold. These factors contribute to an overall negative impression of the restaurant.

question: Great place, I visited there this weekend and the service was blazing fast. I had the goat cheese chicken sandwich and it was excellent!
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer praised the service as "blazing fast" and described the goat cheese chicken sandwich as "excellent." Additionally, the reviewer mentioned enjoying their visit over the weekend, further indicating their satisfaction with their experience at the place.

question:
What a great place for brunch, not to mention filling!

I've only been there once, but had to try it because I kept getting so many recommendations. I had the chicken salad sandwich, not to saucy or creamy, and fresh. It had chopped chicken and salad on a ciabatta roll. it had a great flavor. I also switched out the fries for the house potatoes, which were also very good!

My boyfriend decided to go with breakfast and had the Huevos Rancheros, he loved it and said he would definitely get it again. He's a picky eater so if he says something like that I trust that the food is good. 

I also ordered one of their specialty milk shakes with coffee in it. What an amazing drink!!! 

I would definitely go back over and over again! And I'll wait with no problem because that usually means that the food is worth it...
rationale: The sentiment is Positive because the reviewer had an overall excellent experience at the brunch place. They highlighted the delicious food, including the chicken salad sandwich and Huevos Rancheros, as well as the specialty milkshake they enjoyed. The reviewer also expressed willingness to return multiple times, indicating high satisfaction with the food and service. Additionally, the fact that the reviewer's picky eater boyfriend loved his dish adds further validation to the positive sentiment.

question:
The service is excellent, the atmosphere a time capsule of a 50s diner & the food is some of the best diner fair I've ever had. 

The Meatloaf is called the "Meatloaf of the Gods," and it truly is. I don't even like Meatloaf and I literally savored each bite of this culinary masterpiece. It is extremely filling because it is made with nutrient rich local meat, savory vegetables & topped with the best gravy I've ever tasted. Yum!  For $10, how can't it be "As good as it gets?"

If you like pie, also make sure to get a slice. It is delicious!
rationale: The sentiment is Positive because the review highlights several aspects of the experience that were enjoyable, such as the excellent service, nostalgic atmosphere, and delicious food. The reviewer specifically praises the Meatloaf, describing it as a culinary masterpiece that exceeded their expectations. Additionally, they mention the high quality and filling nature of the dish, along with the delicious gravy. The mention of the affordable price point further reinforces the positive sentiment. Overall, the reviewer's enthusiasm for the food and the dining experience conveys a positive impression.

question: Gross, disgusting, rip-off. This place makes me seriously doubt the Madisonian palate. I had a cheeseburger from here a few nights ago. I asked for medium - which to Monty's means completely raw in random spots. Aside from the random rawness, the burger tasted like it was over seasoned with pepper. The meat was of absolute shit quality, the bottom bun was soggy (probably from undercooked meat juices), and I did get it to go. Thanks for the ketchup and mustard packets - now that's classy. I have no reason to set foot in this place. Every experience I've had up to point makes me wonder why I bothered to return one more time. Maybe there's something wrong with my palate, but to be honest, I'm pretty certain that there's not. East side institution? What a joke!
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer had a very unpleasant experience at the restaurant. The food was described as raw in spots, over seasoned, and of poor quality. Additionally, the reviewer was dissatisfied with the presentation of the meal, as well as the lack of attention to detail in providing condiments. Their overall dissatisfaction with multiple aspects of their visit, coupled with a sarcastic tone in their review, clearly indicates a negative sentiment towards the restaurant.

question:
Monty's is one of the many mind-boggling Food Fight restaurants that is a Madison favorite despite serving mediocre food. 

I've eaten one good dish here: the TNT BLT (tempeh and tomato). And the chocolate shake is good if you need to consume an extraordinary number of calories on any given day.

The last time I went, I did so because a friend told me the restaurant is attempting to make a switch to more sustainability-conscious, organic food. I ordered chili that was pretty much inedible. On another night, my boyfriend ordered a soup that was, again, inedible. 

I can imagine that people like to come here because the restaurant resembles an old-school diner and has booths, which are fun for kids to sit in. But the food quality is generally average to poor. The brunch I've had is tasteless and limited, and you are not getting fresh eggs unless you order them over easy. 

The only reason I give Monty's two stars is because its pies are great. And once in a while, I can stomach a TNT BLT because someone I'm with persuades me to give Monty's one . . . more . . . try.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the review highlights several issues with Monty's restaurant, such as serving mediocre and inedible food, limited and tasteless brunch options, and the lack of fresh ingredients. The reviewer also mentions that the only redeeming qualities are the pies and one good dish, but overall, the food quality is described as average to poor. These points contribute to an overall negative sentiment towards the restaurant.

question: Yucky greasy food.
rationale: The sentiment is Negative because the food is described as "yucky" and "greasy," both of which are typically negative attributes associated with poor quality and unappetizing taste.

question:
A late night dessert run with my pregnant bestie led to a Monty's revelation:
They now serve (organic, classy) Sassy Cow ice cream, have even nicer and more delectable cheesecakes and their brownie sundae puts the Ella's Sparkled Kazoo to shame. 

Post-brownie sundae, bestie's baby to-be kicked. 

I think it was the hot fudge.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer describes their experience as a pleasant and enjoyable one. They mention discovering new and improved dessert options at Monty's, noting the delicious ice cream, cheesecakes, and brownie sundae. Additionally, the mention of the bestie's baby kicking after enjoying the dessert adds a heartwarming and joyful element to the review, implying a sense of happiness and satisfaction. Overall, the positive language used to describe the food and the happy ending with the baby kicking contribute to the positive sentiment of the review.

question: Its a great place.  Both me and my wife thought it had a great summer feel in the 50s.  What's nice about it is that it has a Madison vegetarian twist.  If we would've been hungrier the pies looked amazing but our bellies had reached their capacity.\n\nOverall quality, its traditional american diner feel w/ a twist of Madison.  Great spot for a sit down lunch on a road trip.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer expresses enjoyment and appreciation for the place they visited. They mention the great summer feel, the Madison vegetarian twist, and the amazing pies, all of which contribute to their positive experience at the diner. The reviewer also praises the overall quality and atmosphere, indicating that it's a great spot for a sit-down lunch, which further supports the positive sentiment.

question: One of our favorite Madison restaurants!  Great food (most of the time) and fast.  The non-booth side feels like a cafeteria, though, since the tables are so close together.  Great desserts too!
rationale: The sentiment is Positive because the review highlights the restaurant's great food, fast service, and enjoyable desserts which are all positive aspects of the dining experience. Even though there is a minor critique about the seating arrangement, overall, the reviewer seems to have a favorable opinion of the restaurant.

question:
We've eaten at Monty's a number of times and have always had good food there.   Service has also been good to excellent.   The veggie quesadilla is quite good.   Their prices are a little higher than we would like.
Bathroom and restaurant is very clean. 
When we are in the mood for something vegetarian Monty's is a safe bet.
I wouldn't really say I'm a fan but they do enough right to get 4 stars.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the review highlights several positive points about the restaurant, such as having good food and good to excellent service, cleanliness of the bathroom and restaurant, and the quality of the veggie quesadilla. Despite mentioning that the prices are a little higher than preferred and not being a super fan, the reviewer acknowledges that Monty's does enough right to warrant a 4-star rating. Overall, the positive aspects outweigh the minor negatives mentioned in the review.

question: Been several times and always the same. Fun space, menu reads very well and you expect to get a great meal, but food is totally plain and unexciting. All hat, not cattle.  Don't waste the time or money, many better options around town.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the customer had high expectations based on the fun atmosphere and enticing menu descriptions, but was ultimately disappointed by the plain and unexciting food. The customer felt that the restaurant did not live up to its potential and expressed dissatisfaction with their overall experience, concluding that there are better dining options available.

question: Disregard the sniffy reviews by food snobs; Monty's is great at being what it is, a nouveau diner with an eclectic menu, welcoming to old and young, hipster and square, LGBT and straight,etc. Great breakfast items (French toast,omelettes, scramblers, pancakes) available around the clock, lots of comfort food veg and non-veg dishes (\"meatloaf of the gods\" enchiladas, chili, etc.). Everything is freshly prepared with good ingredients. Not to mention the delicious pies and cakes..coffee is meh but that's par for diners. Prices are reasonable, two can be stuffed for $30. Friendly service by the mostly college student/artsy young person staff. If you're looking for a good solid (but not fancy-shmancy) meal on the E. Side of Madison, can't do better than Monty's.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the review highlights various aspects of Monty's that are praised by the reviewer. They mention that the restaurant is inclusive and welcoming to diverse customers, offers a wide variety of delicious menu items, uses good quality ingredients, and provides reasonable prices. Additionally, the review emphasizes the friendly service and mentions the positive atmosphere created by the staff. Overall, the reviewer appreciates the overall experience at Monty's, making it a positive sentiment.

question:
Here's a lil story about SWEET potato corned beef hash. 

Monty's will make it for you if you ask nicely. 

The end.

Alright that was the short version for those with an inability to read more than a few lines... here's the lengthier more tasty version! 

After having some lunchie and being pleasantly surprised by their afternoon eats, I decided it was time to give MBPD a try for brekkie. Holy options batman. This isn't your typical eggs, griddle, sausage type of place. They have some really inspired creations, and it was hard for me to pick between two. The corned beef hash (served with typical white potatoes and the sweet potato hash... more interesting taters but no meat) Hold up, wait a minute, how do you get both? You ask nicely. Really nicely. And low and behold moments later I had a plate of blended potato perfection and some chipped meat. It was rad. Deliciously rad. And served with amazing fruit, not just crappy melon as is typical during morning meal time and the best I'M TALKING THE BEST biscuit I've ever eaten. And I'm a guy who's had a few biscuits in his day, so trust. 

Now don't going running over there saying, "Corey said, Corey said!" But if you happen to get a nice server and you happen to strike up some nice conversation nicely ask for hot tuber take on their standards. And be nice if they charge you a little more. They're combining two dishes to make you happy after all. 

Nice.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the review describes the experience at Monty's with enthusiasm and excitement. The reviewer uses phrases like "Holy options batman," "rad," and "Deliciously rad" to convey their enjoyment of the food and the unique offerings at the restaurant. Additionally, they recommend being nice and asking for a customized dish, which they found to be delicious and satisfying. Overall, the review expresses a positive and satisfied tone towards Monty's and their menu options.

question: Always loved this place, but last time we tried it had a terrible experience.  Wanted to order fish and was told they no longer served it.  About 5 minutes later the same waitress brings out a huge fish plate for the lady next to us.  We are like \" What the HECK\" ????  Needless to say if we are not good enough to eat what anyone else gets, then we are taking our business else where.  The food that we got was not that great this time anyway.
rationale: The sentiment in the review is negative because the customer had a bad experience at the restaurant. They were disappointed that the menu had changed without proper notification, leading to confusion and a sense of being treated unfairly. The customer felt disrespected and ultimately decided to take their business elsewhere due to the unpleasant experience and the perceived inconsistency in service. Additionally, they mentioned that the food they did receive was not up to their expectations, further contributing to their negative sentiment.

question:
I love diners.  I love Monty's.  I especially love the pie porn lingering on the other side of the glass so you can just gaze with wonder as you wait for your cibo.  

I ordered the Italian grilled cheese which had an exorbitant amount of cheese.  Seriously could have served a whole Italian family, that's how much mozzarella was squished in there.  Tasty? Hell yes.  

Alcohol is offered, wine and beer galore.  Woohoo!
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer expresses love for both diners and Monty's, indicates excitement about the experience (such as admiring the pie selection and the abundance of cheese in their sandwich), and positively evaluates the taste of the food by describing it as "tasty" and expressing enthusiasm with "Hell yes." Additionally, the mention of alcohol offerings and the enthusiastic "Woohoo!" at the end further suggests an overall positive impression of the dining experience.

question: One of my favorite breakfast places in Madison.  The salmon hash is a dream.  And Tim bakes the best biscuits in town!
rationale: The sentiment is Positive because the user expresses enthusiasm and satisfaction with the breakfast place in their review. They mention the salmon hash being a dream and Tim baking the best biscuits in town, indicating that they had a great dining experience and enjoyed the food.

question: good breakfast !! good service !! good place if your in Madison
rationale: The review expresses satisfaction with the breakfast, service, and overall experience at the place in Madison. The use of multiple exclamation points and positive adjectives like "good" indicate that the reviewer had a highly enjoyable experience, leading to a positive sentiment overall.

question: Walnut Burger is the way to go.. Their bean salad as a side option is Delish. Not expensive, long waits on weekends in the mornings but worth it.
rationale: The review mentions that the Walnut Burger is recommended and the bean salad is delicious as a side option. Additionally, the reviewer notes that the restaurant is not expensive, despite potential long waits on weekends, making it worth the visit. Overall, the positive descriptions of the food quality, affordability, and the acknowledgment of the wait times suggest a positive sentiment towards the dining experience at Walnut Burger.

question: I love that this diner offers vegetarian/vegan options. Perfect for me and my omnivore hubby. Our waitress was great, too.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the review highlights the positive aspects of the diner, such as offering vegetarian/vegan options, which cater to the reviewer's dietary preferences. Additionally, the reviewer mentions that the waitress was great, further contributing to their positive experience at the diner.

question: I'm sad to say that after a really great first experience over one year ago, Friday night's dinner at Monty's was very disappointing and I probably won't come back any time soon.  The host at the counter was not friendly.  My sandwich came on bread that was literally hard as a rock and then my husband was done eating before I even started my dinner because I sent it back and waited for new bread. The bread the second time around was greasy and the sandwich itself was dripping in grease.  GROSS.  My husband ordered the fish fry and they forgot part of his order.  It was just a bad day for Monty's....I might be back for dessert someday.
rationale: The sentiment in the review is negative because the customer had multiple negative experiences during their dining visit to Monty's. They encountered unfriendly service from the host, received a sandwich with hard bread and then greasy bread upon replacement, and had to wait while their husband finished eating due to the delay in getting a proper meal. Additionally, the customer's husband experienced missing parts of his order. These issues collectively made for a disappointing dining experience, leading the customer to express their dissatisfaction and indicate hesitance to return in the near future.

question: This place is always excellent.    I've never left unhappy.    Even amongst so many good offerings in Madison, this diner stands out.   Plan your arrival carefully though, as there is often a long wait for tables.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the review highlights how the diner consistently delivers an excellent experience, with the customer never leaving unhappy. Additionally, the diner is praised for standing out among the many good offerings in Madison. While mentioning a potential issue with wait times, the overall tone is still positive, emphasizing the quality and reputation of the establishment.

question: Stopped here for dinner before going out. Our server was friendly and efficient. The 50's diner motif was cute. Tons of vegetarian and gluten free options if you're into that sort of thing. I had the roasted turkey club and it was tasty. Awesome dessert options too so save room!
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the user had a good experience at the restaurant. They highlighted the friendly and efficient server, the cute 50's diner atmosphere, the variety of vegetarian and gluten-free options, and the tasty turkey club sandwich. Additionally, they mentioned the awesome dessert options, indicating an overall enjoyable dining experience.

question:
I had something to celebrate and hadn't been able to eat meat since watching a food documentary a few weeks prior, so Monty's seemed like the appropriate celebratory location.  I ordered their special: teriyaki tofu with peas, coconut, peppers and peanuts, served with a side of fresh pita.  The description was a little clunky--there were other ingredients in the dish description that I've since forgotten--and I got a kick out of listening to the waitress explain it to other patrons.  During a short wait, I sipped a heavenly hot chocolate.  My husband isn't a hot chocolate fan but agreed that it was really, really good.  FYI: they'll make it with soy milk if you ask.  After the food arrived it took me two seconds to realize that the tofu was the best I'd ever tasted.  Tender, flavorful, caramelized on the outside.  The sauce was a little saltier than I prefer, but still quite good.  The pita had good texture and a nice, buttery taste.  My husband enjoyed the traditional-type burger he ordered.  Our only disappointment is that we didn't save room for dessert.

Other observations:
-Going early helped avoid parking lot anxiety--they get Busy here.
-Our red-haired waitress was friendly, intelligent, and overall awesome.  Noting that I had ordered soy milk hot chocolate, she advised that the teriyaki tofu meal is prepared with a small amount of dairy.
-Staff brought water to a puppy who was sitting outside with his humans.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is positive because the reviewer had a delightful dining experience at Monty's. They enjoyed the unique teriyaki tofu dish, highlighted the tasty hot chocolate, complimented the attentive service, and appreciated the welcoming gesture towards a puppy. Despite a minor preference regarding saltiness of the sauce, the overall tone of the review reflects satisfaction with the food, atmosphere, and service, making it a positive review overall.

question: So, it's not like this place was ever gonna make it outta my e-gutter, cuz there's nothing really redeeming about it. You know, sometimes a craving makes one act desperately... sometimes against one's better knowledge. Nevertheless, I make my way to Monty's one fine day, craving some sort of ice-cream based treat, similar to a beverage, but of a thicker consistency. Nothing special, just some plain old ice cream and say, caramel. It was $6.38?! Okay, so I go into a Vincent Vega state of mind, zoning out while the shake's bein' made thinking to myself \"Did I just order a six-dollars n' 38 cent shake? Sure did. A shake? Milk, ice cream, caramel? Uh-huh. Six-dollars n' 38 cents? Yep. They don't put bourbon in it or anything? Nope. Just checking... smh... Whoa, WHAT?! When it came up, it was in a small, flimsy styro cup, with a sad lil' wafer sticking out the top. Wait... did they just charge me like that much for this??? Ugh! I was so pissed, I told em' keep it, n' got my money back. I can get Culver's or Michael's for like, way better... Even the Chocolate Shoppe, or like, buy your own pint and a gallon of milk, stir in some Smucker's flavoring and have change to spare... I don't even know why people like this place. Dude, seriously...
rationale: The sentiment of the review is Negative because the customer had a disappointing experience at Monty's. The high price of $6.38 for a simple ice cream treat with caramel felt unjustified to them, especially when considering the underwhelming presentation in a flimsy cup with a small wafer. The customer ultimately felt cheated and upset, expressing frustration and a sense of being overcharged for a subpar product. They also compared Monty's unfavorably to other establishments and DIY alternatives, highlighting their dissatisfaction with the quality and value received.

question: Abundant vegan options, even for breakfast!  Food is above average, service was great, prices really low.\n\nThe sweet potato hash with tofu scramble was especially good.
rationale: The review praises the restaurant for its abundant vegan options, above-average food, great service, and low prices. The specific mention of the sweet potato hash with tofu scramble being especially good highlights a standout dish, reinforcing the positive sentiment. Overall, the positive tone of the review indicates a satisfying and enjoyable experience at the restaurant.

question:
Their banana pie and carrot cake are SUPER!!!!!!!
and if you happen to buy the whole container, you are required to give a 5-dollar deposit which will be returned if you bring it back.

Oh Monty, finally!
This morning, though I am still a little bit ill, I came only for you :) (and for me:))
Waiting for less than 10 minutes, we were seated by the window. A very nice spot. 

I decided quickly: I wanted to have a dish of scramble "something" (hahaha, I found this funny, I was wondering what "something" meant. I asked the server and she said it is for broccoli, pepper, some cheese (and God knows what else!-- too many to list! :D) and has no meat (yay!)
Hubby ordered a dish of pesto omelet! Both came with homemade biscuit- I'm in love with this biscuit right away! We enjoyed our brunch soooooooooooo much. 
I told the waiter: The food is excellent! I wanna come back soon!

The food is a five.
The service is a five.
Yes, full score for you, Monty. 

Sshhhhh, don't forget to also order their coffee and the donut.
The coffee is really an eye opener and the donut is ridiculously huge but so GOOD.

Monty has made my Saturday happy! and I really need that after one week of my illness :(
Mahalo, Monty!
rationale: The sentiment in the review is positive because the reviewer highly praises and appreciates the food, the service, and the overall experience at Monty's. They compliment the delicious banana pie and carrot cake, the quick seating by the window, the tasty dishes they ordered, and the friendly service from the staff. They express their excitement about returning to Monty's and are enthusiastic about the coffee and donut as well. The reviewer ends the review by stating that Monty's has made their Saturday happy, showing genuine gratitude and satisfaction with their visit despite feeling unwell previously. Overall, the review is filled with enthusiasm and compliments, highlighting a positive experience at Monty's.

question:
I don't understand why this place is popular.  The food was bad and the service was bad.  I ordered a burger medium well and got it medium rare.  After sending it back and getting another it was still medium/medium rare but I was too hungry to send it back again and lost all faith in their cooks.  I think they served it on the same plate with the same cold fries as before.  My friend ordered a breakfast dish and it was terrible.  The scrambled eggs were so overcooked they were hard and rubbery, the potatoes were very undercooked, and the biscuit was dry and literally had no flavor.  None.  The service seriously lacked as well.  No one was unfriendly, just incompetent.

We thought the dessert would redeem them but after paying so much for a single slice of cheesecake we couldn't even finish it.  One slice was dried out and the other cheesecake had too much sour cream - it was actually mushy and very sour, almost spoiled tasting.

Bottom line, I found this place to be mediocre at best, and that's being generous. There's tons of better restaurants in the area and in the city.  Never going back, and I think the food has made me ill.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the customer had a poor experience overall at the restaurant. They highlighted multiple issues with the food, such as incorrect cooking temperatures, undercooked and overcooked items, lack of flavor, and poor quality desserts. Additionally, they expressed dissatisfaction with the service, deeming it incompetent. The customer concluded that the restaurant was mediocre at best and stated they would not be returning, indicating a strong sense of disappointment and frustration with their dining experience.

question: I have been going here since the 90s and it has been up and down.  Some ok food, some terrible.  Once found fatty masses in my meatloaf.  Recently it has been just ok.  Inexpensive, pretty fast but low quality compared to other places on Willy street and mediocre compared to the many good options in Madison.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the review highlights inconsistent food quality over time, including instances of terrible food and finding unpleasant surprises like fatty masses in the meatloaf. The reviewer also mentions that the restaurant's food is lower in quality compared to other establishments on the same street and mediocre when compared to the wider range of dining options in Madison. These experiences and comparisons contribute to an overall negative impression of the restaurant.

question: It's unique diner food in a renovated old gas station. They have lots of  vegetarian options and a fantastic bakery!
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the review highlights the uniqueness of the diner food, the variety of vegetarian options available, and the praise for the fantastic bakery. These positive aspects indicate an overall enjoyable experience for the customer.

question:
Going to see a show or concert across the street at the Barrymore? Well, we all have to eat somewhere, why not Monty's? The first time I laid eyes on this joint, it was a few weeks ago after skipping dinner and going to Bo Burnham. I wondered if it was a bar or a restaurant, a week later, I found out that it's kind of both! It's a classic diner that happens to serve alcohol. I ordered and enjoyed the mushroom and swiss, but I came in on a mission. To order a burger. Their menu almost distracted me from my mission by offering breakfast all day. Oh, I shall return to conquer the idea of Breakfast for Dinner another time!

Waffle fries! need I say more on this topic? Well, its Yelp, so yes. Just the right amount of crispy and not too many. I also managed a dessert on my first visit, that portion size of the Oat Fudge Bar was enough for me to have skipped the fries or the burger, it was huge! Sadly there were nuts mixed in (personal preference), but that didn't stop me.

I didn't opt-in for a shake, but I should have. All I've learned about my visit is that I will have to make another trip before my next Barrymore concert!
rationale: The sentiment of the review is positive because the reviewer had an enjoyable experience at Monty's. They appreciated the ambiance of the place being a mix of a bar and a restaurant, enjoyed their mushroom and swiss dish, and expressed excitement about trying more items on the menu, such as the waffle fries and the dessert. Despite a personal preference issue with nuts in the dessert, the reviewer still found the experience satisfying and mentioned wanting to return for more. The overall tone of the review indicates that the reviewer had a good time and is looking forward to visiting again, reflecting a positive sentiment.

question:
Monty, thank you for saving my restaurant foody soul last night.
After a disastrous meal at another restaurant, I was crabby, mad, moody and wanting to go home.  Luckily we drove by the shining light of the Monty's sign and pulled in to the parking lot.  
Grabbed a seat at the counter and ordered a piece of pecan pie a la mode for myself and my husband.  Your hostess, waitress, bus staff were all polite, welcoming, and doing their jobs.  They refilled our coffee, checking on our food, did we need anything else?  THANK YOU!
The pie was delicious, the ice cream melted slowly into the pecan crust and became a delicious consoling comfort food. 
My congratulation on being a place that I have visited for over 10 years and still makes the mark of having great staff, great food and ambiance.  That turquoise counter has never felt so good to lean my elbows on as last night.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer expresses gratitude and appreciation towards Monty's restaurant for providing a pleasant dining experience after a previously disappointing one. The reviewer highlights the delicious food, attentive service from the staff, and the comforting ambiance of the restaurant. Overall, the reviewer commends Monty's for consistently maintaining high standards over the years, making it a reliable and enjoyable dining destination.

question:
Ok, this is bad news (for me and my waistline)... Second visit to Monte's was 1/27/14 for "dinner," although I was there for some breakfast vittles.

+ Breakfast ALL FREAKING DAY, EVERY FREAKING DAY - hip hip hooray
+ Excellent variety of breakfast grub
+ Reasonable prices

+ Servers have been friendly, efficient, and professional - just the right "warmth"
+ Atmosphere is classic diner; very familiar feel to it
+ Obviously shares a connection with Hubbard Ave Diner (both are FF restaurants)

+ Sweet Potato Hash: perfectly seasoned, nice slight char on the veggies, eggs were ever-so-slightly overcooked but still good
+ Breakfast Burrito: I'm a sucker for these things; chorizo is just a touch greasy; left a little film in the mouth, but that's chorizo for you... 
+ Good coffee, with speedy refills

I've heard the shakes and burgers are good; I'm too in love with the breakfast fare to venture to that side of the menu, but who knows... I'll give into temptation at some point, I'm sure.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer highlights several aspects of Monte's that they enjoyed, such as the availability of breakfast all day, excellent variety of breakfast options, reasonable prices, friendly and efficient servers, classic diner atmosphere, and the tasty dishes they tried like the Sweet Potato Hash and Breakfast Burrito. The reviewer also mentions their interest in trying the shakes and burgers in the future, indicating an overall positive outlook on their dining experiences at Monte's.

question: Nice atmosphere and fantastic food!  And I love their gluten free options.  They made things as we ordered them and the service was prompt and friendly.  This is a really nice \"diner\" with nice decor and a very friendly atmosphere.  The line was very long on Sunday morning but that's the sign of anything good because everyone wanted to eat there.  Nom nom, we'll be back! :)
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the review highlights several aspects that the customer enjoyed: the atmosphere, food quality, gluten-free options, friendly service, nice decor, and a welcoming atmosphere. The customer also expresses enthusiasm about returning, which indicates a high level of satisfaction with their dining experience. Overall, the review is filled with positive remarks and excitement about the restaurant, and the customer's positive language, such as "fantastic food," "prompt and friendly service," and eagerness to return, all contribute to the positive sentiment.

question:
This is just an average place. Its not bad. 
Parking is free, small lot but street parking around the area is possible.
Went there for brunch. 
Hippy looking teenage waitress was patronizing, Couldn't serve me a side of bacon with my Bloody Mary before my entree for whatever reason. 
Biscuit was dry, really nothing special. 
Salmon hash was average and not very many salmon pieces, mostly potatoes and onion. It was tasty none the less. Quantity was less than average. 
Bacon was just like what they serve at my hospital cafeteria, nothing special. 
There was a 25 minute wait which is always expected at a good brunch place. 
Bloody Mary was average as well. 

When I think of brunch I expect a quantity and quality as I am combining both meals. Here Quantity was slightly less than average, and quality was average. 



Noise level- Noisy, 

They take cards including AMEX

Have no idea why this place is so popular. Probably people haven't been to Original pancake house, much better service and far better food and cheaper too (they take only cash)
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer expresses disappointment with multiple aspects of their experience at the restaurant. They mention average food quality, limited quantity, patronizing service from the waitress, dry biscuit, average Bloody Mary, and noisy environment. The reviewer also compares the restaurant unfavorably to another establishment, highlighting the perceived shortcomings in terms of both service and quality of food. Overall, the feedback indicates a lackluster experience, contributing to the negative sentiment.

question: Everything about this place was mediocre. The food was mediocre, the ambiance was mediocre and the service was mediocre.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the review highlights several aspects of the experience as "mediocre," which typically indicates a lack of excellence or quality. The use of the word "mediocre" across all areas of the establishment - food, ambiance, and service - suggests a consistent underwhelming experience, leading to an overall negative perception of the place.

question: Great food and great atmosphere! Always fun!
rationale: The review expresses positive sentiment because it highlights the aspects of the experience that are enjoyable and satisfying, such as the great food and atmosphere. Additionally, the use of words like "fun" indicates that the overall experience was pleasant and enjoyable for the reviewer.

question:
Shut your mouth!  Meatloaf of the Gods!  There are three types of meat rolled into this meatloaf.  It comes with a red wine gravy, mashed potatoes and veggies.  All of this for $10.  Yup, a complete, well-rounded, mouth watering meal for just $10.  

The broccoli was blanched rather than steam.  So it was not mushy.  

The service is incredible.  The people are friendly and the food comes up fast.  I have nothing but good things to say.  On a date?  With family?  Have a small child?  Check this place out.  

They get desserts from a local bakery.  The carrot cake is ridiculous.  Are you full from your meal?  Take cake or pie to go.  Seriously, you will not regret a snack for later.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the review highlights the overall positive experience at the restaurant. The reviewer praises the variety and quality of the food, the reasonable price, the attentive service, and the friendly atmosphere. Additionally, the positive comments about the broccoli not being mushy and the delicious dessert options further contribute to the positive sentiment. The reviewer recommends the restaurant for various occasions, emphasizing that they have nothing but good things to say, which ultimately conveys a positive overall experience.

question: I love this place and go all the time. I am vegetarian and it is a great spot to eat with my meat eating friends. It has a good mix of veggie friendly food and meaty dishes.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer expresses love for the place and mentions that they go all the time, indicating a high level of satisfaction. They also appreciate the restaurant's ability to cater to both vegetarian and meat-eating preferences, highlighting its versatility and inclusivity. The mix of veggie-friendly and meaty dishes suggests a diverse menu that appeals to a wide range of diners, further contributing to the positive sentiment.

question: great diner with good veggie and vegan options.\noverall very nice staff, friendly, prompt\ngreat desserts!
rationale: The review highlights several positive aspects of the diner, such as good veggie and vegan options, nice and friendly staff, prompt service, and great desserts. These positive remarks collectively contribute to an overall positive sentiment. The reviewer seems satisfied with their experience, making it clear that they had a good time at the diner.

question: One of my Madison favorites.  Always something new to try.  Good staff, offbeat atmosphere, great service and food.  However I will note that not everyone I bring here has enjoyed their food... I think I talked it up too much.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer acknowledges that the restaurant is one of their favorites with always something new to try, good staff, offbeat atmosphere, great service, and good food. Despite some people not enjoying their meal, the reviewer's overall experience and opinion of the restaurant is positive, highlighting the positive aspects that they have personally enjoyed.

question: The biscuits and gravy on Saturday mornings is delicious.  By far the best thing on the menu, in my opinion.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer expressed enjoyment and satisfaction with the biscuits and gravy, describing it as delicious and the best item on the menu in their opinion. Their positive words indicate that they had a pleasant experience with the dish, leading to a positive sentiment.

question: Came in for brunch today and had a very nice experience.  I really like their d\u00e9cor, classic diner style.  I got the Meatloaf and oh my goodness it was so AMAZING! The homemade gravy was to die for!  My friend got the Egg Mornay I didn't try it but it looked delicious.  Our server Eric was also amazing! I will definitely be returning soon, for a first time experience I give five stars! \n\nAs a side note as we were walking out every single employee that we passes said, \"Thank you, have a great day.\"
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer had a very nice experience, enjoyed the delicious meatloaf with homemade gravy, liked the decor of the diner, and received excellent service from their server Eric. Additionally, the reviewer mentioned that all the employees they passed on their way out were polite and thanked them, contributing to an overall positive dining experience. The reviewer expressed an intention to return and gave a rating of five stars, indicating high satisfaction with their visit.

question: I love this place! They have amazing cheesecakes, breakfast options and yummy sammies. My favorite thing to eat is the grilled chicken and goat cheese sandwich! The flavors are so fresh and work well. I also love to sneak raspberry cheesecake when I am done ;)
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer expresses love for the place and highlights the amazing cheesecakes, breakfast options, and sandwiches available. They mention specific items they enjoy, such as the grilled chicken and goat cheese sandwich and raspberry cheesecake. Their use of words like "amazing," "yummy," and "love" conveys a high level of satisfaction with the food offerings. Overall, the review indicates a positive experience and a strong preference for the restaurant.

question: Love the BLT
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the review expresses a strong and simple endorsement of the BLT sandwich. The use of "love" indicates a high level of satisfaction and enjoyment, suggesting that the reviewer had a great experience with the BLT. Additionally, the BLT is a classic and well-loved sandwich, so a positive review like this is expected.

question: We love this place! The food is great. The biscuits which I love the most is the best! I love the coffee. I come here once a week with my in laws and two sons. This is our spot in Madison for comfort food. It's just family friendly and the prices are great. Who doesn't like a hot cup of coffee and comfort food :) Yummo to this place!
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer expresses love for the place, praises the food quality, particularly highlighting the biscuits and coffee, and appreciates the family-friendly atmosphere and reasonable prices. The reviewer also mentions visiting the restaurant weekly with family, indicating a strong sense of loyalty and enjoyment of the overall experience. Overall, the review conveys a high level of satisfaction and enjoyment towards the restaurant.

question:
Monty's is one of those places where you start going to as a little kid, and continue going to well past your 70s. I could definitely see myself here years from now shaking my head disapprovingly at the rowdy young'un's over my newspaper (aka some form of electronic tablet at that point).

Monty's serves up some classic breakfast items, including the standard buttermilk pancakes, bottomless coffee (sorry millenniums, no mimosas here) and various omelets.

The servers here are extremely down to earth and friendly, and their chefs cook a mean meatloaf (highly recommended). 

What to get away from the glitz and glamour of most brunch places these days? Come by Monty's for some ultimate comfort food!
rationale: The sentiment in this review is positive because the reviewer speaks fondly of their longstanding connection to Monty's, emphasizing the enduring charm of the establishment that spans multiple generations. The mention of classic breakfast offerings and friendly service further contribute to a positive tone. The recommendation of the delicious meatloaf adds to the positive sentiment by highlighting a particular standout item on the menu. Additionally, the reviewer appreciates the laid-back and unpretentious atmosphere at Monty's, contrasting it positively with the perceived glitz and glamour of other brunch spots. Overall, the review conveys a sense of nostalgia, appreciation for the comforting food, and admiration for the warm hospitality of the staff at Monty's, all of which contribute to the positive sentiment expressed.

question:
Craving a chocolate malt, I stopped in on a walk around 3 pm on a Friday afternoon. The place was largely empty, and spotless. I haven't been to Monty's in several years, after suffering from 'stomach issues' after dining here back then, I couldn't bring myself to chance it again.

No issues this time, I'm happy to report. I ordered a triple chocolate malt to go. Chocolate (Sassy Cow!) ice cream, chocolate milk and chocolate syrup. Really good, and worth the $7 price tag. Definitely killed the craving, and put a happy spring in my step for the rest of my errand walk around the Atwood area.

The service was fast and friendly, as there were more than enough employees waiting around for the afternoon and evening dinner rush to begin. Maybe next time I'll be brave enough to try the food again :-)
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer had a pleasant experience at Monty's, with the highlight being the delicious triple chocolate malt that satisfied their craving. They specifically mentioned that they had no issues this time, enjoyed the treat, and felt happy and energized after their visit. The reviewer also appreciated the fast and friendly service, noting the presence of attentive employees. Overall, the positive tone, satisfaction with the food, and consideration of a future visit contribute to the positive sentiment expressed in the review.

question: Went here last night after an exhausting day taking care of a newborn. Thankfully my baby slept through our entire dinner despite how loud the place is. The decor is simple but spacious and the service is really good and fast. We were seated immediately (on a Saturday night! ) and were served water by the waitress right away. She was friendly and always nearby her customers. My husband had the Mediterranean omelet  (can't remember what It's called). It had feta cheese,  mushrooms and spinach with potatoes on the side and a biscuit.  It was so good I wanted to steal his plate.  I got the meatless meatloaf.  It was very filling and the gravy was good but the  portion was way too big. By the time we were done we had no room for the amazing looking cheesecake. I guess we will have to come back to try dessert.  Oh and the couple next to us ordered an ice cream Sundae, it was ridiculously huge and looked awesome. Good for sharing!  I definitely recommend this once for simple diner food done well.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is positive because the reviewer highlights several positive aspects of their dining experience. They appreciate the fast and friendly service, the delicious food options, and the spacious and welcoming atmosphere of the restaurant. Despite the large portions preventing them from trying dessert, the reviewer expresses a desire to return, indicating an overall satisfaction with their experience. Additionally, they praise the selection of dishes and mention seeing other appetizing options on the menu, further emphasizing their positive impression of the restaurant.

question: Their food is ok.  I would not call it special or extraordinary, but it is not bad.  The service is less than desirable.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the review states that the food is just okay and not special or extraordinary, indicating a lack of enthusiasm or satisfaction with the dining experience. Additionally, the mention of the service being less than desirable further contributes to the negative sentiment as poor service can significantly impact a customer's overall impression of a restaurant.

question: My dad and I both had the Heathen Vegan Shoplifters Delight. Basically portobello mushrooms, tempeh, and avocado. Amazing. Great section of vegan and non vegan options. Loved it.
rationale: The review expresses positive sentiment by mentioning that the food was amazing and that the individual loved the wide selection of vegan and non-vegan options at the restaurant. The use of words like "Amazing" and "Loved it" indicates a high level of satisfaction with the experience, highlighting the deliciousness of the Heathen Vegan Shoplifters Delight dish and the overall quality of the restaurant's offerings.

question:
Big plates of food. Awesome staff. So, so many shake/malt options. 

This is the place I usually come after my flight has landed in Madison. The food isn't aiming to be some crazy, new, cutting edge concoction. It's homey and it's familiar. 

I've been to a lot of diners. Not every diner does it right, but this one does. If you want tasty food, and ample servings of it, at a good place then this is the place to go.
rationale: The review expresses positive sentiments towards the diner, highlighting the big plates of food, awesome staff, and wide variety of shake/malt options. The reviewer also appreciates the homey and familiar atmosphere of the place. They specifically mention that the diner consistently delivers tasty food with generous portions, making it a good dining choice. Overall, the reviewer's tone is enthusiastic and satisfied, leading to a positive sentiment towards the diner.

question:
My partner and I came with two friends who were from out-of-town. I had heard really good things about Blue Plate, and I wanted to try it out, but I wish we had left when we saw there was a wait.

We ended up waiting for a table for around 45 minutes. While waiting I had to use the restroom--disgusting. There was no soap in the dispenser, water all over the counter and floor, and paper towels crumpled everywhere. I realize this is largely because of the patrons, but you would expect somebody from the staff to pop in every once in a while to make sure everything is neat and in stock. 

When we finally got a table, service was rushed and impersonal. I was a little dismayed that a manager never came over to at least thank us for waiting for so long, but who knows if a manager was even there? It seemed totally chaotic and like nobody was in charge. Lunch was okay, but nothing special. I had an omelette that was pretty good, but the breakfast potatoes that it came with were soggy, and while some of the potatoes were heavily seasoned, others didn't have any seasoning on them whatsoever and tasted horribly bland. I also had to wait several minutes before I could even eat because the server who delivered the plates (not our server, who spent approximately two minutes at our table in total) brought everyone else's meals out first and left mine in the kitchen. 

Will not be back.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the customer experienced significant issues throughout their dining experience at Blue Plate. These included a long wait time without acknowledgment or apology from the staff, a poorly maintained restroom, rushed and impersonal service, mediocre food quality, and an overall chaotic and disorganized atmosphere. The lack of attention to detail, poor customer service, and disappointing food presentation all contributed to the negative sentiment expressed in the review.

question: Such a fun place to get an interesting plate of great food.  The neighborhood is awesome and you can see it in their customers.  Great selection of pies,  and will take suggestions on what to offer.  Love their raspberry cream pie! May seem hipster but this is the real deal.
rationale: The sentiment in the review is positive because the reviewer praises the enjoyable atmosphere of the place, the quality and variety of the food offered, and the willingness of the establishment to consider customer suggestions. Additionally, the mention of a delicious raspberry cream pie reflects a specific positive experience that the reviewer had at the restaurant. The positive comments about the neighborhood and the authenticity of the place further reinforce the overall positive sentiment.

question: This place was great! The food was stellar. There wasn't a part of the meal that was disappointing. Kudos!\n\nThe meatloaf is so good, my meatloaf-hating boyfriend is getting it next time.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the review highlights praise for the food, describing it as "stellar" and stating that there wasn't a disappointing part of the meal. Additionally, the fact that the reviewer's meatloaf-hating boyfriend is willing to try the meatloaf next time suggests a positive experience. Overall, the review expresses high satisfaction with the quality of the food and the dining experience.

question: Friday night in Wisconsin and we couldn't resist the fish fry. It didn't disappoint. Fast, flavorful, perfectly crisp and just the right amount of food. I love that they have a local beer selection on tap and in bottles. Service was attentive and friendly. While waiting, we had the opportunity to observe their operations and I was suprised. The man that appeared to be the manager or owner, was helping in any way that he could. I think we watched him take reservations, run water, bus tables, greet guests, seat guests, basically anything to help offer excellent customer service. The highlight was the PIE! Oh my! I had a slice of oreo deliciousness that rocked my world! Light and fluffy with an oreo cruble crust and a huge slice. I savored that one piece three times! Worth every calorie! I can't wait to go back and try others dishes! \n\nOh and they also have an extensive vegan menu if that's your thing.
rationale: The review highlights several positive aspects of the dining experience, such as the fast and flavorful fish fry, attentive and friendly service, a wide selection of local beers, and the exceptional customer service provided by the manager or owner. The reviewer also expresses delight over the delicious and indulgent pie, which they thoroughly enjoyed. The mention of a vegan menu option also adds to the positive sentiment, showing that the restaurant caters to a variety of dietary preferences. Overall, the review conveys enthusiasm and satisfaction with the food, service, and overall experience, making it clear that the sentiment is Positive.

question: I didn't particularly care for the food, but I loved the length of the vegan menu and I can't wait to come back and try the rest of it, even if it is just to be disappointed.\n\nWe waited for about a half hour and were seated likely as the last Friday rush made its way out. I had the sweet potato hash. I couldn't taste much besides the sweet potato, and even that was masked by the heavy spices added to the top. I wouldn't order it unless you're really into hash. The apple pie \u00e0 la mode was solid (as in yummy, but also as in not runny). Prices were good, service was attentive. Remember to check in with Yelp to get a free coffee!
rationale: The sentiment is considered positive because even though the reviewer didn't particularly enjoy the food they ordered, they appreciated the extensive vegan menu offerings and expressed excitement about returning to try more options. They also mentioned positive aspects such as good prices, attentive service, and a solid dessert. Their willingness to give the restaurant another chance despite initial disappointment suggests an overall positive outlook.

question: Still great. Thanks to Yelp and Monty's for the free check-in coffee. Service good despite the full house. Our server forgot a glass of milk, felt terrible amd immediately comped it. GREAT service.  We'll be back.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer had a good experience overall at Monty's. Despite the full house, the service was described as good, and the server's quick response to an oversight by comping a forgotten item showed great customer service. Additionally, the reviewer expressed gratitude for the free check-in coffee provided by Yelp, indicating an additional positive aspect of their experience. The reviewer's intention to return further solidifies the positive sentiment towards the restaurant.

question: Amazing is all I can say. They have absolutely everything. No, it's not organic but it's super homemade and killer. I get something different every time I am there and have yet to be disappointed. All the brats, beef, chicken, BACON are all wonderful. Support local butchers or they will disappear! Perfect example, I went in and asked for a pound of italian sausage (kale/cauliflower/sausage pot pie, yum!) and they were out but they offered to make me some on the spot. Really amazing service and great product quality. Make the trip to Jim's
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the customer describes the products as homemade and delicious, mentioning that they have yet to be disappointed. They also appreciate the variety of options available and the willingness of the butcher to create a custom order on the spot. The mention of supporting local businesses adds to the overall positive experience, making this review reflective of a satisfied and happy customer.

question: Love this place and the people that run it. They're just an old school neighborhood meat market.  Burgundy steaks are the best. Great deals ALWAYS!!!
rationale: The review expresses positive sentiments by praising both the place and the people who run it. The use of words like "Love," "best," and "Great deals ALWAYS!!!" indicates a strong endorsement for the establishment. Additionally, the reference to the Burgundy steaks being the best further supports the positive sentiment of the reviewer. Overall, the reviewer's enthusiastic language and appreciation for the quality of products and service contribute to the positive sentiment conveyed in the review.

question: We stayed in Madison Lakes rooms, it was beautiful - modern, comfortable, very well put together.  Being dog friendly was a great treat and we got to bring our 4 legged friend with us, who loved the stay.  The property is wonderful and the owners incredibly nice.  Breakfast was really great, a wonderful way to start the day.  The only reason I give 4 and not 5 stars is that it is somewhat close to the highway, which detracts from the tranquil nature of the property, though not enough to prevent me from staying again.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is positive because the guest highlights numerous aspects that they enjoyed about their stay at Madison Lakes rooms, such as the modern and comfortable accommodations, the property being dog-friendly, the friendly owners, and the great breakfast. Despite the minor drawback of its proximity to the highway, the reviewer still expresses their willingness to stay again in the future, indicating an overall positive experience.

question: I should have left this review back in November when I stayed here with my parents - every time I look through our vacation photos I think about how much fun I had showing them Madison... and how we enjoyed where we stayed just as much.  Pat and Bob and Happy (their dog) were wonderful and their food was amazing.  They make many of the ingredients on their property (fresh maple syrup anyone?).  Would go back in a heartbeat.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer reminisces fondly about their stay with their parents and the enjoyable time they had at the accommodation. The mention of how much fun they had, the wonderful hosts, and the delicious food all contribute to a positive overall experience. Additionally, the reviewer expresses a willingness to return, emphasizing their satisfaction with the stay.

question:
This place was wonderful all around. I would return and I would recommend. It is a bit higher price point, but it is such a great space it is worth it. If you are looking to get away, relax, have a romantic weekend, enjoy nature, this is a great place. If you just need a place to sleep you might want something less expensive (unless you can afford it). 

The first floor of the house is very clean and neat, but has a very comfortable and cozy feel. There is a small kitchenette stocked with coffee, tea, cold drinks and lite snacks. If we stayed longer I could see relaxing down there enjoying a glass of wine, playing a game or reading. There is a nice selection of wine available to purchase so you don't even have to go out. 

Our room was very nice. King sized bed, robes, our own deck with a great view of the sheep. The bathroom had a big Jacuzzi tub and a large duel-head shower. We enjoyed glasses of champagne on the deck before heading out to explore and hike around their land. 

He had dinner downtown Madison which was an easy drive to and from. When we returned we were happy to have the fireplace in our room and cozied up with some of freshly baked cookies left out for guests. 

Breakfast was delicious. Farm fresh eggs from their hen's, herbs from the garden and all the other ingredients were local. We had good conversation with the other couple staying there as well as the owners.

Great place!
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer thoroughly enjoyed their experience at the location. They praised the cleanliness, comfort, and coziness of the space, as well as the amenities provided such as a kitchenette, wine selection, robes, jacuzzi tub, and fireplace. The reviewer also had a good time exploring the surroundings and appreciated the delicious breakfast made with fresh ingredients. Overall, the reviewer found the place to be great for relaxation, romance, and nature enjoyment, and they would recommend it to others.

question: Wow, 5 stars? Did we stay at the same hotel? This location is the newer version where the room entrances are enclosed which is a plus. They've also had their renovation in the lobby with the high counter/seating area.  But my room smelled like stale smoke and the desk was really small.\n\nSo while the staff was super friendly and the location is actually more convenient to where I needed to be in Madison, on my return trip I opted to stay in the HGI in Middleton than endure another week in this less than acceptable Hampton.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is negative because the guest experienced multiple issues during their stay at the hotel, such as a room that smelled like stale smoke and a small desk. Despite some positive aspects like the updated room entrances and lobby renovations, the negative experiences with cleanliness and room amenities led the guest to choose a different hotel for their return trip.

question: Front Desk was rude and not helpful whatsoever. The rooms were small and when we got to our room there was pee in the toilet still. Would choose a different hotel if I was you.
rationale: The sentiment is Negative because the user had an unpleasant experience with the hotel, including encountering a rude and unhelpful front desk staff, small rooms, and finding the toilet in their room unclean upon check-in. These factors would likely leave a negative impression on the user and influence their decision to not recommend the hotel to others.

question: The room was clean and modern. The hotel has been renovated recently.  Customer service at the desk was great.  I would definitely stay again. Free breakfast, They have a pool, but it was being renovated so we didn't get to use it.  My only complaint would be that the eggs and sausage in the breakfast were pretty bad.
