But they were free so can't complain too much.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the review highlights several positive aspects of the hotel experience, such as cleanliness, modernity, recent renovations, excellent customer service, free breakfast, and amenities like a pool. The reviewer also expresses willingness to stay again despite a minor issue with the quality of some breakfast items, acknowledging that they were complimentary. Overall, the positive aspects clearly outweigh the negative, leading to an overall positive sentiment.

question:
So close to the airport, but remains off the grid. The Villa Tap neighborhood bar looks as it hasn't changed in forty years. The wooden bar is topped with a baseball cards that have a laminate over them.

Want to drink? Stop over. They have friendly bartenders and great prices. The bartenders do a nice job on the bloodies and Old Fashioneds.

Want to eat? Om nom. They have some type of food every night, but their Friday fish fry is worth going. The perch or walleye is what you should get. Even though it was busy when we were there, the servers were funny, had a good attitude, and our food came promptly. They know what the hell they are doing.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is positive because the reviewer highlights several positive aspects of the Villa Tap neighborhood bar. They mention the convenient location near the airport, the nostalgic atmosphere that remains unchanged for decades, friendly bartenders, great prices, and delicious food options like the Friday fish fry featuring perch or walleye. Additionally, the reviewer acknowledges the efficient and enjoyable service provided by the servers, further contributing to the overall positive experience at the bar.

question: Looks sketch from the outside, but true fish fry happiness awaits! I have been going to this place for about one year.  The first time we went later around 9 pm or so and a lot of the fish was gone.  I had an amazing hamburger instead, meat from Jenifer St Market. Besides the first time, I have always gotten the fish.  The perch is amazing and be sure to get the loaded baked potato.  The craft beer selection is impressive.  Chico-the owner is usually cooking, it's a small kitchen, so be prepared to wait, but it's worth it. My fiance usually gets the walleye and loves it. It's now my go to place for fish!
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer highlights several aspects of the restaurant that they enjoy, such as the delicious fish fry, the amazing perch, the loaded baked potato, the impressive craft beer selection, and the fact that it has become their go-to place for fish. Additionally, the reviewer mentions that their fiancé also loves the walleye, further emphasizing the positive experience they have had at the restaurant. Despite a minor issue with fish availability during one visit, the reviewer still found a great alternative and continues to have positive experiences overall.

question: Another strictly pinball review. \nAround thanksgiving the Ideal was had Simpsons Pinball Party. SPP is a lot of fun but never lasts long at any one stop in Madison (first played it at the Plaza this past summer) because it always has mechanical issues going on. \nStopped in the other night to find Walking Dead (which you can also find at the Up North currently). I haven't seen a lick of the TV series, Walking Dead so I admit I'm missing something but this game was just plain boring in my book. 4 stars for having a functioning (and new!) pinball machine - I bet Walking Dead fans will feel differently than I do about this one.
rationale: The sentiment of this review is considered positive because the reviewer acknowledged that The Simpsons Pinball Party is a lot of fun and he enjoyed playing it at various locations despite the mechanical issues. Furthermore, the reviewer gave a positive rating of 4 stars to the Walking Dead pinball machine for being new and functioning well, showing appreciation for its quality regardless of personal interest in the TV series. Overall, the review emphasizes the positive aspects of the pinball machines being discussed.

question: The burgers are amazing and ridiculously reasonable! The staff is friendly and attentive. The place is super clean! They do everything right at Players! Good drinks, great lunch specials and awesome service!
rationale: The reviewer highlights several positive aspects of their experience at Players, including the amazing and reasonably priced burgers, friendly and attentive staff, cleanliness of the place, good drinks, great lunch specials, and awesome service. These positive attributes indicate that the reviewer had an overall pleasant and satisfying experience, leading to a positive sentiment in their review.

question: Do NOT go here if you are looking for a nice 4 1/2 star place. Not very clean and very loud!
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the review highlights the cleanliness and noise issues at the place, contradicting the expectation of a nice 4 1/2 star establishment. The reviewer's experience did not meet their expectations, resulting in a negative perception of the place.

question:
So I've been hearing this joint has one of the "Best" burgers in town. I'm generally reluctant to order a bar burger - they are generally frozen and then cooked to well done. Not at Players - hand pattied in view of the customer. Meat is from the Jennifer Street Market - Right around the corner. 

You want your burger rare - Fine... It's rare... Sha- Freaking- Zam! I think perhaps the only Burger Joint in town that is capable of cooking a burger properly to order. 

Sandwiches come with pub chips - you can upgrade to fries for a buck... Other stuff like onion rings for $2.  The sides are frozen and then dropped in the fryer. But you are here for the burgers - they are fresh, as is everything on them. The tomato on my burger was actually tasty. My only complaint is the burgers could use a more robust bun... But the fact that Players can properly cook a burger makes this discretion forgivable.

So go to this locals joint blue collar bar - have a beer, get the drink special and order a freaking burger!
rationale: The sentiment of the review is positive because the reviewer highlights several key positive aspects of their experience at Players, a local bar known for its burgers. They appreciate the fact that the burgers are hand-pattied and cooked to order, with the option to have them cooked rare if desired. The reviewer also notes that the meat is sourced locally and compliments the taste of the ingredients, such as the tomato on the burger. Despite a minor complaint about the bun, the reviewer finds it forgivable because of the overall quality of the burger and the restaurant's ability to properly cook it to their liking. Additionally, the mention of a welcoming atmosphere, drink specials, and the recommendation to visit the establishment all contribute to the positive sentiment of the review.

question:
Ah, yes.  The site of where one of my profile pictures was taken.  I could not resist the allure of a bar that had a giant neon "Drink Blatz" sign hanging above the door.  I am, after all, a Wisconsin girl.

The boy and I went on some random weekday night in the winter.  It was a very large, divey, unattractive hole-in-the-wall as you would correctly surmise from the Blatz sign.  Fortunately, I love townie dive bars, and therefore, was comfortable with this.

We each ordered a beer on tap from the nice, older lady who was bartending, (PBR and Leinie's, if I remember correctly) and paid something like $3 total.  Sexy.  Very sexy.

As we drank our beers, we decided to arm wrestle.  The bartender was going outside for a smoke and cheered me on.  My back was to her, but my boyfriend told me that she mouthed the words "Let her win" to him.  Haha!  She came back later to see if I'd won or not.  :)

I need to go back post haste!
rationale: The sentiment of the review is positive because the user describes their experience at the dive bar with nostalgia and fondness. They mention enjoying the unique charm of the bar, the affordable prices, and the friendly interaction with the bartender. The playful atmosphere of arm wrestling and the bartender's supportive gesture further contribute to the positive tone of the review. Additionally, the user expresses a desire to return to the bar, indicating that they had an overall enjoyable time.

question: This place SUCKS!  Every time I go in here it depresses the shit out of me.  People say it's haunted and I would agree - haunted by degenerates and meth heads.  I always say I'll never go back but that never happens...
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the review expresses feelings of depression and dissatisfaction with the location. The reviewer associates the place with negative experiences, describing it as haunted by undesirable individuals such as degenerates and meth heads. Additionally, the reviewer expresses a sense of hopelessness by acknowledging that despite intending not to return, they end up going back.

question:
I miss "my old Menards" - the west side store is so awesome; it has a great layout, decent checkout speed, things are easy to find, it's big and bright... Unfortunately, this Menards shares nothing in common with its western sibling.

+ Fairly close to my home
+ Typical Menards stuff

- Horrible layout; things are just scattered about in odd places.
- Lack of sufficient, active checkout lanes
- No room in checkout lanes for your items to accumulate as you're paying for them

I wish Menards would choose a store layout and stick with it across all locations.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer expresses disappointment in the layout, checkout experience, and overall consistency of the Menards store they visited. They highlight issues such as a horrible layout, scattered items, lack of sufficient checkout lanes, and problems with space at checkout. The reviewer's comparison to another Menards location that they preferred further emphasizes their negative experience at the store in question. Ultimately, the review reflects a sense of dissatisfaction with the particular store's organization and service, leading to a negative sentiment overall.

question:
I've revisited this Menards countless times over the past few months. Lately, I've only been coming here when I absolutely must; I much prefer going to my local hardware store - their selection for anything that's not a big-ticket item is better, as is the service and overall experience. 

- There are signs posted in several places that claim, "No waiting for savings! If there are more than 2 customers waiting to check-out, we'll open additional check-out lanes!" -- I have yet to see this happen. A most recent visit left us waiting in line for nearly 10 minutes before checking out.

- The indoor/outdoor lumberyard is a source of frustration. I would venture a guess that one of the more commonly sought items from a hardware store like Menards is the basic 2x4 (or similar dimensional piece of lumber). Any idea where they're located? We wandered the indoor lumberyard for a good 5 minutes before realizing that the 2x4s are located in the faaaaaaaaaar back corner from the main entrance. You have to walk by scores of 1-by-whatevers, fence posts, fence slats, decorative posts, synthetic decking, lattice, and other rarely used items before you get to the 2-by-whatevers. Do you need pressure treated wood? That's outside, somewhere. Do you need cedar? That's on the opposite end of the indoor yard. Do you need plywood? It's at the front of the lumberyard. Do you need insulation? It's in the middle of the lumberyard... catch the problem? There's zero organization/logic...

- The outdoor lumberyard. I hate (as do my contractor friends) checking in and out with the lumberyard guard. Put it all inside like every other store does and call it good.

- Limited supply of plumbing items. I recently needed a Sharkbite connector for a plumbing project I was doing with PEX. Menards didn't have the fittings, but my tiny little local Ace Hardware did. A few days ago, I needed a John Guest fitting, which Menards didn't have, but my local Ace Hardware did. 

+ Holiday sales are usually a good deal, especially for large ticket items like ceiling fans and whatnot.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is negative because the reviewer expresses frustration and disappointment with several aspects of their experiences at Menards. They mention issues with long wait times at the checkout, disorganization in the indoor lumberyard, inconvenience with the outdoor lumberyard setup, and a limited supply of plumbing items compared to their local hardware store. While they do acknowledge the positive aspect of holiday sales, the overall tone of the review is critical and emphasizes the shortcomings and challenges faced by the reviewer when visiting Menards.

question: As everyone in Madison knows, there are no doughnut chain stores around.  No Krispy Kreme.  No Dunkin Donuts.  Although I know that the best doughnuts in town are from the Greenbush Bakery, sometimes it's just easier to go with the place down the street.  \n\nThat basically sums up the People's Bakery.  When you're too lazy to go anywhere else, they are pretty good.
rationale: The sentiment is Negative because the reviewer acknowledges that People's Bakery is only chosen out of convenience and laziness, not because it offers exceptional doughnuts. The reviewer also mentions that they know the best doughnuts in town are from another bakery, Greenbush Bakery, implying that People's Bakery is a subpar option compared to the competition.

question:
I've been lamenting the lack of Mediterranean establishments on the Eastside for a while. We have arguably the best Thai, Indian, Nepali, Jamaican, Japanese, Chinese and American restaurants in town. But Downtown and the Westside both hold the Mediterranean trump card.

Then I discovered People's Bakery. How can you go wrong? Fresh pastry AND gyros? Wait. Did I say gyros? Yes, I did. No longer do you have to venture downtown to get said sandwich. And the one I had wasn't a ticking grease bomb!

Do yourself a favor when you go and try the red lentil soup. The flavor is excellent and there's plenty of cumin to spare. Delicious! My gyro and bowl of soup plus coffee was under $10, so it's a great choice when you're low on cash and need a filling lunch.

(Oh, and it's right next to El Pescador, across from the Madison East Shopping Center. Pretty easy to miss when driving.)
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer expresses excitement and satisfaction about discovering People's Bakery, particularly praising the availability of fresh pastries and gyros on the Eastside. They appreciate the quality of the food, especially highlighting the red lentil soup and the affordable pricing. Additionally, the reviewer provides helpful tips for future customers, indicating that they had a great experience and recommending the establishment for a fulfilling and budget-friendly lunch.

question: I usually go here because they have some Halal dishes but it's definitely not my \"go -to\" place for Halal.  I find that I have to be in the mood for it in order to really enjoy it.  However, my husband swears by their chicken and I do really enjoy their kefta with rice.
rationale: The sentiment in the review is Negative because the customer does not consider the restaurant as their first choice for Halal food, indicating a lack of enthusiasm or preference for the dishes offered. Although the customer's husband enjoys the chicken dish and the customer themselves likes the kefta with rice, the overall impression of the restaurant seems underwhelming and dependent on mood rather than being consistently satisfying.

question:
The food and service attitude is pretty good for the price you pay.
They also got all kinds of beverages to go with your meal. They cook it fresh after you place an order. The owners are very nice.

We had the vegetarian meza. Everything tastes good, though I've definitely had better middle eastern food before. But for the price you pay, the food is well worth it. All the basics are done right, e.g. dolma, hummus, kabob/shawarma, cucumber yogurt, kofta, kebbi, etc.

But I will mention stuff they could improve a bit more:
The red pepper paste was a bit bitter, but taste fresh
Tabouli was a bit saucy (ask them to use less dressing).
rationale: The review overall highlights positive aspects of the restaurant, such as good food and service for the price paid, a variety of beverages, fresh cooking upon ordering, and friendly owners. The reviewer acknowledges that while they have had better Middle Eastern food elsewhere, they feel that the quality is still well worth the price. They also provide constructive feedback on areas for improvement, suggesting that the criticisms are minor in the context of an overall positive experience. Therefore, the sentiment of the review is Positive.

question:
Now this is what I'm talking about!!  Total hole in the wall on East Wash in a strip mall behind some Mexican buffet, with the name People's Bakery, you'd never guess this place would have the best Middle Eastern food in Madison.  

Start with the wife of the wife and husband team, who greets you warmly as you come in.  The menu is on the wall, but there are hard copies for those who need an explanation of the nicely blended mix of Lebanese, Armenian and Syrian dishes.  No matter your experience with food of the Middle East or Mediterranean, you'll find dishes you recognize, perhaps by different names.

This was my first visit, I'm sitting here eating my takeout order as I type this because it's that good.  I ordered the lentil soup, and several appetizer portions including hummus, moohamara, sarma, and falafel.    

Quick review:
- lentil soup.  Awesome, just awesome.  Beautiful saffron color from the cooked down red lentils, just the right mix of cumin and lemon, and a back end of heat, I'm guessing from Aleppo pepper.  This is some thick soup, and filling, and for 2.50, you get a pint

- Moohamara.  I wasn't going to get this.  I like roasted red bell pepper, and I've had dips and purees made of them, but I've never sought it out.  Mary, one of the owners, told me it was her favorite, best on the menu.  And holy COW was she right.  A smack of roasted red pepper is quickly deepened by a sweet hit of pomegranate and walnuts, ubelievably complex and wonderful.

- Falafel.  Huge portion, perfectly deep-fried, with a really nice, light texture.  Love the falafel, but I prefer tahini sauce, and these come with a yogurt mint sauce.  Don't get me wrong, this is clearly their regional interpretation, Im all about the authentic experience, and this was good sauce.  But, I confess that for my leftovers I'm making some tahini sauce.

- Hummus.  You know, hummus is always a crap shoot for me.  I make my own, from dried chick peas, and I've been working on this recipe for 25 years (along with my Bloody Mary recipe and about a hundred others). This is another of those regional interpretation issues, this was my least favorite today.  I'll try it again, because my own hummus has on and off days.  This was just more on the bland side than I expected,  No one distinct flavor dominated so I felt like it was left with an almost indescribable flavor.  Not bad, totally edible, just oddly unflavored.  I added some lemon and salt, which helped some.  

Sarma - if you're expecting dolmathes this will be familiar in flavor, but it texture.  These are served cold with a yogurt dipping sauce.  I'm okay with the temperature, but I just like a little lemon on mine.  These are veg, the rice filling is cooked down to a coarse 'risotto-y' consistency.  I dig them, but those who prefer the snap of dolmathes will find these softer, but just as flavorful

All in all, outstanding.  Next time, shish tahouk and baba ganouj.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is Positive because the reviewer describes the food at People's Bakery as "awesome" and "outstanding." They praise the flavors and complexity of the dishes such as the lentil soup, moohamara, and falafel. Despite minor critiques like the hummus being slightly bland, the reviewer still finds it edible and acknowledges personal taste preferences. Overall, the reviewer expresses excitement and satisfaction with their dining experience, indicating a positive sentiment towards the restaurant.

question:
After moving from Chicago to Madison, I thought that I would be safely tucking my Lebanese palate into the furthest recesses of my tongue, saving it only for the occasional trips back to Kedzie Avenue.  That was, until my wife and I discovered People's bakery.  

Upon walking in, I was thrown back into the likes of such wonderful restaurants as Salam and Semiramis...but with Donuts!  We were genuinely welcomed in and I knew People's Bakery was gonna be one of my new spots, having not even tried a single thing in the store.  

We ordered a lunch "to-go."  I got a Shish Taouk (commonly known as a Chicken Shawarma) and my wife got a falafel sandwich and we split a side of Hummus.  Well, my Shish Tauok was plump with heavily marinated, tender chicken slices, tomatoes, tahina, and lettuce.  In short, it was outstanding.  Aggressive herbal flavors perfectly matched with a spike of lemony acidity.  My wife LOVED her falafel sandwich...which is really saying something, as she's somewhat of connoisseur.  The hummus was really good, and the spike of sumac was a nice touch, although it was tad bit to lemony for me.  

Nonetheless, this is an AWESOME Madtown ethnic eats spot...and oh yeah...how can  completely dismiss the incredible homemade donut selection?  They looked stunningly good, but we both left that for another day.  Lebanese food and donuts....a winning combination, in my book.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer describes their experience at People's Bakery in a very enthusiastic and appreciative manner. They express excitement and admiration for the food they tried, using words like "outstanding," "really good," and "AWESOME." The reviewer also highlights the delicious flavors and quality of the dishes they ordered, as well as the warm welcome they received at the bakery. Overall, the review conveys a sense of satisfaction and enjoyment, making it clear that the experience was a positive one.

question:
Who says donuts and Lebanese food don't go together?!  People's Bakery has made me a believer of this magical combination! This place is great for some affordable, delicious Lebanese food, and some of the best donuts in town. The outside (and inside) is unassuming, but the food is authentic (as far as I know) and yummy. 

Pros
- VERY affordable
- friendly and helpful staff
- Did I mention it is scrumptious?

Cons
- service is a little slow
- inconsistent drink options

I highly recommend trying their falafel with a fritter for dessert.
rationale: The sentiment is Positive because the review highlights the positive aspects of People's Bakery such as their affordable pricing, delicious Lebanese food, and excellent donuts. The reviewer also praises the helpful staff and authentic, yummy food. Despite mentioning a couple of drawbacks, the overall tone of the review is enthusiastic and recommends trying their offerings, indicating a positive experience overall.

question: In addition to sweet treats like donuts and bear claws, they also have lunch and dinner options for cheap. Falafel is not the best in town, but try the gyro, which comes as a sandwich or entree sized plate. They have other standard Mediterranean options such as hummus and kebobs. Seating is limited and would not be good for large groups. Definitely more of a take-out place. I would definitely go back to explore their menu.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is positive because the reviewer highlights various food options available at the restaurant, such as sweet treats, lunch and dinner options, and standard Mediterranean dishes like hummus and kebobs. Despite mentioning that the falafel is not the best in town, they recommend trying the gyro, indicating that there are still delicious items on the menu. The reviewer also expresses an intention to return and explore more of the menu, which suggests overall satisfaction with their experience. Additionally, they appreciate the affordability of the food and acknowledge the restaurant's suitability for take-out, showing a practical and favorable view of the establishment.

question: Some secrets are best kept secret.  However I don't want my new donuts find going out of business anytime soon.  I stumbled across this little gem while trying to find some real donuts for my wife to take to her at work.  I found the People's Bakery.  The donuts selection was wonderful.  The wall mentioned some other baked goods as you walk in like scones, but those are no longer available.  The donuts were fantastic.  So good that I had to go back today and they are still fantastic and the shelves were socked full at 9:30am with plenty of choices and the prices are great.  \nTo be honest i had tunnel vision on the donuts but I believe they have some other things to offer for lunch and dinner.
rationale: The sentiment is Positive because the review overall is praising the People's Bakery for its wonderful selection of donuts that are fantastic and delicious. The reviewer expressed satisfaction with the variety of choices available, the reasonable prices, and the fact that the shelves were well stocked. Additionally, the reviewer mentioned being impressed enough to go back for more, indicating a high level of satisfaction with the bakery's offerings. The mention of possibly offering other items for lunch and dinner adds to the positive sentiment by hinting at the potential for further exploration of the bakery's menu.

question: I can tell by the way it tastes that the falafel sandwich, baba ganoush and tabbouleh are totally vegan, and delicious too. I didn't bother asking them about ingredients because it's so obvious.
rationale: The sentiment in this review is positive because the customer enjoyed the food, specifically highlighting the falafel sandwich, baba ganoush, and tabbouleh as delicious vegan options. The fact that they didn't feel the need to confirm the ingredients further shows their confidence in the vegan nature of the dishes and indicates a positive dining experience.

question: Great Greek food. Delicious and huge assortment of donuts! Worth stopping in for a treat.
rationale: The review uses positive adjectives such as "great," "delicious," and "huge assortment," which indicate a favorable experience with the Greek food and donuts. Additionally, the reviewer finds the food worth stopping in for as a treat, emphasizing the value they place on the overall experience. This positive feedback suggests that the reviewer enjoyed the food and treats offered at the establishment.

question: I must say perfect... I travel for work and it was great to check into my room, find Rosati's on Yelp and have them here within 30 minutes. The food was much more than I anticipated...  A MUST try. Very well seasoned and the service was great from the phone call to the delivery... 5 stars all around!  The Spinach and Tomato Garlic bread was delicious!
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer had a great experience with the food and service provided by Rosati's. They mentioned that the food exceeded their expectations, was well-seasoned and delicious. Additionally, they appreciated the prompt delivery and good overall service. The reviewer gave a high rating of 5 stars, indicating a very positive experience with no complaints mentioned.

question: I was in town for the weekend with my son (13) and his friend. asked the front desk at my hotel if there was any good Chicago style pizza places in Madison. I was directed to rosati's. such a disappointment. very bland & the crust...just no. the teenagers even thought it was mediocre. we each tried a slice, put the rest in the hall & called a different place.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the customer expressed disappointment with their experience at Rosati's, describing the pizza as bland and expressing dissatisfaction with the crust. They also mentioned that even the teenagers found it mediocre, indicating that the overall quality of the pizza did not meet their expectations. Furthermore, they decided not to finish the pizza and opted to order from a different place instead.

question: Not a fan. I desperately needed a manicure and being new to the area, stumbled upon this nail salon. I had heard about Nini Nails (on the west side) but didn't want to stray too far away from home just to get my nails done. BIG MISTAKE. I waited FOREVER for someone to assist me (even though it was mid-week and not busy) and to make matters worse, my nails chipped within 3 days.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the user expressed dissatisfaction with their experience at the nail salon. They mentioned waiting for a long time to be assisted despite the salon not being busy, which indicates poor customer service. Additionally, the fact that their nails chipped within three days of getting them done reflects a low-quality manicure service. These factors contribute to an overall negative review of the salon.

question:
The first time I came to 007 I walked in, sat right down and had an awesome spa pedicure at a really reasonable price! The gal who has done my spa pedicure twice now was very sweet and spent a lot of time on the foot/calf massage portion of the pedi. I was in heaven! 

My only gripe here has nothing to do with the staff, but the customers! Both times I've been in I've witnessed at least 3 other women treating the staff like dirt-- speaking to them rudely and criticizing them and their practices, speaking loudly on the phone during their service, etc. BE NICE. Just because English isn't someone's first language doesn't mean they don't understand. 

The staff is kind and accommodating and my toes look great. This is my monthly treat to myself!
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer highlighted their great experience with the spa pedicure, mentioning the reasonable price and the excellent service provided by the staff member. Despite witnessing some unpleasant behavior from other customers, the reviewer focused on the kindness and accommodation of the staff, ultimately expressing satisfaction with their experience and considering it their monthly treat. Overall, the review conveys a positive tone due to the reviewer's appreciation for the service received and the staff's efforts.

question:
I went to this salon in June for the first time. I went in to get a manicure and pedicure both with shellac polish. I had called to set up an appointment beforehand for my friend and I and I asked how much it would be for the shellac on both my hands and feet. The woman I talked to said $60. That's what I usually pay for the other place I go to but wanted to try this place out cause people said they did a good job. 
The day of our appointment we showed up and they started our hands first...they seated us away from each other when they knew we had come in together. So that bothered me right off the bat. I had gotten a design on one nail on each hand and the girl did a great job with the design and painting my nails. 
Then it was time for my pedicure, once again they sat my friend and I away from each other. We barely got a chance to talk because they sat people in between us too. The woman that gave me my pedicure did a great job painting my nails but a horrible job with everything else. The main reason I get pedicures is not for them to paint my nails (I can do that myself) I'm paying for them to scrub my feet, massage and whatever else to make my feet smooth. The woman scrubbed my feet for 5 minutes and that was it.  I was very disappointed. Especially when I saw that everyone else there had a lot more done then me. 
When I went up to pay the woman said the total was $80!! I told her I was told $60 then the woman said that I has gotten a design... My friends total came to $60 and she had gotten shellac on her hands but regular polish on her toes....so I paid $20 more for a small design and a bad pedicure. 
Later in the day my feet were already dry so it was like I never got a pedicure. I left that salon very disappointed and will never go back again. Or recommend it to anyone.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is negative because the customer experienced multiple issues during their visit to the salon. They were disappointed with the service due to being seated away from their friend, feeling rushed during both the manicure and pedicure, not receiving the expected foot scrub and massage during the pedicure, and being charged more than initially quoted. Additionally, the customer felt that their pedicure was not thorough as their feet were already dry later in the day. These combined factors led to a negative overall experience and a decision not to return to the salon.

question: I used this place once, and it will be my last. The place reeked of old urine. I'm not sure if someone has used it as a bathroom, and the place never got cleaned, or what? All I know is that it stinks, and not a good smell at that.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the user had a very unpleasant experience at the place they visited. The strong odor of old urine indicates poor hygiene and maintenance standards, leading to a negative association and overall dissatisfaction with their visit. The user's perception of the unclean environment contributed to their negative sentiment.

question: The Inferno plays goth, industrial, etc music.  Great place to go and dance, and there's plenty of eye candy.  Wednesday nights are nice and small, and Leather and Lace is good if you like dancing around a lot of people.  Sabbat de Sade is fun for public BDSM. Sometimes there are cool live bands.
rationale: The review mentions positive aspects of "The Inferno" club, highlighting it as a great place to dance with a variety of music genres, mentioning eye candy, and different themed nights like Leather and Lace and Sabbat de Sade. The reviewer also appreciates the option of cool live bands at the venue. Overall, the positive comments about the atmosphere, music choices, and diverse events indicate a favorable view of the club, earning it a positive sentiment.

question: I love the music. I love the dancing. I love the funky metalwork throughout the club, even down to the drain covers in the bathrooms which coordinate with the mirrors on the wall. I love the \"shows\" put on in the back of the club on Leather and Lace nights. I love the people watching. \n\n I hate the smoke. I mean I really, really hate that I reek like an ashtray after going dancing here. I would come here much more frequently if it weren't for the smoke. I hate that in the winter I have to freeze my ass off walking into the place because I don't want to have to get my coat dry-cleaned to get the smoke smell out of it if I brought it in with me.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer expresses genuine love for the music, dancing, funky decor, shows, and people-watching at the club. They appreciate the overall atmosphere and entertainment offerings. Despite their strong dislike of the smoke smell and inconvenience related to it, their positive feelings towards the various aspects of the club outweigh this negative aspect, leading to an overall positive sentiment in their review.

question: Happy to live in a city with a club like this.
rationale: The use of the word "happy" indicates a positive sentiment in this review. The reviewer expresses contentment with living in a city that has a club like the one being referenced, suggesting that they enjoy the club's presence and see it as a beneficial aspect of their city life.

question: Came to Inferno for the first time this past weekend. From the outside you could easily miss it, blending into the surrounding neighborhood, but the inside definitely lets you know where you are. Deep scarlet walls, metalwork, and interesting art identify Inferno as part of the goth/industrial/alternative scene. They definitely have a sense of humor about them, though: above the men's and women's bathrooms is a neon sign that reads cock/tails. \n\nWe came on a tame Sunday night for Naked Girls Reading. It was really fun to do something different from the usual Capitol bar scene. A friend of mine goes to Inferno's many theme nights, and the pictures always look like a fun time.
rationale: The review describes the experience at Inferno positively by highlighting the intriguing interior decor, the sense of humor evident in the establishment, and the unique events offered such as Naked Girls Reading. The reviewer appreciated the departure from the typical bar scene and seemed to enjoy the alternative atmosphere and activities at the venue. These aspects contribute to an overall positive sentiment in the review.

question: We loved this store..... for about a month. Then they sold us fish KNOWING they had ick. We knew it was the new fish because they had spots first.  After trying two different medicines all but one of our fish died. We took back the ones we had gotten from petsmart and I said, \"hey I think your fish gave our tank ick\" the employee responded with \"probably we found ick in one of our tanks and there's one fileter for all our tanks\" I could not believe it. Why would you knowingly sell someone sick fish? They wouldn't even refund our money for the fish we had bought. If you ask me they should have payed for the rest of the fish they killed and the two bottles of medicine too! We will never go back.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the customer had a poor experience with the store. They purchased fish that were sick with ick, resulting in the death of most of their fish despite their efforts to treat them. The store's response to the situation was unsatisfactory as they did not acknowledge their mistake, failed to refund the purchase, and did not take responsibility for the consequences. The customer felt the store should have paid for the losses incurred, and the overall experience left a negative impression, leading them to vow never to return.

question:
This is for the grooming department.

The customer service here has always been sub par. sometimes we have brought our pup in for a nail trimming and he is done within a couple of minutes, which questions what they're exactly doing if he can be done in a time period that is less than a few minutes.
what completely stopped us from ever going to this alleged "pet grooming salon" is one particular miserable female who was going to shave our pup from head to toe due to a couple of matted areas on his body. she never gave advice as to why or what else can be done. obviously that was her plan because it was convenient for her, and not for us. the freaking customer.

please do not support this sad establishment and venture into town a little bit more and go to rufus dumonde pet salon.

p.s. other than the laughable salon and their miserable groomers, the store itself is decent with an excellent selection of food and toys.
rationale: The sentiment is Negative because the reviewer expressed dissatisfaction with the customer service at the grooming department. They mentioned quick service for nail trimming, which raised concerns about the quality of care given to their pet. Additionally, the reviewer had a negative experience with a particular groomer who did not provide proper advice and seemed to prioritize convenience over customer needs. The overall tone of the review points to a lack of satisfaction with the grooming services provided at the establishment.

question: I wouldn't even put a star. We bought fish from them and asked their \"fish specialist\" if the fish we selected will get along. Of course she said yes. We have had our fish now for 3 weeks and one is obviously get attacked by another fish! Well petsmart thanks for that! Tetras are aggressive fish and attack others. Maybe they should teach their employees what they r talking about! No way am i going back to them! So uneducated and to top it off the woman that helped us made it seem like we bothering her!  Get it together petsmart! Ur losing customers!
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the customer had a poor experience after seeking advice from a staff member at Petsmart. The customer was given incorrect information about the compatibility of the fish they purchased, resulting in one fish being attacked by another. The customer felt frustrated and disappointed with the lack of knowledge displayed by the employee, as well as feeling like their concerns were not taken seriously. This negative experience has led the customer to decide not to return to Petsmart and to express their dissatisfaction with the store's customer service and expertise.

question: I have only been to cafe Zoma once, and I didn't even order anything.  My friends got coffee to go, and there were two customers ahead of them in line.  I had no idea that it could take a half hour to serve four people coffee, but the Clap your Hands Say Yeah listening idiots behind the counter at Cafe Zoma made it possible.\n\nI gave this place an extra star because my friends thought their coffee was pretty good.
rationale: The sentiment in the review is negative because the reviewer had a poor experience at Cafe Zoma. They mentioned that it took a long time to serve just a few customers, and they didn't appreciate the service or attitude of the staff members. The use of the term "Clap your Hands Say Yeah listening idiots" to describe the staff indicates their dissatisfaction with the customer service provided. Overall, the reviewer's lack of enjoyment and frustration during their visit contribute to the negative sentiment expressed in the review.

question: It's a nice place in a great location, but the coffee is a let down. It's kind of bland, even when you get an extra shot of espresso to toughen it up. I'm not sure if it was me or the coffee, but I had terrible indigestion after having the coffee here. I noticed becaues based on my schedule, I would get my coffee here some days, and other days at McDonalds. Never on the McDonald's days, but always on the Zoma days, my stomach let the world know it wasn't doing too well. It happened too much to be coincidence. Anyhow, I guess if I'm in a bind I'll get my coffee here, but I think for now I'll take a pass :(
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer expressed disappointment with the coffee at the place, mentioning that it was bland even with an extra shot of espresso. Additionally, the reviewer experienced terrible indigestion only on the days they had coffee at this place, not on the days they went to McDonald's, indicating a potential association between the coffee from this place and stomach issues. This negative feedback about the quality of the coffee and the negative physical reaction experienced contributes to an overall negative sentiment towards the place.

question:
I love Cafe Zoma. I just discovered this place about two months ago and have visited about a dozen times since then. I really love the outside yard in the back where there are several tables and a play area for kids. This is very important to me since I have a one year old and a two year old. I also love the access from the bike path. I would highly recommend a smoothie, they are great. However, if I go in before work I usually get a Cubano, cause I need to caffeine to help wake me up in the early mornings. I've also had two different sandwiches and both were very hearty and delicious.

When I go I'm usually there between 7am and 8:30 am and I've never had to wait more than a few minutes for my drink. I will actually come here over Starbucks when I'm in hurry because Zoma is always quicker.

I'm giving five stars even though I have had one problem with a drink I ordered not being hot enough, not even close to the temperature of the times that I ordered the drink before. However, I'm am not counting that against their rating since the employee I talked to about it was great and offered to give me a free drink the next time I came in.

I think that have a great staff and great customer service. If you haven't been I highly suggest you stop by sometime and give it a try.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is positive because the reviewer expresses love for Cafe Zoma and highlights various aspects of the cafe that they appreciate. They mention enjoying the outdoor yard, the play area for kids, the smoothies, the Cuban coffee, and the sandwiches. The reviewer also praises the quick service during morning hours, preferring Cafe Zoma over Starbucks for its speed. Despite a minor issue with a drink not being hot enough, the reviewer appreciates the great customer service they received in handling the situation. Overall, the reviewer highly recommends Cafe Zoma and acknowledges the great staff and customer service, contributing to the positive sentiment of the review.

question: I don't get what all the hype is about. This seems to be a completely average coffee shop, with the added bonus of being off a bike path. So two stars for convenience. Coffee was, like I said, average. People behind the counter were indifferent at best. I asked for a 'cubano' based on previous reviews and was met with a blank stare and a 'what?!?', then told I could chose from the board. There was no cubano on the board. Maybe it's the same worker some other reviewers talked about, and possibly every other employee there is fantastic. But this has been my experience. Also, the food was a big disappointment. Even though they have a menu, when we tried to order from it we were pointed to the pre-made sandwiches in the display case. No veggi options, no choice of bread, just what was there, much like a Starbucks. Meh.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is negative because the customer had a disappointing experience at the coffee shop. They found the coffee to be average, the staff indifferent, and were unable to order a specific item they desired. Additionally, the lack of customization options for food further added to their dissatisfaction. Overall, the review highlights several shortcomings that contributed to the negative sentiment expressed by the customer.

question: The most chill, relaxing, artistic coffee shop in Madison. Love the outdoor seating watching the bikers go by sipping on an iced tea. Their drinks are great. Service is nice, very polite staff. I also love that it's next to Absolutely Art.
rationale: The review is positive because it highlights several aspects that contribute to a good experience at the coffee shop. The reviewer appreciates the chill and relaxing atmosphere, the artistic vibe, the quality of the drinks, and the friendly service provided by the staff. Additionally, the mention of outdoor seating and the proximity to Absolutely Art suggests added value and enhances the overall positive sentiment of the review.

question: Great local coffee shop! I love that it's right off the bike path - gives it a nice, neighborhood feel. Beautiful back patio and large glass doors for when the weather isn't ideal but you still want a view of the outdoors. The food and pastry options are minimal but the coffee is good and I usually only go there for a place to hang out and study. Theres a decent amount of seating but I have had trouble finding anywhere to sit several times already. I also love that they have a few games available as well, though I wouldn't complain if they added a few more options ;)
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer highlights several aspects they love about the coffee shop, such as its location by the bike path, the cozy neighborhood feel, the ambiance with the beautiful back patio and large glass doors, and the good quality of the coffee. Even though there are some minor drawbacks like limited food options and occasional seating issues, the reviewer appreciates the overall experience of having a place to hang out, study, and enjoy games. Their suggestions for improvement are minor and do not significantly detract from their positive overall impression of the coffee shop.

question: Ever since Caf\u00e9 Royale took over the scene, the coffee is not fantastic. The baristas are always super crass and I know multiple people whom have applied for positions there and have been turned away because their lack of coffee making skills. So, rather than hiring someone new and exciting and completely qualified, they don't want to bother with teaching others coffee making skills, so they keep hiring people with huge egos and previous experience. How neat! I don't come here anymore - bad vibes. Go to The Victory a block or two down!
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer had a poor experience with the coffee quality and customer service at Café Royale. They mentioned that the baristas were rude and that the establishment seemed to prioritize hiring individuals with previous experience over those who may be more qualified but lack experience. The reviewer also expressed that they have stopped going to Café Royale due to the negative atmosphere they experienced there.

question: My chai wasn't as tasty as other places, but was drinkable. Friend said that it is not her experience...maybe a bad make.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the user did not find the chai to be as tasty as they have experienced at other places. Additionally, their friend also noted that it may have been poorly made, indicating a potential quality issue with the drink. This dissatisfaction with the taste and quality of the chai contributes to an overall negative sentiment.

question:
What I liked:
The coffee was good. I had a specialty seasonal beverage that the barista recommended. 
The walls were covered in art from local elementary school students - LOVED THIS.  It speaks to this shop's effort to be connected to the community.
They're open later than most non-campus coffee shops.

What I didn't like:
It was freezing in the back of the coffee shop where all the premium seating is, but so hot in the front of the shop that the poor barista was sweating.  I had to wear my jacket the whole time, and never quite warmed up. I left earlier than I would have as a result.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the review highlights several aspects that the reviewer liked about the coffee shop, such as the good coffee, recommended specialty beverage, and the community connection through showcasing local art. Although there was a downside mentioned regarding the temperature imbalance in different areas of the shop, the overall tone of the review seems to be appreciative and positive towards the coffee shop's offerings and efforts to engage with the local community.

question: The restaurants that Food Fight offers are all subpar, with one exception of Johnny Delmonicos. Aside from the Johnny D's the others all serve incredibly bad food. I tried El Dorado's once and it was terrible, on top of things they charge so much for a margerita served in a tiny glass its ridiculous.
rationale: The review expresses dissatisfaction with the majority of the restaurants offered by Food Fight, describing them as subpar and serving incredibly bad food. The negative experience at El Dorado's, coupled with the high price for a small margarita, adds to the overall disappointment. The customer's disappointment with the quality of the food and the pricing strongly indicates a negative sentiment towards the dining options provided by Food Fight.

question: Great service. great prices. Local in our neighborhood. Easy to work with. Honest.  I wish we had more places like this in town.  I would highly recommend Kirch Appliance to someone on a budget or looking for a great value!
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the review highlights several key points that reflect a positive experience. The customer appreciates the great service and prices, the convenience of having a local business in their neighborhood, and the ease of working with the company. They also specifically mention the staff's honesty, which is a highly valued trait in business. Furthermore, the reviewer expresses a desire for more businesses like Kirch Appliance in town, indicating a strong endorsement and recommendation.

question:
How does this place have good reviews? I have apartments and Kirch is the only game in town when it comes to used appliances which keeps me coming back; but I'm annoyed I did every time. 
I have purchased 2 refurbished coin op washers here, both died in less than a year. 
I have purchased about 8 stoves or refrigerators, each time they try to charge to remove the old one. Each time I refuse and they always take it for free, because they are going to fix and sell it.  
I called them recently for a stove repair. I told the guy on the phone exactly what the error code is. They made an appointment to come fix it; they did not fix it and instead just told me the error code. Duh, that's why I called and that's what I told you. First the guy said they would have to order the part and come back. Then a day later some other guy called claiming the manufacturer recommends not repairing when this part is needed.  It's a $50 part and they are flat out lying hoping to sell me a used stove while taking one back to the shop at the same time.  I've had enough, the difference between a used stove/fridge/washer and a new one is not enough to put up with these good old boys - just go to Sears or someone like that.
rationale: The sentiment in the review is negative because the customer had a series of frustrating experiences with the business. They purchased multiple appliances that broke down within a short period, were charged unnecessarily for removal of old appliances, and received poor customer service when requesting a repair. The customer felt that they were being deceived by the staff and ultimately became dissatisfied with the overall service provided. These negative encounters led the customer to advise others to seek appliances from a more reputable source like Sears instead.

question: At a recent game 3 of the 5 people in my party (myself included)  were stung by hornets.  I can't say enough good about the staff response. The medics took great care of us. They cheered up our kid really well and then the manager gave us all new seats behind home plate with food and beverage too. We really enjoyed the rest of the game. Also they did deal with the hornets I promise. \n\nI have been to a bunch of other Mallards games too, and I always have a blast.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is positive because the writer emphasizes the exceptional response and care provided by the staff when they and their party members were stung by hornets at the game. The writer praises the medics for taking great care of them, mentions how the staff cheered up their kid, and appreciates the manager's gesture of providing new seats behind home plate with food and beverages. Despite the initial setback of the hornet stings, the writer was able to have an enjoyable experience for the rest of the game, highlighting the positive outcome and the overall fun they have always had at Mallards games. The mention of dealing with the hornets also suggests an efficient and reassuring response from the staff.

question: I don't have kids, so I've only been to one game where I haven't been in the Duck Blind.  The food's okay - the pulled pork sandwich is good, the burger is okay, the chicken slider is just a little piece of chicken on a bun.  The beer selection is great.  I'm not a fan of the Great Dane stuff, but there's still more than enough to choose from.  Sitting out here is a great place to mingle, but it's rough because I actually like baseball.  The sight lines aren't the best, but can be mitigated if you get there early and are actually around people who know what sports are (wtf would you sit with your back to the field while you doodle around on your phone?).  Getting there early also sets your mind at ease about getting your money's worth.  Let's face it, $33 on a weekend is a bit stiff.  If you don't get there early, you have to pound it, and then you run out of room, and the rest of the night will be shot.  Don't do that.
rationale: The sentiment in the review is deemed positive because the reviewer highlights several positive aspects of their experience, such as enjoying the pulled pork sandwich, the beer selection, and the opportunity to mingle in a great atmosphere. They also mention the importance of arriving early to make the most of the experience, indicating a commitment to making the most of their time at the game. While they provide constructive criticism about the sightlines and ticket price, the overall tone suggests that they still found value in their visit to the game.

question:
Take me out to the ballgame! Coming from Milwaukee, our experience of a night at the ballgame WAS Miller Park. I love Miller Park, but, we had just as much fun at the Madison Mallards game. Here are some of the reasons why...

The parking was easier and cheaper. We had our wallets pulled out and ready to go, but never found anyone to pay...because the parking is free! 

The stadium is small and easy to navigate. You can get there 15 minutes before a game and still get to your seat.  

There are really cool between inning activities. Fruit races (small children in costume), baby crawl, T-shirt toss. This was awesome. I looked forward to the end of each inning just to see what would happen between the innings. 

Food was good. The pulled pork was recommended to us. We got it, it was good. Overall, a great night with friends and a great game! Go Mallards! We'll be back!
rationale: The sentiment of the review is Positive because the reviewer highlights several enjoyable aspects of their experience at the Madison Mallards game. They mention that the parking was free and easy, the stadium was small and easy to navigate, and they enjoyed the between-inning activities like fruit races and T-shirt toss. The reviewer also compliments the food, specifically the pulled pork. Overall, they express excitement, anticipation, and satisfaction with their time at the game with friends, and express a desire to return in the future. This positive tone and enthusiasm throughout the review indicate a positive sentiment.

question:
Highlights/lowlights

1) friendly staff
2) fun thing to do on a nice summer night
3) gluten free food options available

I think it's really important to head in to your first (or any) mallards game with the right mind set. This isn't MLB! If you want that that head to a Brewers game in Milwaukee (NOT a Cubs game at Wrigley :p). 

As this is not MLB, the stadium is smaller and really easy to navigate through. I would imagine this would be really good for families looking for a night out. There is a decent sized kids area near the entrance as well. 

For a smaller stadium there is a really impressive amount of food and drink options. There are over 17 different beers available plus people selling Seagrams escape drinks (supposedly gluten free!), lime-a-Ritas etc. I was expecting pretty limited options for food as this is a smaller stadium but they really have everything you can get at an MLB game. Brats, burgers, chicken sandwiches, even cheese curds! There are even gluten free hamburger AND brat buns. Basically a food coma waiting to happen for anyone with celiac disease/gluten intolerance. The staff at all the food and drink stands was really friendly and quick!

Wisco fans everywhere are pretty chill but even more so here! Everyone is just here to have a good time and nobody gets really competitive about the game.

With plenty of food and drink options and great fans, a Mallards game is a great choice for a night out on a nice night!
rationale: The sentiment of the review is positive because the reviewer highlights several positive aspects of their experience at the Mallards game. They mention friendly staff, a fun atmosphere for a summer night out, and the availability of gluten-free food options. The reviewer also praises the easy navigation of the smaller stadium, the variety of food and drink options, the family-friendly environment with a kids area, and the laid-back and enjoyable atmosphere created by the fans. Overall, the reviewer emphasizes that a Mallards game is a great choice for a positive night out, which contributes to the positive sentiment of the review.

question: One of the greatest treasures of Madison. There's no better place to simply relax and enjoy the beauty and variance of nature. \nThe only downside: the inevitable disrespectful patrons. Particularly when it comes to the Thai Pavilion. Usually this means people with kids, but just as often applies to adults that can't seem to understand the words \"Please don't touch\".
rationale: The sentiment is Positive because the review highlights the beauty and enjoyment that can be found in the mentioned place, despite the downside of disrespectful patrons. The reviewer emphasizes the value of the location as a relaxing and beautiful spot in Madison, which indicates an overall positive experience.

question: Wonderful space. I cannot believe it is free. It is truly a gem of Madison. The history and story behind the Thai Pavilion is remarkable and it's a can't miss. Just keep your grubby little paws off of it if you want it to stick around...
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer is praising the space as wonderful and a gem of Madison. They appreciate the fact that the Thai Pavilion is free to access and find the history and story behind it remarkable. Although the reviewer jokingly mentions keeping hands off the structure to preserve it, it seems to be out of a genuine appreciation for the site to continue being available for everyone to enjoy. Overall, the reviewer's comments reflect a positive and enthusiastic attitude towards the experience.

question:
What a lovely way to spend a Saturday afternoon! ...Although I'd probably recommend going on cooler day. It is a lot of walking and sunshine...so really, regardless of the heat, you should slather on the sunscreen and stay hydrated! 

It takes about an hour to 1.5 hours (going at a brisk pace) to cover all of the gardens on display. Some gardens are nicer than others, and there are a few that are still under construction. My favorites were the Sunken Garden, the Rose Garden, and the Thai Temple Garden. I thought that all of these displays are well thought-out and perfectly executed!

Looovve!! I'll be back in the fall when the leaves change colors. (:
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer had an overall enjoyable experience spending a Saturday afternoon at the gardens. Despite the recommendation for a cooler day due to the walking and sunshine, the reviewer emphasizes the importance of sunscreen and hydration, showing a proactive attitude towards making the most of the visit. The reviewer mentions specific favorite gardens and positive aspects about them, highlighting the well-thought-out and well-executed displays. Additionally, the reviewer expresses excitement about returning in the fall, indicating a desire to visit again and further enjoy the changing scenery, overall contributing to a positive sentiment.

question: Love this place
rationale: The use of "Love" in the review indicates a strong positive sentiment towards the place. It suggests that the individual has a deep affection or enjoyment for the place, leading to a positive overall feeling.

question: Awesome! We went a little too early to see many butterflies at their exhibit, but it was still great and the grounds are beautiful!
rationale: The sentiment is Positive because the reviewer expresses enthusiasm by using words like "Awesome" and "great." Despite not seeing many butterflies due to timing, the reviewer still enjoyed the experience and appreciated the beauty of the grounds. Overall, the review reflects a positive and satisfied perspective.

question: Didn't see any roses in the \"rose garden\" and I counted only 5 butterflies in the \"butterfly house\" -- even the feeding trays were completely empty.  Definitely not 1-star, but also not quite up to \"ok\" -- 2 stars.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer expressed disappointment in not finding any roses in the supposed "rose garden" and only spotting a low number of butterflies in the "butterfly house." Additionally, the fact that the feeding trays were completely empty adds to their dissatisfaction. The reviewer felt that the experience did not meet their expectations, resulting in a 2-star rating.

question:
Being from the Chicago area, I am a member of the of the Chicago Botanic Garden [third year] and very much enjoy gardens and plant life ESPECIALLY when I don't have to do any maintenance myself. 
That said, when I saw my opportunity to visit the Olbrich Botanical Garden when passing through the Madison area, I needed to make a stop and take full advantage of the adventure. I've really only been to two official botanic gardens (mostly CBG) however I'm glad Olbrich was another to add to my list. 

It was absolutely pouring down rain when we arrived, which was actually ok because the doors hadn't opened yet, and it also gave us an opportunity to have the gardens to ourselves once we were let in. We checked in with the ladies at the front desk and they happily pointed us to the garden areas and told us about the park; they also lent us an umbrella which was nice customer service. 
We had a plan to do a loop and visit the famous Thai garden (awesome) and our idea paid off greatly. With the rain ever-present we had our own rainforest jungle to enjoy to ourselves, which made for a very peaceful experience. We passed back around to the rose garden and detoured around the flooded pathways, so I'm not entirely sure which gardens we passed through.

After getting soaked (I'm glad I had my waterproof kayaking shoes in the car) we walked through the indoor garden, which was free because I had my membership card for the CBG, otherwise it would have been $2. Even if I had to pay I would have been satisfied, it was pretty cool. They had a variety of trees, fish, painted pheasants, a waterfall, and other hidden gems I wont spoil. 

Although we didn't make a purchase, their gift shop area was pretty nice for its size. If we had more time and nicer weather, I wouldn't hesitate to make this garden a destination for a bit. It's so close to Chicago so I can't see why that would be a difficult task to accomplish. 
I'll be back for sure; but next time I'll bring the sunshine.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is positive because the reviewer expresses enjoyment of gardens and plant life, appreciation for the ambiance of Olbrich Botanical Garden despite the rain, satisfaction with the customer service received, and admiration for the features of the garden including the Thai garden, indoor garden, and gift shop. The reviewer also expresses a desire to return to the garden in better weather, indicating a positive overall experience and a willingness to visit again.

question: Free and much larger than I expected, this botanical garden was a pleasant surprise.  There are a few corners that are particularly nice, like the Rose Tower and Temple. Meander throughout and try to get lost. Sit a spell on a bench and enjoy the scenery.
rationale: The review expresses positive sentiments as it highlights the botanical garden as a pleasant surprise that exceeded the visitor's expectations. The mention of specific attractions such as the Rose Tower and Temple being particularly nice showcases the enjoyment and appreciation of the garden's beauty. Phrases like "meander throughout and try to get lost" and "sit a spell on a bench and enjoy the scenery" further depict a sense of relaxation, contentment, and enjoyment experienced by the reviewer, overall creating a positive tone towards the botanical garden visit.

question: So, I know it's crazy that I'm giving this place one star but hear me out. I recently had my engagement pictures here. I was so so excited, bc I come here every year and I thought it was going to be an amazing experience. I have never been more wrong. I paid the $31 fee to have my pictures professionally done there, not a big deal bc I loved this place and it was worth that to me. I then found out we only had an hour to take them.  Ok still, we can hurry. As soon as we walked into the building, we were bombarded by the woman who runs the place(I assume), asking what we were doing, did we have a permit, and what not. We told her yes we paid, and we were waiting for our  photographer. She then asked me if I had any clothing changes planned, and I said yes, just one. Her answer astounded me. \"We don't allow people to change in our bathrooms, so you need to find someplace else, like your car\". Ummmm, it was a Saturday at 3pm and almost 80 degrees outside, how can you tell me I need to change in my car??  I was floored, speechless. She then goes \"it's in the contract\" bc she must have seen our jaws on the floor. How can you ask that of someone?!?  I work in customer service, and the way were treated that day was awful. Thank god a friend of mine who works with a limo service was there that day and I changed in the limo. My fianc\u00e9 did not bc he did not feel comfortable. When we came in, she followed us and goes \"10 minutes left\". Um again, what?!  I would assume she's walked the grounds before, and it takes a while to get around, especially in heels.  We ended up going 10 minutes over.. Oops. And my photographer stayed to take pics with my ring. Apparently the woman tracked her down and said she needed to leave. I was so excited to take my engagement pics there, considering they will be the only ones I take, and this lady ruined it. I've never been treated so terribly. Especially in a public place like that. Part of me really never wants to go back there ever again. She needs a crash course on customer service. Bc she has zero. I would be fired and lose a lot of money if I treated people the way she does.
rationale: The sentiment in the review is negative because the customer experienced multiple issues during their visit for engagement pictures. They were limited to only one hour for the photoshoot, told to change in their car despite the impracticality of the suggestion, encountered unfriendly and unaccommodating behavior from the staff member, felt rushed during the shoot, and ultimately had a negative and disappointing experience due to poor customer service. The lack of empathy, professionalism, and understanding displayed by the staff member contributed to the customer feeling mistreated and frustrated, resulting in a negative sentiment overall.

question: I think this is the best botanical garden I have ever visited.  I didn't even make it through the majority of the place since my 3 year old was getting cranky, but was completely amazed by what I saw.  The staff was friendly, helpful, and very patient with my oldest who will talk your ear off.  The three year old wondered off the path once or twice when my attention was elsewhere, and the staff gave him a gentle warning without making me feel like a bad parent for not having my eyes glued to him every second.  There were tons of learning activities and seating found throughout the portion I was able to visit.  Before we left, I bought a family membership as I see us returning on multiple occasions.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the visitor describes the botanical garden as the best they have ever visited, despite not being able to explore the entire place due to their child getting cranky. They commend the friendly and patient staff, who were accommodating towards their talkative eldest child and handled a situation with the three-year-old wandering off with gentleness and understanding. The presence of learning activities and seating throughout the garden added to the positive experience, prompting the visitor to purchase a family membership for future visits. Overall, the review showcases a high level of satisfaction and appreciation for the botanical garden's offerings and staff.

question: So glad we decided to stop by here! The conservatory was small but worth the $2 to get in. Butterflies flying around everywhere and even quail running around. Neat to see so many tropical plants, all labeled. Outside was larger than I anticipated but we enjoyed every minute of it. Lots of photo ops around the grounds with different themes in areas. Beautifully kept!
rationale: The review highlights the positive aspects of the conservatory visit, such as the variety of butterflies and quail, the well-labeled tropical plants, and the overall beauty and photo opportunities around the grounds. The reviewer expresses satisfaction with their experience and seems to have enjoyed every minute of it. The mention of the place being "neat," "beautifully kept," and the unexpected size outside reinforces the positive sentiment.

question:
YES.  My new favorite thing to do is to go to Crema Cafa (or any other place I suppose) and sip a coffee while walking through the gardens.  So relaxing.  And for free!  

The gardens are friendly for studying, though I am not sure of the wifi situation.  Great for kids' field trips.  Great for adults just doing their thing.  I went and cartwheeled around their big center lawn.  Nobody even looked twice!

I have not been through the butterfly exhibit because the gardens are good enough for me.  I will be saving the butterflies for a rainy day.

If you get a chance, check out the HUGE hibiscus like flowers.  They are my favorite and makes you feel you are at least a bit closer to Hawaii...the humidity helped as well though.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer thoroughly enjoys visiting Crema Cafa and finds it to be their new favorite activity. They appreciate the relaxing experience of sipping coffee while walking through the gardens, mentioning that it is free. The reviewer also highlights the friendliness of the gardens for various activities like studying, cartwheeling, and children's field trips. They express excitement about the beauty of the hibiscus flowers and mention the potential enjoyment of the butterfly exhibit in the future. Overall, the reviewer's description is enthusiastic and filled with positive experiences at Crema Cafa, making it a positive sentiment.

question: Just can't get decent pizza in Wisconsin... sorry... but someone needs to head down to Chicago and learn how to make a pizza.\n\nThis place piles sauce and toppings on a crust that can't support it.  you end up with a slide off mess.  Flimsy crap.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer expressed disappointment in the pizza they received, stating that the crust was unable to support the sauce and toppings, leading to a messy and unsatisfying experience. The use of terms like "Flimsy crap" also contributes to the overall negative sentiment towards the pizza from the mentioned establishment in Wisconsin.

question:
Grease running down my hand. That's a first. Maybe that's appealing to some people, but definitely not me.

Sorry, Pizza Pit staff. 

[Cue the Tim & Eric "Ya blew it!" .gif.]
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the user expresses disappointment and dissatisfaction with their experience at Pizza Pit. They mention grease running down their hand, which suggests a messy or unappetizing situation. question: One of a select few good places to eat on the far East side of town.  I mean come on, between a bunch of chain restaurants flanking the mall and Maharaja, there's no comparison.  Love lunch buffet, and you can in fact grab a solid dinner as well.  Perfect dinner for two: samosas, ginger naan, bainghan bartha (mashed grilled eggplant mmm), and mango chicken curry.  The service is very courteous for dinner, they drop your napkin in your lap and you get a hot steaming towel after your meal!  Extra points for the extremely bass-heavy hip hop gospel music coming through the wall from Now Faith Ministries next door.  They have one helluva sound system.  If that's not your sort of thing, then avoid typical church hours. ;)
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the review praises the restaurant for being a standout choice for dining on the far East side of town, noting the quality of the food, service, and unique experiences such as the lunch buffet and courteous dinner service. The reviewer also highlights specific menu items they enjoyed for dinner, further emphasizing their satisfaction with the dining experience. Additionally, the mention of the restaurant having a unique ambiance with bass-heavy hip hop gospel music adds to the overall positive tone of the review. Overall, the reviewer's comments express enthusiasm and satisfaction with their dining experience at the restaurant, making the sentiment positive.

question: Love this place. Their lunch buffet is great. So is their dinner menu. My partner and I went there for dinner on New Years Eve and for Valentines Day, we had so much fun. It is a relaxed atmosphere and they have great food. I recommend the Tikki Masala.
rationale: The review expresses positive sentiments towards the restaurant, highlighting how much the reviewer loves the place, enjoys the lunch buffet, dinner menu, and special occasions spent there. The relaxed atmosphere, fun experiences on New Year's Eve and Valentine's Day, along with the recommendation of a specific dish (Tikki Masala) further support the positive sentiment. The overall tone is enthusiastic and satisfied, making it clear that the reviewer had a great time at the restaurant.

question: Sorry I am indian and as a indian this place blows .. Their aloo parathas are a cop out the just use samosa filling for the stuffing ...  The spicy pickles are from a can, also their vegetable curry is made with frozen vegetables not fresh ... Also I know its not a authentic place when the serve beef...  No authentic place will ever serve beef, they will serve goat, lamb, chicken and every animal except beef... what else, oh yea two of the servers started chewing each other out in the back of the room where EVERYONE could here.... Also they should invest in making \"chaat\" food - street food of india .. they had none of that one the menu!  I will give it 1 star because the garlic naan was good.. Also our waiter was really nice it was some guy who moved here from SD... Save your indian food craving and head down to Chicago
rationale: The sentiment of the review is negative because the reviewer expresses dissatisfaction with several aspects of the restaurant. They criticize the quality and authenticity of the Indian food, mentioning shortcuts in preparation, lack of authentic dishes, and serving beef, which is culturally insensitive to some Indian beliefs. Additionally, the reviewer points out unprofessional behavior from the staff and suggests other locations for better Indian food. Overall, the review highlights multiple disappointments and fails to find many positive aspects aside from the garlic naan and the friendly waiter.

question:
The decor was ok. Nothing special but there were some odd mylar stars and hot air balloons hanging from the ceiling
