Came in for dinner and there are two other tables at 8:00 on a Thursday night.  I wonder if people go to bed early around this neighborhood or if this place just isn't that popular.

Coconut soup was weird .  A mix of hot coconut milk that's been watered down and then laden with sweetened baking coconut from a bag.  This was definitely not fresh coconut in any way and I found this soup to be disapointing.   

Lamb Saag was about as much lamb as you might expect for a dish costing 12.95. It's uniform liquidey sludge was a little too reminiscent of diarrhea for me and I lost a little of my appetite, though the lamb was tender and cooked well.  The overall dish was very very salty with no special taste.  Just a little spicy, a little Indian, and a little lamb.  They are probably using curry paste from a jar, or there is just not a very imaginative cook in the kitchen because the whole dish was lacking in flavor (besides salt).  A whole cardamom pod was left hidden in the diarrhea sludge, which led to an unpleasant burst of cardamom in one bite.

Rice had clearly been sitting around for awhile and was very dry throughout with crunchy bits and very chewy bits.  I just don't see how this is acceptable to serve someone in a restaurant.  Rice is one of the cheapest ingredients out there.  If the rice has been sitting for too long, throw it out and make more.  

I tried the saag with the rice and the oily mess of lamb Saag rehydrated the rice somewhat, and the rice's absorption of the Saag took away some of its saltiness.

Three sauces or chutneys that came with the papadom were not very good at all. 

Had to ask to have my water glass filled every single time I finished it. (this is a major pet peeve)
rationale: The review expresses disappointment and dissatisfaction with various aspects of the dining experience, including the decor, food quality, portion size, taste, and service. The descriptions of the coconut soup as "weird" and the lamb dish as resembling "diarrhea sludge" indicate a strong negative reaction to the food. Furthermore, the criticism of the rice being dry and the sauces/chutneys not tasting good adds to the negative sentiment. The reviewer's annoyance at having to repeatedly ask for water refills also reflects poorly on the restaurant's overall service quality. Overall, the reviewer's detailed and negative comments on multiple components of the dining experience justify the sentiment being classified as Negative.

question: We went for the buffet on a Sunday morning, and are so glad we decided to give it a try!  My husband's favorite is Chicken Tikka Massala - which they had on the buffet.  I'm pretty new to Indian food, but there were so many options and so many things I liked!  \n\nThe service was amazing!  Our water glasses were constantly full, which is good considering some of the food is really spicy!  We're not from that area, but if we were in the neighborhood, I would consider going there again!
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer had a great experience at the restaurant. They enjoyed the variety of options available at the buffet, liked the Chicken Tikka Massala, and appreciated the attentive service. The comment about potentially visiting again if in the neighborhood also contributes to the overall positive sentiment. The reviewer had a positive dining experience, highlighted by the delicious food and excellent service.

question:
Our family went to celebrate a birthday with an Indian dinner - there were 6 of us in our happy group.  We have been going to the Maharaja for years, to enjoy the lunch buffets, Valentines Day, birthdays etc.  Tonight the food was good, but the service was an issue.

To start, we could see that the staff had changed.  The service took a long time, even though there were only 5 tables with customers and six wait staff.  The server did not understand English well enough to properly place the order, so there was extra wine for one person.  Also, the glassware and flatware were spotted, with some that needed to be sent back.

The service had really changed for the worse.  The server would clear one dirty plate, then wander off, return five minutes later to get another and so on.  The Manager or owner really needs to train the staff.  They were all working, but seemed unclear as to who was responsible for what duties.

We also ordered ice cream and a special birthday dessert, while very tasty - the service was vey slow, at least 10 minutes from the time the ice cream was ordered to served.

What really put us over the top was when they refused to accept their own $50 Gift Certificate that they sold to me in June towards the $160 bill (not including tip).  It had only been approximately 6 weeks. Apparently, this location has been sold.  The old owners still own the location on Odana Rd (same name), but not this one.  Therefore, they would not accept their own gift certificate and told us, we could use it at Odana Rd.  
Interestingly, they still kept the Best of Madison sign on the door for the old ownership,  they will need to take this down.    Again, we were surprised at the business decision about their own gift certificate.
rationale: The sentiment in the review is negative because the customer experienced multiple issues with the service at the restaurant. These issues included slow and inefficient service, language barriers leading to order mistakes, dirty glassware and flatware, unclear responsibilities among the staff, and a significant delay in receiving desserts. Additionally, the situation was aggravated when the restaurant refused to accept their own gift certificate, which was unexpected and disappointing for the reviewer. Overall, the poor service and lack of professionalism described in the review contributed to a negative experience for the customer and their group.

question: My husband and I came today with a group of 14 people for their Sunday lunch buffet and I have to say, for the price, excellent service and quality of food, I really recommend this place!  I called ahead and they allowed our group to have a semi-private room away from the restaurant but close to the buffet.  The buffet had all the dishes you would hope for and some unexpected ones as well!  I really enjoyed the chicken tikka, chana masala, samosa and more common dishes...but they also had a goat dish, fish, several biryanis, really nice chutneys, etc.  \n\nMy only complaint  about this place was that the naan wasn't in a basket with a napkin to keep it warm...it was just plopped on a plate and got cold quickly.  The naan was great and deserves to be kept warm!  The dessert section of the buffet had a ton of variety but the mango ice cream was superb.  Apparently, when you order a meal during the week (even take away!), everyone gets a mango ice cream as well.  The food was excellent but the mango ice cream will bring me back!
rationale: The sentiment of the review is positive because the reviewer highlights the excellent service, quality of food, and the variety of dishes available at the restaurant. They specifically mention enjoying the chicken tikka, chana masala, samosa, and several other dishes. The reviewer praises the buffet setup and the consideration given to their group by providing a semi-private room. Despite a minor complaint about the naan not being kept warm, they emphasize the overall positive experience, particularly enjoying the mango ice cream which they found superb. The reviewer expresses a willingness to return to the restaurant, indicating a positive overall impression.

question: Good food, reasonable price for the lunch buffet and very attentive service. I'll be back.
rationale: The review mentions positive aspects such as good food, reasonable prices for the lunch buffet, and very attentive service. These factors contribute to an overall positive experience for the reviewer, resulting in a positive sentiment towards the establishment.

question: DO NOT EAT HERE.  They changed my tip and charged me $28 for lunch.  Absolutely ridiculous.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the customer had a negative experience at the restaurant. They felt deceived and taken advantage of when their tip was changed without consent, resulting in an unexpected charge for their meal. This kind of behavior is considered unacceptable and reflects poorly on the restaurant.

question:
Let me set the scene... Coming back from the Packers vs Panthers game. The trip is interminable. As we get closer to home we realize we are starving and need to grab take-out or else we will die.
My Pakistani guy suggests Maharajah East. There are 3 of us. We order two orders of Samosas, naan, parantha, chicken mougali, and palak paneer.  We swing by, grab the bag and before you know it we are seated at my table unwrapping our treats.
This is no easy crowd to please. We taste the crispy samosas which are filled with mashed potatoes and peas. Dipped in tamarind sauce they were downright heavenly. We nod silently in approval. We move on and find each dish to be equally yummy. The palak paneer (creamed spinach and cheese) was quite spicy and the mougali was very similar to tikka masala. Both dishes were quite rich. The naan and paratha were used to wipe up every last bit. As a treat, the restaurant threw in two little servings of mango ice cream. Thank you very much!
A great meal to end a great day. Go Pack!
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer describes their experience at Maharajah East in a very enthusiastic and satisfied manner. They mention enjoying all the dishes they ordered, finding them to be "equally yummy," and specifically highlight the delicious flavors of the samosas, palak paneer, and mougali. The reviewer also expresses appreciation for the complementary mango ice cream, indicating an extra touch of generosity from the restaurant. Additionally, the reviewer notes that the meal was a great way to end a great day, further solidifying their positive sentiment towards the overall dining experience.

question:
Got take out here tonight and I love myself some Wisconsin Fish Fry.

We ordered the Lake Perch and The Cod, with baked potatoes.

It was great.  The Lake Perch was light and small but with many pieces-delish-more than enough.

I didn't eat the cod but my relative said it was good but not as good as my perch.

The bake potatoes were excellent, large, cooked perfectly and yummy.

The Rye Bread is a nice touch and it was great.

Slaw, tart sauce and sour cream were all added in a nice box.

I ordered and they were available in 10 minutes.

The woman on the phone was great and the woman that rang me out was great and friendly, considering that she was dealing with an overflow house.

I will be back soon.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer had a pleasant experience overall while ordering takeout from the restaurant. They enjoyed the Wisconsin Fish Fry, specifically praising the Lake Perch and baked potatoes. Even though one dish was not as fantastic as the other, the reviewer still appreciated the quality of the food. They also highlighted the excellent service from the staff, commendable efficiency in fulfilling the order, and the friendliness encountered during the process. The reviewer expressed their intention to return to the restaurant soon, indicating a positive impression and likelihood of future patronage.

question: I read the new ass't governor gave a speech there invoking God.  Please, spare me, now I will pass.\n\nPlease save that shit for church.  The rest of us will pass on this crap.
rationale: The sentiment is Negative because the user expresses disdain and disrespect towards the new assistant governor giving a speech that invoked God, indicating they have a strong negative reaction to religious references in a secular or public setting. The use of strong language like "spare me" and referring to the speech as "crap" shows a clear disapproval of the situation.

question: I went there a few months ago for Fish Fry after reading a rating that this place was a great place for Fish Fry's. I've had dinner here before and it was very good, so I thought oh why not, I'll give it a try. Big mistake! They usually get pretty busy (usually a good sign), but that night we didn't have to wait long for a table. I ordered the Icelandic Cod and It was terrible. As this was a few months ago, my brain is clouded on which exact fish (cod or perch) the comments were made about, but as I recall: The waitress claimed that the cod isn't \"fresh\" and she knew I didn't like it, so she offered to get me some perch, which was fresh. That wasn't much better. One (either the cod or the perch) of them tasted, looked like and smelled like a \"fish stick.\" It literally looked like a kiddie meal. All in all, I will never return for a fish fry there. The waitress was very attentive and tried to make me happy, but it was not her fault, she did everything she could to please me. Service = 5 star, Atmosphere = 4 Star, Food (overall) = 4 Star, Fish Fry = 1 Star
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer had a disappointing dining experience at the restaurant specifically related to the Fish Fry they ordered. They mentioned that the Icelandic Cod they received was terrible, and despite the waitress offering an alternative perch, it also did not meet expectations. The fish was described as tasting, looking, and smelling like a "fish stick" and not being fresh. Despite positive ratings for service and atmosphere, the low rating given for the Fish Fry itself indicates a negative sentiment overall.

question: TERRIBLE service, went here for breakfast and was in shock and awe at how bad our server was.  It took well over 45 minutes for us to get our food and there was only 1 other table in the restaurant.  I got our own coffee, drinks, half and half, ketchup and jam.  I will NEVER go back there again!
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the user had a very unsatisfactory experience at the restaurant. The long wait time for food despite having few other customers, having to serve themselves for basic items like coffee and condiments, and the overall feeling of shock and disappointment all contribute to a negative sentiment. The user explicitly states they will never return, emphasizing the extent of their dissatisfaction.

question:
The place sucks.  I don't care if a commie or socialist or nazi eats there.

The owners are what concerns me most.

I enjoyed the food the first time but when I ready they had the ass't governor holding some fricking prayer service there I was through.

I don't care what any businesses politics are BUTT I don't want to hear or read about them.
rationale: The sentiment in the review is negative because the reviewer expresses strong disapproval of the place and the owners based on their political affiliations and actions. The use of derogatory terms like "commie," "socialist," and "nazi" indicates a strong bias and negative attitude towards the establishment. Additionally, the reviewer's anger towards the owners' political activities and the mention of a prayer service being held at the location convey a sense of resentment and disapproval, contributing to the overall negative sentiment of the review.

question: This place has really gone downhill.  IF you can get a drink (last time I was there, they served their regulars at the bar and totally ignored me repeatedly until I finally asked a waitress how to get a drink at the bar.)  The fish fry has been out of rye bread the last two times, and the time before that, it was stale.  Also, the breading falls off of the cod, and the perch must be coming from a different distributor, as it is extremely fishy tasting.  Coleslaw was good - they must be using the same recipe for that.  Too bad- I used to really look forward to dining here.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer had a disappointing experience at the restaurant. They received poor service at the bar, encountered issues with the fish fry such as lack of rye bread, stale bread, and fish with a fishy taste. Although they liked the coleslaw, the negative aspects outweighed the positives, leading to an overall negative impression of the dining experience.

question: Fish fry was over cooked and greasy. People seem to like it here so maybe I just had it on a bad day.
rationale: The sentiment is Negative because the review describes the fish fry as overcooked and greasy. These are not desirable qualities in a dish, and the reviewer did not have a positive experience. Additionally, the reviewer mentions that others seem to like the place, indicating that their negative experience may have been an anomaly.

question: They make a good brandy old fashioned, but otherwise I am not a fan. Like a previous reviewer, I am also grossed out by tartar sauce that has been sitting out for who-knows-how-long. And the fish fry? I really don't see any greatness there.  Cave-ish interior, average clientele age of 75--really not my scene.
rationale: The sentiment is Negative because the reviewer expresses dissatisfaction with multiple aspects of their experience. They mention not being a fan of the establishment overall, finding the tartar sauce gross and questioning the freshness of the food, and expressing disappointment with the fish fry and the ambiance of the place. The negative comments regarding various aspects of the experience lead to an overall negative sentiment.

question: Not a fan.  We had a breakfast buffet for a meeting there and the food was... not much of a buffet.  Potatoes were cold and greasy and the rest of the food was just not very good.  Have not had lunch or dinner here.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the user expressed disappointment with the breakfast buffet they had at the restaurant. The user mentioned that the food was not up to their expectations - describing the potatoes as cold and greasy and overall not very good. Additionally, the user indicated that they have not had lunch or dinner there, which suggests they were not satisfied with their dining experience.

question: My wife and ate there tonight. Food so so. Service not good. Efficent but not friendly. I had the feeling she wanted to be somewhere else
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the review highlights multiple issues with the dining experience. The food quality is described as "so so," indicating it was not particularly enjoyable. Additionally, the service is criticized for being efficient but lacking warmth and friendliness. The reviewer also mentions feeling that the server was disinterested and not fully present, further contributing to a negative overall experience.

question:
They gave money to discriminate to gay people.

Forget about it.

I will never ever eat there again.

They are major bigots.
rationale: The sentiment expressed in the review is negative because the person expresses strong disapproval and disappointment towards the restaurant, stating that they will never eat there again due to the perception that the restaurant supports discrimination against gay people. The use of words like "discriminate", "bigots", and the overall tone convey a strong negative sentiment towards the establishment.

question: Yes, it's a chain.  Is it top of the line?  No.  But the quality has greatly improved over the years and the service as well.  They handle groups well.  This place is always on the list for my office to have lunch.  I recommend it.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the review acknowledges that while the establishment is a chain and may not be considered top-tier, there have been noticeable improvements in both the quality of the food and the level of service over the years. Additionally, the reviewer highlights the restaurant's ability to handle groups effectively, making it a reliable choice for office lunches. The personal recommendation adds to the positive sentiment, indicating overall satisfaction with the dining experience.

question: One of the employees stole my sons wallet.  He left it at the table and with in a half hour is disappeared.  The management are not willing to do anything about this and say that it just disappeared and that their employees do not steal.  I have managed restaurants, and theft is quite common.  Ever watch restaurant undercover on Foodnetwork.  The management actually laughed at me that i would think the employees would steal.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is Negative because the customer's son experienced theft at the restaurant, and the management's response was dismissive and unsympathetic. The customer felt unheard and disrespected by the management's refusal to take action and their mocking attitude towards the concern of theft. The customer's past experience in the restaurant industry also leads them to believe that theft is common in such establishments, adding to their frustration with the situation.

question:
I was hungry so I stopped in. Not hard to be seated at 4:30PM. FIrst time at an OG. 
Salty, doughy breadsticks. Minestrone OK. 
Eggplant parmesan, greasy, boring cheese. The red sauce, peppery but no substantial flavor.
Chicken parmesan. Might as well walk down the street, head into McDonald's, pay one fifth the price and order some chicken nuggets.
"Have we arrived at our taste destination?" Huh? No, we aren't in Italy. Italian food is light years beyond what is served at OG. Maybe I ordered the wrong thing. If you can't do the basics correctly, how are the other dishes fare?
This chain of restaurants is one of many contributing to American obesity. Quantity vs. quality. "Unlimited soup, breadsticks" makes you think you got a bargain. I think not. I left full, but I can get full at McDonald's too. Americans don't know the difference any more.
rationale: The sentiment is Negative because the reviewer had a disappointing experience at the restaurant. The review mentions various issues with the food, such as salty and doughy breadsticks, greasy eggplant parmesan, and lackluster chicken parmesan. The reviewer also criticizes the lack of authentic Italian flavors and questions the overall quality of the dishes. Additionally, the review expresses dissatisfaction with the focus on quantity over quality, with comments on the restaurant's contribution to American obesity. Overall, the reviewer's experience was far from positive, leading to a Negative sentiment.

question: Had lunch here today. All in all, the food is tasty and I've been her several times before. Unfortunately, my co-worker got a hair in her food and had to wait for them to re-cook it, but that was a huge dent in the dining experience.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because despite the food being tasty and the reviewer having visited the restaurant multiple times before, the experience was significantly impacted by finding a hair in their co-worker's food. This incident caused inconvenience and likely discomfort, overshadowing the positive aspects of the meal and leading to an overall negative dining experience for the group.

question: Been going here for years but either the quality has slid or my taste has improved because the last few times have been a disappointment. I really wanna like it as I live nearby but anymore I drive to the west side location which is not perfect but it has higher quality food.\n\nWhy can't this town have one good Chinese place, I'd eat there once a week!  instead we have 50 awful ones and three mediocre.  This is one of the Mediocre, but for the price it should be considerably better.  maybe this is what midwestern mall shoppers want?
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer expresses disappointment in the declining quality of the restaurant they have been going to for years. They also mention driving to a different location for higher quality food, indicating dissatisfaction with the current restaurant's offerings. The reviewer is disappointed with the overall quality, referring to it as mediocre and stating that for the price, they expect better. The reviewer's tone suggests frustration and a desire for better dining options in their town.

question: This is the worst Chinese food I have had could not even finish meal...ordered general tso's chicken with egg roll.  I do not recommend this place.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer describes the Chinese food as the worst they have ever had and were unable to finish their meal. Additionally, they specifically mention not recommending the place to others. These reasons indicate that the overall experience with the food and service was unsatisfactory.

question: Nice decorations and inerior, that's about it. The waitress is not helping at all for selecting good menu. They are charging for hot tea and pepper oil.(I guess they need to do that recover from investing for the interior.) Go ahead cross the street and go to the food court in the mall. They have better service and half lower price for the better food.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the customer experienced disappointments with the service provided by the waitress in selecting a menu. Additionally, the customer felt that charging for hot tea and pepper oil, in addition to potential high investment costs for the interior, were not justified. The recommendation to go to the food court in the mall highlights the perceived better service and more cost-effective options for food compared to the reviewed establishment. Overall, the review expresses dissatisfaction with the dining experience at the mentioned restaurant.

question: Overall experience was disappointing. For all of the awards that they've received that they display in the entrance, this experience was not good. Food was okay, probably one of the most bland general tsao's chicken I have ever had. And last but not least, the service was terrible. I had to wait 20 minutes for my second glass of water. If you are looking for a good Chinese restaurant, your best bet is to save a few dollars and get a better meal at Panda Express at the east town mall across the street.
rationale: The sentiment is Negative because the reviewer expressed disappointment with their overall experience at the restaurant. They specifically mentioned that the food was bland and highlighted poor service, such as having to wait a long time for a simple request like a second glass of water. Additionally, the reviewer suggested that a better meal could be found at a fast-food chain instead of this supposedly award-winning restaurant, indicating a lack of satisfaction with the quality of the food and service provided.

question: Lame, I didnt have very high expectations but had heard a very good things and I was not impressed.  The bartender told me everything was fresh and prepared in house and made to order.  After I ordered the food came out literally within 1-3 mins so I know for a fact that it was not fresh or made to order.  To be honest I would have been more satisfied with food court chinese/asian food.  Sad comparison i know, but true. I would not eat there again.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the customer had low expectations but was still disappointed with the experience. The customer felt misled by the bartender's claim that the food was fresh and made to order, only for the food to be served extremely quickly. Additionally, the customer expressed that they would have preferred food court Chinese/Asian food over their experience at this establishment, indicating a lack of satisfaction with the quality of the food. Overall, the customer concluded that they would not return to eat there again, highlighting their dissatisfaction with the overall dining experience.

question: Hands down my favorite place for Chinese food in Madison. Consistency is key for me and IG is always consistent. The pace is slower than some restaurants, but it's worth the extra time. We eat here at least 4-5 times a year and it's always a great night with great service. \n\nCashew Chicken, egg roll, shrimp rangoon and a glass of wine = LOVE!
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the review highlights the reviewer's favorite place for Chinese food in Madison, emphasizing consistency, good service, and enjoyable dining experiences. The reviewer mentions returning multiple times a year and expresses love for specific menu items, reinforcing their positive feelings towards the restaurant. Overall, the reviewer's positive comments and praise for the food, service, and overall experience indicate a favorable sentiment.

question: I really don't know what happened with all of the negative reviewers. We've been coming to Imperial Garden since 1997.  We've tried other places, but this place is easily the best  for Chinese food anywhere in the area. Chicken & Broccoli, Beef Lo-mein, Stir fried rice noodles, steamed pot stickers, & the chicken egg foo young are all great! General Tso's is good too.  Staff is very friendly, many have been working there for 10+ years, and we are remembered when we come in- a nice touch. We've been to the westside location as well. Good, but not as good as East, if you ask me. If you don't believe me, take a look at the wall in the lobby. They've won best in Madison nearly every year since 1987! How many restaurants around now can say the same thing??
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer is expressing a strong preference for Imperial Garden and highlighting their positive experiences with the food and staff over many years. They praise a variety of menu items and mention the longstanding presence of the staff as a positive aspect. The reviewer also points out the restaurant's consistent recognition as the best in the area for Chinese food over several years, which further adds to the positive sentiment. Overall, the reviewer's enthusiasm and loyalty towards Imperial Garden contribute to a positive sentiment in the review.

question: My husband and I returned to Imperial Garden for dinner with our children. We were there on a Friday night. There was a bit of a wait (about 20 min), but nothing out of the ordinary for a Friday night around 5:30 pm. We had another great experience. We found IG family friendly and able to accommodate our two children without disturbing any other guests. Our five year old loved the experience and the food as well. And as parents know, if your children are happy, you are happy. We ordered the (very affordable I might add) lo mein for our daughter. It was good and there were plenty of leftovers between the lo mein and the two entrees we ordered.
rationale: The sentiment in this review is positive because the customer had an overall great experience dining at Imperial Garden with their family. They appreciated the family-friendly atmosphere, the accommodating service for their children, and the affordable menu options. The fact that their five-year-old loved the experience and food also added to their happiness. Furthermore, the positive mention of plenty of leftovers from the meal indicates satisfaction with the portion sizes and value for money.

question: We really enjoyed our meal there.  We ordered a variety of dishes including curry beef,  egg foo young and Governor's chicken.  Nothing trendy,  just reliable Chinese dishes.  Everything was fresh,  and the beef egg foo young was especially good.  We'd return.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer shared that they "really enjoyed" their meal at the restaurant. They appreciated the variety of dishes they ordered and found them to be fresh and reliable. Specifically mentioning that the beef egg foo young was especially good indicates a high level of satisfaction with the food. The statement, "We'd return," suggests that they had a good overall experience and would be willing to dine at the restaurant again in the future.

question: Not sure why this place has so many good reviews as the food is not Chinese! I'm a Chinese girl myself and I know how Chinese food should taste like. And this place does not have the authentic Chinese taste, in fact, it is a mixture of American, Thai and Chinese altogether which makes me disappointed. However, what makes me even more disappointed was when I ordered beef lo mein, The waiter was too busy chitchatting with guests and put in pork lo mein instead. When I called him back (it was a takeout order) he was saying it was his mistake and will credit that for my future order and refused to replace it! I was like, really? Definitely will not come back and  not recommend this place to friends and family!
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the customer had high expectations for authentic Chinese food but was disappointed by the lack of traditional flavors and the fusion of different cuisines. Additionally, the error in their order and the unsatisfactory response from the waiter further contributed to their negative experience. The customer felt let down by both the food quality and the service, leading them to decide not to return and not recommend the restaurant to others.

question: I've been meaning to give the place a review, but I can be forgetful. My husband and I ate here recently at the suggestion of his sister. We started off with soups; I went with the hot and sour soup and my husband chose the won-ton soup. I was extremely pleased with my choice, because in my experience hot and sour soup is a very hit or miss dish. I've tried many I wasn't satisfied with, but their soup had a wonderful, vibrant flavor. It also had shredded pork, which I'm not really accustomed to it having, but it was delicious. My husband liked his soup as well, though good  won-ton soup is much easier to find. I ordered the Cashew Chicken, which consists of chicken, cashews, water chestnuts, pea pods, mushrooms, and carrots. I liked the flavor of the Cashew Chicken, but it didn't really stand out for me compared to the same dish at other restaurants. My husband ordered the General Tsao Chicken and he was pretty pleased with what he had. They  also brought out a big plate of white rice for us to share from; the rice was cooked well and sticky. Our server was also very attentive, she made sure our drinks were filled and checked up on us often. The prices were decent and I'd be happy to go back whenever I'm in Madison.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is positive because the customer had a satisfying experience at the restaurant. They highlighted enjoying the hot and sour soup, the Cashew Chicken, and the General Tsao Chicken. The positive aspects mentioned include the vibrant flavor of the hot and sour soup, the delicious addition of shredded pork, the attentive service from the server, well-cooked rice, and reasonable prices. Overall, the customer expressed satisfaction with the food quality, service, and value, indicating a positive sentiment towards the restaurant.

question: No fortune in the fortune cookie! Are you for real?!\n\nSo my friend and I are scoping out all the Chinese restaurants in Madison, and this one was not impressive. Although it looked promising when we arrived because of how many people were here, we quickly learned the truth. This place ... is whack. I ordered my go to - cashew chicken - and my friend ordered one of her go to's - fried rice with beef - and we were both NOT impressed. Second bite into my chicken, and it's HARD. Like BONE hard. Eew. And my friend's fried rice had so much egg in it, it took up a quarter of her plate after picking the egg out of a third of her dish. Like, we know protein is important, but there are other food groups too, ya know? The best parts of my cashew chicken were the cashews and the white rice - which if you don't know - are impossible to mess up. So we wait for our bill, like forever, and when we finally get it, there are our fortune cookies! I open mine, and it has the fortune sticking out, and she opens hers, and BOOM. No fortune. That's like the whole reason we're doing this. We love those fortunes. Disappointment. Wah. Anyway. The chicken was bad quality, I've had much better. The pieces that weren't hard were dark meat - very spongy. But they fill up that soy sauce bottle real good, because we used over half of it, so that's a plus. Prices weren't bad either. Overall, we decided not to come back.
rationale: The sentiment in the review is negative because the customer and their friend had a disappointing experience at the Chinese restaurant in Madison. The food quality was subpar, with the cashew chicken being described as hard and having dark, spongy meat. The fried rice was also not satisfactory, with an excessive amount of egg. Additionally, the absence of a fortune in one of the fortune cookies was a major disappointment for the customers, who enjoy that part of the dining experience. The overall impression was unfavorable, leading the customers to decide not to return to the restaurant.

question:
I can't believe I haven't reviewed this yet. This is one of the better Chinese places in Madison, although it can be a little spendy (not too bad, though) compared to your run-of-the-mill Chinese take-out joint. It's worth it, though.

The menu here is huge, and the portions match. I've never come here and not had leftovers to reheat the next day. 

The food itself is almost always excellent. The wonton soup and anything with duck in it, in particular, are really well-flavored. 

This is also one of the few Chinese restaurants I've been to that does an equally good job of catering the adventurous eaters and people who are a little bit less comfortable with something out of the ordinary. 

Service is also always friendly and quick, especially considering how big the restaurant is.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is positive because the reviewer highlights several positive aspects of the Chinese restaurant they visited in Madison. They mention that the food is excellent, particularly praising the wonton soup and dishes with duck. The reviewer also appreciates the extensive menu and generous portions that leave them with leftovers. Furthermore, they highlight that the restaurant caters well to both adventurous eaters and those looking for more familiar options. Additionally, the reviewer praises the friendly and quick service despite the restaurant's size. Overall, the reviewer has a high regard for the food quality, menu variety, portion sizes, and service, all contributing to their positive experience.

question: Tammy fixed my favorite sunglasses (not purchased at eyemart) at no charge!  What great, friendly service.\nI stopped in to Eyemart Express to see if my favorite sunglasses could be fixed.  I will definitely go back for my next pair of sunglasses.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the user had a great experience at Eyemart Express where Tammy was able to fix their favorite sunglasses at no charge. The user appreciated the excellent and friendly service received, indicating they will return for future sunglasses purchases. This positive review highlights the exceptional customer service and satisfaction the user experienced at Eyemart Express.

question: Went in and worked with this funny and wonderful man. The whole time my step daughter and I never knew he was the store manager but we can see why after we found out. He was very professional and helpful to all. His staff loved him and they all was laughing with all their customers and just seemed they loved working there.\nWhat a Great leader. We will be back because Allen showed and gave us the best service ever.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the review highlights the manager's professional and helpful demeanor, as well as the positive atmosphere he fosters among his staff. The mention of the staff laughing with customers and loving their work environment further emphasizes the positive experience had by the reviewer and her stepdaughter. The mention of receiving the best service ever from the manager, Allen, indicates a high level of satisfaction, leading to a positive sentiment in the review.

question: I would give a zero but I can't I bought alot of glasses from this location and not one pair is correct just took my glasses in for repair and still broke now with a huge scratch on the lens all the have been doing is changing management and screwing there faithful customers I am really angry and upset like I said if it was possible I would have given you a zero for workmanship and how you treat your customers
rationale: The review expresses dissatisfaction with the quality of the glasses purchased, highlighting issues with accuracy and durability. The customer is upset about receiving incorrect orders and experiencing further problems even after seeking repairs. They also mention a lack of consistency due to frequent changes in management. Overall, the frustration and disappointment conveyed in the review indicate a negative sentiment towards the business's workmanship and customer treatment.

question: Prices too high and service very slow. Save yourself lots of money and frustration and avoid this location. I've made the mistake of getting service here three times and always leave in a bad mood. Watch out for the aggressive up sell!
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the review highlights multiple issues with the location, including high prices, slow service, and aggressive upselling. These factors contribute to a frustrating experience for the customer, leaving them in a bad mood after each visit. The reviewer advises others to avoid this location to save money and avoid similar frustrations.

question:
Went here today for a flat tire patch.  I left pertinent info and went across the street to kill time.  When I returned, a mechanic mentioned that I was due for an oil change, and did I want them to change my oil?  I said no (my dealership recommends every six months versus every three months) and the mechanic looked stricken, and went back into the garage.  

When I paid the bill, I was surprised to discover a charge for an oil filter that was not "okayed" by me.  

I returned home and noticed a sweet smell by my radiator.  Radiator fluid.  I can't figure out that none of those guys could figure out that there was a radiator leak while they were replacing the oil filter that I did not approve!

Taking my car back to the dealership tomorrow.  Never again, Goodyear!

Update:
The radiator fluid smell was due to the fact that the staff at Good Year opened up the radiator to see how the level of fluid was.  In doing so, some of the fluid splashed up on my grill, causing the sweet smell.  How did I discover this?  When I took my car to the dealership after I smelled the radiator fluid.  Expensive lesson learned.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the customer experienced multiple issues during their visit to Goodyear. They were upsold on an oil change despite declining it, were charged for an oil filter without consent, and noticed a radiator leak after the service, which was not addressed by the staff. These issues show a lack of communication, transparency, and attention to detail on the part of the service center, leading to a frustrating and unsatisfactory experience for the customer.

question: Very unhelpful. The staff did not even attempt to address my needs.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the user expressed dissatisfaction with the service received, stating that the staff did not make any effort to address their needs. This implies a lack of responsiveness and customer care, which can lead to frustration and disappointment.

question:
The first time I came in, one of the staff on the floor helped address some of my questions when trying to pick out my new device. She was helpful and even offered to help me with discounts because I didn't need all of the accessories. She even helped me sort out some billing questions I had on my shared plan. For this reason, I am giving them an extra star. I wish I could remember this one's name.

I went back the next day and was served by Rebecca. She was unfriendly and never smiled! She helped me with what I needed, but seemed uninterested in helping me make my purchases. When it came time to check out, she barely gave me any information in regards to:

1. What kind of rebate I was getting and how to really go about doing it.
2. Did not ask if I wanted her to put on my screen protector, decided to do it herself, and didn't even make it straight
3. Asked me if I wanted insurance but never told me what it included
4. Did not ask me if I wanted all of the accessories but just assumed I wanted the bundle.

These are just a few of the concerns I had. I think that if I never asked questions, I would have not learned about any of these things. I was less than impressed with the customer service I received. It was so poor that I almost just walked out of the store without buying anything. She was lucky I already knew what I wanted.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is negative because the customer had a poor experience with a specific staff member named Rebecca during their second visit to the store. Rebecca was described as unfriendly, not engaging with the customer, and lacking in the level of service expected when making a purchase. The customer felt that Rebecca did not provide essential information about the products and services, made assumptions about their preferences without asking, and did not demonstrate a willingness to assist effectively. These factors combined led the customer to consider leaving the store without making a purchase, indicating a lack of satisfaction with the customer service received.

question: I was very disappointed at the service I got here.  My iphone is 1 1/2 years old and was turning off on me constantly.  I didn't drop it and never had problems before.  I went to the store for help and they checked the battery and then told me there is nothing they can do unless I purchase a warranty on the phone.  I went home and deleted old photos and videos and updated the software and it no longer shuts off.  I just think it's ridiculous they told me there was nothing they could do unless I bought a warranty, when clearly there were simple things I could do to fix it!!!
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the user was disappointed with the service provided to them. They felt that the store was unhelpful by suggesting they purchase a warranty for a problem that could have been resolved through simple steps like deleting old files and updating the software. The user's frustration with the lack of assistance and the perceived unnecessary push for a warranty led to a negative overall experience.

question:
Welcome to my exclusive 1-star club, Mr. Roberts.

I went here to see a friend's band play, despite my boyfriend's warning that it was not the greatest bar.  I do so love dive bars--how bad could it be?

Bad.  It's so bad.  It's past the stage of being a fun dive bar, it's just plain frightening.  The people looked like the kind of scary, angry drunks you would only encounter in a movie.  The bathroom stall was so little that had I weighed 20 pounds more, I probably would have gotten wedged in (the door opened inward, not outward).

We did not stay long, I did not regret it, and won't be back.  Ick, yuck, blech, and ptooey.  Why would anyone think this is a good place?!
rationale: The sentiment of the review is negative because the customer had a very unpleasant experience at the bar. From encountering frightening and angry individuals to finding the facilities unappealing, the customer's overall impression was strongly negative. The use of words like "bad," "frightening," "ick," "yuck," "blech," and "ptooey" clearly conveys a sense of disappointment and disgust, indicating a negative sentiment towards the establishment.

question:
I fully appreciate that Mr. Roberts is a blue collar dive bar that's located on Atwood. So when a friend asked me to join him to watch a favorite band there, I set my expectations accordingly.

Is it possible for an establishment to disappoint you when you've already lowered your expectations to crackhouse-lows? Only if that establishment is Mr. Roberts.

The tap beers are not only unexciting, they're as stale and flat as day old bread that's been run over by a steamroller.  Bartenders are more interested in talking with their buddies than they are helping anyone. And the whole vibe of this place is more sketchy than an Etch-A-Sketch wearing Sketchers... 

I'd give anything to not be stuck here right now. I'm scared to death of what might be lurking in the bathrooms... Think I'll go pee in the parking lot.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is negative because the customer had already lowered their expectations for Mr. Roberts, yet the establishment still managed to disappoint them. The review highlights multiple negative aspects such as unexciting, stale beer, disinterested bartenders, and a sketchy vibe, making the overall experience unpleasant for the customer. The mention of feeling scared in the bathrooms and the decision to pee in the parking lot further emphasize the negative sentiment towards Mr. Roberts.

question:
Mr. Roberts is not a place I'd ever go to for the sole purpose of going out. Both times I've gone have been for bands, and both times were fairly different experiences.

My first time was a one-star experience: it was ridiculously hot and humid inside, the staff lacked any sort of motivation for good customer service, and they crammed the 7- or 8-piece band in the front of the bar near the window, making for awkward viewing and playing. The sound was terrible and I spent more time outside than in. 

My second time was a better experience, but still not one that would cause me to suggest other people go there. This time around it was a reasonable temperature in the bar, but that may only be due to the fact that it was in the 50s outside. The bands played in the back of the bar in an alcove/side room deal and it made a lot more sense. The sound was still deafening and subject to random strangers twiddling the knobs on the mixer, but overall not too bad. 

Free music is the best thing (only thing?) Mr. Roberts has going for it. Its biggest downsides:
- it's touted as a blue-collar bar, but it's more an excuse to be shabby and dirty than anything; $15 for a 5-bottle bucket of beer is not a good deal, and $5 for a PBR & a rail shot is a special for a couple hours one night a week when it should be the standard price for such a combination
- the ladies room is ridiculously tiny and awkward, had a seat that was half hanging off the bowl, and no TP
- every surface was dirty or sticky, yuck

You probably won't die if you go to see a friend's band play, but supporting a friend should be the only motivation for setting foot inside.
rationale: The review expresses multiple negative experiences and criticisms of Mr. Roberts, highlighting issues with the venue's atmosphere, customer service, cleanliness, pricing, and overall experience for patrons attending live music events. These aspects collectively contribute to an unfavorable impression of the establishment and suggest that the reviewer does not recommend visiting Mr. Roberts for entertainment purposes.

question: The service at Mr. Roberts is okay, but the free live music is what pulls me in! Drinks are reasonably priced too.
rationale: The sentiment in the review is negative because the word "okay" used to describe the service does not convey a strongly positive feeling. Additionally, the positive aspects mentioned (free live music and reasonably priced drinks) are not enough to offset the lukewarm response to the service. This indicates that the overall experience at Mr. Roberts is not exceptional or outstanding, leading to a negative sentiment.

question: Karaoke on Tuesday night is so fun! i love this unpretentious, accepting place. The drinks are well priced.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the user is expressing enjoyment and enthusiasm for the karaoke night, as well as appreciating the welcoming atmosphere of the place. Additionally, the user mentions that the drinks are well priced, indicating a good value for the experience. Overall, the review conveys a sense of satisfaction and happiness about the experience, leading to a positive sentiment.

question:
I never went into the old Tip Top (because I was far too terrified) but there is no way it held a candle to the current Tip Top. 

Basically, the place looks fantastic from ceiling to floor. It now makes sense why the remodel took so long and it was clearly worth the wait. It's exactly what you'd want a neighborhood bar to be. Small but not too small, inviting atmosphere, comfortable lighting, and no over the top decorating. 

I had a beer and a very good whisky sour. Looking forward to heading back soon.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer praises the current Tip Top bar for its fantastic appearance, inviting atmosphere, comfortable lighting, and understated decor. The reviewer also mentions enjoying their drinks and expresses excitement about returning. These positive comments indicate satisfaction with the bar's ambiance and offerings, resulting in an overall positive sentiment.

question:
The place has gotten quite a dramatic face-lift. It looks great. I love everything they've done with the place.

I tried the Tip Top Burger and the chili. The burger was fine, but not spectacular. The chili was really freaking delicious, though. I would highly recommend grabbing a bowl. 

The space is pretty small, but there is actually a lot of seating. It does get pretty loud though. The staff members were all very nice and did a great job. The bitchy people  next to us were treated a lot nicer than they deserved. A waiter mixed up an order and was very apologetic and quickly resolved the issue.

Overall, I'm happy that the place is finally open. A welcome addition to the neighborhood.
rationale: The sentiment in the review is positive because the customer describes the newly renovated place as great and loves everything that has been done to it. They specifically highlight the delicious chili and recommend it to others. Despite minor issues like the burger not being spectacular and the potential loudness of the space, the customer acknowledges that the staff members were nice and did a great job, even handling a mixed-up order with prompt and apologetic service. The customer expresses happiness that the place is finally open and considers it a welcome addition to the neighborhood, overall portraying a positive experience.

question:
I stopped by the Tip Top yesterday evening with some coworkers to finally check it out. I've been curious since renovations began and was expecting great things. After a late shift, we were there for drinks and light food. The place was bustling, and yes noisy, yet we could still have a conversation without straining at a table near the back wall - so don't be afraid to bring a friend here if you actually want to chat. Selection was great and everything that we ordered (and actually received) was excellent. The fried pickles are crispy, delicious, and done right.

However after waiting a half hour for an order of chicken wings, we were able to grab our server's attention and ask about my wings. "Oops," she said. And then a not very satisfying apology. Having already waited a half hour, we were wrapping our night up and I said, "Let's forget them" since she was offering any solutions. 

Somewhere between ordering the wings and realizing we wouldn't get them, our server told us she was taking off for the night and asked us to settle up with her. Our bill was completely off. You could say the free beers offset the lost order but it definitely wasn't intentional since the bill came first.

I have high expectations of customer service and Tip Top Tavern failed, which is too bad because I was really beginning to like the place.
rationale: The sentiment is Negative because the reviewer had high expectations for their experience at Tip Top Tavern but ultimately felt disappointed. They had a frustrating wait for their order of chicken wings, encountered issues with the server's attentiveness and accuracy in handling the bill, and felt let down by the overall customer service provided. These experiences overshadowed the positive aspects of the visit, leading to a negative overall review of their experience at the establishment.

question:
I could say "This is a tip top spot!" but that would be CHEESY and my New Year's resolution 23 years ago was to avoid such things.

ANYways. I definitely liked the ambiance of this space a lot. A charming neighborhood bar with horizontal narrow wood paneling, lower lighting, tiled floor, tin ceiling, and a very pretty border/trim around the ceiling. Being a small-ish space with lower ceilings and hard floors, it does get a bit noisy when the place fills up so best to beat the rush if you're sensitive to that sort of thing. Also, it's another CASH ONLY spot so be sure to stock up or else they have an ATM on site.

My co-workers and I headed here for drinks one Friday. The place seemed to have a "must order food" policy in order to be seated at the tables so 15 of us frustratingly spent a bit of time crowded at the entrance, downing beers, trying to decide if we should move on. Fortunately, I think the staff finally figured out that two beers basically equals the cost of a sandwich (so what's the difference) and we got a nice row of tables.  Whew!  The place was definitely running a wait by 6:30pm so, again, head out early/late!

The Mister and I headed here at 6pm on a Saturday and were able to snag the last open table in the place. The beer list is good and reasonably priced ($4).  The menu offers burgers, apps, and sandwiches and sports several vegetarian options. Mr. had the special (Walleye sandwich) which he enjoyed while I had the Seitan Philly ($8.95), also tasty. We started with the cheese curds ($5.95) which were yummy. I'd previously had the kettle chips/dip, which were just that, chips/dip, nothing fancy and the fried pickles which weren't my favorite... 

All in all I really liked the ambiance (but I'd go early so I can hear better) and appreciate the reasonably priced & yummy options for both vegetarians and carnivores.  I hope they are able to work out the kinks along the way (i.e., must order food to get a seat policy) but overall think this is a very nice addition to the neighborhood.
rationale: The sentiment is Positive because the reviewer highlighted several aspects they enjoyed about the place, such as the ambiance, reasonably priced food and drinks, variety of menu options for both vegetarians and carnivores, and the overall positive experience despite some initial frustrations. They expressed appreciation for the establishment and considered it a nice addition to the neighborhood, indicating an overall positive impression of the spot.

question:
Small but high-quality menu selections with locally sourced foods. Good value for what you get.  Great selection of microbrew beers. Our waiter was very attentive and a nice guy.
 
TheTip Top Tavern has opened again after a major remodel. It was well worth the wait. It is now cozy, cute, and tiny. 

Great for those who prefer unique destinations over corporate chains.
rationale: The review expresses positive sentiments by highlighting several key factors. Firstly, the reviewer compliments the small but high-quality menu selections with locally sourced foods, which suggests a commitment to quality and supporting local businesses. Additionally, the mention of good value for what you get indicates that customers feel they are getting a fair deal. Praise for the great selection of microbrew beers and the attentive service further contribute to the positive sentiment. Finally, the reviewer appreciates the cozy and unique atmosphere of the tavern, indicating a preference for individuality over corporate chains. Overall, these factors demonstrate a positive customer experience that contributes to the positive sentiment of the review.

question:
Stopped by for a late meal on a Thursday night and the place was quite lively, but there were still a few tables open.  The servers all seemed to be having a good time and took excellent care of us, checking in just enough but not too much.  

The menu is small, but has something for everyone.  We tried the carnitas - flavorful and tender - and a burger - expertly seasoned and juicy.  Both were slightly overcooked: the burger arrived more medium rare than the requested rare, and on the carnitas the yolk of one fried egg was deliciously soft, while the other was just a bit too set.  However the high quality ingredients and delightful flavors evened out any imperfections.  The drink menu was well rounded and we enjoyed both the beer and cocktails.  

The small touches in design elevate the interior from the ordinary in an entirely pleasing way.  Tip Top is a great addition to the neighborhood and I look forward to enjoying it again soon.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is positive because the reviewer highlighted several aspects they enjoyed about their experience at the restaurant. They found the atmosphere lively and the staff attentive and friendly. Despite some minor issues with the food being slightly overcooked, the reviewer praised the flavors and quality of the dishes. Additionally, they appreciated the variety of options on the menu, the well-rounded drink selection, and the thoughtful interior design of the restaurant. Overall, the reviewer expressed excitement about returning to the restaurant, indicating a positive overall impression.

question:
Love!   We will be back, and back often.  As our summer Saturday dining trek continues this is the epitome of what we want.  A local joint, that just makes you comfortable and glad to be out.

Arrived about 6:30 on a Saturday, and found our way to the new back patio.  A couple of larger groups, but plenty of choice of seating.  Found our table, and service was immediate-friendly, attentive, and just exceptional.  KR had barely ordered and couldn't stop gushing about her love of this place.  
We started with the fried pickles, based on previous reviews, and they were perfectly done.
KR had the Rooster sandwich and enjoyed it so much, she only offered me a tiny bite, As I'm unable to order the same, I was forced to the Tip Top burger, and was not disappointed.  Perfectly done, and flavor throughout.
After another beverage, and just enjoying the evening, we got our check and headed out.
Thanks to other reviews, we knew CASH only, but there is an ATm, so heads up!

Perfect, exactly what we wanted, and this sets the bar for us for the balance of our summer Saturday dining trek.
rationale: The sentiment in the review is positive because the customers express their love for the restaurant and their intention to return. They describe the experience as comfortable, enjoyable, and exceptional. The immediate and friendly service, delicious food like the fried pickles and sandwiches, and the pleasant atmosphere on the back patio all contribute to a positive dining experience. The customers also appreciate the details provided in other reviews about the restaurant, showing that they feel well-prepared and satisfied with their visit. Overall, the review conveys a sense of satisfaction and sets high expectations for future visits, making it a positive review.

question:
Finally go to the Tip Top last night for dinner and had a great experience.  Great job with the remodel, and the outdoor patio is very nice as they put up a high enough fence to block the street and make it private, but it is lareg enough to be fun.
  Excellent liquor and beer selections at reasonable prices.  Food was way better than expected - huge portions, excellent quality, and nicely different than the usual Madtown fare.  

We had fried pickles which were done with tempura batter so they were not heavy and the slight sweetness of the batter nicely offset the brininess of the pickles.  Huge basket with a great home made dipping sauce ( a remoulade) as well.   Then, thank God cause it is also big, we split a plate of two pepper mac 'n cheese, which was cooked perfectly and the jalapenos were offset perfectly by the poblanos for a flavorful balance.  

Twelve taps, good cocktails, great service and a friendly atmosphere.  Hope you do well Tip Top!
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer had a great experience at the Tip Top restaurant. They mentioned the remodeled interior and nice outdoor patio with a high fence for privacy. Additionally, they highlighted the excellent liquor and beer selections at reasonable prices, as well as the better-than-expected food with huge portions and excellent quality. The reviewer specifically praised the fried pickles with tempura batter and homemade dipping sauce, as well as the flavorful two pepper mac 'n cheese. They also appreciated the variety of drinks, good service, and friendly atmosphere, expressing hope for the restaurant's success. Overall, the reviewer's detailed and positive descriptions of their dining experience contribute to the upbeat sentiment.

question:
Food:  The fried pickles with special sauce are very good.  The breading is like the batter from a good fish fry, and the pickles are cut in deliciously thin chips.  The sweet potato fries were also quite good, but they were cold when they got to us.  I always appreciate it when a restaurant goes the extra mile to make their own vegetarian burger.  This one was fair and had a southwest flavor to it.  The macaroni and cheese (which does not come with the cilantro or parsley mentioned on the menu) was pretty bad.  You could eat the top layer off, but the bottom layer was completely flooded with oil.

Service:  The server was very friendly and courteous.  However, we only got a refill on the water when the check came.  Like most pubs, be prepared for a pretty good wait before you get your food.  And, there appeared to be some issue with misplacing our appetizer order.  

Atmosphere:  Fun and kind of hipster.   There is a nice outdoor patio, but be aware that it is dog friendly.  This means that you may have someones poorly trained dog licking your feet during dinner.  This also means that all of the servers and staff will pet the dogs while handling your food.  If this is a concern for you, consider a different restaurant.

Price: Very reasonable.  Starters were about $5 and entrees were less than $10.

Payment:  Cash only

Parking: Street, but there seemed to be plenty of spaces.

I love Tip Top Tavern's sister restaurant - Lazy Janes - and I would like to come back for brunch.  And, the new ownership has done some great things to the restaurant.  But, I would not come back for dinner.  The food was fair to poor, and the dog issue is unappetizing.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is negative because the customer highlights several issues with the food quality, service, atmosphere, and overall dining experience at the restaurant. The customer found the macaroni and cheese to be bad due to being overly oily, the sweet potato fries were cold, and the vegetarian burger was only fair. They also mentioned a significant wait time for food, a mistake with their appetizer order, and discomfort with the dog-friendly atmosphere leading to concerns about hygiene. These negative aspects outweigh the positives, making the overall sentiment unfavorable.

question: Poor service by the wait staff is my biggest complaint. We were there at 5:00 (and it wasn't busy yet), and it took probably 15 minutes to place our order. \n\nFinally, $16.95 for a fish fry. Yowzers!
rationale: The sentiment is Negative because the user expressed dissatisfaction with the service provided by the wait staff, highlighting a slow order placement process despite the lack of busyness at the time. Additionally, the user mentioned a high price of $16.95 for a fish fry, indicating they felt the cost was unreasonable or too expensive. These negative experiences would likely result in an overall negative impression of the dining experience.

question:
I have been on two trips to Top Top now, and figured it was time to write a quick review. I've done weeknight dinner and Sunday brunch.

The weeknight we stopped in was a beautiful night for patio eating. My partner and I both had the Tip Top burgers and they were wonderful. Nice albeit modest selection of beers on tap (disclaimer: we moved from Milwaukee where anything less than a novel in a beer menu is modest) and just an all around pleasant experience. Service was good--relaxed but not too distant--and we were in and out in decent time.

Brunch was a few days ago and nearer to memory. I stopped in with a friend who ordered the pastrami hash and I had the veggie benedict. Mint and avocado? Apparently delicious! My only minor complaint on the benedict was that the tomatoes weren't quite ripe, but as my own garden will attest it's been a rough tomato year. My friend who has a gluten allergy was delighted to learn that they offer gluten free bread and said his hash was delicious. It was pretty quiet, just us and a few other people around noon. Hoping other people find this little neighborhood gem soon. Just, you know, not when I want to be there, it's nice to have some room to stretch out ;).
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer had great experiences on both visits to Top Top. They enjoyed the food, with positive comments about the burgers, pastrami hash, and veggie benedict. The reviewer appreciated the selection of beers, the pleasant dining atmosphere, and the good service. Additionally, their friend with a gluten allergy had a delicious meal and found options suitable for their dietary needs. Although there was a minor complaint about the tomatoes, overall, the reviewer found the experience enjoyable and even referred to the restaurant as a "gem."

question: I love this friendly, neighborhood gym. It has everything you could want - cardio, weights, machines, trainers, power-lifting/strong man equipment, boxing, plus yoga and martial arts classes upstairs. This old-school gym is all about working out!  :-)
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the review highlights the wide range of amenities and equipment available at the gym, catering to different fitness needs and interests. The mention of friendly staff, diverse classes, and old-school workout focus all contribute to a positive experience for gym-goers. Overall, the reviewer expresses satisfaction and enthusiasm for the gym's offerings, creating a positive sentiment.

question: Madison's Hardest Working Gym. With the closing of the Cemetery circa 1992, Ford's - formally Muscles & Fitness remains Madison's only real gym. It's where you go to get in shape when the mega clubs have failed you. It's where you go to get strong, to be strong. It also has arguably one of the countries best Boxing programs, which has been nurtured by the legendary Bob Lynch. If you don't know who Bob Lynch is, look it up. \n\nFord's has something for everyone - Strong Man equipment, Olympic gear, classic Powerlifing equipment and more. The place is always a bit dusty and musty... Why... Because it's a Freaking Gym, not a club or a spa. This is a place where legends train and are made.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the review highlights the gym, Ford's, as a dedicated and authentic fitness center in Madison that stands out as a reliable option for those looking for a serious workout environment. The review emphasizes the gym's commitment to helping individuals achieve their fitness goals, particularly when other mainstream clubs may not have been effective. Additionally, the mention of the gym's renowned Boxing program and the presence of legendary trainer Bob Lynch adds credibility and prestige to Ford's. The description of the gym as a place where "legends train and are made" further contributes to the positive sentiment by portraying Ford's as a place for serious athletes and individuals seeking strength and fitness improvements. Overall, the review's focus on the gym's offerings, reputation, and authentic atmosphere contributes to a positive assessment.

question: I started going here on and off about eight years ago. The pizza is the best, but the burgers (veggie and regular) are very good as well. It's bar food at its very best. Hot chips with dipping sauce are good too! There's often bands on the weekends, and the occasional lesbian after bowling league get together, but not angry, man-hating, shemales. Quite a few different groups of people get together for good beer, food and music at reasonable prices.
rationale: The review conveys a positive sentiment overall by praising the quality of the pizza, burgers (both regular and veggie), and other bar foods. The mention of hot chips with dipping sauce also adds to the positive tone. Additionally, the reviewer highlights the inviting atmosphere with live music, diverse groups of people gathering, and reasonable prices. The positive language used to describe the food, ambiance, and community interactions within the venue all contribute to the overall positive sentiment expressed in the review.

question: Some of the best bar food in the state.  Burgers and Pizza are always a fantastic choice.  Entertainment is hit or miss, but at least they have some.  However, my favorite reason to go here is it serves the coldest tap beer ever!!!
rationale: The sentiment of the review is Positive because the reviewer highlights that the bar offers some of the best bar food in the state, with burgers and pizza being fantastic choices. They also appreciate that the bar has entertainment options, even though it can be hit or miss. The standout feature that the reviewer emphasizes as their favorite reason to go is the fact that the bar serves the coldest tap beer ever, indicating a high level of satisfaction with their experience.

question:
I just want to mention that we came back on a Sunday afternoon at around 8:30.  We ordered burgers and cheese curds.  They tasted a lot like burgers and cheese curds.  I also don't think the prices are that great on further reflection.  6 dollars for a stinkin cheeseburger?  That's not great...  3 dollars for a pabst?  

But the place was kid free this time.  That's nice.  

I would give higher ratings, but some drunk regular yelled at us for ordering from the menu instead of the "board."  Unpleasant.
rationale: The sentiment is incorrectly labeled as positive. The review mentions several negative aspects, such as high prices, an unpleasant encounter with a drunk patron, and not being happy with the food. These factors contribute to an overall negative sentiment in the review.

question:
Oh how I miss you, Harmony Bar!  I never miss a chance to grab a walnut burger and hot chips when I'm back in town.  

This is just a wonderful neighborhood bar.  The food is still "bar" food but it's quality, tasty and made fresh to order.  The pizza is good, too.  Good beer selection and a truly local atmosphere.  The Harmony fits right into the vibe of the neighborhood.

Oh how I miss you, Harmony Bar!
rationale: The review expresses strong feelings of nostalgia and fondness towards Harmony Bar, reminiscing about the enjoyable experiences and delicious food enjoyed there. The reviewer praises the quality and freshness of the food, the good beer selection, and the local atmosphere, all contributing to a positive overall sentiment. The reviewer's repeated exclamation of missing Harmony Bar further reinforces the positive sentiment, indicating a deep appreciation and affinity for the establishment.

question: I like bars that are a little rough around the edges, but they don't usually have good food.  Harmony, on the other hand, manages to come through quite nicely in the food department.\n\nI had a walnut burger and an order of their potato chips which they apparently make fresh.  The burger was great.  Large but not too large, a little bit messy, and just the right amount of toppings.  The chips were great too... at first.  Though I have to say that they started to feel a bit heavy about half way through.  They're still good, just be warned that if you eat an entire thing of chips your heart might explode.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is positive because the overall experience at Harmony is highlighted as enjoyable, particularly in the food department. The reviewer praises the walnut burger for being great with just the right amount of toppings, and commends the freshly made potato chips as initially great. Despite a slight downside of feeling heavy halfway through, the reviewer still acknowledges the goodness of the chips. The mention of potential overindulgence humorously adds to the positive tone of the review.

question:
If I could give the Harmony less than one star, I would. I live in the Shenk-Atwood neighborhood, so I'm not writing as an outsider. I've been to the Harmony many times, but I'm finally done being abused by the notoriously unfriendly owner, bartenders and waitstaff at the Harmony. The Harmony is worse than Seinfeld's Soup Nazi because there's no irony or humor in being treated the way the employees here treat their customers. 

I won't get into specifics. I can only say that I take pride in my neighborhood. My wife and I frequent those establishments that understand that they are part of a community and treat their paying customers as such. The Harmony is a black mark on our neighborhood, and I am ashamed that unsuspecting visitors to the quaint east side should have to endure the abusive, disrespectful and generally unapologetic service at this establishment. If you scroll down you'll read other comments about the owner's girlfriend who is now manager. The last time I was in there with a group of friends, she couldn't have been more rude or insulting. When we all said we wouldn't be back, she merely shrugged her shoulders. 

If you're visiting the East Side, there are plenty of other places that serve great food with friendly service. Alchemy, Mickey's, Wilson's, The Weary Traveller all come to mind as places that will make you feel and taste the love on the East Side.  If you're a masochist, be sure to head on over The Harmony for your daily dose of abuse. 

You've been warned. You certainly won't catch me sitting at this bar ever again.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is negative because the reviewer expresses strong dissatisfaction and disappointment with their experiences at The Harmony. They specifically mention feeling abused, disrespected, and insulted by the owner, bartenders, and waitstaff. The reviewer criticizes the lack of friendliness and community spirit at the establishment, contrasting it with other nearby places that provide great food and friendly service. The overall tone of the review is one of warning others to avoid The Harmony due to the poor treatment they experienced, indicating a negative overall experience.

question:
The unfriendly atmosphere at The Harmony Bar is its biggest failing.  At first I thought it was just sarcastic "Soup Nazi" humor, but soon realized that the prevalent hostile attitude there is genuine and that it trickles down from management to employees, customers, and even performers.  I've seen bar managers there either berate customers directly or berate the bartenders who then have to try very hard not to pass that negativity on to customers.

Also, it's downright embarrassing to be an audience member there when the bar mistreats the band.
