Quit being cheap with the sides. I like taters, more than 5 bites please!! Hook up the mac with some cheese!! I support small businesses and love bbq, give me a reason to!!

The "good":

Staff is friendly. Most of the food had good flavor, but fell way short on the prep/handling end. Place was very clean and smelled delicious.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is negative because the customer expresses dissatisfaction with several aspects of their dining experience. They highlight multiple issues with the food quality, such as the dry and overcooked chicken, poorly prepared sandwiches, and lackluster sides. Additionally, they criticize the restaurant for offering limited sauce options and small portion sizes. The reviewer also points out specific shortcomings in the preparation of the dishes, like the presence of membrane on the ribs and the subpar mac-n-cheese. Overall, the customer's feedback indicates disappointment and a sense of unmet expectations, resulting in a negative sentiment towards the restaurant.

question:
I keep thinking my experience at Smoky Jon's will be better than it ever is. I lived and worked nearby for a number of years, and ate there often. 

The staff were always incredibly friendly, and even got to know my order after awhile. Their sugar fried biscuits were a must until I had to go gluten-free, and I always enjoyed the corn and mashed potatoes with my pork shoulder.

Overshadowing this, though, were the counterproductive idiosyncracies of the business.  I enjoy quirky (and don't see it often enough these days,) but in this case, in the business sense, it confused me.

The owner is a bit...eccentric, to say the least.

Also, he's famous for his BBQ sauces. There are awards and ribbons all over the restaurant saying so. Fantastic! Why can't I get them on my dinner? 

There's only ONE sauce available in the restaurant (and it's on the sweeter end of the spectrum.) What about adding a mustard-based sauce? Or something in a spicier Texas-style?

Your sauce skills may be excellent, but if you don't allow your restaurant patrons to experience them, you're leaving them with a really narrow excerpt of what you have to offer. TELLING us how wonderful your work is PALES in comparison letting us TASTE it.

Even if there were only 2-3 options, that would put a whole 'nother spin on the SJ dining experience!

Additionally, the sides are tasty, but TEENY! I know the focus is on the protein, but even simply increasing the portion size by 50% (and keep the 2 sides/entree) would be a good start. Or double+ their size and have 1 side/entree. (The entrees w/sides aren't exactly cheap.)

In closing, next time you stop by, on your way in, take a look at the happy, oblivious-looking pig painted on the building, sitting on the globe, munching on a rack of tasty pork ribs. 

Is he just there for the award-winning sauce, or do you think he knows he's unintentionally advocating porcine cannibalism?
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer expresses disappointment with their overall experience at Smoky Jon's. They highlight issues such as limited sauce options, small side portions, and a sense of confusion surrounding the business's idiosyncrasies. The reviewer also mentions feeling let down by the disconnect between the praise for the BBQ sauces and the lack of variety offered to diners. Overall, the review conveys a sense of unmet expectations and dissatisfaction with various aspects of their dining experience.

question: This place is great and very authentic. The sauce is so yummy...no wonder they sell bottles of it! I just wish the sides were a bit bigger. I was also expecting cornbread, but they didn't have any. I would have preferred that over the dinner roll. They also don't have beer/wine which would have been nice. Despite these things, I will definitely be coming back!
rationale: The review expresses overall satisfaction with the restaurant, acknowledging the great taste and authenticity of the food. The mention of the delicious sauce and the fact that they sell bottles of it indicates high praise for a specific element. Despite some minor areas for improvement such as larger side portions, availability of cornbread, and a lack of beer/wine options, the reviewer concludes positively by expressing intent to return. This overall appreciation and willingness to give the restaurant another chance indicate a positive sentiment.

question: Wow, this place was fantastic. I didn't know bbq could be this good this far north. Their brisket sandwich was amazing and I'm eager to go back and try something else! A must go to if you have a bbq craving.
rationale: The review expresses enthusiasm and satisfaction with the restaurant, highlighting the quality of the BBQ and specifically praising the brisket sandwich. The reviewer mentions excitement about returning to try more items, indicating a positive dining experience. Overall, the reviewer recommends the place as a must-visit for satisfying BBQ cravings, confirming a positive sentiment.

question: This place was my favorite BBQ in the past. However, now all menu items are smaller, the prices are higher and the sauce is lower quality. I believe smokey Jon can make an award winning sauce but he's not bringing it here. The sides are always top notch the meat is alright but made to be drenched in BBQ, kind of plain alone. All around too expensive for the portion size and used to be a lot higher quality.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the customer expresses disappointment with several aspects of their experience, including smaller portion sizes, higher prices, lower quality sauce, and a decline in overall quality compared to their previous visits. They feel that the food is overpriced and not up to the standards they had previously enjoyed, leading to an overall feeling of dissatisfaction.

question: If you want \"Italian food\" that has the look and feel of a Stouffer's t.v. dinner, Fazoli's gets it right.\n\nActually, I take that back.  If you are heating up a t.v. dinner, at least you are guaranteed it will be warm.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer is expressing disappointment with the quality of the Italian food at Fazoli's, comparing it unfavorably to a TV dinner from Stouffer's. The reviewer implies that the food at Fazoli's lacks the taste and freshness one would expect from a restaurant, making a negative comparison to a pre-packaged TV dinner. This negative sentiment is reinforced by the comment that even a TV dinner would be preferable as it would at least be warm.

question: Very frustrating experience.  Our order was very simple but the cashier couldn't get it right.  While waiting for our food I watched the beleaguered manager apologizing to every table.  Every customer had a problem with their food or order.  We waited twenty minutes for our food and decided to leave.   I have never experienced more incompetence.  Never again.....
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the customer had a frustrating experience at the restaurant due to multiple issues with their order, prolonged waiting time, and witnessing other customers facing similar problems. The incompetence demonstrated by the cashier and manager, coupled with the dissatisfaction of multiple customers, contributed to a negative overall experience.

question:
The first time I ate at a Fazoli's, I was blown away. They had great sandwiches, good pasta, and a solid business model.  One of my favorite things to do when I was young and poor was to go to Fazoli's to do homework.  I would have lunch, then sit there all afternoon refilling my drink cup and saying "HIt me again" to the girl who came around with the basket of breadsticks every  fifteen minutes.  By the time I was done with my studying, I would be so full of breadsticks that I didn't need dinner.  Fazoli's helped me through college and grad school.  

Since those days (many years ago, sadly), they've gone downhill faster than a Red Zephyr wagon with two fat kids in it.  They tinker needlessly with the menu.  Their food has gotten tasteless. And for a time, you had to go ask for the breadsticks instead of having them brought to you.  

I used to love their food.  Now, it's just okay. Mediocre, really.  I no longer look forward to going to Fazoli's.  What once used to be a weekly thing when I was younger has become a once, maybe twice yearly thing.  And each time I go back, I remember what used to be and swear that I'll never return.  

But those breadsticks--they're like crack, man.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is negative because the customer expresses disappointment and dissatisfaction with the decline in quality of Fazoli's food over the years. They mention that the food has become tasteless, the menu changes are unnecessary, and the overall dining experience has gone downhill. While the customer has fond memories of their earlier positive experiences at Fazoli's, they now only find the food to be mediocre. Despite the negative aspects, the customer acknowledges that the breadsticks are a standout item that they enjoy.

question:
Noah's Ark Pet Center?? More like, Nooooo way will i ever step foot in this ark pet center.
From the moment we stepped foot in this store with our 4 month old puppy, we had an unwelcomed feeling from all of the employees. Walking into the store, you would have thought we had a rabid dog on our hands. Everyone seemed bothered that we even walked in to the store to help support the local businesses.
We went in for a simple nail and hair trim, and the groomer acted like we were a burden on her apparent busy (and seemingly miserable) life.
Nail trim? Decent. 
Hair trim? We wanted a basic trim around his face, basically so its out of his eyes. She gave him a trim that would bring back horrible memories of our childhood where our parents tried to give us haircuts, resulting in uneven cuts looking like they used a pair of rusty garden shears.

no way.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the user had a very unpleasant experience at Noah's Ark Pet Center. The user felt unwelcomed by the employees, who seemed bothered by their presence despite coming in with their puppy for a simple nail and hair trim. The groomer's attitude was described as unfriendly and uncaring, making the user feel like a burden. The result of the hair trim was also unsatisfactory, resembling a poorly done home haircut with uneven cuts. Overall, the user felt disappointed and frustrated with the service they received, leading to a negative review of the pet center.

question: I have mixed feelings about this store.  I am a Northside resident and want to support local business but the customer service here is very poor.  I usually buy 2-40# bags of dog food at a time and am offered help to my car about 50% of the time.  The store is very dirty and the staff do not seem friendly or healthy--maybe the cat dander is activating their allergies?!?  I understand others appreciate the kittens and cats roaming free, but I have gotten home to realize the dog food bags have teeth marks and puncture holes in them.  I give them 2 stars for the buying program another customer mentioned, buy 12 bags get the 13th free.  Overall, this store is disappointing.
rationale: The sentiment is Negative because the reviewer expresses multiple concerns about the store's poor customer service, cleanliness, and staff friendliness. The issues mentioned such as dirty store conditions, inconsistent help with carrying purchases, and damaged dog food bags affect the overall shopping experience. Additionally, the negative tone regarding the potential impact of cat dander on staff health and the quality of products received after purchase further contribute to the negative sentiment expressed in the review.

question:
Came to Chet's because of the good reviews it got on Yelp! Here's another one! 

So I don't know crap about cars. Unfortunately, this fact shines through when asking my questions about my car ("oh the year of my car?...um...I..uh...don't know off the top of my head", "was my temperature gauge high? well...uh...no lights lit up on the dash...?)  Yeah, I'm a prime target to get scammed at a auto repair shop.  So when smoke started coming out from under the hood, I was pissed and fearful of taking it to a car repair shop.   But Chet's was super nice and helpful!!  The guy taking all my information at the desk was incredibly cheerful and happy to have me as a customer. Their reception area is pretty nice too (especially for a car place). And when I found out my car had to stay at the shop for a few hours, they offered me a free ride home.  My car was diagnosed, fixed, and cleaned up in a few hours and they didn't charge me through the roof for it!!  

Definitely coming back to Chet's the next time my car is being a piece.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer initially had a lack of knowledge about cars and expressed fear of being scammed at an auto repair shop. However, they were pleasantly surprised by the friendly and helpful service they received at Chet's. The reviewer appreciated the cheerful staff, the comfortable reception area, and the free ride home offered when their car had to stay at the shop. They were also satisfied with the quick diagnosis, repair, and fair pricing. Overall, the reviewer felt valued as a customer and expressed an intention to return to Chet's for future car repairs.

question: Honest, friendly, clean and efficient service.  I will be returning here again for all my current vehicle's maintenance needs - which should be relatively few, according to the mechanics at Chet's, who could have frankly sold me quite a significant line of bull about that had they cared to.  In and out for an oil change and tire rotation in about an hour and for about $40 total.  Thanks, guys.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer praises the service for being honest, friendly, clean, and efficient. They appreciate the fact that the mechanics did not try to upsell unnecessary services and delivered the maintenance quickly and at a reasonable cost. The reviewer even expresses gratitude towards the staff, indicating a high level of satisfaction with their experience.

question: It's hard to find a good auto repair place where you won't get taken advantage of.  Because of the great reviews on Yelp, I drove out of my way to take my car to Chet's.  I'm a young woman with an old car that I didn't want to put a lot of money into.  I just need my car to last me another year or so until I can afford a new one.  I dropped by Chet's without an appointment or anything, and one of the mechanics came out to the parking lot to take a look at my car right away (free of charge).  He actually got on the ground to peak under my car, and he knew what the problem was in less than a minute.  He answered all my questions, and I arranged to bring my car back the next day to get fixed.  When I brought my car in to get fixed, the guy at the front desk recognized me right away and slipped me a coupon from their ad for 10% off my services because he knew that I didn't want to put a lot of money into my car.  I was taken aback by his thoughtfulness.  The mechanics kept me informed as they were working on my car, gave me the estimate, gave me their opinion, and answered all my questions.  All around great service at a reasonable price.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer had a great experience at Chet's Auto Repair. The reviewer highlighted several positive aspects, such as the quick and thorough inspection of her car, the friendly and helpful customer service, the mechanic's expertise in diagnosing the problem quickly, the proactive gesture of offering a discount knowing the customer's budget constraints, and the excellent communication throughout the repair process. Overall, the reviewer was pleased with the service received, pricing, and felt well taken care of, leading to a positive sentiment.

question: As a young woman, I have had so many awful experiences being ripped off or treated like an idiot at auto shops. Chet's is a total dream. They are straightforward, honest and do good work. They take time to explain what's going on without being condescending. They're great at catching issues before they become huge costly problems, but will tell you plainly whether it's something that needs to be fixed immediately or if it can wait. Their oil changes are the same price as the sale/coupon prices at the national chains. Since I bought my tires from them, I get them rotated for free for life. They are respectful, cheerful and expert. I can't say enough about them.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the review highlights the customer's satisfaction with Chet's auto shop. The customer praises the honesty, transparency, and expertise of the staff. The fact that they take time to explain issues without being condescending and are proactive in catching potential problems shows their commitment to quality service. The added benefit of free tire rotations and competitive pricing further contributes to the positive experience. Overall, the review reflects a high level of trust and appreciation for Chet's, making it a positive sentiment.

question:
After reading other Yelp reviews, I decided to try Dimitri's, unfortunately. The gyro meat was bland...gyros are not meant to be BLAND! We also tried the so-called spinach pie. Again, it's pretty bland and seems like it came from a grocery store freezer. It isn't actually *bad*...it's just not *good*... so I gave it two stars. There is much better food in Madison.

If you want gyros, go to the Parthenon.
If you want spinach pie, go to Med Cafe.
If you're on the East side and you're desperate, go to Dimitri's.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer uses words like "unfortunately," "bland," "not good," and "desperate" to describe their experience at Dimitri's. They express disappointment in the taste of the gyro meat and spinach pie, suggesting that the food lacked flavor and quality. Additionally, they recommend other restaurants in the area known for better food, implying that Dimitri's falls short in comparison.

question:
B.E.S.T. brunch in Madison. 
Brunch at airport  - "huh" right? Right.

The restaurant is located with in the Wisconsin Aviation building, which is across the field from where the commercial flights are housed.  You can eat the fantastic food while plane watch for your pleasure. If you haven't been here already, you're missing out - A. Lot. 

The airy pancakes that I ordered were fluffy, and really the best I've had in Madison. It sounds like a "guilty pleasure," but the pancakes are truly airy that it doesn't feel heavy on the stomach after clearing the plate. The three eggs omelet was equally spectacular. Plus the solid cordial service seals the 5-stars deal.

The scene is a clean diner, but as my friend put it, "it's an actual diner with good food, and not like the other wanna-bes." Absolutely correct. And there's no need to do too much flare on the decor when they got the fantastic view of the private planes against the blue sky. I will be back for more for sure! Maybe a sunset dinner for the next time?
rationale: The sentiment of the review is positive because the reviewer praises the "B.E.S.T. brunch in Madison" and highlights the fantastic food, airy pancakes, and spectacular omelet they enjoyed. They also appreciate the unique setting of the restaurant within the Wisconsin Aviation building, offering a pleasant view of private planes against the blue sky. The reviewer mentions the solid service and the clean diner atmosphere, emphasizing that it is a genuine diner with great food. Overall, the reviewer expresses enthusiasm about their experience and mentions a desire to return for more, possibly even for a sunset dinner, indicating a positive overall impression.

question:
I gave two stars, 1 star for the nice behavior of owners who welcome you into the restaurant with a smile and another star is the ambiance and my kiddo loved it.

Worst service. waitress (an Asian women) was very rude and made me feel like we are not welcome there. 

my two cents, if you are not a white man, please find a Dennis or Perkins and don't even bother to go to this place. 

I never wrote a review as bad as this and this place deserves it.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the user had a negative experience at the restaurant due to the rude behavior of the waitress. Additionally, the user felt discriminated against based on their race, which further adds to the negative sentiment. Overall, the user did not have a pleasant dining experience and felt unwelcome at the restaurant.

question: Great morning breakfast spot. Take the kids, they love watching the planes.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the review highlights the positive attributes of the breakfast spot, such as being a great place to bring kids and the unique experience of watching planes while enjoying a meal. The reviewer's enjoyment of the experience suggests a positive overall impression of the establishment.

question: First off the view is outstanding.  O'Malley's is right off the runway at the Madison Airport.  The waitstaff is very good,  and the food as well.  There can be a wait so do not expect to get in an  out very fast.  I recommend trying the Jet Room.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the review highlights several positive aspects of the experience at O'Malley's - the outstanding view, good waitstaff, and quality food. The recommendation to try the Jet Room further supports the positive sentiment by suggesting that the reviewer enjoyed the dining experience and would recommend it to others. Overall, the review focuses on the positive aspects of the restaurant, making it clear that the reviewer had a good experience.

question: The Jet Room is a must when in Madison. Watching planes take off and land while eating the best diner breakfast or lunch in Madison is a huge hit with adults and kids. If you go in the early morning you can also watch the Truax Fire Department Trucks circle the air field on their morning rounds. I'd highly recommend the Scramble for breakfast and the Wing Walker for lunch. I wish they were open past 2:00pm, but understand they are tailoring to a specific food type.\n\nGO TO THE JET ROOM! That is all.
rationale: The review expresses enthusiasm for The Jet Room, highlighting the unique experience of watching planes while enjoying delicious breakfast or lunch. The reviewer appreciates the family-friendly environment and the opportunity to witness the Truax Fire Department activity. Their recommendations for specific menu items and the overall suggestion to visit The Jet Room further indicate their positive sentiment. The understanding of the restaurant's specialized hours also shows a level of appreciation for their focus on a particular food type. Overall, the reviewer's excitement and positive recommendations make the sentiment of the review clearly positive.

question:
This place is great.  A lot of people don't know it exists, or think it's just for pilots.  The Jet Room is a diner with a great view the Wisconsin Aviation Airport runway.  

The food was decent, but I don't think anyone comes here for the food.  It's all about the view.  I had the sausage scrambler which was pretty standard.  Nothing to brag about, but it did the trick.  My gf had the salmon benedict.  It looked great and she was pretty happy with it.   

It's a busy place on the weekend but you'll be entertained while waiting for your table.   Plenty to look at.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer generally speaks positively about their experience at The Jet Room. They highlight the unique selling point of the diner, which is the great view of the Wisconsin Aviation Airport runway. Despite mentioning that the food was decent and not particularly outstanding, they acknowledge that it served its purpose. They also mention that their girlfriend was happy with her dish. Additionally, the reviewer notes that the diner is a busy and entertaining place on weekends, suggesting that they enjoyed the overall atmosphere and experience.

question: Excellent, excellent food! Very reasonable also. I would highly recommend to give this place a try. I had the veggie eggs Benedict on an English muffin. Fantastic! They offer dishes like salmon omlettes, salmon eggs Benedict, etc. Very good quality for an airport diner.
rationale: The review expresses enthusiasm and satisfaction with the food quality and pricing at the restaurant. The reviewer highly recommends trying the place and specifically mentions the delicious veggie eggs Benedict they had. They also appreciate the variety of dishes offered, like salmon omelettes and salmon eggs Benedict, indicating a positive overall experience and good quality for an airport diner. Overall, the reviewer's positive language and strong recommendation support the sentiment being positive.

question: Was thrilled to see vegetarian options. Very nice restaurant, clean, fun decor. Son absolutely loved watching the planes land & take off. Best moment was seeing plane land & pilot came into diner- was very cool for him. Had California Benedict which was good not great- not best Hollandaise but wasn't expecting gourmet granted. Liked fruit cup that was offered, good variety. Average diner food but good menu options and above average atmosphere. Host was delightful but service was slow & spotty.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the review highlights several positive aspects of the restaurant experience, such as the presence of vegetarian options, a nice and clean restaurant with fun decor, and a unique view of planes landing and taking off that the son enjoyed. The reviewer also appreciated the variety of menu options and the pleasant host. While there were some minor issues with the food and service, overall, the reviewer seemed to have enjoyed their visit and had a good time at the restaurant.

question:
Excellent service, friendly staff and you get to watch plans land and take off.  The food is great.  We've been here several times with our younger kids (just my husband and I and with extended family).  The wait has never been that long.  They work to get you seated as soon as possible if there is a wait.

Awesome diner food with daily specials.  Delicious, mouth watering diner food at diner prices.

They are open for breakfast, brunch and lunch.  Great family friendly spot.  Also great for a quick bite on your own.  

Highly suggest checking this place out if you haven't yet.
rationale: The review expresses positive experiences and satisfaction with the service, food quality, and overall atmosphere of the establishment. The reviewer highlights aspects such as friendly staff, quick seating, delicious food at reasonable prices, and suitability for families or individual visits. Their repeated visits with both family and as a couple indicate a high level of enjoyment. The recommendation to check out the place further reinforces the positive sentiment, making it clear that the reviewer had a great experience and would encourage others to visit as well.

question: The Jet Room and some decent dinner food. It's a great place for a breakfast. But honestly I don't go to the Jet Room for the food. It's the view that keeps me coming back.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer starts by praising 'The Jet Room' as a great place for breakfast, implying satisfaction with the food offered. Although they mention that the food is decent for dinner, their main attraction to the establishment is the view, which they positively highlight as the reason that keeps them coming back. This indicates that the reviewer overall enjoys their experience at 'The Jet Room' and finds value in the unique feature of the view, resulting in a positive sentiment.

question:
We had a late breakfast here on a Tuesday afternoon. The hostess cheerfully seated us, and our server was friendly and attentive. It wasn't crowded at all, and the atmosphere was nice--open but comfortable, with lots of windows and light.

We had coffee, the Sausage Skillet, and the Southern Benedict. Coffee was run-of-the-mill, but hot & plentiful. The Sausage Skillet tried hard to be a Fair Oaks Skillet (a la Willalby's) but was half the size, $1.50 more, and the hashbrowns (like everything else) were slightly undercooked and were obviously frozen/out of a bag. The gravy on the Southern Benedict was a sickly shade of brown, and thick, but gelatinous rather than creamy. All was edible, but nothing out of the common way.

Overall not the worst experience ever, especially if you don't mind eating straight out of the Sysco truck. Probably convenient for folks using/frequenting the airfield, but not really worth driving out just to eat and watch a puddle jumper get a tune-up outside.
rationale: The sentiment is Negative because the reviewer had several criticisms about the food and overall dining experience. They mentioned issues like undercooked hashbrowns, mediocre coffee, unimpressive dishes, and a gelatinous gravy. Additionally, the comparison made to another restaurant's skillet dish suggests a lack of satisfaction with the quality and value offered at this establishment. The reviewer also indicated that the experience was not worth making a special trip for, which further emphasizes their disappointment with the food and service provided.

question:
Newer diner (was expecting older), great service with a neat view.  Food was very delicious but it's hard to swallow the price tags.  $9.50 for a BLT sandwich?  I guess you're paying for the view, which is kind of cool but I'd rather not pay double.  

Was passing through - I live in Chicago where I understand establishments charge $$$ when dining out, but didn't think I'd see it in Wisconsin.  I recommend you Eat there once when you're don't mind paying more then you should.  We loved all the old pics on the wall and the original "Restaurant" neon sign hanging from the original diner that was once there.

Oh and Shannon gave us excellent service!
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer highlights the great service, delicious food, and the cool view of the diner. Even though they found the prices to be a bit high, they still appreciated the experience and recommended trying it out at least once. Additionally, the praise for the service from Shannon adds to the overall positive sentiment of the review.

question: We ordered two salads this morning and the waitress snarled at us, took our menus and through them on the front desk behind her.  Apparently the waitresses have to make the salads. At one point she told the table next to us when they were not ready, that she would be back then as I have to go make salads.  Based on this experience I will never make another cross country flight to KMSN nor would I recommend anyone go out of their way to only to be treated so poorly.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the customer had a poor experience with the service at the restaurant. The waitress's behavior was rude and unprofessional, as demonstrated by her snarling, tossing menus, and making dismissive comments to customers. The customer felt mistreated and disrespected, leading to a decision to avoid the restaurant in the future and discourage others from visiting as well.

question: After a very bad experience at Stanton Optical, it was a breath of fresh air to be greeted by Susan at Wisconsin Vision. She helped me pick out my frames and helped me save 100$  on my frames at the register. It was very affordable and enjoyable. I will return there for my next pair.
rationale: The sentiment is Positive because the reviewer had a negative experience at a previous optical store but found the service at Wisconsin Vision to be a "breath of fresh air." The reviewer specifically mentioned the helpfulness of Susan, who assisted in selecting frames and offering a discount. The overall experience was described as enjoyable, affordable, and successful enough for the reviewer to express intent to return for future purchases.

question: Wonderful. My girlfriend had to pick up her new glasses from them and they were really great. They greeted us as soon as we walked in and were very polite. The woman behind the counter was helpful and made sure the glasses fit exactly right. She even complimented my girlfriend on her selection which really made me smile. All in all, great experience.
rationale: The review describes a positive experience at the glasses store, emphasizing the excellent customer service received. The staff greeted the customers warmly, were polite, and provided attentive assistance in ensuring the glasses fitted well. The mention of the woman behind the counter complimenting the girlfriend's selection highlights personalized attention and friendliness, contributing to an overall positive experience for the reviewer.

question:
They have an acoustics problem here.  It's horribly loud in there, and everything feels rushed and crushed together.  I had some vegetarian sandwich, it was mediocre and gave me heartburn supreme.  Blah.  

Also there was an article on MSNBC that revealed that Panera uses additives in their bakery items that cause hyper activity in young children.  

So if you are looking for a place that's crowded, loud, has mediocre food and pocked with spastic, hyper active children who will gnaw on your leg, go here.
rationale: The review expresses numerous negative points about the experience at the restaurant, citing issues with loud acoustics, rushed atmosphere, mediocre food quality, and personal health concerns with the vegetarian sandwich causing heartburn. Additionally, the mention of Panera's use of additives linked to hyperactivity in children adds another layer of negativity to the review. The overall tone of dissatisfaction and disappointment painted in the review clearly indicates a negative sentiment towards the restaurant.

question: saw a fly dancing on my sandwich when waiting for my order, they don't bother to pay attention anyway since there are quite a lot customers , awful awful place even though i have very good experience with other panera bread
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the customer had a negative experience at the restaurant, with a fly dancing on their sandwich. Additionally, the customer felt that the staff did not pay attention to the issue and that the overall experience was awful. This negative experience overshadowed any positive experiences they may have had at other Panera Bread locations.

question: Love the sour dough bread...they make great grilled cheese. The bagels aren't too bad......they will make due until the next time you get to New York. My favorite bagel is a fresh asiago cheese with tons of cream cheese. Yum!  The broccoli cheese soup is also very tasty.  I love that they have cage free eggs and antibac free chicken. I appreciate that they are starting to care more about the products they are serving. The only question I have is this...are the chickens free range? \n\nThis Panera is rather loud and always busy.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer mentions loving the sourdough bread and enjoying the grilled cheese, bagels, and broccoli cheese soup at the restaurant. They also appreciate the use of cage-free eggs and antibiotic-free chicken, showing that they value the quality of the ingredients being used. Additionally, the reviewer expresses excitement about their favorite bagel and appreciates the effort the restaurant is making to serve better-quality products. Despite noting the loud and busy atmosphere, the overall review is positive based on the enjoyment of the food and the appreciation for the restaurant's efforts towards better quality ingredients.

question: This is a shout-out to Matt & Ashley at this location.  They are awesome!!  On a super cold day when it was already dark & snowing, Matt completed my rental agreement, put on his coat, went outside to get my car & then drove it around so that I just had to hop in.   Ashley is also super nice & helpful, and was able to assist me with a larger car when I needed one.  I hope corporate is reading these reviews, because the Madison location of Enterprise is doing it correctly!  Thanks Matt & Ashley!
rationale: The sentiment of the review is positive because the customer had a great experience with Matt and Ashley at this specific Enterprise location in Madison. Both employees were described as awesome, super nice, and helpful. Matt went above and beyond by braving the cold and snow to ensure a smooth rental experience, while Ashley was able to accommodate the customer's need for a larger car. The customer specifically praises the outstanding customer service provided by Matt and Ashley, indicating that they were satisfied with their interactions and the overall service received at the Madison location. Overall, the review reflects a positive sentiment due to the exceptional service received from the staff members.

question: Thanks for making a great trip even better - quick, caring service and a free upgrade to a great Jeep Patriot that we really enjoyed. Enterprise is all I've used for years and I don't see myself ever changing. Rare that service in your business is this good.
rationale: The review expresses gratitude for the positive experience with Enterprise, highlighting quick and caring service, a free upgrade, and enjoyment of the Jeep Patriot. The reviewer states their loyalty to Enterprise due to consistently good service, indicating a strong level of satisfaction and a high likelihood of continued patronage. The reviewer's tone is appreciative, praising the exceptional customer service in an industry where it is considered rare, all contributing to a positive sentiment.

question: Convenient location.  Was traveling with a small infant and needed a car seat.  I booked everything online and called to confirm.  When I got to the rental desk the price was $100 more for the ten days than the online price I was given.  I was told it was a 25% deposit.  When I dropped the car off it still cost me $100 more, so no 25% deposit.  \nThe car seat was not ready when I arrived and I was told she had gotten me a nice \"clean\" one.  The car seat was disgusting:  full of crumbs and food leftovers and smelled horrible.  I had to cut holes I a blanket to run the straps of the car seat through because it was so nasty.  My word of advice:  don't ever rent a car seat!  When I inquired about car seat installation I was told they are not aloud to install them due to liability reasons which wasn't a problem.  When I asked for the installation instructions and they didn't have them that was a problem.  She said she would send her manager out to instruct me but he was just as clueless as she is about the word \"clean\".  \nNext month I will be renting from any other company besides enterprise.  There are about 4-5 to choose from at that location.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the customer had a disappointing experience with Enterprise car rental. The customer encountered issues with the pricing discrepancy, unclean car seat, lack of proper installation instructions, and unhelpful staff members. These factors contributed to a frustrating and inconvenient rental process, prompting the customer to express dissatisfaction and a decision to choose a different rental company in the future.

question: I typically rent my cars through Enterprise, but this experience has me shaking my head. I landed less than 30 minutes early and went to get my rental. When I got to the counter I was told they didn't even have a car the property and would make some phone calls. They told me they had another car, but they wanted to charge me extra. (I've always been upgraded at no extra cost in these situations) I booked my car through hotwire and was told that by choosing a compact over economy that I would get more features. However, when I got my car it didn't even have cruise and I had to put on about 300 miles. The car didn't drive straight, wasn't that clean (front windshield was streaked from the inside and something was spilled in the center cup holder.) There were no power seats or adjustable steering wheel. (I found a lever, but it didn't seem to do anything - broken maybe?) I was mostly upset that the car didn't have cruise, you would think that would be a standard feature. When I returned the car and the lady asked me how it was, I told her that I was unhappy, but she didn't seem to really have anything to say except when I told her my biggest complaint was that it didn't have cruise, she did say that the guy who issued the car to me at the airport should have told me that. Come on Enterprise... you can do better than this!!!
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the customer experienced multiple issues with their rental car from Enterprise. They were initially informed that there was no car available on the property, then were offered a different car but charged extra for it. The car they received did not meet their expectations, lacking basic features like cruise control and cleanliness. Additionally, the car had mechanical issues, as it did not drive straight and appeared to have broken or non-functioning components like the power seats and adjustable steering wheel. The customer's interactions with staff did not result in a satisfactory resolution to their concerns, contributing to their overall dissatisfaction with the experience.

question:
NEVER have I been stranded at an airport because a reserved vehicle was unavailable.  I arrived in Madison---on time---with a confirmed RESERVATION made through Enterprise's website.   I waited at the counter for over 5 minutes while the agent talked to a co-worker or friend on the phone.   When she was done and I handed her my ID and credit card and told her I had a reservation she said "that won't do you any good"  "We are out of cars".  I asked how long of a wait and she said "maybe an hour----maybe not until tomorrow".    So having traveled thousands of miles today, I am now stranded at the airport.  She offered no options----no taxi service, etc.  NOTHING...and on top of it she was RUDE and offensive in her handling.   She took great delight in informing me that there were fourteen others waiting in front of me that also didn't have cars.   

Fortunately, a travel companion had a reservation with HERTZ who handled his reservation professionally and quickly.   I got a ride from him to my hotel and will deal with this fiasco tomorrow morning.   You can rest assured I will NEVER RENT FROM ENTERPRISE AGAIN.      

Awful does not begin to describe tonight's experience.   She's one heck of a good will ambassador for the Madison area.  

Word of advice---if you think your reservation with Enterprise guarantees a car, guess again.  Cancel and go with a reputable company
rationale: The sentiment in the review is negative because the customer had a terrible experience with Enterprise. The customer arrived on time with a confirmed reservation, but was left stranded at the airport because there were no cars available. The Enterprise agent was rude, unhelpful, and even seemed to take pleasure in informing the customer that there were others also waiting without cars. The lack of alternatives provided by the agent and the overall unprofessionalism of their handling of the situation contributed to the negative experience. The customer had to rely on a travel companion's reservation with a different company, Hertz, to get to their hotel. This frustration and inconvenience lead the reviewer to vow never to rent from Enterprise again and advise others to cancel and choose a more reputable company for car rentals.

question: The worst customer service I have ever experienced.  Trailers and trucks all over the place, so I had to make a place to park.  Ended up getting cursed out by a maintenance guy.   Nice job U-haul!!!!  Will never be going back to this place again.
rationale: The review mentions several negative experiences, such as the chaotic parking situation due to trailers and trucks scattered around, as well as being verbally abused by a maintenance staff member. These incidents clearly left a negative impression on the customer, leading them to state that they will not return to the location. The lack of organization, unprofessional behavior, and overall dissatisfaction portrayed in the review contribute to the sentiment being negative.

question: Worst service ever.  No one cares, was lied to, wasted my time, twice and ended up demanding a refund and taking business elsewhere.  NEVER AGAIN.
rationale: The sentiment in the review is negative because the user expressed dissatisfaction with the service received. They mentioned feeling uncared for, being lied to, having their time wasted, and ultimately demanding a refund and taking their business elsewhere. These experiences led the user to express frustration and vow to never patronize the business again.

question: Excellent prices, wonderful basic food, and outstanding service.  The wait staff is very efficient and consistent, and I particularly enjoy the potatoes obrien.\n\nOpen only until 2pm, for breakfast and lunch.
rationale: The review expresses positive feedback regarding the prices, food quality, and service. The mention of the efficient and consistent wait staff and the enjoyment of a specific dish, potatoes obrien, indicates a satisfying dining experience. Additionally, the restriction on hours implies a popular establishment with limited availability, suggesting a positive reputation.

question:
I want to give this dump a big fat 0.

My mother and I went this past weekend very hopeful that the food would be good based on the fact they won Best in Madison. How on earth did this place win any award for great food and service is beyond me.


The menu was extremely old, small and the coffee was pure water.  
I order the walleye, hash browns, toast and eggs breakfast.
My mother order biscuits and gravy

My toast was cold, hash browns had no tastes, over easy eggs were not cooked fully and fish was very small in size.

Mothers gravy was too salty and a thick bunch of sop. 

The menu had no coordination. Biscuit,gravy and hash browns? That is nothing but starch!

With that aside,
Not only that but the server was horrible. I felt like she ignored my mother and I the entire time. I understand they were kinda busy. Fine. We can be patient. However, she refilled coffees at her other tables and stopped by to tell the customers their food was being made after waiting for so long. We did not receive such treatment. She passed our table several times and never once asked us how was the food or why our orders were taking so long. Not once.  She was a horrible waitress.

Neither my mother or I could finish our food. I took possibly 4 bites and was done.
We spent less time eating then we did waiting and ordering. Waitress continued to ignore us, so we got up and just walked over to pay.

I told the cashier the food was horrible and I wouldn't be back. She then stated to us that normally the food is good and she wasn't sure why it was taking the kitchen so long and were getting orders wrong.

 But here is the killer... she then leans over and says " I hate our kitchen staff, we need new ones"

What kind of place does that? You do no throw your co workers under the bus TO CUSTOMERS! I was beyond flabbergasted. 

Just a horrible business, not friendly and food is beyond pathetic. 
Do not go here. I have no idea who in their right mind would vote them as "Best in Madison" or give it 5 stars unless you do not have taste buds. 

If you want great food, coffee AND service, go to The Original Pancake House in Monona.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is negative because the customer experienced multiple disappointments throughout their dining experience. They were unsatisfied with the quality and taste of the food, citing issues such as cold toast, tasteless hash browns, undercooked eggs, small portion size, and oversalted gravy. The poor service from the waitress, who ignored them and failed to check on the quality of their food or provide updates, added to their negative experience. Furthermore, the cashier's comment about the kitchen staff and the overall lack of professionalism left a sour impression on the customer. The reviewer strongly advises against visiting the establishment, indicating a clear feeling of disappointment and dissatisfaction.

question: Incredible service and amazing food! Eggs Benedict meal was one of the best ones I have had in a long time! Prices are very, very great - fairly inexpensive!
rationale: The reviewer uses enthusiastic language to describe their experience, highlighting the incredible service and amazing food they received. They specifically mention that the Eggs Benedict meal was one of the best they've had in a long time. Additionally, they appreciate the fairly inexpensive prices. Overall, the positive descriptors and satisfaction expressed indicate a positive sentiment towards their experience at the establishment.

question:
My car was no completed on time.  Even after I picked it up 5 days late I had to take it back twice.  East side never fixed the problem but they were glad to keep my money.

Ended up getting a used transmission from Schmidt's so I could drive my car.

Make sure to get paperwork if you have the misfortune of dropping your car of there.  Make sure the paperwork reflects what they told you they were going to do.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer's experience was filled with frustration and disappointment. The car was not completed on time, leading to a delay in getting it back, and even after picking it up late, the problem was not correctly fixed despite multiple return visits. The reviewer had to resort to getting a used transmission from another place to make their car drivable, indicating a lack of trust in the initial repair service. Additionally, the reviewer mentions that the auto shop seemed more interested in taking their money than providing satisfactory service, which reflects poorly on the integrity of the business. Overall, the experience described in the review was unsatisfactory and resulted in inconvenience and wasted time and money for the customer.

question:
I heard funny noises and my car wasn't shifting right... it made me a bit leery, and I am from out of town.  

I called East Side, and they were very up front saying that they would be able to drive it around, check my fluid levels, and let me know what they thought.

Everywhere else I had contacted was booked, and these guys came through!

Very Helpful!
rationale: The sentiment in the review is positive because the customer expresses appreciation for East Side's willingness to help despite being from out of town. The customer initially had concerns about their car but was reassured by East Side's upfront communication and prompt availability. Additionally, the customer highlights the exceptional service they received, citing the helpfulness of the staff as a key factor in their positive experience.

question:
Thank god Michelle reviewed this place. She's taken me here before and IT RULED but I coudn't remember the name. I wish we had a place like Michael's even half as good in Minneapolis.

Every single time I have frozen custard it tastes like butter and, while some may find that awesome, it happens to make my gag reflex go crazy. The custard at Michael's is pretty much perfect and the root beer is SO good. I don't even like root beer that much but I would drink this stuff every day if I could.

I'm sure I'd love the K-9 custard, too. Who cares, I'm sure it's ten times better than the solid half and half a lot of places are trying to pass off as custard around here.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer expresses gratitude for a previous recommendation, praises the quality of the frozen custard and root beer at Michael's, and expresses eagerness to try other menu items. Despite a personal preference against custard that tastes like butter, the reviewer appreciates that the custard at Michael's is exceptional. The overall enthusiastic tone and high praise for the food and experience indicate a positive sentiment towards the restaurant.

question: Cheddar burger, check. Vanilla shake, check. Food coma, double check!!! This place is old school burgers, fries and shakes; and they are good at what they do!
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the review highlights the satisfaction the customer experienced from the cheddar burger, vanilla shake, and overall dining experience. The use of words like "good at what they do" and "old school burgers, fries, and shakes" indicates that the customer enjoyed the classic menu offerings and found them to be delicious. Additionally, the mention of a "food coma" with a double check suggests that the customer was pleasantly full and satisfied with the quality and taste of the food.

question: Better than Culvers. But more expensive.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the review acknowledges that the place being reviewed is better than Culvers, which implies that the experience or quality is considered superior. Additionally, despite being more expensive, the positive comparison to a known establishment suggests that the overall value and satisfaction are still higher.

question: If you stop eating frozen custard for a while and then go back to it, you  wish you never tried it again.  After a few years frequenting this place, the Oreo malt is the only thing I consider ordering. And that is only if someone I'm with really wants to go and is paying for it. Prices are obscene. All of the food is greasy, bland, and expensive.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the review mentions that after taking a break from the frozen custard and returning to it, the reviewer regrets trying it again. They also mention that the only item they consider ordering is the Oreo malt, but only if someone else is paying for it. The reviewer criticizes the high prices, describing them as obscene, and expresses dissatisfaction with the overall quality of the food, characterizing it as greasy, bland, and expensive. These negative experiences and criticisms collectively contribute to the overall negative sentiment of the review.

question: I was there on a hot Sat in June.  They had one clerk and some other guy learning over try to hear the order.  Shouldn't the outside order window be opened.  I order the basket and the clerk specifically asked me for fries, onion rings, and cheez curds.  What I ended up in my basket were onion petals.  These aren't rings( they used to serve rings)but that's not what I got. I got about 10 and they used to serve big portions.  This location didn't have fountain drinks and had the choice of soda in a can. They used to have fountain drinks.Finally, the last thing that made mad as a wet wasp is the prices listed are cash prices. If use a credit card you pay 3% more. A flavor OF THE DAY(fod) is about 3.70 while a whole pint is about 4.99.  You can always get the FOD in a pint so I would go with a whole pint.  Basket are about 5.99 to 6.70 but bring your cash or add 3% to the already absorbent prices.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer experienced several issues during their visit to the establishment. They felt that the service was insufficient with only one clerk working, confusion with the order, and a lack of clarity on what was being served. Additionally, the change in portion sizes and drink options from their previous experiences disappointed the reviewer. The additional charge for using a credit card also left a negative impression, making them feel that the prices were already high and the payment policy was unfair. Overall, the reviewer's experience was unsatisfactory, leading to a negative sentiment in their review.

question: Stick with Culvers!  My family and I stopped by on our way biking around the lake. What a rude and disappointing experience. First of all the staff who waited on us, Andrea was short tempered and not into customer service. We tried to order swirl, but they don't have it, we had to come up with a solution, Andrea just said no. We ordered a cone, small sundae and a can of coke. About $10.00 later, I was grudging given a glass filled about 1/3 full of ice for my not very chilled coke. The custard is ok, but nothing special. Another option would to be to continue on the bike path. In Monona there is an ice cream stop by a park on the lake. We will try that next time.
rationale: The sentiment in the review is negative because the customer had a disappointing experience at the ice cream shop. The staff member was described as rude and not interested in providing good customer service. Additionally, the customer was not satisfied with the limited menu options, the portion sizes, and the quality of the ice cream. The overall tone of the review is one of dissatisfaction and the customer even mentions considering alternative options for their next visit.

question: Just had the worst tasting greasy cheesburger I have ever had.  Served with about 5 french fries.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the review indicates dissatisfaction with the taste and quality of the cheeseburger, describing it as greasy and the worst ever tasted. Additionally, the small portion size of only 5 french fries suggests a lack of value and further contributes to the negative experience.

question:
Please do not ever go here.  This is a public service announcement.  I do not even know you and I like you too much to suggest this place.

1- Prices?!  Are you kidding me?  $6 for a milkshake?  It was tiny.  Not to mention it was not much of a milkshake.  It was a peanut butter cup shake.  They took some peanut butter cups, crushed them and stirred them into custard with some milk.  I saw the whole process.  It was not very impressive whatsoever.  The flavor was ok.  

2 - The food.  I had a chili cheese dog.  This is my standard order when it is available on the menu.  The chili tasted like Hormel.  The hot dog was hot and the chili was warm.  I like that they have shredded cheese on it, rather than liquid cheese.

3 - My dining companion got a burger.  It tasted ok, but it was a very thing patty. He also ordered cheese curds with it.  They were so greasy and lacked any good flavor in the breading.  

Overall, we spent nearly $20 there and I was not satisfied with my meal.  Every talks so much about how great the custard is.  Nope.  Not good.  Go to Culver's!  Seriously, for $6 you can get something TWICE the size with more mix-ins.  Better yet?  Get a cone for you AND a friend.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the review highlights several disappointing aspects of the dining experience. The high prices for small portions, lackluster quality of the milkshake, average taste of the food items, and overall unsatisfactory meal contribute to the negative sentiment. The reviewer also suggests an alternative option, Culver's, indicating a preference for better value and quality elsewhere.

question: Way overpriced. I paid just about $21 for a burger basket, an order of cheese curds, bottled water, and two custard cones. Not even worth the price!!!!Culvers would have been a better option. the food was ok, but I suppose the custard was good.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the customer feels that the food they ordered was overpriced for the quality they received. They mention that Culvers would have been a better option, indicating they believe they could have gotten better value for their money elsewhere. Additionally, the customer expresses disappointment in the overall experience and feels that the food was just okay, with only the custard standing out as good.

question: Overpriced, usually burnt, tasteless, if you're spending this much money on these bad burgers you might as well just go to Blue Plate a mile or two down atwood and get something worth your time.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the review highlights multiple issues with the burgers, including being overpriced, burnt, and tasteless. The reviewer also suggests that the food is not worth the money spent, which ultimately leads to a negative overall experience. Additionally, the reviewer recommends going to another restaurant nearby for a better dining experience, further supporting the negative sentiment towards the original restaurant.

question:
This place has saved me from dry nights on numerous occasions. The sign faintly resembles one of a Harley Davidson merch shop, but upon entry, your greeted with plenty of boozin' options. The vodka assortment is also pretty top notch. I've managed to score some unique domestics and imports. I've often been confused by the age of some of their patrons, but then I remember that this is also a bait shop, and that there is a rare few of today's use that actually go fishing. Ew... worms.

Anyway, the location of this place is another reason I'll continue to visit. For those who haven't been to Madison, 9 PM is when alcohol sales come to a screeching holt. If you're hanging out on the east side, the clock strikes 8:45, and you've realized that you started to sweat because you don't know if you can make it down Willy St. in time on a Friday night, don't worry. Just head a bit more east. 

Harley's may be a little out of the way of the party sector, but you're guaranteed a traffic-free, open road, complete with the freedom to change lanes. You'll have no problems getting here fast enough that you won't turn into a pumpkin.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is positive because the reviewer highlights the convenience and variety of options at the place. They express satisfaction with the assortment of booze available, mentioning the top-notch vodka selection and the unique domestic and imported options. Additionally, the reviewer appreciates the location and convenience of the place, especially in relation to alcohol sales restrictions in the area. Overall, the review emphasizes the positive aspects of the establishment, making it clear why the sentiment is positive.

question: I love Harley's, but my liver hates it. Booze and Bait,what more do you want?
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer expresses their love for Harley's, a place that they clearly enjoy. Despite mentioning the negative impact on their liver from the alcohol consumption, they still show enthusiasm for the combination of "Booze and Bait," indicating that they appreciate the overall experience and what the establishment has to offer.

question: Sunset at the tiki bar is as good as it gets besides the Union!
rationale: The use of words like "good as it gets" indicates a very positive sentiment in the review. The comparison to another popular location, the Union, implies that the tiki bar experience is highly regarded and enjoyable. This overall positive tone suggests that the reviewer had a very pleasant experience at the tiki bar during sunset.

question: I'm astounded at the fuss is around this place. Outside of the view and that it has that hipster smell, what's the attraction?  Limited beer selection. I could accept that if the food were good. But it's not. Went for the \"famous\" Friday fish fry. Clearly nothing is made from scratch. The coleslaw was average. The roll was something out of the freezer. The \"roasted\" potatoes were still crunchy. And the fish was on the order of Mrs Paul's. Seriously, I don't expect a lot from a $13 fish meal, but I do expect better than what I was served. The cafeteria at work serves better fish for half the price. \n\nThe service was good and the people were friendly, but at some point the food needs to carry it's weight. This is a restaurant after all.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is Negative because the reviewer expresses disappointment and dissatisfaction with their experience at the restaurant. They find fault with multiple aspects of their visit, ranging from the limited beer selection to the quality of the food, particularly the Friday fish fry that was underwhelming and lacking in freshness. Despite acknowledging the friendly service, the reviewer strongly emphasizes their disappointment with the food, which is a key aspect of their overall dining experience, leading to an overall negative assessment of the restaurant.

question:
Only gave them one star because zero wasn't an option!!!!  I had a very unpleasant experience with the owner of this business today.  We drove from Chicago to Madison to meet with Terri regarding flowers for our wedding, after confirming our appointment time and location via e-mail.  When we got there nobody was there.  We waited for 30 minutes, called and left a message, left and came back after another 20 minutes and called again, and still she didn't show.  No phone call, no e-mail, nothing.  I suspect she bailed on us because our small floral budget wasn't worth her time, but who knows. Barring some serious emergency (and if that's the case I WILL update this review if I hear from her), her behavior was extremely unprofessional and I would not recommend using this florist. Extremely disappointed.

9/4/11 Update:  She e-mailed today to say she forgot, because she's exhausted and has a cold.  But apparently not too exhausted to keep her from going to the movies with her husband instead, which is where she tells me she was while I was standing in her parking lot in the rain waiting for her.

Seriously?
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the customer had a very unpleasant experience with the owner of the business. Despite confirming the appointment via email, the owner did not show up or communicate about any changes, leaving the customer waiting for a significant amount of time. The customer felt like their small floral budget may have been the reason for the owner's unprofessional behavior, which added to their disappointment. Additionally, the owner's excuse of being exhausted and having a cold, yet still going to the movies with her husband instead of fulfilling her appointment, further reflects poorly on her professionalism and customer service.

question: Everyone here is very nice. You can really tell they all absolutely love animals. I called and they got my cat in the next day. They couldn't get a urine sample, so they gave me another appointment the next day for no charge. The facility is clean and up to date. I'm coming here from now on!
rationale: The review highlights the positive aspects of the experience, such as the friendly staff who genuinely care for animals, prompt scheduling of appointments, willingness to go the extra mile by offering a follow-up appointment for free, and the cleanliness and modernity of the facility. These factors contribute to an overall positive sentiment in the review.

question: They provide good service, but are probably one of the most expensive vets on the east side. $110 for an exam/consult and \"lab\" work for a healthy dog. That didnt include any flea/tick preventive. They are very quick to offer the most expensive services first, then discuss more cost effective alternatives after you say no. Dr. Brittany is very nice and good with my dog.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer highlights that the veterinary clinic is one of the most expensive on the east side, with high prices for basic services like an exam and lab work. They also note that the clinic seems to push expensive services first before discussing more affordable options, which can be off-putting for customers. Despite the positive feedback about Dr. Brittany, these factors contribute to an overall negative experience for the reviewer.

question: This review is long overdue. I think I caught Dr Tom when he was practically fresh out of vet school (3 dogs ago for me). I stayed with him for 24 years watching his business grow to what it is today until I moved to Chicago for work. I have been to 4 different vets since moving to Chicago and have yet to find one half as good as he was! I have even consulted him via email since moving here (no charge: )). I saw other vets at his clinic also and was always very happy with them too. If I were ever to move back to Madison I wouldn't even consider taking my pets anywhere else! When one of my previous dogs had cancer he got me into the UW Vet School for treatment the same day (after they said they couldn't do it when I called them myself).
rationale: The sentiment of the review is Positive because the reviewer expresses a strong sense of loyalty and satisfaction towards Dr. Tom and his veterinary business. The reviewer highlights a long-standing positive relationship spanning over two decades, indicating a high level of trust and confidence in the services provided. The reviewer also praises the efficiency and care received, especially during a challenging situation with a previous pet's cancer diagnosis. Additionally, the reviewer's willingness to consult Dr. Tom even after moving to a different location further demonstrates the positive impact and quality of service provided by the veterinary team.

question: Dave is a miracle worker. We broke down on Sunday and had our car towed there on the recommendation of a friend. Although we weren't a regular customer, he worked Sunday night (he wasn't supposed to be open) so we could get on our way Monday morning. He did great work for a great price and was completely honest. I couldn't recommend him more highly.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is positive because the customer had a great experience with Dave. Despite not being a regular customer, Dave went above and beyond to help them by working on their car on a Sunday night, even though he wasn't scheduled to be open. The customer appreciated the excellent work done at a reasonable price and highlighted Dave's honesty. Overall, the customer highly recommends Dave, indicating their satisfaction with the service provided.

question: I usually despise going to auto shops, but this was really a great experience!  I mostly understand what was wrong with my car instead of my usual clueless-ness.  The price seemed pretty reasonable too.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer had a great experience at the auto shop, highlighted by the fact that they now have a better understanding of what was wrong with their car. Additionally, they found the price to be reasonable, which likely contributed to their overall satisfaction with the service.

question: Courtesy Auto is THE only place you should take your VW.  They do outstanding work and are super honest.  I have used them exclusively for almost 80k miles worth of service and couldn't be happier.  They know these cars in and out and won't sell you something you don't need.  Once I asked Dave if I needed front brakes and he said - I am betting your light will come on close to your next service so you probably have 7500 miles left on them.  The light came on at 7800 miles.  If you want to support a great shop - head over to Courtesy Auto.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer had a consistently good experience with Courtesy Auto over almost 80k miles of service for their VW. They praise the outstanding work, honesty, and knowledge of the staff, highlighting that the shop won't sell unnecessary services. They also provide a specific anecdote about accurate advice on brake service, which demonstrates the trustworthiness of the shop. Overall, the reviewer highly recommends Courtesy Auto, indicating a positive sentiment towards their services.

question: I've been using Priceline for 8 years almost on a weekly basis. Every once in a while I run across a hotel that treats you like a second class citizen. This is one. They are nearly empty and won't put me in a king room without a $50 up charge.  My room is next to the elevator too.  Why us Priceline if you're going to resent all your customers.
rationale: The sentiment is Negative because the reviewer expresses frustration and disappointment with their experience using Priceline. They mention feeling like a second-class citizen at a hotel that refused to provide a requested room type without an additional charge, even though the hotel was not busy. The reviewer is also unhappy about being assigned a room next to the elevator. Overall, the review conveys a sense of dissatisfaction and resentment towards both the hotel and the booking platform.

question:
YAY Mounds!!
I've gone with my sister to get kitty litter and food here before and I really like this place! 
For any Chicagoan's who may read this, it is similar to a Petco, but priced like a PetsMart. So they are rather pricey..
My favorite thing about this store was the Adoption Center. They have this great big glass window that you can see all the available kitties they have up for adoption. And they also have a board with pictures and descriptions of available dogs from the local shelters they can bring in. I know PetsMart offers this as well, but it is not nearly as big or clean. :)~
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer expresses liking the store and highlights specific aspects that they enjoyed, such as the Adoption Center with available kitties and dogs for adoption. They also mention the store's similarity to Petco and competitive pricing compared to PetsMart. The reviewer's overall tone is enthusiastic and appreciative, indicating a positive experience at the store.

question: Awesome store!  Had the Acana Ranchlands dog food that I was looking to get Cheppie and PItzie.  It's funny b/c the two people who helped me also give their food Acana Ranchlands.  I was able to convince two shoppers to change to it also from the crappy food they were giving their dogs.  Good prices too.  Not the best, but good.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer is satisfied with their experience at the store. They found the specific dog food they were looking for, had a positive interaction with the staff who also recommend the same brand, and were able to convince other shoppers to switch to the same food. Additionally, the reviewer mentioned good prices, which adds to their overall positive impression of the store.

question: Mounds always has what we need for our girls, two siamese Himalayans who require LID food. It was great to see these were on sale this week.\n\nMostly I want to note that Molly M, the cashier, was really nice. I haven't had any bad experiences, but this mounds is clearly where LaFollette and Monona Grove kids go to work part time after school. Molly was friendly and quick and I was really thrilled by her professional and kind demeanor. I think the other cashiers could take a note from her book. She was so nice :)
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer had a good experience at the store. They were pleased to find the specific food they needed on sale and were particularly impressed by the cashier, Molly M, who they found to be friendly, quick, professional, and kind. The reviewer's positive interaction with Molly made their overall shopping experience enjoyable, leading them to commend her service and suggest that other cashiers should emulate her demeanor. The reviewer's emphasis on Molly's positivity and efficiency reflects their positive feelings towards the store and its staff.

question:
Today, I had a terrible experience at Monona's Village Pedaler. i arrived at 10am as the shop opened. I needed to simply pump up a tire on my nephew's bike. I had trouble getting to the air value due to a spoke that was a little to snug to the value. Very simple issue....

I walked in and there was a white lady getting her bike fixed. Another white lady and a white gentleman came in after me. 

The first lady bike was serviced. I was clearly next. The guy working there looked past me and serviced the white lady before me! It was clear that I was next, but he didn't serve me. 

I patiently waiting thinking something was strange. He then asked me what I needed. I explained and we walked to the pump. He started to pump the air into the value, stopped 1/2 way through, and went to help the white gentleman. He just left me standing there. ??????

He got a set of tires for the man and left me wondering what I had done. I walked back in the shop wondering what was going on. I stood next to the gentleman. As the worker charged the man's credit card in the front of the store, the customer looked at me and apologized for the man working. He thanked me for my patience and went along. 

Again, we went to the pump and the worker finished pumping up the front tire. I proceeded to ask him if he would squeeze the back tire to see if it needed air too. He refused to do it, telling me that I 'should know how to do it.' He told me that 'this is a simply life skill that I should already know how to do'. Huh? 

I said, 'In your professional opinion, would you suggest that I add more air to the tire?'. He replied with a short, crisp, snotty attitude, "you feel the front tire and it (the back tire) needs air, do it". Wow!!!!!

...and he walked back in the store, leaving me by myself. 

I'm serious, I stood there shocked and wondering what was happening.

I am an African American professional who wanted to take my nephew on his first Monona-lake bike ride. I didn't deserve service like this. 

If you don't support discriminatory business, stay away from this shop! He didn't need to treat me with such disregard. They don't deserve your money. Stay away and tell your friends to not support this shop.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer had a terrible experience at the bike shop due to perceived discriminatory treatment based on race. The reviewer felt ignored, disrespected, and undervalued by the shop employee, who prioritized serving other customers who were white over them. The reviewer also felt belittled and dismissed when asking for assistance with their nephew's bike tire. Such treatment left the reviewer feeling shocked, unappreciated, and unwelcome in the shop, ultimately leading them to warn others against supporting the business. The discriminatory behavior and lack of respectful customer service described in the review contribute to the overall negative sentiment expressed by the reviewer.

question: Good local shop.  I haven't experienced any racism like jayson and can safely say after LONG conversations with a very interesting owner that they are NOT a racist bike shop.  Madison maybe a bit on the hyper-sensitive side when pulling the race card.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer shares a positive experience at the local shop, emphasizing that they have not personally encountered any racism there. The reviewer also appreciates the conversations they had with the owner, finding them interesting, which further contributes to their positive view of the shop. Additionally, the reviewer addresses potential concerns about racism raised by others, providing reassurance based on their own interactions and observations.

question: Craving a thin crust Pizza Hut pizza last night I called this place at 8PM for a delivery..They were out of pizza,yes out of thin crust pizza...I said that's like McDonalds being out of cheeseburgers,and was hung up on!? Unbelievable!
