rationale: The sentiment is negative because the customer had a disappointing experience when they tried to order a thin crust Pizza Hut pizza but were told the restaurant was out of that particular type of pizza. The fact that they were out of a popular menu item and the customer was hung up on when expressing their frustration led to a negative experience for the customer.

question: In a world where money buys you food--why would you come here and buy cardboard?  \n\nPizza Hut in general has gone downhill so far, it's not even funny.  I remember when I was a kid in the early 80's, Pizza Hut was awesome.  Now, it's all horrible.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer expresses disappointment and frustration with the quality of Pizza Hut's food compared to the past. The reviewer uses strong language like "horrible" and contrasts the current experience with memories of a better quality in the early 80s, indicating a significant decline in their perception of Pizza Hut.

question: Cheese sticks were under cooked, the pizza was EXTREMELY greasy.  I mean, oil was literally dripping out of the crust. Gross. It also had kind of a funky aftertaste. Wings were okay. \n\nWith so many options for good pizza in town, there is pretty much no reason to eat at pizza hut, even if it does save you a few bucks. Boo-urns.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer highlighted multiple issues with their experience at Pizza Hut. The undercooked cheese sticks, extremely greasy pizza, funky aftertaste, and lackluster wings all contributed to their negative assessment. Additionally, the reviewer points out that with so many other good pizza options available in town, there is little reason to choose Pizza Hut, despite the potential cost savings. This overall dissatisfaction and disappointment with both the food quality and overall dining experience contribute to the negative sentiment expressed in the review.

question: We were not impressed at all. We took the time to sit down with one of their accountants and explained exactly what we needed them to do for our businesses. Spent at least an hour and a half going thru everything and provided them with all the information they needed. They told us they understood and sold us on their services - but clearly they either didn't understand or were incapable of doing anything that didn't fit into their rigid structure. A quarter later we called to follow up and we got a \"I'm too busy for you right now\" reply. Not cool. Three months after that we realized they weren't doing anything we asked and we tried to find out what happened. Instead of owning up to their mistake - they tossed insults at us and acted like our earlier conversation never happened! When we took our complaint to the owner we got a very robotic apology with no attempt to make things better. Clearly this company doesn't work well with others.
rationale: The sentiment of this review is negative because the customer feels that the accounting company they worked with did not fulfill their promises or meet their expectations. The customer's experience of explaining their needs thoroughly, providing all necessary information, and then feeling ignored and dismissed by the company illustrates a lack of effective communication, competence, and customer service. The customer's dissatisfaction with the company's behavior, lack of accountability, and robotic apology all contribute to the negative sentiment expressed in the review.

question: Well, let's begin with the owners son who made my pregnant wife feel like a complete idiot.  We don't know anything about accounting, that's why we hire an accountant.  Then we are asked to put down a $300 retainer like they don't trust we'll pay the money to get the work done.  Then once retainer is paid, we are put on the backburner and ignored and sent bills for over $1000 over the next few months just to get our year end taxes done!  Then we ask to have help closing the business out with the government and are made promises that everything will be completed.  Now 6 months later, my wife had every penny (thousands) taken from her account by the state because nothing was ever done and the state is still charging my wife Unemployment Insurance taxes ($2000+) that she doesn't actually owe because the business was closed in February!  Guess what, Sorge said they'd fix it for us if we paid a $300 retainer again!
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the user experienced multiple issues with the accounting service, including feeling belittled by the owner's son, being asked for a retainer fee which led to being ignored and overbilled, unfulfilled promises regarding closing the business with the government, and ultimately facing financial consequences as a result of the firm's inaction. The user's frustration and disappointment with the lack of competence, communication, and integrity displayed by the accounting service provider led to a negative experience and financial consequences for them and their wife.

question: Grade: F\n\nEven the fantastic Crunch Coat Blizzard can't make up for the deep fried tumor passed off as a chicken breast.
rationale: The review expresses strong dissatisfaction with the food item being described. The use of negative language, such as "deep fried tumor," suggests a very unpleasant dining experience. Additionally, referring to the dessert as fantastic does not redeem the overall negative sentiment conveyed in the review. This negative sentiment is further emphasized by the grade of "F" given at the beginning of the review.

question:
One liner:  Ick.

Even the heartiest of cravings for a DQ treat could not make us go here....simply nasty.  Dirty counters, messy machines, and dirty tables.  And super rude staff.

The ultimate kicker?  Walking in to find the nastiest dust pan sitting right on the counter where they place your food when it is ready.

Seriously...call the health department. We will drive all the way to Sun Prairie rather than ever step foot in this place again.
rationale: The sentiment in the review is negative because the customer describes their experience at the restaurant as extremely unsatisfactory. They mention dirty conditions, messy equipment, rude staff, and a particularly concerning sight of a dirty dustpan near the food preparation area. These factors contribute to an overall negative impression of the establishment and prompt the reviewer to strongly discourage others from visiting.

question:
Ew,  I recently moved to this area and this is now my local Dairy Queen.  Who knew you could mess up a Blizzard so bad?

First of all, the line was out the door.  We assumed that it was just a busy night.  Turns out they were out of multiple items (and did not put a sign up). People were upset and walking out.  Then the family in front of us ordered, but did not pay.  No card, no money left their hand.  What?  So like you are giving out free ice cream and making us wait in line?  

I get up to the counter and ask a question about the ingredients of a Brownie Batter blizzard.  They are like, it is just brownies.  My response: Anything else?  They had to go ask someone.  What?  Seriously?!  So I finally get my answer and order it.  My husband also ordered a blizzard.  He ordered a Turtle Pecan blizzard and received some random peanuts in his blizzard.  We never got a receipt.  When I asked for one, they said they did not have any.  What?!

We pay and wait.  And wait.  Oh, but while we wait, we get to watch the kitchen person.  He was making a chicken sandwich.  With his LONG ponytail hanging over the grill.  Yum?  More like gross.  Then both my husband and I notice that he grabbed a raw chicken breast (while not wearing a glove) and placed it on the bare counter.  He then wiped his hand on his pants.  What?  Salmonella much?  Any food standards?

We get our medium blizzards.  The ice cream normally extends to the top or slightly over the top of the cup.  This time the ice cream barely made it to the top of my cup. My husband had ice cream under the cup.  When we asked if this was a medium, they said yes.  And just walked away.  

I walked out feeling very unsatisfied and my husband I determined this will be our last visit to the local DQ.  Besides the poor service, the food standards were disgusting.
rationale: The sentiment of this review is negative due to the numerous issues highlighted by the reviewer during their visit to the local Dairy Queen. The long wait times, lack of items available, confusion during ordering, improper handling of food by the kitchen staff, and poor quality of the Blizzards all contribute to the overall negative experience described in the review. Additionally, the fact that the reviewer and their husband were both unsatisfied and determined not to return indicates a strong level of disappointment with their visit.

question:
Forget it. They get a negative star!
I love a good DQ cone or blizzard just as much as the next person, but a complete failure was at hand on my first visit to this particular DQ. 
Let's just say....I watched a cook with a large beard and very long hair (both uncovered) toss a uncooked frozen chicken breast someone ordered directly on a dirty counter before putting it into their cooking machine (some sort of microwave)...ah ya.

Do Not eat food here, unless you like the thrill of being poisoned. 

As for the ice cream---I have never been to a DQ where I've been told they were out of a specific blizzard mix. 
I completely understand that having multiple 16 year old kids run the store might sound great in theory for cheap easy labor, but they are ruining the franchise and spending the owner's money as I watched them give away multiple items free to a group on their friends sitting at a table in the back.

This DQ does not even deserve 1 star.

I read a review that said call the Health dept.....Seriously, someone call them!
rationale: The sentiment in the review is negative because the customer had a terrible experience at this particular Dairy Queen location. The review describes unsanitary food handling practices, such as a cook tossing a frozen chicken breast onto a dirty counter before cooking it. Additionally, the customer was disappointed by the lack of available ice cream flavors and observed inappropriate behavior by the staff, including giving away items for free to friends. Overall, the reviewer felt that this DQ location was poorly managed and did not deserve a positive rating.

question: I sent this review in and all Dairy Queen said was thank you for your feedback.  Nothing more.  No follow up.  Gross.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the customer expected Dairy Queen to provide more than just a generic response of "thank you for your feedback". By not offering any further assistance or addressing the customer's concerns, the customer was left feeling unsatisfied and unappreciated. This lack of follow-up can be perceived as dismissive and may lead to a negative experience for the customer.

question: When Rocky's is good it is very good.  However it is always a hit or miss. Today was the worst pizza I have ever had. The bread sticks were hard as croutons and my pizza was barely warmer than room temperature and looked as if it was made hours before. My husbands also was just as bad.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the review highlights a very poor dining experience at Rocky's - the pizza was described as the worst ever, breadsticks were hard, and the overall quality of both pizzas was subpar. The mention of food being barely warm and looking like it had been made hours before adds to the disappointment expressed in the review. The inconsistency in the quality of the food, described as a hit or miss, further contributes to the negative sentiment.

question: Normally, their food and service is great.  However, we ate there on February 18th 2012 and had anything but, that!  We saw people who got there after us, being waited on like kings and got their food, drinks and their bill before us.  I ordered the half chicken (which was more like two small pieces of chicken) and in towards the bone, there was blood...BLOOD!  Not pink or even a smoke ring, blood.  Not cool.  They were busy (which is great) but they could not handle it.  Our server got our drinks and took our order, other than that, we never saw her again.  I was about to get up and ask another serer for our bill.  We will give them another chance, as we've eaten there many time before.  However, if the next visit is like this one, I will find another place to take my money!
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the customer experienced multiple issues during their visit to the restaurant on February 18th, 2012. They were disappointed with the slow service, discrepancies in food quality (finding blood in the chicken), lack of attention from their server, and feeling overlooked compared to other patrons who arrived after them. The customer expressed frustration and disappointment, indicating that their experience fell far short of their usual positive expectations.

question: Ate here last night.  Food was barely tolerable and the place was so dirty. Waitress stood in the middle is the dining area loudly babbling about movies for 10 minutes annoying everyone. Never  going back.
rationale: The sentiment is Negative because the customer had a negative dining experience. They mentioned that the food was barely tolerable, the place was dirty, and the waitress's behavior was annoying. These factors would contribute to an overall negative impression of the restaurant and would likely deter the customer from returning in the future.

question: I ate here last week,  this was my first time to Fat Jack's and likely the last. The place is quite dingy and has this layer of dusty grime on everything, it is in need of one of those restaurant makeover shows. The wait staff was friendly but unprofessional and somewhat inattentive given that there were few other people there at the time. It is a windowless, dark, cave atmosphere and dimly lit. \n\nMy food was Just OK and for a $10 sandwich they could have done allot better, it had zero flavor, but they provide home made BBQ sauces in those on-table, refillable squeeze bottles that never see a fridge or dishwasher. This place is in need of some serious updating in ALL areas.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the review highlights several issues with the restaurant Fat Jack's. The customer was disappointed with the overall cleanliness and ambiance of the place, describing it as dingy and in need of a makeover. They also found the wait staff to be friendly but unprofessional and inattentive. Additionally, the food was deemed to be just okay and lacking in flavor, especially considering the price of the sandwich. The mention of homemade BBQ sauces in unsanitary refillable squeeze bottles further adds to the negative perception of the restaurant. Overall, the review reflects a general dissatisfaction with the dining experience at Fat Jack's.

question:
i travel a lot and no matter what city i find myself in, i make sure to hit up a bbq spot at least once during the trip. each and every one of those visits are compared to my bbq gold standard, fat jack's in monona. 

i'm actually leaving on sunday for yet another trip and i can say, without fail, on bbq night, one of my travel buddies at the table will ask, "so... how'd it compare to fat jack's?"

chances are my response will be something like, "it's good... but it ain't fat jack's!"
rationale: The sentiment in this review is positive because the reviewer consistently views Fat Jack's in Monona as the gold standard for BBQ. Despite trying BBQ in various cities while traveling, the reviewer always compares their experiences to Fat Jack's which indicates a high level of satisfaction and preference for the BBQ spot. The fact that the reviewer's travel buddies also ask how other BBQ restaurants compare to Fat Jack's further emphasizes the positive sentiment towards the restaurant. Overall, the review conveys a strong sense of loyalty and fondness towards Fat Jack's BBQ.

question: My dad and I went here thinking it would be a good place to try. The inside of the restaurant was unclean and tacky. Neither my dad nor I were impressed with the food. We both had ribs. There was very little BBQ sauce on the ribs, and while our food came out fast the quality was not great.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is Negative because the customer had a disappointing experience at the restaurant. They mentioned that the interior was unclean and tacky, the food quality was not great, and there was very little BBQ sauce on the ribs they ordered. Overall, the lack of cleanliness, poor food quality, and minimal sauce on their dish contributed to their negative impression of the dining experience.

question:
Anyone familiar with Sonny's BBQ (a southern chain) will immediately notice the similarity. This is not a good thing. 
Salad bar was ok. Not a lot of great variety.
I had the 1/2 rack of ribs with slaw and fries. 
The slaw and fries were fine. Nothing special but not bad. 
The garlic bread, soaked in buttery garlic, also was fine. Probably the best part of the meal. 
The ribs, on the other hand, could use some work. 
First, they were covered in SO MUCH SAUCE, that I had to hold them up to let some drip off. Sauce should provide an accent to good BBQ, not be the BBQ.
Second, the doneness of the meat varied across the ribs. One rib was fall of bone. Further down, it was closer to jerky. 

All in all, not a great BBQ experience.
rationale: The review expresses a negative sentiment primarily because the customer was not impressed with the quality of the BBQ experience. Several key points contribute to this negative sentiment: the lack of variety in the salad bar, mediocre slaw and fries, overly saucy ribs, inconsistency in the doneness of the meat, and the overall dissatisfaction with the ribs. Additionally, the comparison to another BBQ chain with a negative connotation adds to the customer's disappointment. Overall, the review highlights multiple aspects of the dining experience that fell short of the customer's expectations, resulting in a negative sentiment.

question: Best BBQ in madison. The best night is Thursday. All you can eat chicken and ribs. Their coleslaw is the vinegar oil kind. Not creamy. I love it. Some of the staff has worked there for years - a nod to this awesome locally/family owned eatery.
rationale: The sentiment in the review is Positive because the user praises the BBQ restaurant in Madison as the best in town, highlighting the popular all-you-can-eat chicken and ribs special on Thursdays. They appreciate the unique vinegar-oil coleslaw and express admiration for the longstanding staff, recognizing the establishment as locally and family-owned. These positive remarks demonstrate the user's satisfaction with the food, service, and atmosphere of the restaurant.

question: Have been eating here for 25 years. It used to my favorite place for barbecue. I ordered a half rack of ribs and the bones were soft and tasted awful. The waitress took it back to the cook. The cook said that happens sometimes and sent out two cold pieces of rib. I won't be going back sad to say.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the customer had a disappointing experience at a restaurant they have been loyal to for 25 years. Despite ordering a half rack of ribs, the bones were soft and tasted bad. Furthermore, the customer was unsatisfied with the resolution provided by the staff, leading to a decision not to return to the establishment.

question:
I got the all you can eat spare ribs and chicken.  I tried a chicken leg first and all I could taste was smoke.  The leg and thigh weren't that bad despite the heavy smoke.  The breast was dry.

Next I tried the ribs.  They were tender,but for some reason they tasted like sausage.  Maybe they were smoked with sausage.

The baked beans were pretty good.  They had a hint heat, which is good.

The coleslaw is what hurt.  I could taste apple and it is vinegar based I believe, which I like, but it looked and tasted old. 

Bottom line is I've had better BBQ in the Madison area.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer experienced multiple issues with the food they ordered. They found the chicken to be overly smoked, the breast to be dry, and the ribs to taste like sausage, which was unexpected. Additionally, the coleslaw was described as tasting and looking old, despite having flavors the reviewer typically enjoys. Overall, they mentioned that they have had better BBQ in the Madison area, indicating a level of disappointment with their dining experience.

question:
In July 2013, I was staying at the Country Inn down the street, and figured I'd walk to dinner in the area. I had my heart set on another restaurant.

THEN I SMELLED BARBECUE.

I literally followed my nose, and ended up at Fat Jack's. I was traveling alone, and the experience was phenomenal. Good food and great staff. The place doesn't look like much from the outside, but once inside, they have a ton of memorabilia around. I've been there several times since (I'm from Chicago, so I'm not up that often), but it is my go-to if I'm riding I-90 through the area.

If you're feeling ambitious and/or want leftovers the next day, go for their sampler platter. It has all their barbecue and is more than enough for 2 meals. There's two different kinds of sauces on the table, mild and spicy. 

I went here last Friday, 8/1/14, with my boyfriend for lunch. As we got out of our car, an older gentleman told us how good it was. And right he was!

I wish Fat Jack's was nearer so we could go more often!
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer had a phenomenal experience at Fat Jack's, stating it has good food and a great staff. They were drawn in by the smell of barbecue, enjoyed the atmosphere inside the restaurant with its memorabilia, and liked the option of a sampler platter for generous portions. Additionally, the reviewer mentions returning multiple times and expresses a desire to visit more frequently if the restaurant were closer. The enthusiastic tone and repeat patronage indicate a strong overall positive feeling towards Fat Jack's.

question: UW Health Monona is the worst clinic in the world. I finally left after waiting an hour to see my doctor. They are incompent and don't care how much of their patients time they waste
rationale: The review expresses frustration and dissatisfaction with UW Health Monona, citing a long wait time and perceived incompetence of the staff. The use of words like "worst" and "don't care" indicates a strongly negative sentiment towards the clinic. The customer's negative experience and perception of wasted time contribute to the overall negative sentiment.

question: I've taken my kids there for lab work and the clinic personnel are always very nice and professional.  It is not as busy as the bigger clinics, so I prefer to go there instead of where our docs are when we need labs done between visits.
rationale: The sentiment is Positive because the user had a good experience at the clinic with friendly and professional personnel. They appreciate the lower levels of busyness compared to bigger clinics and find it convenient for getting lab work done between doctor visits. This positive feedback highlights the user's preference for this clinic over others, indicating a satisfactory and positive experience overall.

question: I had a very poor experience with Brothers Main. Went to the store to get information on an entire house worth of appliances, as we're building a new home. The salesperson was very friendly and knowledgeable, and the in-store experience was a good one. From there, it was all downhill. It took a full week to get a quote on the appliances we discussed in the store. Since we are under a bit of a time crunch with the builder, that was not helpful. We called the store four times to request the quote (after waiting 5 days we called, and were told that we would have the quote by the end of the day. It didn't come. We called the next morning, and were told we'd have the quote \"within the hour\". We called 4 hours later and were again told we'd have it \"within the hour\". Finally, after the 4th call, we received the quote. To add insult to injury, the quote included a price higher than the Brothers Main website price for the fridge we had picked out.\nWe will be going with another provider for our appliances.
rationale: The sentiment is Negative because the customer had a poor experience with Brothers Main due to delays in receiving a quote, lack of timely communication, and being quoted a higher price than advertised on the store's website. The customer felt frustrated and inconvenienced by the entire process, leading them to ultimately decide to go with another provider for their appliances.

question: bad experience at the west side location. went there to look at projectors for my man room. had a nice selection but expensive. asked the sales associate if there were other projectors and he kept telling me about the one for 3000 bucks. told me best buy bad garbage (was true). found one online.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the user had a bad experience at the West side location when looking for projectors. They found the selection to be expensive, and the sales associate was not helpful in assisting them with alternative options despite expressing disinterest in the pricey projector recommended. This led to the user feeling disappointed and ultimately finding a suitable projector online instead.

question: La Bamba where the burritos are as big as your head.  I suppose this would be true if I had Beetlejuice's head after he gets it shrunken by the voodoo guy.  They aren't as big as your head, so if you go in there thinking you are going to nosh on a seriously huge burrito, you are going to be let down.  Just when you think \"oh well, maybe it'll at least taste good,\" you find out the disappointing truth, the burritos are bland and full of dry rice.  Booooo!  The path to gigantic burrito enlightenment is not here my friends, just keep on drivin' by.
rationale: The sentiment of this review is negative because the reviewer expresses disappointment and dissatisfaction with their experience at La Bamba. They highlight that the burritos are not as big as advertised, lack flavor, and contain dry rice. The reviewer describes being let down and advises others to not expect a positive experience at the restaurant. These negative remarks impact the overall sentiment conveyed in the review.

question:
Wow, kind of let down.  I have been to other locations and always received a pretty good meal.  Most likely between 3 and 4 stars.  On an early Saturday evening, I walked in to an empty restaurant.  I order the combo: two tacos and one quesadilla with rice and beans.  My order was to go.  I live about 7-8 minutes from there.  

When I got home my food was room temperature.  It was like they pre-cooked the meat and then just warmed it up quick when I got there.  My quesadilla was a bean taco, yup definitely NOT a quesadilla.  That is it.  Not impressive.  The side of rice was great.  The side of beans was salty.  It is just not what I am used to from other La Bamba visits.  

Step up your game.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is negative because the customer was disappointed with their experience at the restaurant. They were let down by the quality of the food, especially since they had previously had better meals at other locations. The fact that the restaurant was empty on a Saturday evening also likely contributed to their disappointment. Additionally, receiving a different item than what was ordered (a bean taco instead of a quesadilla) and finding the beans to be too salty further added to their negative impression of the meal. Overall, the customer expected more from a restaurant chain they had previously enjoyed and felt that this particular visit did not meet their expectations.

question: Don't go out of your way to get there because they probably won't be open. They were closed early the last two times I went there.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer's experience has consistently been disappointing with the business being closed early on two separate occasions. This indicates poor reliability and inconvenience for customers, leading to a negative overall experience.

question:
As the owner of several older motorcycles, and pretty much being mechanically inclined, Suters has been invaluable to me. Sam, who is pretty much in charge of the bone yard side of Sutter's, knows most every part of every bike you could think of, or that matters at least... 
They keep parts in stock that are hard to find TODAY ( let's be realistic, ever since the Internet came about nothing is hard to find if your little balls have dropped and you can patiently wait for it) and can cut you any gasket you need while you wait. 

The only negative thing is that most of the bikes in the yard have been picked clean, probably by Sam himself, but that's how he makes his money, for what he has in his barn the prices are very fair, a $45 seat from a 33 year old cycle wont be taped up or missing half a hinge.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is positive because the user highlights the shop's value in providing rare and hard-to-find motorcycle parts, as well as offering custom gasket cutting services. The reviewer also appreciates the fair pricing and the extensive knowledge of Sam, the person in charge of the bone yard section. Despite mentioning that some bikes in the yard may have been picked through, the overall tone of the review conveys satisfaction with the range of services and expertise available at Suters.

question: This place is the quintessential bike salvage yard / shop, and I'd have it no other way. The folks there are helpful and they don't beat around the bush.  They've got two barns full of parts, pretty much anything you need. Sam knows the yard like the back of his hand, and the shop will hook you up with what isn't out in the yard. Prices are decent and the location isn't too far out of the way
rationale: The sentiment in the review is positive because the reviewer highlights the helpfulness of the staff, the wide range of parts available, the expertise of Sam, reasonable prices, and convenient location. The reviewer appreciates the straightforward and efficient service provided by the shop, indicating a positive experience overall.

question: Don't shop here.  The owner John Menard is PURE EVIL...  Menards is a terrible place to work, not a good corporate citizen, and a terrible customer for its' vendors.  Spend your money in a local hardware store.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the review mentions the owner as "PURE EVIL," describes Menards as a terrible place to work and a bad corporate citizen, and advises against spending money there. These negative statements indicate a strong dislike and dissatisfaction with Menards, making the sentiment negative overall.

question:
I've been in a Menards a LOT ever since I was a young kid following my Dad around on the weekends. However, this review is mostly based off of a shopping experience that I undertook there.

I was in the market for a couch and shopped around at a lot of places, wasn't looking for anything too fancy or expensive. Someone gave me a tip that Menards was selling a decent one for $250 so I went in to check it out (this was their East Towne location). After giving it a day of thought I decided to pull the trigger. I called the east side and they said they only had the floor model left (they were priced to sell). I asked if their other two locations had some in stock, and they said the west side did, so I called the west side and had one put on hold so I could buy it that evening.

Get to the west side and they have the loveseat, not the couch. ARGGG, I thought these things were organized by SKU, you messed up on the store computer on that one, East Side. The Monona location still has one left though! It's the floor model, but now it's $200 (after $50 rebate). OK, fine. I go to the Monona location and ask if I can buy it now and pick it up in a few days when I can borrow my dad's trailer and haul it to my apartment. They say "No" we don't do prepay anymore. Darn. I ask if I can put it on hold and my dad can alter his schedule so that he can pick it up tomorrow morning (this was a deal on a couch that I didn't want to let get away). The sales associate calls his manager and they make a big exception for me. That I'm happy with, and I commend them for being flexible.

However, I go to put it on hold, and they say that I need to pay for it now when I put it on hold. What??? So you first say that Menards doesn't do prepay (pay now, pick up later), but when I put something on hold to buy and pick up later, I have to pay now? What's the difference???

Anyway, I'm happy that I found such a deal, and I'm happy that they were willing to make a small exception to their rules, but Menards you really need to get your stuff together.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is negative because the customer experienced multiple issues during their shopping experience at Menards. They faced discrepancies in product availability between store locations, confusion over payment policies, and encountered conflicting information regarding prepayment and holding items. Overall, these frustrations and inconsistencies in service likely contributed to the negative sentiment expressed in the review.

question:
When walking into this store you get the impression of distrust right off the bat. You walk into a highly secure well thought out maze that forces you past all of their high profit items or whatever they want you to see on the way to your can of WD-40. They just "remodeled" the Monona store and made it much larger (like it wasn't large enough already), and it is now ridiculously large, to the point I will not go back unless I absolutely HAVE to. I am  partially disabled and can have a difficult time walking, so when a store forces you to walk through needless extra aisles it becomes very daunting.
This store seems "artificially" large and there is a TON of wasted space, it appears that they made the store as large as they legally could, and for no other reason than that.

I also resent being distrusted to such a high degree. I fully understand that they must maintain a secure place, but Mernard's makes it super obvious. On the subject of distrust, I think they may distrust their employees even more than the customers. This is blatantly obvious when the cashiers have to get a manager's approval to accept a $20 bill or do any sort of pricing change in correcting one of their all to frequent "computer goofs"(funny how these "innocent" computer error/ pricing over-rings are ALWAYS in their favor).  They also boast a computer at the customer svc.counter displaying the Menard's website, but it doesn't go "on-line".  They offer a price guarantee but have no way to verify or look up a competitor's price due to this seemingly and prevailing level of distrust of everyone.

I will give Monona Menard's props in just ONE area (Monona Menard's has an extra large wood shed and selection) and that is their lumber quality and selection. They have the most extensive assortment of awesome quality lumber I have ever seen in any lumber retailer anywhere. They have lumber assorted by species and size and it is not all culled and picked over, it is always nice, clean and straight. 

If I have to ever return here it will be only for the lumber and building materials selection which is far superior to The HD or Lows.
rationale: The sentiment in the review is negative because the customer expresses feelings of distrust, inconvenience, and frustration towards their experience at the store. They highlight issues with the store layout, feeling forced through unnecessary aisles, and perceiving the store as artificially large with wasted space. Additionally, they mention their perception of being distrusted by the store through stringent security measures and over-scrutiny of transactions, leading to a lack of trust in both customers and employees. Despite acknowledging one positive aspect regarding the lumber selection, overall the review conveys dissatisfaction and a strong reluctance to revisit the store unless absolutely necessary.

question: This past summer I built a new expanded porch on the front of my house. In the process I went to home improvement stores a lot. This Menards was recently remodeled and expanded. The yard area out back is much nicer and easier to get around than it used to be. The inside is huge, but arranged poorly. Now when you need to order stuff from the yard you have to go to the back corner farthest from the entrance. I get that they want you to wander through and maybe pick up random crap, but when all you need is bags on concrete it's annoying to have to make that trek. The new checkout lines are set up in a really dumb way. It forces the checkout person to have their back to you for most of the time that they are checking you out and you have to bag things yourself now. Inside the store I've had to hunt around when I did need help with something, but once found they sales people would be helpful. In the yard you can rarely find anyone to help with locating products or loading the heavier stuff.
rationale: The sentiment in the review is negative because the reviewer points out several issues they encountered while shopping at Menards. These include inconvenient layout of checkout lines, poor organization inside the store, difficulty in finding assistance, and lack of help in the yard area. The overall experience described seems frustrating and inefficient, contributing to a negative impression of the store.

question:
Why is it that no two Menards stores are arranged or laid out in the same manner? I mean, seriously - I don't get it. 

Perhaps it has something to do with the relative age of each store? If that's the case, this particular location must have been "Plan C" for "chaotic."

I know my way around the west side Menards like the back of my hand. It never takes me more than a few minutes to run in, grab what I need and get back home.

This store; holy cats. It's like someone made a list of all of the departments, threw them into a big top hat, shook the hat vigorously, and then dumped it onto a floor plan.

Examples: you've just purchased a new faucet and would like to replace the faucet lines and fittings. One would reason to think these components would be located within a few aisles of one another... HA! Gotchya! They're nowhere near one another!

Need a mirror to go with that new faucet? You'll be making a trip to the PAINT department for that, which seems entirely logical to me (insert eye roll).

I could go on, but you get the idea.

At least the checkout folks are friendly. The same can't really be said for the few department staff I've dealt with; on a recent visit, two department guys were standing in the middle of an aisle talking about how "f-ing dumb" a previous customer was. Nice.

In general, I'm a fan of Menards - especially the west side store. This one? Not so much.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is negative because the reviewer expresses frustration and confusion about the layout and organization of the Menards store they visited. They highlight inconsistencies between different Menards locations and criticize the chaotic layout of the store, making it difficult for them to find what they need quickly. The reviewer also mentions encountering unprofessional behavior from department staff, which adds to their negative experience. Overall, the review reflects dissatisfaction with the store's layout, organization, and customer service, leading to a negative sentiment.

question:
Customer service...by manager or underling at times can be a disappointing and ingrained experience.   I love hardware stores  in general for the inspiration and fun brainstorming provided with staff for non traditional challenges. Which  I then buy the products suggested after brainstorming...I am happy, the employee knows that I know he's smart because he endevored for a solution so he's happy , and menards corporation is happy because they made another sale $$.  I am also o.k. understanding 

This  scenario is great if... managers,  department heads,  employees who are not managers, 
-Did not talk about how they punished another employee for something frivolous and petty deed by assigning him with a undesirable task multiple times near other customers.
-Employees whom you have never met before turn there back on you, and when you quicken your step and say "Excuse me, could I ask a question" for just being pointed the right direction,  not  ten feet in front of you turn down an isle and out of sight.
Yes they did hear you but you are just another bothersome customer.
-Approach with a smile inquiring about the pricing of a plant, have the employee who is apart of the department hear the the exchange of inquiry 14 feet away glancing at you while organizing a shelf, not aproach, making the non gardening recipient search for ten minutes for him.  He is found...And you ask you self this question...why did this person not come over?  She found him.    To surprise whch was to be the same guy 14 feet away...I did not aproach him after she went to go find someone because he made no motion, or inclination to talk, and he stepped out of site as soon as she announced let me find someone. And because before talking to the young lady, I approached him first with an "Excuse Me".  Of which he did not respond so I assumed maybe he was someone sent to to this department over inventory discrepancies.
(Exept standing there straitening items on the shelves like an office clerk would at a desk if there had not had any calls or clerical duties recieved to be done for awhile.)

I will not go into detail but I found out why this employee was still employed...this manager who he returned with or maybe even managers are fostering an environment very much not conductive to employee teamwork,...favouritism, privilege removing, snubbing, false appearances in helping others among employees are hallmarks of a work place many sincere and hardworking individuals leave to work somewhere else.  Leaving the creepy employees behind.
Yes,..it's not just the customer...the employees who work with these or under these "duds"  do have to put up with the same stupid crap that the customers do.
"managers overlooking sour laden behaviour because they do it them selfs." Yes even the managers above the mangers and so on.
They give the well behaved underlings a hard time in subtle and stealthy ways because any employee who is at all showing that they value doing things the right way, threatens their position.  "Insecure people need to not have there inner sense of authority threatened thus are the cause of a miserable work place. Therefore do soul sucking things to keep this invisible balance."  
And the poor attitude gets directed at you the customer also.  Yes these not so great workers at menards do to you, what they would do to thier coworkers becuase there are not really consequences and the social environment this menards location promotes and feeds , keeps this type of thinking and way of being alive.  Thriving in the support brought be misscommunication and acknowledgment among select employees inadvertently or overtly that this is o.k.!!

I love menards....and the inspiration it brings.   I have grown up beings menards fan.
But from what I know of the Menona Wisconsin  (Sadly the closest menards store.)
Give the few good employees who actually do a good job lots of praise because you the "Awsome happy relaxed undemanding customer" who made their day. (Which true costomer service oriented employees are motivated by genuine thank yous thus strives for them). So keep this in mind... When you leave the store location...these few exceptional employees cannot until their shift is over and so are in crapster job becuase of what I have mentioned above.

I have witnessed or encountered at least two other top customer service or job responsibility inventory tracking fails...besides what is mentioned above.  

STAR Level:   ONE!!
rationale: The sentiment of the review is negative because the customer expresses disappointment and frustration with the customer service experience at Menards in Menona, Wisconsin. The customer details instances of employees displaying unhelpful behavior, including ignoring customers, appearing disinterested, and failing to provide assistance. The review also highlights a toxic work environment fostered by management, involving favoritism, lack of teamwork, and mistreatment of employees. Overall, the customer perceives a lack of genuine care and professionalism, leading to a negative overall experience, resulting in a low "STAR Level" rating of one.

question: Kind of makes me feel like I' inconveniencing them.  I get left so they can help others.  I don't mind waiting, but when its my turn, then I am the person that should get the help and the other people should be told to wait.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the individual feels like they are being treated unfairly and that their needs are not being prioritized. They feel as though they are an inconvenience and are frustrated that others are being helped ahead of them. This can lead to feelings of frustration, inadequacy, and unworthiness.

question: One of our family's favorite choices for pizza...staff has always been very friendly and helpful at this location even when we have to customize their specialty pizzas for the kids. Over the summer we have also tried their s'mores pizza and it was a big hit.  Our favorite right now is the  Herb Chicken Mediterranean....would definitely recommend giving it a try.
rationale: The review expresses satisfaction with the restaurant, highlighting that it is a family favorite for pizza and praising the friendly and accommodating staff. The mention of trying different pizzas, such as the s'mores pizza and the Herb Chicken Mediterranean, indicates that the reviewer enjoys exploring the menu and finding new favorites. The recommendation to try the Herb Chicken Mediterranean suggests a positive overall experience and a willingness to encourage others to visit the restaurant. Overall, the reviewer's positive comments and recommendations contribute to the sentiment being classified as Positive.

question: I love this place, have been going to \"Poppas\" for years, started back when they were on the corner of Milwaukee and Stoughton. Best place to get Dogs and Gyros.  The building may be run down, the booths maybe hard plastic, but the Gyros and Chicago dogs are worth the trip for a great lunch!
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer expresses their love for the place and mentions being a loyal customer for years. They highlight the quality of the food, specifically praising the Gyros and Chicago dogs. Despite acknowledging that the building and seating may not be the most modern or comfortable, the reviewer still believes that the delicious food makes it a great spot for a satisfying lunch.

question:
Happy to echo the sentiments here - good, honest shop with fair prices.

No up-sell here - I've actually had them tell me I didn't need work after another shop tried to tell me I did.  Keeps me coming back, for sure.

Awesome building, and historic - apparently, the city of Monona was founded there! http://www.mymonona.com/pages/parks_recreation/parks_open_space/details.php/31/parks_open_space/schluter+beach/ 

If you have time, grab an ice cream at the bait shop a couple of doors down, and wander over to the lake.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer had a strong endorsement for the shop, praising their fair prices, honesty, and lack of upselling tactics. The fact that they specifically mentioned being told they didn't need work after another shop claimed they did shows a high level of integrity on the part of the shop. Additionally, the positive note about the historic building and the recommendation to enjoy other local amenities nearby contribute to an overall positive sentiment.

question:
i drove out here from chicago before an evening engagement i had. i was a bit put off at first as it is located in a dingy strip mall -- though i don't know what i was expecting as most antique malls don't have prime real estate.

i was greeted and then left alone to mosey along the maze of booths. the booths are not as eclectic as i would've hoped but there is a lot of stuff and most of it is reasonably priced. with the plethora of cups, saucers and plate ware you would think that some prices would drop. they were a bit pricey compared to similar items i have seen elsewhere. 

a bit partial to the mid-century i was disappointed that there were only two booth that gave me my fix. however, these booths were GOOD.

this place gets such high marks because
1) there is little, if any, junk. just good plain OLD stuff
2) save for a couple of candles, there are no new booths trying to sneak in old-looking new things. i hate that.
3) they are markedly green conscious: signs praising you for shopping second hand and keeping a three foot high stack of splayed-out newspaper for wrapping gifts. 

p.s. i left with a set of four cups and saucers, a mid-century teak planter, a retro canvas print (for $3!) and a chrome tray.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer acknowledges some initial reservations about the location and the selection of items at the antique mall. However, they highlight several positive aspects that outweigh any shortcomings, such as the abundance of reasonably priced items, the presence of quality booths catering to their mid-century tastes, and the overall lack of junk or new items masquerading as old. The reviewer appreciates the environmentally conscious practices of the mall and ends on a happy note, listing the unique and affordable items they were able to purchase. Overall, the positive aspects of the antique mall experience outweigh the initial concerns, leading to a positive review.

question: Wow, this antique mall seems to go on and on forever. It is huge and has a wonderful selection of collectibles. I am in the market for collectible books and they had so many books, that I could not see them all in this trip. There are a lot of kitchen items, dishes and vintage toys. This is a great place to spend a Saturday afternoon. The prices were reasonable. There was a check in offer and some of the dealers booths have coupons.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the review highlights several positive aspects of the antique mall, such as its huge size, wonderful selection of collectibles, variety of items available (collectible books, kitchen items, dishes, and vintage toys), reasonable prices, and added benefits like a check-in offer and coupons from dealers. The reviewer enjoyed their experience and found the antique mall to be a great place to spend a Saturday afternoon, indicating a positive overall impression.

question: Great selection of fun stuff!  We stopped by on our way to Chicago and it was a perfect break in the trip to stretch our legs and browse.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the review mentions the selection of fun items, indicating that the customer was pleased with the variety of products available. Additionally, the customer found the stop to be a perfect break in their trip, suggesting that they had a pleasant and enjoyable experience at the store. Overall, the mention of browsing and stretching their legs further reinforces the idea that the customer had a positive visit.

question: I grew up with this as my neighborhood grocery store so it's got a space in my heart.  I never gave it much thought, though, until I noticed it swanked it up big time in order to beat off the Goliath that is Whole Foods.  Rock out, Sentry.  You'll always be my favorite.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer expresses a deep emotional connection to the grocery store, referring to it as their favorite and noting that it holds a special place in their heart. The reviewer also acknowledges and appreciates the efforts made by the store to improve and compete with larger competitors like Whole Foods, showing admiration for their determination and success. Overall, the reviewer's tone is enthusiastic and supportive, reflecting a positive sentiment towards the grocery store.

question:
If ever there were a real live grinch, It would be the hag (presumably the manager) working 2 days before Christmas.  I was going to buy a bottle of wine, and she came over to let me know in a nasty voice that if I were buying alcohol, I better hurry up.

Well I did, and because the cashier was seriously slow, it was 9:01 when it was my turn at the register.  This woman came over, and snatched the bottle away from the cashier and said something to the effect that I should have hurried up, and they didn't sell alcohol after 9.  The cashier looked really uncomfortable, and mumbled some excuse.  

What is it about the holidays that turns people into complete assholes?
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer encountered rude and impolite behavior from the store manager or employee during the holiday season. The reviewer felt mistreated and disrespected, especially considering they were merely trying to purchase a bottle of wine before closing time. The manager's aggressive and unfriendly attitude, as well as the overall unpleasant experience described in the review, contribute to the negative sentiment expressed by the reviewer.

question:
I came here for one reason, the free Sunday paper. I love free stuff. Even if it appears to be absurd, like a Sunday paper. The deal is, you spend five dollars and they give you a two dollar Wisconsin Sunday paper. Okay, so know you know how I ended up here, let me tell you all about the magnificent Metcalfe's.

It is just a supermarket. Not of a Safeway variety, but a Gelson's or Bristol Farms variety. Despite the many Yelpers who proclaimed that this is expensive, its not expensive. If you are buying toilet paper or paper towel here, it is expensive, but it is no more expensive on food than anyone else. I don't care about some Brat Fest, I don't even care about brats. Cheese is just cheese, in fact, if you have been to cheese stores in New York and Paris, you realize everything else pales in comparison. In fact, everything pales to New York and Paris anyway.

Back to the review. The store is well laid out, clean, the produce appeared fresh. It was early on a Sunday morning, but a lot of the prepared foods were already out. They looked good, but I don't buy prepared foods in a supermarket, unless its Wegmans, but that isn't a supermarket, its nirvana. Thus I can not assess the prepared section. I do buy baked goods, and it is on this basis that the store failed. As I was walking down the bakery aisle, I noticed a slice of white cake. I love white cake. The soft, dewy white cake, enrobed in creamy butter cream frosting *cue the angels and ethereal music* Anyway, as part of my five dollars, I bought a 2.49 piece of white cake. *gag* How much sugar do you people eat? The cake was okay, but the frosting was just a sugary, you could taste the granules, nightmare. This is not white cake!!

There was nothing wrong with the store, but if your bakery sucks, it is a good indication that the other prepared foods are not going to be very good and there are also some other flaws. I didn't see anything that was unique or that would make me want to come here. There wasn't any Bell and Evans Chicken. I did see they sold Boar's Head cold meats, which is always a plus, but is it worthy of five stars? No.

Sorry Mr. and Mrs. Metcalfe (or whomever you are), work on the bakery, let me know and I will come back and re-evaluate you again.
rationale: The sentiment of this review is negative because the reviewer expresses disappointment and dissatisfaction with their experience at Metcalfe's supermarket. They highlight a specific flaw with the bakery section, as the white cake they purchased did not meet their expectations in terms of taste and quality. The reviewer also mentions the absence of certain unique or high-quality products that would have made a positive impression. Overall, the review communicates a sense of letdown and lack of enthusiasm about the store, indicating a negative sentiment.

question:
An excellent grocery store with lovely produce, meat and deli. Just moved here from the west coast and this is the only big grocery in town that doesn't make me feel very very homesick.
Produce section includes a big organic section. Products labeled with origin.
Prices may be higher but if you watch for the sale items- the prices are good. 
Helpful staff.
Huge selection of local cheeses. (duh)
Bakery seems full of variety, from boring midwest white bread products to many whole grain and local breads/pastries. They will slice anything.
I go here when I do not want to be depressed by the other grocery stores in town and want a bigger selection than I can get at the local co-op.
One Sunday they had over 40 free sample stations! Might be a regular thing?
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the review highlights several aspects of the grocery store that the reviewer finds commendable and appealing. They appreciate the quality and variety of the produce, meat, deli, and bakery items, as well as the large selection of local cheeses. The inclusion of an organic section and products labeled with origin further adds to the positive experience. The reviewer also notes the helpful staff and the presence of free sample stations, which they find enjoyable. Overall, the reviewer's positive tone, specific praises, and comparison to other grocery stores in town indicate a high level of satisfaction and a likelihood of return visits.

question: I really don't understand why anyone would go here. The prices are absolutely astronomical!!! Whole Foods gets a bad rap but honestly, the same products are available there for way less money. Take Barbara's cereals-- $6.09 at Metcalfe's. That's right, SIX dollars. For cereal. At WF, the same cereal is $4.99. And then there is the ice cream aisle. One would imagine that this place would carry premium ice cream, being that it kind of touts itself as gourmet. Wrong! It's all garbage. The only semi good brand is Sassy Cow and again, guess what? More than six dollars per container!! The bakery section is gross, too. I'm sure the booze and meats and cheeses are probably great but after seeing what they charge for fairly basic products I am not sure why anyone would go here when WF is 100 percent natural and costs less.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is Negative because the reviewer is expressing dissatisfaction and disappointment with various aspects of their experience at the store. They highlight the high prices of products compared to a competitor, noting specific examples like expensive cereal and premium ice cream. The reviewer also criticizes the quality of certain products like the ice cream and bakery items, describing them as subpar. Overall, the tone of the review is critical and implies that the store does not meet the reviewer's expectations in terms of both pricing and product quality.

question: Your bakery department sucks big time. You charge ridiculous prices on your desserts that are made just not right. Well we tried almost every item, EASY ON A SUGAR GUYS, YOUR STUFF IS WAY TOOOOOO SWEET. \nWe love the rest of the store though, deli snd sushi are great. GL
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the user expressed dissatisfaction with the quality of the bakery department's desserts, stating that they are overpriced and too sweet. Additionally, they mentioned that they have tried multiple items and found them to be lacking. This negative experience contrasts with the positive feedback provided for the deli and sushi departments.

question:
Have you ever wanted to know what it's like to be rich?  Be more refined?  You know, go to high-end fancy shmancy places?  

My friend, welcome to the place where millionaires shop for groceries.  

Okay, I have no idea if that statement is accurate.  But, how many grocery stores do you go to that play classical music?  

This place pays a lot of attention to detail and it shows.  The store is very clean, bright, well laid out, and bears a friendly staff that is eager to help.  The produce department is world-class, with fresh clean produce that doesn't disappoint.  

I think what I appreciate the most about this place is the huge deli and prepared foods section.  If you're in need of a ready made meal or something hot and tasty, this is the place to get it.  

One downside is the selection.  The store and aisles are too small to accommodate a large selection, so don't expect to find 13 different brands of canned diced tomatoes.  But they do have a generic brand for most items.  

The prices are a bit high, but not unreasonable.  In this case, you're paying more for the shopping experience and the quality of products.  

Also, parents, they have nice carts with attached cars.  Plus a tiny cart with a flag on it that says "Customer in training."  When you're shopping with a two year old, that is HUGE.

Bottom line, I like this place a lot.  I just wish their prices were a bit lower.  But I'm willing to pay the premium for the better experience than other stores in town.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the review highlights various positive aspects of the grocery store, such as its attention to detail, cleanliness, friendly staff, high-quality produce, and extensive deli and prepared foods section. The reviewer appreciates the shopping experience and the quality of products offered, even though the prices are mentioned to be a bit high. Overall, the reviewer expresses a liking for the store and is willing to pay a premium for the better experience it provides compared to other stores in town.

question: Looks nice but you will pay for it. Way to expensive for what you get. No worries many options to choose from near by. They scream about being local but they really dont partner with local businesses. Save a bunch by just crossing the parking lot or even the street. Just look both ways first.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is negative because the reviewer expresses dissatisfaction with the high price of the product or service relative to its value. They also criticize the lack of partnership with local businesses, which goes against the establishment's claim of being local. Furthermore, the reviewer suggests that there are more affordable options nearby, indicating that they feel the high cost is unjustified. The overall tone of the review is dismissive and implies a lack of willingness to recommend the establishment to others.

question:
This is my go-to grocery store.  

Yes, it might be a little higher priced than other grocery store options in Madison, but the customer service, quality, and variety of food is worth it.  They have a good selection of local foods in pretty much every section of the store and they are easy to spot because they are market with the distance the food traveled to get there! 

Their deli, cheese, meat and seafood counters really don't compare to anywhere else that I go.  The selection is large, the staff is knowledgeable, and the food is delicious. The cheese section in particular blows me away with the variety every time. 

Aside from the some higher prices the only thing that I really can say bad about this place is that the parking lot is a mess if you come when it is busy - but that might have to do more with the mall and Target than the actual grocery store.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is positive because the reviewer consistently praises the grocery store for its customer service, quality, and variety of food. They highlight the good selection of local foods, the knowledgeable staff at the deli, cheese, meat, and seafood counters, and the delicious food offered. Despite mentioning that the prices are a bit higher and the parking lot can be busy, the reviewer ultimately expresses that the experience at the grocery store is worth it, which indicates overall satisfaction and positivity.

question:
Glam. Glam. Cool.

I spend a lot of time in Hilldale teaching ballet to tiny humans, so I decided to do my weekly shopping at Metcalfe's for the convenience. 

Many things to note here, so I'll point out the items that stood out like an MBA player in Japan.

1) The carts glide smoothly.  Yes, I know this sounds dumb, but for someone who dances all the time and am 99% of my life physically tired, I HATE.  I repeat, HATE when I have to scoot a cart around that won't turn.  This was like gliding on velvet and I wanted to faint.  It's the little things in life people.

2) Artisan bread.  Don't go searching for the cheap bread.  Pick up a nice loaf of crusty, fire baked carb-luvin heaven and giggle as you walk away.  

3) Local and organic.  Speaks for itself.

4) Classical music.  For once in my entire life I was not stressed out shopping.  Waaaaaah?  My blood pressure was normal.  I did not want to punch anyone.  It was enjoyable.

5) Parcel pick up service.  Drive your car around and they'll load ya up. 1st class style.

6) Dollar bills dollar bills.  Coupon, save, and pinch your pennies, because the 1% style of shopping will cost you a few more bucks than your average shopping experience.

Let me tell you though, I'll be going back.  Oh yes indeed.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is positive because the reviewer highlights several positive aspects of their shopping experience at Metcalfe's. They appreciate the convenience of shopping at the store while teaching ballet nearby, the smooth gliding carts, the quality of the artisan bread, the availability of local and organic products, the calming classical music ambiance, and the efficient parcel pick-up service. Despite the slightly higher prices, the reviewer expresses a desire to return to the store, indicating an overall satisfaction and intention to continue shopping there.

question:
Metcalfe's, what is this? I am new to Madison and everyone can't stop talking about what an experience it is to shop here. It's the fine-dining of grocery shopping. Well, I have only been shopping like a grown up for about a year now - but I learned how to do it in Denver. So the bar was set pretty high through Whole Foods and Safeway. But I can safely say that my experience at Metcalfe's topped it.

It was very clean and well stocked. I believe I went on a Friday night too. The main goal was to get some fresh meat and milk; let's face it - those are two items you don't want to get from an Aldi's or a Woodman's. I was told by a friend that I was lucky to live so close to it, but to be careful because it was expensive. WRONG, not expensive (or maybe Denver was expensive, so that word has become relative).

Safeway had a discount meat section because it was within a few days of expiring (cook it that night and you're fine). Now, I wasn't looking for that at Metcalfe's (I don't know if they'd have that even), but I found $2 Pork Butt Steak (which, the mere name of the steak made me question it - but for $2 I'll try anything once). Delicious, and I won't go as far as to say I'm a great cook.

Of course I also got some stuffed pork chops and fresh produce. But the experience I had was very pleasant and the prices were fair for the quality of food I was buying (dare I say, I thought prices should be higher).

As for the atmosphere, I don't think I've gone to a store in a long time that played classical music. I almost feel like if I came in sweatpants and a t-shirt that I would be under-dressed to get groceries.

Whole Foods ain't got nothing on Metcalfe's (leave my double negative alone).
rationale: The sentiment is Positive because the review highlights several aspects of the shopping experience at Metcalfe's that were very pleasing to the reviewer. They mention the cleanliness, well-stocked selection, reasonable prices, and quality of the food purchased. The reviewer also appreciates the atmosphere of the store, noting the pleasant classical music playing and the general upscale feel of the establishment. Overall, the reviewer's experience at Metcalfe's exceeded their expectations and left them feeling satisfied and impressed, leading to a positive sentiment in the review.

question: I think this is one of the best grocery stores in Madison but you have to watch your wallet at the check out.  I was there today and bought organic lemons for .99 cents.  A lot for one lemon, right?  When I was at check out, they range them up as $1.99/lemon.  Over 100% more and I had to wait 10 minutes for the manager to credit back my $2.00.  I just wonder how often this happens.  Plus, I think their organic produce is more expensive than whole foods.  If you have time, shop at Metcalf's for supplies but buy your produce at whole foods or the market.  And be sure to check the prices at the register!!
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer had a frustrating experience at the grocery store related to a pricing discrepancy with organic lemons, which resulted in having to wait for a manager to correct the error. Additionally, the reviewer perceives the store's organic produce to be more expensive compared to other options like Whole Foods. These issues impacted the reviewer's overall satisfaction with the store and led them to suggest shopping for supplies elsewhere.

question: Today's review is for the floral shop at Metcalfe's - I worked with Sally Rossmiller for flowers for my wedding, and she absolutely outdid herself with the arrangements she created!  I had a very specific look I wanted, and she was able to take the cute Pinterest photos I provided as inspiration and create truly spectacular arrangements using the elements I loved.  She worked hard to figure out which local flowers would be available at the time, and as a result we only had to have a few things that were sourced regionally instead of locally - very cool!! \n\nThe flowers were all beautifully packaged and well labeled, as well, which made it easy for the folks setting up the morning of. Sally also had some great ideas that contributed to our day, as I probably wouldn't have gone hunting for vintage lace for my bouquet handle without prompting.  It made a lovely addition.  I can't recommend her work more highly, and I am so happy with the addition they made to our special day.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer had an excellent experience working with Sally Rossmiller at the floral shop. They were highly impressed with the arrangements created for their wedding, noting that Sally went above and beyond to understand their specific vision and preferences. The reviewer appreciated Sally's attention to detail, creativity in using local flowers, and valuable suggestions that enhanced their special day. Overall, the review showcases satisfaction and gratitude towards Sally's work, making it a positive sentiment.

question:
Metcalfe's is what all supermarkets should aspire to be.  I have never been to a supermarket that has its combination of size, local products and management.  It carries everything from value (Sentry Brands) to premium version of products.  

They also GIVE out free Sunday papers.  There is no low end of purchase to get this offer - I bought a pack of gum for under a dollar and they asked if I wanted a newspaper.  Righteous!

Every department runs extremely well.  I've never had a problem with rotten or outdated goods while shopping.  The staff are plentiful and friendly. Even at the busiest times, they staff cashiers smartly and the lines are rarely longer than three deep. 

During the late afternoon and early evening, you are bound to run into a vendor providing samples of their local product.  Unlike every other store I went to, it's often an owner or manager that handles the stand.  Frequently they even have WINE!  Delicious wine at that. 

Local foods and brands are center stage here.  They are clearly identified as local on their display.  You'll see local everywhere from the bakery, frozen foods and cheeses (of course).

The only critique is that the deli prepared foods and the bakery are good, but not great.  If I have a little more disposable income, I go down the road to Whole Foods to get my prepared deli/bakery fix.  With that written, I am very picky and their deli is much superior to Copps (read my review of the very sad S. Park Copps -- I really deserve Metcalfe's!) or other like grocers. 

Although Whole Foods has a short list of better prepared products (for example, their deli and bakery), they cost so much more (it's referred to as "Whole Paycheck" for a reason) and have nowhere near the variety and local selection Metcalfe's has.


Tips:  

1 - Be careful in the parking lot.  Their are many patrons that have lost their driving skill (think that South Park episode) and it may be frightening at times.  Drive very defensively and always given certain drivers the right of way.

2 - Like their Facebook page for insight on demos and events.  For example, last month they had a three-day cheese tasting event hosted by cheesemakers in town for the American Cheese Society Conference. 

3 - If you must use plastic bags, Metcalfe's has the best in the business - they are an awesome green (some sort of implied "gentle" dig, I know ... but whatever) and very sturdy.  I use those for my small wastepaper baskets - they look and hold up better than anything I paid Hefty for...
rationale: The sentiment in the review is positive because the reviewer highlights numerous aspects of Metcalfe's that they appreciate, such as the variety of products, the cleanliness and efficiency of the store, the friendly staff, the promotion of local products, and the enjoyable sampling experiences. Even though the reviewer mentions a minor critique about the deli and bakery, it is clear that overall they have a high regard for Metcalfe's compared to other supermarkets they have visited. They also provide helpful tips for others to enhance their shopping experience at the store.

question:
I'm on a Madison grocery store reviewing rage! 

Metcalfe's is pretty much Wisconsin's own version of Whole Foods. It has the same brightly lit displays and wide open layout. I think the prices are comparable as well.

Metcalfe's carries all the local goodies (Potter's crackers, Mad Urban Bees honey, etc.) that Copps and Woodmans don't carry. Some items are a little more expensive than other places, but considering the convenience, I don't mind paying a couple cents extra to pick something up at Metcalfe's. 

I was looking to pick up some side dishes for a picnic, and decided to stop by the deli to peruse their prepared dishes. I ended up going with the signature potato salad, which a hit at the picnic! I'd say that Metcalfe's would be the place to stop after work to pick up groceries if you are too lazy or too tired to cook for the night because you could always make a pit-stop by the deli/hot foods/salad bar before exiting!
rationale: The sentiment in the review is positive because the reviewer highlights several aspects of their experience at Metcalfe's grocery store that they enjoyed. They mention the store's similarities to Whole Foods, the availability of local products not found at other stores, the convenience of the deli and prepared dishes, and the success of the potato salad they purchased. The reviewer expresses willingness to pay slightly higher prices for the convenience and quality offered by Metcalfe's, indicating overall satisfaction with their shopping experience.

question:
The newly remodeled Metcalfe's are a real treat to visit. I love their focus on sourcing from vendors as local as possible. When I want to purchase local meats, cheeses and other specialty products, I visit Metcalfe's first.

Their deli, salad bar, soups and other pre-made items are delicious. The selection is so vast, it's overwhelming at times! 

I always find very friendly and helpful employees in the aisles. 

It's also handy to run in to the store whilst shopping at Hilldale.
rationale: The sentiment in the review is positive because the reviewer expresses enjoyment in visiting the newly remodeled Metcalfe's. They particularly appreciate the focus on sourcing local products, as well as the delicious offerings from the deli, salad bar, and other sections of the store. The reviewer also praises the vast selection of items available and notes the helpful and friendly employees. Overall, the reviewer's comments convey a strong sense of satisfaction with their experiences at Metcalfe's, highlighting the store's quality products and customer service.

question: This grocery store is constantly out of stock of wayyyyy too many items. At least half the time I go there, several of the items I am looking for are out of stock. Not only that, but the store is over-priced and not well laid out. Additionally, other patrons in the store seem to think they own the isles and aren't considerate of their fellow shoppers. The ONLY reason I stop back in from time to time is the convenient location, right next to Target, and close (relatively) to downtown.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the review highlights several significant issues with the grocery store. The constant out-of-stock items, overpricing, poor layout, and inconsiderate behavior of other shoppers create a frustrating and unpleasant shopping experience for the reviewer. The only positive aspect mentioned is the convenience of the location, but it is not enough to offset the numerous negative aspects described in the review.

question: This place is pretty gross.  It's dirty.  The gas station it's attached to need a massive overhaul.  The employees are sketchy-looking at best.  Have some standards, Arby's.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the review highlights multiple issues with the cleanliness of the place, the condition of the attached gas station, and the appearance of the employees. These factors contribute to an overall negative impression of the establishment and suggest a lack of standards in maintaining a welcoming and hygienic environment for customers.

question: last time I went here the bartender was more worried about giving his friends shots, eating his food and drinking coffee than to take my order.  when he finally realized me standing there with my money in my hand five minutes later he acted as if i inconvienced him.  Gave him a two dollar tip on a drink, went back up to bar the second time he didn't notice me again, and i got his attention by saying \"hey man i just need an empty glass\" then he walk past me and the empty glasses across from me takes a dudes order who just walked up and grabs a glass after helping him so he oviously heard me.
rationale: The sentiment is Negative because the reviewer had a frustrating experience at the bar due to the bartender's lack of attention, prioritizing his friends over customers, and showing indifference towards serving them. The reviewer felt ignored, inconvenienced, and unappreciated, leading to disappointment and dissatisfaction with the service received.
