rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer had a poor experience at Red Robin due to the long wait time for service despite the lack of customers, unattended by multiple servers who were chatting instead of assisting, and feeling ignored to the point of considering themselves invisible. This resulted in frustration and ultimately the decision not to return to the restaurant.

question: Flowers are overpriced and usually dead within a day.  Talk about a ripoff.  I realized that I need to go to Metcalf's for decent flowers in Madison.
rationale: The sentiment is Negative because the user expresses dissatisfaction with the quality and value of the flowers purchased, describing them as overpriced and short-lived, which led to feeling ripped off. Additionally, the user highlights the realization that better quality flowers can be found elsewhere, indicating disappointment with their initial purchase experience.

question: Called direct to the flower shop after picking an arrangement that was listed on their website. Person was very professional who took my order. They were able to deliver the same day too! My Mother-in-law was very happy - she sent a picture of what we order- flowers looked fresh, with a nice assortment of flowers. Highly recommend this florist. (Order was placed from Delaware).
rationale: The sentiment is Positive because the customer had a smooth and professional experience when ordering from the flower shop. The fact that the florist was able to deliver the arrangement the same day and that the recipient, the customer's Mother-in-law, was very happy with the fresh and nicely assorted flowers all contribute to a positive review. The customer also highly recommends the florist, indicating satisfaction with the overall service provided.

question: Not impressed, ordered flowers for a friends bday and they were not available at university ave location, so had to pick them up in monona, which is fine, I wanted a specific flower, so when I got to the monona store, the flowers which had already been paid for were very different (much much smaller bouquet) than what I was told I'd be getting, after questioning the cashier, i was told that was what you get for the price I'd paid, poor customer service, the cashier knew I wasn't happy but didn't seem to care.
rationale: The sentiment is Negative because the customer expressed disappointment with their experience. They were not satisfied with the customer service, as they did not receive the specific flowers they wanted and were promised. Additionally, the customer felt that the size of the bouquet they received was much smaller than expected for the price paid. The lack of understanding and empathy from the cashier further contributed to the negative sentiment in the review.

question: Horrible service, old flowers.  Tons of swearing and screaming coming from the back room, very unprofessional.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the review highlights multiple issues with the service provided. The description of old flowers suggests a lack of quality and attention to detail. Additionally, the presence of swearing and screaming in the back room indicates a lack of professionalism and creates a negative and uncomfortable atmosphere for customers.

question:
Perhaps good product, but really poor service. My wife and I stopped here to purchase a bike rack for our Rav4. We noticed a Rav4 in the parking lot with a bike rack and asked the salesperson (Jim) if he could help us determine if it met some of our criteria (does not cause bike damage to mounted back tire; allows back door to swing open for rear access). Jim was telling us some things that contradicted information I had found online; so we asked if he could help us track down the owner. This was over the top for Jim and he made derogatory comments as he strutted away to hide in the back of the store.  My wife and I tracked down the Rav4 owner on our own and he was more than happy to share his experience and contradict Jim's "guesses" that were portrayed as fact.

I had never been in a situation where a sales person abandoned me in a store before; so I contacted the owner (Darren). He apologized and indicated that we would receive a 20% discount on another bike rack that he had in stock and that I believed would meet our needs. I indicated I would think about the purchase offer, but really wanted an apology from the sales person. I was told the offer stood for as long as they had my desired bike rack in stock and that I would receive an apology from Jim. I decided to purchase a rack and followed up twice to make arrangements. Once I was ignored; the other time I was told they'd have to check inventory. I was never able to make arrangements to conclude the sale and never received an apology from the sales person. 

If you place importance on follow-through and commitment to customer satisfaction, I would suggest you consider other stores in the Madison area. I frequent several other stores that have excellent follow-through and place greater emphasis on customer satisfaction.
rationale: The sentiment of this review is negative because the customer experienced poor service, feeling abandoned by the salesperson and not receiving the desired level of assistance and attention. Additionally, there was a lack of follow-through on promises made by the store owner, leading to frustration and disappointment on the part of the customer. These factors contribute to a negative overall experience for the customer.

question: Amazing selection of product, and very knowledgable staff. Location is great because you can paddle right from the back door.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer praised the selection of products and the knowledge of the staff, indicating a high level of satisfaction with the shopping experience. Additionally, the convenient location that allows for easy access to paddling adds to the positive review. Overall, the reviewer's comments suggest they had a pleasant and enjoyable experience at the store.

question: Phenomenal locally owned store for outdoor enthusiasts. I like to buy local whenever I can and this store reminds me a lot of REI but with the added bonus of being locally owned. I've always received outstanding customer service and found the staff to go out of their way to find a solution for me. I just finished my holiday shopping here because they have a ton of little things that make great stocking stuffers for anyone like balms, solar lights for camping, doggy gear, kid stuff, etc. \n\nI often like to gauge a business by the happiness of its employees and when I talk with them about working at Rutabaga, they never hesitate to sing the praises of this very cool store. Looking forward to my next visit!
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer highlights several commendable aspects of the store, such as being locally owned, providing outstanding customer service, offering a variety of products suitable for gifting, and having happy employees who speak highly of their workplace. The reviewer expresses enthusiasm for returning to the store in the future, indicating an overall positive experience and satisfaction with their interactions and purchases at Rutabaga.

question:
I was in town for business and got back to my hotel around 7PM (dinner time). Having work to do for my client, I decided that I would order food to be delivered to my room and chinese food sounded great! 

I ordered General Tso's Chicken, a small Pork Lo Mein, and the fried dumplings. I thought I was in for a treat as I don't often get the chance to have chinese food. Little did I know, that the food about to be delivered from Taste of China @ 5415B Monona Dr, Monona, WI was horrible.

The chicken smelled a little different, but when i tasted it I could tell that it had been left out on the counter for hours instead of being in a cooler prior to preparation. The pork lo mein was OK, so I ate some of it and the dumplings were edible.

The next day, I was sick all day. I called the resteraunt and complained when I got back to the hotel and they offered to replace my order. No way was I going to go for round two of the food poisoning game. Instead I told them that I would be posting this review and reporting them to the health department. DO NOT EAT THERE!! YOU WILL BE VERY SORRY THAT YOU DID!!
rationale: The sentiment in this review is negative because the customer had a poor experience with the food they ordered from Taste of China. The customer describes the General Tso's Chicken as having a strange smell and tasting like it had been left out for hours, indicating poor hygiene and food safety practices at the restaurant. Additionally, the customer felt sick the following day, further confirming the low quality of the food. The overall tone of the review is one of disappointment and warning others to avoid eating at this establishment.

question:
You need a good Chinese delivery wherever you go. This has become ours, in Madison. 

We tried 3 or 4 others - including Rubys - and none of them could pass our litmus: it must be able to produce a decent General Tso's Chicken that isn't too sweet or gooey with a modicum of heat, the egg rolls must be fried in clean oil and we should never see canned vegetables. 

So far, they have satisfied. The General Tso's is by far better than anything we have come across in Madison - and no, the chicken has not been spoiled for us. The battered coating before fry is not too heavy and the sauce has a little bit of heat. Personally I would like more chilis, but I realize that is an acquired taste. 

Mu Shui style pork with plum sauce and pancakes has been fine, not dry and overcooked, and no sight of canned vegetables. Cold sesame noodles were the lightly dressed vinegar kind, not the peanut butter sauce kind. But they were fresh, not gloopy. Looking forward to trying other dishes on the menu but so far, it's been good. This has made us very happy, since we have always enjoyed Asian cuisines wherever we have lived (San Francisco, New York) and Madison seemed to have been devoid of decent Cantonese/Hunan/Szechuan style Chinese food. 

Sure, it isn't Wu Leng Yi but it is quite adequate for those long work days when you get home and just don't want to cook. Delivery is always within 20 minutes even though they say 40.
rationale: The sentiment for this review is positive because the reviewer highlights several aspects they enjoy about the Chinese delivery service in Madison. They appreciate the quality of the food, specifically mentioning the General Tso's Chicken, Mu Shui style pork, and cold sesame noodles. The reviewer is pleased with the flavors, the absence of canned vegetables, and the freshness of the dishes. Additionally, they express satisfaction with the delivery service being prompt, making it a convenient option for busy days. Overall, the reviewer feels that this Chinese delivery service has met their expectations and has filled a previously missing need for good Chinese cuisine in Madison, which is why the sentiment is positive.

question: Taste China (as their sign says) is our stand-by for Chinese. Programmed into our cell phone and it is ready by the time we drive by on our way home.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the review mentions that "Taste China" is the reviewer's go-to place for Chinese food, implying that they have consistently enjoyed their meals there. Additionally, the convenience of having the order ready quickly when passing by on the way home suggests a positive customer experience and satisfaction with the service provided by the restaurant.

question: Do you like greasy overcooked American chinese? If not try some place else! They cater to those with no appreciation for anything close to decent chinese take out.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the review criticizes the quality of the food at the restaurant, describing it as "greasy" and "overcooked." The reviewer also suggests that the restaurant caters to those with low standards for Chinese takeout, indicating a lack of appreciation for the food being served. Overall, the review conveys a dissatisfaction with the dining experience at the restaurant, hence the negative sentiment.

question: Cheap, tasty noodle concoctions are served up in decent-sized portions in this apparently national chain.  With most everything available vegetarian, the low prices and friendly service at this little strip-mall establishment made my lunch memorable.  When will Noodles & Company come to California, where I live?
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the review highlights the positive aspects of the restaurant experience. The reviewer mentions cheap, tasty noodle dishes served in decent portions, emphasizing the affordability and good portion sizes. Additionally, the availability of vegetarian options, friendly service, and the memorable lunch experience all contribute to a positive overall sentiment. The reviewer's only downside is a desire for the restaurant chain to expand to California, showing enthusiasm and anticipation rather than dissatisfaction.

question:
Just mediocre. Essentially it's a pasta version of Panera. Which means strip mall dining with premeasured components. 

Pad Thai style noodles with tofu lacked flavor - the pre-measured sauce was already weak to begin with. Vegetables and tofu were fresh, though. 

A bowl of "spicey" penne pasta in an also bland tomato sauce with cheese and herbs needed seasoning. 

There are better and cheaper choices for all the regional elements just down the street, so may as well try those out instead.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the review highlights various shortcomings of the restaurant, such as bland and uninspiring flavors in the dishes, lack of seasoning, and the suggestion that better and cheaper options are available nearby. The lack of flavor and seasoning in the food seems to have led to disappointment and a general feeling of mediocrity in the dining experience. The overall impression conveyed is that the restaurant falls short in providing a satisfying culinary experience, contributing to the negative sentiment expressed in the review.

question:
Gross.  Went to Noodles for lunch on a Saturday, place was not busy.

Bathroom was disgusting.  Dirty floor and wet.  No paper towels.  Smelled.

Plates and bowls (all of them) were chipped.  Not sanitary.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the review describes a disappointing experience at Noodles. The dirty and unsanitary conditions of the bathroom, including a lack of paper towels and an unpleasant smell, indicate poor hygiene practices. Additionally, the presence of chipped plates and bowls suggests a lack of attention to quality control and cleanliness standards, further contributing to the negative perception of the establishment.

question:
The service was spot on. I was taking my food to go and they got my order right along with a place setting. So no eating with my fingers this time; which is a nice change.

I use to always get the mac and cheese with extra cheese an extra meat. It was my one guilty....really guilty pleasure in my stop over here. For some reason it just was not hitting the spot with me. It use to hae this really creamy cheese sauce that went with it and of course topped with shredded cheese. 

I got back to my hotel, putting the bag of yum on the floor board with the heat blasted to make sure my yum stayed warm and gooey....but then...I get back to my room open up the lit to start the hunt for my goo...where was it!!!!! Frankly it was nowhere to be found. That is right, it is as if they boiled some elbow macaroni slapped it in a bowl, threw some meat and cheese on the top and called it a day.

So disappointing that I skipped my mac an cheese and moved on to the rice krispy hunk that I got; which was hard as a rock. Very disappointing. The good news is it kept me from wracking up an insane amount of calories because frankly it just was not worth it.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the customer expressed disappointment and dissatisfaction with their experience. They specifically mentioned that their favorite dish, the mac and cheese, did not meet their expectations as it lacked the creamy cheese sauce they remembered and was not as flavorful as before. Additionally, the customer was further let down by the rice krispy treat being hard and inedible. Overall, the lack of quality in the food items led to a negative experience for the customer.

question: I won't be returning. Today, I picked up an order for my friend and I. They read back the order and it was exactly what it should be, but when I got to work, they had not put a rice krispie bar in even though they charged us for it. Additionally, my Japanese Pan noodle bowl left much to be desired. The carrots were uncooked (even though they were supposed to be) and \"topped with cilantro\" means one slimy spring of cilantro with 2 leaves on it. My friend's pasta was burnt. Burnt! While I like Noodles & Company in general, this location is lacking.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the customer experienced multiple issues with their order at the restaurant. They did not receive an item they were charged for, the noodle bowl had uncooked carrots and minimal cilantro, and their friend's pasta was burnt. These issues indicate a lack of quality control, which left the customer feeling disappointed with their overall experience.

question: I always use the on-line ordering. Simple and easy. Cuts down on wait time. I dig their thai curry soup. Nice and zesty.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the user expresses satisfaction with the online ordering process, finding it simple and easy which reduces wait times. They also specifically mention enjoying the Thai curry soup, describing it as nice and zesty, showing an overall appreciation for the food at the restaurant.

question: Amazing restaurant. In expensive. Great location. And a nice place for a family to come and eat lunch. It is similar to a fast food place with a combination of a restaurant. Th food tastes great and the service is descent. I would recommend this restaurant to anyone whose in a hurry.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the review highlights positive aspects of the restaurant, such as being amazing, having a great location, being a nice place for families, serving great-tasting food, and providing decent service. Additionally, the reviewer mentions that they would recommend the restaurant to others who are in a hurry, indicating overall satisfaction with their experience.

question: Would be so much better if they did not cook the cheap pasta into mush. I want to like it,  tried to get them to cook Al dante, but they refused. That makes them a Fast food outlet, no more. Better option would be Sala Thai.
rationale: The sentiment is Negative because the customer expressed dissatisfaction with the quality of the pasta dish, specifically criticizing the overcooked and mushy texture of the cheap pasta. They also mentioned that despite requesting the pasta to be cooked al dente, the restaurant refused. This negative experience influenced the customer's decision to no longer consider the outlet as a preferred dining option. Furthermore, the recommendation of a better alternative, Sala Thai, implies that the customer sees the quality of food and service at this new restaurant as superior to their current experience.

question: Wouldn't do an oil change when I came in at 5:10, the guy at the desk said they didn't have time to do it, but they only had one car in the bay. What's the point in advertising a cheap special on oil changes if you won't do it because you close only an hour after people get off work.
rationale: The sentiment is Negative because the customer experienced frustration and disappointment due to the inconsistency between the advertised cheap special on oil changes and the refusal to do an oil change despite seemingly having capacity. The customer also expressed dissatisfaction with the limited service hours that don't align well with typical working hours.

question: Extremely over-priced!  I was quoted over $600 for a particular repair.  I took the vehicle down the road to Farm-n-Fleet and got the same repair done for $315.
rationale: The sentiment in this review is negative because the customer expressed dissatisfaction with the high price they were quoted for a repair compared to a lower price at another location. The customer's belief that the initial quote was extremely overpriced indicates perceived unfairness or lack of value in the service provided.

question: I know people are crazy for Culver's. It's an ok place for a custard, but I don't get the butter burger thing. Every meal I've eaten there just hasn't set well on my stomach--especially the \"walleye\" sandwich. I even tried a salad in an attempt to find something healthy. The lettuce was wilted and what chicken they had on top was uninspired and as dry as a shoe.   I'll keep trying, though. I haven't had any of their soups, and if these are good I'm willing to rethink this review a bit. \n\nI will say they are very awesome with kids and generous with the free little dishes of custard for them.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer mentions multiple disappointing experiences with the food at Culver's, including the butter burger, walleye sandwich, and salad. They describe the food as not sitting well in their stomach, wilted lettuce, and dry chicken. Despite these negative experiences, they are open to trying other menu items like the soups. Overall, the review expresses a lack of satisfaction with the quality of the food at Culver's, indicating a negative sentiment.

question: Every Wisconsin fatty loves a good butterburger, we all know that, but what sets this Culvers apart from the others is the fact that its hands down the best one in Madison, and maybe even Wisconsin. The food is always hot,fresh,well prepared,and served quickly and politely. The other thing is its cleanliness. Its restrooms are always very clean and smell good, and the tables are quickly bussed and wiped down to make room for the next customer. The floors are kept immaculate, and you will never see a mess on the floor or at the condiment station. I think this is because the owner takes great pride in his resteraunt, and is always there. I know this because I live close and eat here 3 times a week, and he's always there. Most of the staff has worked there for a long time as well, and are good at their job. This place is the blueprint of what a Culvers should be,and a shining star among the companys resteraunts.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the review highlights numerous positive aspects of the Culvers restaurant in Madison. The reviewer praises the food quality, speed of service, cleanliness of the establishment, and the dedication of the owner and staff. The consistent positive experiences described in the review contribute to an overall positive sentiment towards the restaurant, making it a shining star among Culvers locations.

question:
It's Culvers, what else can I say. 
I love the place. Best fast food for the price.

This particular Culver's is getting a review because of how great it is. There is something about this location that stands above the rest and I can not put my finger on it. better tasting food, better frozen yogurt, better specials every day...I just don't know. It is just great.

I have to also add in that this location is always busy. Always busy! Cars coming onto the road busy, so this must mean I'm not the only person that thinks this Culver's location is extremely awesome.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is Positive because the reviewer expresses their love for the Culver's restaurant, emphasizing that it offers the best fast food for the price. They highlight the exceptional quality of the food, frozen yogurt, and daily specials at this particular location, indicating that there is something special about it that sets it apart from others. Furthermore, the reviewer mentions the high level of popularity and busyness of the restaurant, suggesting that many other customers also share a positive opinion about the location. Overall, the reviewer's enthusiastic and appreciative tone conveys a highly favorable sentiment towards this Culver's restaurant.

question: Love me some Culver's!  The burgers rock, the cheese turds & onion rings are fab, and the fish fry is REALLY good!  And, let's not even talk about the malts!  OMG, sooooo gooooood!
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer expresses enthusiasm and enjoyment for multiple items on the menu at Culver's. They use positive adjectives such as "rock," "fab," and "REALLY good" to describe the food items, and show excitement with phrases like "OMG" and "sooooo gooooood." The overall tone is one of satisfaction and delight, highlighting a strong preference for the dining experience at Culver's.

question: This review is SOLELY for the butter pecan. This flavor is pretty close to the traditional butter pecan. \n\nMy only request is that it was a richer butter flavor. The creaminess just wasn't there. However, a good second place.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer compliments the butter pecan flavor for being close to the traditional version. Even though they suggest a richer butter flavor, they still consider it a good option and rank it as a close second choice. The overall tone of the review is constructive and appreciative, highlighting the positive aspects of the product.

question: This review is for Just Drummy.\n\nBoring.  I do not feel like I had many piece of the \"drummy.\"  It was vanilla ice cream with a couple of pieces of waffle cone.  I should have just gotten vanilla and skipped the frustration.
rationale: The sentiment is Negative because the reviewer found the dish to be boring, lacking in "drummy" pieces, and ultimately not fulfilling their expectations. They felt disappointed by the experience and regretted choosing the dish, indicating an overall negative sentiment towards Just Drummy.

question: This review is for Blueberry Cheesecake.\n\nNo. Just say no. The blueberries are REALLY hard and frozen. They are like little flavored icicles.The ice cream part was delicious. It really had a rich cheesecake flavor. I would love to have regular cheesecake custard. It was hard to enjoy because the blueberries were SO hard.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer expresses disappointment with the product, specifically citing the hard and frozen blueberries that made it difficult to enjoy the overall experience of the Blueberry Cheesecake dessert. Despite liking the ice cream part for its rich cheesecake flavor, the negative impact of the hard blueberries overshadowed the positive aspects, leading to an overall negative sentiment.

question: This review is solely for Boston Cream.\n\nThis is my favorite flavor at other establishments. I really like the donut, the pie, just everything. However, this flavor? Total let down. It was too sweet and did not have a good cream flavor. Making cream flavored ice cream and adding chocolate does not make it Boston Cream. The effort was there but the execution was sad.
rationale: The sentiment in this review is negative because the customer expresses disappointment with the Boston Cream flavor they tried. They found it too sweet, lacking in a good cream flavor, and felt that it did not accurately capture the essence of a classic Boston Cream dessert. The customer's expectations were not met, leading to a sense of letdown and sadness about the overall experience with this particular flavor.

question: This place is great! Lots of great stuff, and priced to move. And I mean really, REALLY priced to move. My husband could have spent days in there looking around (his words), and it's great to have a place like this in the community where you can not only drop off leftover supplies and hardware (or countertops, cabinets, doors, windows, sinks, you name it!) that's still useable so that it doesn't go to the landfill, and also for picking up odds and ends for a building or remodeling project. I have a very strong inclination to say that we'll be back!
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer describes the place as great, with lots of great stuff available at very reasonable prices. They appreciate the variety of items and the recycling aspect of being able to drop off usable supplies. The reviewer's husband even expresses a strong desire to spend more time exploring the store. Overall, the reviewer is enthusiastic about the positive experience and expresses a willingness to return, indicating a positive sentiment.

question:
This place totally rocks. It's like a Menards thrift store. You can get a huge mirror for $10. The selection changes constantly, so if you want to find a treasure, you might need to hunt patiently. There's no website for inventory because things turn around so fast it would just be a waste of the volunteers time. Speaking of which, they are some of the most cheerful people I've ever seen working retail.

I bought a pedestal sink from them with a faucet attached for $30, and I've repainted our bathroom with "oops" paint that cost me about $5. We bought tile for the backsplash in our kitchen for $20.

Oh yeah, it also feels pretty awesome to not have this stuff end up in a landfill, since there's little wrong with it, other than someone didn't want it anymore. Everyone should check this place out, homeowners, apartment dwellers, artists, woodworkers, interior designers, everyone.
rationale: The review expresses positive sentiment because the customer highlights the affordability, unique finds, and ever-changing inventory of the thrift store. They appreciate the value they received, such as a $10 mirror, a $30 pedestal sink with a faucet, and materials for home improvement projects at low costs. The reviewer also praises the positive attitude of the volunteers, emphasizing the welcoming and cheerful atmosphere of the store. Additionally, the mention of sustainability and the avoidance of items going to the landfill adds to the positive sentiment. Overall, the review recommends the store to various types of customers, further indicating a positive experience.

question:
OK place and i will probably try them again, however, the down side is that their prices are somewhat high and some cases comparable to new stuff on sale at Menards or Home Depot.
If you intend to pay more for a good cause, then it is OK, however, if you are looking for a good price on used and reused items, that is tougher to find at the Madison restore.
I miss the st vincent depaul dig and save, they used to have building materials for good prices and i used to donate to them but they stopped selling building materials.

The Madison restire also does not carry the same variety as other restore stores, they will actually refuse certain types of items ...
again, i will probably stop and visit occasionally, but my expectations of a good deal are much lower.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer expressed disappointment with the prices being high and comparable to new items at other stores, as well as the lack of variety and refusal of certain items at the Madison restore. They also expressed longing for a previous experience at St. Vincent de Paul where they found better deals on building materials. Overall, the reviewer indicates lower expectations for good deals and a sense of dissatisfaction with their experience at the Madison restore.

question: Upswing in furniture recently which has made this my go-to before St. Vinny when it comes to looking for random pieces to add to my pad! The staff is lovely, quick to help me load things in my coche, and prices are unbeatable for pieces that are in really great shape. Nabbed a desk recently for $20 that's super solid and looks swell in my space. \n\nYou might have to bounce around to a few ReStores before you find what you're looking for, and you have to wade through all the tile, cabinets and random pieces of wood. But you're down to do some digging, stellar furniture finds await!
rationale: The sentiment of the review is positive because the reviewer highlights multiple positive aspects of their experience at the furniture store: the recent upswing in furniture selection, helpful and lovely staff, unbeatable prices for quality items, quick assistance with loading purchases, and finding a solid desk for a great price. The reviewer also mentions that despite the need to search through various items in the store, they still find it worth it for the fantastic furniture discoveries. Overall, the review reflects satisfaction and excitement about the store and its offerings, leading to a positive sentiment.

question: Capitol Plumbing has helped me out twice this month, once to install a water heater and then to come replace an outside spigot. Both repairmen who came out were friendly, professional, and thorough. I'm glad to recommend Capitol Plumbing!
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the user had a good experience with Capitol Plumbing twice in a month. They specifically mentioned that both repairmen were friendly, professional, and thorough, indicating high quality service. Additionally, the user expressed their satisfaction by stating that they are glad to recommend Capitol Plumbing to others.

question:
If you are looking for a great fishfry this is your place. My husband and I have been going to Toby's for 5 years. We have never had a bad meal. Everything is great. My husband loves the chicken and I haven't had better shrimp than the ones at Tobys and I grew up in Florida.
It's family owned and everyone in the family works there.
We are there at least twice a week.
There is quite a wait on Fridays but it is so worth it.
rationale: The review expresses a positive sentiment towards Toby's restaurant, highlighting the great quality of the food, especially the fish fry, chicken, and shrimp. The reviewer mentions that they have been going to Toby's for 5 years and have never had a bad meal. Additionally, the fact that the restaurant is family-owned and run adds to the positive sentiment, as well as the reviewer's commitment to dining there at least twice a week despite the wait on Fridays. Overall, the review reflects a happy and satisfied customer, resulting in a positive sentiment towards Toby's restaurant.

question: I loved the whole experience.  Old people like it here too.  Soup was bacon cheeseburger chowder.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the user expresses their love for the experience, indicating a high level of satisfaction. Additionally, they mention that old people like it there too, suggesting that the place is welcoming to a diverse range of customers. Lastly, they provide positive feedback about the soup, specifically mentioning that it was bacon cheeseburger chowder, which implies that they enjoyed the unique and tasty dish.

question: Toby's has one of the best fish fry's around which makes this place SUPER packed on Fridays.  Expect an hour wait as they do not take reservations. We have never had bad food here and we come here 2 - 3x/month. My husband loves the steaks. I usually order a variety of their seafood. We love the supper club effect with the veggies out first.  Salads are always fresh.  I recommend you try Toby's if you are not in a hurry.  They are just that good!  You will not be disappointed. Relax with one of their signature key lime martinis...better yet, make it two!!!
rationale: The review is positive because the reviewer praises the quality of the food, saying they have never had a bad meal at Toby's and enjoy a variety of dishes such as seafood and steaks. They appreciate the traditional supper club experience with fresh salads and veggies served first. Despite the potential long wait on Fridays, the reviewer recommends Toby's for its delicious food and relaxed atmosphere, suggesting readers try the restaurant and enjoy its signature key lime martinis. Overall, the reviewer's positive experiences and repeated visits convey a sense of satisfaction and enjoyment, making the sentiment of the review positive.

question: Avoid this place.  Its super loud, and the weird seating gimmick is a nightmare.  Food was nothing better than average.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer highlights several negative aspects of the experience: the loud environment, uncomfortable seating gimmick, and the underwhelming quality of the food. These factors collectively contribute to a negative overall impression of the place.

question:
Arrive. 
Order* with a waitress. 
Drink while you wait for a table. 
Sit down an hour and a half later. 
Eat. 
Lots. 
Repeat next Friday. 

*two pieces of cod, fries and slaw
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the review highlights a consistent and enjoyable dining experience. Despite the wait for a table, the reviewer seems content with the process and ends the review by expressing a desire to repeat the experience the following Friday. This indicates satisfaction with the food, service, and overall atmosphere of the establishment.

question: Loved this place. Classic Wisconsin supper club with wood paneling. Order your drink, order with a waitress, drink some more, get seated an hour later and enjoy. Great fish fry! \nNot good for Kids who aren't patient but my 6 year old did great! We will be back
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer expressed enjoyment of the place, praising its classic atmosphere and great fish fry. Despite mentioning the long wait time and potential impatience of kids, the reviewer still plans to return, indicating an overall positive experience and satisfaction with the establishment.

question: Kicking it up a star because draaaanks are cheap, service it bomb and food is consistently tay-hay-sty.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is positive because the customer highlighted several aspects that they enjoyed about their experience at the reviewed establishment. They mentioned that the drinks were cheap, the service was great, and the food was consistently tasty. Overall, the customer had a positive experience and felt inclined to give a higher rating as a result.

question: We dropped by this place on a Fish Fry Friday which is a big night for Toby's. The place is so packed that they try to cut back on the time you take up at a table by having you order your food before being seated. You then stand around should to shoulder with other people who are waiting and you all have to work together to let the employees pass through. Our party was seated 20 minutes after ordering. \n\nMy bland plate of fish wasn't something I'll come back for. I'm just too use to food with seasoning on it.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer had a disappointing experience at the restaurant. They mentioned the crowded and rushed atmosphere, as well as the bland and unseasoned fish they received, which did not meet their expectations. These factors contributed to the overall negative impression of their visit.

question: I have no idea why this place is so popular. After three attempts, we finally rode out the wait for the fish fry. After all, can ALL those people be wrong? Well, yes they can. Let every other town in American, Madison has it's share of cheap b---ds that will endure any indignity to get a bargain. That seems to be the draw of this dumpy little joint.\n\nThe drinks aren't expensive, but that means you get what you pay for. The fish was rubbery, the service perfunctory, and the decor beyond kitschy -- just old and tired. The restaurant equivalent of flying coach.
rationale: The review expresses disappointment and dissatisfaction with the dining experience at the restaurant. The customer mentions that despite the popularity of the place, they found the food to be of poor quality, the service lackluster, and the overall atmosphere unappealing. The use of negative language like "rubbery fish," "perfunctory service," and comparing the restaurant to "flying coach" implies a sense of frustration and disappointment. Overall, the customer's review reflects a negative sentiment due to their unfavorable experience at the establishment.

question: Walked in on a busy fish fry night for the first time.  No hostess spot, so we wondered around until a waitress barked at us to go to one of the bartenders.  The bar was two people deep so that was nearly impossible.  Maybe the food here is that great but we left after feeling very unwelcome.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the customer felt unwelcome due to the lack of a hostess, being barked at by a waitress, and difficulty in navigating through the crowded bar. These experiences left a negative impression on the customer and influenced their decision to leave without trying the food.

question: Horrible service! Crappy food! We waited 45 min at our table before we even got any type of food.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer expressed dissatisfaction with both the service and the food quality. They mentioned having to wait for a substantial amount of time before receiving any food, indicating poor service. Additionally, they described the food as "crappy," suggesting that they were not pleased with the taste or overall experience.

question: Will NEVER take our dog here again. Our dog spent two nights here and I can't believe the damage that was done in that time. Upon pick up we asked how she had done, and were told, \"She's on Facebook!\" (which she wasn't...) but weren't given any legitimate information. What actually had happened was that ALL of her gums were bruised and her teeth were covered with metal from chewing on a cage for 2 days straight. The next week at home she cried in pain when she played with any chew toys. She had lost a noticeable amount of weight (in 2 DAYS) so who knows if she was fed. He nose was swollen and there was a quarter sized wound on the top of her nose. When we asked the staff who walked her out to us what happened he had no idea. \n\nHaving our fun-loving happy dog be visibly terrified walking out to us and not even looking up to see who we were until she could smell us upset me us so much. If you love or care about your dog spend the extra 5 dollars for a place that cares about animals.
rationale: The sentiment in the review is negative because the user describes a distressing experience with their dog at the facility. The dog suffered physical harm, such as bruised gums, covered teeth, weight loss, a swollen nose, and a wound on the nose. Additionally, the staff appeared unaware of what had happened to the dog during her stay, leaving the user feeling concerned and upset about the lack of care provided. The user's emotional reaction and the visible distress of their dog upon leaving the facility further contribute to the negative sentiment expressed in the review.

question:
Giving this place two stars is a stretch, but the front service people have always been friendly, so there you go. 

Now about my experience with Hickory Hills:

I was a loyal customer for three years for one of my dogs. Although I never felt like the service was great there, the prices were good and they seemed to care about the dogs, so I kept coming back. 

I don't know if something changed, but over time my dog started coming back sore and covered in blood. He started acting terrified whenever I would pull up front, and it was clear he was having bad experiences there. I asked the owner about this, and she said that nothing was going on and that he played well with other dogs. 

Well two months ago, my healthy four year old dog came back barely able to walk. It took weeks before he recovered, and he still hasn't seemed himself. I can't help but wonder what goes on there, but it seems like something fishy is going on. 

To make matters worse, I boarded him at a different kennel last weekend. The owner immediately called me after I dropped him off and explained that he was acting traumatized and terrified of the kennel. He said it was very obvious he was not suited for kennels. 

Unfortunately, he also told me that some kennels are known for taking dogs that don't do well and lying to the owners to keep the business. When I mentioned Hickory Hills, he laughed and said they were the worst kennel in Madison. He also told me a story about how the owner or manager killed several dogs by leaving insect poison out in the play area.

I feel so lucky my dog wasn't more hurt at this horrible kennel, and I hope nobody else has to lose a beloved pet to this sub-par facility. This is a harsh review but these things matter.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is Negative because the customer describes concerning experiences with the kennel regarding their dog's well-being and safety. They mention that their dog came back sore, covered in blood, and traumatized from their visits to the kennel. Additionally, the account from the other kennel owner about dogs being mistreated and the mention of the alleged incident involving insect poison create a sense of alarm and distrust towards Hickory Hills. Overall, the review expresses a strong negative sentiment due to the perceived neglect and potential harm to the dogs in their care.

question: My dog goes to this kennel at least twice a month for 4-5 days at a time. He always comes back to me happy and healthy. The staff is kind and really personable, they are good with the dogs and understand that every dog has different needs. My dog has been at several other kennels in Madison before I found hickory hills and he use to come home completely out of it, but here he actually seems happy. My dog is an escape artist and does use his teeth to get out of the kennel, the staff figured out a creative way to keep him in and now his teeth aren't silver.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer expresses satisfaction with the services provided by the kennel. They appreciate that their dog comes back happy and healthy after stays, highlighting the staff's kindness and understanding of their dog's unique needs. The reviewer also praises the staff for addressing their dog's escape artist tendencies creatively and effectively. Overall, the reviewer's experience with hickory hills kennel has been significantly better compared to other kennels in the past, leading to a positive review.

question:
DO NOT allow your dogs to go to daycare here. Today I came to pick up my dog after going here for over a month twice a week. I was told that my dog attacked a small dog who "did nothing", which doesn't sound like him at all (we go to dog parks and he's never done anything like that). I was told that they had repeatedly had problems with him (but no phone calls to me or notes when I picked him up) and that I should take him to a place with a limit on the number of dogs. They clearly had over 30 dogs in a single group outside and only one staff member attending them. Sometimes when I arrived, I have had to wait 5 or more minutes and the dogs were entirely alone. Quite frankly it sounds like they are not supervising the dogs well enough. 

Nothing quite adds up with this business, and while I would have sang their praises just a month ago for giving me a calm dog twice a week, they are clearly poorly managing their daycare.

EDIT: My dog just has a confirmed case of Kennel Cough and the vet says that there have been 3 other dogs they have seen (in one practice!!) that have it and who go to Hickory Hills!! STAY FAR FAR AWAY!!
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer had a bad experience with the daycare facility. Their dog was involved in an aggressive incident without prior warning, suggesting lack of proper supervision and communication from the staff. Additionally, the reviewer's dog contracted Kennel Cough, indicating potential issues with hygiene and disease control at the facility. Overall, the reviewer felt let down and warned others to avoid the daycare due to these concerning experiences.

question: Seriously good coffee.  I'm not really a coffee drinker, but even I can tell the difference between Johnson Bros. and whatever starbucks crap I usually drink.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer, who is not a regular coffee drinker, acknowledges that the coffee from Johnson Bros. is notably superior to their usual Starbucks choice. This indicates that they were pleasantly surprised by the quality of the coffee, suggesting a positive experience that exceeded their expectations.

question: The Ulos Batak Sumatra was hands down the worst cup of coffee I have ever had. Way too acidic- as in that \"I just vomited a little in my mouth\" flavor. Nothing helped the flavor except pouring it down the drain.
rationale: The sentiment is Negative because the user expressed strong dislike and disappointment towards the Ulos Batak Sumatra coffee, describing it as the worst they have ever had. They found the flavor to be overly acidic to the point of being unpleasant, comparing it to a distasteful experience of vomiting. Additionally, they emphasized that nothing improved the flavor, ultimately resulting in them disposing of the coffee.

question:
Now these guys take coffee drinking to a whole new level! I usually add cream and sugar to coffee to knock off the acidity but I drink this brew black and pure. It's phenomenal! 

I also love the fact that they are into sustainable farming practices and they're educating people all over the world in regard to coffee quality, sustainable farming practices, and coffee service. 

Do yourself a huge favor and try it! I know Rosie's Coffee Bar & Bakery on Monona Drive serves it. You'll have a brand new experience in coffee drinking.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer is highly enthusiastic about their experience with the coffee, describing it as phenomenal when consumed black and pure. They also appreciate the company's commitment to sustainable farming practices and spreading awareness about coffee quality and sustainability. The reviewer encourages others to try the coffee, suggesting that it will provide a brand new and enjoyable experience. Overall, the review reflects a strong endorsement and satisfaction with the product and brand, leading to a positive sentiment.

question: You can find this company's products at several retail stores throughout Madison and also at their booth at the summer Farmer's Market. The donuts are always moist and very tasty. The cookies are hit an dmiss--some days they are the perfect combination of being chewy in the middle and crunchy on the outsides. The scones are far too dry for my taste, and the other products look and taste mass-produced. Where is the love?!
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer expressed dissatisfaction with several aspects of the company's products. They highlighted inconsistencies in the quality of the cookies and described the scones as far too dry. Additionally, the reviewer felt that the other products appeared and tasted mass-produced, indicating a lack of attention to detail and personalized touch. This overall lack of enthusiasm and disappointment in the products led to a negative sentiment.

question:
Pros: Got a deal on Priceline. Nice pool.

Cons:

---First suite we were given was freezing cold when we walked in. When we turned on the heater, a strong and horrible "burning" smell filled the room. I had to get my elderly mother and our things out of the room and then figure out how to shut down the heater-air conditioner unit.

---Woke up to find a slip under our door saying our card was declined and to visit the front office, but we were already paid in full.

---Got back to hotel in the late afternoon and the elevator to our room was shut down because of construction. Also the stairs closest to our room. My mom has cancer and limited mobility when her pain flares up and we had to walk the full length of the hotel, up the stairs and all the way back...I had specifically requested a room next to the elevator for this reason.

Bottom line: First time and last time staying at a Staybridge Suites.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the guest experienced multiple significant issues during their stay at the Staybridge Suites. From the uncomfortable temperature and strong smell in the room, to the confusion over a declined card payment, and the inconvenience of the elevator and stairs being out of service, these factors all contributed to a disappointing and frustrating experience for the guest. Additionally, the guest's specific needs and requests, such as a room near the elevator due to their mother's limited mobility, were not accommodated. Overall, these issues and lack of attention to detail left the guest feeling dissatisfied and unlikely to return to this hotel in the future.

question: I would also like to note that the telephones in our room did not work (both) nor did the internet (as a business traveler, I need to be able to utilize the Wi-Fi.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the user expressed dissatisfaction with the non-functional telephones and internet in the room, highlighting the inconvenience it caused, especially for a business traveler who relies on Wi-Fi for work purposes. The issues with communication and connectivity likely impacted their overall experience negatively.

question:
We are planning to move to Madison from Virginia, and I needed a place to stay. Also, I wanted to bring my dog along for some company (my husband and daughter stayed home for work/school). I'm so glad I found this place!

As other reviews have noted, you get an actual suite with a door and everything! There is a kitchen with a full sized refrigerator, microwave, stove and sink. It also comes stocked with silverware, plates, and pots and pans. 

The hotel has a small convenience area in case you don't want to go out for food. There are a few frozen meals, etc. Free wi-fi as well.

The full breakfast was pretty good, too. Waffles, eggs, sausage, biscuits and gravy (on most mornings), pastries, coffee, etc. 

My only complaints (and these are pretty minor) was that the TVs weren't very new. And the shower curtain was so thick and heavy that it kept touching me. A curved shower curtain would do wonders.

The front desk staff was so nice! There was an issue with my check-in (they didn't have me on record), but they were accommodating. And one of the desk guys said that if someone had to leave their dog all day, he'd walk the dog for the guest! Cool!

All this for under $100 a night. Can't beat it! I'll stay here again.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is positive because the guest highlights numerous aspects of the hotel that they enjoyed. They mention the spacious suite with a full kitchen, the convenience of on-site food options, the quality of the breakfast, and the helpfulness of the front desk staff. Even the minor complaints mentioned, such as the older TVs and the shower curtain, are described as "pretty minor." Overall, the guest expresses satisfaction with their stay, emphasizing the value for the price and expressing a willingness to stay at the hotel again in the future.

question: We stayed over the weekend and the hotel rented to some \"shady\" characters immediately after we checked in and of course, they get the room across the hall from us. They had a party going on until 2am, I called the front desk 3 times, she came the third time saying at first that she thought we were on a different floor then said that she had already given them a warning (which is it). When we complained we were told that they cannot control what other guests do, which I somewhat understand but #1. Immediate action was not taken and #2. No accommodations were offered.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the review describes a frustrating experience with disruptive guests at the hotel, leading to a late-night disturbance and a lack of appropriate response from the front desk staff. The reviewer felt ignored and uncomfortable, highlighting the hotel's failure to address the situation promptly and the lack of any gestures to make amends for the inconvenience caused. Overall, the lack of effective communication and customer service in handling the issue contributes to the negative sentiment expressed in the review.

question: Place is fantastic! Best in Madison. For all things growing - inside and out. Nice to be in a store where employees actually know what customer service means.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is positive because the reviewer describes the place as fantastic and the best in Madison. They appreciate the knowledge and customer service of the employees, indicating a positive experience overall. The reviewer's use of superlatives like "best" and "fantastic" further emphasizes their satisfaction with the store.

question: This place is fun!  Huge space, lots to do... limited parking, but park down the street.  I went there with a big group & saw SuperTuesday (great cover band, 1st time seeing them)  This place is pretty close to my place & I can see myself going more often.  There's something for everyone.  And if you are a girl, you can always get to the bar (just smile).
rationale: The review expresses enthusiasm and enjoyment from the experience at the venue, highlighting the fun atmosphere, variety of activities, and entertainment provided by the cover band. The reviewer mentions convenience in terms of proximity and the inclusive aspect of the venue offering something for everyone. The positive tone is also emphasized by the reviewer's intention to visit the place more frequently and the casual, light-hearted comment about the bar experience. Overall, the review points to a positive and enjoyable experience, making the sentiment Positive.

question: Don't bother going here to watch the NFL unless you're a Packers fan.  Refused to turn up volume in a room full of Bears fans so we could actually hear the game.
rationale: The sentiment is Negative because the reviewer had a disappointing experience at the venue while trying to watch an NFL game. The refusal to accommodate the request to increase the volume for a room full of Bears fans indicates a lack of consideration for the preferences and enjoyment of all customers, leading to dissatisfaction and frustration.

question: Ok crowd. Good place to see concerts. But stupid expensive drinks and the bartenders do not give very good service. I've downgraded this place to only a concert stop. And only then if there is nothing else going on.
rationale: The sentiment is Negative because the user expresses dissatisfaction with the expensive drinks and poor service provided by the bartenders. Additionally, the user mentions downgrading the overall experience of the venue to only attending concerts if there are no other options available, indicating a lack of enthusiasm or satisfaction with the overall experience.

question: Pooley's has too small of a parking lot to host too large of event.  Beware that the Madison Cops watch the side streets and are ready and waiting to write parking tickets.  Friends and I recently went to Pooley's for a Madison County Concert. The parking lot had over flown into the neighboring parking lots and folks ended up parking on the side street. After the show we found that everyone that parked around the corner on Cross Hill Drive had parking tickets issued.  I know we won't be going back there anytime soon.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is negative because the reviewer had a negative experience due to the limited parking situation at Pooley's during a large event. The reviewer mentioned receiving parking tickets issued by the Madison Cops, indicating additional inconvenience and cost. The overall tone of the review suggests frustration and disappointment with the parking situation, leading to the conclusion that they do not plan to return to Pooley's in the near future.

question: Parking there is a pain in the ass. The ever popular MPD wasted no time in ticketing 10+ cars parked around the corner. The signs read, no parking between 10 PM and 5 AM - hrm, seems be aimed directly at the Bar business. WTF.  Perhaps the obnoxious, money grubbing city of Madison could consider issuing *warnings* first, or make the tickets a nominal fine, like 5 bucks. Oh, we can't do that and still fund the liberal bike boxes, can we ? Or buy snow making machines. So instead of wisely spending money, they'll sock it to people out and about. Way to go Madison. \n\nThe bar itself is fine, plenty of room, except, the bathrooms - they should put in MORE! There were girls in the men's bathroom waiting to use the stall.
rationale: The sentiment in this review is negative because the reviewer expresses frustration and annoyance with the parking situation and the actions of the city and police department. They are critical of the parking restrictions and the strict enforcement, suggesting that warnings or lower fines could be more reasonable. The reviewer also highlights dissatisfaction with the lack of available bathrooms at the bar, indicating a negative overall experience.

question: I have been going here a long time. Since they opened. Since they had Inddor Sand Courts. The staff are friendly. Not sure about this new food service.... But I don't goto a bar for food. I goto a bar to have fun. \nThis place is a blast, did I forget to mention about the outdoor patio and live music. \nNo I do not work there. No I do not own anything. I am just someone who has always been treated right. I feel that when a place treats you right. You do the same.
rationale: The review expresses a strong sense of loyalty and satisfaction towards the establishment, mentioning that the reviewer has been frequenting the place since it opened, highlighting the friendly staff, outdoor patio, live music, and overall fun atmosphere. The reviewer also acknowledges that they have always been treated well there, emphasizing the importance of reciprocating good treatment. Overall, the review conveys a positive sentiment by focusing on the enjoyable experiences and positive interactions at the bar.

question:
Typical sports bar layout: taps, cheap drinks and a ton of tv's. They've a semi-separate room for pool and darts. 

Saw the Packers opener here. The table service was friendly and polite, and very quick with drinks. 

The rounds ordered from the bar were quick, too. The bartenders were good guys, joked a lot, and seemed happy to be there doing what they do...which is exactly what I look for. 

Also of note, they have an insane amount of sports memorabilia, with a ton signed, from all across the spectrum and the last six-plus decades. 

This place is definitely worth a visit or two, as the atmosphere was great for the game. A bit long of a wait for typical bar food is the only drawback.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer had an overall good experience at the sports bar. They highlighted friendly and efficient table service, quick drink orders, and engaging bartenders who created a pleasant atmosphere. Additionally, the extensive sports memorabilia collection added to the appeal of the place. Despite a minor drawback of a bit long wait for food, the reviewer expressed that the sports bar is worth a visit or two, emphasizing the positive aspects of their experience.

question:
This place is awful.  

Drinks are way overpriced and weaker than a popcorn fart.

The place is filthy inside and smells like a old, sweaty jock strap.

Staff is slower than molasses and you'd see the Minnesota Vikings in the Super Bowl before you get served.

Always a testicle festival.  No hot single chicks here.  

Rather buy a 12 pack of Ultra and spend my Friday night under a bridge.

Go Packers!!!!!!
rationale: The review contains multiple negative remarks and complaints about the drinks being overpriced and weak, the cleanliness and smell of the establishment, the slow service, and the lack of attractive people. The sarcastic comments about preferring to spend the evening under a bridge and the declaration to support a rival sports team further emphasize the negative sentiment expressed towards the place.

question: We went here to watch football on Sunday, and even though they were very very slow...service was lacking.  They seem to have a lot of regulars around the bar, who occupy the attention of the bartenders. Otherwise, being a \"regular\" customer, it was hard to get service. I was also a little bit disturbed because the girl bartender, who clearly just rolled out of bed after a long new years eve celebration, was sitting on the counter..with her shoes placed on the SAME spot where they place the clean glasses--mouth down. \n\nThe atomosphere was great, and I think this could be a great place to watch a game, but wouldn't make the drive back out there with the service we had.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the customer experienced slow and lacking service at the bar, with bartenders seeming to prioritize regular customers over others. The mention of a bartender sitting on the counter with her shoes where clean glasses are placed also gives a negative impression of hygiene practices. Despite the positive atmosphere, the overall experience with the service was unsatisfactory, leading to the customer not wanting to return to the establishment.

question: This would be the perfect site for the TV shows \"Bar Rescue\" or \"Kitchen Nightmares.\"\nThe biggest weakness was the waitress we had. Slow service for both the drinks and our food. This is a bar: the drinks should have come fast and furious. The food arrived before the plates. The waitress forgot my water. Waitress never checked to see if I wanted another drink.\nPlaces like this should be using mystery shoppers to test and improve their service. And this bar is in Madison, WI, where there are a million other bars one can go to.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the review highlights significant issues with the service at the bar, with the waitress being described as slow, forgetful, and inattentive to the needs of the customers. The reviewer expected quick service due to the nature of a bar setting, where drinks should come promptly. Additionally, the fact that the food arrived before the plates and the waitress failed to check on the customer's needs indicate a lack of professionalism and care. The suggestion of using mystery shoppers to improve service further emphasizes the dissatisfaction with the overall experience.

question: Have been to Pooley's numerous times during trips to state basketball tournaments. The experience had always been good, but not today. Even though there were few patrons, waited 20 minutes for our beverages, and 45 minutes for our meal. The server was woefully untrained, and the bartender seemed to be annoyed when we asked for our drinks.  Food was just averge, price was ok. Service was poor.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the customer had a subpar experience at Pooley's during their recent visit. They had to wait an unusually long time for their drinks and meal despite there being few other patrons. Additionally, they received poor service from an untrained server and encountered an annoyed bartender when requesting their drinks. The food was only average, and overall, the customer felt that the service was poor.

question:
I had been to Pooley's only once prior to this past Saturday. I really have no desire to return ever again. 

My roommates and I had heard they have some pinball machines, and wanted to check that out. Who doesn't love pinball?! Well, their pinball machines ares mostly pretty lame. The only machine worthy of your time or money is the Star Trek machine, which is pretty awesome. The others aren't so great. The Addams Family machine looks awesome, but man does it cheat!

So we did quickly glance at Yelp regarding their food, and we thought it was probably going to be mediocre...but we were hungry.  And it was indeed mediocre. My chicken sandwich was pretty basic California Chicken. It came smothered in some sort of spread. If you are going to use a cheap bun, you can't just smother both sides! My sandwich felt apart immediately. Ugh. The chicken was a little underdone as well, verging on pink. I didn't get sick from eating it, so that's a plus. I gave half of it to my roommate and he didn't get sick either. So the three of us all ate mediocre chicken sandwiches and we survived. People seem to like their pizza, so maybe go with that.

The crowd was also interesting. A bunch of bros and bottle blondes. That sums it up pretty accurately, actually. I felt some hard glares from across the bar from some sketchy looking dudes. With limited physical strength, I would absolutely not feel safe going to Pooley's alone on a Saturday night. Absolutely not. Maybe the daytime crowd doesn't look so threatening. 

The bartenders were friendly, and did a great job. They should migrate somewhere else, because I'd gladly order from them again. But, I will not return to Pooley's. No way.
rationale: The sentiment of this review is negative because the customer had a disappointing experience at Pooley's. They found the pinball machines to be mostly lackluster, the food mediocre, and expressed concerns about the quality and safety of the establishment based on the crowd. Although they appreciated the bartenders, overall, they do not plan to return due to the various negative aspects of their visit.

question: This is my favorite commercial movie theater.  The biggest draw for me is 1) location and 2) hot cinnamon and sugar donuts!  They always have a large selection of movies due to the many many screens.  A big plus is that, unlike the Point, they take debit cards at the ticket line AND at the treat counter.  Make me wanna buy lotsa candy.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the user expresses their love for their favorite commercial movie theater, highlighting key factors such as its convenient location, delicious hot cinnamon and sugar donuts, the large selection of movies available, and the convenience of being able to use debit cards at both the ticket line and treat counter. Additionally, the user's excitement about buying lots of candy further emphasizes their overall positive experience at this theater.

question:
Let me start by saying that I often carry around a back pack.  When the occasion calls for it I upgrade to a purse.  But most of time I am traveling with munchkins with insatiable appetites, so I've got snacks in there for them and/or lots of books.  

We go to this theater all the time, and I take my back pack there all the time too.  But this time it created a problem.  

We got our tickets and were happily standing at the concession counter ordering tons of overpriced, bad for you, food when this teeny, tiny, little teenage employee approached me and advises me that they are going to have to search my back pack.  WTF??

They got a homeless guy out front smokin' a doobie with some teenagers, but they want to search my stuff?!?!  But you see I was wrong about what they were looking for.  

Knowing that I had nothing in my pack that was without prescription, (ho ho hee hee) I willingly handed it over to the mickey mouse club house member.  She opens the first big zipper and finds, OH MY GAWD!!  

RICE CAKES!!!  

I am so busted.  That's right she was lookin' for food contraband, not drugs!  The first thing she says is, "yep, food" and she hands the pack back to me looking disgusted.  She then advises me that I have to leave the pack locked in the office during the movie we came to see.

Because you know, even though we're standing there with food from the concession stand, we still might wanna eat them rice cakes instead!!!!  

At this point everyone is looking, and my fellow movie companion is standing there eating his newly purchased popcorn enjoying the live action theater.  I thought I wouldn't care if she wanted to hold on to it while I watch a movie, but my credit cards, cell phone, iPod and prescription drugs were the real items of value and that had me worried.  

Thankfully for me all the contents of my pack were still there when I got it back from food police.  However the movie sucked, I sat there the whole time wondering if her and her teenage friends were rifling through my pack.

All this because of rice cakes my friends.  So the next time you dare purchase some, just remember it's better to use them as target practice than to mistakenly bring them into the theater!!!

Even though bringing in outside food was not my intention this time, I can say that next time I go, I think I'll wear a trench coat and inside I'll have bags of popcorn and cans of soda strapped to me so I can smuggle in the contraband and be an arsehole just for the heck of it.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is negative because the reviewer had a frustrating experience at the theater due to having their backpack searched for outside food, in this case rice cakes. They felt embarrassed and inconvenienced by the situation, especially since they were not trying to bring in contraband but were still treated as such. The overall tone of the review conveys disappointment and annoyance with the theater's policies and the handling of the situation by the staff.

question:
UPDATE!  

Ever since my last review where I described being backpack violated for carrying rice cake contraband, I've made it my mission to sneak in as much snack contraband as I can every time I go here.  

Today I stopped at Walgreens before heading over to the theater, and bought 3 large boxes of candy for 3 bucks!  Yes!  The same candy in the same size boxes that they sell at the theater for 4.25 a piece!  That's a 9.75 savings to me Eastgate, and YES I like stuffing boxes of candy down my pants!  I like it!!
rationale: The sentiment is Negative because the reviewer is engaging in sneaky and potentially disrespectful behavior by trying to sneak in snacks to the theater instead of purchasing them there. Additionally, the review includes a sense of defiance and disrespect for the theater's policies, which can come across as negative and disruptive to the overall experience for other patrons and the theater staff.

question:
Definitely a theater that's showing its age. The last movie I saw here was the first Matrix movie... and I don't think much has been updated in the past 13+ years since then.

Swung by to see Rush (by Ron Howard); it was a Sunday at 6:20pm - the parking lot was nearly empty. The ticket sales person was friendly; she made a little small talk and said that she heard Rush was a great film - apparently she was going to try to watch it tomorrow. I appreciated the chat; all too often stores/shops/etc are staffed with drones. Not the case here.

Figured I'd treat myself to a small popcorn and a soda. Concession stand had zero people in line; another very friendly staff member asked if she could get me anything. I placed my order and she did something that made me want to rate this place at 5 stars: she said, "I'll fill your popcorn half-way, and if you'd like me to add butter or salt, you'll get a better mix." I declined the butter but did shake a little salt into the middle of the container before having her fill it the rest of the way. What a great, very welcomed touch. I've never seen that before.

Rush wasn't playing on one of the IMAX screens, and maybe I'm spoiled by IMAX and from having watched dozens of movies in my own home theater (with 4, 18" subwoofers in an infinite baffle line array and 4800-watts of Crest power), but wow - the theater was a disappointment.

Picture was fine, but the sound was so flat and reverse-scooped (no highs/no lows). Makes for easy-to-hear dialogue, but takes away all of the boom/rumble/feel that comes with the big screen experience. :-(

Restrooms were clean, but also very dated.

So... 

Service/Staff: 10-stars (out of 5)
Value: 1-star (movie, popcorn (junior size) & large soda was $24.74 for 1 person)
Theater: 2-stars - very dated/aged; poor sound quality, seats cramped (no leg room)
rationale: The sentiment of the review is considered negative because the reviewer highlights several shortcomings of the theater experience. They mention that the theater is showing its age with outdated facilities, poor sound quality, and cramped seating. Additionally, the reviewer expresses disappointment in the overall movie-watching experience, especially compared to modern amenities like IMAX and home theaters. While the staff received high praise for friendliness and service, the value for money in terms of ticket and concessions prices is perceived as poor. Overall, the review emphasizes more negative aspects of the theater visit than positive ones, leading to a negative sentiment.

question:
This is your typical movie theater but I loooove that they are running their $5 Tuesday (movie ticket AND free popcorn special).  

My review centers around their customer service.  I purchased movie tickets at 3 pm for a 5:30 pm movie.  I then went about my errands.  I was accidentally shorted on my change.  When I realized what happened, I called and spoke to Jason who said they would could the cashier's drawer when I came back for my movie.  

Not only did they respond and were ready with the cash when I arrived, but they were really nice about it.  Mitch is a great box office person and I appreciate he apologized.  We both made the mistake.  

Thank you for your niceness and your prompt response.  I appreciate it.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the user had a good experience with the movie theater's customer service. Despite being shorted on change, the staff, particularly Jason and Mitch, responded promptly, acknowledged the mistake, and provided a solution with kindness and efficiency. The user felt appreciated and thanked the staff for their niceness and quick response, ultimately leaving them with a positive impression of the theater.

question:
I am dropping you down two stars.  I checked the website last night at 8pm and realized I missed the 7:25pm showing of 12 Years a Slave.  So I decided to go tonight.  

I got there to purchase my tickets when the window person told me there is no such showtime.  I was like, what?  Huh?  No.  

She told us to head out and the times were on the wall.  Well they sure were, and in an obvious place, the numbers 7:25 were removed. The gap was comical.  

We were told by the manager that updates can be made and will be reflected on the website 15 minutes after they are made.  This means that the showtimes are simply suggested times, they will not actually be honored and can change at any time to put up a more popular film.  In addition to that, it was my responsibility to check the internet before I left home.  His assumption that I have constant and immediate access to the internet was insulting.  

I was not the only one standing there.  Another patron complimented me on the points I made to Tom, the manager.  They are all valid points and completely unacceptable that an email is sent out each week reflecting these times.  Each theater sends out their showtimes.  In addition, I checked this time yesterday.  

The box office person did not even realize that a time was cancelled.  Inform your people to address the problem in a productive manner.  Perhaps: I apologize, there was a change to the schedule or I am sorry for the error, can I suggest another movie.
