The movie was to show at 7:25.  Unless you got there 30 minutes early, you only had one other movie option.  Everything else started during the 6 o'clock hour.  It was offensive to be suggested that I see some other movie.  

I am not always in the mood for an action movie or a cartoon.  I find it tragic that an award-winning movie is not being shown during prime hours.  There were so many of us dumb-founded that there were no other options.  Tonight, they lost at least ten patrons (that I could see).

Two stars is: Meh, I've experience better and I would say that is what Eastgate Cinemas has become.  They do not have enough showtimes for movies which lack blockbuster status.  Then to cancel showtimes with no notice is not a great way to do business.
rationale: The sentiment in the review is negative because the customer experienced frustration and disappointment due to the lack of accurate showtime information at the theater. They felt misled by the website and were annoyed by the lack of accountability from staff members regarding the schedule changes. The customer also expressed dissatisfaction with the limited movie options available and felt that their concerns were not properly acknowledged or addressed by the manager. This overall negative experience led the customer to give a lower rating to the theater.

question:
It's a basic, few frills theater.  Their screens are a little too small for this day and age, which I assume they'll be fixing when they build the new location in Sun Prairie.

I go to a lot of movies, and this theater is really no better or worse than most other theaters I've been to, and given that this is closest to my home, it receives the majority of my business.

My favorite part of this theater is the fact that I usually go to the bathroom before a show (who doesn't really?).  I always use the same bathroom (the smaller one to the right), and I usually end up at the first urinal when I go in.  At the first urinal, a few years ago, some dude wiped a nasal nugget on the wall when he was doing his business.  That wall widget happened to be nearly the same color as the tile in the men's room.  Now, every time I go in there, I look for it.  It's still there, over 4+ years now.

Way to clean the bathrooms, Eastgate!
rationale: The sentiment is Negative because the review highlights several shortcomings of the theater, such as small screens and basic amenities. The customer also expresses disappointment in the consistency of the theater compared to others they have visited. Additionally, the mention of a dirty bathroom with a specific unsanitary incident that has persisted for years reflects poorly on the theater's cleanliness and maintenance standards, contributing to an overall negative impression.

question: Abra took great care of the repairs on my truck.  I had a minor concern, and they took care of it quickly and perfectly!
rationale: The review mentions that Abra took great care of the repairs on the truck and addressed a minor concern quickly and perfectly. These positive comments indicate that the customer was satisfied with the service provided by Abra. The use of words like "great care" and "perfectly" conveys a sense of high-quality service and customer satisfaction, which makes the sentiment of the review positive.

question: Expensive for food that is mediocre.  The wait time for the food was incredibly long and they weren't even that busy.  Lame.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the review highlights multiple negative aspects of the dining experience: the high prices compared to the mediocre food quality, the long wait time despite the restaurant not being very busy, and the overall disappointment with the experience described as "lame." These points collectively contribute to an overall negative sentiment towards the restaurant.

question:
As a recent Chicago transplant, I've really been missing Chicago pizza. Imagine my amazement when I discovered that there was an Uno's in Madison! 

Wrong. While the original Pizzaria Uno (at Ohio and Wabash) is wonderful, something is lost in translation here. I can't even explain it. It's just bad. 

The hunt for good deep dish in Madison continues...
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer expresses disappointment and dissatisfaction with their experience at Uno's in Madison. They had high expectations due to missing Chicago pizza, only to find that the deep dish pizza at Uno's in Madison did not meet their standards. The reviewer was let down by the quality of the pizza, expressing that something was lost in translation and that it was simply bad. Their statement that the hunt for good deep dish in Madison continues also indicates that they were not satisfied with the restaurant's offering.

question: Very good service and great pizza! The staff did a great job with refills and making the 4 kids in our group comfortable. The bloody Mary bar looked great.
rationale: The review highlights multiple positive aspects of the experience, such as the good service, great pizza, attentive staff, and an appealing bloody Mary bar. The reviewer specifically mentions that the staff made the children in their group comfortable, indicating a family-friendly atmosphere. Overall, the positive feedback on service quality, food, and ambiance suggests a satisfying and enjoyable dining experience, leading to a positive sentiment.

question: Horrible, horrible service.  I went twice before writing a review.  the first time I thought maybe it was an off day.  The second time, they lost me as a customer.  The wait staff was more interested in talking about their weekend plans than serving customers.  The food was okay, nothing special.  But, for the price, I expect a little more service from a staff that realizes they're not working at Denny's.  Hell, Denny's usually has pretty solid service.  This place will have to go to an extreme to get me to return.  If I could give them zero stars, I would.
rationale: The sentiment expressed in the review is Negative because the customer describes the service as "horrible" and mentions that the wait staff seemed more interested in their personal conversations than providing good service. The customer also states they were disappointed with the level of service given the price they paid, expecting more professionalism. Additionally, the customer indicates that their poor experience was consistent over two visits, leading them to feel that the restaurant would have to make significant improvements for them to consider returning.

question: I had the spinoccoli deep dish pizza and i loved it! It was very delicious but the only thing keeping me from 5 stars was that I understand that It was small and the pizza wasn't as filled as I would like it to be for the price. I also had the chi town appetizer platter and it was not bad. I could tell that the chicken tenders were made from scratch and the avocado egg rolls were pretty good! My meal overall was very filling and I'm extremely happy with my meal and service overall.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the user enjoyed the spinoccoli deep dish pizza, describing it as delicious. They also appreciated the homemade quality of the chicken tenders and found the avocado egg rolls to be good. Despite some minor feedback about portion size and filling, the user expressed overall satisfaction with the meal and service.

question:
Stopped by here after seeing a movie across the street.  The place wasn't very busy for a late Saturday night and I think we were the only ones sitting in the bar area.  This place had some New Glarus on tap which is a must anytime I am in Wisconsin. 

Our server was great and got us everything we needed quickly.  It wasn't till after we were served our food that we realized we didn't have any silverware.  It took a while for our server to come back into the room but once he did we waved him down and he promptly brought out silverware for us.  

We both really enjoyed our pasta dishes.  And there was plenty of food and I ended up taking half mine home.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer had a good experience at the restaurant. Despite it not being very busy, they received quick and attentive service from a great server. The reviewer enjoyed the food, particularly highlighting the pasta dishes, and appreciated the generous portions. The minor issue of missing silverware was quickly resolved by the server once brought to their attention. Overall, the reviewer had a satisfying dining experience with no major complaints.

question: The service at this location is slow, the prices are outrageous, the food is totally sub-par, the drinks are always made super duper weak, and they close really early. I don't suggest coming here for a good time. The servers are nice, but I would suggest going to a more delicious location.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the review highlights several significant issues with the establishment, including slow service, high prices, poor quality food, weak drinks, and early closing times. The overall tone suggests that the reviewer did not have a good experience and recommends against visiting this location for a good time. The positive mention of the servers being nice does not outweigh the numerous drawbacks mentioned.

question: Worst experience please don't go this shitty place\nLong wait for order delivery .for fucking sandwich they took 1 hour, the bartender is very careless and replied to me \"i am not making it \". Damn worst service in my entire life.\nManager is also worst and racial.
rationale: The sentiment of this review is negative because the customer had a terrible experience at the place they visited. The use of strong language like "shitty," "fuck," and "worst" highlights their dissatisfaction with the service and their perception of high wait times, careless staff, and poor customer service. Additionally, mentioning the bartender's dismissive attitude and the implication of racism from the manager further signify a negative experience for the reviewer.

question: Used these guys for a warranty repair. The 1st couple of people I spoke to on the phone were very nice, however flexibility for scheduling was not there. The first person said I could ask for a specific time, the 2nd person said I could only choose a time frame, the 3rd person said they pretty much ignore that and schedule by geographics.  AND online they even say, 'a time convenient for you. And by the time we were able to get a mutual time for the repair, the tech was unpleasant. The appliance did get fixed.  5 stars for getting the appliance fixed, 0 stars for the tech's attitude. Not sure how to rate being pleasantly lied to about scheduling.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is Negative because the customer experienced a lack of consistency and transparency in the scheduling process. The initial interactions with the staff on the phone were positive, but there was a disconnect in communication regarding scheduling options. This led to frustration and a perception of being misled. Additionally, the negative attitude of the technician during the repair further added to the customer's dissatisfaction. Overall, the customer felt let down by the company's handling of the repair process, which overshadowed the successful resolution of the appliance issue.

question:
If you were to ask me about my in store purchase and customer service I would have said it was great. However that all changed once they had my money and the purchase was complete. I spent nearly $3,000 on a sectional over Memorial Day weekend and was told that my order would take at most 14 weeks but that most orders take around 6 weeks. So at the end of July I call and I'm told August 21st is my delivery date. I call back at the end of August (it took three messages and calls to reach my salesmen) and he says he's been trying to call me but my phone was broken (it wasn't, I've had the same phone for 10 years). Then he tells me it will be September 21st. I begrudgingly agree since this is the maximum timeline in the 14 weeks. Now here we are and I call again today and I'm told 2-4 more weeks. I tried to talk to the manager and express my dissatisfaction and he stood there silent on the other end of the phone offering no concern or effort to expedite my shipment. 

Bottom line: once the sale is final and they have your money they put zero effort in helping you. 

Meanwhile here I sit (on the floor) 4 months after my purchase and I still have another month to go (that is if this time quote is accurate)!

I recommend taking your business elsewhere. Somewhere where customer service is more than a smile to get the sale.
rationale: The sentiment in the review is negative because the customer experienced frustration and disappointment with the store's post-purchase customer service. Despite being promised a delivery date within 14 weeks, the customer faced multiple delays and unclear communication from the salesperson. Additionally, their attempts to address the issue with the manager were met with silence and lack of effort to resolve the situation. This lack of follow-through and poor customer service after the sale contributed to the negative sentiment expressed in the review.

question: Worthless.  Everyone in the television department sits around talking to each other.  You basically have to tape $20 bills to your forehead in order to get any attention.  Based on how empty sections of the store are, they must be going out of business.  The furniture department is stocked with things to look at, but rarely is it in stock.  Big profits in furniture....I wouldn't be surprised if they turn into a furniture store.

The criticisms of the television department and furniture department also contribute to the overall negative sentiment expressed in the review. Additionally, the speculation that the store may be going out of business adds to the negative tone.

question: Going out of business sale is a joke. Drove up from Chicago and it was a complete waste of time! Prices are extremely high - electronics are higher than best buy. Furniture needs another 50% off to even consider buying floor models. Customers were all walking around complaining about the price.
rationale: The sentiment is Negative because the review highlights various issues that resulted in a negative experience for the customer. The reviewer found the prices to be extremely high, even higher than at a well-known retailer like Best Buy. They also felt that the furniture prices were still too high even with a supposed discount. Additionally, the fact that multiple customers were overheard complaining about the prices further emphasizes the negative sentiment.

question:
I won an air conditioner and a heating tune-up through an auction. Upon the initial inspection I was told that everything should be OK but that a newer furnace (mine is 8 years old) was recommended. 

Later, when it was determined I could not afford a new furnace I was told that my venting was not up to code. All Comfort Services would then be happy to sell me a new furnace (to replace one that's only 8 years old) and a new water heater as well as the stuff that goes along with it (plumbing, electrical, etc.) 

So I took it upon myself to hire a home inspector to look things over and was told that everything was fine. The venting was indeed up to code and that there should be no real reason that I couldn't have the A/C and venting work I wanted done with the current set-up. The inspector then also told me he has had trouble with All Comfort Services in the past using similar bait-and-switch tactics to upsell customers into equipment that is not needed (in my case it was to make up for the A/C unit I was getting for much less than the list price I think). 

Emails and phone calls to Kendall Richards, the owner, went unanswered when I tried in vain to get my money refunded to me. Thankfully my credit card company worked with me to dispute the charges and I got my money back. 

I would stay far, far away from All Comfort Services and instead use a more reputable heating and air conditioning vendor.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer had a poor experience with All Comfort Services. The reviewer felt that the company engaged in deceptive tactics, attempted to upsell unnecessary equipment, and ignored attempts to resolve the issue by refunding the money. The lack of responsiveness from the owner further added to the negative sentiment. Additionally, the reviewer's trust was further eroded when an independent home inspector contradicted the company's claims, indicating possible dishonesty or incompetence on the part of All Comfort Services. Ultimately, the reviewer had to escalate the situation to their credit card company to resolve the issue, indicating a significant level of dissatisfaction with the company's practices.

question: Had a cracked line on my ac unit - got charged $100 to find it, and then the quote was for $1150 and was told to replace my entire AC system instead of fixing it.  Got a second opinion from another place and they said it was just a $400 fix including a recharge.  All Comfort Services quoted me $500 in refrigerant alone.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the user had a disappointing experience with the first service provider who charged a high fee for diagnosing the issue and then recommended replacing the entire AC system instead of a more cost-effective repair. The user's frustration is evident as they were quoted a significantly higher price compared to the second opinion they received from another service provider. Additionally, the user felt that the initial service provider may have overcharged for the refrigerant alone.

question: Tech was on time and very courteous.  Performed the necessary maintenance quickly.  All in all a very good experience.
rationale: The review expresses satisfaction with the technician's punctuality, politeness, and efficiency in completing the maintenance task promptly. These positive remarks suggest that the overall experience was enjoyable and successful, resulting in a positive sentiment.

question: Quoted me over $1000 to replace an ignition switch that cost $300 from another vendor. Quoted me $500-1000 more to replace my furnace as well. Basically, they tried to trick me into buying a new, overpriced furnace from them by lying about the cost of repairing the old unit. I would never do business with anyone at this firm again.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer had a poor experience with the firm. The reviewer felt that they were being overcharged for services and that the firm was being deceitful in an attempt to sell them a new furnace at an inflated price. The reviewer also indicated that they would not do business with the firm again, reflecting a lack of trust and dissatisfaction with the services provided.

question:
[This is part of a set of reviews covering establishments my family and I encountered while taking a road trip to Cincinnati.]

I'm finally getting to the final few reviews from my trip more than two months ago.  I guess I could have scrapped these last few, but that's not what Yelpers do.  Is it!?

This was your typical Courtyard by Marriot.  Clean, well-run, friendly staff.  They have a good-sized pool and a big, comfortable lobby.  There were quite a few people checking in at the same time I was (the young lady at the front desk seemed a bit frazzled, but still very professional) and I was surprised how much room there was given the limited space they had cordoned off for registration.

I would complain about the fact that there were only two elevators at either end of the hotel, but for this size hotel it didn't make sense to add more.  It gave the feeling that we were waiting a long time because we had only one option, but that was probably just skewed because of my impatience of wanting to get to where I was going that night.  I did take the stairs a few times when I didn't want to wait and going up and down to the third floor was surprisingly un-strenuous.  They had enough room that the staircase was very shallow.  Actually, a very unusual setup.

I was a little disappointed in the morning when we were trying to get breakfast.  Like the first Marriot we stayed on the outbound part of our trip, there were waffle makers, but these weren't self-serve.  There was an area for a "chef" to make you eggs/omelette, but there was no one manning the station.  Granted, it was early.  But still.  If you're going to have a station like that, shouldn't there be *someone* there?

Even with that, we had a nice stay.  Comfortable and restful before the drive home.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is positive because the reviewer highlights the positive aspects of their stay at the Courtyard by Marriott. They mention that the hotel was clean, well-run, and had friendly staff. Despite some minor inconveniences like limited elevators and unattended breakfast stations, the reviewer still acknowledges having a nice stay and found the experience comfortable and restful. Overall, the positive aspects outweighed any negative points in the review.

question:
Pros: 
Good  clean rooms
Nice lounge inside and out, fire pit awesome
Starbucks and breakfast, service friendly and fast
friendly front desk greeters very accommodating

Cons:
Hear noise levels of the highway in room
Prices of food is a bit steep

Final word: I'll go back and stay here when I'm visiting.
rationale: The review highlights several positive aspects of the stay, such as the cleanliness of the rooms, the pleasant lounge area with a fire pit, the convenience of having Starbucks and breakfast available, and the friendly and accommodating service from the front desk staff. While some drawbacks were mentioned, such as noise from the highway and slightly high prices for food, the reviewer indicates an overall positive experience by stating that they would choose to stay at the location again in the future. This suggests that the positive aspects of the stay outweighed any negatives, leading to a positive sentiment overall.

question: Simply the best! Kayla, Angie and the entire staff always offer excellent customer service. As a business traveler, this is my favorite to stay at. The rooms are clean, quiet and up to date. The lobby area is inviting and fun place to work and have a drink after a long day!
rationale: The review expresses positive sentiment because the guest praises the staff for excellent customer service. They also mention that the rooms are clean, quiet, and up to date, which are all positive attributes. Additionally, the guest highlights the inviting lobby area as a fun place to work and unwind, indicating a pleasant overall experience at the hotel.

question:
Clean newer property on Madison's east side with big rooms and great pillows (5) on each of the two queen beds in our room.  

The furnishings are new and stylish and they have a large well appointed lobby where their "cafe" is open in the evenings at 5 so you can buy a drink or get something to eat. They also offer breakfast (not included in the room rate).

We stayed in 415-on the top floor and booked the room the same day (don't try this on football weekends!). I don't think it was a very full house so things were on the quiet side which was nice after a long harrowing day driving in the snow.  

Bathroom features a shower tub and stool in a larger space. Sink is located outside bathroom door in the room. Room also featured a small refrigerator and a work desk.

All in all a comfy spot to spend the night.
rationale: The review expresses positive sentiments about the property, highlighting aspects such as the cleanliness, size of rooms, comfortable pillows, stylish furnishings, and convenient amenities like the lobby "cafe" and breakfast options. The reviewer also appreciates the quiet atmosphere of the hotel, especially after a long day. Overall, the reviewer found the property to be a comfortable and enjoyable place to stay, indicating a positive experience.

question: Website updated on the hour.  Clean.  Friendly and knowledgeable staff.  Odd location.
rationale: The review praises the frequency of website updates, cleanliness of the location, and the friendly and knowledgeable staff. Despite mentioning an "odd location," the overall tone of the review is positive, highlighting several key positive aspects of the experience. The compliments about the staff and the website updates likely played a significant role in shaping the positive sentiment of the review.

question: Keep up all the good work at the Humane Society.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the user is encouraging and appreciative of the work being done at the Humane Society. The use of words like "good work" indicates a sense of praise and support, highlighting the positive impact of the organization's efforts in caring for animals.

question: We had to surrender a dog here after a horrible experience getting one from a different rescue.  On the phone and in an hour and a half interview along with our vet calling, we stated the dog was not to go back to the rescue.  We waited and waited to see our dog come up on the website and she never did.  After a week, I called DCHS and found out that pretty much immediately after I had left, the worker who had checked us in called the rescue and our dog was picked up the next day.  DCHS didn't even have her for 24 hours and even admitted they knew nothing about the rescue they sent her back to.  Over a month later and she still is not adopted from the other rescue and our feelings and needs were totally dismissed.  NOT humane treatment in this case.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer expresses frustration and disappointment with their experience surrendering their dog to the rescue organization. They feel that their requests regarding the dog's rehoming were not respected, leading to a lack of communication and concern for the dog's well-being. Additionally, the reviewer perceives their feelings and needs as being disregarded by the rescue organization, which has left them feeling dissatisfied with the overall treatment received.

question: I love dogs and feel bad for all of them that are in there.  That being said, I think that they would be better off elsewhere.  This place, since its run by the county) is filled with lazy uncaring employees.  I will goto a breeder or find a
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer expresses a lack of trust and confidence in the county-run facility for dogs, describing the employees as lazy and uncaring. This negative perception contributes to the reviewer's preference for going to a breeder or finding another alternative for obtaining a pet, indicating a lack of satisfaction with the services and care provided at the facility.

question:
I went to the main location to adopt a dog for my mother who is handicapped and cannot come in to get her own dog.
I had to see out help and I stood there waiting for someone to talk to me ( I was looking at them like hellloooo) and they were all at the counter all socializing and ignoring everyone. 
Why are they letting people wander around the place unescorted as well. I have lived in other places and NO ONE runs a shelter like this. You have to protect the animals from children who might poke fingers and get bit. 

Finally I went to the counter and asked someone :Can you help me?  The volunteer who was very distracted and bored to talk to me told me  she had to come in to meet the dog otherwise they would not adopt a dog to her. 
I was like THIS MAKES NO SENSE SHE IS A WHEELCHAIR.
I called later and a real employee apologized but too late I ended up getting a wonderful animal on Craigslist instead.

Dear DCHS train your volunteers better animals lives depend on it.
I was not greeted no one looked at me very unfriendly place for being such fancy building there is hardly any space for actual animals. I went to look at the cats and they were all out of their cages and you only had a small to view at the entryway. 

I like their satellite centers the Mounds one on University is a great place to meet and hang out with a new fur family friend to be.I got a cat there and it was an awesome experience
.
rationale: The sentiment in this review is negative because the user had a poor experience at the main adoption location of the shelter. They felt ignored and frustrated by the volunteers who were socializing instead of assisting them in finding a dog suitable for their handicapped mother. Additionally, the user was disappointed by the lack of proper supervision of visitors to ensure the safety of the animals. The user ultimately found the experience unwelcoming and decided to adopt a pet elsewhere, reflecting their dissatisfaction with the shelter's operations.

question:
No bueno!

1. Tough, chewy Hamachi with not so fresh flavor

2. Salty and otherwise bland udon soup wih limp, flavorless tempura

3. Salmon-skin handroll completely overpowered by way too much shizo leaf.

4. Salad with no character and bitter ginger dressing

Blech!  Maybe I should have known better than to seek out sushi in Wisconsin?  For the sake of Madison, I hope there's better out there.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer had a disappointing dining experience with multiple aspects of the meal being described as tough, not fresh, bland, limp, flavorless, overpowered, and bitter. The description of the food lacking character and being unappetizing indicates a significant level of dissatisfaction with the overall quality of the dishes. The reviewer also expresses regret for seeking out sushi in Wisconsin, suggesting that the quality of the food did not meet expectations and may not be representative of the local cuisine scene.

question: I personally rank this place as the best sushi restaurant in town. They don't use msg and its safe for pregnant woman like me. I've tried muramoto, takara, but sushibox was the only place that i could finish my plate.
rationale: The sentiment is Positive because the user expressed their personal opinion that the sushi restaurant is the best in town, highlighting the fact that it is safe for pregnant women due to not using MSG. Additionally, the user implies satisfaction by stating that Sushibox was the only place where they could finish their plate, indicating a positive dining experience.

question: Came here while in town visiting a relative and wanting to get some sushi together.  This place was a huge disappointment.  The place was overpriced and left me with a not so fresh feeling.  I dont recall everything that I had, but when you spend money on sushi, which I have no problem doing, you expect to get what you paid for.  At this place I felt I would have been better off going to a local grocery store and getting some of their crap sushi, because at least then I would have wasted less money.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the customer expressed disappointment with their experience at the sushi restaurant. They felt that the food was overpriced and not fresh, which are essential qualities expected when paying for sushi. Their comparison to grocery store sushi suggests a significant level of dissatisfaction with the quality and value they received at the restaurant. Overall, their remarks indicate a poor dining experience and a feeling of regret for choosing to dine at that establishment.

question: Was glad to see a sushi place right across the street from my hotel.  I had the tuna roll, tuna avocado  roll, and shrimp tempura and avocado roll.  The shrimp one was a little bland but okay.  The tuna ones were good, definitely a step above \"grocery store\" rolls.  I thought the rice they used was very good.  So I haven't tried a lot of menu items, but the ones I had were good.  And that was all I was really looking for!
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer was glad to find a sushi place conveniently located near their hotel. They enjoyed the tuna rolls and shrimp tempura and avocado roll, noting that the tuna rolls were a step above what you typically find in grocery stores. Despite finding the shrimp roll slightly bland, overall, the reviewer had a good experience and was satisfied with the quality of the food, especially praising the rice used in the sushi. The reviewer's main goal was met, as they were looking for a good meal, and they were pleased with the items they tried.

question: We love this restaurant.  For the past 11 years we have gone there or picked up dinner almost every Friday.  It is great to invite friends for dinner and pick up the dinner at the Sushi Box.  The food always looks beautiful and is well liked (for those who do not like raw fish, there are lovely cooked things).  Mr and Mrs Kim are always incredibly accommodating to our varied needs.
rationale: The review expresses a deep affection and loyalty towards the restaurant, highlighting a long-standing tradition of dining there every Friday for the past 11 years. The mention of inviting friends for dinner and enjoying the beautifully presented and well-liked food, including options for those who do not prefer raw fish, indicates a positive overall experience. The appreciation for the accommodating service provided by Mr. and Mrs. Kim further reinforces the positive sentiment towards the restaurant.

question: Green tea in a can.  Solid sushi.  Unique atmosphere.  The person who brought out my  sushi cared that I'd liked everything.  Good experience.
rationale: The review contains several positive statements, such as the mention of solid sushi, unique atmosphere, and the caring attitude of the staff member who brought out the sushi. The overall experience is described as good, indicating satisfaction with the food quality and service received. The customer appreciates the attention to detail and the effort made by the staff to ensure their enjoyment, leading to a positive sentiment.

question: This is a real nice sushi shop. Reminds me of places in Japan. Sauces are the best. Teriyaki chicken dish is well done. Presentation is excellent. They really want you to have a good meal and they take care of the details.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer highlighted several positive aspects of the sushi shop, such as the authenticity of the place resembling those in Japan, delicious sauces, well-prepared teriyaki chicken dish, excellent presentation, and the attentive service focused on ensuring customers have a great dining experience. These compliments indicate satisfaction with the overall quality of the food, ambiance, and service, which resulted in a positive experience for the reviewer.

question: Good for their simplicity, they have this cheapo little sandwich called a \"skinny\" that is just meat and bread.  Of course, if you want anything else on it they start jacking up the price, even for mayo or veggies.  Pretty good though for a quicky snack.
rationale: The sentiment is considered positive because despite mentioning a few shortcomings, such as the lack of included toppings and potential extra charges for additions, the reviewer ultimately describes the food as "pretty good" for a quick snack. This indicates that they were overall satisfied with the quality and taste of the sandwich, despite the minor criticisms.

question: I didn't eat at BIG mike's. I ate at Milio's. I don't know which location, but it was downtown in amongst the UW campus and State buildings. It was very cold that day, around 19 degrees. So, I will just post my review here. It was good! I had the Pilgrim. What a novel idea, keep the sandwich simple and make it good (why don't you learn something Subway!) I highly recommend Milio's, and I highly recommend very little.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the user speaks highly of their experience at Milio's, mentioning that the sandwich they had was good and praising the concept of keeping it simple yet delicious. Additionally, they recommend Milio's to others, indicating satisfaction with their overall dining experience. The positive remarks about the food and recommendation contribute to the overall positive sentiment expressed in the review.

question: Ordered 2 sandwiches w/o tomatoes, when we opened them they had tomatoes and the bread wasn't fresh :(
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the customer's expectations were not met. They specifically requested sandwiches without tomatoes, but the sandwiches they received still had tomatoes. Additionally, the disappointment was further compounded by the bread not being fresh, ultimately resulting in a negative experience for the customer.

question:
When I thought about a review I would write for Milio's I thought 'Meh. I've experienced better.' Oh wait, that's Yelp's 2 star indicator.

Well, it's true, I have experienced better - it reminded me of a Jimmy John's copycat. Except the bread was what they give away as 'day old'. I tried the #8 Big Steer and the meats and cheeses used seemed fresh. It was pleasant to eat - but I should be using adjectives like yummy, tasty, scrumptious, and even finger lickin'. But this meal was more or less fulfilling my need to not starve. It was a means to an end.

I do have to congratulate Milio's for their advertising campaign through their countless billboards along the beltline. I knew it was only a matter of time until I stopped in to see why I deserved a Milio's sandwich. It did it's job, it got me to come in, well done.

I won't be returning anytime soon. Oh, and this specific location was doing construction to their floor tiling, not only did I trip on the floor mat that was laying disheveled on the floor but so did the two customers that came in after me. What a lazy job they were doing in there.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer expresses disappointment with their experience at Milio's. They mention that the food was mediocre, the bread seemed stale, and the overall meal was just satisfying their hunger rather than being enjoyable. Additionally, the reviewer criticizes the ongoing construction at the specific location, highlighting safety concerns with a disheveled floor mat causing them and other customers to trip. Overall, the review conveys a sense of dissatisfaction and lackluster experience, leading to a negative sentiment.

question: Great bread!  But I wish the sandwiches were a little bigger.  I got the wheat sub roll with meal deal and it disappeared too quickly...left me hungry!  I guess I'll try the french bread next time.  Maybe it's a little bigger.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the customer found the sandwiches to be too small, which left them hungry after consuming the meal. The mention of the sandwich disappearing too quickly, coupled with the feeling of still being hungry, indicates dissatisfaction with the portion size, resulting in a less positive customer experience. Additionally, the customer is already contemplating trying a larger bread option next time, further emphasizing their disappointment with the current portion size.

question:
I LOVE Milio's. They're for sure my go to sub shop. The delivery range is kind of small so I've never been able to get delivery and can't attest to the speed of that. The pick up is always ready by the time I get there though. I can't remember a time where my order was messed up, but I can't say for certain it hasn't happened. If it has, it hasn't been often enough or much of a hassle.

I used to go to Jimmy John's all the time and thought of Milio's as the lesser version. Man was I wrong. The quality here is much better. I love the bread. The perfect amount of soft insides and hard crust. Occasionally the end is a little harder than I like, but it's not too often. I really recommend getting the bread left in. I find not doing so to be a bit lacking. I can understand the other reviewer's complaints about it not being enough.

They also give you plenty of guacamole! I always feel like other places are a rip off with the amount they give.

Also try the cookies! I love the White Chocolate Chip Macadamia Nut. They're always soft and fresh.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer expresses love for Milio's as their go-to sub shop, highlighting the quality of the food, especially the bread which they describe as having the perfect texture. They appreciate the consistency in their orders and the generous portion sizes, specifically mentioning the generous serving of guacamole. The reviewer also recommends the cookies, showing overall satisfaction with their dining experience.

question: As a former employee (8 years) back when Joe H. owned it and Larry taught me to butcher, it warms my heart that this place is still in existence (I still have my Jay Rath designed butcher paper window sale signs from my last week working there).  I grew up buying mainly candy, but occasionally milk, and eggs for my mother as one of the neighborhood kids/'weasels'.  Great store, great neighborhood.  Best homemade brats in the universe, excellent deli, nice people have always run the place.  I've been/lived all over the United States now, there really isn't a better place to buy the basics than the Regent Food Market, \"Joes\", \"The Little Store\".  It is a slice of Americana that doesn't exist much anymore.  Keep up the great work to everyone that is keeping it ALIVE, goodonya.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer expresses nostalgic fondness for their time as an employee at the store, highlighting personal connections and happy memories associated with the place. They praise the quality of products like homemade brats and emphasize the welcoming atmosphere created by the nice people running the store. The reviewer also appreciates the store's role in the neighborhood and its sense of community, noting that it provides a valuable and unique shopping experience that is hard to find elsewhere. Overall, the review conveys a strong sense of admiration and gratitude for the store and the individuals maintaining its legacy, reflecting a positive sentiment towards the Regent Food Market.

question: It's a Best Western, but among Best Westerns, it's a nice one.  Friendly staff, good pool and exercise facilities.
rationale: The review highlights positive aspects of the Best Western hotel, such as friendly staff and good amenities like the pool and exercise facilities. These factors contribute to a pleasant guest experience, indicating a positive sentiment towards the hotel overall.

question:
Want a room with scary stains and torn carpeting?

Want a "complimentary breakfast" so gross you'll feel like a contestant on Fear Factor?

Want the most incompetent front-desk employees in the history of the world?  

If you answered "yes" to any of those questions, this is the place for you!!!  
If you answered "no", stay at the Madison Hostel.  It's about 10x cheaper and about 1,000x better.
rationale: The sentiment in the review is negative because the reviewer highlights numerous issues with the accommodation, such as scary stains and torn carpeting in the room, a gross complimentary breakfast, and incompetent front desk employees. The overall tone of the review is sarcastic and critical, emphasizing the negative aspects of the experience. Additionally, the reviewer recommends staying at an alternative hostel, further emphasizing their dissatisfaction with the reviewed accommodation.

question:
We were in town for a wedding & stayed here for one night. 

The on-site parking is free & there were plenty of spaces available when we arrived. Check in was fairly painless; we appreciated the front desk guy running after us to give us new room keys as he forgot to program them. Our room was okay, however, the air was not on & it was really muggy. Other than that, our bed & pillows were comfortable and the bathroom was a decent size. 

The breakfast buffet was pretty weak. The eggs were watered down; the hash browns were flavorless; the sausage was alright. The best thing we ate was a bagel. It definitely tasted like a free breakfast. 

This hotel was perfect for what we used it for; sleeping. If our stay was longer than a few hours, we'd have stayed elsewhere.
rationale: The sentiment in this review is negative because the guest experienced multiple issues during their stay at the hotel. These include the inconvenience of having to get new room keys, the uncomfortable room temperature, and the poor quality of the breakfast buffet. The guest also mentions that they would have chosen a different accommodation if their stay was longer, indicating overall dissatisfaction with their experience.

question: The manager was very nice. The pool was nice and deserted as well as the hot tub. The room was fine but NOTHING fancy.\nThe 3 people at the front desk ignored us when we first came in. They were on the phone, but couldn't even give us a nod of acknowledgement. After waiting 10 minutes I tried to check in and I told them we had registered online and we were cashing in our Best Western points. Immediately the man checking us in got a strange look on his face and without saying anything he turned and walked into a closed door behind the desk. I was left feeling confused. When he came back he started to ask us a question and the very rude blonde check in girl interrupted him to say, you can't use those points to pay for a room, that has to be done ahead of time ONLINE. We had just driven 5 hours with 2 wild boys in the car to find out we couldn't stay there? That was what my brain was thinking. I was just really confused and surprised at to why she would get so abrupt and defensive and not even ask us any questions. Oh and she was still on the phone. The timid looking check in guy said the manager would be over to talk to us. He still had not said a word about whether or not we could use our points. I tried to ask him, and he seemed to have absolutely ZERO knowledge of how that worked. Maybe he was in training. My husband travels for work and stays at Best Westerns all of the time. He has never had a problem like this. The manager was extremely nice and we gave him our account/approval number from registering online. He was younger than both of the people at checkout and much more helpful and professional. He got us registered within 10 minutes. I just thought someone should know about this incident. I work with people and would NEVER be so rude to customers as the front desk. They never even smiled and we did not get anywhere until the manager came out. We will not be staying there again.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is negative because the guest had a poor experience with the front desk staff during check-in. Specifically, the guest describes feeling ignored, confused, and surprised by the rude behavior of the staff members, particularly the blonde check-in girl. The lack of customer service, knowledge about loyalty points, and overall unprofessionalism displayed by the front desk staff contributed to the negative experience for the guest. The guest also mentioned that they were only able to resolve their issues and complete the check-in process satisfactorily when the manager intervened. These factors contribute to the overall negative sentiment expressed in the review.

question: I have traveled all over this wonderful country and stayed in many hotels.  This easily ranks among the worst.  The staff is rude, the room has a weird stench if the AC is not on, and the \"breakfast buffet\" in the morning is a regimented affair with coffee canisters empty or spitting some weird, vaguely brown, lukewarm liquid. The staff will thrust a bag with unidentified contents at you if you do not wish to stay in the dirty, cluttered eating area, and tell you this is what you are \"allowed\" to take.  \n\nClearly this establishment benefits mightily from its location, so if there is a hotelier out there reading this I suggest you look into Madison as a likely place to put a comfortable inn.  I am sure I am not the only one who would take advantage of such a alternative.
rationale: The sentiment is Negative because the review describes multiple issues with the hotel, including rude staff, a strange smell in the room, poor quality breakfast offerings, and a lack of hospitality from the staff. The overall tone of the review is discontent and disappointment, highlighting various shortcomings that made the guest's stay unpleasant. The guest also suggests that the establishment benefits mainly from its location rather than its quality of service, further indicating a negative experience.

question: My room was on the top floor at the Highland Club. Fantastic! Very nice rooms. A lounge with free drinks every evening. Chocolate chip cookies. I don't know what the regular floors are like, but if you can swing it, definitely stay at the Highland Club!
rationale: The sentiment is Positive because the review highlights several positive aspects of the Highland Club, such as the fantastic room on the top floor, the very nice rooms, the lounge with free drinks every evening, and the presence of chocolate chip cookies. The reviewer is highly satisfied with their stay and enthusiastically recommends staying at the Highland Club, portraying an overall positive experience.

question: Not at all worth it. Front of the car was not clean at all. Paid an extra $5 to have the wheels cleaned and the brake dust still remained on the rims. Will not be going back
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the customer did not feel that the service provided was satisfactory. Despite paying extra for wheel cleaning, the brake dust was still visible on the rims, and the front of the car was not clean. This led to a disappointing experience for the customer, resulting in the decision not to return to the business.

question: Really terrible service from my mini-detail today. For $53 I got spots on the exterior, a splotch of Armour All on my leather seats that I don't think is going to come out, a pile or grit still around my gas pedal (that also was not cleaned)...all this even after I complained and pointed this out to them.  All they did was ran it through the wash again - only after a bit of back and forth - the manager was actually reluctant to even do that.  No offer to help me out on the cost despite the splotch on my seats,  They actually wanted more money to clean the stuff on the floor.  I certainly will never go back.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the customer had a very unsatisfactory experience with the mini-detail service. The customer paid $53 but received a poor quality service with spots on the exterior, a splotch of Armour All on the leather seats, and dirt still present around the gas pedal. Despite the customer's complaints and pointing out the issues, the manager was reluctant to rectify the situation. The customer did not receive any offer for compensation or assistance, and was even asked for more money to clean additional areas. Overall, the customer was left feeling dissatisfied and unappreciated, leading to a negative sentiment towards the service provider.

question:
I've bought 2 $20 Diamond washes from Octopus and here's my verdict:

+Relatively quick...
+Friendly staff inside

-They will annoy you with a sales pitch
-They only spent 5 minutes on my car and it shows. Spots, cheap wax, and the interior was barely touched, save for a "fragrance" boasting the subtlety of a cherry shoved into my brain. 

I'm buying my own cleaning materials, befriending someone with a hose and cleaning my car myself from now on. I paid $8 for a wash in Atlanta at Cactus Car Wash with better results.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the review highlights several shortcomings of the car wash service, including a pushy sales pitch, rushed job resulting in spots and cheap wax application, minimal interior cleaning, and an overpowering fragrance. The reviewer expresses dissatisfaction with the overall service and results, concluding that they can achieve better outcomes by cleaning the car themselves or visiting a different car wash facility.

question: It was a pretty good and quick job for a ten dollar bill!\nWe'll be back, that's for sure.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the customer explicitly mentioned that the job was good and quick for the cost of ten dollars, indicating they felt the service provided was worth the price. Additionally, the statement "We'll be back, that's for sure" suggests they were satisfied and intend to return, reflecting a positive overall experience.

question: I recently purchased a used car that was a great deal, but super filthy and reeked of cigarette smoke so  I decided to have the interior detailed and steam cleaned. At first I thought the price was ridiculous, but they spent nearly three hours on my car and the results were fantastic.  I didn't think it was possible for them to get rid of the smell in one cleaning, but the interior looks and smells new. The staff was also friendly and the place was clean. I have had issues with other octopus locations before, but this one seems like a good spot.
rationale: The review expresses overall satisfaction with the interior detailing service, highlighting the positive aspects such as the fantastic results, the removal of the cigarette smoke smell, the clean and new look of the interior, and the friendly staff. The reviewer initially had doubts about the price but found that the quality of service justified it, which indicates a positive experience overall. The acknowledgement of past issues at other locations but the positive experience at this particular one further supports the positive sentiment.

question: no appt possible for detailing on weekends!!!!!   this is how this business's advertising should read.  always call ahead on weekends for detailing!!!!!!!
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the customer is frustrated that the business does not offer appointments for detailing services on weekends, which is likely inconvenient for them. Additionally, the customer feels that the business should clearly communicate this limitation in their advertising to avoid any misunderstandings. The excessive use of exclamation points also conveys a sense of frustration and dissatisfaction.

question: I brought my car & was conned into getting the \"express detail\" for 29.99(on sale from 39.99)..they didn't explain that didn't include the wSh so when I went to pay it was $53...ok fine....sign says it takes 15 minutes... 45 minutes later I knew something was up & went to see... Upon seeing me coming they told me it was finished... I noticed a film on front 1/4panel & door....I asked them to wipe down but it wouldn't come off.. Manager comes out says it must have been on there when I brought it in...I told him the car is a month old & the film  wasn't there when I came in...  Then a detailer comes over & tries some wax on it & it seemed to do the trick but they told me I would have to pay extra AND make an appointment for the wax job as they didn't cause the film... Bottom line is the manager is a meathead & this place blows.\n\nUpdate.... Now I notice there are 20-30 nats or maybe fleas on the inside of windshield... This place is terrible...
rationale: The sentiment of the review is negative because the customer had a poor experience at the car detailing service. They felt like they were misled about the pricing and services included, were dissatisfied with the quality of the detailing job, and encountered unhelpful and dismissive responses from the manager and staff when trying to address the issues. The presence of insects inside the car further added to their dissatisfaction. Overall, the customer's negative interactions and perceptions of the service contributed to their negative sentiment.

question: Managers name is Damion Diitsch... The meatiest of meatheads.. There are fleas in my car from the guys doing the interior too...morons.......they took 45 minutes to perform the\"express detail \" they say will take 5 minutes. On top of that they do an overall CRAP job and do nothing to resolve the issue hen brought to their attention. MY PREVIOUS REVIEW WAS LENGTHY & SPECIFIC BUT IT WS TAKEN DOWN BY YELP. COULD THE RUMORS BE TRUE THAT THEY PROTECT CERTAIN CLIENTELE FROM BAD REVIEWS? Say it ain't so.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is negative because the user expresses frustration and disappointment with the service provided by the manager and employees of the car detailing business. The user uses strong language such as "meatiest of meatheads" and "morons" to describe the employees, indicating a lack of respect and dissatisfaction with the quality of work. Additionally, the user mentions that the service took much longer than advertised and was poorly done, leading to an overall negative experience. The user's mention of a previous detailed and specific negative review being taken down by Yelp suggests a lack of transparency and accountability, further contributing to the negative sentiment expressed in the review.

question: I used to go to Mermaid and thought they were ok, but then I came here. The washes are definitely way better. They do a much better job at cleaning the interior. I've never gotten anything over the $30 range, so I'm not really sure how the detailing is. The waiting area is really nice and comfortable. They're usually pretty fast, but can get really clogged up during busy hours. I still end up touching up after they're done, but I usually don't have to do much.
rationale: The review overall highlights several positive aspects of the car wash, such as the better cleaning quality compared to a previous option, a nice and comfortable waiting area, and generally fast service. The reviewer also mentions that they usually don't have to do much touch-up after the car wash, which implies satisfaction with the results. These positive points contribute to an overall positive sentiment in the review.

question:
Stopped by for the Deluxe Wash Package, which should include basics like vacuuming floors and mats, and wiping down interior surfaces. 

After the wash, I was disappointed to find the same dirt and debris between and on the seats, floor mats haphazardly placed back in the car (mine attach with velcro, so it's quite easy to get right if you spend two seconds on it), and smudges on the dash where there had been none before. 

Overall it was a terrible car wash. When I politely told the manager, my concerns were met with excuses and no apology was given. "Next time, if you want the seats wiped down, you need to get the Diamond Package or make an appointment in our detail center."

He agreed to have an employee re-do the interior. The second time they got it right but I still wouldn't recommend this place.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the customer expressed dissatisfaction with the car wash service they received. They highlighted specific issues, such as dirt left on the seats and floors, haphazard placement of floor mats, and smudges on the dashboard. Additionally, the lack of a proper apology from the manager and the suggestion that a higher-priced package was needed for basic cleaning tasks contributed to the negative experience. Overall, the customer did not have a satisfactory experience and would not recommend the place to others.

question: Run by college students for college students. Which is good if you are a UW student, bad for everyone else. I have seen fellow students get fat sandwiches and extras for no extra cost. While the rest of the world gets a skinny sandwich and crap service.\nI only go here if I have no other choice. I suggest going down the road to University Station and hit the Subway there. Better service and sandwiches.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer experienced unfair treatment at the restaurant, witnessing UW students receiving preferential treatment and extra food for free while non-UW customers received inferior service and less food. This differential treatment left the reviewer feeling dissatisfied and frustrated with the restaurant's service and offerings, prompting them to suggest alternative dining options.

question: OH DEAR GOD. Someone please teach the employees here how to better scrub the toilets. I almost lost my appetite after using the women's restroom.\n\nThis Subway has NOT been closed as may have been reported by other Yelpers (I was just there on Friday), but may be it should be.
rationale: The sentiment in this review is negative because the customer had a negative experience using the women's restroom at the Subway. They expressed disgust at the cleanliness of the toilets, mentioning that it almost made them lose their appetite. The tone of the review also suggests that the customer believes the employees should improve their cleaning practices and that the restaurant may need to be closed down due to sanitation issues. Overall, the review conveys dissatisfaction and a sense of disappointment with the cleanliness standards at the Subway location.

question: 30 minutes is just too long to wait for wings and it still didn't look like my order was coming so no thanks.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the customer experienced a long wait time of 30 minutes for their order, which is deemed unacceptable for a seemingly simple food item like wings. Additionally, the customer expressed frustration that even after waiting for that duration, there was still uncertainty about whether their order was coming, indicating a lack of clear communication or service efficiency, further adding to their dissatisfaction.

question: I used tatman's to have a few small scratches removed.  The workmanship was alright but the customer service was mediocre at best.  It took many visits to ensure the job was done correctly.  I would recommend you look elsewhere for better service.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the review mentions mediocre customer service and the need for multiple visits to ensure the job was done correctly. These factors typically indicate a lack of efficiency, inconvenience for the customer, and overall dissatisfaction with the service provided by the business. Additionally, the recommendation to look elsewhere for better service further emphasizes the negative sentiment.

question:
Stay away from this worst place. I went there to straighten my car body frame and their quote was in line with other body shops in the area. But, it has taken them nearly 2 weeks to make a repair that should have only taken them 2 day as they promised.  Every time I was told the vehicle would be done, it wasn't. I had to call them on the days they claimed it would be done. When finally, the repaired my body frame, they fractured my windshield but they didn't informed me about it. But, luckily we noticed the crack on the windshield before leaving their premise eventhough it was raining heavily.
 
When I asked about the broken windshield initially they refused to agree and went on to stay it was broken when I left the vehicle. Since I had photo evidence they don't want to continue their "story". Finally, they agreed that the broken windshield was their mistake but they asked me to pay extra $ 200 for their mistake. 

After a very long heated argument I paid nearly $ 80 for new windshield since I want to get back my car from these guys. Look elsewhere for body work especially if you are an international scholar otherwsie take picture of your vehicle before leaving over there.
rationale: The sentiment in the review is negative because the customer had a bad experience at the body shop. The repair took much longer than promised, there was a lack of communication about delays and additional damages, such as the fractured windshield. The customer also had to bear the cost for the repair caused by the shop's mistake, resulting in frustration and a heated argument. Additionally, the shop's initial denial of responsibility for the broken windshield added to the negative experience. Overall, the customer felt dissatisfied with the service and the handling of the situation by the body shop, prompting them to warn others to seek alternative options for body work.

question: Mark and the folks at Tatman's turned what could have been a major hassle into a minor inconvenience. I was only without my car for a week, and the on-site Hertz service took care of me. My car looks great and my inconvenience was minimal. Highly recommended.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer had a generally good experience with Tatman's. They mentioned that what could have been a major hassle was turned into a minor inconvenience, and they were without their car for only a week. The fact that the on-site Hertz service took care of them, the car looked great, and the inconvenience was minimal all contribute to a positive review. The reviewer also highly recommended the service, indicating a positive overall experience.

question: Got my rear bumper 'fixed' there and a couple weeks after I got the car back, I noticed that the paint was cracked and chipping in four different places across the bumper.  They also forgot to put the fuel tank rubber seal back after fixing fender.  The lady looked at the bumper and said that someone probably hit my bumper and they don't cover chips caused by outside sources.  There was absolutely no sign of bumper flexing or denting and regardless, the paint was chipping way too much to have been properly done.  She also said I couldn't verify they were at fault for losing the rubber seal so it wasn't their problem.  And then she just went back inside.  Save yourself of dealing with a crappy maaco-grade paint job and a good-for-nothing \"lifetime quality guarantee\" and invest in a quality shop.  \nTook my other car to gallo-miller and it was much, much better quality of workmanship and customer service.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer had a poor experience with the auto body shop. The customer received subpar repair work with cracked and chipping paint on the bumper, as well as a missing rubber seal. The shop did not take responsibility for these issues and provided unsatisfactory customer service, leading the reviewer to caution others against using their services. The comparison to another shop where the reviewer had a much better experience further reinforces the negative sentiment towards this particular auto body shop.

question:
The best in town for tire services!  They have repaired tires for me twice and also put on new tires.  They are always very friendly, honest and low-key, not pushy salespeople at all.  The work was great and done very quickly.  I feel like I can trust their input.

They most recently repaired a tire for me that a larger chain store in town insisted was beyond repair.  I had gone to the larger store because it was Sunday and Urbana Tire was closed.  Through a series of events, it became clear that they were dishonest and only interested in selling tires at all costs, so I opted to wait to visit Urbana Tire on Monday when they opened.  They were perplexed by the diagnosis by the other shop of needing a new tire when the only issue was a screw about a half an inch inch long.  They fixed it quickly and put on 2 new tires, taking the time to explain my options and not at all pushing for the top of the line.

As good as it gets!! :-)
rationale: The sentiment of the review is positive because the reviewer praises the tire services provided by Urbana Tire. They highlight the friendliness, honesty, and efficiency of the staff, as well as their quick and high-quality work. The reviewer also expresses trust in the shop's input and appreciates the fact that they were not pushy in trying to upsell. Additionally, the comparison with a larger chain store that was perceived as dishonest further emphasizes the positive experience at Urbana Tire. Overall, the reviewer's glowing recommendation and use of phrases like "As good as it gets!! :-)" indicate a highly positive sentiment towards Urbana Tire's services.

question: got a great mani-pedi here the other day. big plus was that although their hours sign on the front door said they closed at 7, they stayed open to accomodate anyone who came in, even when someone called at 7:30 and asked if they could still come in and get their nails done. \n\nthe pedi didn't seem as thorough as the usual pedi is, but overall it was a great experience and my nails look fab. i'll definitely be back in the future.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer had a great experience overall despite a minor issue with the thoroughness of the pedicure. The flexibility and accommodating nature of the salon staff standing out, going above and beyond to provide service beyond their regular hours further adds to the positive sentiment. The reviewer's enthusiasm to return in the future and satisfaction with the results ('nails look fab') indicate that they had a positive and enjoyable visit overall.

question:
Oh boy. Where do I begin?

This place is awful. I went here with a friend.  We both received terrible service. There was only 2 workers, and about 5 people getting feet and nails done when we first walked in. We waited FOREVER before they actually got to our pedicures.

25 dollars for a pedicure basically included cutting the skin under by big toe where I was bleeding the whole time, barely scrubbing with the pumice stone, you had to ask to have the nails clipped, and oh yes, nails are totally crooked. The pedicure lasted about 10 minutes, and no scrubbing or exfoliating. They halfass the lotion massage and throw in 1 hot rock, which was actually burning my leg and not very enjoyable. 
And I cannot leave out that my friend did not even receive the lotion massage and hot rock until after her toes had already been painted!

Only reason we came here was because our regular place, Pro Nails down Philo is closed on Mondays. That place is great! And its only 21 dollars.  

Do NOT come here, you will be greatly disappointed.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is Negative because the customer had a terrible experience at the nail salon. They had to wait a long time for their pedicures, which turned out to be rushed and poorly done. The service was subpar, with inadequate scrubbing, crooked nails, and a painful hot rock treatment. Additionally, the friend did not receive the full treatment they paid for. The customer felt disappointed and even compared the experience unfavorably to another salon they usually visit. Overall, the review highlights multiple aspects of dissatisfaction, leading to a clear negative sentiment.

question: Overpriced and poor quality.  For 38 dollars for a mani-pedi, I'd expect not to get burned by the hot stones or have my manicure chip within hours.  It's been 48 hours and there is NO indication that I ever had a manicure, since my polish is gone and my cuticles are still ragged.  Pedicure was decent except for the aforementioned too-hot stones.  There are lots of other places in Champaign-Urbana that charge less for a better experience -- go there!
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the customer expressed dissatisfaction with the service received at the nail salon. They mentioned feeling that the services were overpriced for the quality provided, experiencing issues such as being burned by hot stones, chipped manicure, and poor longevity of the polish. Additionally, the customer highlighted that other options in the area offer better experiences at lower prices, indicating a preference for alternatives.

question:
Dr. Curt Thurman is my hero.

I trust Curt with my pets completely.  He is absolutely wonderful with the animals and treats them with as much care and compassion as if they were his own.  He explains everything and the reasons for it; never have I felt in the dark about what was going on.  Our dog has had some pretty serious health problems as she's gotten older, and having Curt as our vet made the process of dealing with everything a lot easier for me.  He offers wonderful advice on all things pet and is great about making himself available to answer questions if you call with a concern.

The staff is great as well.  They are super-friendly, very helpful and my dog loves them.  Actually, my dog loves everything about Caring Hands.  She actually gets excited when we drive in the direction of the clinic and literally drags me in the door when we arrive because she is so excited to visit herCaring Hands friends.

I can't say enough wonderful things about this clinic.  I dread graduating and moving from the area because I know I it will be impossible to find another vet that comes anywhere near the quality of Caring Hands.
rationale: The sentiment in the review is positive because the reviewer expresses deep appreciation and admiration for Dr. Curt Thurman and the staff at Caring Hands clinic. They praise Dr. Thurman's care, compassion, and expertise in treating their pets, particularly during serious health issues. The reviewer also highlights the staff's friendliness and helpfulness, noting that even their dog enjoys visiting the clinic. Overall, the reviewer has a strong bond with the veterinary team at Caring Hands and finds their services invaluable, which clearly indicates a positive sentiment.

question: My fiance and I took our dog here during an emergency and were turned away because the vet was busy eating lunch.  This place is only a few blocks from our home and we rushed to the nearest place possible because our dog was having a seizure and was unable to stand up.   We were told drive to the university emergency pet clinic which is a ten minute drive.  The vet also had a lot of appointments coming and was \"very busy\".  There was not a single car in the parking lot nor a single room occupied. \n\nWe pleaded with them to at least check his vitals and make sure he would be OK, they again turned us down.  I cannot speak to the quality of either the vets there because we were never given a chance to see them.  The staff was unprofessional.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer had a negative experience when seeking emergency care for their dog. The fact that they were turned away during an emergency situation due to the vet being busy eating lunch, and were directed to drive to another clinic while their dog was in distress, reflects a lack of compassion and urgency on the part of the staff. Additionally, the refusal to even check the dog's vitals when requested further adds to the negative sentiment. The perceived unprofessionalism of the staff also contributes to the overall negative experience described in the review.

question: I never rate on here but I came to this vet because of the ratings. Although initially we loved the doctors and everything, they told us our dog was OCD and sent us home. I'm fairly certain my dog has severe allergies now. Here is the thing I'm upset about though. We were there 2 weeks ago. I just saw a worm in my dog's poop. I called to ask them about it and they said \"Oh, your dog tested positive for roundworms when your brought him in\" THEY NEVER CALLED ME. I was never notified or given any treatment for it!!!!!!!!!! It may have gotten even worse because of their negligence. I will never go back here. No matter how nice everyone is.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the customer experienced a lack of communication and follow-up from the vet clinic regarding their dog's health condition. Not being informed about a positive test result for roundworms and not receiving any treatment for it can lead to frustration and a feeling of neglect towards the clinic. Additionally, the customer's concerns about their dog potentially suffering from severe allergies were not addressed, adding to their dissatisfaction with the overall experience.

question: These East-coast bagel gurus give good bread!  Grab a box of a dozen, don't even think too hard about the flavors because they're all great, and any cream cheese will be perfect.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer had a great experience with the bagels from the East-coast bagel shop. They appreciate the quality of the bread, the variety of flavors available, and the recommendation that any cream cheese will complement the bagels well. The reviewer's enthusiastic tone and overall satisfaction indicate a positive sentiment towards the bagel gurus and their products.

question:
Bagelman's is closed.

Regardless, I'll give them a posthumous review:  WHY OH WHY did you have to change?  You had wonderful NY-style water bagels.  Crusty on the outside, yet dense and soft on the inside.  I would have happily given you five stars just for your plain bagel.

But then you changed.

You closed your bagel factory and started shipping them in from some crap food distributor.  They had the consistency of cardboard and no flavor.  None.  Even the blueberry bagels:  they were purple, like there might be a hint of berry flavor, but no.

You might as well have bought square ones.  At least you could market that.  (Squagles!)

But I'm proud of you for closing up shop right after you started sucking.  It was the honorable thing to do, so you get two stars.
rationale: The sentiment in the review is negative because the customer expresses disappointment and frustration with the decline in quality of Bagelman's bagels. They initially loved the NY-style water bagels for their crusty yet soft texture and flavor, but were let down when the bagel quality deteriorated after the business changed their production method. The customer laments the loss of the delicious bagels they once enjoyed and criticizes the new cardboard-like consistency and lack of flavor in the shipped-in bagels. Overall, the customer's experience with the new bagels was extremely disappointing, resulting in a negative sentiment towards the establishment.

question: Friendly, prompt service. I told them I needed to be done in 30 minutes and not only were they able to do it, they also kept an eye on the clock for me. The pedicure included callous removal and a massage. Highly recommended!
rationale: The reviewer mentioned friendly and prompt service, indicating a positive experience with the staff. Additionally, the fact that the service provider was able to accommodate the customer's time constraint and included extra services like callous removal and a massage adds value to the overall experience. The reviewer's recommendation also indicates satisfaction with the service received.

question: I live in Chicago but whenEVER I'm in town I get my nails did here!!!  It's clean and everyone is good.  I love the No Chip Mani!!  Wish I could find a place this good in Chicago, but it hasn't happened!
rationale: The sentiment expressed in the review is positive because the user is enthusiastic about their experience at the nail salon. They praise the cleanliness of the salon, the skills of the staff, and their love for the No Chip Manicure service. Additionally, the user expresses a desire to find a similar salon in Chicago, indicating a positive overall experience at the current salon.

question: I love Pro Nails.  Best nail salon in C-U area.  Very reasonably priced also.  My friend and I are regulars there for pedicures and they know our names and even got us cute little Christmas Presents this year.  Love it here!  Highly highly recommended.  Oh and the hot stone massage during pedis is FABULOUS.
