question: Ned Kelly's is your normal steak house. I had a very good Filet here once though! The bread they bring you before the meal is great along with a nice fresh salad! The best part of the whole place is the skillet cookie-I highly suggest ordering this while dining here!
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer highlights several positive aspects of their dining experience at Ned Kelly's steakhouse. They mention enjoying a very good filet, compliment the bread and salad, and highly recommend trying the skillet cookie. These positive comments indicate that the reviewer had an overall enjoyable and satisfying dining experience at the restaurant.

question: Closed, now called The Timbers.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the establishment has closed down, indicating a loss of business and possibly disappointing experiences for customers who enjoyed the place when it was open.

question: Gross man!  The food is tasteless slop and will only add about five cholesterol points to your day.  Not impressed with the granny bait store either.  The service is friendly, so at least the people who made you come here understand civility.
rationale: The review expresses dissatisfaction with the food, describing it as tasteless slop and implying it is unhealthy. The mention of adding cholesterol points suggests a negative impact on health. Additionally, the reference to the store being described as "granny bait" conveys a negative perception of the overall ambiance. Despite friendly service, the overall tone of the review suggests disappointment and lack of satisfaction, leading to a negative sentiment.

question:
I love Cracker Barrel for Sunday morning, on the way out of Champaign food. Great way to end the weekend. All the food is good, esp the hash brown casserole, but we all knew that. 

I'm reviewing especially for service. Twice now, we've been with parties of at least 10. This past weekend? 14! Both times, we've been seated without much wait (no wait this past weekend...and who would expect no wait for 14...at a breakfast place...on Sunday), been served quickly, been given separate checks without a second word, and just had a totally painless experience. Orders are all correct, food prepared well for what it is. Good times. This past visit...3 of us went to put names in for everyone, expecting a wait, and they pushed a huge table together, and sat the scouting party, letting them just wait for everyone else to show up. All service I guess I wouldn't expect from a run of the mill, always busy breakfast place. 

So - visit this Cracker Barrel without fear. Order Grandma's French Toast.
rationale: The sentiment in this review is positive because the reviewer has had consistently excellent experiences at the Cracker Barrel location they visited. The reviewer praises the efficient and accommodating service, especially during busy times with large parties. The mention of being seated quickly, receiving separate checks without issue, and having orders served correctly demonstrates a smoothly run operation that goes above and beyond the reviewer's expectations. Overall, the review conveys a sense of satisfaction and enjoyment, making it a positive evaluation of the restaurant.

question:
Perhaps I have overstayed my welcome. Lately the sides have been awful. Last night I ordered hash brown casserole, pinto beans and okra. The okra and casserole were cold. I asked my server if I could get some fresh hash brown casserole because it was cold and crunchy. He said that was fine and he brought me more casserole that was so very obviously microwaved. It was the same casserole but now was steaming hot and tasteless. Obvious signs of microwaved reheating. That in my opinion is really poor customer service. 

Other visits I have had reheated green beans (dark green and mushy), cold okra, dried pinto beans and cold corn. It's hit or miss and I am getting tired of it. And to top it off the servers act like it's such a pain to take it back. 

The country store is still as good as it ever was and the people that work there are very friendly.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the customer expresses dissatisfaction with the quality of the food they received at the restaurant. They mention multiple instances of cold, reheated, and tasteless dishes, as well as poor customer service from the server. The overall experience seems to be consistently disappointing, leading the customer to feel tired of the hit-or-miss meals. The negative sentiment is further emphasized by the customer feeling like it's a hassle for the servers to address their complaints.

question:
This was probably first time at a Cracker Barrel in maybe 3-4 years. I've always have eaten here with people in number more than myself. Today... that was not the case.

This store looks like all other CB store I've been to. No big deal there. Nice flowers out front. Picture included. Also is the great triangular golf tee  game that normally takes between 3-7 times of playing it before 1 tee remains when no plays are possible. Picture of that too.

The salad was great!  Their first try with the rib eye ... had to go back. I ordered MEDIUM..it arrived WELL DONE. They'll get it right next time. NOT! Strike 2. Sheesh! This one was MEDIUM WELL. 

With two steaks sent back, I'm not exactly getting the royal treatment. My coke was empty. Just now replaced. 

Steak #3 arrived ... aaaaand ... RARE! Well, this one can go back for another try. I think this breaks a record for me. I've sent steaks back twice to get a good one on the 3rd try. Never has it ever taken this many attempts to get it right.

The food so far has been tasty. It's obvious they don't get a lot of practice at cooking steaks with everything else on the menu.

Ok.. received the steak and .. close enough. It was cooked on the high end of medium. The steak was kinda ... meh ... not great nor bad. There wasn't a good steak flavor as I'd expect from a restaurant . I think I'd have done better had i gone to Sam's, bought 3x the steaks for twice the price and cooked them at home. They also replaced my baked potato because i had the same one all the way thru the replacement steaks. The baked potato was delivered piping hot. When i eat one, i consume the whole potato was.. skin and all. During the eating of it, i there were parts of the skin that seemed a bit tough like it had been microwaved. Normal baked potato don't exhibit that kind of toughness near the ends of naked taters.

All in all, I'm quite a bit disappointed with this visit. I might give them another try at a steak at a later date.  Probably not soon. I'll stick with something i normally get like fried chicken or pot roast.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is negative because the customer experienced multiple issues with their meal, particularly with the steak they ordered. Despite sending the steak back three times, it was still not cooked to their liking. Additionally, the customer felt that the steak lacked flavor and was not up to their expectations for a restaurant meal. The lack of attention to detail and consistency in the food preparation led to a disappointing dining experience.

question: I've eaten here numerous times.  It's a favorite of our children.  The wait staff is a bit iffy sometimes, but the food has always been consistent.  They have the cutest gift shop and their prices are great!
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the individual highlights that the food at the restaurant has always been consistent, making it a favorite of their children. Additionally, they mention that the prices are great and appreciate the presence of a cute gift shop. Despite some issues with the wait staff, the overall positive experiences with the food and ambiance contribute to a positive sentiment.

question: If you like catfish, get the fried catfish plate! You won't be dissapointed.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer highly recommends the fried catfish plate, expressing satisfaction with the dish. The use of "you won't be disappointed" implies that the reviewer had a positive experience and enjoyed the catfish, likely indicating that the dish is delicious and worth trying.

question: DO NOT GO TO THIS RESTAURANT IF YOU ARE A PERSON OF COLOR.  The manager, I believe of indian or Syrian decent is one of the most prejudice individuals I have ever met in my entire life.  His attitude is discussing.  Please join me in boycotting this establishment.  I will never, ever eat here again.  Nasty, despicable place. I will forever let any person who will listen to me know that this place is a throwback to Jim Crow days.
rationale: The sentiment expressed in the review is negative because the reviewer had a very unpleasant experience at the restaurant, specifically mentioning encountering prejudice from the manager due to the reviewer's race. The reviewer expresses their strong disapproval of the manager's behavior and the overall atmosphere of the establishment, vowing never to return and encouraging others to boycott the restaurant as well. This negative sentiment is based on their perception of discrimination and mistreatment they experienced, leading to a strong and critical opinion of the restaurant.

question: I've been taking pets here for several years after a bad experience with another vet. These vets do not require unnecessary tests on every visit, don't act like you hate your pet if you don't want to spend endless money on tests and such (my last vet wanted me to spend $1800 to run a test to MAYBE DIAGNOSE - not TREAT - my elderly cat). They are caring, realistic and competent. It took me a long time to find a vet I liked and I will definitely stick with and continue to recommend this place.\nMy only suggestion is that they learn to treat chickens. Urbana allows chickens and it would be very nice to be able to take my girls there as well.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer had a bad experience with another vet in the past and switched to this particular vet, whom they found to be caring, realistic, and competent. The reviewer appreciates that the vets at this practice do not require unnecessary tests on every visit and are understanding if pet owners are mindful of excessive costs. Their loyalty to the vet, willingness to continue recommending the practice, and desire for additional services for their chickens all indicate a positive overall experience.

question:
I have been taking my pet cats here for four years.  I have been satisfied with any vet and any assistant that has seen my cats.  They aren't all gushy over my animals, but they do a good job of making them comfortable.  

The vets are honest and don't beat around the bush.  Cat's got fleas?  They tell me to take care of it and how.  That's cool with me because I hate to be coddled.  

I feel like the prices are fine, although I don't have much to compare them to.  Let's just say I don't feel like I'm being taken advantage of.

I do recommend this place.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer expresses satisfaction with the veterinarians and assistants they have interacted with over the four years of visiting the clinic. They appreciate the honesty of the vets in addressing issues like fleas and providing guidance on how to handle them. The reviewer also feels comfortable with the pricing and overall does not feel taken advantage of, leading them to recommend the clinic to others. The positive experiences and trust in the clinic's services contribute to the overall positive sentiment expressed in the review.

question: This is where I take my car when I need a real mechanic (I *so* do not qualify) that does honest work for a reasonable price.  \n\nThey guys there have been unfailingly cool, honest, and affordable but it's also good to know that you're less likely to get screwed here than at a locallly-owned or non-chain joint because they have a corporate structure to complain to if need be.  But like I said, this is unlikely.  Find value, fo real tho!
rationale: The review expresses satisfaction and trust in the services provided by the mechanic shop. The reviewer appreciates the honesty, affordability, and professionalism of the staff, highlighting the fact that they have had positive experiences consistently. Additionally, the assurance that there is a corporate structure to address any issues if needed adds a layer of reassurance. Overall, the review conveys a positive sentiment due to the quality service received, making it a good recommendation for others seeking reliable car repair services.

question: SEWWWWWWWWWEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEE.......\n\nI grew up coming to this Farm and Fleet. I still buy Keys coveralls from this place for under thirty bucks. Work n Sport boots that last forever... and well... anything I could ever need. They sell anything from horse-bits, saddles, tires, carburetors, Red Rider BB guns, boots, bikes, sledgehammers, chainsaws, any carpentry or automotive tool, heavy bags, horse food, mudflaps with stripper silhouettes, stereo equip...etc...etc... they have a full service auto department that has good deals on services too so you can shop around and play with the power tool displays or make things out of the pvc fittings while you're waiting. Man, I love this place.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer is expressing genuine fondness and appreciation for Farm and Fleet. They mention specific products that they have consistently purchased and found to be of good quality and value. The reviewer highlights the store's wide range of products and services, as well as the enjoyable shopping experience they have had there over the years, including the full-service auto department and interactive displays. Overall, the reviewer's enthusiastic tone and expression of love for the store indicate a positive sentiment.

question:
soooo, it has been over two years since my last review... the service at farm and fleet's small engine repair no longer meets my standards.

last year i took an MTD mower in with a leaking fuel line.  i asked for the fuel line to be replaced, and when i returned to pick up the mower... a complete tune up had been done.  i was anticipating a 20-30 bill for labor and hose, instead i got $70+ bill for a tune up i never asked for.  ok, i got hosed, payed up and the mower ran fine.

this year i took my Yard Machine weedeater in for a new starter pull cord.  that's it, just a starter pull cord because the current one is frayed.... so i get charged 15 bucks which will apply to the repairs later.  i think to myself " what's there to look at, just replace the starter pull cord.    sooooo, i wait...  10 days, no call from farm and fleet.... so i call them.  they tell me it'll be two weeks and an additional $45 before they get to my weedeater repaired! 

WHAT?  i'll come pick it up.

learn from my errors, find somewhere else for your small engine repair work.

i went on-line and bought the replacement parts for 15 bucks.  i should have done that first.
rationale: The sentiment in the review is negative because the customer expresses dissatisfaction with the service received at the small engine repair shop. They felt that they were overcharged for services they did not request, experienced delays in repairs without proper communication, and ultimately decided to source replacement parts themselves rather than continue dealing with the shop. The customer's frustration and disappointment with the lack of transparency, unnecessary services, and extended wait times contribute to the negative sentiment expressed in the review.

question: More expensive than walmart, menards....\nNot really a \"Farm\" person. Went there when I got a coupon in the mail.
rationale: The sentiment is Negative because the user expresses dissatisfaction with the prices at the store, stating that they are more expensive compared to Walmart and Menards. Additionally, the user mentions that they are not a "Farm" person, indicating that the store may not cater to their preferences or needs. The overall tone of the review suggests disappointment and lack of enthusiasm about the store experience.

question: I get my hair cut at these types of places and i rotate all the time. There is a guy here - mildly creepy and blatently prompting you for gossip. I'm sure he and so many other stylists get a ton of it but i could tell he was prompting me for it. No thanks. When i want to put people on blast i'll do it myself.
rationale: The sentiment expressed in the review is negative because the user had a negative experience with a stylist who they found to be mildly creepy and blatantly trying to prompt them for gossip. The user did not appreciate this behavior and felt uncomfortable, leading them to have a negative opinion of the stylist and the overall experience at the salon.

question:
I've been going to Long's Garage for about 5 years now and have been very happy with their service.  They've always been honest with me.  The prices are comparable to other shops. The repairs are done quickly and professionally.  My truck is 16 years old, yet it drives like it's only a few years old thanks to Long's. 

The only criticism I would have would be if you need something done with a truck topper.  I didn't know what to do with the rubber seal that was falling off.  Their body work person offered to epoxy it, but that didn't stay on very long.  I didn't know at the time that I could get a new seal at Truck Trends in Champaign.
 
Something that really impressed me though was how honest their detail person was about the state of the paint on my truck.  I wasn't sure how salvageable it was, and he was honest in telling me that my paint was too thin to try polish on (would rub the last of the paint off), but he did give me some recommendations on how to keep what paint I have left on the truck for years to come.  I followed the recommendations and get compliments on how good my truck looks all the time.  What impressed me was that the detail person didn't try to convince me of paying him for things that might not have helped or made my paint situation worse.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is positive because the reviewer has expressed satisfaction with Long's Garage's service overall. They appreciate the honesty, professionalism, and timely repairs provided by the staff. Despite a minor issue with truck topper repair, the reviewer highlights the exceptional honesty of the detail person when discussing the truck's paint condition. The reviewer's truck drives well, and they have received helpful advice on maintaining its appearance. These positive experiences illustrate a strong level of satisfaction with Long's Garage.

question:
Easily the best garage in Chambana. I went to Midas in Champaign and was told my car was in serious danger because the brakes we are less than 10% pads. I was also told my left front strut was blown (this was true). The quote was 850 for the brakes and caliper service and 1050 for the struts as they have to replace both (also true). I told them I simply couldn't afford it and instantly the offer for their overpriced credit was made.

I left and decided to try my hand at a local garage. Long's did not disappoint. I was seen immediately and given a cost of almost half what Midas quoted for the strut and then told that my pads had 50% left and calipers were fine and could easily and safely drive for quite some time on them. They offered me rides to and from my home and found ways to discount and save parts like the strut strike plate and charge less for labor. Rudy, who I did my service with, was given a handshake and the promise that I now have my permanent mechanic: Long's Garage

PLEASE bring your car in to Long's!
rationale: The sentiment in this review is positive because the customer had a significantly better experience at Long's Garage compared to Midas in Champaign. They were grateful for the honest assessment of their car's condition, the cost-saving recommendations, immediate service, and the overall excellent customer service provided by Rudy. The customer expressed confidence in Long's Garage and even stated that they have found their permanent mechanic there, showcasing a high level of satisfaction and trust.

question: Clean and polite and punctual. However, after supposedly fixing the furnace, it quit working that evening and they were closed for the weekend.  Had to call in another company who did fix the furnace.  Was still charged full amount by Ray's.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the service provided by Ray's resulted in the furnace not working after it was supposedly fixed, leading to inconvenience and the need to hire another company to resolve the issue. Additionally, the fact that the customer was still charged the full amount despite the problem not being completely resolved adds to their dissatisfaction.

question: Overpriced.  The taste was barely average, but a large plain cost over $14, so Monical's fails the cost-benefit analysis.  Complaints about the service are well-founded, as we had a pick-up order and it took 3-4 minutes of standing at the counter for anybody to even wait on us.\n\nI ordered the thin crust pizza, and won't return to Monical's, so I address only the thin crust.  The pizza was pretty bland, despite a hefty helping of oregano.  There is very little sauce, fairly dry cheese, and a chewy crust.  Heed other reviewers' advice and get the dipping sauce, because you will need it.
rationale: The sentiment is Negative because the review highlights several key shortcomings of the restaurant experience, such as overpricing, below-average taste, poor service, and bland food. The customer expresses dissatisfaction with the quality of the pizza, commenting on the lack of sauce, dry cheese, and chewy crust. Additionally, the mention of needing dipping sauce to enhance the flavor suggests that the overall pizza experience fell short of expectations. These factors collectively contribute to a negative sentiment towards Monical's in the review.

question: The pizza is pretty good, but not the best in Champaign-Urbana. I prefer Papa Del's. I know it's a different style of Pizza, but for the money, Papa Del's is still better.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because despite the reviewer mentioning that the pizza they tried is not the absolute best in Champaign-Urbana, they still acknowledge that it is pretty good. They also express a preference for Papa Del's, indicating that they have a specific favorite but still find the reviewed pizza to be enjoyable. Overall, the review suggests that the pizza being discussed is decent and provides good value for the money, which is a positive assessment.

question: Went here after a doctors appointment one day. The pizza was good. The small salad wasn't their best. The service sucked. The waitress didn't give us refills and nothing was clean. She gave us our check but never came back to take our money. My husband almost walked out after being ignored at the desk by many waitresses that still wouldn't take our money. Finally, the manager did. I will not be back because of the horrible service.
rationale: The sentiment is Negative because the customer experienced poor service at the restaurant. They mentioned that the waitress did not provide refills, the place was not clean, and there was a lack of attention to customers. Additionally, the customer's husband had to wait a long time to pay the bill, which resulted in frustration and an overall negative dining experience.

question: Awesome thin crust pizza. The crust is cracker crispy, just burnt enough on the edges to give it the right smokiness.  The toppings are just right too.  Does anyone even order anything else?\n\nFYI to Holly S., there was a Monical's in Chicago's Western Suburbs (Lombard?) a few years ago but sadly, it closed.
rationale: The review expresses positivity by describing the thin crust pizza as "awesome" with specific praises for its crispy texture and well-balanced toppings. Additionally, the rhetorical question, "Does anyone even order anything else?" implies that the reviewer highly values the pizza and may not see the need to try other menu items. Additionally, the reviewer's only negative sentiment is directed towards the closure of a specific location, which does not impact the overall positive sentiment towards the pizza itself.

question:
I went to Monical's on Philo Road last Saturday, July 13.  My party and I arrived at approximately 6:15 P.M.  The restaurant was very busy, and I gave my name to the hostess, indicating that our party would require a table with chairs, since my wife is confined to a powerchair, and an elderly gentleman in our party had had recent knee surgery and walks with a cane with great difficulty.
We waited a total of 1.5 hours without being seated.  At one point, we were offered a booth/chair seating arrangement, but I declined, explaining that I was the only one in our group that could "scoot" into a booth (as should have been obvious by looking at us).
After that conversation, the wait staff appeared to lose interest in us; when I inquired of one of the male waiters as to an estimated time for a table with chairs, I was rudely informed "when this other group leaves".  I should hasten to point out that I am not a college student (my student days were over in 1974), and I am 61 years of age.  I am accustomed to being accorded with much more respect from twentysomethings than I encountered at Monical's that night.
Finally, I hunted up the manager (who appeared totally clueless), and informed her that our group had been waiting 1.5 hours for a table with chairs, that we were tired of waiting, and that I and my party were leaving and would never return.
At no point was I offered any apology for the long wait, by the manager or anyone else.
I feel that I and my group were the victims of discrimination of age and my wife's handicapped status.
I urge the public to boycott Monical's on Philo Road.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is negative because the reviewer describes a frustrating and disappointing experience at Monical's on Philo Road. The long wait time of 1.5 hours without being seated, coupled with the perceived lack of consideration for the special requirements of their group members, such as the need for a table with chairs for mobility reasons, contributed to their dissatisfaction. The reviewer also felt disrespected by the wait staff's attitude and lack of apology for the inconvenience. Additionally, the encounter with the manager, who seemed clueless and did not address their concerns, further added to the negative sentiment. The reviewer even perceives their treatment as discriminatory based on age and their wife's handicapped status.

question: Overpriced...\nArtificially red salad dressing on a boring salad is just terrible...\nHonestly, go anywhere else for pizza!
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the review mentions that the restaurant is overpriced and serves a boring salad with artificial red dressing, which the reviewer finds terrible. Additionally, the reviewer suggests going elsewhere for pizza, indicating overall dissatisfaction with the dining experience.

question: I placed my order from the hotel at 6:18pm - an hour and ten minutes later my 30-45 minute delivery showed up (I ordered the wings and a tortellini dinner).  I travel 150 nights/year for work so I order food a lot.  These were the worst wings I've ever had  I called the manager and she freely admitted \"that's our worst food - we get the most complaints on the wings\" ... I couldn't believe what I was hearing.  Your company knows this ... yet continues to serve it???\n\nWon't make this mistake again.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the user expressed disappointment and frustration with the quality of the food they ordered. The user specifically mentioned that the wings were the worst they had ever tasted and that the manager confirmed they receive a lot of complaints about the wings. The user felt let down by the company's knowledge of the issue but apparent lack of action to improve the food quality. This negative experience has led the user to decide not to order from the company again in the future.

question: Hubby told me its like the best pizza ever but I don't feel like it.\nI like other much cheaper pizza than this.
rationale: The sentiment is Negative because the individual does not agree with their husband's opinion that the pizza is the best ever. They express a preference for other, cheaper pizza options over the more expensive one they are currently eating, indicating their dissatisfaction with the quality or taste of the pizza in question.

question: Not a good place if your actually looking for good pizza or Italian beef.  I am from Chicago and the locals seem to think this place is good.  It is far from decent no fries just a bag of plain ruffles to go with your Italian beef.  The beef by the way only had like 3 slices of beef and the cheese was overbaked into the bread.  If you just want food for your face its fine but if you are actually looking for good food go somewhere else.
rationale: The sentiment in the review is negative because the customer had high expectations for good pizza and Italian beef, based on their background from Chicago. They were disappointed by the quality of the food they received, including the lack of fries, minimal beef in the Italian beef sandwich, and overbaked cheese. The customer felt that the food fell short of their standards and did not live up to what they were expecting.

question: Not crazy about this place.
rationale: The phrase "Not crazy about this place" typically indicates a negative sentiment because it conveys a lack of enthusiasm or strong dislike towards the location being referred to. It suggests that the person did not have a positive experience or was not impressed with the place.

question: Placed an order from so many miles aways,  and was so specific on the type of look I wanted for this Bday arrangement. Had a very tight window time frame for delivery and everything was right on time. Most importantly.. When my sister sent me a pic of what the flowers looked like,  they were beautiful and exactly what I had pictured. Happy customer :)
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the user had a specific vision for the birthday flower arrangement, and the order was delivered accurately and on time. The user's sister also confirmed that the flowers were beautiful and exactly as pictured, resulting in a happy customer. The overall experience met or exceeded the user's expectations, leading to a positive review.

question: The mass transit system in Champaign-Urbana is actually really good! You can get almost anywhere by the bus! The 22 is the most used bus which will take you anywhere on campus that is in the most traveled area...Green St., the Quad, ect.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the review states that the mass transit system in Champaign-Urbana is really good and can get you almost anywhere by bus. It also highlights a specific bus route, the 22, which is the most used and conveniently services popular areas on campus. This positive review indicates that the public transportation system is efficient and reliable for getting around the area.

question:
I've always been pretty indifferent about the CU MTD.  I relied on the bus for a couple years to get to campus and it wasn't terribly pleasant, reliable, or timely (caveat: I was on the route used by Urbana middle school students and rode the bus the same time as all the kids, which probably had something to do with the various forms of unpleasantness).  That said,the MTD fills an EXTREMELY important need in this community and I've never had any doubt that they do the best they can.


Then, today, I read this:  http://www.newsgazette.com/news/local/2009/04/09/no_mtd_service_planned_this_sunday

Public transportation is being suspended in observance of a religious holiday.   Are you freakin' kidding me?  Sorry to all of you who rely on the MTD to get to work, the grocery store, to visit family or even go to church.  You won't be doing it this Sunday.
rationale: The sentiment in the review is negative because the user expresses frustration and disbelief at the decision to suspend public transportation services on a particular day due to a religious holiday. The user highlights the inconvenience this decision causes to members of the community who rely on the MTD for essential transportation needs, such as getting to work, the grocery store, visiting family, or going to church. This negativity is further emphasized by the sarcasm and frustration evident in the user's tone, indicating dissatisfaction with the service disruption.

question: After moving to the big city, I realized just how good the bus system at UofI is.  Back in the day we just waited until the bus came, but now they have those digital boards that tell you how long it will be unti the next bus comes - awesome!  The buses are always clean, there's hardly ever smelly homeless people on there.  And they are a blast when the bars close!  Multiple bus lines and lots of stops, if you live on campus you are never more than 2-3 blocks from a bus.  Just don't make the mistake of getting on the wrong bus and having to ride for an extra 30 min because you got on the wrong way :)  Also, it's nice that even the off-campus buses are free for students.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is positive because the reviewer highlights several positive aspects of the bus system at the University of Illinois. They mention how convenient and efficient the system is with digital boards providing real-time bus arrival information, clean buses, minimal presence of unpleasant odors, and accessibility to various locations with multiple bus lines and stops. The reviewer also appreciates the fact that the buses are free for students, making transportation easier and more affordable. Despite a minor hiccup with getting on the wrong bus, the overall tone of the review is upbeat and satisfied with the bus system's offerings.

question:
This is my 4rd year in UC and CU MTD is a life saver... 

You can go almost everywhere with them almost anytime.  The GPS Systems Installed in each bus allows you to be able to track  them in the web and know when they pass in your stop. VERY useful when you get wind chills of -20 F.... 

My only complain is that sometimes the rides are too crowded.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the user appreciates the convenience and reliability of the UC and CU MTD transportation service. They highlight the usefulness of the GPS system in tracking the buses and mention that the service is a "life saver." Although they mention crowded rides as a complaint, overall, the user's review expresses satisfaction with the service's accessibility and efficiency, leading to a positive sentiment.

question:
So one afternoon, stopped by to eat a chicken teriyaki sandwich. Looked pretty good.

I have this weird thing of chopping my subs into one bite sizes, so was doing that as usual.
after I have half of my sub, I find a piece of chiken..... pink inside.

They served me a half raw chicken sub!

I mean, I noticed this cause of my weird hobby of chopping my sandwich but if I didn't, I probably wouldn't of noticed. . .  don't wanna think about that.

I went to show them that and, they remade me a new chicken teriyaki sub (which was nice) but. . .  I totally lost my appitite and was scared of imagening finding another half raw chicken in my sandwich.

There's other subway's in town so probably go to those, never back to this one.
rationale: The sentiment in the review is negative because the customer had a bad experience with their food - they found a piece of chicken that was pink and raw inside their sandwich. This not only affected their appetite and made them feel scared of potentially encountering the same issue again, but also led them to decide not to return to that particular Subway location in the future. The customer's overall dissatisfaction with the food quality and the impact it had on their dining experience clearly indicates a negative sentiment.

question: This is my favorite place to get my hair cut in all of C-U. It's a Korean place, yes. Most of the other clients are Korean, yes. I'm not, though, and while the first time I went I wondered if I was going to feel intimidated, I was immediately put at ease. The stylist gave me a wash and this fantastic towel-neck-massage when she was drying me. I could have fallen asleep, it was so relaxing, plus the hair products she was using smelled great. I bring in pictures of hairstyles I want, and she does a good job for -- get this - $20. I'm a woman, and $20 for a haircut *this good* compared to $40 at the last place I used to go was just amazing. I have now converted one friend to using this as their main place and I'm working on another as well. Please check this place out!
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the review highlights several aspects of the hair salon experience that the user enjoyed. They express satisfaction with the quality of service, mentioning a relaxing hair wash and massage, pleasant hair products, and a well-done haircut for a very affordable price. Additionally, the user mentions feeling welcomed and comfortable despite being a non-Korean client, emphasizing their intention to recommend the salon to others. Overall, the review conveys a strong sense of satisfaction and enthusiasm, making it a positive sentiment.

question: These ladies are pretty adorable. I loved talking with them about being Asian American, growing up in a small town and teaching second generation kids their native tongue. The haircut, minus the bangs, was perfect. Just the right amount of layering and length. I have crazy thick hair, and they did it perfectly in about a half hour, shampooing for free. Now...the bangs. You need to specify exactly what you want to prevent them from butchering them. I don't know what happened, but suddenly I was stuck with the same straight bangs I've been avoiding for years because they \"would fall better.\" Um...no, not exactly. I'll stick to cutting my own bangs as always from now on, but I do recommend getting a trim here. Friendly service and decently priced for men and women.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the review highlights several positive aspects of the salon experience, such as the friendly service, decent pricing for men and women, and the overall satisfaction with the haircut in terms of layering and length for someone with thick hair. Despite a small issue with the bangs, the reviewer still recommends the salon for getting a trim, indicating an overall positive experience.

question:
Needs appointment, my first and only haircut in America in 3 years.
Got my hair cut short and took care of the split ends. 

Nice Korean run Place, parking is difficult
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the review mentions that the haircut helped with split ends, and the reviewer appreciated the service at the Korean-run place. question: One of the fears with moving to a new place is not finding a good place for a haircut. I am so lucky as to find Red Hair on my 2nd day here in Champaign. Sue and Kee are absolutely amazing, they are very skilled and also friendly! I definitely recommend this place for anyone, looking for any kinds of haircut (I got a super short two block haircut, and I'm a girl). Thanks Red Hair!
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer expresses feelings of luck and satisfaction in finding a good place for a haircut in a new location. They specifically highlight the skills and friendliness of the staff at Red Hair, as well as recommend the salon to others. The reviewer's positive experience and the praise for the services received contribute to an overall positive sentiment in the review.

question:
I haven't been to this clinic in awhile, but when I did go, it was usually a good experience. I occasionally had a mess up with scheduling or some other issue that wasted a lot of my time and that was highly annoying, hence the lost star, but otherwise it was just fine. The people who work here are really sweet and informative. I got my annuals and birth control (pills, depo-provera shot and IUD) from here. The OB-GYN who was there was fantastic. 

Since I had no steady income and I couldn't use my insurance, they were able to put me on a sliding scale plan and I donated what I could give them each time I came in. This saved me a TON of cash. And, like Amy mentioned, make appointments early, they do fill up fast!

It really pisses me off to hear that there are now protestors hanging outside the clinic. Yay, let's continue to oppress women's sexuality!
rationale: The sentiment is considered positive because the review highlights several positive aspects of the clinic such as having a good experience overall, finding the staff sweet and informative, praising the OB-GYN, and appreciating the financial assistance provided through a sliding scale plan. The reviewer also acknowledges the importance of the services offered by the clinic, particularly for those with financial constraints. Despite mentioning some scheduling issues and external protests, the overall tone of the review is positive and appreciative of the clinic's services and support.

question:
Planned Parenthood has very cold and stern staff who fail to give proper care based on biased personal reasons. 

I was there for a check up, seen by a woman who asked way too many personal questions about my life, and *deliberately* DID NOT help us get birth control, due to a personal bias based on the answers I gave her.

It was an outrage. We needed her signature to order contraception and she denied us care based on her own personal reasons....

She called her manager into the room and they both stood there like tall bulldogs, alienating me and my partner and blocking the way out the door. 
...
unbelievable...I am considering a lawsuit. I have never seen more unprofessional behavior.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer had a negative experience at Planned Parenthood due to the staff's behavior. The staff member was described as cold, stern, and unhelpful, showing bias in providing care based on personal reasons rather than the patient's needs. The reviewer felt alienated and blocked from accessing contraception, which is concerning and unprofessional. The mention of considering a lawsuit indicates the seriousness of the situation and the deep dissatisfaction with the care received.

question: Completely INCOMPETENT staff.  After switching insurance plans and needing my 12 month prescription re-issued to my new provider, PP was horrible at processing this request.  After promising they would fax it over the next day, and having the pharmacy assure me they never received it for a week, it turns out that PP never faxed it over.  After having to constantly talk to the insurance company, the pharmacy and PP over the course of A MONTH (which I had to pay out-of-pocket for my prescription) I finally got a letter in the mail from my insurance company saying \"Cannot renew prescription. Request of renewal denied by doctor\".  Thanks for helping me out PP, after I not only pay my co-pay to your incompetent staff, but additionally make donations for your site.  Way to improperly utilize your resources.
rationale: The sentiment in the review is negative because the user expresses frustration and dissatisfaction with the service provided by the staff. They highlight the staff's incompetence in processing a simple request, resulting in a prolonged delay in getting their prescription renewed. The user had to bear additional costs due to the staff's inefficiency, which caused inconvenience and frustration. Overall, the user felt undervalued as a customer due to the mishandling of their request and the lack of proper communication and follow-through by the staff at the provider (PP).

question: My brother attended here, and I have a friend pursuing a PhD here now. They like the campus and the teachers. The grading scale is tough sometimes, but they really feel like they got a good education that was worth the expense and time.
rationale: The review expresses overall satisfaction with the institution based on firsthand experiences from a sibling and a friend. The mention of liking the campus and teachers, despite a tough grading scale, indicates that the positive aspects of the education and overall experience outweigh any challenges. Additionally, highlighting that they feel the education was worth the expense and time further reinforces the sentiment of positivity.

question:
It's a place that is easy to both love and hate. On one hand they have some unique academic programs and great professors, but you'll probably have to slog through lots sub-par classes before you get the good classes. 

Business is one of the "better" colleges, but you wouldn't know if from the lower level classes. My least favorite class ever was an upper level econ (econ is technically in LAS even though business people spend plenty of time in the department) class that was taught by a TA who not only didn't speak very good English, but who also gave really harsh tests. The first test average was a 64% and there was no curve. Grading is harsh here! Lots of people repeat classes. I also have plenty of bad things to say about accounting and finance classes, but it depends on the class I guess. 

LAS is the catch-all college that gets shafted a lot. Many of my lectures were too big and in auditoriums were literally falling apart. Contrast that with the much-funded engineering college's glittering shiny collection of brand new giant buildings. Oh well. 

ACES, my college, is a bit of a catch-all college as well, but some of the majors are quite small. I've had my smallest and favorite classes in ACES. For development and other niche economics specialties this is the place to be and undergrads get lots of attention. It also has top-notch programs in other aggy stuff ranging from food science to animal science. I adore most of my professors I have had in this college. The only downside is that ACES has tended to attract some less than bright students in the past and has some programs within it in need of reform, but I'm sure that is true in many UIUC colleges.  I recommend ACES, but only if you are truly interested in the curricula. 

I would note that I skipped all gen-eds and a lot of ugly giant lower level classes thanks to APs and placements tests. If you can do that, it is worth it, because the upper level classes are where you can really enjoy academics. The lower level classes seem to be purposefully soul-crushing, with harsh curves, unintelligible TAs, and professors who just read off powerpoints. 101 classes are where learning goes to die. I basically did well on them by memorizing lectures off flashcards, a sad way to "learn" if you ask me. Don't be afraid to switch classes if you get a bad feeling on the first day. I did that a lot and it was worth it for the English-speaking TAs. 

I am personally not a fan of the Greek system, which welds a little too much power here. The drunken anti-intellectual environment can be stifling if you don't find a niche. Allen Hall is the place to be for anti-Greeks/hippies/outsiders and it has the bonus of small lower level classes often taught by people who actually care. Avoid the isolated residence halls like PAR and FAR, go six-pack only if you are Greek-ish, and ISR is the place to be for engineers and other assorted people who want to live near the science and engineering buildings. Dorm food is a mixed bag...it's mostly just inexcusably bad, but most people don't seem to notice because they think fries and hot dogs= acceptable lunch. 

I like the Chambana area, even if it has some minor annoyances. Ill-kept frat houses and a bizarre lack of on-campus grocery stores mar it, but otherwise it was easy for me to find restaurants to eat at and assorted drunk-free places to hang out. However, I can think of about ten major cities where I'd rather live.

The weather here is horrible. In the summer you scald and in the winter you freeze, so pack your snowboots and your short-shorts.
rationale: The review expresses a negative sentiment overall based on various complaints and criticisms about the academic experience, campus facilities, student life, and surrounding area. The reviewer mentions sub-par classes, harsh grading, lack of resources for certain colleges like LAS, and a somewhat negative social environment with the dominance of the Greek system. Additionally, the critique of the dorm food, weather, and surrounding area further contributes to the negative sentiment expressed in the review.

question: Had a great time!  So much so that I stretched out my senior year into an extra semester.  And despite the fact that I took human sexuality, modern dance, stress management (had to drop it because I had such a full workload and my doctor told me I was on my way to an ulcer), and ice skating (twice!), I still feel that my business degree was worthwhile.\n\nI miss going to Meijer at all hours of the night and getting pushed around in a shopping cart.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is positive because the reviewer reflects on their time in college with fondness and nostalgia. Despite some challenges like a full workload and having to drop a class due to health concerns, the reviewer still expresses that their business degree was worthwhile. Additionally, they mention enjoying various unique classes and activities, as well as missing the fun experience of late-night trips to the store. Overall, the review conveys a sense of satisfaction and enjoyment with their college experience.

question: Face it.  College is just a stepping stone to work.  Getting into a \"better\" one is mainly to make landing that first job easier.  I have to say that UIUC did its job.\n\nCome here for memorable experiences and lifelong friends.  Oh wait.  You can probably get that anywhere else.  What more do you want?
rationale: The sentiment is considered positive because the reviewer acknowledges that the college experience served its purpose as a stepping stone to work and made landing a job easier. Additionally, the reviewer acknowledges that the college provided memorable experiences and the potential to make lifelong friends, even though they quip about these aspects being found elsewhere. Overall, the reviewer acknowledges the benefits of their college experience at UIUC, indicating a positive outlook on their time there despite some playful skepticism.

question:
First of all, don't get me started on how angry I am about the fact that the Illini no longer have a mascot. The Chief was a total badass, enough said.

Secondly, I've seen a lot of people apply themselves and get really excellent jobs right out of this college.

Yeah, it could be because I'm a townie, but I love Champaign-Urbana. It's a perfect distance from Chicago. The only reason I gave it four stars is because I don't go there so I felt like giving it 5 would've been a bit unfair. Annnnywho, I love the U of I and going to football and basketball games have been a part of my childhood. Go Illini
rationale: The sentiment in the review is positive because the reviewer expresses love and nostalgia for the University of Illinois, mentioning their fond memories of attending football and basketball games there. They also appreciate the location of Champaign-Urbana and the opportunities the college has provided to others in terms of job prospects. Despite the minor disappointment about the lack of a mascot and not being actively involved currently, the overall tone is one of affection and positivity towards the university and its community.

question:
Like much in life, you get out of UIUC what you put in.  Can you have a mediocre education with annoying/poor TAs, never talk to a prof, never leave the dorm?  I guess so, but that wouldn't be much fun. 

I earned a BA and an MS from UIUC.  Yes, the grad level is a whole different world from the undergrad, but I still got a lot out of my undergrad experience. I learned to have confidence and stand out from a crowd, learned a lot, had great experiences (even learned from some bad ones), met the love of my life and managed to pay off my student loans way before my private school friends had made a dent.

Champaign-Urbana... you either love it or you don't.  It isn't Chicago and it isn't the suburbs. I'm still here, so obviously I love it.  It isn't for everyone, but then again, I tried living up north and that wasn't for me. 

Don't know if people thinking about college will read this review, but if so, give UIUC a good solid look.  It can be big and faceless if you let it, but that's a challenge for you to overcome and learn how to be an adult, an academic, aw heck I'm sounding all schmaltzy.  Good school. Go.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is positive because the reviewer highlights the valuable experiences and personal growth they gained from their time at UIUC. They emphasize that students can have a fulfilling education by engaging with professors, pushing themselves academically, and making the most of their college experience. Overall, the reviewer encourages potential students to consider UIUC as a good option, recognizing the school's potential for personal and professional development.

question:
I transferred into UIUC at 23 as a junior. I had spent a couple years in community college as well as a couple years working, supporting myself, and traveling. I went to UIUC because it is the best public school in IL, but it turned out to NOT be a good place for me with my level of life experience and need for city living and diversity. I was miserable here because I felt like I was back in high school in the north shore. Had I come to UIUC straight out of high school there is a good chance I would have enjoyed it, but at 23 it was horrible. 

Because of my bad experience and some money issues I decided to drop out after a month. Now you know things had to be really bad for me to not stick it out for at least a semester. But when I went to drop out I had to go visit with several people who were basically there to make sure that I was making the right decision. They all felt I was especially when they found out how old I was. The average age at UIUC is 19 and the maturity level at that school really showed. 

Yeah, I probably could've gotten a better education at UIUC than I did at UIC, but I would have suffered in so many other ways that it was really one of the best decisions I ever made. UIC has an average age of 22 and much higher diversity rates. That and it is in my wonderful city of Chicago.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is negative because the individual expresses feelings of misery, disappointment, and a sense of not fitting in at the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign (UIUC). They highlight issues related to their age and life experiences not aligning with the predominately younger student population at UIUC, leading them to believe they were back in a high school environment. The decision to drop out after only a month, despite the recognition that UIUC may offer a better education than the University of Illinois at Chicago (UIC), reflects the significant negative impact the experience had on the individual's well-being and sense of belonging. The review emphasizes a lack of satisfaction with the overall environment and the realization that UIC, with its older average age and higher diversity rates, would have been a better fit for the individual's needs and preferences.

question:
Hail to the Orange,
Hail to the Blue,
Hail Alma Mater,
Ever so true!
We love no other
So let our motto be
Victory, Illinoisssssssssssssss! Varsity!

The best education you can get for your money if you're an in-state student.  Great student body, great classes, profs, world class research, great athletics (at least B-Ball was when I was there, although football kind always sucked) .   Long live the Chief!
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the review highlights several positive aspects of the university, such as having a great student body, classes, professors, research, and athletics. The reviewer also expresses their love and loyalty to the alma mater and appreciates the value of education provided for in-state students. Although there is mention of football not being as strong, overall, the sentiment is positive with a strong sense of pride and fond memories associated with the university.

question: One of the best research institutions in the world with many high ranking programs.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the review highlights the research institution as one of the best in the world, implying excellence and prestige. The mention of high-ranking programs further reinforces the positive evaluation, indicating that the institution excels across various fields of study. Overall, the review portrays the institution in a favorable light, emphasizing its top-tier status and quality of education and research.

question:
I am so proud to call this place my Alma Mater. I spent 4 wonderful years there and even if I am currently in a career that had absolutely nothing to do with my major (i'm a techie and BA was in Sociology), I would not trade my degree and my experience there for the world. 

I do sigh from time to time when I remember walking across the quad to get to my classes. I was in awe at how beautiful the old buildings were.

Like others, I could write on and on about how great this school is. The academics were top notch, the people where all so open-minded..and of course of the THE largest Greek systems in the nation did not disappoint this grad.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer expresses pride in their alma mater, fondly recalling their time spent there and describing it as a wonderful experience. They appreciate the education they received, even though it may not be directly related to their current career. The reviewer also mentions the beauty of the campus, the quality of academics, the open-mindedness of the people, and the positive experience in the Greek system. Overall, the review highlights a strong sense of connection and gratitude towards the university, indicating a positive sentiment.

question:
I never really considered writing a Yelp review for UIUC, but after seeing some of the ludicrous negative reviews, I'd like to voice my opinion.

Most importantly, for those individuals who may be considering the University for their higher education needs, know that it is an excellent place of learning, especially for engineering and the sciences.  

I don't think it's fair or accurate to claim that there is nothing to do in Champaign or that it is devoid of the cultural richness of cities like Chicago.  If you asked many of my college friends, they may take the position that the best thing about the C U is the drinking, but I would contend that people who take that position have never left campus or spent time trying to find something to do with their time.  There are lots of things to do and places to spend time that don't involve drunk undergrads.  And, you'll get a quality education at a good price (even though tuition keeps going up).
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the review highlights the positive aspects of the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign (UIUC) such as its excellence in learning, particularly in engineering and the sciences. The reviewer also refutes negative claims about the lack of activities in Champaign and emphasizes that there are diverse options beyond just drinking. Additionally, they mention the decent education offered at a reasonable price despite tuition increases, showcasing a balanced view of the university's strengths. Overall, the review promotes UIUC as a valuable institution for higher education.

question:
Very pretty view and lots of stores, restaurants, bars...
Good combination of academic and party life.
Had my master here in communication.
Good class content but not much help in career.
Living expense is pretty low, rent is 300-700 regularly, food is around 5-15 a meal. 50 dollars of grocery can last you a week and a drink at the bar is around 3.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the review highlights the positive aspects of the university experience, such as a beautiful view, a vibrant social scene with plenty of amenities, a good balance between academic and social life, and reasonable living expenses. Despite some drawbacks like lack of career support, the overall tone is positive and optimistic about the university experience.

question: Krannert Art Museum is lucky to have a Director that actually believes art should stimulate and provoke thought...and that's exactly what she does with the exhibitions I've seen there so far. This would be the local equivalent to the Yerba Buena Center for the Arts in San Francisco ... cool social events and openings for a cross-generational and cross-cultural crowd. What I love most about KAM is that I've had some great conversations standing around the lobby of a show and there's no snotty art culture where people blather on about \"high art\" and how it's so much better than anything and everyone. They don't play those games here, even though this is the 2nd largest art institute in IL outside of the Chicago Art Institute. Impressive, yes? Pretentious, no.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer highlights the Director of Krannert Art Museum for her approach in curating exhibitions that stimulate and provoke thought. The reviewer praises the museum for hosting cool social events and creating a welcoming atmosphere for a diverse audience. Additionally, the reviewer appreciates the lack of pretentiousness in the art culture at the museum, emphasizing the enjoyable conversations and absence of snobbery typically associated with art institutions. Overall, the reviewer's experience at Krannert Art Museum has been engaging, inclusive, and free from the elitism often associated with art institutions, which contributes to a positive impression of the museum.

question:
This museum rocks, especially for a university.  A few friends and I had so much fun wandering the place.  Loads bigger than it looks, Krannert offers everything from Gaugin to modern mulit-media installations.  There's a great one about baggage right now.

Went for a friend; she was opening her MFA exhibition.  One half star knocked off 'cuz was extra-tempted by her claims of wine.  Sadly, they only served soda.  Any art opening should have wine, people.  That's how you tempt folks into gettin' a little culture.

The other half star knocked off because the security guard followed us around like he thought we'd stolen his puppy.  C'mon, you don't expect to see oddly dressed mofos at an art opening, guy?  The fact one of our party was a 60 year old librarian (who really looks like a librarian!) didn't tip you off that we weren't there to rob the place or splash mud on the older works?
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer praises the museum for its impressive collection and diverse range of artworks. They mention having had a fun experience and highlight specific exhibitions that they enjoyed. Despite a couple of minor drawbacks related to the lack of wine at an art opening and feeling overly monitored by a security guard, the overall tone remains enthusiastic about the museum visit.

question:
Come get your creative juices flowin - 

What a great way to spend 2 hours on a Friday afternoon! There were several rotating exhibits one being from the graduate students at UIUC. Other exhibits included 1700-1800 oil paintings, Jacob Lawrence: Toussaint L'Ouverture Series, Fasioning Traditions of Japan, Counterpoints / Moshekwa Langa: Mogalakwena, Encounters: The Arts of Africa. The experience was quiet, reflective, and mind stimulating. There is a small coffee shop inside which I did not partake but looked like a nice spot to read/study with some caffeine. 

If you bring a bag they will have you check it in one of their quarter lockers. So bring a quarter (you get it back)! Museum is free with $3 suggested donation.
rationale: The sentiment is Positive because the reviewer highlights the positive aspects of their experience at the museum. They mention that it was a great way to spend their time, enjoyed the rotating exhibits, found the experience reflective and stimulating, and even appreciated the presence of a coffee shop for relaxation. Additionally, the reviewer shares practical tips for visitors, like the availability of lockers and the option for a free visit with a suggested donation. These aspects collectively contribute to a positive review of their time at the museum.

question: What the heck is some of the best Chinese cuisine anywhere doing in Champaign?  Seriously folks, I have been looking for the equal to their steamed dumplings EVERYWHERE (including Chicago's Chinatown) and cannot find any I like nearly as well.  Their portions, as I recall, are huge for the price you're paying, and the stuff is delicious.  They make other dumpling/potsticker selections look pretty pathetic by comparison in size and flavor. For those of you who go beyond the appetizers, I highly recommend their General Tso or sweet & sour.  I've really got to roll back to the old alma mater and try their mu-shu as well, but truthfully I'll probably eat way more dumplings than anything else.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer praises the Chinese cuisine at the restaurant in Champaign, specifically highlighting the deliciousness of the steamed dumplings and the generous portion sizes for the price. Additionally, the reviewer expresses enthusiasm about trying other dishes on the menu like General Tso's chicken and sweet & sour dishes. The overall tone of the review is appreciative and enthusiastic, showing a high level of satisfaction with the food and overall dining experience at the restaurant.

question: My preferred place to eat Chinese on campus.  Although, I will admit that I haven't eaten at every place around town, there aren't too many great Chinese restaurants around here (this does not include buffets).  Their General Tso's chicken is amazing.  Giant quantities for prices a bit on the high side, but not too bad considering how much you get.  Anything bigger than a small and you're guaranteed to take it home in a doggie bag tray thingy (are the trays seriously called doggie bags, too?) unless you're sharing it with someone else.  I usually only order the General Tso's or Vegetable Lo Mein (my default Chinese food preferences), so I can't really say much about the rest of the menu, but I did order soup there once and they gave me it in a giant bowl, with a decent amount of noodles.  It tasted okay, but not great.  It can get kind of crowded in there with limited seating and the atmosphere isn't too great, but it's acceptable.
rationale: The sentiment of this review is positive because the reviewer expresses a preference for this Chinese restaurant on campus. They specifically mention that the General Tso's chicken is amazing, and they appreciate the generous portion sizes despite the prices being slightly on the higher side. Additionally, they note that even with limited seating and an average atmosphere, the overall experience is acceptable. The reviewer's positive comments about the food quality, portion sizes, and overall experience contribute to the positive sentiment of the review.

question: Best General Tso's chicken I have ever had, and I'm Chinese.  Granted, it's not really an authentic Chinese dish, but this place makes it damn good, and it's cheap!  But man, is it spicy!  One of the best fast-food Chinese places I've ever eaten at.  Definitely go here when you have the hankering for Chinese.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer appreciates the General Tso's chicken, describing it as the best they have ever had despite being Chinese themselves. They acknowledge that it may not be authentic but still praise the taste, affordability, and spiciness of the dish. Additionally, the reviewer highlights the place as one of the best fast-food Chinese places they have eaten at, recommending it for those craving Chinese food.

question:
If you like really bad generic Americanized Chinese Food, this place is for you. After my first order from this place I wouldn't dare order again. I got the Double Sauteed Pork with "Fried Rice." For one, there were more vegetables than meat, which isn't always a bad thing if the vegetables are good enough to want to eat, but these vegetables were the run of the mill cabbage, bamboo shoot, water chestnut, and sliced carrot medley that they probably stick in every dish they make. Sprinkled between the overly large vegetable pieces were slim strips of pork that were barely seasoned and covered with again, the run of the mill brown gravy that they probably smother every beef or pork dish they make, the worst part of which was that it was bland and tasted vaguely of corn-starch thickened soy. And last but not least, the dish came with a choice of white or "fried" rice. I opted for the fried rice which looked and tasted almost identical to what I imagine their white rice would have tasted like except that it was tinged yellow.  It looked like the stuff that comes out of a box of Uncle Ben's, except I'd pay for Uncle Ben's.

I can't believe there are so many positive reviews of this place. Granted there aren't very many good 4+ star-worthy places on Green St., but I'm led to believe that most of these people have never had really good Chinese food and stick to their staples of Orange or General Tso's chicken, or some variation on fried chicken bits in a sweet sauce. If you're looking for a good place near Green St., try Evo's on Sixth south of Green or if you're willing to walk the extra six or so blocks, head over to Golden Wok on University and Fourth.

Never ordering from this place again.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer had a disappointing experience with the food they ordered from the Chinese restaurant. They were dissatisfied with the quality of the dish, highlighting issues such as an imbalance of vegetables to meat, lack of flavor in the pork and gravy, and underwhelming fried rice. The reviewer also expresses disbelief at the positive reviews the restaurant has received and ultimately decides to not order from the restaurant again. The overall tone conveys disappointment and a lack of satisfaction with the dining experience.

question: For very cheap and not AWFULLY bad Chinese food, the regular, cheap, two-sized (small and large) portions menu is (barely, and I mean barely) OK. However, since they've hired a new chef, they put on more pretensions now, they have some alleged \"Szechuan\" dishes, which are quite a bit more expensive, yet EVEN WORSE than the regular dishes. The \"new chef\" is worse than the traditional chefs I've seen there for years. I tried two different dishes from the more expensive menu, some beef which was edible but undermediocre, and then a whole \"Szechuan bean chili whole fish\" dish which was so bad and literally stinky I couldn't finish it. (I should mention I love Chinese food and I had lots of it, in lots of places.) The reason I still visit the place, rarely, is a cheapish and tasty Crispy Whole Fish, in the regular menu, which is not authentic Chinese, but which for some reason I crave every three months.\n\nThe campus Chinese place to go is Lai-Lai, period. There's simply no comparison in quality, and when the ratio price/quantity/quality satisfaction is being taken into account, Lai-Lai offers by far the best deal on campus. Compared to Empire Chinese, Evo (where the chef comes out of the toilet and back into the kitchen, without washing his hands), or even Mandarin Wok, which has some OK dishes, but not equal to Lai-Lai.
rationale: The sentiment in the review is negative because the reviewer expresses dissatisfaction with the quality of the food, particularly after the restaurant hired a new chef and introduced more expensive dishes. The reviewer found the new dishes to be even worse than the regular menu items, with one dish being described as bad and stinky. Additionally, the comparison to other Chinese restaurants in the area highlights that the reviewer views this particular restaurant as inferior in terms of quality and value. The overall tone of the review is critical and unimpressed with their dining experiences at this establishment.

question: Empire is cheap, super fast, and generally satisfying.  There are certain days where I start fantasizing about their pork dumplings and must have them.  And they're affordable enough that I don't feel like I should hate myself afterwards.  Dishes may be slightly greasy, but they're tasty as hell.  Delivery is also pretty nice, although I've had trouble on occasion getting my order through clearly via the telephone.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer highlights several positive aspects of Empire, including the speed of service, affordable prices, delicious dishes such as the pork dumplings, and satisfactory delivery service. Despite minor concerns like greasiness and occasional difficulties with ordering, the overall tone of the review is enthusiastic and appreciative of the restaurant's offerings.

question:
I've only tried 2 dishes here so far but they were so sub-par it's iffy whether another chance here will be taken.  Even for a cheap Chinese place the atmo leaves much to be desired.  And I'm not at all fussy about that.

My friend had a tofu dish that was ok.  Tasted like BBQ sauce mixed with teriyake.  Should've tried the dumplings myself; was all set to do so after reading reviews here.  But I wasn't in the mood for meat. So...

I got the veggie lo mein.  It's not a difficult dish, and I've pretty much never gotten a bad version.  Until here!  Bland, boring, and worst of all, super greasy.  

It felt like oil slicks in my mouth.  Arrgh.  Why?  It was like being served greasy coffee- one of those things that totally mystify and leave you wondering what the hell the chef was up to back there.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is negative because the customer had a sub-par experience at the restaurant. They found the atmosphere unsatisfactory, the tofu dish tasted like BBQ sauce mixed with teriyaki, and the veggie lo mein was described as bland, boring, and super greasy, which left a bad taste in their mouth. The customer expressed disappointment and confusion over the quality of the food, indicating that they were unlikely to give the restaurant another chance.

question: oh, where to begin.... first, it took me three tries to reach anyone to place my order.  then, it took them about an hour and 15 minutes to get my food out for delivery, and once that happened, it took the incompetent delivery driver another five minutes to find where i was.  and to top it all off, the chicken was crappy to say the least, and the dumplings were inedible.  if this review can convince even one person from making the mistake of ordering empire chinese, then i will be happy.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the user experienced multiple issues with their order from Empire Chinese. They faced difficulties in placing the order, experienced long wait times for delivery, encountered incompetence from the delivery driver, and were disappointed with the quality of the food received. These negative experiences contributed to an overall unsatisfactory customer experience, leading the user to discourage others from ordering from the restaurant.

question: Stopped by Empire yesterday for some quick takeout. \nPros: Friendly service, order was ready pretty quickly, meals were cheap (plenty of food for three people for 13 and change), walls were freshly painted in bright colors, napkins, sauces, forks, etc were fully-stocked and clean.\nCons: Decor was sort of confusing and borderline gross. We wondered what had been living in the empty fishtank near the door. Mix of Chinese language and Champaign newspapers scattered all around the seating area, walls postered in a million different menu items. The biggest con, however? The food. My friends got sweet and sour chicken. They said it was alright. The fried rice was BRIGHT yellow - almost saffron-y in color. Unnatural. The egg roll was disappointing. I had the pork with 'string beans,' a.k.a. green beans and white rice. The pork wasn't terrible, and the beans were passable, but it was all covered in this hideous teriyaki/shoyu sauce. There was SO much MSG that I ended up with a horrible migraine later in the evening. I anticipate that any (especially cheap) Chinese food in the area will contain at least some MSG, but this was just over the top. Considering the number of good-to-amazing Chinese restaurants within a 2 mile radius of campus (Golden Harbor, Lai Lai Wok, Rainbow Garden, etc), I won't be going back to Empire.
rationale: The sentiment expressed in the review is negative because the customer had several complaints about their experience at Empire. They found the decor confusing and borderline gross, indicating a lack of cleanliness or aesthetic appeal. The food received mixed reviews, with the sweet and sour chicken being only "alright" and the other dishes disappointing due to excessive use of MSG, unnatural colors, and unsatisfactory taste. The presence of a migraine later on suggests a significant oversaturation of MSG, which negatively impacted the customer's overall dining experience. Additionally, the customer's comparison to other nearby Chinese restaurants that offer better quality food further solidifies their decision not to return to Empire, emphasizing their dissatisfaction.

question: I really love this family-owned/ran business. I've been in Champaign for several years and whenever I need my Chinese food fix, I know exactly where to go. I love the general's or Orange Chicken. I'm not a huge fan of their 'yellow-fried' rice, but it's a price I can pay for the deliciously cooked chicken and at home atmosphere I feel.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer expresses love for the family-owned business, indicating a strong personal connection and loyalty. They also mention that they know exactly where to go for their Chinese food fix, which suggests a high level of satisfaction with the food offerings. Despite not being a huge fan of a specific menu item, the reviewer balances it by highlighting the deliciously cooked chicken and the comfortable at-home atmosphere they enjoy at the restaurant. Overall, the review reflects a positive experience and a willingness to overlook minor drawbacks for the overall positive aspects of the business.

question:
Best crab rangoon EVER. 

I made SURE to stop at Empire while in CU because I was dreaming about their crab rangoons.  $3 gets you 6.  Complete steal.

Empire also finally takes cc's , but there's lame $8 min.
rationale: The review expresses enthusiasm and high praise for the crab rangoon at Empire. Words like "Best EVER" and "dreaming about" indicate a very positive sentiment towards the food. Despite mentioning a slight inconvenience with the credit card minimum, the overall tone is still very positive, emphasizing the deliciousness of the dish and the value for money.
