I guess I should have asked but I thought that the name was self sufficient...WRONG.  The potato totally overpowered the brie and you could barely taste it.  I must admit, when I eat brie, I want to EAT brie...I like lots of it.  So I guess that was a bad selection.  Then the \"prawns\" came out....well it wasnt prawns at all.  It was one very small, what looked like, a crab cake, slathered in guacamole....weird....so we took a bite and were pretty confused so we asked about it because it said stuffed prawns on the menu...well, it so happens that they messed up the order and gave us the crabcake topped with wasabi guac...or something like that.  Their fault so they said they would bring the prawns right out....except the bartender came back from the kitchen and said that they were out of prawns but they could do it with regular shrimp.  We said fine.  They came out (four of them), not stuffed at all.  It literally looked like sauteed shrimp with a touch of crab meat around the edge...unimpressed.  Overall, the dinner was not that good and for the price of everything...it was really overpriced!  I liked the atmosphere but the food is less than desired and $$$.  However, the staff was super nice and always checking up on us.  I didnt have the heart to tell them that most of the food was not great....alas, I will not be going back to Luna.
rationale: The sentiment of this review is negative because the diner expresses disappointment and dissatisfaction with several aspects of their dining experience at Cafe Luna. They had issues with the service, menu clarity, food quality, portion sizes, and pricing. Despite the friendly staff, the overall sentiment conveyed is that the food did not meet their expectations and was not worth the high cost. The numerous missteps in their order and the underwhelming dishes contributed to their negative perception of the restaurant.

question:
Okay here's the deal, I personally think the food is GREAT! However, the service is so-so and ladies, that's a DEALBREAKER!

One time a friend and I showed up around 7 to eat and stood in the doorway for nearly 10 minutes before we decided to blow that joint -- we went to Radio Maria. Way too expensive for crap like that and shuffling, slow waitresses. No I do not want to tip you $20, even though my bill was $100, because You Don't Deserve It! (but I still did anyways...)

They're always out of a lot of stuff too.

I think they graduated to this bigger, beautiful space, but are still staffing for the hole-in-the-wall they used to be at... pity, pity
rationale: The sentiment in the review is negative because the reviewer expresses frustration and disappointment with their experience at the restaurant. They specifically mention issues with slow service, high prices, lack of availability of menu items, and feeling that the staff is not deserving of a generous tip. The reviewer also highlights a contrasting opinion that while the food is great, other aspects of the dining experience, such as service and value, are significant enough to overshadow the positive aspects. These various criticisms and complaints contribute to an overall negative sentiment towards the establishment.

question: I haven't been here in several months, but I used to dine here regularly when I lived in C-U. \n\nI never had any major complaints-- I had several GREAT meals here (brunch & dinners, including one dinner with great live music). If I could find anything wrong with Luna it is, as others mentioned, the service. The waitresses are hit or miss--sometimes excellent and sometimes moody/incompetent.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer mentions having had several great meals at the restaurant, including brunch and dinner experiences with great live music. Despite mentioning some inconsistency in the service, the overall tone is positive, emphasizing the enjoyable dining experiences had at Luna.

question: This is the best restaurant in C-U.  We ordered the Parmesan fries, mushroom/gruyere crostinis, potato gnocchi and crab/lobster crab cake tapas to share.  Everything was spot on delicious!  To drink we had a dirty martini (best I've ever had) and the French Horn.  The French Horn was good but a little sour for my tastes.  The atmosphere is very quaint.  I am very excited to try their brunch menu sometime.  I thought it was very reasonably priced for everything we had.  I'd highly recommend Cafe Luna to anybody!
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the review highlights various positive aspects of the restaurant experience, such as delicious food, good drink options, a quaint atmosphere, reasonable pricing, and excitement about trying their brunch menu. The reviewer highly recommends the restaurant to others, indicating overall satisfaction with their dining experience at Cafe Luna.

question: Oh man. Croquette Madame and the Croque Monsieur. Seriously killer. It's so delicious and it has to be one of the best sandwiches in the city, by far. It's perfect for a brunch but filling enough for later on too. I also really love how beautiful this restaurant is, it's got a nice French shabby-chic look to it. It's usually fairly empty whenever I'm there, but it still takes a little time to get your food, which I don't mind. I definitely would recommend it anytime you're in town!
rationale: The sentiment is Positive because the review is filled with enthusiastic and complimentary language. The reviewer describes the Croquette Madame and Croque Monsieur as "seriously killer" and "delicious," highlighting them as some of the best sandwiches in the city. Additionally, they appreciate the ambiance of the restaurant and find it beautiful. Despite mentioning a slight wait for the food, the reviewer still highly recommends the restaurant to others, indicating an overall positive experience.

question:
Among the best restaurants in Chambanavoy (I know that's not saying a whole lot, but still!)

Tapas is an awesome concept, and Luna does it well. They always have many small plates to choose from. Even though I'm vegetarian there are always plenty of things on the menu for me.

Food has ranged from mediocre to very good. Pesto burgers were definitely the former (I mean seriously, if you're going to mention pesto, shouldn't there be pesto involved in the dish?), roasted garlic was definitely the latter (so simple, so cheap, so tasty). I have to dock a star just because at Luna's price, I don't expect to see any mediocre dishes - and I've definitely had a few there.

Service has been very nice and friendly, but also very slow (and it's never been all that busy when I've been there, so that can't be used as an excuse). Put two hours on that meter and set a timer on your phone for 1:55 just in case.

It's a little spendy (expect to spend $25+/person + drinks), but if you want a nice meal in Chambanavoy this is about as good as it gets.
rationale: The sentiment in the review is considered positive because the reviewer praises Luna for offering a variety of vegetarian options on their menu, highlighting the concept of tapas and the quality of some dishes as very good. Despite mentioning a few mediocre dishes and slow service, the reviewer appreciates the overall experience at Luna, describing it as a nice place for a meal in Chambanavoy. The positive aspects outweigh the criticisms, leading to an overall positive sentiment towards the restaurant.

question: Maybe I'm not in the right crowd to enjoy the food. The feeling was far too pretentious for my taste, and the food was quite underwhelming.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer expresses dissatisfaction with the overall dining experience. The feeling of pretentiousness and the underwhelming quality of the food indicate that they did not enjoy their visit, and it suggests that they did not feel welcome or satisfied with the food offerings.

question:
I have had two experiences at Luna Cafe, one of which was good. Went there a long time ago with my mom and little sister, and loved the atmosphere and thought the food was decent. 

The second time we went my entire family (8 of us) went after my little sister's graduation from high school. We made a reservation to do the "Chef's Special" meal in which you are given 8 to ten courses of tapas not on the menu that the chef creates.

We showed up at 5:30 or 6, when our reservation was, and they were very under prepared. We were also all STARVING, and my grandfather is diabetic, and after being seated requested some bread or a started to help tide us over until the food arrived. She brought the table of 8 four slices of bread. About a half an hour after arriving we got the first dish, and the others followed, each taking about 30 or so minutes. The dishes were EXTREMELY underwhelming, and the first 4 or 5 were cold. ONE shrimp, or ONE small slice of cheese. There is no way these could count as tapas. They were bites. Needless to say, very disappointing, not worth the hefty price tag.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the customer had a disappointing experience at Luna Cafe during their second visit. The restaurant was underprepared despite the reservation for a special meal, causing hunger and discomfort among the group. The dishes served were described as underwhelming, with some being cold and extremely small in portion size, falling short of the expected quality for the high price paid.

question: Enjoy the ambiance of Luna and there is solid food for the price. A bit skimpy on the vegetarian/vegan options, however I've seen a few more added in the past few years.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the review highlights the enjoyable ambiance of Luna and the acknowledgement of solid food being offered at a good price point. Furthermore, although mentioning a slight lack in vegetarian/vegan options, the reviewer notes that improvements have been made over the past few years, indicating a positive trend towards addressing this issue.

question:
This should be a great restaurant.  It's in a great location, the menu is interesting, and they have a good wine selection.  But this is not a great restaurant; it's a lazy restaurant.  It's a restaurant that is confident that there aren't other good restaurants in town, and that they can coast a little bit because we have no real choice when we want good food.  

Alas for you Luna, you are deceived because  this is not true anymore. There are a lot of good places to eat now.  And in those places, the tables aren't jammed together so closely that you can hear the most intimate details of strangers' conversations (spoiler alert: the conversations are about whether other people can hear the conversation). And in those other places, the portions are not tiny, like sad little retro homages to late 80s nouvelle cuisine. And in those other places, the food arrives at your table in under 40 minutes. 

I really used to like how haphazard Luna was when it was on campus. There was a sort of charm in not really knowing if you would get the food you ordered. But this charm has worn thin, and the last time I ate at Luna (last week), the disjunction between the price and the quality of the food was too great.  No way.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer expresses disappointment and frustration with the restaurant, describing it as lazy and overconfident. They highlight issues such as crowded seating, small portions, slow service, and a perceived disconnect between the price and quality of the food. The reviewer also believes that the restaurant is not keeping up with the evolving dining scene and competition in the area, leading to a sense of dissatisfaction and a lack of value for the experience.

question: Food was overpriced and low quality.  Service was very slow during lunch hour and servers didn't bring out some drinks and amenities even after being asked twice.  Orders were messed up.  Very unorganized.  We ordered the Luna Club which was greasy and a salad which was drowned in dressing.  Had to ask for silverware.  2 hours for lunch is too long.
rationale: The sentiment of this review is negative because the customer experienced multiple issues during their visit to the restaurant. From overpriced and low-quality food to slow service, missing items, orders being messed up, unorganized service, and dishes not prepared as expected, it is clear that the overall experience was disappointing. These various complaints highlight a lack of attention to detail, poor customer service, and a general feeling of dissatisfaction with the dining experience.

question:
Dear Café Luna,

     You had ruined my graduation dinner on May 14th, 2011.  There are so far about, let's say, 2,000 restaurants I had visited throughout my lifetime across the globe.  I had experienced from no service at all to service styles that would leave someone feel so much like a prince or princess.  The restaurants also vary from home dinning to where President Obama and other diplomats would dine at.  None of them, even for the ones provide no service at all, had left me with such a horrific memory.  I had made a reservation at 8p.m. to celebrate the night with my family and friends who came all the way to this seemingly middle of nowhere.  We had arrived a little bit early, waited for at least 10 minutes, asked the others who were waiting, and then been informed that they all had been waiting for at least 30minutes.  One customer told us to find the host wearing white with an apron.  We waited for another 10 minutes to finally found him, then been informed by him that we would have to wait until there is an empty seat.  As a recent grad expecting an exciting and enjoyable dinner, I started to fume up with anger.  Then finally after another 15 minutes, we were being seated.  However, this nightmare did not end then.  We were sitting there for yet another 20 minutes to be finally served with water (and that's after we asked for it).  The server served the water to people next to us who were there later than us first.  Again, the server had our neighbors ordered first before we were allowed to order.  And, we were finally allowed to order after 35 minutes of sitting!  Neither the server, nor the host, was attentive and helpful.  The server had this terrible attitude toward us the whole time.  There was also no water being refilled (unlike our neighbor), so we had to head to the bar to get water ourselves.  Nothing much was explained nor bettered throughout our experience.  And the foods were not the best they could be consider the price.  Since we were "forced" to order off the graduation menu costing $35 per person and plus this outlandish experience, we ended up deciding to offer no tip.  We could not grasp the understanding of this horrific experience.  Was it that our crowd did not seem to be as important as the other bigger crowds?  Was it that we looked foreigner and stupid?  Was it because we were furious having to wait even with a reservation?  Or rather, was it because you guys tend to pretend to be something you are not?  Café Luna, you had successfully ruined my graduation celebration.  Thank you SO much for doing so.  I would never ever go there again.

It was truly a nightmare,

By: One of your customer who intends to let everyone know about this incident
rationale: The sentiment of this review is negative because the customer had a terrible experience at Café Luna during their graduation dinner. The customer expressed feelings of frustration, disappointment, and anger due to the poor service, long wait times, unattentive staff, and lackluster food quality. They were upset about the treatment they received compared to other customers, questioning whether they were treated poorly because of their appearance or nationality. The customer felt that their special occasion was ruined by the restaurant's incompetence and expressed a strong aversion to ever returning. Overall, the review conveys a strong sense of dissatisfaction and disappointment, leading to a negative sentiment.

question:
This was my first dining experience at Cafe Luna and unfortunately I cannot say it was great. 

Pros: the beignets were tasty and so was the sandwich. Nice portions as well. 

Cons: 

-I was seated without a menu. They could have at least said it would be a few minutes until the newly printed menus were ready. 

-I ordered the beignets and they forgot to put chocolate sauce on the plate. 

-The croque monsieur sandwich took about 35 minutes (I know baked menu items take longer but still...) and it wasn't even hot. 

I'll do Sunday brunch somewhere else!
rationale: The sentiment for this review is Negative because the dining experience at Cafe Luna did not meet the customer's expectations. The customer highlighted several cons such as being seated without a menu, missing chocolate sauce on their order, a long wait time for their sandwich that arrived cold, and overall dissatisfaction with the service received. These factors indicate a subpar experience that left the customer feeling disappointed and unlikely to return.

question:
OK- this review has been a long time coming.  I have visited Luna four times now and each time is worse than before.  First off, the service is always slow and they seem to consistently be out of specials.  I have gone for lunch multiple times and it always averages two hours b.c. the service is soooo slow.  

Now, onto my dinner last night.  I sat at the bar and ordered a glass of wine- which promptly came in a dirty glass complete with a lip imprint!  The waitress apologized and then announced she was the only server in the whole restaurant and the place was full!  She also mentioned that they started their new menu last night and she had no idea what was on it.  Classy. 

I ordered the lobster ravioli and after 10 minutes, she returned and said "I don't know why this is the special.  The chef is searching for the pasta."  No thank you.  I changed my order to the chicken dijonaise.  It came out looking decent until I took a bite.  There was so much salt on it, I couldn't eat it.  

This place is so overrated it's not even funny.  I wouldn't be surprised if they closed down soon and honestly hope they do.  The service is awful, food is less than mediocre, and it's overpriced.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is negative because the customer had consistently poor experiences at Luna, including slow service, being frequently out of specials, receiving a dirty glass, dealing with unprepared staff, and encountering high levels of salt in their food. These negative experiences have led the customer to believe that the restaurant is overrated, with subpar food quality and service, as well as feeling it's overpriced.

question:
Let me start by saying, if zero stars were an option, that's what they'd get! Not once, not twice, but I made three separate visits to Luna, each one worse than the last! I will speak of my last visit because it's fresh in my mind!

It was Monday night, 10/03/2011 around 6:45pm. I stood at the door for the better part of 10 minutes before I grabbed my own menu and finally seated myself. I saw the waitress running around the restaurant, frantically trying to accommodate everybody. She finally made her way over to me and took my drink order. Since I had ample time to look over the menu, I already knew what I wanted and had placed my food order at that time as well.

I ordered the fried goat cheese as an appetizer and the Filet--cooked MEDIUM! My goat cheese came out about 5 minutes after ordering. Looked great...but she forgot my bread. When I got her attention and asked her for the bread that is suppose to be served with the goat cheese, she told me they didn't have any fresh bread ready, but there was some in the oven. Needless to say, 10 minutes had passed before my bread came out! Now my goat cheese was cooled and not easily spreadable! 

From that point, I waited for an additional 15 minutes before my meal came out. It looked great! The seasoned fries that came with the fillet were pretty good. As I sliced into my fillet, a pool of blood came gushing out!!! I cut the fillet in half, down the middle and spread it apart. It was so red and bloody, it almost looked purple! The center of the fillet was cool to the touch! 

I immediately got the attention of the frazzled server and brought it to her attention. She apologized and took the steak back to the kitchen to be put back on the grill. I sat and waited another 15 minutes before I saw my fillet again. It was the same piece of meat brought back out with fresh garnishments. I parted the fillet once again, only to find my steak was just as bloody and bright red as the first time! Now I'm livid! It was once again, cool to the touch! Keep in mind, I'm paying almost $30 for this dinner, without appetizer or drink. 

I brought the server back over and asked her if she thought my fillet was cooked medium...she hung her head in shame, apologized once again, and agreed with me that the fillet sitting in front of me was nowhere near medium. She pulled the plate back and was going to take it back to the kitchen when I stopped her and told her to box it up, and I will take it home and cook it myself! I gave Luna 2 different opportunities and around 90 minutes of my time, only to be disappointed again! I boxed up my fillet, paid my bill, and left the restaurant mad, once again! The only thing she did to compensate me for my experience was, a free drink. Meanwhile, I paid a $42 bill, for a horrible dinner, for myself! 

The service sucks, their attitude is horrible and the food is so overpriced! If the owner would call me today and offer me a free meal, I would hang up on her! I'm never going back! I've wasted enough time and money in that place! If you choose to go, best of luck!

LUNA GETS SHUT DOWN FOR HEALTH VIOLATIONS!  PLEASE READ...
http://cu-citizenaccess.org/content/new-records-show-more-restaurant-inspection-failures
rationale: The sentiment in the review is Negative because the reviewer had multiple negative experiences during their visits to Luna. They experienced poor service, delays in receiving their food, and a significant issue with the quality of their meal, specifically the undercooked fillet steak. The reviewer expressed frustration at the lack of proper handling of their concerns by the server and management, and felt that the overall dining experience was not worth the high price they paid. Additionally, the mention of health violations reported in a news article further adds to the negative sentiment associated with Luna.

question:
Uggggg....

OK, so I used to love Luna when it was on campus.  LOVE. IT.  Which I guess is why I have repeatedly attempted to continue my love affair at the new location.  

First and second, I went with a group for brunch.  The place was nearly empty the first time, but we waited forever for the food.  My second trip, our group had reservations and we still waited 45 minutes! I enjoyed my breakfasts (poached egg  with lox) but the service was suck.

Third (and I'm afraid final) visit was a disaster.  This was another large-ish group (about 12) with reservations.  Drink orders were taken but never filled.  Our food orders were not taken at the same time; not even close.  I was the last person to order food (by about 20 minutes) but the first person to receive my meal.  On the other hand, my husband didn't receive his dinner until after the rest of us had eaten!  All of this happened while thirsty patrons are still waiting for their first drinks.

I ordered risotto that night.  Mistake.  It was like a sticky sort-of rice pudding that was cold and just all wrong.  The very delicious-looking fries were sort of like my risotto, cold and wrong.  The steaks that my friends ordered looked great, but some were not cooked to order.

I think the most annoying part of the night was that the restaurant will not accept more than two credit cards from a party.  They will split up the check, but they will only allow two parties to use plastic.  In this day and age, I don't know how this kind of policy could even be imagined, but we asked the waitress to combine some checks so that we could accommodate.  Of course that was all wrong and took another half hour.

I also wish they wouldn't cram their tables they way they do, especially next to the door.  It's so cold, loud and crowded.  And by the way, on our way out the back to parking lot, I could hear all of the employees in the kitchen yelling about how they couldn't wait to get out of there and that they hated being there...my sentiments exactly.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is Negative due to the numerous issues the customer experienced during their visits to the restaurant. These issues include long wait times despite having reservations, inconsistent and slow service, incorrect or poorly prepared food, problems with splitting the check, uncomfortable seating arrangements, and negative comments overheard from staff. The customer's overall experience was marred by these factors, leading them to express frustration and disappointment with Luna's new location.

question: I just read that this place was temporarily shut down by health inspectors for scoring -9 out of 100 on their inspection.  Disgusting!
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the user expresses disgust upon learning that the place was temporarily shut down by health inspectors after scoring a very low -9 out of 100 on their inspection. This information indicates that the establishment had serious health and safety issues, resulting in a negative experience for customers and potentially raising concerns about the overall quality of the place.

question:
I WOULD RATHER EAT OUT OF THE GARBAGE ... than eat at Cafe Luna again.

The day we went they had a set menu for $45 a person. 4 courses. Without exaggeration, THE FOOD WAS DISGUSTING. This was my first time here, so I didn't know what to expect. The restaurant looked nice, good atmosphere. The service was fine.

FIRST COURSE: Lox with cream spread and bread and Oysters
The salmon tasted like it was two weeks old. It had that rancid fish smell you get when you buy old discount fish from meijer. The oysters were the same. Terrible.

SECOND COURSE: Coconut Shrimp and Mixed greens with beets
The Coconut Shrimp tasted like it came straight from the buffet line at a cheap Chinese restaurant. Cheap quality. I wouldn't be surprised if it came from some frozen bag at costco. Mixed greens with beets was pretty good. 

THIRD COURSE: New York Strip Steak and Lamp Chops
I swear on my life this is the worst steak I've ever had. The meat was tough and stringy. It was WAY over-seasoned. And it was like 50% tough, inedible fat. I could make a better steak when I was 12. The Lamb Chops were so tough, we couldn't even eat them. 

DESSERT: Berry pastry, flourless chocolate cake, and some shitty marshmallow thing covered in chocolate and coconut
What can I say? Dessert was the best part of the meal. And it was still awful. The pastry was fine. Nice and flaky. However, the flourless chocolate cake (portion was the size of my thumb) was subpar, and the marshmallow dessert tasted like sugared tar. It was impossible to chew.

Dropped $120 with tip (two people) for the worst food I've ever had at a respectable looking restaurant. I understand it was a set menu day and their tapas are better. However, what self-respecting chef/cook serves food this low-quality to anyone on anyday? I enjoy good food, but I'm definitely no snob. This was just unacceptable.
rationale: The sentiment expressed in the review is negative because the reviewer had a very disappointing experience at Cafe Luna. The food was described as disgusting, with specific criticisms of each course highlighting issues such as rancid fish, low-quality shrimp, tough and over-seasoned steak, and inedible lamb chops. Even the dessert, which is typically a redeeming aspect of a meal, was deemed awful. The reviewer felt that the quality of the food was unacceptable, especially considering the price they paid. Overall, the review conveys a strong sense of dissatisfaction and disappointment with the dining experience, leading to a negative sentiment.

question:
OMG! I think my last review of this place had been deleted or flagged for no reason! I couldn't find it from the actual review page! 

Here is the review I posted on June 13th, 2011:

Dear Café Luna,

    You had ruined my graduation dinner on May 14th, 2011.  There are so far about, let's say, 2,000 restaurants I had visited throughout my lifetime across the globe.  I had experienced from no service at all to service styles that would leave someone feel so much like a prince or princess.  The restaurants also vary from home dinning to where President Obama and other diplomats would dine at.  None of them, even for the ones provide no service at all, had left me with such a horrific memory.  I had made a reservation at 8p.m. to celebrate the night with my family and friends who came all the way to this seemingly middle of nowhere.  We had arrived a little bit early, waited for at least 10 minutes, asked the others who were waiting, and then been informed that they all had been waiting for at least 30minutes.  One customer told us to find the host wearing white with an apron.  We waited for another 10 minutes to finally found him, then been informed by him that we would have to wait until there is an empty seat.  As a recent grad expecting an exciting and enjoyable dinner, I started to fume up with anger.  Then finally after another 15 minutes, we were being seated.  However, this nightmare did not end then.  We were sitting there for yet another 20 minutes to be finally served with water (and that's after we asked for it).  The server served the water to people next to us who were there later than us first.  Again, the server had our neighbors ordered first before we were allowed to order.  And, we were finally allowed to order after 35 minutes of sitting!  Neither the server, nor the host, was attentive and helpful.  The server had this terrible attitude toward us the whole time.  There was also no water being refilled (unlike our neighbor), so we had to head to the bar to get water ourselves.  Nothing much was explained nor bettered throughout our experience.  And the foods were not the best they could be consider the price.  Since we were "forced" to order off the graduation menu costing $35 per person and plus this outlandish experience, we ended up deciding to offer no tip.  We could not grasp the understanding of this horrific experience.  Was it that our crowd did not seem to be as important as the other bigger crowds?  Was it that we looked foreigner and stupid?  Was it because we were furious having to wait even with a reservation?  Or rather, was it because you guys tend to pretend to be something you are not?  Café Luna, you had successfully ruined my graduation celebration.  Thank you SO much for doing so.  I would never ever go there again.

It was truly a nightmare,

By: One of your customer who intends to let everyone know about this incident
rationale: The sentiment of this review is negative because the customer expressed disappointment and frustration with their experience at Café Luna. They described a series of unfortunate events during their graduation dinner, highlighting issues such as long wait times, poor service, lack of attentiveness from staff, and unsatisfactory food quality considering the price. The customer felt that their special occasion was ruined, leading them to conclude that they would never return to the restaurant. The overall tone of the review conveys a sense of anger and disappointment, contributing to the negative sentiment.

question: A place Gordon Ramsay should visit.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the review implies that the place is not up to the standard that Gordon Ramsay, a renowned chef known for visiting and critiquing restaurants, would find appealing. The suggestion that it is a place he "should visit" may suggest that the location is in need of improvement or has experienced issues that would catch his attention for not so positive reasons.

question: They took down my review twice..... It was not offensive at all except stating the facts. Yelp should stop letting the owners easily taking off the reviews......
rationale: The sentiment of the review is Negative because the user expresses frustration and dissatisfaction with Yelp's review removal process and believes their review, which they consider to be factual and non-offensive, was unfairly removed. The user is unhappy with the perceived ease with which owners can take down reviews, indicating a lack of transparency and fairness in the review platform's policies.

question: My favorite place to get brunch in this neck of the woods. The beignets and eggs benedict are killerrrr. I will say however the staff is a little too unattentive for a 5 star review
rationale: The sentiment is still considered positive because the user highlights that the food at the brunch place is exceptional, particularly praising the beignets and eggs benedict. Although they mention that the staff is a bit inattentive, the overall positive experience with the food likely outweighs the minor drawback of the staff's attentiveness, leading to a positive sentiment overall.

question:
There is a long standing debate between my friends and I over the best Indian restaurant on Green street. Unlike Chinese food here, there isn't much competition, so it's basically Bombay vs. East and West. East and West is completely vegetarian and leans towards Southern Indian style snacks, whereas Bombay Grill has heartier food  and has a more formal dinner.

I think some of their dishes are a little overspiced, but the Tandoori chicken is absolutely divine with a crisp skin and the perfect amount of seasoning. I only wish it came with more chicken and less of the lentil side and gigantic naan. Don't get me wrong, the naan here is great, but more of that chicken would be better. 

The service is quite slow and it is pretty expensive, so I reserve going here for when I really need a treat.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is positive because the reviewer praises the Tandoori chicken at Bombay Grill as "absolutely divine" with the "perfect amount of seasoning." They also acknowledge the quality of the naan even though they wish for more chicken. Despite some criticisms about the overspicing of dishes, slow service, and high prices, the reviewer still reserves visiting the restaurant for when they really need a treat, indicating an overall positive impression of the dining experience.

question: Ok, I am a food snob from Los Angeles. Just moved here and to be totally honest  I think the food here is so plain. Yes, you have a lot of great steak places and American food but things such as Sushi ( there is NO good places I have tried each and every one) and Indian are hard to come by. We first went to Basmati and honestly I thought we were doomed. There was no flavor and most dishes seemed to be watered down. NOW, we were driving near campus and we drove by Bombay and I am more then happy we stopped. As for the other poster whos friends said its over spiced, have you tried real Indian food? This is tame in comparison. The food is just right and always served fresh and hot. The semosas are great and served with the best sauces. We love the Gobi Aloo and chicken masala, we will be back to try other dishes. Bottom line other then the lackluster decor and sometimes dirty looking floors this place was a sweet treat for those of us who are used to some variety!
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer had a negative experience at one Indian restaurant but found a better alternative in Bombay. They appreciated the flavorful and fresh food served at Bombay, enjoying dishes like Gobi Aloo and chicken masala. Despite some minor issues with the decor and cleanliness, the reviewer overall had a pleasant dining experience, describing it as a "sweet treat" and expressing intentions to return to try other dishes. Their positive feedback on the food quality and taste reflects a favorable sentiment towards Bombay.

question: This is probably my favorite place to eat in C-U.  I come from Boston, the land of 100 Indian restaurants.  I fell in love with Indian there, and was very wary of moving to a tiny midwestern city.  However, Bombay definitely hits the spot.  I like the typical curry dishes, chicken tikka masala, samosas, naan - all are great here.  My husband is a bit more adventurous and he has never been disappointed.  Granted, it's not better than many of the places we've been to in Boston - but it's way better than I expected for around here!  On the down side, it's pretty small and very crowded around lunch time.  Good luck finding space for more than just 2 at noon!
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer expresses enthusiasm and satisfaction with their dining experience at the restaurant. They highlight their favorite dishes and mention that even though the restaurant may not be as good as some in Boston, they were pleasantly surprised by the quality of the food in a small Midwestern city. The reviewer also mentions that their husband, who is more adventurous with food, has also enjoyed the meals. Despite some drawbacks like limited space during peak hours, overall, the reviewer's tone is upbeat and appreciative of the restaurant.

question: If you are a female and like to be gawked at, I recommend this place for you. The staff stare like they have never seen a woman before. Also, if you like black hair as a garnish in your chicken makhani, you'll really enjoy it here. \n\nDisgusting. Threw out a $10 plate of food after finding hair. Not to mention when brought to the attention of the staff, there was no apology or anything to fix it.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is Negative because the customer had a bad experience at the restaurant. They found hair in their food, which is unhygienic and unacceptable. Additionally, the staff's behavior of staring at the customer made them feel uncomfortable and unwelcome. The lack of apology or any attempt to rectify the situation further contributed to the negative sentiment expressed in the review.

question: I got food poisoning here.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the review mentions experiencing food poisoning, which is a serious health issue and implies that the food served at the mentioned establishment was unsafe and caused harm to the reviewer.

question:
Let me start by saying, I NEVER had a bad meal at the location on Green Street.

However, the problem started when Bombay moved into the old Basmati's restaurant on 1st.

For all intents and purposes, this restaurant is Basmati's all over again.  The decor was exactly the same.  The waiters seemed to be the same too.  However, would we still have the same bland food that made Basmati my least favorite restaurant?

Well, yes and no.

Even with an expanded area for cooking and serving, the food is identical to the location on Green Street.  Wait, no, not identical.  The main courses cost about $3.00 more than on Green Street.

Of course there's the addition of alcohol on the menu, but the location on 1st doesn't afford you the great meal at a low price that the Green Street location was so good at.
rationale: The sentiment in the review is negative because the reviewer expresses disappointment in the lack of improvement in the restaurant's food quality despite the change in location. They mentioned that the food was bland, and even though there were some additions like alcohol on the menu, the increased prices did not justify the overall dining experience. Additionally, the reviewer highlights that the new location failed to capture the charm and value that made the original location on Green Street a favorite. Overall, the comparison between the old and new locations leads to a negative sentiment due to perceived stagnation and a feeling of not receiving value for the money spent.

question:
Totally solid, no-frills Indian food.  The lunch specials are affordable and come with rice/naan (THE LARGEST PIECE OF NAAN YOU'VE EVER SEEN), salad, and a veggie pakora - for under $10.  Yes, please!

I've only been to the 1st Street location once, but from what I've tasted, the food is basically the same here.  Creamy chicken tikka masala (my fave, I'm a gringo, I know) with crispy, buttery naan, mmm.  I tried my boyfriend's Lamb Saag dish and loved it also.

Why is the lunch so affordable?  Because it's a really small place (the tables are tightly-packed in), there's no waiter service, and your meal is served on Styrofoam.  This is Indian food for poor college students.  If you want a more relaxed, "restaurant-y" atmosphere (and don't mind paying a few extra dollars), head over to the Bombay Grill on 1st.  But if, like me, you are in grad school and up to your ass in student loan debt, this is the place for you.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer appreciates the affordability and generous portions of the Indian food at the described restaurant. They highlight the tasty dishes, such as the chicken tikka masala and lamb saag, and express satisfaction with the overall dining experience despite the no-frills atmosphere. The reviewer acknowledges and appreciates the cost-effective nature of the establishment, making it suitable for those on a budget, like college and grad students. Their enthusiastic tone and descriptions of the food indicate a favorable opinion of the restaurant.

question: I would highly recommend the lamb curry which is spicy and comes with fragrant basmati rice. The naan is really great too. I also enjoy the aloo tikki appetizer, as well as the samosas. I am not an expert on Indian food so I can't tell you how authentic it is, but I can tell you that it is delicious.
rationale: The sentiment in the review is positive because the reviewer highly recommends specific dishes such as the lamb curry, naan, aloo tikki, and samosas due to their great taste. Despite not being an expert on Indian cuisine, they describe the food as delicious, which indicates their overall satisfaction with the dining experience. The positive language used to describe the flavors and quality of the dishes suggests that the reviewer enjoyed their meal and would likely return to the restaurant.

question: my favorite restaurant of ANY variety here in town.  not only have i never had a bad meal here, but i've never had anything short of FANTASTIC!!  i prefer this location to the tablecloth place on 1st.  spicy ginger chicken is the best, and they'll make it hot as you like it.  naan is a must with your order!
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer expressed a high level of satisfaction and enthusiasm for the restaurant. They consistently enjoy the meals they have had there, describing them as fantastic. They also praise a specific dish as the best and highlight the customization options available. Additionally, recommending a specific item and emphasizing it as a must-have further indicates their positive experience at the restaurant.

question: I've eaten at a lot of Indian places and I love Indian food. I must say, I was very pleased with this place, especially given its location. The food was delicious and pretty authentic. I gave it four stars because the service was so-so and there was no ice in the water.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is positive because the reviewer mentions that they were very pleased with the Indian restaurant, emphasizing that the food was delicious and pretty authentic. Despite some minor issues with the service and water, the overall impression is favorable, resulting in a positive review.

question: This restaurant is dam costly and is not at all worth for the food they serve. I am Vegan and Paid $13.2 for just 3 types of sides and naan bread and custard. Food was ot worth more than $6 however we were shocked to see their heavy check. Food is not so tasty to admire. It doesnt have the true authentic Indian food taste. They make sides of potatoes and green peas which are cheap in market to keep their profit margin high. They are smart enough to rob people. Please try other Indian restaurant who give you many option to eat for less than $10.
rationale: The review expresses dissatisfaction with the high prices charged by the restaurant in relation to the quality and quantity of food served. The reviewer also criticizes the lack of authentic Indian flavors and feels that the expensive sides, such as potatoes and green peas, are used to increase the profit margin. The overall negative tone indicates disappointment and a lack of value perceived by the reviewer, leading to the negative sentiment of the review.

question:
This is the best Indian food you'll find in Urbana-Champaign.  Growing up in India and spending more than a decade in New Jersey, I have had luxury of trying out Indian food at many places (incl. home!!).  The taste of the food is authentic, not too spicy, but not at all bland.  True art of Indian food is to use variety of herbs and spices in a way that it enhances the taste of food, but doesn't dominate the overall taste. Many Indian restaurants either are afraid of using spices or carelessly overdo it.   Bombay Grill nails that aspect, so it gets five stars from me. 

Besides the taste, the food isn't that expensive for an Indian restaurant standard.  We tried weekday buffet last week.  For $11 + tip + tax, it had enough varieties.  Some really good, some right on mediocrity, which is very common with buffet. Their butter chicken and tandoori roast chicken are worth trying.  Saag paneer is phenomenal for those interested in vegetarian options.  Lunch buffet had probably the best naan I've tried in many years.  They are freshly baked and new ones keep coming worm and fluffy from the kitchen. Judging from the buffet food, I can confidently say that a la carte items would be a bang for your buck too!!

Next time will try dinner and see if it's equally satisfying as the lunch buffet.
rationale: The sentiment of the review is Positive because the reviewer praises the authenticity and quality of the Indian food at Bombay Grill in Urbana-Champaign. They highlight the balanced use of herbs and spices, the reasonable pricing, and the variety offered at the weekday buffet. The reviewer also mentions specific dishes that they enjoyed, such as the butter chicken and saag paneer. Overall, the review expresses high satisfaction and a willingness to return for dinner, indicating a positive experience at the restaurant.

question:
I ordered my food online with my credit card at about 6:30 PM. 

At 8PM, I called Bombay Indian Grill, and asked about the status of my food. I was told that the delivery guy should be picking up soon.

Around 9PM, I called again. This time I was told I had to call delivery.com. I tried calling, and no one picks up. 

Around 9:30PM, I get a call from the delivery person. When I go to take my food, he says, "you're supposed to pay with cash." I explained that I already paid via yelp's link for online delivery with my credit card. He said, "it says you are paying with cash." I proceed to stand there for fifteen minutes, while he calls various people to finally get to the number to call to confirm my method of payment. He says, "do you have your credit card?" I respond, "no." He says, "you'll need it because they're going to want to confirm the payment." Mind you, I am in the law building. My stuff is on the other side of the law building. I am not wandering around looking for my credit card, while he calls people to confirm my payment. I just stood there. At one point, I said, just void this I don't want it. Then my hunger snapped me back to my senses. 

After some time on the phone, he is told I paid with my credit card already. I told him I would not be using their services again, he said "okay." He walked out unaffected. 

Around 10 PM, I called the number on delivery.com, and heard no apologies. 

Thanks Bombay Grill, for providing me with the distinct pleasure of paying $23 to have cold mutter paneer and wilted garlic naan delivered to me more than 2.5 hours after I ordered it. The lack of silverware and napkins was a nice touch.

Thanks delivery.com, for demonstrating that incompetence and a lack of care is possible at all levels of an organization.
rationale: The sentiment in the review is negative because the customer experienced multiple issues with their food delivery order. They had to wait over 2.5 hours for their food, encountered confusion and lack of coordination between Bombay Indian Grill and delivery.com regarding payment methods, received cold and wilted food, and found the customer service to be lacking in both responsiveness and empathy. This overall experience left the customer dissatisfied and frustrated, highlighting multiple shortcomings in the service provided by both the restaurant and the delivery platform.

question: Okay Indian food. Bit overpriced. The naan is big and fresh. The service is sub par. I ordered an aloo paratha once and the owner brought me a regular paratha. Did you think I didn't know? The vindaloo tastes okay. The lassi is waaayyy too thick. They do have mango kulfi, which Ambar does not. But 10 out of 10 times I would go to Ambar.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the review highlighted several shortcomings of the restaurant, such as being overpriced, subpar service, mistakes with orders, and dissatisfaction with the quality of some dishes like the lassi being too thick. The reviewer also mentioned that despite some positive aspects like the fresh naan and availability of mango kulfi, they would still prefer another restaurant, Ambar, over this one.

question: I'm not sure if it was Jon I met there a few times, but the man behind the counter was helpful and funny.  Don't ask for a cheap cigar or you'll be corrected - 'no no no - \"inexpensive\" - cheap implies poor quality' - in the voice of a movie college professor.  A good place to buy gifts for guys, even if not cigars, especially the cool zippo lighters.  They carry a full line of humidores and smoking accessories.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer highlights positive aspects of the experience, such as the helpful and funny attitude of the man behind the counter, the variety of gift options available for guys, the cool zippo lighters, and the full line of humidors and smoking accessories offered at the store. Overall, the review emphasizes the reviewer's satisfaction with the products and services provided, making it a positive sentiment.

question: A pipe-smokers paradise! This tiny shop has a dazzling selection of new and vintage pipes, along with the most extensive selection of tinned tobaccos I've ever seen outside of a Web site. Even better, the staff is extremely knowledgeable, friendly, and happy to chat. This is what a pipe shop should be -- and what virtually none of them are anymore.
rationale: The review expresses positive sentiment by highlighting the shop's impressive selection of new and vintage pipes, extensive variety of tinned tobaccos, and knowledgeable and friendly staff. The reviewer appreciates the personalized service and engaging atmosphere, indicating that the shop embodies the qualities one would expect in a top-tier pipe store. This overall positive experience is reflected in the reviewer's enthusiastic praise and glowing recommendation, making it clear that they had a truly enjoyable visit.

question:
They've got a great selection of cigars AND pipes.  It's hard to find a good selection of the latter this day and age.  Most shops cater to the higher margin and repeat cigar business more than the pipe business.  Many other shops seem to carry pipes as an afterthought.  That's not the case at Jon's.  Jon's is a pipe shop first and foremost, they just happen to carry cigars too.

They have a huge selection of pipes, and most are priced fairly.  They have a nice selection of bulk/house blend pipe tobaccos and a respectable offering of tinned pipe tobaccos.  Plenty of accessories to round out your shopping experience.  The store is a little small/cramped, but that's a given considering their proximity to campus.  I never felt uncomfortable in the store -- it just adds to the charm.

If you're a college kid looking for RYO tobacco and supplies, yes, Jon's stocks those items as well.  This is no head shop, so don't waste your time looking for pipes made from materials other than briar or meerschaum.

I dropped a good amount of dough here considering it was my first visit.  I found a pipe I just had to have, a couple bulk blends that caught my attention, and some tins that appeared to have some age on them (a good thing).  After I left the store, I met up with the owner and other regulars at a local bar that has a covered/heated patio area and bought two more cigars at that event (it's a weekly or monthly thing they do).

Overall, it's a great shop with an outstanding pipe selection, a very good pipe tobacco selection, and a good cigar selection.  If you're lucky enough to catch the owner, he's an extremely personable and nice fellow.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer praises the shop's excellent selection of both cigars and pipes, emphasizing the focus on pipes which is not common in many other shops. The reviewer also compliments the fair pricing, variety of tobacco blends, and range of accessories available. Additionally, the reviewer had a positive interaction with the owner and other customers, indicating a welcoming and friendly atmosphere. Overall, the reviewer's experience was enjoyable, leading to a favorable assessment of Jon's shop.

question:
I usually never have a problem here, but I just got talked to like I was a pile of crap stinking up the place.
I came to get snus and they were out of the regular flavor and I was like shucks and the guy (beady eyes, dark hair, mustache, glasses) just sort of looked at me like he was already tired of me. So I asked "when are you getting any more in?" You know, a normal customer question when things are out of stock....and he just huffs and says in the most contemptuous way possible "UH well MAYBE at the end of NEXT WEEK after we MOVE to the NEW LOCATION"...with a scowl on his face while shaking his head and turning to his pipe.
I was just taken aback and said "oh you're moving huh" and he whips his head back scowling 'YEAH, we're MOVING", continuing to shake his head and turning away as if I should have known all along and just inconvenienced him with the dumbest question he's ever heard. Well excuuuuse me, I didn't get the memo! It's not like I came in seconds to closing or that I was interrupting him while he was busy, there was nobody else in the place. 

So I just silently walked out, never to come back! Obviously I'm not welcome anymore. Way to think that one through, old BOY. I wished I had said something but this is more constructive. No use trying to reason with that cantankerous, condescending old codger attitude.
 I need to quit anyway, so thanks for helping me kick the habit. 
Seriously, how about take a vacation or try exercising once in your life already, if that's all it takes to unload your bad day or moving woes on regular customers you're expected to treat with common courtesy. You know, since your brick and mortar tobacco industry sort of depends on it....that whole free-market thing...
rationale: The sentiment of this review is negative because the customer had a poor experience at the store when inquiring about a product that was out of stock. The staff member displayed contempt, rudeness, and condescension towards the customer, making them feel unwelcome and unappreciated. The customer felt disrespected and decided not to return to the store due to the poor treatment they received. The overall tone of the review is critical and highlights the lack of professionalism and customer service exhibited by the store employee, leading to a negative impression of the establishment.

question: This shop is everything that a pipe collector could want. The shop keepers however, are smug and condescending.  They spoke down to me and seemed very put out that I was even in the store. I like to shop at local establishments but after this experience I will be buying my pipes on line.  Plus, they both speak like Mr. Howell from Gilligan's island, pretentious and fake.  Great selection, but you can find the same for cheaper online without the insulting clerks.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer had a poor experience dealing with the shopkeepers, who came across as smug, condescending, and pretentious. The reviewer felt spoken down to and unwelcome in the store, leading them to decide to shop online for their pipes instead. The negative interactions with the shopkeepers overshadowed the positive aspects of the shop, such as its great selection.

question: Boo notes and quotes for raising prices tenfold just b/c they were making illegal copies. No one should pay $150 for 100 pages of paper.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer is expressing frustration and disagreement towards a company raising prices tenfold simply because customers previously made illegal copies of their product. The reviewer believes that charging $150 for just 100 pages of paper is unreasonable and unjustified. This reaction reflects a sense of dissatisfaction and disapproval towards the company's decision to significantly increase prices based on the actions of a few individuals.

question: I hated this place because professors would make us go here to get course packets.  Why do I need to pay for them, why can't you just provide it to me for free when you're getting the damn syllabus printed!  It was especially the worst when you wait in line for 20 minutes just to get a 20 pg packet.
rationale: The sentiment is Negative because the individual expressed strong dislike and frustration towards the situation they experienced. They felt unhappy about having to pay for course packets that they believe should be provided for free and were irritated by the inconvenience of waiting in a long line for what they considered to be a simple and unnecessary task. Their negative emotions are evident in their use of words such as "hated," "damn," and "worst," indicating a highly unfavorable opinion of the experience.

question: Oh boy, what a crazy place this is.  Large portions, reasonable prices, varying quality, weird staff, dingy place, cheap drinks in the basement.  I've heard people rave and dis it - the only thing I have first hand experience with is the chicken tenders. I'm something of a chicken tenders/strips conisseur (sp?).  \n\nThey do homemade chicken strips with a batter that's not too far off from the kind at Chilli's, almost like a tempura type of thing.  When they're good, they give esquire a run for best around.  Too often though, the tempura-mental batter puffs up like a corndog and soaks up too much grease - my theory is that they just don't keep the oil hot enough.  i've basically sworn it off because of this inconsistency.  Also, the honey mustard is like some funky yellow mayonaise.  Blech!
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer expresses dissatisfaction with several aspects of their experience at the establishment: large portions, reasonable prices, varying quality, weird staff, dingy place, and cheap drinks. Specifically, the reviewer's disappointment with the chicken tenders, which they claim to be a connoisseur of, highlights inconsistencies in the batter and the quality of the food. The negative comments about the texture of the batter and the flavor of the honey mustard contribute to an overall unfavorable impression of the food.

question: The food is great for lunch. Huge portions, pretty cheap. Best are the Chicken fingers (enormous, 2 is plenty with fries) and the \"Godfather\" sandwich (also huge). Drink specials at night are super cheap. I think they have $3 pitchers every night.
rationale: The review highlights several positive aspects of the restaurant, such as great food for lunch, huge portions at affordable prices, specific standout menu items like the Chicken fingers and "Godfather" sandwich, and discounted drink specials in the evening. The reviewer also mentions the value of $3 pitchers every night, which adds to the overall positive experience at the establishment.

question: I'm kind of tempted to give this place 5 stars for the memories, but 4 I guess will suffice.  The only thing I ever really got there was the baked mostaccioli, and it was soooo delicious and so so so so cheap ($5.95 for a full, which is definitely more worth it than the half for a dollar cheaper or so) and they give you such a big portion that it lasts you days and days and it still tastes so good when you microwave it up!!  Their garlic bread's not the best, but it's edible and again, I can't stress how much I love that baked mostaccioli!!!!
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer highly praises the delicious and affordable baked mostaccioli they had at the place, emphasizing the generous portion size and how it remained tasty even when reheated. Despite a slight criticism of the garlic bread, the overall positive experience and love for the baked mostaccioli shines through in the review.

question:
These are the best chicken strips I have ever had.  I went to Ohio and ate at Raising Cane's which is a chicken strips franchise and they paled in comparison.  Even in the city of Chicago you will not find a chicken strip as good as here.  They are huge! 

If these were indeed the fingers of a chicken they would be of some mutant killer robot chicken that could probably kill us all.

The service can be pretty surly and they are kind of nickel and dime nazis with the water and sauce.  But the chicken...oh the chicken.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer highly praises the chicken strips, describing them as the best they have ever had and noting that they exceed other popular chain options. The reviewer emphasizes the size and quality of the chicken strips, even humorously suggesting they come from a mutant killer robot chicken. Despite some criticism of the service and policies regarding water and sauce, the overall positive sentiment is driven by the exceptional quality and taste of the chicken strips, making it a positive review.

question:
Honestly, seriously and absolutely the best freakin' chicken fingers I have ever had.  They measure about 6" x 2" and are always hot, golden brown and delish!  Their honey mustard is on the mayonaisey side, but makes a good compliment to the biggest chicken fingers on the planet.  

The bar in the basement has cheap pitchers/good drink specials and that is pretty much all I have to say about that.

Minus one star for the basement bar inspiring claustrophobia that I didn't know I had.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the review praises the chicken fingers as the best ever tasted, describing them as hot, golden brown, and delicious. The mention of the honey mustard being a good compliment adds to the positive feedback. Additionally, the positive comment about the cheap pitchers and good drink specials in the basement bar contributes to an overall positive sentiment despite the minor drawback mentioned about feeling claustrophobic. The reviewer's tone is enthusiastic and satisfied, highlighting their enjoyment of the food and drinks offered at the establishment.

question:
Great pizza on mondays deal!

4.99 for a large pizza with cheese off of EatCu.com

I got a large with half steak and half italian beef.

Let me say, it was the most delicious hearty pizza I have ever had for 6 bucks. 
I usually get Papa Johns large pineapple for 5 bucks, but it gets old. This is good "Italian" pizza. (as italian as they say they are.)

Anyway, I keep reading all these rave reviews about the chicken tenders, and as I waited for my pizza, multiple people came in and ordered those chicken tenders, so they must be good.

But back to my pizza, it was AMAZING. I took 2 slices and and im not even hungry anymore. THis baby is gonna last me for the rest of the night and at least 1 slice for breakfast tomorrow.

5/5 stars A+
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the reviewer thoroughly enjoyed their experience with the pizza deal. They praised the taste of the pizza, specifically mentioning it as hearty and delicious. The reviewer even compared it favorably to other pizza options they usually go for, indicating a higher level of satisfaction. Additionally, they expressed satisfaction with the portion size of the pizza, stating it would last them for the rest of the night and even into the next day. Overall, the reviewer gave the experience a 5/5 rating and an A+, indicating a highly positive sentiment.

question: Last chicken fingers I had were a little salty and overfried.  Plus, they charged me $0.50 for more sauce.  Seriously, how can you win the hearts of your customers with stinginess.  Anyways, I still love you Geo's..but you are no longer in my selective 5 star club.
rationale: The sentiment is considered positive because despite the negative aspects mentioned (salty and overfried chicken fingers, extra charge for sauce, exclusion from the selective 5-star club), the reviewer still expresses love for the restaurant, Geo's. The reviewer acknowledges their ongoing loyalty and appreciation for the establishment, indicating an overall positive sentiment despite the specific criticisms mentioned.

question:
I didn't like this place.

First, the service is slow.
Second, the food is not that good.

Gyros are below the average and chicken is too greasy! I don't wanna talk about fries...

So, this place is so overrated!
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the user expresses dissatisfaction with the service, food quality, and overall experience at the place they visited. They specifically mention slow service, below-average gyros, greasy chicken, and disappointing fries, indicating a general lack of satisfaction with their visit. Their comment that the place is "overrated" further emphasizes their negative experience.

question:
OK, another bad Geovanti's experience, again!

This time I ordered a "famous" calzone. However, the servbice is still sooo slow. Aprrox. 15 mins after my order, I asked the guy on the cashier about the situation, and he told me back "It'll be ready in 2 mins" and after another 15 mins, he said the calzone is ready. Gee...

Also, I do not recommend you to go there for a "dine-in" dinner, coz people usually have a party in downstairs and make noise... your dinner would become a disaster...

PS: The taste of calzone is nearly perfect, but it doesn't change my thoughts about this place.

Thumbs down!!! Again!!! Unfortunately!!!
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer expresses dissatisfaction with their experience at Geovanti's. They mention slow service, a noisy dining environment, and a disappointing wait time for their order. Despite the good taste of the calzone, these issues overshadowed their dining experience and led them to give a thumbs down review.

question:
I needed to order catering for an event at work.  A coworker called to pay for the order, and was told that they "don't have alfredo sauce."  She then passed it it back to me so I could reconfigure my order.

I'm sorry, but what kind of Italian restaurant doesn't have alfredo sauce before their dinnertime rush starts?  It's a white sauce.  MAKE some.  It's not hard.  If it's too difficult to make some, perhaps you should run out and buy some.  I have a feeling that not everyone who went to Geovantis that night was satisfied with their one option: Marinara sauce.

But I digress.  On with the story...

This is a phone conversation that actually happened between me and a Geovantis staff member:

Me: Hi, I'm calling back about my order--my coworker tells me you don't have alfredo sauce?  
SM: Oh, right!  No, we don't.
Me: ....Like, you don't have it ever, or you're just out for today?
SM: Yeaaah, we're just out today.
Me: Oh...okay.  So, I ordered the Fettuccine Alfredo because it's vegetarian.  What else, aside from the cheese tortellini (which I'd already ordered) is vegetarian?
SM: Umm....hold on.  *puts me on hold for a few minutes*  We can make stuff vegetarian for you?
Me: Oh, no, that's okay.  Let's just make it two cheese tortellinis, then.
SM: Okay!  One cheese tortellini, one cheese ravioli...
Me: No, no, you don't have to make cheese ravioli special, since it's not on your menu.  Two cheese tortellinis will be fine!
SM: Oh, okay.  *Proceeds to spend a few minutes figuring out the rest of my order until I confirm that it's correct.*  Now, what kind of sauce do you want on the Chicken Parmesan?
Me: .....I'm sorry?  
SM: What kind of sauce do you want on your Chicken Parmesan?  
Me: What do you mean?  Isn't it marinara sauce?
SM: Yeah, you can either get marinara sauce, or alfredo sauce.
Me: ...........Considering that you don't have alfredo sauce, I guess it would have to be marinara sauce.
SM: Oh!  Yeah!  Right!

Seriously.  That sound you hear is of me banging my head against the wall.

And the food is only okay.

But, if you like the food, the portions are really cheap and HUGE.
rationale: The sentiment in the review is negative because the customer had a frustrating experience while trying to place a catering order at Geovantis. The lack of alfredo sauce, miscommunication with the staff about vegetarian options, and confusion about sauce choices all contributed to the customer feeling disappointed and dissatisfied with the service. Additionally, the customer mentions that the food was only okay, further indicating a negative experience overall.

question: We have ordered delivery several times and it gets worse all the time! We waited over 2 hrs for cold chicken strips one night, and the delivery driver was a jerk. Ordered 5 piece chicken strips and fries tonight... They were overbooked, greasy and tasted of old grease. They forgot the fries and delivered them35 minutes later.. Greasy, lukewarm and also tasting of old grease. The only reason I gave them more than 1 star is because we had good food from there in the past. Don't order delivery.
rationale: The sentiment is Negative because the review details multiple instances of unsatisfactory experiences with the food quality and delivery service. The customer had to wait a long time for cold food, encountered a rude delivery driver, received greasy and old-tasting chicken strips and fries, and experienced missing items in their order. These repeated negative experiences indicate a pattern of poor service and quality, leading to the overall negative sentiment expressed in the review.

question: I made the mistake of reading the reviews of this place and deciding to order food online. I had eaten at Geovanti's once before and was underwhelmed to say the least.  But who can turn down amazing chicken strips? WELL, it took over an hour and a half to get the order and once it arrived, it was soggy and lukewarm.  Yuck.  I can tell you that I will never order from Geovanti's again.\nIf you are at the restaurant, its 2 am, and you're drunk, then the food here is ok and the wait for it won't seem too long. Under those conditions, I say go for it.  Otherwise, stay away.
rationale: The sentiment is Negative because the reviewer had a negative experience with Geovanti's when ordering food online. The food took over an hour and a half to arrive, and when it did, it was described as soggy and lukewarm, resulting in a disappointing experience. The reviewer states that they will never order from Geovanti's again, indicating a strong dissatisfaction with the service and quality of the food.

question: I really do like their chicken strips.  My previous review is still accurate, but the last time I went, the management change shows and the new service staff is slow and inefficient.  The place was always borderline sketchy, but with the new folks it seems to have plummeted and I recently saw their Champaign county restaurant inspection reports, and they have been failing them with pretty egregious offenses.\n\nDon't get me wrong, most restaurants have issues and even fail these inspections, but issues with hot water, spoiled foods, and pests....I won't be headed back anytime soon.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the customer experienced poor service due to a management change, slow and inefficient staff, and noted a decline in overall quality and cleanliness standards at the restaurant. Additionally, the customer mentioned serious health code violations such as issues with hot water, spoiled food, and pests, leading to a strong disapproval of returning to the establishment.

question:
Illini Inn is the last dive bar remaining in campus.  After Deluxe got knocked down to make way for the mediocrity of Legend's and Murphy's expanded and cleaned the place up, Illini Inn stands alone.

This place is a true dive:  cheap drafts, dingy bathrooms, a good jukebox and a surprising lack of fratboys (especially considering you're surrounded by big houses with greek letters in the front yards.)

Go forth.  Chug a beer.  Join the Mug Club.
rationale: The review describes the Illini Inn as a quintessential dive bar that offers cheap drinks, a good jukebox, and a lack of rowdy fratboys. The reviewer appreciates the authentic dive bar atmosphere amidst the changing landscape of campus bars. The enthusiastic recommendation to "chug a beer" and join the Mug Club indicates a positive sentiment towards the establishment, highlighting the appeal of its unpretentious charm and laid-back vibe.

question:
What the Inn lacks in amenities, it more than makes up with it's ambiance. This is no Joe's, Legends, or Brothers. While Ed is correct that lately, it seems like there's more patrons wearing vertical striped oxford shirts and square toed shoes on their way to Brother's, they don't tend to stick around too long. If you get there early, you can grab a table, toss some darts, and get your songs played on the internet jukebox. 

Most of the bartenders are polite, patient, and fun. However, there's one beast of a woman who enjoys berating people who aren't the fastest Mug Club pledges... but hey, you asked for it anyway. 

If you come to visit Champaign, you simply MUST join the 60,000 member mug club, and take in some of the history at the Inn... It's a Champaign institution.
rationale: The sentiment is positive because the review highlights the ambiance of the inn, acknowledging that it may lack in amenities but makes up for it with a unique atmosphere. The reviewer mentions the opportunity to grab a table, play darts, and enjoy music on the jukebox, indicating a pleasant and enjoyable experience. Additionally, the positive interactions with most bartenders are emphasized, with only one minor negative mention. The mention of joining the Mug Club and appreciating the history of the inn further indicates a positive overall experience.

question:
How does this place stay in business? It's never a good shopping experience here and I've never seen it busy. Coming here, I feel as if I'm raiding the owner's personal collection. You're not allowed to browse and he will frequently tell you so.

One time I asked the owner to order something for me and he REFUSED because he would "only make $1 off it." So I went to G-Mart and they ordered it for me instead.

Conversations with the owner are bound to be interesting -- like the fact that he wants to have a funeral pyre when he dies -- but most people I know are made uncomfortable by going there. Apparently our two kinds of geek do not mesh.

G-Mart has a better selection and the employees are helpful and funny.
rationale: The sentiment is negative because the reviewer expresses dissatisfaction with their experiences at the place in question. They mention feeling unwelcome, restricted from browsing, and having a negative interaction with the owner. Additionally, the reviewer compares the place unfavorably to another store, G-Mart, emphasizing their better selection and helpful employees. Overall, the review paints a picture of a business with poor customer service and unappealing atmosphere.

question: I was in this shop once when I was picking up my girlfriend. She was still finishing her final paper after a 2 week crash course that kicked off her graduate school education. Mind you I said grad school, yes I am a fully grown man in his early thirties with a girlfriend who is in grad school. Not a 18 year old undergrad with no money. I was just killing time and saw this shop. I stopped in to browse, as I was browsing I knelt down to get a better look at some books on the bottom shelf grabbed one to figure out what exactly it was,  this takeing maybe a full 10 seconds. Mind you I'm kneeling (not a comfortable position that I would stay in for long) and the guy behind the counter comes tells me that your not allowed to sit on the floor and read. I look at him like Huh?! I explain I am kneeling and wasn't even reading just looking. He points to a sign and says \"those are the rules\" rather rudely. I take the 3 books I had in hand (and was planning on buying) put them back on the shelf and walk out. I haven't been treated that bad in a store since I was 12. Judging from the other reviews this guy isn't very friendly and his store is kinda dirty. I mean really when was the last time you dusted dude? Your little model cars on the wall were filthy.
rationale: The sentiment of this review is negative because the customer felt disrespected and mistreated by the staff member at the shop. The customer's experience of being reprimanded for kneeling to browse books, despite not violating any rules, and the rude interaction with the staff member contribute to the negative sentiment expressed in the review. Additionally, the customer's observation of the shop being dirty and the lack of friendliness from the staff further support the negative sentiment. Overall, the customer's encounter with the shop left them feeling unwelcome and unappreciated, resulting in a negative review.

question:
I know Jimmy John's is all about "super freaky fast" service, but their manners are also pretty freaky.  I'm usually sympathetic to unmotivated or cranky employees (after all, there's nothing glamorous about working at a fast food place).  Unfortunately, the college kids who work here are particularly resentful--and they don't mind taking it out on your sandwich.

I came in by myself to pick up dinner for friends.  When I tried to place my order, the girl working the register (who was obviously new) struggled to punch in each item.  No one seemed interested in helping her, even though 4 other people stood behind the counter.  She finally started yelling at them...still, they just stared blankly at the cold cuts in front of them (maybe they were stoned?).  

After they made and wrapped my subs, they placed them on the counter in front of me.  I asked if they could bag them since it would be awkward to carry all those sandwiches on my own.  One employee pointed to a stack of paper bags and told me I could bag them myself, if I wanted.

The sandwiches are all just variations on a theme: meat of choice, watery mayo, tomatoes, a modest smear of avocado, and too much shredded iceberg lettuce.  The taste is much improved if you add their tasty hot peppers, but I very rarely crave a Jimmy John's sandwich.
